Hebrew: אַ֥שְֽׁרֵי־הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר ׀ לֹ֥א הָלַךְ֮ בַּעֲצַ֢ת רְשָׁ֫עִ֥ים וּבְדֶ֣רֶךְ חַ֭טָּאִים לֹ֥א עָמָ֑ד וּבְמוֹשַׁ֥ב לֵ֝צִ֗ים לֹ֣א יָשָֽׁב׃
Translated:
Happy is the man who has not followed the counsel of the wicked,
or taken the path of sinners,
or joined the company of the insolent;
Transliteration: asherey-haiysh asher lo halakhe vaatsa֢t reshaiym uvederekhe chataiym lo amad uvemvoshav letsiym lo yashav

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אִ֥ם־בְּתוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֗ה חֶ֫פְצ֥וֹ וּֽבְתוֹרָת֥וֹ יֶהְגֶּ֗ה יוֹמָ֥ם וָלָֽיְלָה׃
Translated:
rather, the teaching of the LORD is his delight,
and he studies that teaching day and night.
Transliteration: khiy im-vetvorat yehovah chefetsvo uvetvoratvo yehegeh yvomam valayelah

Hebrew: וְֽהָיָ֗ה כְּעֵץ֮ שָׁת֢וּל עַֽל־פַּלְגֵ֫י־מָ֥יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר פִּרְי֨וֹ ׀ יִתֵּ֬ן בְּעִתּ֗וֹ וְעָלֵ֥הוּ לֹֽא־יִבּ֑וֹל וְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה יַצְלִֽיחַ׃
Translated:
He is like a tree planted beside streams of water,
which yields its fruit in season,
whose foliage never fades,
and whatever it produces thrives.
Transliteration: vehayah kheets shatul al-falegey-mayiim asher fireyvo yiten veitvo vealehu lo-yivvol vekhol asher-yaasheh yatseliycha

Hebrew: לֹא־כֵ֥ן הָרְשָׁעִ֑ים כִּ֥י אִם־כַּ֝מֹּ֗ץ אֲֽשֶׁר־תִּדְּפֶ֥נּוּ רֽוּחַ׃
Translated:
Not so the wicked;
rather, they are like chaff that wind blows away.
Transliteration: lo-khen hareshaiym khiy im-khamots asher-tidefenu rucha

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֤ן ׀ לֹא־יָקֻ֣מוּ רְ֭שָׁעִים בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט וְ֝חַטָּאִ֗ים בַּעֲדַ֥ת צַדִּיקִֽים׃
Translated:
Therefore the wicked will not survive judgment,
nor will sinners, in the assembly of the righteous.
Transliteration: al-khen lo-yakumu reshaiym vamishefat vechataiym vaadat tsadiykiym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יוֹדֵ֣עַ יְ֭הֹוָה דֶּ֣רֶךְ צַדִּיקִ֑ים וְדֶ֖רֶךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים תֹּאבֵֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
For the LORD cherishes the way of the righteous,
but the way of the wicked is doomed.
Transliteration: khiy-yvodea yehovah derekhe tsadiykiym vederekhe reshaiym toved {f}

Hebrew: לָ֭מָּה רָגְשׁ֣וּ גוֹיִ֑ם וּ֝לְאֻמִּ֗ים יֶהְגּוּ־רִֽיק׃
Translated:
Why do nations assemble,
and peoples plot vain things;
Transliteration: lamah rageshu gvoyim uleumiym yehegu-riyk

Hebrew: יִ֥תְיַצְּב֨וּ ׀ מַלְכֵי־אֶ֗רֶץ וְרוֹזְנִ֥ים נֽוֹסְדוּ־יָ֑חַד עַל־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וְעַל־מְשִׁיחֽוֹ׃
Translated:
kings of the earth take their stand,
and regents intrigue together
against the LORD and against His anointed?
Transliteration: yiteyatsevu malekhey-erets vervozeniym nvosedu-yachad al-yehovah veal-meshiychvo

Hebrew: נְֽ֭נַתְּקָה אֶת־מֽוֹסְרוֹתֵ֑ימוֹ וְנַשְׁלִ֖יכָה מִמֶּ֣נּוּ עֲבֹתֵֽימוֹ׃
Translated:
“Let us break the cords of their yoke,
shake off their ropes from us!”
Transliteration: nenatekah et-mvoservoteymvo venasheliykhah mimenu avoteymvo

Hebrew: יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם יִשְׂחָ֑ק אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י יִלְעַג־לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
He who is enthroned in heaven laughs;
the Lord mocks at them.
Transliteration: yvoshev vashamayiim yishechak adonay yileag-lamvo

Hebrew: אָ֤ז יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֵ֣ימוֹ בְאַפּ֑וֹ וּֽבַחֲרוֹנ֥וֹ יְבַהֲלֵֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
Then He speaks to them in anger,
terrifying them in His rage,
Transliteration: az yedaver eleymvo veafvo uvacharvonvo yevahalemvo

Hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי נָסַ֣כְתִּי מַלְכִּ֑י עַל־צִ֝יּ֗וֹן הַר־קׇדְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
“But I have installed My king
on Zion, My holy mountain!”
Transliteration: vaaniy nasakhetiy malekhiy al-tsiyyvon har-kׇdeshiy

Hebrew: אֲסַפְּרָ֗ה אֶֽ֫ל־חֹ֥ק יְֽהֹוָ֗ה אָמַ֘ר־אֵלַ֥י בְּנִ֥י אַ֑תָּה אֲ֝נִ֗י הַיּ֥וֹם יְלִדְתִּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Let me tell of the decree:
the LORD said to me,
“You are My son,
I have fathered you this day.
Transliteration: asaferah el-chok yehovah amar-elay veniy atah aniy hayyvom yelidetiykha

Hebrew: שְׁאַ֤ל מִמֶּ֗נִּי וְאֶתְּנָ֣ה ג֭וֹיִם נַחֲלָתֶ֑ךָ וַ֝אֲחֻזָּתְךָ֗ אַפְסֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Ask it of Me,
and I will make the nations your domain;
your estate, the limits of the earth.
Transliteration: sheal mimeniy veetenah gvoyim nachalatekha vaachuzatekha afesey-arets

Hebrew: תְּ֭רֹעֵם בְּשֵׁ֣בֶט בַּרְזֶ֑ל כִּכְלִ֖י יוֹצֵ֣ר תְּנַפְּצֵֽם׃
Translated:
You can smash them with an iron mace,
shatter them like potter’s ware.”
Transliteration: teroem veshevet varezel khikheliy yvotser tenafetsem

Hebrew: וְ֭עַתָּה מְלָכִ֣ים הַשְׂכִּ֑ילוּ הִ֝וָּסְר֗וּ שֹׁ֣פְטֵי אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
So now, O kings, be prudent;
accept discipline, you rulers of the earth!
Transliteration: veatah melakhiym hashekhiylu hivaseru shofetey arets

Hebrew: עִבְד֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּיִרְאָ֑ה וְ֝גִ֗ילוּ בִּרְעָדָֽה׃
Translated:
Serve the LORD in awe;
tremble with fright,
Transliteration: ivedu et-yehovah veyireah vegiylu vireadah

Hebrew: נַשְּׁקוּ־בַ֡ר פֶּן־יֶאֱנַ֤ף ׀ וְתֹ֬אבְדוּ דֶ֗רֶךְ כִּֽי־יִבְעַ֣ר כִּמְעַ֣ט אַפּ֑וֹ אַ֝שְׁרֵ֗י כׇּל־ח֥וֹסֵי בֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
pay homage in good faith,
lest He be angered, and your way be doomed
in the mere flash of His anger.
Happy are all who take refuge in Him.
Transliteration: nasheku-var fen-yeenaf vetovedu derekhe khiy-yivear khimeat afvo asherey khׇl-chvosey vvo {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִ֑ד בְּ֝בׇרְח֗וֹ מִפְּנֵ֤י ׀ אַבְשָׁל֬וֹם בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: A psalm of David when he fled from his son Absalom.
Transliteration: mizemvor ledavid vevׇrechvo mifeney aveshalvom venvo

Hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה מָה־רַבּ֣וּ צָרָ֑י רַ֝בִּ֗ים קָמִ֥ים עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
O LORD, my foes are so many!
Many are those who attack me;
Transliteration: yehovah mah-ravu tsaray raviym kamiym alay

Hebrew: רַבִּים֮ אֹמְרִ֢ים לְנַ֫פְשִׁ֥י אֵ֤ין יְֽשׁוּעָ֓תָה לּ֬וֹ בֵאלֹהִ֬ים סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
many say of me,
“There is no deliverance for him through God.” Selah.
Transliteration: raviym omeri֢ym lenafeshiy eyn yeshuatah lvo velohiym selah

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה מָגֵ֣ן בַּעֲדִ֑י כְּ֝בוֹדִ֗י וּמֵרִ֥ים רֹאשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
But You, O LORD, are a shield about me,
my glory, He who holds my head high.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah magen vaadiy khevvodiy umeriym roshiy

Hebrew: ק֭וֹלִי אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶקְרָ֑א וַיַּעֲנֵ֨נִי מֵהַ֖ר קׇדְשׁ֣וֹ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
I cry aloud to the LORD,
and He answers me from His holy mountain. Selah.
Transliteration: kvoliy el-yehovah ekera vayaaneniy mehar kׇdeshvo selah

Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י שָׁכַ֗בְתִּי וָאִ֫ישָׁ֥נָה הֱקִיצ֑וֹתִי כִּ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה יִסְמְכֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
I lie down and sleep and wake again,
for the LORD sustains me.
Transliteration: aniy shakhavetiy vaiyshanah hekiytsvotiy khiy yehovah yisemekheniy

Hebrew: לֹֽא־אִ֭ירָא מֵרִבְב֥וֹת עָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר סָ֝בִ֗יב שָׁ֣תוּ עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
I have no fear of the myriad forces
arrayed against me on every side.
Transliteration: lo-iyra merivevvot am asher saviyv shatu alay

Hebrew: ק֘וּמָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ הוֹשִׁ֘יעֵ֤נִי אֱלֹהַ֗י כִּֽי־הִכִּ֣יתָ אֶת־כׇּל־אֹיְבַ֣י לֶ֑חִי שִׁנֵּ֖י רְשָׁעִ֣ים שִׁבַּֽרְתָּ׃
Translated:
Rise, O LORD!
Deliver me, O my God!
For You slap all my enemies in the face;
You break the teeth of the wicked.
Transliteration: kumah yehovah hvoshiyeniy elohay khiy-hikhiyta et-khׇl-oyevay lechiy shiney reshaiym shivareta

Hebrew: לַֽיהֹוָ֥ה הַיְשׁוּעָ֑ה עַֽל־עַמְּךָ֖ בִרְכָתֶ֣ךָ סֶּֽלָה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Deliverance is the LORD’s;
Your blessing be upon Your people! Selah.
Transliteration: layhovah hayeshuah al-amekha virekhatekha selah {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינ֗וֹת מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; with instrumental music. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha vinegiynvot mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: בְּקׇרְאִ֡י עֲנֵ֤נִי ׀ אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י צִדְקִ֗י בַּ֭צָּר הִרְחַ֣בְתָּ לִּ֑י חׇ֝נֵּ֗נִי וּשְׁמַ֥ע תְּפִלָּתִֽי׃
Translated:
Answer me when I call,
O God, my vindicator!
You freed me from distress;
have mercy on me and hear my prayer.
Transliteration: vekׇreiy aneniy elohey tsidekiy vatsar hirechaveta liy chׇneniy ushema tefilatiy

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י אִ֡ישׁ עַד־מֶ֬ה כְבוֹדִ֣י לִ֭כְלִמָּה תֶּאֱהָב֣וּן רִ֑יק תְּבַקְשׁ֖וּ כָזָ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
You men, how long will my glory be mocked,
will you love illusions,
have recourse to frauds? Selah.
Transliteration: veney iysh ad-meh khevvodiy likhelimah teehavun riyk tevakeshu khazav selah

Hebrew: וּדְע֗וּ כִּֽי־הִפְלָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה חָסִ֣יד ל֑וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה יִ֝שְׁמַ֗ע בְּקׇרְאִ֥י אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated:
Know that the LORD singles out the faithful for Himself;
the LORD hears when I call to Him.
Transliteration: udeu khiy-hifelah yehovah chasiyd lvo yehovah yishema vekׇreiy elayv

Hebrew: רִגְז֗וּ וְֽאַל־תֶּ֫חֱטָ֥אוּ אִמְר֣וּ בִ֭לְבַבְכֶם עַֽל־מִשְׁכַּבְכֶ֗ם וְדֹ֣מּוּ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
So tremble, and sin no more;
ponder it on your bed, and sigh.
Transliteration: rigezu veal-techetau imeru vilevavekhem al-mishekhavekhem vedomu selah

Hebrew: זִבְח֥וּ זִבְחֵי־צֶ֑דֶק וּ֝בִטְח֗וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Offer sacrifices in righteousness
and trust in the LORD.
Transliteration: zivechu zivechey-tsedek uvitechu el-yehovah

Hebrew: רַבִּ֥ים אֹמְרִים֮ מִֽי־יַרְאֵ֢נ֫וּ ט֥וֹב נְֽסָה־עָ֭לֵינוּ א֨וֹר פָּנֶ֬יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Many say, “O for good days!”
Bestow Your favor on us, O LORD.
Transliteration: raviym omeriym miy-yaree֢nu tvov nesah-aleynu vor faneykha yehovah

Hebrew: נָתַ֣תָּה שִׂמְחָ֣ה בְלִבִּ֑י מֵעֵ֬ת דְּגָנָ֖ם וְתִירוֹשָׁ֣ם רָֽבּוּ׃
Translated:
You put joy into my heart
when their grain and wine show increase.
Transliteration: natatah shimechah veliviy meet deganam vetiyrvosham ravu

Hebrew: בְּשָׁל֣וֹם יַחְדָּו֮ אֶשְׁכְּבָ֢ה וְאִ֫ישָׁ֥ן כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה לְבָדָ֑ד לָ֝בֶ֗טַח תּוֹשִׁיבֵֽנִי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Safe and sound, I lie down and sleep,
for You alone, O LORD, keep me secure.
Transliteration: veshalvom yachedav eshekheva֢h veiyshan khiy-atah yehovah levadad lavetach tvoshiyveniy {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אֶֽל־הַנְּחִיל֗וֹת מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; on neḥiloth. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha el-hanechiylvot mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: אֲמָרַ֖י הַאֲזִ֥ינָה <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֗ה בִּ֣ינָה הֲגִיגִֽי׃
Translated:
Give ear to my speech, O LORD;
consider my utterance.
Transliteration: amaray haaziynah <small></small> yehovah viynah hagiygiy

Hebrew: הַקְשִׁ֤יבָה ׀ לְק֬וֹל שַׁוְעִ֗י מַלְכִּ֥י וֵאלֹהָ֑י כִּֽי־אֵ֝לֶ֗יךָ אֶתְפַּלָּֽל׃
Translated:
Heed the sound of my cry,
my king and God,
for I pray to You.
Transliteration: hakeshiyvah lekvol shaveiy malekhiy velohay khiy-eleykha etefalal

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בֹּ֭קֶר תִּשְׁמַ֣ע קוֹלִ֑י בֹּ֥קֶר אֶעֱרׇךְ־לְ֝ךָ֗ וַאֲצַפֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Hear my voice, O LORD, at daybreak;
at daybreak I plead before You, and wait.
Transliteration: yehovah voker tishema kvoliy voker eerׇkhe-lekha vaatsafeh

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹ֤א אֵֽל־חָפֵ֘ץ־רֶ֥שַׁע ׀ אָ֑תָּה לֹ֖א יְגֻרְךָ֣ רָֽע׃
Translated:
For You are not a God who desires wickedness;
evil cannot abide with You;
Transliteration: khiy lo el-chafets-resha atah lo yegurekha ra

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יִתְיַצְּב֣וּ ה֭וֹלְלִים לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינֶ֑יךָ שָׂ֝נֵ֗אתָ כׇּל־פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
wanton men cannot endure in Your sight.
You detest all evildoers;
Transliteration: lo-yiteyatsevu hvoleliym leneged eyneykha shaneta khׇl-foaley aven

Hebrew: תְּאַבֵּד֮ דֹּבְרֵ֢י כָ֫זָ֥ב אִישׁ־דָּמִ֥ים וּמִרְמָ֗ה יְתָ֘עֵ֥ב <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
You doom those who speak lies;
murderous, deceitful men the LORD abhors.
Transliteration: teaved dovere֢y khazav iysh-damiym umiremah yetaev <small></small> yehovah

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י בְּרֹ֣ב חַ֭סְדְּךָ אָב֣וֹא בֵיתֶ֑ךָ אֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֥ה אֶל־הֵֽיכַל־קׇ֝דְשְׁךָ֗ בְּיִרְאָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
But I, through Your abundant love, enter Your house;
I bow down in awe at Your holy temple.
Transliteration: vaaniy verov chasedekha avvo veytekha eshetachaveh el-heykhal-kׇdeshekha veyireatekha

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ נְחֵ֬נִי בְצִדְקָתֶ֗ךָ לְמַ֥עַן שׁוֹרְרָ֑י (הושר) [הַיְשַׁ֖ר] לְפָנַ֣י דַּרְכֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
O LORD, lead me along Your righteous [path]
because of my watchful foes;
make Your way straight before me.
Transliteration: yehovah necheniy vetsidekatekha lemaan shvoreray (hvshr) [hayeshar] lefanay darekhekha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֪ין בְּפִ֡יהוּ נְכוֹנָה֮ קִרְבָּ֢ם הַ֫וּ֥וֹת קֶֽבֶר־פָּת֥וּחַ גְּרֹנָ֑ם לְ֝שׁוֹנָ֗ם יַחֲלִיקֽוּן׃
Translated:
For there is no sincerity on their lips;
their heart is [filled with] malice;
their throat is an open grave;
their tongue slippery.
Transliteration: khiy eyn vefiyhu nekhvonah kireva֢m hauvot kever-fatucha geronam leshvonam yachaliykun

Hebrew: הַ֥אֲשִׁימֵ֨ם ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים יִפְּלוּ֮ מִֽמֹּעֲצ֢וֹתֵ֫יהֶ֥ם בְּרֹ֣ב פִּ֭שְׁעֵיהֶם הַדִּיחֵ֑מוֹ כִּי־מָ֥רוּ בָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Condemn them, O God;
let them fall by their own devices;
cast them out for their many crimes,
for they defy You.
Transliteration: haashiymem Elohimm yifelu mimoats֢voteyhem verov fisheeyhem hadiychemvo khiy-maru vakhe

Hebrew: וְיִשְׂמְח֨וּ כׇל־ח֪וֹסֵי בָ֡ךְ לְעוֹלָ֣ם יְ֭רַנֵּנוּ וְתָסֵ֣ךְ עָלֵ֑ימוֹ וְֽיַעְלְצ֥וּ בְ֝ךָ֗ אֹהֲבֵ֥י שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
But let all who take refuge in You rejoice,
ever jubilant as You shelter them;
and let those who love Your name exult in You.
Transliteration: veyishemechu khׇl-chvosey vakhe levolam yeranenu vetasekhe aleymvo veyaeletsu vekha ohavey shemekha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּה֮ תְּבָרֵ֢ךְ צַ֫דִּ֥יק יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּ֝צִּנָּ֗ה רָצ֥וֹן תַּעְטְרֶֽנּוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
For You surely bless the righteous man, O LORD,
encompassing him with favor like a shield.
Transliteration: khiy-atah tevare֢khe tsadiyk yehovah khatsinah ratsvon taeterenu {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ בִּ֭נְגִינוֹת עַֽל־הַשְּׁמִינִ֗ית מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; with instrumental music on the sheminith. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha vinegiynvot al-hashemiyniyt mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה אַל־בְּאַפְּךָ֥ תוֹכִיחֵ֑נִי וְֽאַל־בַּחֲמָתְךָ֥ תְיַסְּרֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
O LORD, do not punish me in anger,
do not chastise me in fury.
Transliteration: yehovah al-veafekha tvokhiycheniy veal-vachamatekha teyasereniy

Hebrew: חׇנֵּ֥נִי יְהֹוָה֮ כִּ֤י אֻמְלַ֫ל־אָ֥נִי רְפָאֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֖י נִבְהֲל֣וּ עֲצָמָֽי׃
Translated:
Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I languish;
heal me, O LORD, for my bones shake with terror.
Transliteration: chׇneniy yehovah khiy umelal-aniy refaeniy yehovah khiy nivehalu atsamay

Hebrew: וְ֭נַפְשִׁי נִבְהֲלָ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד (ואת) [וְאַתָּ֥ה] יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עַד־מָתָֽי׃
Translated:
My whole being is stricken with terror,
while You, LORD—O, how long!
Transliteration: venafeshiy nivehalah meod (vt) [veatah] yehovah ad-matay

Hebrew: שׁוּבָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה חַלְּצָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֑י ה֝וֹשִׁיעֵ֗נִי לְמַ֣עַן חַסְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
O LORD, turn! Rescue me!
Deliver me as befits Your faithfulness.
Transliteration: shuvah yehovah chaletsah nafeshiy hvoshiyeniy lemaan chasedekha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֣ין בַּמָּ֣וֶת זִכְרֶ֑ךָ בִּ֝שְׁא֗וֹל מִ֣י יֽוֹדֶה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
For there is no praise of You among the dead;
in Sheol, who can acclaim You?
Transliteration: khiy eyn vamavet zikherekha vishevol miy yvodeh-lakhe

Hebrew: יָגַ֤עְתִּי ׀ בְּֽאַנְחָתִ֗י אַשְׂחֶ֣ה בְכׇל־לַ֭יְלָה מִטָּתִ֑י בְּ֝דִמְעָתִ֗י עַרְשִׂ֥י אַמְסֶֽה׃
Translated:
I am weary with groaning;
every night I drench my bed,
I melt my couch in tears.
Transliteration: yagaetiy veanechatiy ashecheh vekhׇl-layelah mitatiy vedimeatiy areshiy ameseh

Hebrew: עָשְׁשָׁ֣ה מִכַּ֣עַס עֵינִ֑י עָ֝תְקָ֗ה בְּכׇל־צוֹרְרָֽי׃
Translated:
My eyes are wasted by vexation,
worn out because of all my foes.
Transliteration: asheshah mikhaas eyniy atekah vekhׇl-tsvoreray

Hebrew: ס֣וּרוּ מִ֭מֶּנִּי כׇּל־פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֥ע יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה ק֣וֹל בִּכְיִֽי׃
Translated:
Away from me, all you evildoers,
for the LORD heeds the sound of my weeping.
Transliteration: suru mimeniy khׇl-foaley aven khiy-shama yehovah kvol vikheyiy

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֣ע יְ֭הֹוָה תְּחִנָּתִ֑י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה תְּֽפִלָּתִ֥י יִקָּֽח׃
Translated:
The LORD heeds my plea,
the LORD accepts my prayer.
Transliteration: shama yehovah techinatiy yehovah tefilatiy yikach

Hebrew: יֵבֹ֤שׁוּ ׀ וְיִבָּהֲל֣וּ מְ֭אֹד כׇּל־אֹיְבָ֑י יָ֝שֻׁ֗בוּ יֵבֹ֥שׁוּ רָֽגַע׃ {פ}
Translated:
All my enemies will be frustrated and stricken with terror;
they will turn back in an instant, frustrated.
Transliteration: eivoshu veyivahalu meod khׇl-oyevay yashuvu eivoshu raga {f}

Hebrew: שִׁגָּי֗וֹן לְדָ֫וִ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֥ר לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה עַל־דִּבְרֵי־כ֝֗וּשׁ בֶּן־יְמִינִֽי׃
Translated: Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the LORD, concerning Cush, a Benjaminite.
Transliteration: shigayvon ledavid asher-shar layhovah al-diverey-khuush ven-yemiyniy

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהַי בְּךָ֣ חָסִ֑יתִי הוֹשִׁיעֵ֥נִי מִכׇּל־רֹ֝דְפַ֗י וְהַצִּילֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
O LORD, my God, in You I seek refuge;
deliver me from all my pursuers and save me,
Transliteration: yehovah elohay vekha chasiytiy hvoshiyeniy mikhׇl-rodefay vehatsiyleniy

Hebrew: פֶּן־יִטְרֹ֣ף כְּאַרְיֵ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֑י פֹּ֝רֵ֗ק וְאֵ֣ין מַצִּֽיל׃
Translated:
lest, like a lion, they tear me apart,
rending in pieces, and no one save me.
Transliteration: fen-yiterof kheareeih nafeshiy forek veeyn matsiyl

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהַי אִם־עָשִׂ֣יתִי זֹ֑את אִֽם־יֶשׁ־עָ֥וֶל בְּכַפָּֽי׃
Translated:
O LORD, my God, if I have done such things,
if my hands bear the guilt of wrongdoing,
Transliteration: yehovah elohay im-ashiytiy zot im-yesh-avel vekhafay

Hebrew: אִם־גָּ֭מַלְתִּי שֽׁוֹלְמִ֥י רָ֑ע וָאֲחַלְּצָ֖ה צֽוֹרְרִ֣י רֵיקָֽם׃
Translated:
if I have dealt evil to my ally—
I who rescued my foe without reward—
Transliteration: im-gamaletiy shvolemiy ra vaachaletsah tsvoreriy reykam

Hebrew: יִ֥רַדֹּֽף־אוֹיֵ֨ב ׀ נַפְשִׁ֡י וְיַשֵּׂ֗ג וְיִרְמֹ֣ס לָאָ֣רֶץ חַיָּ֑י וּכְבוֹדִ֓י ׀ לֶעָפָ֖ר יַשְׁכֵּ֣ן סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
then let the enemy pursue and overtake me;
let him trample my life to the ground,
and lay my body in the dust. Selah.
Transliteration: yiradof-voeiv nafeshiy veyasheg veyiremos laarets chayay ukhevvodiy leafar yashekhen selah

Hebrew: ק֘וּמָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ בְּאַפֶּ֗ךָ הִ֭נָּשֵׂא בְּעַבְר֣וֹת צוֹרְרָ֑י וְע֥וּרָה אֵ֝לַ֗י מִשְׁפָּ֥ט צִוִּֽיתָ׃
Translated:
Rise, O LORD, in Your anger;
assert Yourself against the fury of my foes;
bestir Yourself on my behalf;
You have ordained judgment.
Transliteration: kumah yehovah veafekha hinashe veavervot tsvoreray veurah elay mishefat tsiviyta

Hebrew: וַעֲדַ֣ת לְ֭אֻמִּים תְּסֽוֹבְבֶ֑ךָּ וְ֝עָלֶ֗יהָ לַמָּר֥וֹם שֽׁוּבָה׃
Translated:
Let the assembly of peoples gather about You,
with You enthroned above, on high.
Transliteration: vaadat leumiym tesvovevekha vealeyha lamarvom shuvah

Hebrew: יְהֹוָה֮ יָדִ֢ין עַ֫מִּ֥ים שׇׁפְטֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּצִדְקִ֖י וּכְתֻמִּ֣י עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
The LORD judges the peoples;
vindicate me, O LORD,
for the righteousness and blamelessness that are mine.
Transliteration: yehovah yadi֢yn amiym shׇfeteniy yehovah khetsidekiy ukhetumiy alay

Hebrew: יִגְמׇר־נָ֬א רַ֨ע ׀ רְשָׁעִים֮ וּתְכוֹנֵ֢ן צַ֫דִּ֥יק וּבֹחֵ֣ן לִ֭בּוֹת וּכְלָי֗וֹת אֱלֹהִ֥ים צַדִּֽיק׃
Translated:
Let the evil of the wicked come to an end,
but establish the righteous;
he who probes the mind and conscience is God the righteous.
Transliteration: yigemׇr-na ra reshaiym utekhvone֢n tsadiyk uvochen livvot ukhelayvot Elohim tsadiyk

Hebrew: מָגִנִּ֥י עַל־אֱלֹהִ֑ים מ֝וֹשִׁ֗יעַ יִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
I look to God to shield me;
the deliverer of the upright.
Transliteration: maginiy al-Elohim mvoshiya yisherey-lev

Hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים שׁוֹפֵ֣ט צַדִּ֑יק וְ֝אֵ֗ל זֹעֵ֥ם בְּכׇל־יֽוֹם׃
Translated:
God vindicates the righteous;
God pronounces doom each day.
Transliteration: Elohim shvofet tsadiyk veel zoem vekhׇl-yvom

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א יָ֭שׁוּב חַרְבּ֣וֹ יִלְט֑וֹשׁ קַשְׁתּ֥וֹ דָ֝רַ֗ךְ וַֽיְכוֹנְנֶֽהָ׃
Translated:
If one does not turn back, but whets his sword,
bends his bow and aims it,
Transliteration: im-lo yashuv charevvo yiletvosh kashetvo darakhe vayekhvoneneha

Hebrew: וְ֭לוֹ הֵכִ֣ין כְּלֵי־מָ֑וֶת חִ֝צָּ֗יו לְֽדֹלְקִ֥ים יִפְעָֽל׃
Translated:
then against himself he readies deadly weapons,
and makes his arrows sharp.
Transliteration: velvo hekhiyn kheley-mavet chitsayv ledolekiym yifeal

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה יְחַבֶּל־אָ֑וֶן וְהָרָ֥ה עָ֝מָ֗ל וְיָ֣לַד שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
See, he hatches evil, conceives mischief,
and gives birth to fraud.
Transliteration: hineh yechavel-aven veharah amal veyalad shaker

Hebrew: בּ֣וֹר כָּ֭רָה וַֽיַּחְפְּרֵ֑הוּ וַ֝יִּפֹּ֗ל בְּשַׁ֣חַת יִפְעָֽל׃
Translated:
He has dug a pit and deepened it,
and will fall into the trap he made.
Transliteration: vvor kharah vayacheferehu vayifol veshachat yifeal

Hebrew: יָשׁ֣וּב עֲמָל֣וֹ בְרֹאשׁ֑וֹ וְעַ֥ל קׇ֝דְקֳד֗וֹ חֲמָס֥וֹ יֵרֵֽד׃
Translated:
His mischief will recoil upon his own head;
his lawlessness will come down upon his skull.
Transliteration: yashuv amalvo veroshvo veal kׇdekodvo chamasvo eired

Hebrew: אוֹדֶ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה כְּצִדְק֑וֹ וַ֝אֲזַמְּרָ֗ה שֵֽׁם־יְהֹוָ֥ה עֶלְיֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will praise the LORD for His righteousness,
and sing a hymn to the name of the LORD Most High.
Transliteration: vodeh yehovah khetsidekvo vaazamerah shem-yehovah eleyvon {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־הַגִּתִּ֗ית מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; on the gittith. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-hagitiyt mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה אֲדֹנֵ֗ינוּ מָה־אַדִּ֣יר שִׁ֭מְךָ בְּכׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּנָ֥ה ה֝וֹדְךָ֗ עַל־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated:
O LORD, our Lord,
How majestic is Your name throughout the earth,
You who have covered the heavens with Your splendor!
Transliteration: yehovah adoneynu mah-adiyr shimekha vekhׇl-haarets asher tenah hvodekha al-hashamayiim

Hebrew: מִפִּ֤י עוֹלְלִ֨ים ׀ וְֽיֹנְקִים֮ יִסַּ֢דְתָּ֫ עֹ֥ז לְמַ֥עַן צוֹרְרֶ֑יךָ לְהַשְׁבִּ֥ית א֝וֹיֵ֗ב וּמִתְנַקֵּֽם׃
Translated:
From the mouths of infants and sucklings
You have founded strength on account of Your foes,
to put an end to enemy and avenger.
Transliteration: mifiy voleliym veyonekiym yisa֢deta oz lemaan tsvorereykha lehasheviyt voeiv umitenakem

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֶרְאֶ֣ה שָׁ֭מֶיךָ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֶצְבְּעֹתֶ֑יךָ יָרֵ֥חַ וְ֝כוֹכָבִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר כּוֹנָֽנְתָּה׃
Translated:
When I behold Your heavens, the work of Your fingers,
the moon and stars that You set in place,
Transliteration: khiy-ereeh shameykha maasheh etseveoteykha yarecha vekhvokhaviym asher khvonanetah

Hebrew: מָה־אֱנ֥וֹשׁ כִּֽי־תִזְכְּרֶ֑נּוּ וּבֶן־אָ֝דָ֗ם כִּ֣י תִפְקְדֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
what is man that You have been mindful of him,
mortal man that You have taken note of him,
Transliteration: mah-envosh khiy-tizekherenu uven-adam khiy tifekedenu

Hebrew: וַתְּחַסְּרֵ֣הוּ מְּ֭עַט מֵאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְכָב֖וֹד וְהָדָ֣ר תְּעַטְּרֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
that You have made him little less than divine,
and adorned him with glory and majesty;
Transliteration: vatechaserehu meat meElohim vekhavvod vehadar teaterehu

Hebrew: תַּ֭מְשִׁילֵהוּ בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֣י יָדֶ֑יךָ כֹּ֝֗ל שַׁ֣תָּה תַֽחַת־רַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated:
You have made him master over Your handiwork,
laying the world at his feet,
Transliteration: tameshiylehu vemaashey yadeykha khol shatah tachat-ragelayv

Hebrew: צֹנֶ֣ה וַאֲלָפִ֣ים כֻּלָּ֑ם וְ֝גַ֗ם בַּהֲמ֥וֹת שָׂדָֽי׃
Translated:
sheep and oxen, all of them,
and wild beasts, too;
Transliteration: tsoneh vaalafiym khulam vegam vahamvot shaday

Hebrew: צִפּ֣וֹר שָׁ֭מַיִם וּדְגֵ֣י הַיָּ֑ם עֹ֝בֵ֗ר אׇרְח֥וֹת יַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
the birds of the heavens, the fish of the sea,
whatever travels the paths of the seas.
Transliteration: tsifvor shamayim udegey hayam over ׇrechvot yamiym

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה אֲדֹנֵ֑ינוּ מָה־אַדִּ֥יר שִׁ֝מְךָ֗ בְּכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: O L<small>ORD</small>, our Lord, how majestic is Your name throughout the earth!
Transliteration: yehovah adoneynu mah-adiyr shimekha vekhׇl-haarets {f}

Hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ עַל־מ֥וּת לַבֵּ֗ן מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; ‘almuth labben. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-mut laven mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: אוֹדֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה בְּכׇל־לִבִּ֑י אֲ֝סַפְּרָ֗ה כׇּל־נִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I will praise You, LORD, with all my heart;
I will tell all Your wonders.
Transliteration: vodeh yehovah vekhׇl-liviy asaferah khׇl-nifelevoteykha

Hebrew: אֶשְׂמְחָ֣ה וְאֶעֶלְצָ֣ה בָ֑ךְ אֲזַמְּרָ֖ה שִׁמְךָ֣ עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
I will rejoice and exult in You,
singing a hymn to Your name, O Most High.
Transliteration: eshemechah veeeletsah vakhe azamerah shimekha eleyvon

Hebrew: בְּשׁוּב־אוֹיְבַ֥י אָח֑וֹר יִכָּשְׁל֥וּ וְ֝יֹאבְד֗וּ מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
When my enemies retreat,
they stumble to their doom at Your presence.
Transliteration: veshuv-voyevay achvor yikhashelu veyovedu mifaneykha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עָ֭שִׂיתָ מִשְׁפָּטִ֣י וְדִינִ֑י יָשַׁ֥בְתָּ לְ֝כִסֵּ֗א שׁוֹפֵ֥ט צֶֽדֶק׃
Translated:
For You uphold my right and claim,
enthroned as righteous judge.
Transliteration: khiy-ashiyta mishefatiy vediyniy yashaveta lekhise shvofet tsedek

Hebrew: גָּעַ֣רְתָּ ג֭וֹיִם אִבַּ֣דְתָּ רָשָׁ֑ע שְׁמָ֥ם מָ֝חִ֗יתָ לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
Translated:
You blast the nations;
You destroy the wicked;
You blot out their name forever.
Transliteration: gaareta gvoyim ivadeta rasha shemam machiyta levolam vaed

Hebrew: הָֽאוֹיֵ֨ב ׀ תַּ֥מּוּ חֳרָב֗וֹת לָ֫נֶ֥צַח וְעָרִ֥ים נָתַ֑שְׁתָּ אָבַ֖ד זִכְרָ֣ם הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated:
The enemy is no more—
ruins everlasting;
You have torn down their cities;
their very names are lost.
Transliteration: havoeiv tamu choravvot lanetsach veariym natasheta avad zikheram hemah

Hebrew: וַֽ֭יהֹוָה לְעוֹלָ֣ם יֵשֵׁ֑ב כּוֹנֵ֖ן לַמִּשְׁפָּ֣ט כִּסְאֽוֹ׃
Translated:
But the LORD abides forever;
He has set up His throne for judgment;
Transliteration: vayhovah levolam eishev khvonen lamishefat khisevo

Hebrew: וְה֗וּא יִשְׁפֹּֽט־תֵּבֵ֥ל בְּצֶ֑דֶק יָדִ֥ין לְ֝אֻמִּ֗ים בְּמֵישָׁרִֽים׃
Translated:
it is He who judges the world with righteousness,
rules the peoples with equity.
Transliteration: vehu yishefot-tevel vetsedek yadiyn leumiym vemeyshariym

Hebrew: וִ֘יהִ֤י יְהֹוָ֣ה מִשְׂגָּ֣ב לַדָּ֑ךְ מִ֝שְׂגָּ֗ב לְעִתּ֥וֹת בַּצָּרָֽה׃
Translated:
The LORD is a haven for the oppressed,
a haven in times of trouble.
Transliteration: viyhiy yehovah mishegav ladakhe mishegav leitvot vatsarah

Hebrew: וְיִבְטְח֣וּ בְ֭ךָ יוֹדְעֵ֣י שְׁמֶ֑ךָ כִּ֤י לֹֽא־עָזַ֖בְתָּ דֹרְשֶׁ֣יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Those who know Your name trust You,
for You do not abandon those who turn to You, O LORD.
Transliteration: veyivetechu vekha yvodeey shemekha khiy lo-azaveta doresheykha yehovah

Hebrew: זַמְּר֗וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה יֹשֵׁ֣ב צִיּ֑וֹן הַגִּ֥ידוּ בָ֝עַמִּ֗ים עֲלִֽילוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Sing a hymn to the LORD, who reigns in Zion;
declare His deeds among the peoples.
Transliteration: zameru layhovah yoshev tsiyyvon hagiydu vaamiym aliylvotayv

Hebrew: כִּֽי־דֹרֵ֣שׁ דָּ֭מִים אוֹתָ֣ם זָכָ֑ר לֹֽא־שָׁ֝כַ֗ח צַעֲקַ֥ת (עניים) [עֲנָוִֽים]׃
Translated:
For He does not ignore the cry of the afflicted;
He who requites bloodshed is mindful of them.
Transliteration: khiy-doresh damiym votam zakhar lo-shakhach tsaakat (nyym) [anaviym]

Hebrew: חָֽנְנֵ֬נִי יְהֹוָ֗ה רְאֵ֣ה עׇ֭נְיִי מִשֹּׂנְאָ֑י מְ֝רוֹמְמִ֗י מִשַּׁ֥עֲרֵי מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
Have mercy on me, O LORD;
see my affliction at the hands of my foes,
You who lift me from the gates of death,
Transliteration: chaneneniy yehovah reeh ׇneyiy mishoneay mervomemiy mishaarey mavet

Hebrew: לְמַ֥עַן אֲסַפְּרָ֗ה כׇּֽל־תְּהִלָּ֫תֶ֥יךָ בְּשַׁעֲרֵ֥י בַת־צִיּ֑וֹן אָ֝גִ֗ילָה בִּישׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
so that in the gates of Fair Zion
I might tell all Your praise,
I might exult in Your deliverance.
Transliteration: lemaan asaferah khׇl-tehilateykha veshaarey vat-tsiyyvon agiylah viyshuatekha

Hebrew: טָבְע֣וּ ג֭וֹיִם בְּשַׁ֣חַת עָשׂ֑וּ בְּרֶֽשֶׁת־ז֥וּ טָ֝מָ֗נוּ נִלְכְּדָ֥ה רַגְלָֽם׃
Translated:
The nations sink in the pit they have made;
their own foot is caught in the net they have hidden.
Transliteration: taveu gvoyim veshachat ashu vereshet-zu tamanu nilekhedah ragelam

Hebrew: נ֤וֹדַ֨ע ׀ יְהֹוָה֮ מִשְׁפָּ֢ט עָ֫שָׂ֥ה בְּפֹ֣עַל כַּ֭פָּיו נוֹקֵ֣שׁ רָשָׁ֑ע הִגָּי֥וֹן סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
The LORD has made Himself known:
He works judgment;
the wicked man is snared by his own devices. Higgaion. Selah.
Transliteration: nvoda yehovah mishefa֢t ashah vefoal khafayv nvokesh rasha higayvon selah

Hebrew: יָשׁ֣וּבוּ רְשָׁעִ֣ים לִשְׁא֑וֹלָה כׇּל־גּ֝וֹיִ֗ם שְׁכֵחֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
Let the wicked be in Sheol,
all the nations who ignore God!
Transliteration: yashuvu reshaiym lishevolah khׇl-gvoyim shekhechey Elohim

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א לָ֭נֶצַח יִשָּׁכַ֣ח אֶבְי֑וֹן תִּקְוַ֥ת (ענוים) [עֲ֝נִיִּ֗ים] תֹּאבַ֥ד לָעַֽד׃
Translated:
Not always shall the needy be ignored,
nor the hope of the afflicted forever lost.
Transliteration: khiy lo lanetsach yishakhach eveyvon tikevat (nvym) [aniyiym] tovad laad

Hebrew: קוּמָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אַל־יָעֹ֣ז אֱנ֑וֹשׁ יִשָּׁפְט֥וּ ג֝וֹיִ֗ם עַל־פָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Rise, O LORD!
Let not men have power;
let the nations be judged in Your presence.
Transliteration: kumah yehovah al-yaoz envosh yishafetu gvoyim al-faneykha

Hebrew: שִׁ֘יתָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ מוֹרָ֗ה לָ֫הֶ֥ם יֵדְע֥וּ גוֹיִ֑ם אֱנ֖וֹשׁ הֵ֣מָּה סֶּֽלָה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Strike fear into them, O LORD;
let the nations know they are only men. Selah.
Transliteration: shiytah yehovah mvorah lahem eideu gvoyim envosh hemah selah {f}

Hebrew: לָמָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה תַּעֲמֹ֣ד בְּרָח֑וֹק תַּ֝עְלִ֗ים לְעִתּ֥וֹת בַּצָּרָֽה׃
Translated:
Why, O LORD, do You stand aloof,
heedless in times of trouble?
Transliteration: lamah yehovah taamod verachvok taeliym leitvot vatsarah

Hebrew: בְּגַאֲוַ֣ת רָ֭שָׁע יִדְלַ֣ק עָנִ֑י יִתָּפְשׂ֓וּ ׀ בִּמְזִמּ֖וֹת ז֣וּ חָשָֽׁבוּ׃
Translated:
The wicked in his arrogance hounds the lowly—
may they be caught in the schemes they devise!
Transliteration: vegaavat rasha yidelak aniy yitafeshu vimezimvot zu chashavu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִלֵּ֣ל רָ֭שָׁע עַל־תַּאֲוַ֣ת נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וּבֹצֵ֥עַ בֵּ֝רֵ֗ךְ נִ֘אֵ֥ץ <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
The wicked crows about his unbridled lusts;
the grasping man reviles and scorns the LORD.
Transliteration: khiy-hilel rasha al-taavat nafeshvo uvotsea verekhe niets <small></small> yehovah

Hebrew: רָשָׁ֗ע כְּגֹ֣בַהּ אַ֭פּוֹ בַּל־יִדְרֹ֑שׁ אֵ֥ין אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים כׇּל־מְזִמּוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
The wicked, arrogant as he is,
in all his scheming [thinks],
“He does not call to account;
God does not care.”
Transliteration: rasha khegovah afvo val-yiderosh eyn Elohimm khׇl-mezimvotayv

Hebrew: יָ֘חִ֤ילוּ דְרָכָ֨ו ׀ בְּכׇל־עֵ֗ת מָר֣וֹם מִ֭שְׁפָּטֶיךָ מִנֶּגְדּ֑וֹ כׇּל־צ֝וֹרְרָ֗יו יָפִ֥יחַ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated:
His ways prosper at all times;
Your judgments are far beyond him;
he snorts at all his foes.
Transliteration: yachiylu derakhav vekhׇl-et marvom mishefateykha minegedvo khׇl-tsvorerayv yafiycha vahem

Hebrew: אָמַ֣ר בְּ֭לִבּוֹ בַּל־אֶמּ֑וֹט לְדֹ֥ר וָ֝דֹ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־בְרָֽע׃
Translated:
He thinks, “I shall not be shaken,
through all time never be in trouble.”
Transliteration: amar velivvo val-emvot ledor vador asher lo-vera

Hebrew: אָלָ֤ה ׀ פִּ֣יהוּ מָ֭לֵא וּמִרְמ֣וֹת וָתֹ֑ךְ תַּ֥חַת לְ֝שׁוֹנ֗וֹ עָמָ֥ל וָאָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
His mouth is full of oaths, deceit, and fraud;
mischief and evil are under his tongue.
Transliteration: alah fiyhu male umiremvot vatokhe tachat leshvonvo amal vaaven

Hebrew: יֵשֵׁ֤ב ׀ בְּמַאְרַ֬ב חֲצֵרִ֗ים בַּֽ֭מִּסְתָּרִים יַהֲרֹ֣ג נָקִ֑י עֵ֝ינָ֗יו לְֽחֵלְכָ֥ה יִצְפֹּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
He lurks in outlying places;
from a covert he slays the innocent;
his eyes spy out the hapless.
Transliteration: eishev vemaerav chatseriym vamisetariym yaharog nakiy eynayv lechelekhah yitsefonu

Hebrew: יֶאֱרֹ֬ב בַּמִּסְתָּ֨ר ׀ כְּאַרְיֵ֬ה בְסֻכֹּ֗ה יֶ֭אֱרֹב לַחֲט֣וֹף עָנִ֑י יַחְטֹ֥ף עָ֝נִ֗י בְּמׇשְׁכ֥וֹ בְרִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He waits in a covert like a lion in his lair;
waits to seize the lowly;
he seizes the lowly as he pulls his net shut;
Transliteration: yeerov vamisetar kheareeih vesukhoh yeerov lachatvof aniy yachetof aniy vemׇshekhvo verishetvo

Hebrew: (ודכה) [יִדְכֶּ֥ה] יָשֹׁ֑חַ וְנָפַ֥ל בַּ֝עֲצוּמָ֗יו (חלכאים) [חֵ֣ל כָּאִֽים]׃
Translated:
he stoops, he crouches,
and the hapless fall prey to his might.
Transliteration: (vdkhh) [yidekheh] yashocha venafal vaatsumayv (chlkhym) [chel khaiym]

Hebrew: אָמַ֣ר בְּ֭לִבּוֹ שָׁ֣כַֽח אֵ֑ל הִסְתִּ֥יר פָּ֝נָ֗יו בַּל־רָאָ֥ה לָנֶֽצַח׃
Translated:
He thinks, “God is not mindful,
He hides His face, He never looks.”
Transliteration: amar velivvo shakhach el hisetiyr fanayv val-raah lanetsach

Hebrew: קוּמָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵ֭ל נְשָׂ֣א יָדֶ֑ךָ אַל־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח (עניים) [עֲנָוִֽים]׃
Translated:
Rise, O LORD!
Strike at him, O God!
Do not forget the lowly.
Transliteration: kumah yehovah el nesha yadekha al-tishekhach (nyym) [anaviym]

Hebrew: עַל־מֶ֤ה ׀ נִאֵ֖ץ רָשָׁ֥ע ׀ אֱלֹהִ֑ים אָמַ֥ר בְּ֝לִבּ֗וֹ לֹ֣א תִדְרֹֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Why should the wicked man scorn God,
thinking You do not call to account?
Transliteration: al-meh niets rasha Elohim amar velivvo lo tiderosh

Hebrew: רָאִ֡תָה כִּי־אַתָּ֤ה ׀ עָ֘מָ֤ל וָכַ֨עַס ׀ תַּבִּיט֮ לָתֵ֢ת בְּיָ֫דֶ֥ךָ עָ֭לֶיךָ יַעֲזֹ֣ב חֵלֵ֑כָה יָ֝ת֗וֹם אַתָּ֤ה ׀ הָיִ֬יתָ עוֹזֵֽר׃
Translated:
You do look!
You take note of mischief and vexation!
To requite is in Your power.
To You the hapless can entrust himself;
You have ever been the orphan’s help.
Transliteration: raitah khiy-atah amal vakhaas taviyt late֢t veyadekha aleykha yaazov chelekhah yatvom atah hayiyta vozer

Hebrew: שְׁ֭בֹר זְר֣וֹעַ רָשָׁ֑ע וָ֝רָ֗ע תִּֽדְרוֹשׁ־רִשְׁע֥וֹ בַל־תִּמְצָֽא׃
Translated:
O break the power of the wicked and evil man,
so that when You look for his wickedness
You will find it no more.
Transliteration: shevor zervoa rasha vara tidervosh-rishevo val-timetsa

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה מֶ֭לֶךְ עוֹלָ֣ם וָעֶ֑ד אָבְד֥וּ ג֝וֹיִ֗ם מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The LORD is king for ever and ever;
the nations will perish from His land.
Transliteration: yehovah melekhe volam vaed avedu gvoyim mearetsvo

Hebrew: תַּאֲוַ֬ת עֲנָוִ֣ים שָׁמַ֣עְתָּ יְהֹוָ֑ה תָּכִ֥ין לִ֝בָּ֗ם תַּקְשִׁ֥יב אׇזְנֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
You will listen to the entreaty of the lowly, O LORD,
You will make their hearts firm;
You will incline Your ear
Transliteration: taavat anaviym shamaeta yehovah takhiyn livam takeshiyv ׇzenekha

Hebrew: לִשְׁפֹּ֥ט יָת֗וֹם וָ֫דָ֥ךְ בַּל־יוֹסִ֥יף ע֑וֹד לַעֲרֹ֥ץ אֱ֝נ֗וֹשׁ מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
to champion the orphan and the downtrodden,
that men who are of the earth tyrannize no more.
Transliteration: lishefot yatvom vadakhe val-yvosiyf vod laarots envosh min-haarets {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ לְדָ֫וִ֥ד בַּֽיהֹוָ֨ה ׀ חָסִ֗יתִי אֵ֭יךְ תֹּאמְר֣וּ לְנַפְשִׁ֑י (נודו) [נ֝֗וּדִי] הַרְכֶ֥ם צִפּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
For the leader. Of David.

In the LORD I take refuge;
how can you say to me,
“Take to the hills like a bird!
Transliteration: lamenatsecha ledavid vayhovah chasiytiy eykhe tomeru lenafeshiy (nvdv) [nuudiy] harekhem tsifvor

Hebrew: כִּ֤י הִנֵּ֪ה הָרְשָׁעִ֡ים יִדְרְכ֬וּן קֶ֗שֶׁת כּוֹנְנ֣וּ חִצָּ֣ם עַל־יֶ֑תֶר לִיר֥וֹת בְּמוֹ־אֹ֝֗פֶל לְיִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
For see, the wicked bend the bow,
they set their arrow on the string
to shoot from the shadows at the upright.
Transliteration: khiy hineh hareshaiym yiderekhun keshet khvonenu chitsam al-yeter liyrvot vemvo-ofel leyisherey-lev

Hebrew: כִּ֣י הַ֭שָּׁתוֹת יֵהָרֵס֑וּן צַ֝דִּ֗יק מַה־פָּעָֽל׃
Translated:
When the foundations are destroyed,
what can the righteous man do?”
Transliteration: khiy hashatvot eiharesun tsadiyk mah-faal

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ בְּֽהֵ֘יכַ֤ל קׇדְשׁ֗וֹ יְהֹוָה֮ בַּשָּׁמַ֢יִם כִּ֫סְא֥וֹ עֵינָ֥יו יֶחֱז֑וּ עַפְעַפָּ֥יו יִ֝בְחֲנ֗וּ בְּנֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
The LORD is in His holy palace;
the LORD—His throne is in heaven;
His eyes behold, His gaze searches mankind.
Transliteration: yehovah veheykhal kׇdeshvo yehovah vashamayiim khisevo eynayv yechezu afeafayv yivechanu veney adam

Hebrew: יְהֹוָה֮ צַדִּ֢יק יִ֫בְחָ֥ן וְ֭רָשָׁע וְאֹהֵ֣ב חָמָ֑ס שָֽׂנְאָ֥ה נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
The LORD seeks out the righteous man,
but loathes the wicked one who loves injustice.
Transliteration: yehovah tsadi֢yk yivechan verasha veohev chamas shaneah nafeshvo

Hebrew: יַמְטֵ֥ר עַל־רְשָׁעִ֗ים פַּ֫חִ֥ים אֵ֣שׁ וְ֭גׇפְרִית וְר֥וּחַ זִלְעָפ֗וֹת מְנָ֣ת כּוֹסָֽם׃
Translated:
He will rain down upon the wicked blazing coals and sulfur;
a scorching wind shall be their lot.
Transliteration: yameter al-reshaiym fachiym esh vegׇferiyt verucha zileafvot menat khvosam

Hebrew: כִּֽי־צַדִּ֣יק יְ֭הֹוָה צְדָק֣וֹת אָהֵ֑ב יָ֝שָׁ֗ר יֶחֱז֥וּ פָנֵֽימוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
For the LORD is righteous;
He loves righteous deeds;
the upright shall behold His face.
Transliteration: khiy-tsadiyk yehovah tsedakvot ahev yashar yechezu faneymvo {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־הַשְּׁמִינִ֗ית מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; on the sheminith. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-hashemiyniyt mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: הוֹשִׁ֣יעָה יְ֭הֹוָה כִּֽי־גָמַ֣ר חָסִ֑יד כִּי־פַ֥סּוּ אֱ֝מוּנִ֗ים מִבְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Help, O LORD!
For the faithful are no more;
the loyal have vanished from among men.
Transliteration: hvoshiyah yehovah khiy-gamar chasiyd khiy-fasu emuniym miveney adam

Hebrew: שָׁ֤וְא ׀ יְֽדַבְּרוּ֮ אִ֤ישׁ אֶת־רֵ֫עֵ֥הוּ שְׂפַ֥ת חֲלָק֑וֹת בְּלֵ֖ב וָלֵ֣ב יְדַבֵּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Men speak lies to one another;
their speech is smooth;
they talk with duplicity.
Transliteration: shave yedaveru iysh et-reehu shefat chalakvot velev valev yedaveru

Hebrew: יַכְרֵ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־שִׂפְתֵ֣י חֲלָק֑וֹת לָ֝שׁ֗וֹן מְדַבֶּ֥רֶת גְּדֹלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
May the LORD cut off all flattering lips,
every tongue that speaks arrogance.
Transliteration: yakheret yehovah khׇl-shifetey chalakvot lashvon medaveret gedolvot

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָמְר֨וּ ׀ לִלְשֹׁנֵ֣נוּ נַ֭גְבִּיר שְׂפָתֵ֣ינוּ אִתָּ֑נוּ מִ֖י אָד֣וֹן לָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
They say, “By our tongues we shall prevail;
with lips such as ours, who can be our master?”
Transliteration: asher ameru lileshonenu nageviyr shefateynu itanu miy advon lanu

Hebrew: מִשֹּׁ֥ד עֲנִיִּים֮ מֵאֶנְקַ֢ת אֶבְי֫וֹנִ֥ים עַתָּ֣ה אָ֭קוּם יֹאמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה אָשִׁ֥ית בְּ֝יֵ֗שַׁע יָפִ֥יחַֽ־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
“Because of the groans of the plundered poor and needy,
I will now act,” says the LORD.
“I will give help,” He affirms to him.
Transliteration: mishod aniyiym meeneka֢t eveyvoniym atah akum yomar yehovah ashiyt veeiesha yafiycha-lvo

Hebrew: אִ֥מְר֣וֹת יְהֹוָה֮ אֲמָר֢וֹת טְהֹ֫ר֥וֹת כֶּ֣סֶף צָ֭רוּף בַּעֲלִ֣יל לָאָ֑רֶץ מְ֝זֻקָּ֗ק שִׁבְעָתָֽיִם׃
Translated:
The words of the LORD are pure words,
silver purged in an earthen crucible,
refined sevenfold.
Transliteration: imervot yehovah amar֢vot tehorvot khesef tsaruf vaaliyl laarets mezukak shiveatayiim

Hebrew: אַתָּֽה־יְהֹוָ֥ה תִּשְׁמְרֵ֑ם תִּצְּרֶ֓נּוּ ׀ מִן־הַדּ֖וֹר ז֣וּ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
You, O LORD, will keep them,
guarding each from this age evermore.
Transliteration: atah-yehovah tishemerem titserenu min-hadvor zu levolam

Hebrew: סָבִ֗יב רְשָׁעִ֥ים יִתְהַלָּכ֑וּן כְּרֻ֥ם זֻ֝לּ֗וּת לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
On every side the wicked roam
when baseness is exalted among men.
Transliteration: saviyv reshaiym yitehalakhun kherum zulut liveney adam {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: עַד־אָ֣נָה יְ֭הֹוָה תִּשְׁכָּחֵ֣נִי נֶ֑צַח עַד־אָ֓נָה ׀ תַּסְתִּ֖יר אֶת־פָּנֶ֣יךָ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
How long, O LORD; will You ignore me forever?
How long will You hide Your face from me?
Transliteration: ad-anah yehovah tishekhacheniy netsach ad-anah tasetiyr et-faneykha mimeniy

Hebrew: עַד־אָ֨נָה אָשִׁ֪ית עֵצ֡וֹת בְּנַפְשִׁ֗י יָג֣וֹן בִּלְבָבִ֣י יוֹמָ֑ם עַד־אָ֓נָה ׀ יָר֖וּם אֹיְבִ֣י עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
How long will I have cares on my mind,
grief in my heart all day?
How long will my enemy have the upper hand?
Transliteration: ad-anah ashiyt etsvot venafeshiy yagvon vilevaviy yvomam ad-anah yarum oyeviy alay

Hebrew: הַבִּ֣יטָֽה עֲ֭נֵנִי יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑י הָאִ֥ירָה עֵ֝ינַ֗י פֶּן־אִישַׁ֥ן הַמָּֽוֶת׃
Translated:
Look at me, answer me, O LORD, my God!
Restore the luster to my eyes,
lest I sleep the sleep of death;
Transliteration: haviytah aneniy yehovah elohay haiyrah eynay fen-iyshan hamavet

Hebrew: פֶּן־יֹאמַ֣ר אֹיְבִ֣י יְכׇלְתִּ֑יו צָרַ֥י יָ֝גִ֗ילוּ כִּ֣י אֶמּֽוֹט׃
Translated:
lest my enemy say, “I have overcome him,”
my foes exult when I totter.
Transliteration: fen-yomar oyeviy yekhׇletiyv tsaray yagiylu khiy emvot

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ בְּחַסְדְּךָ֣ בָטַחְתִּי֮ יָ֤גֵ֥ל לִבִּ֗י בִּישׁוּעָ֫תֶ֥ךָ אָשִׁ֥ירָה לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֖י גָמַ֣ל עָלָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
But I trust in Your faithfulness,
my heart will exult in Your deliverance.
I will sing to the LORD,
for He has been good to me.
Transliteration: vaaniy vechasedekha vatachetiy yagel liviy viyshuatekha ashiyrah layhovah khiy gamal alay {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ לְדָ֫וִ֥ד אָ֘מַ֤ר נָבָ֣ל בְּ֭לִבּוֹ אֵ֣ין אֱלֹהִ֑ים הִֽשְׁחִ֗יתוּ הִֽתְעִ֥יבוּ עֲלִילָ֗ה אֵ֣ין עֹֽשֵׂה־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
For the leader. Of David.

The benighted man thinks,
“God does not care.”
Man’s deeds are corrupt and loathsome;
no one does good.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha ledavid amar naval velivvo eyn Elohim hishechiytu hiteiyvu aliylah eyn osheh-tvov

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה מִשָּׁמַיִם֮ הִשְׁקִ֢יף עַֽל־בְּנֵי־אָ֫דָ֥ם לִ֭רְאוֹת הֲיֵ֣שׁ מַשְׂכִּ֑יל דֹּ֝רֵ֗שׁ אֶת־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
The LORD looks down from heaven on mankind
to find a man of understanding,
a man mindful of God.
Transliteration: yehovah mishamayim hisheki֢yf al-veney-adam lirevot haeish mashekhiyl doresh et-Elohim

Hebrew: הַכֹּ֥ל סָר֮ יַחְדָּ֢ו נֶ֫אֱלָ֥חוּ אֵ֤ין עֹֽשֵׂה־ט֑וֹב אֵ֝֗ין גַּם־אֶחָֽד׃
Translated:
All have turned bad,
altogether foul;
there is none who does good,
not even one.
Transliteration: hakhol sar yacheda֢v neelachu eyn osheh-tvov eyn gam-echad

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֥א יָדְעוּ֮ כׇּל־פֹּ֢עֲלֵ֫י אָ֥וֶן אֹכְלֵ֣י עַ֭מִּי אָ֣כְלוּ לֶ֑חֶם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לֹ֣א קָרָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
Are they so witless, all those evildoers,
who devour my people as they devour food,
and do not invoke the LORD?
Transliteration: halo yadeu khׇl-fo֢aley aven okheley amiy akhelu lechem yehovah lo karau

Hebrew: שָׁ֤ם ׀ פָּ֣חֲדוּ פָ֑חַד כִּֽי־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים בְּד֣וֹר צַדִּֽיק׃
Translated:
There they will be seized with fright,
for God is present in the circle of the righteous.
Transliteration: sham fachadu fachad khiy-Elohimm vedvor tsadiyk

Hebrew: עֲצַת־עָנִ֥י תָבִ֑ישׁוּ כִּ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה מַחְסֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
You may set at naught the counsel of the lowly,
but the LORD is his refuge.
Transliteration: atsat-aniy taviyshu khiy yehovah machesehu

Hebrew: מִ֥י־יִתֵּ֣ן מִצִּיּוֹן֮ יְשׁוּעַ֢ת יִשְׂרָ֫אֵ֥ל בְּשׁ֣וּב יְ֭הֹוָה שְׁב֣וּת עַמּ֑וֹ יָגֵ֥ל יַ֝עֲקֹ֗ב יִשְׂמַ֥ח יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
O that the deliverance of Israel might come from Zion!
When the LORD restores the fortunes of His people,
Jacob will exult, Israel will rejoice.
Transliteration: miy-yiten mitsiyyvon yeshua֢t yisherael veshuv yehovah shevut amvo yagel yaakov yishemach yisherael {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָ֫וִ֥ד יְ֭הֹוָה מִי־יָג֣וּר בְּאׇהֳלֶ֑ךָ מִֽי־יִ֝שְׁכֹּ֗ן בְּהַ֣ר קׇדְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
A psalm of David.

LORD, who may sojourn in Your tent,
who may dwell on Your holy mountain?
Transliteration: mizemvor ledavid yehovah miy-yagur veׇholekha miy-yishekhon vehar kׇdeshekha

Hebrew: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ תָּ֭מִים וּפֹעֵ֥ל צֶ֑דֶק וְדֹבֵ֥ר אֱ֝מֶ֗ת בִּלְבָבֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He who lives without blame,
who does what is right,
and in his heart acknowledges the truth;
Transliteration: hvolekhe tamiym ufoel tsedek vedover emet vilevavvo

Hebrew: לֹֽא־רָגַ֨ל ׀ עַל־לְשֹׁנ֗וֹ לֹא־עָשָׂ֣ה לְרֵעֵ֣הוּ רָעָ֑ה וְ֝חֶרְפָּ֗ה לֹא־נָשָׂ֥א עַל־קְרֹבֽוֹ׃
Translated:
whose tongue is not given to evil;
who has never done harm to his fellow,
or borne reproach for [his acts toward] his neighbor;
Transliteration: lo-ragal al-leshonvo lo-ashah lereehu raah vecherefah lo-nasha al-kerovvo

Hebrew: נִבְזֶ֤ה ׀ בְּֽעֵ֘ינָ֤יו נִמְאָ֗ס וְאֶת־יִרְאֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֣ה יְכַבֵּ֑ד נִשְׁבַּ֥ע לְ֝הָרַ֗ע וְלֹ֣א יָמִֽר׃
Translated:
for whom a contemptible man is abhorrent,
but who honors those who fear the LORD;
who stands by his oath even to his hurt;
Transliteration: nivezeh veeynayv nimeas veet-yireey yehovah yekhaved nisheva lehara velo yamir

Hebrew: כַּסְפּ֤וֹ ׀ לֹא־נָתַ֣ן בְּנֶשֶׁךְ֮ וְשֹׁ֥חַד עַל־נָקִ֗י לֹ֥א־לָ֫קָ֥ח עֹֽשֵׂה־אֵ֑לֶּה לֹ֖א יִמּ֣וֹט לְעוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
who has never lent money at interest,
or accepted a bribe against the innocent.
The man who acts thus shall never be shaken.
Transliteration: khasefvo lo-natan veneshekhe veshochad al-nakiy lo-lakach osheh-eleh lo yimvot levolam {f}

Hebrew: מִכְתָּ֥ם לְדָוִ֑ד שׇֽׁמְרֵ֥נִי אֵ֝֗ל כִּֽי־חָסִ֥יתִי בָֽךְ׃
Translated:
A michtam of David.

Protect me, O God, for I seek refuge in You.
Transliteration: mikhetam ledavid shׇmereniy el khiy-chasiytiy vakhe

Hebrew: אָמַ֣רְתְּ לַֽ֭יהֹוָה אֲדֹנָ֣י אָ֑תָּה ט֝וֹבָתִ֗י בַּל־עָלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I say to the LORD,
“You are my Lord, my benefactor;
there is none above You.”
Transliteration: amarete layhovah adonay atah tvovatiy val-aleykha

Hebrew: לִ֭קְדוֹשִׁים אֲשֶׁר־בָּאָ֣רֶץ הֵ֑מָּה וְ֝אַדִּירֵ֗י כׇּל־חֶפְצִי־בָֽם׃
Translated:
As to the holy and mighty ones that are in the land,
my whole desire concerning them is that
Transliteration: likedvoshiym asher-vaarets hemah veadiyrey khׇl-chefetsiy-vam

Hebrew: יִרְבּ֥וּ עַצְּבוֹתָם֮ אַחֵ֢ר מָ֫הָ֥רוּ בַּל־אַסִּ֣יךְ נִסְכֵּיהֶ֣ם מִדָּ֑ם וּֽבַל־אֶשָּׂ֥א אֶת־שְׁ֝מוֹתָ֗ם עַל־שְׂפָתָֽי׃
Translated:
those who espouse another [god]
may have many sorrows!
I will have no part of their bloody libations;
their names will not pass my lips.
Transliteration: yirevu atsevvotam ache֢r maharu val-asiykhe nisekheyhem midam uval-esha et-shemvotam al-shefatay

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה מְנָת־חֶלְקִ֥י וְכוֹסִ֑י אַ֝תָּ֗ה תּוֹמִ֥יךְ גּוֹרָלִֽי׃
Translated:
The LORD is my allotted share and portion;
You control my fate.
Transliteration: yehovah menat-chelekiy vekhvosiy atah tvomiykhe gvoraliy

Hebrew: חֲבָלִ֣ים נָֽפְלוּ־לִ֭י בַּנְּעִמִ֑ים אַף־נַ֝חֲלָ֗ת שָֽׁפְרָ֥ה עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
Delightful country has fallen to my lot;
lovely indeed is my estate.
Transliteration: chavaliym nafelu-liy vaneimiym af-nachalat shaferah alay

Hebrew: אֲבָרֵ֗ךְ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְעָצָ֑נִי אַף־לֵ֝יל֗וֹת יִסְּר֥וּנִי כִלְיוֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
I bless the LORD who has guided me;
my conscience admonishes me at night.
Transliteration: avarekhe et-yehovah asher yeatsaniy af-leylvot yiseruniy khileyvotay

Hebrew: שִׁוִּ֬יתִי יְהֹוָ֣ה לְנֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִ֑יד כִּ֥י מִֽ֝ימִינִ֗י בַּל־אֶמּֽוֹט׃
Translated:
I am ever mindful of the LORD’s presence;
He is at my right hand; I shall never be shaken.
Transliteration: shiviytiy yehovah lenegediy tamiyd khiy miymiyniy val-emvot

Hebrew: לָכֵ֤ן ׀ שָׂמַ֣ח לִ֭בִּי וַיָּ֣גֶל כְּבוֹדִ֑י אַף־בְּ֝שָׂרִ֗י יִשְׁכֹּ֥ן לָבֶֽטַח׃
Translated:
So my heart rejoices,
my whole being exults,
and my body rests secure.
Transliteration: lakhen shamach liviy vayagel khevvodiy af-veshariy yishekhon lavetach

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־תַעֲזֹ֣ב נַפְשִׁ֣י לִשְׁא֑וֹל לֹֽא־תִתֵּ֥ן חֲ֝סִידְךָ֗ לִרְא֥וֹת שָֽׁחַת׃
Translated:
For You will not abandon me to Sheol,
or let Your faithful one see the Pit.
Transliteration: khiy lo-taazov nafeshiy lishevol lo-titen chasiydekha lirevot shachat

Hebrew: תּֽוֹדִיעֵנִי֮ אֹ֤רַח חַ֫יִּ֥ים שֹׂ֣בַע שְׂ֭מָחוֹת אֶת־פָּנֶ֑יךָ נְעִמ֖וֹת בִּימִינְךָ֣ נֶֽצַח׃ {פ}
Translated:
You will teach me the path of life.
In Your presence is perfect joy;
delights are ever in Your right hand.
Transliteration: tvodiyeniy orach chayiym shova shemachvot et-faneykha neimvot viymiynekha netsach {f}

Hebrew: תְּפִלָּ֗ה לְדָ֫וִ֥ד שִׁמְעָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ צֶ֗דֶק הַקְשִׁ֥יבָה רִנָּתִ֗י הַאֲזִ֥ינָה תְפִלָּתִ֑י בְּ֝לֹ֗א שִׂפְתֵ֥י מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
A prayer of David.

Hear, O LORD, what is just;
heed my cry, give ear to my prayer,
uttered without guile.
Transliteration: tefilah ledavid shimeah yehovah tsedek hakeshiyvah rinatiy haaziynah tefilatiy velo shifetey miremah

Hebrew: מִ֭לְּפָנֶיךָ מִשְׁפָּטִ֣י יֵצֵ֑א עֵ֝ינֶ֗יךָ תֶּחֱזֶ֥ינָה מֵישָׁרִֽים׃
Translated:
My vindication will come from You;
Your eyes will behold what is right.
Transliteration: milefaneykha mishefatiy eitse eyneykha techezeynah meyshariym

Translated:
You have visited me at night, probed my mind,
You have tested me and found nothing amiss;
I determined that my mouth should not transgress.
Transliteration: vachaneta liviy fakadeta layelah tserafetaniy val-timetsa zamotiy val-yaavׇr-fiy

Hebrew: לִפְעֻלּ֣וֹת אָ֭דָם בִּדְבַ֣ר שְׂפָתֶ֑יךָ אֲנִ֥י שָׁ֝מַ֗רְתִּי אׇרְח֥וֹת פָּרִֽיץ׃
Translated:
As for man’s dealings,
in accord with the command of Your lips,
I have kept in view the fate of the lawless.
Transliteration: lifeulvot adam videvar shefateykha aniy shamaretiy ׇrechvot fariyts

Hebrew: תָּמֹ֣ךְ אֲ֭שֻׁרַי בְּמַעְגְּלוֹתֶ֑יךָ בַּל־נָמ֥וֹטּוּ פְעָמָֽי׃
Translated:
My feet have held to Your paths;
my legs have not given way.
Transliteration: tamokhe ashuray vemaegelvoteykha val-namvotu feamay

Hebrew: אֲנִֽי־קְרָאתִ֣יךָ כִֽי־תַעֲנֵ֣נִי אֵ֑ל הַֽט־אׇזְנְךָ֥ לִ֝֗י שְׁמַ֣ע אִמְרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
I call on You;
You will answer me, God;
turn Your ear to me,
hear what I say.
Transliteration: aniy-keratiykha khiy-taaneniy el hat-ׇzenekha liy shema imeratiy

Hebrew: הַפְלֵ֣ה חֲ֭סָדֶיךָ מוֹשִׁ֣יעַ חוֹסִ֑ים מִ֝מִּתְקוֹמְמִ֗ים בִּֽימִינֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Display Your faithfulness in wondrous deeds,
You who deliver with Your right hand
those who seek refuge from assailants.
Transliteration: hafeleh chasadeykha mvoshiya chvosiym mimitekvomemiym viymiynekha

Hebrew: שׇׁ֭מְרֵנִי כְּאִישׁ֣וֹן בַּת־עָ֑יִן בְּצֵ֥ל כְּ֝נָפֶ֗יךָ תַּסְתִּירֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Guard me like the apple of Your eye;
hide me in the shadow of Your wings
Transliteration: shׇmereniy kheiyshvon vat-ayiin vetsel khenafeykha tasetiyreniy

Hebrew: מִפְּנֵ֣י רְ֭שָׁעִים ז֣וּ שַׁדּ֑וּנִי אֹיְבַ֥י בְּ֝נֶ֗פֶשׁ יַקִּ֥יפוּ עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
from the wicked who despoil me,
my mortal enemies who encircle me.
Transliteration: mifeney reshaiym zu shaduniy oyevay venefesh yakiyfu alay

Hebrew: חֶלְבָּ֥מוֹ סָּגְר֑וּ פִּ֝֗ימוֹ דִּבְּר֥וּ בְגֵאֽוּת׃
Translated:
Their hearts are closed to pity;
they mouth arrogance;
Transliteration: chelevamvo sageru fiymvo diveru vegeut

Hebrew: אַ֭שֻּׁרֵינוּ עַתָּ֣ה (סבבוני) [סְבָב֑וּנוּ] עֵינֵיהֶ֥ם יָ֝שִׁ֗יתוּ לִנְט֥וֹת בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
now they hem in our feet on every side;
they set their eyes roaming over the land.
Transliteration: ashureynu atah (svvvny) [sevavunu] eyneyhem yashiytu linetvot vaarets

Hebrew: דִּמְיֹנ֗וֹ כְּ֭אַרְיֵה יִכְס֣וֹף לִטְרֹ֑ף וְ֝כִכְפִ֗יר יֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּמִסְתָּרִֽים׃
Translated:
He is like a lion eager for prey,
a king of beasts lying in wait.
Transliteration: dimeyonvo kheareeih yikhesvof literof vekhikhefiyr yoshev vemisetariym

Hebrew: קוּמָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֗ה קַדְּמָ֣ה פָ֭נָיו הַכְרִיעֵ֑הוּ פַּלְּטָ֥ה נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י מֵרָשָׁ֥ע חַרְבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Rise, O LORD! Go forth to meet him.
Bring him down;
rescue me from the wicked with Your sword,
Transliteration: kumah yehovah kademah fanayv hakheriyehu faletah nafeshiy merasha charevekha

Hebrew: מִ֥מְתִֽים־יָדְךָ֨ ׀ יְהֹוָ֡ה מִֽמְתִ֬ים מֵחֶ֗לֶד חֶלְקָ֥ם בַּֽחַיִּים֮ (וצפינך) [וּֽצְפוּנְךָ֮] תְּמַלֵּ֢א בִ֫טְנָ֥ם יִשְׂבְּע֥וּ בָנִ֑ים וְהִנִּ֥יחוּ יִ֝תְרָ֗ם לְעוֹלְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
from men, O LORD, with Your hand,
from men whose share in life is fleeting.
But as to Your treasured ones,
fill their bellies.
Their sons too shall be satisfied,
and have something to leave over for their young.
Transliteration: mimetiym-yadekha yehovah mimetiym mecheled chelekam vachayiym (vtsfynkh) [utsefunekha] temale֢ vitenam yisheveu vaniym vehiniychu yiteram levoleleyhem

Hebrew: אֲנִ֗י בְּ֭צֶדֶק אֶחֱזֶ֣ה פָנֶ֑יךָ אֶשְׂבְּעָ֥ה בְ֝הָקִ֗יץ תְּמוּנָתֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Then I, justified, will behold Your face;
awake, I am filled with the vision of You.
Transliteration: aniy vetsedek echezeh faneykha esheveah vehakiyts temunatekha {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֤חַ ׀ לְעֶ֥בֶד יְהֹוָ֗ה לְדָ֫וִ֥ד אֲשֶׁ֤ר דִּבֶּ֨ר ׀ לַיהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־דִּ֭בְרֵי הַשִּׁירָ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את בְּי֤וֹם הִֽצִּיל־יְהֹוָ֘ה־אוֹת֥וֹ מִכַּ֥ף כׇּל־אֹ֝יְבָ֗יו וּמִיַּ֥ד שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: For the leader. Of David, the servant of the L<small>ORD</small>, who addressed the words of this song to the L<small>ORD</small> after the L<small>ORD</small> had saved him from the hands of all his enemies and from the clutches of Saul.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha leeved yehovah ledavid asher diver layhovah et-diverey hashiyrah hazot veyvom hitsiyl-yehovah-votvo mikhaf khׇl-oyevayv umiyad shaul

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֡ר אֶרְחׇמְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה חִזְקִֽי׃
Translated:
He said:
I adore you, O LORD, my strength,
Transliteration: vayomar erechׇmekha yehovah chizekiy

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ סַ֥לְעִ֥י וּמְצוּדָתִ֗י וּמְפַ֫לְטִ֥י אֵלִ֣י צ֭וּרִי אֶֽחֱסֶה־בּ֑וֹ מָֽגִנִּ֥י וְקֶֽרֶן־יִ֝שְׁעִ֗י מִשְׂגַּבִּֽי׃
Translated:
O LORD, my crag, my fortress, my rescuer,
my God, my rock in whom I seek refuge,
my shield, my mighty champion, my haven.
Transliteration: yehovah saleiy umetsudatiy umefaletiy eliy tsuriy echeseh-vvo maginiy vekeren-yisheiy mishegaviy

Hebrew: מְ֭הֻלָּל אֶקְרָ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמִן־אֹ֝יְבַ֗י אִוָּשֵֽׁעַ׃
Translated:
All praise! I called on the LORD
and was delivered from my enemies.
Transliteration: mehulal ekera yehovah umin-oyevay ivashea

Hebrew: אֲפָפ֥וּנִי חֶבְלֵי־מָ֑וֶת וְֽנַחֲלֵ֖י בְלִיַּ֣עַל יְבַֽעֲתֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
Ropes of Death encompassed me;
torrents of Belial terrified me;
Transliteration: afafuniy cheveley-mavet venachaley veliyaal yevaatuniy

Hebrew: חֶבְלֵ֣י שְׁא֣וֹל סְבָב֑וּנִי קִ֝דְּמ֗וּנִי מ֣וֹקְשֵׁי מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
ropes of Sheol encircled me;
snares of Death confronted me.
Transliteration: cheveley shevol sevavuniy kidemuniy mvokeshey mavet

Hebrew: בַּצַּר־לִ֤י ׀ אֶ֥קְרָ֣א יְהֹוָה֮ וְאֶל־אֱלֹהַ֢י אֲשַׁ֫וֵּ֥עַ יִשְׁמַ֣ע מֵהֵיכָל֣וֹ קוֹלִ֑י וְ֝שַׁוְעָתִ֗י לְפָנָ֤יו ׀ תָּב֬וֹא בְאׇזְנָֽיו׃
Translated:
In my distress I called on the LORD,
cried out to my God;
in His temple He heard my voice;
my cry to Him reached His ears.
Transliteration: vatsar-liy ekera yehovah veel-eloha֢y ashavea yishema meheykhalvo kvoliy veshaveatiy lefanayv tavvo veׇzenayv

Hebrew: וַתִּגְעַ֬שׁ וַתִּרְעַ֨שׁ ׀ הָאָ֗רֶץ וּמוֹסְדֵ֣י הָרִ֣ים יִרְגָּ֑זוּ וַ֝יִּתְגָּֽעֲשׁ֗וּ כִּי־חָ֥רָה לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Then the earth rocked and quaked;
the foundations of the mountains shook,
rocked by His indignation;
Transliteration: vatigeash vatireash haarets umvosedey hariym yiregazu vayitegaashu khiy-charah lvo

Hebrew: עָ֘לָ֤ה עָשָׁ֨ן ׀ בְּאַפּ֗וֹ וְאֵשׁ־מִפִּ֥יו תֹּאכֵ֑ל גֶּ֝חָלִ֗ים בָּעֲר֥וּ מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
smoke went up from His nostrils,
from His mouth came devouring fire;
live coals blazed forth from Him.
Transliteration: alah ashan veafvo veesh-mifiyv tokhel gechaliym vaaru mimenu

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣ט שָׁ֭מַיִם וַיֵּרַ֑ד וַ֝עֲרָפֶ֗ל תַּ֣חַת רַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated:
He bent the sky and came down,
thick cloud beneath His feet.
Transliteration: vayet shamayim vayerad vaarafel tachat ragelayv

Hebrew: וַיִּרְכַּ֣ב עַל־כְּ֭רוּב וַיָּעֹ֑ף וַ֝יֵּ֗דֶא עַל־כַּנְפֵי־רֽוּחַ׃
Translated:
He mounted a cherub and flew,
gliding on the wings of the wind.
Transliteration: vayirekhav al-kheruv vayaof vayede al-khanefey-rucha

Hebrew: יָ֤שֶׁת־חֹ֨שֶׁךְ ׀ סִתְר֗וֹ סְבִֽיבוֹתָ֥יו סֻכָּת֑וֹ חֶשְׁכַת־מַ֝֗יִם עָבֵ֥י שְׁחָקִֽים׃
Translated:
He made darkness His screen;
dark thunderheads, dense clouds of the sky
were His pavilion round about Him.
Transliteration: yashet-choshekhe sitervo seviyvvotayv sukhatvo cheshekhat-mayiyim avey shechakiym

Hebrew: מִנֹּ֗גַהּ נֶ֫גְדּ֥וֹ עָבָ֥יו עָבְר֑וּ בָּ֝רָ֗ד וְגַֽחֲלֵי־אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Out of the brilliance before Him,
hail and fiery coals pierced His clouds.
Transliteration: minogah negedvo avayv averu varad vegachaley-esh

Hebrew: וַיַּרְעֵ֬ם בַּשָּׁמַ֨יִם ׀ יְֽהֹוָ֗ה וְ֭עֶלְיוֹן יִתֵּ֣ן קֹל֑וֹ בָּ֝רָ֗ד וְגַֽחֲלֵי־אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Then the LORD thundered from heaven,
the Most High gave forth His voice—
hail and fiery coals.
Transliteration: vayareem vashamayiim yehovah veeleyvon yiten kolvo varad vegachaley-esh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח חִ֭צָּיו וַיְפִיצֵ֑ם וּבְרָקִ֥ים רָ֝֗ב וַיְהֻמֵּֽם׃
Translated:
He let fly His shafts and scattered them;
He discharged lightning and routed them.
Transliteration: vayishelach chitsayv vayefiytsem uverakiym rav vayehumem

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤רָא֨וּ ׀ אֲפִ֥יקֵי מַ֗יִם וַֽיִּגָּלוּ֮ מוֹסְד֢וֹת תֵּ֫בֵ֥ל מִגַּעֲרָ֣תְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֑ה מִ֝נִּשְׁמַ֗ת ר֣וּחַ אַפֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
The ocean bed was exposed;
the foundations of the world were laid bare
by Your mighty roaring, O LORD,
at the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.
Transliteration: vayerau afiykey mayiim vayigalu mvosed֢vot tevel migaaratekha yehovah minishemat rucha afekha

Hebrew: יִשְׁלַ֣ח מִ֭מָּרוֹם יִקָּחֵ֑נִי יַֽ֝מְשֵׁ֗נִי מִמַּ֥יִם רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
He reached down from on high, He took me;
He drew me out of the mighty waters;
Transliteration: yishelach mimarvom yikacheniy yamesheniy mimayiim raviym

Hebrew: יַצִּילֵ֗נִי מֵאֹיְבִ֥י עָ֑ז וּ֝מִשֹּׂנְאַ֗י כִּֽי־אָמְצ֥וּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
He saved me from my fierce enemy,
from foes too strong for me.
Transliteration: yatsiyleniy meoyeviy az umishoneay khiy-ametsu mimeniy

Hebrew: יְקַדְּמ֥וּנִי בְיוֹם־אֵידִ֑י וַֽיְהִי־יְהֹוָ֖ה לְמִשְׁעָ֣ן לִֽי׃
Translated:
They confronted me on the day of my calamity,
but the LORD was my support.
Transliteration: yekademuniy veyvom-eydiy vayehiy-yehovah lemishean liy

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצִיאֵ֥נִי לַמֶּרְחָ֑ב יְ֝חַלְּצֵ֗נִי כִּ֘י־חָ֥פֵֽץ־בִּֽי׃
Translated:
He brought me out to freedom;
He rescued me because He was pleased with me.
Transliteration: vayyvotsiyeniy lamerechav yechaletseniy khiy-chafets-viy

Hebrew: יִגְמְלֵ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֣ה כְּצִדְקִ֑י כְּבֹ֥ר יָ֝דַ֗י יָשִׁ֥יב לִֽי׃
Translated:
The LORD rewarded me according to my merit;
He requited the cleanness of my hands;
Transliteration: yigemeleniy yehovah khetsidekiy khevor yaday yashiyv liy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־שָׁ֭מַרְתִּי דַּרְכֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־רָ֝שַׁ֗עְתִּי מֵאֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated:
for I have kept to the ways of the LORD,
and have not been guilty before my God;
Transliteration: khiy-shamaretiy darekhey yehovah velo-rashaetiy meelohay

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כׇל־מִשְׁפָּטָ֣יו לְנֶגְדִּ֑י וְ֝חֻקֹּתָ֗יו לֹא־אָסִ֥יר מֶֽנִּי׃
Translated:
for I am mindful of all His rules;
I have not disregarded His laws.
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-mishefatayv lenegediy vechukotayv lo-asiyr meniy

Hebrew: וָאֱהִ֣י תָמִ֣ים עִמּ֑וֹ וָ֝אֶשְׁתַּמֵּ֗ר מֵעֲוֺנִֽי׃
Translated:
I have been blameless toward Him,
and have guarded myself against sinning;
Transliteration: vaehiy tamiym imvo vaeshetamer meavoniy

Hebrew: וַיָּֽשֶׁב־יְהֹוָ֣ה לִ֣י כְצִדְקִ֑י כְּבֹ֥ר יָ֝דַ֗י לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינָֽיו׃
Translated:
and the LORD has requited me according to my merit,
the cleanness of my hands in His sight.
Transliteration: vayashev-yehovah liy khetsidekiy khevor yaday leneged eynayv

Hebrew: עִם־חָסִ֥יד תִּתְחַסָּ֑ד עִם־גְּבַ֥ר תָּ֝מִ֗ים תִּתַּמָּֽם׃
Translated:
With the loyal, You deal loyally;
with the blameless man, blamelessly.
Transliteration: im-chasiyd titechasad im-gevar tamiym titamam

Hebrew: עִם־נָבָ֥ר תִּתְבָּרָ֑ר וְעִם־עִ֝קֵּ֗שׁ תִּתְפַּתָּֽל׃
Translated:
With the pure, You act purely,
and with the perverse, You are wily.
Transliteration: im-navar titevarar veim-ikesh titefatal

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַ֭תָּה עַם־עָנִ֣י תוֹשִׁ֑יעַ וְעֵינַ֖יִם רָמ֣וֹת תַּשְׁפִּֽיל׃
Translated:
It is You who deliver lowly folk,
but haughty eyes You humble.
Transliteration: khiy-atah am-aniy tvoshiya veeynayiim ramvot tashefiyl

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַ֭תָּה תָּאִ֣יר נֵרִ֑י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י יַגִּ֥יהַּ חׇשְׁכִּֽי׃
Translated:
It is You who light my lamp;
the LORD, my God, lights up my darkness.
Transliteration: khiy-atah taiyr neriy yehovah elohay yagiyha chׇshekhiy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־בְ֭ךָ אָרֻ֣ץ גְּד֑וּד וּ֝בֵֽאלֹהַ֗י אֲדַלֶּג־שֽׁוּר׃
Translated:
With You, I can rush a barrier;
with my God I can scale a wall;
Transliteration: khiy-vekha aruts gedud uvelohay adaleg-shur

Hebrew: הָאֵל֮ תָּמִ֢ים דַּ֫רְכּ֥וֹ אִמְרַֽת־יְהֹוָ֥ה צְרוּפָ֑ה מָגֵ֥ן ה֝֗וּא לְכֹ֤ל ׀ הַחֹסִ֬ים בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
the way of God is perfect;
the word of the LORD is pure;
He is a shield to all who seek refuge in Him.
Transliteration: hael tami֢ym darekhvo imerat-yehovah tserufah magen huu lekhol hachosiym vvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מִ֣י אֱ֭לוֹהַּ מִבַּלְעֲדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמִ֥י צ֝֗וּר זוּלָתִ֥י אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Truly, who is a god except the LORD,
who is a rock but our God?—
Transliteration: khiy miy elvoha mivaleadey yehovah umiy tsuur zulatiy eloheynu

Hebrew: הָ֭אֵל הַמְאַזְּרֵ֣נִי חָ֑יִל וַיִּתֵּ֖ן תָּמִ֣ים דַּרְכִּֽי׃
Translated:
the God who girded me with might,
who made my way perfect;
Transliteration: hael hameazereniy chayiil vayiten tamiym darekhiy

Hebrew: מְשַׁוֶּ֣ה רַ֭גְלַי כָּאַיָּל֑וֹת וְעַ֥ל בָּ֝מֹתַ֗י יַעֲמִידֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
who made my legs like a deer’s,
and let me stand firm on the heights;
Transliteration: meshaveh ragelay khaayalvot veal vamotay yaamiydeniy

Hebrew: מְלַמֵּ֣ד יָ֭דַי לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וְֽנִחֲתָ֥ה קֶֽשֶׁת־נְ֝חוּשָׁ֗ה זְרוֹעֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
who trained my hands for battle;
my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
Transliteration: melamed yaday lamilechamah venichatah keshet-nechushah zervootay

Hebrew: וַתִּתֶּן־לִי֮ מָגֵ֢ן יִ֫שְׁעֶ֥ךָ וִֽימִינְךָ֥ תִסְעָדֵ֑נִי וְֽעַנְוַתְךָ֥ תַרְבֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
You have given me the shield of Your protection;
Your right hand has sustained me,
Your care has made me great.
Transliteration: vatiten-liy mage֢n yisheekha viymiynekha tiseadeniy veanevatekha tareveniy

Hebrew: תַּרְחִ֣יב צַעֲדִ֣י תַחְתָּ֑י וְלֹ֥א מָ֝עֲד֗וּ קַרְסֻלָּֽי׃
Translated:
You have let me stride on freely;
my feet have not slipped.
Transliteration: tarechiyv tsaadiy tachetay velo maadu karesulay

Hebrew: אֶרְדּ֣וֹף א֭וֹיְבַי וְאַשִּׂיגֵ֑ם וְלֹֽא־אָ֝שׁ֗וּב עַד־כַּלּוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
I pursued my enemies and overtook them;
I did not turn back till I destroyed them.
Transliteration: eredvof voyevay veashiygem velo-ashuv ad-khalvotam

Hebrew: אֶ֭מְחָצֵם וְלֹא־יֻ֣כְלוּ ק֑וּם יִ֝פְּל֗וּ תַּ֣חַת רַגְלָֽי׃
Translated:
I struck them down,
and they could rise no more;
they lay fallen at my feet.
Transliteration: emechatsem velo-yukhelu kum yifelu tachat ragelay

Hebrew: וַתְּאַזְּרֵ֣נִי חַ֭יִל לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה תַּכְרִ֖יעַ קָמַ֣י תַּחְתָּֽי׃
Translated:
You have girded me with strength for battle,
brought my adversaries low before me,
Transliteration: vateazereniy chayiil lamilechamah takheriya kamay tachetay

Hebrew: וְֽאֹיְבַ֗י נָתַ֣תָּה לִּ֣י עֹ֑רֶף וּ֝מְשַׂנְאַ֗י אַצְמִיתֵֽם׃
Translated:
made my enemies turn tail before me;
I wiped out my foes.
Transliteration: veoyevay natatah liy oref umeshaneay atsemiytem

Hebrew: יְשַׁוְּע֥וּ וְאֵין־מוֹשִׁ֑יעַ עַל־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וְלֹ֣א עָנָֽם׃
Translated:
They cried out, but there was none to deliver;
[cried] to the LORD, but He did not answer them.
Transliteration: yeshaveu veeyn-mvoshiya al-yehovah velo anam

Hebrew: וְֽאֶשְׁחָקֵ֗ם כְּעָפָ֥ר עַל־פְּנֵי־ר֑וּחַ כְּטִ֖יט חוּצ֣וֹת אֲרִיקֵֽם׃
Translated:
I ground them fine as windswept dust;
I trod them flat as dirt of the streets.
Transliteration: veeshechakem kheafar al-feney-rucha khetiyt chutsvot ariykem

Hebrew: תְּפַלְּטֵנִי֮ מֵרִ֢יבֵ֫י עָ֥ם תְּ֭שִׂימֵנִי לְרֹ֣אשׁ גּוֹיִ֑ם עַ֖ם לֹא־יָדַ֣עְתִּי יַֽעַבְדֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
You have rescued me from the strife of people;
You have set me at the head of nations;
peoples I knew not must serve me.
Transliteration: tefaleteniy meri֢yvey am teshiymeniy lerosh gvoyim am lo-yadaetiy yaaveduniy

Hebrew: לְשֵׁ֣מַֽע אֹ֭זֶן יִשָּׁ֣מְעוּ לִ֑י בְּנֵֽי־נֵ֝כָ֗ר יְכַחֲשׁוּ־לִֽי׃
Translated:
At the mere report of me they are submissive;
foreign peoples cower before me;
Transliteration: leshema ozen yishameu liy veney-nekhar yekhachashu-liy

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־נֵכָ֥ר יִבֹּ֑לוּ וְ֝יַחְרְג֗וּ מִֽמִּסְגְּרֽוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
foreign peoples lose courage,
and come trembling out of their strongholds.
Transliteration: veney-nekhar yivolu veyacheregu mimisegervoteyhem

Hebrew: חַי־יְ֭הֹוָה וּבָר֣וּךְ צוּרִ֑י וְ֝יָר֗וּם אֱלוֹהֵ֥י יִשְׁעִֽי׃
Translated:
The LORD lives! Blessed is my rock!
Exalted be God, my deliverer,
Transliteration: chay-yehovah uvarukhe tsuriy veyarum elvohey yisheiy

Hebrew: הָאֵ֗ל הַנּוֹתֵ֣ן נְקָמ֣וֹת לִ֑י וַיַּדְבֵּ֖ר עַמִּ֣ים תַּחְתָּֽי׃
Translated:
the God who has vindicated me
and made peoples subject to me,
Transliteration: hael hanvoten nekamvot liy vayadever amiym tachetay

Hebrew: מְפַלְּטִ֗י מֵאֹ֫יְבָ֥י אַ֣ף מִן־קָ֭מַי תְּרוֹמְמֵ֑נִי מֵאִ֥ישׁ חָ֝מָ֗ס תַּצִּילֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
who rescued me from my enemies,
who raised me clear of my adversaries,
saved me from lawless men.
Transliteration: mefaletiy meoyevay af min-kamay tervomemeniy meiysh chamas tatsiyleniy

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֤ן ׀ אוֹדְךָ֖ בַגּוֹיִ֥ם ׀ יְהֹוָ֑ה וּלְשִׁמְךָ֥ אֲזַמֵּֽרָה׃
Translated:
For this I sing Your praise among the nations, LORD,
and hymn Your name:
Transliteration: al-khen vodekha vagvoyim yehovah uleshimekha azamerah

Hebrew: מַגְדִּל֮ יְשׁוּע֢וֹת מַ֫לְכּ֥וֹ וְעֹ֤שֶׂה חֶ֨סֶד ׀ לִמְשִׁיח֗וֹ לְדָוִ֥ד וּלְזַרְע֗וֹ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
He accords great victories to His king,
keeps faith with His anointed,
with David and his offspring forever.
Transliteration: magedil yeshu֢vot malekhvo veosheh chesed limeshiychvo ledavid ulezarevo ad-volam {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם מְֽסַפְּרִ֥ים כְּבֽוֹד־אֵ֑ל וּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָ֝דָ֗יו מַגִּ֥יד הָרָקִֽיעַ׃
Translated:
The heavens declare the glory of God,
the sky proclaims His handiwork.
Transliteration: hashamayiim mesaferiym khevvod-el umaasheh yadayv magiyd harakiya

Hebrew: י֣וֹם לְ֭יוֹם יַבִּ֣יעַֽ אֹ֑מֶר וְלַ֥יְלָה לְּ֝לַ֗יְלָה יְחַוֶּה־דָּֽעַת׃
Translated:
Day to day makes utterance,
night to night speaks out.
Transliteration: yvom leyvom yaviya omer velayelah lelayelah yechaveh-daat

Hebrew: אֵֽין־אֹ֭מֶר וְאֵ֣ין דְּבָרִ֑ים בְּ֝לִ֗י נִשְׁמָ֥ע קוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
There is no utterance,
there are no words,
whose sound goes unheard.
Transliteration: eyn-omer veeyn devariym veliy nishema kvolam

Hebrew: בְּכׇל־הָאָ֨רֶץ ׀ יָ֘צָ֤א קַוָּ֗ם וּבִקְצֵ֣ה תֵ֭בֵל מִלֵּיהֶ֑ם לַ֝שֶּׁ֗מֶשׁ שָֽׂם־אֹ֥הֶל בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Their voice carries throughout the earth,
their words to the end of the world.
He placed in them a tent for the sun,
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haarets yatsa kavam uviketseh tevel mileyhem lashemesh sham-ohel vahem

Hebrew: וְה֗וּא כְּ֭חָתָן יֹצֵ֣א מֵחֻפָּת֑וֹ יָשִׂ֥ישׂ כְּ֝גִבּ֗וֹר לָר֥וּץ אֹֽרַח׃
Translated:
who is like a groom coming forth from the chamber,
like a hero, eager to run his course.
Transliteration: vehu khechatan yotse mechufatvo yashiysh khegivvor laruts orach

Hebrew: מִקְצֵ֤ה הַשָּׁמַ֨יִם ׀ מֽוֹצָא֗וֹ וּתְקוּפָת֥וֹ עַל־קְצוֹתָ֑ם וְאֵ֥ין נִ֝סְתָּ֗ר מֵחַמָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
His rising-place is at one end of heaven,
and his circuit reaches the other;
nothing escapes his heat.
Transliteration: miketseh hashamayiim mvotsavo utekufatvo al-ketsvotam veeyn nisetar mechamatvo

Hebrew: תּ֘וֹרַ֤ת יְהֹוָ֣ה תְּ֭מִימָה מְשִׁ֣יבַת נָ֑פֶשׁ עֵד֥וּת יְהֹוָ֥ה נֶ֝אֱמָנָ֗ה מַחְכִּ֥ימַת פֶּֽתִי׃
Translated:
The teaching of the LORD is perfect,
renewing life;
the decrees of the LORD are enduring,
making the simple wise;
Transliteration: tvorat yehovah temiymah meshiyvat nafesh edut yehovah neemanah machekhiymat fetiy

Hebrew: פִּקּ֘וּדֵ֤י יְהֹוָ֣ה יְ֭שָׁרִים מְשַׂמְּחֵי־לֵ֑ב מִצְוַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֥ה בָּ֝רָ֗ה מְאִירַ֥ת עֵינָֽיִם׃
Translated:
The precepts of the LORD are just,
rejoicing the heart;
the instruction of the LORD is lucid,
making the eyes light up.
Transliteration: fikudey yehovah yeshariym meshamechey-lev mitsevat yehovah varah meiyrat eynayiim

Hebrew: יִרְאַ֤ת יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ טְהוֹרָה֮ עוֹמֶ֢דֶת לָ֫עַ֥ד מִֽשְׁפְּטֵי־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱמֶ֑ת צָֽדְק֥וּ יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated:
The fear of the LORD is pure,
abiding forever;
the judgments of the LORD are true,
righteous altogether,
Transliteration: yireat yehovah tehvorah vome֢det laad mishefetey-yehovah emet tsadeku yachedav

Hebrew: הַֽנֶּחֱמָדִ֗ים מִ֭זָּהָב וּמִפַּ֣ז רָ֑ב וּמְתוּקִ֥ים מִ֝דְּבַ֗שׁ וְנֹ֣פֶת צוּפִֽים׃
Translated:
more desirable than gold,
than much fine gold;
sweeter than honey,
than drippings of the comb.
Transliteration: hanechemadiym mizahav umifaz rav umetukiym midevash venofet tsufiym

Hebrew: גַּֽם־עַ֭בְדְּךָ נִזְהָ֣ר בָּהֶ֑ם בְּ֝שׇׁמְרָ֗ם עֵ֣קֶב רָֽב׃
Translated:
Your servant pays them heed;
in obeying them there is much reward.
Transliteration: gam-avedekha nizehar vahem veshׇmeram ekev rav

Hebrew: שְׁגִיא֥וֹת מִֽי־יָבִ֑ין מִֽנִּסְתָּר֥וֹת נַקֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
Who can be aware of errors?
Clear me of unperceived guilt,
Transliteration: shegiyvot miy-yaviyn minisetarvot nakeniy

Hebrew: גַּ֤ם מִזֵּדִ֨ים ׀ חֲשֹׂ֬ךְ עַבְדֶּ֗ךָ אַֽל־יִמְשְׁלוּ־בִ֣י אָ֣ז אֵיתָ֑ם וְ֝נִקֵּ֗יתִי מִפֶּ֥שַֽׁע רָֽב׃
Translated:
and from willful sins keep Your servant;
let them not dominate me;
then shall I be blameless
and clear of grave offense.
Transliteration: gam mizediym chashokhe avedekha al-yimeshelu-viy az eytam venikeytiy mifesha rav

Hebrew: יִ֥הְיֽוּ־לְרָצ֨וֹן ׀ אִמְרֵי־פִ֡י וְהֶגְי֣וֹן לִבִּ֣י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה צוּרִ֥י וְגֹאֲלִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
May the words of my mouth
and the prayer of my heart
be acceptable to You,
O LORD, my rock and my redeemer.
Transliteration: yiheyu-leratsvon imerey-fiy vehegeyvon liviy lefaneykha yehovah tsuriy vegoaliy {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: יַֽעַנְךָ֣ יְ֭הֹוָה בְּי֣וֹם צָרָ֑ה יְ֝שַׂגֶּבְךָ֗ שֵׁ֤ם ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֬י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
May the LORD answer you in time of trouble,
the name of Jacob’s God keep you safe.
Transliteration: yaanekha yehovah veyvom tsarah yeshagevekha shem elohey yaakov

Hebrew: יִשְׁלַֽח־עֶזְרְךָ֥ מִקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וּ֝מִצִּיּ֗וֹן יִסְעָדֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
May He send you help from the sanctuary,
and sustain you from Zion.
Transliteration: yishelach-ezerekha mikodesh umitsiyyvon yiseadekha

Hebrew: יִזְכֹּ֥ר כׇּל־מִנְחֹתֶ֑ךָ וְעוֹלָתְךָ֖ יְדַשְּׁנֶ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
May He receive the tokens of all your meal offerings,
and approve your burnt offerings. Selah.
Transliteration: yizekhor khׇl-minechotekha vevolatekha yedasheneh selah

Hebrew: יִֽתֶּן־לְךָ֥ כִלְבָבֶ֑ךָ וְֽכׇל־עֲצָתְךָ֥ יְמַלֵּֽא׃
Translated:
May He grant you your desire,
and fulfill your every plan.
Transliteration: yiten-lekha khilevavekha vekhׇl-atsatekha yemale

Hebrew: נְרַנְּנָ֤ה ׀ בִּ֘ישׁ֤וּעָתֶ֗ךָ וּבְשֵֽׁם־אֱלֹהֵ֥ינוּ נִדְגֹּ֑ל יְמַלֵּ֥א יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־מִשְׁאֲלוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
May we shout for joy in your victory,
arrayed by standards in the name of our God.
May the LORD fulfill your every wish.
Transliteration: neranenah viyshuatekha uveshem-eloheynu nidegol yemale yehovah khׇl-mishealvoteykha

Hebrew: עַתָּ֤ה יָדַ֗עְתִּי כִּ֤י הוֹשִׁ֥יעַ <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֗ה מְשִׁ֫יח֥וֹ יַ֭עֲנֵהוּ מִשְּׁמֵ֣י קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ בִּ֝גְבֻר֗וֹת יֵ֣שַׁע יְמִינֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Now I know that the LORD will give victory to His anointed,
will answer him from His heavenly sanctuary
with the mighty victories of His right arm.
Transliteration: atah yadaetiy khiy hvoshiya <small></small> yehovah meshiychvo yaanehu mishemey kׇdeshvo vigevurvot eisha yemiynvo

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה בָ֭רֶכֶב וְאֵ֣לֶּה בַסּוּסִ֑ים וַאֲנַ֓חְנוּ ׀ בְּשֵׁם־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣ינוּ נַזְכִּֽיר׃
Translated:
They [call] on chariots, they [call] on horses,
but we call on the name of the LORD our God.
Transliteration: eleh varekhev veeleh vasusiym vaanachenu veshem-yehovah eloheynu nazekhiyr

Hebrew: הֵ֭מָּה כָּרְע֣וּ וְנָפָ֑לוּ וַאֲנַ֥חְנוּ קַּ֝֗מְנוּ וַנִּתְעוֹדָֽד׃
Translated:
They collapse and lie fallen,
but we rally and gather strength.
Transliteration: hemah khareu venafalu vaanachenu kamenu vanitevodad

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה הוֹשִׁ֑יעָה הַ֝מֶּ֗לֶךְ יַעֲנֵ֥נוּ בְיוֹם־קׇרְאֵֽנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
O LORD, grant victory!
May the King answer us when we call.
Transliteration: yehovah hvoshiyah hamelekhe yaanenu veyvom-kׇreenu {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בְּעׇזְּךָ֥ יִשְׂמַח־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּ֝בִישׁ֥וּעָתְךָ֗ מַה־[יָּ֥גֶל] (יגיל) מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
O LORD, the king rejoices in Your strength;
how greatly he exults in Your victory!
Transliteration: yehovah veׇzekha yishemach-melekhe uviyshuatekha mah-[yagel] (ygyl) meod

Hebrew: תַּאֲוַ֣ת לִ֭בּוֹ נָתַ֣תָּה לּ֑וֹ וַאֲרֶ֥שֶׁת שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו בַּל־מָנַ֥עְתָּ סֶּֽלָה׃
Translated:
You have granted him the desire of his heart,
have not denied the request of his lips. Selah.
Transliteration: taavat livvo natatah lvo vaareshet shefatayv val-manaeta selah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תְ֭קַדְּמֶנּוּ בִּרְכ֣וֹת ט֑וֹב תָּשִׁ֥ית לְ֝רֹאשׁ֗וֹ עֲטֶ֣רֶת פָּֽז׃
Translated:
You have proffered him blessings of good things,
have set upon his head a crown of fine gold.
Transliteration: khiy-tekademenu virekhvot tvov tashiyt leroshvo ateret faz

Hebrew: חַיִּ֤ים ׀ שָׁאַ֣ל מִ֭מְּךָ נָתַ֣תָּה לּ֑וֹ אֹ֥רֶךְ יָ֝מִ֗ים עוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
Translated:
He asked You for life; You granted it;
a long life, everlasting.
Transliteration: chayiym shaal mimekha natatah lvo orekhe yamiym volam vaed

Hebrew: גָּד֣וֹל כְּ֭בוֹדוֹ בִּישׁוּעָתֶ֑ךָ ה֥וֹד וְ֝הָדָ֗ר תְּשַׁוֶּ֥ה עָלָֽיו׃
Translated:
Great is his glory through Your victory;
You have endowed him with splendor and majesty.
Transliteration: gadvol khevvodvo viyshuatekha hvod vehadar teshaveh alayv

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תְשִׁיתֵ֣הוּ בְרָכ֣וֹת לָעַ֑ד תְּחַדֵּ֥הוּ בְ֝שִׂמְחָ֗ה אֶת־פָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You have made him blessed forever,
gladdened him with the joy of Your presence.
Transliteration: khiy-teshiytehu verakhvot laad techadehu veshimechah et-faneykha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הַ֭מֶּלֶךְ בֹּטֵ֣חַ בַּיהֹוָ֑ה וּבְחֶ֥סֶד עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן בַּל־יִמּֽוֹט׃
Translated:
For the king trusts in the LORD;
Through the faithfulness of the Most High
he will not be shaken.
Transliteration: khiy-hamelekhe votecha vayhovah uvechesed eleyvon val-yimvot

Hebrew: תִּמְצָ֣א יָ֭דְךָ לְכׇל־אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ יְ֝מִֽינְךָ֗ תִּמְצָ֥א שֹׂנְאֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Your hand is equal to all Your enemies;
Your right hand overpowers Your foes.
Transliteration: timetsa yadekha lekhׇl-oyeveykha yemiynekha timetsa shoneeykha

Hebrew: תְּשִׁיתֵ֤מוֹ ׀ כְּתַנּ֥וּר אֵשׁ֮ לְעֵ֢ת פָּ֫נֶ֥יךָ יְ֭הֹוָה בְּאַפּ֣וֹ יְבַלְּעֵ֑ם וְֽתֹאכְלֵ֥ם אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
You set them ablaze like a furnace
when You show Your presence.
The LORD in anger destroys them;
fire consumes them.
Transliteration: teshiytemvo khetanur esh lee֢t faneykha yehovah veafvo yevaleem vetokhelem esh

Hebrew: פִּ֭רְיָמוֹ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ תְּאַבֵּ֑ד וְ֝זַרְעָ֗ם מִבְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
You wipe their offspring from the earth,
their issue from among men.
Transliteration: fireyamvo meerets teaved vezaream miveney adam

Hebrew: כִּי־נָט֣וּ עָלֶ֣יךָ רָעָ֑ה חָֽשְׁב֥וּ מְ֝זִמָּ֗ה בַּל־יוּכָֽלוּ׃
Translated:
For they schemed against You;
they laid plans,
but could not succeed.
Transliteration: khiy-natu aleykha raah chashevu mezimah val-yukhalu

Hebrew: כִּ֭י תְּשִׁיתֵ֣מוֹ שֶׁ֑כֶם בְּ֝מֵֽיתָרֶ֗יךָ תְּכוֹנֵ֥ן עַל־פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
For You make them turn back
by Your bows aimed at their face.
Transliteration: khiy teshiytemvo shekhem vemeytareykha tekhvonen al-feneyhem

Hebrew: ר֣וּמָה יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּעֻזֶּ֑ךָ נָשִׁ֥ירָה וּֽ֝נְזַמְּרָ֗ה גְּבוּרָתֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Be exalted, O LORD, through Your strength;
we will sing and chant the praises of Your mighty deeds.
Transliteration: rumah yehovah veuzekha nashiyrah unezamerah gevuratekha {f}

Hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ עַל־אַיֶּ֥לֶת הַשַּׁ֗חַר מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; on ayyeleth ha-shaḥar. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-ayelet hashachar mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: אֵלִ֣י אֵ֭לִי לָמָ֣ה עֲזַבְתָּ֑נִי רָח֥וֹק מִֽ֝ישׁוּעָתִ֗י דִּבְרֵ֥י שַׁאֲגָתִֽי׃
Translated:
My God, my God,
why have You abandoned me;
why so far from delivering me
and from my anguished roaring?
Transliteration: eliy eliy lamah azavetaniy rachvok miyshuatiy diverey shaagatiy

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהַ֗י אֶקְרָ֣א י֭וֹמָם וְלֹ֣א תַעֲנֶ֑ה וְ֝לַ֗יְלָה וְֽלֹא־דֻֽמִיָּ֥ה לִֽי׃
Translated:
My God,
I cry by day—You answer not;
by night, and have no respite.
Transliteration: elohay ekera yvomam velo taaneh velayelah velo-dumiyah liy

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֥ה קָד֑וֹשׁ י֝וֹשֵׁ֗ב תְּהִלּ֥וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
But You are the Holy One,
enthroned,
the Praise of Israel.
Transliteration: veatah kadvosh yvoshev tehilvot yisherael

Hebrew: בְּ֭ךָ בָּטְח֣וּ אֲבֹתֵ֑ינוּ בָּ֝טְח֗וּ וַֽתְּפַלְּטֵֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
In You our fathers trusted;
they trusted, and You rescued them.
Transliteration: vekha vatechu avoteynu vatechu vatefaletemvo

Hebrew: אֵלֶ֣יךָ זָעֲק֣וּ וְנִמְלָ֑טוּ בְּךָ֖ בָטְח֣וּ וְלֹא־בֽוֹשׁוּ׃
Translated:
To You they cried out
and they escaped;
in You they trusted
and were not disappointed.
Transliteration: eleykha zaaku venimelatu vekha vatechu velo-vvoshu

Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֣י תוֹלַ֣עַת וְלֹא־אִ֑ישׁ חֶרְפַּ֥ת אָ֝דָ֗ם וּבְז֥וּי עָֽם׃
Translated:
But I am a worm, less than human;
scorned by men, despised by people.
Transliteration: veanokhiy tvolaat velo-iysh cherefat adam uvezuy am

Hebrew: כׇּל־רֹ֭אַי יַלְעִ֣גוּ לִ֑י יַפְטִ֥ירוּ בְ֝שָׂפָ֗ה יָנִ֥יעוּ רֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated:
All who see me mock me;
they curl their lips,
they shake their heads.
Transliteration: khׇl-roay yaleigu liy yafetiyru veshafah yaniyu rosh

Hebrew: גֹּ֣ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה יְפַלְּטֵ֑הוּ יַ֝צִּילֵ֗הוּ כִּ֘י־חָ֥פֵֽץ־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
“Let him commit himself to the LORD;
let Him rescue him,
let Him save him,
for He is pleased with him.”
Transliteration: gol el-yehovah yefaletehu yatsiylehu khiy-chafets-vvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה גֹחִ֣י מִבָּ֑טֶן מַ֝בְטִיחִ֗י עַל־שְׁדֵ֥י אִמִּֽי׃
Translated:
You drew me from the womb,
made me secure at my mother’s breast.
Transliteration: khiy-atah gochiy mivaten mavetiychiy al-shedey imiy

Hebrew: עָ֭לֶיךָ הׇשְׁלַ֣כְתִּי מֵרָ֑חֶם מִבֶּ֥טֶן אִ֝מִּ֗י אֵ֣לִי אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
I became Your charge at birth;
from my mother’s womb You have been my God.
Transliteration: aleykha hׇshelakhetiy merachem miveten imiy eliy atah

Hebrew: אַל־תִּרְחַ֣ק מִ֭מֶּנִּי כִּי־צָרָ֣ה קְרוֹבָ֑ה כִּי־אֵ֥ין עוֹזֵֽר׃
Translated:
Do not be far from me,
for trouble is near,
and there is none to help.
Transliteration: al-tirechak mimeniy khiy-tsarah kervovah khiy-eyn vozer

Hebrew: סְ֭בָבוּנִי פָּרִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים אַבִּירֵ֖י בָשָׁ֣ן כִּתְּרֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
Many bulls surround me,
mighty ones of Bashan encircle me.
Transliteration: sevavuniy fariym raviym aviyrey vashan khiteruniy

Hebrew: פָּצ֣וּ עָלַ֣י פִּיהֶ֑ם אַ֝רְיֵ֗ה טֹרֵ֥ף וְשֹׁאֵֽג׃
Translated:
They open their mouths at me
like tearing, roaring lions.
Transliteration: fatsu alay fiyhem areeih toref veshoeg

Hebrew: כַּמַּ֥יִם נִשְׁפַּכְתִּי֮ וְהִתְפָּֽרְד֗וּ כׇּֽל־עַצְמ֫וֹתָ֥י הָיָ֣ה לִ֭בִּי כַּדּוֹנָ֑ג נָ֝מֵ֗ס בְּת֣וֹךְ מֵעָֽי׃
Translated:
My life ebbs away:
all my bones are disjointed;
my heart is like wax,
melting within me;
Transliteration: khamayiim nishefakhetiy vehitefaredu khׇl-atsemvotay hayah liviy khadvonag names vetvokhe meay

Hebrew: יָ֘בֵ֤שׁ כַּחֶ֨רֶשׂ ׀ כֹּחִ֗י וּ֭לְשׁוֹנִי מֻדְבָּ֣ק מַלְקוֹחָ֑י וְֽלַעֲפַר־מָ֥וֶת תִּשְׁפְּתֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
my vigor dries up like a shard;
my tongue cleaves to my palate;
You commit me to the dust of death.
Transliteration: yavesh khacheresh khochiy uleshvoniy mudevak malekvochay velaafar-mavet tishefeteniy

Hebrew: כִּ֥י סְבָב֗וּנִי כְּלָ֫בִ֥ים עֲדַ֣ת מְ֭רֵעִים הִקִּיפ֑וּנִי כָּ֝אֲרִ֗י יָדַ֥י וְרַגְלָֽי׃
Translated:
Dogs surround me;
a pack of evil ones closes in on me,
like lions [they maul] my hands and feet.
Transliteration: khiy sevavuniy khelaviym adat mereiym hikiyfuniy khaariy yaday veragelay

Hebrew: אֲסַפֵּ֥ר כׇּל־עַצְמוֹתָ֑י הֵ֥מָּה יַ֝בִּ֗יטוּ יִרְאוּ־בִֽי׃
Translated:
I take the count of all my bones
while they look on and gloat.
Transliteration: asafer khׇl-atsemvotay hemah yaviytu yireu-viy

Hebrew: יְחַלְּק֣וּ בְגָדַ֣י לָהֶ֑ם וְעַל־לְ֝בוּשִׁ֗י יַפִּ֥ילוּ גוֹרָֽל׃
Translated:
They divide my clothes among themselves,
casting lots for my garments.
Transliteration: yechaleku vegaday lahem veal-levushiy yafiylu gvoral

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אַל־תִּרְחָ֑ק אֱ֝יָלוּתִ֗י לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי חֽוּשָׁה׃
Translated:
But You, O LORD, be not far off;
my strength, hasten to my aid.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah al-tirechak eyalutiy leezeratiy chushah

Hebrew: הַצִּ֣ילָה מֵחֶ֣רֶב נַפְשִׁ֑י מִיַּד־כֶּ֝֗לֶב יְחִידָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Save my life from the sword,
my precious life from the clutches of a dog.
Transliteration: hatsiylah mecherev nafeshiy miyad-khelev yechiydatiy

Hebrew: ה֭וֹשִׁיעֵנִי מִפִּ֣י אַרְיֵ֑ה וּמִקַּרְנֵ֖י רֵמִ֣ים עֲנִיתָֽנִי׃
Translated:
Deliver me from a lion’s mouth;
from the horns of wild oxen rescue me.
Transliteration: hvoshiyeniy mifiy areeih umikareney remiym aniytaniy

Hebrew: אֲסַפְּרָ֣ה שִׁמְךָ֣ לְאֶחָ֑י בְּת֖וֹךְ קָהָ֣ל אֲהַלְלֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Then will I proclaim Your fame to my brethren,
praise You in the congregation.
Transliteration: asaferah shimekha leechay vetvokhe kahal ahalelekha
