Hebrew: יִרְאֵ֤י יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ הַֽלְל֗וּהוּ כׇּל־זֶ֣רַע יַעֲקֹ֣ב כַּבְּד֑וּהוּ וְג֥וּרוּ מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ כׇּל־זֶ֥רַע יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
You who fear the LORD, praise Him!
All you offspring of Jacob, honor Him!
Be in dread of Him, all you offspring of Israel!
Transliteration: yireey yehovah haleluhu khׇl-zera yaakov khaveduhu veguru mimenu khׇl-zera yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹֽא־בָזָ֨ה וְלֹ֪א שִׁקַּ֡ץ עֱנ֬וּת עָנִ֗י וְלֹא־הִסְתִּ֣יר פָּנָ֣יו מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וּֽבְשַׁוְּע֖וֹ אֵלָ֣יו שָׁמֵֽעַ׃
Translated:
For He did not scorn, He did not spurn
the plea of the lowly;
He did not hide His face from him;
when he cried out to Him, He listened.
Transliteration: khiy lo-vazah velo shikats enut aniy velo-hisetiyr fanayv mimenu uveshavevo elayv shamea

Hebrew: מֵ֥אִתְּךָ֗ תְּֽהִלָּ֫תִ֥י בְּקָהָ֥ל רָ֑ב נְדָרַ֥י אֲ֝שַׁלֵּ֗ם נֶ֣גֶד יְרֵאָֽיו׃
Translated:
Because of You I offer praise in the great congregation;
I pay my vows in the presence of His worshipers.
Transliteration: meitekha tehilatiy vekahal rav nedaray ashalem neged yereayv

Hebrew: יֹאכְל֬וּ עֲנָוִ֨ים ׀ וְיִשְׂבָּ֗עוּ יְהַֽלְל֣וּ יְ֭הֹוָה דֹּ֣רְשָׁ֑יו יְחִ֖י לְבַבְכֶ֣ם לָעַֽד׃
Translated:
Let the lowly eat and be satisfied;
let all who seek the LORD praise Him.
Always be of good cheer!
Transliteration: yokhelu anaviym veyishevau yehalelu yehovah doreshayv yechiy levavekhem laad

Hebrew: יִזְכְּר֤וּ ׀ וְיָשֻׁ֣בוּ אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְיִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ לְ֝פָנֶ֗יךָ כׇּֽל־מִשְׁפְּח֥וֹת גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
Let all the ends of the earth pay heed and turn to the LORD,
and the peoples of all nations prostrate themselves before You;
Transliteration: yizekheru veyashuvu el-yehovah khׇl-afesey-arets veyishetachavu lefaneykha khׇl-mishefechvot gvoyim

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לַ֭יהֹוָה הַמְּלוּכָ֑ה וּ֝מֹשֵׁ֗ל בַּגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
for kingship is the LORD’s
and He rules the nations.
Transliteration: khiy layhovah hamelukhah umoshel vagvoyim

Hebrew: אָכְל֬וּ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֨וּ ׀ כׇּֽל־דִּשְׁנֵי־אֶ֗רֶץ לְפָנָ֣יו יִ֭כְרְעוּ כׇּל־יוֹרְדֵ֣י עָפָ֑ר וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ לֹ֣א חִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
All those in full vigor shall eat and prostrate themselves;
all those at death’s door, whose spirits flag,
shall bend the knee before Him.
Transliteration: akhelu vayishetachavu khׇl-disheney-erets lefanayv yikhereu khׇl-yvoredey afar venafeshvo lo chiyah

Hebrew: זֶ֥רַע יַֽעַבְדֶ֑נּוּ יְסֻפַּ֖ר לַֽאדֹנָ֣י לַדּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Offspring shall serve Him;
the Lord’s fame shall be proclaimed to the generation
Transliteration: zera yaavedenu yesufar ladonay ladvor

Hebrew: יָ֭בֹאוּ וְיַגִּ֣ידוּ צִדְקָת֑וֹ לְעַ֥ם נ֝וֹלָ֗ד כִּ֣י עָשָֽׂה׃ {פ}
Translated:
to come;
they shall tell of His beneficence to people yet to be born,
for He has acted.
Transliteration: yavou veyagiydu tsidekatvo leam nvolad khiy ashah {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִ֑ד יְהֹוָ֥ה רֹ֝עִ֗י לֹ֣א אֶחְסָֽר׃
Translated:
A psalm of David.

The LORD is my shepherd;
I lack nothing.
Transliteration: mizemvor ledavid yehovah roiy lo echesar

Hebrew: בִּנְא֣וֹת דֶּ֭שֶׁא יַרְבִּיצֵ֑נִי עַל־מֵ֖י מְנֻח֣וֹת יְנַהֲלֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
He makes me lie down in green pastures;
He leads me to water in places of repose;
Transliteration: vinevot deshe yareviytseniy al-mey menuchvot yenahaleniy

Hebrew: נַפְשִׁ֥י יְשׁוֹבֵ֑ב יַֽנְחֵ֥נִי בְמַעְגְּלֵי־צֶ֝֗דֶק לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He renews my life;
He guides me in right paths
as befits His name.
Transliteration: nafeshiy yeshvovev yanecheniy vemaegeley-tsedek lemaan shemvo

Hebrew: גַּ֤ם כִּֽי־אֵלֵ֨ךְ בְּגֵ֪יא צַלְמָ֡וֶת לֹא־אִ֘ירָ֤א רָ֗ע כִּי־אַתָּ֥ה עִמָּדִ֑י שִׁבְטְךָ֥ וּ֝מִשְׁעַנְתֶּ֗ךָ הֵ֣מָּה יְנַֽחֲמֻֽנִי׃
Translated:
Though I walk through a valley of deepest darkness,
I fear no harm, for You are with me;
Your rod and Your staff—they comfort me.
Transliteration: gam khiy-elekhe vegey tsalemavet lo-iyra ra khiy-atah imadiy shivetekha umisheanetekha hemah yenachamuniy

Hebrew: תַּעֲרֹ֬ךְ לְפָנַ֨י ׀ שֻׁלְחָ֗ן נֶ֥גֶד צֹרְרָ֑י דִּשַּׁ֥נְתָּ בַשֶּׁ֥מֶן רֹ֝אשִׁ֗י כּוֹסִ֥י רְוָיָֽה׃
Translated:
You spread a table for me in full view of my enemies;
You anoint my head with oil;
my drink is abundant.
Transliteration: taarokhe lefanay shulechan neged tsoreray dishaneta vashemen roshiy khvosiy revayah

Hebrew: אַ֤ךְ ׀ ט֤וֹב וָחֶ֣סֶד יִ֭רְדְּפוּנִי כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י חַיָּ֑י וְשַׁבְתִּ֥י בְּבֵית־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לְאֹ֣רֶךְ יָמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
Only goodness and steadfast love shall pursue me
all the days of my life,
and I shall dwell in the house of the LORD
for many long years.
Transliteration: akhe tvov vachesed yiredefuniy khׇl-yemey chayay veshavetiy veveyt-yehovah leorekhe yamiym {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֗ד מִ֫זְמ֥וֹר לַֽ֭יהֹוָה הָאָ֣רֶץ וּמְלוֹאָ֑הּ תֵּ֝בֵ֗ל וְיֹ֣שְׁבֵי בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Of David. A psalm.

The earth is the LORD’s and all that it holds,
the world and its inhabitants.
Transliteration: ledavid mizemvor layhovah haarets umelvoah tevel veyoshevey vah

Hebrew: כִּי־ה֭וּא עַל־יַמִּ֣ים יְסָדָ֑הּ וְעַל־נְ֝הָר֗וֹת יְכוֹנְנֶֽהָ׃
Translated:
For He founded it upon the ocean,
set it on the nether-streams.
Transliteration: khiy-hu al-yamiym yesadah veal-neharvot yekhvoneneha

Hebrew: מִֽי־יַעֲלֶ֥ה בְהַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמִי־יָ֝ק֗וּם בִּמְק֥וֹם קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Who may ascend the mountain of the LORD?
Who may stand in His holy place?—
Transliteration: miy-yaaleh vehar-yehovah umiy-yakum vimekvom kׇdeshvo

Hebrew: נְקִ֥י כַפַּ֗יִם וּֽבַר־לֵ֫בָ֥ב אֲשֶׁ֤ר ׀ לֹא־נָשָׂ֣א לַשָּׁ֣וְא נַפְשִׁ֑י וְלֹ֖א נִשְׁבַּ֣ע לְמִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
He who has clean hands and a pure heart,
who has not taken a false oath by My life
or sworn deceitfully.
Transliteration: nekiy khafayiim uvar-levav asher lo-nasha lashave nafeshiy velo nisheva lemiremah

Hebrew: יִשָּׂ֣א בְ֭רָכָה מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וּ֝צְדָקָ֗ה מֵאֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׁעֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He shall carry away a blessing from the LORD,
a just reward from God, his deliverer.
Transliteration: yisha verakhah meet yehovah utsedakah meelohey yishevo

Hebrew: זֶ֭ה דּ֣וֹר דֹּרְשָׁ֑ו מְבַקְשֵׁ֨י פָנֶ֖יךָ יַעֲקֹ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Such is the circle of those who turn to Him,
Jacob, who seek Your presence. Selah.
Transliteration: zeh dvor doreshav mevakeshey faneykha yaakov selah

Hebrew: שְׂא֤וּ שְׁעָרִ֨ים ׀ רָֽאשֵׁיכֶ֗ם וְֽ֭הִנָּשְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵ֣י עוֹלָ֑ם וְ֝יָב֗וֹא מֶ֣לֶךְ הַכָּבֽוֹד׃
Translated:
O gates, lift up your heads!
Up high, you everlasting doors,
so the King of glory may come in!
Transliteration: sheu sheariym rasheykhem vehinasheu fitechey volam veyavvo melekhe hakhavvod

Hebrew: מִ֥י זֶה֮ מֶ֤לֶךְ הַכָּ֫ב֥וֹד יְ֭הֹוָה עִזּ֣וּז וְגִבּ֑וֹר יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה גִּבּ֥וֹר מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Who is the King of glory?—
the LORD, mighty and valiant,
the LORD, valiant in battle.
Transliteration: miy zeh melekhe hakhavvod yehovah izuz vegivvor yehovah givvor milechamah

Hebrew: שְׂא֤וּ שְׁעָרִ֨ים ׀ רָֽאשֵׁיכֶ֗ם וּ֭שְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵ֣י עוֹלָ֑ם וְ֝יָבֹ֗א מֶ֣לֶךְ הַכָּבֽוֹד׃
Translated:
O gates, lift up your heads!
Lift them up, you everlasting doors,
so the King of glory may come in!
Transliteration: sheu sheariym rasheykhem usheu fitechey volam veyavo melekhe hakhavvod

Hebrew: מִ֤י־ה֣וּא זֶה֮ מֶ֤לֶךְ הַכָּ֫ב֥וֹד יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֑וֹת ה֤וּא מֶ֖לֶךְ הַכָּב֣וֹד סֶֽלָה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Who is the King of glory?—
the LORD of hosts,
He is the King of glory! Selah.
Transliteration: miy-hu zeh melekhe hakhavvod yehovah tsevavot hu melekhe hakhavvod selah {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֡ד אֵלֶ֥יךָ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה נַפְשִׁ֥י אֶשָּֽׂא׃
Translated:
Of David.
O LORD, I set my hope on You;
Transliteration: ledavid eleykha yehovah nafeshiy esha

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהַ֗י בְּךָ֣ בָ֭טַחְתִּי אַל־אֵב֑וֹשָׁה אַל־יַעַלְצ֖וּ אוֹיְבַ֣י לִֽי׃
Translated:
my God, in You I trust;
may I not be disappointed,
may my enemies not exult over me.
Transliteration: elohay vekha vatachetiy al-evvoshah al-yaaletsu voyevay liy

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם כׇּל־קֹ֭וֶיךָ לֹ֣א יֵבֹ֑שׁוּ יֵ֝בֹ֗שׁוּ הַבּוֹגְדִ֥ים רֵיקָֽם׃
Translated:
O let none who look to You be disappointed;
let the faithless be disappointed, empty-handed.
Transliteration: gam khׇl-koveykha lo eivoshu eivoshu havvogediym reykam

Hebrew: דְּרָכֶ֣יךָ יְ֭הֹוָה הוֹדִיעֵ֑נִי אֹ֖רְחוֹתֶ֣יךָ לַמְּדֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Let me know Your paths, O LORD;
teach me Your ways;
Transliteration: derakheykha yehovah hvodiyeniy orechvoteykha lamedeniy

Hebrew: הַדְרִ֘יכֵ֤נִי בַאֲמִתֶּ֨ךָ ׀ וְֽלַמְּדֵ֗נִי כִּֽי־אַ֭תָּה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעִ֑י אוֹתְךָ֥ קִ֝וִּ֗יתִי כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
guide me in Your true way and teach me,
for You are God, my deliverer;
it is You I look to at all times.
Transliteration: haderiykheniy vaamitekha velamedeniy khiy-atah elohey yisheiy votekha kiviytiy khׇl-hayyvom

Hebrew: זְכֹר־רַחֲמֶ֣יךָ יְ֭הֹוָה וַחֲסָדֶ֑יךָ כִּ֖י מֵעוֹלָ֣ם הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated:
O LORD, be mindful of Your compassion
and Your faithfulness;
they are old as time.
Transliteration: zekhor-rachameykha yehovah vachasadeykha khiy mevolam hemah

Hebrew: חַטֹּ֤אות נְעוּרַ֨י ׀ וּפְשָׁעַ֗י אַל־תִּ֫זְכֹּ֥ר כְּחַסְדְּךָ֥ זְכׇר־לִי־אַ֑תָּה לְמַ֖עַן טוּבְךָ֣ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Be not mindful of my youthful sins and transgressions;
in keeping with Your faithfulness consider what is in my favor,
as befits Your goodness, O LORD.
Transliteration: chatovt neuray ufeshaay al-tizekhor khechasedekha zekhׇr-liy-atah lemaan tuvekha yehovah

Hebrew: טוֹב־וְיָשָׁ֥ר יְהֹוָ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֤ן יוֹרֶ֖ה חַטָּאִ֣ים בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated:
Good and upright is the LORD;
therefore He shows sinners the way.
Transliteration: tvov-veyashar yehovah al-khen yvoreh chataiym vadarekhe

Hebrew: יַדְרֵ֣ךְ עֲ֭נָוִים בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט וִילַמֵּ֖ד עֲנָוִ֣ים דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He guides the lowly in the right path,
and teaches the lowly His way.
Transliteration: yaderekhe anaviym vamishefat viylamed anaviym darekhvo

Hebrew: כׇּל־אׇרְח֣וֹת יְ֭הֹוָה חֶ֣סֶד וֶאֱמֶ֑ת לְנֹצְרֵ֥י בְ֝רִית֗וֹ וְעֵדֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
All the LORD’s paths are steadfast love
for those who keep the decrees of His covenant.
Transliteration: khׇl-ׇrechvot yehovah chesed veemet lenotserey veriytvo veedotayv

Hebrew: לְמַֽעַן־שִׁמְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְֽסָלַחְתָּ֥ לַ֝עֲוֺנִ֗י כִּ֣י רַב־הֽוּא׃
Translated:
As befits Your name, O LORD,
pardon my iniquity though it be great.
Transliteration: lemaan-shimekha yehovah vesalacheta laavoniy khiy rav-hu

Hebrew: מִי־זֶ֣ה הָ֭אִישׁ יְרֵ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה י֝וֹרֶ֗נּוּ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ יִבְחָֽר׃
Translated:
Whoever fears the LORD,
he shall be shown what path to choose.
Transliteration: miy-zeh haiysh yere yehovah yvorenu vederekhe yivechar

Hebrew: נַ֭פְשׁוֹ בְּט֣וֹב תָּלִ֑ין וְ֝זַרְע֗וֹ יִ֣ירַשׁ אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
He shall live a happy life,
and his children shall inherit the land.
Transliteration: nafeshvo vetvov taliyn vezarevo yiyrash arets

Hebrew: ס֣וֹד יְ֭הֹוָה לִירֵאָ֑יו וּ֝בְרִית֗וֹ לְהוֹדִיעָֽם׃
Translated:
The counsel of the LORD is for those who fear Him;
to them He makes known His covenant.
Transliteration: svod yehovah liyreayv uveriytvo lehvodiyam

Hebrew: עֵינַ֣י תָּ֭מִיד אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֤י הֽוּא־יוֹצִ֖יא מֵרֶ֣שֶׁת רַגְלָֽי׃
Translated:
My eyes are ever toward the LORD,
for He will loose my feet from the net.
Transliteration: eynay tamiyd el-yehovah khiy hu-yvotsiy mereshet ragelay

Hebrew: פְּנֵֽה־אֵלַ֥י וְחׇנֵּ֑נִי כִּֽי־יָחִ֖יד וְעָנִ֣י אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
Turn to me, have mercy on me,
for I am alone and afflicted.
Transliteration: feneh-elay vechׇneniy khiy-yachiyd veaniy aniy

Hebrew: צָר֣וֹת לְבָבִ֣י הִרְחִ֑יבוּ מִ֝מְּצוּקוֹתַ֗י הוֹצִיאֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
My deep distress increases;
deliver me from my straits.
Transliteration: tsarvot levaviy hirechiyvu mimetsukvotay hvotsiyeniy

Hebrew: רְאֵ֣ה עׇ֭נְיִי וַעֲמָלִ֑י וְ֝שָׂ֗א לְכׇל־חַטֹּאותָֽי׃
Translated:
Look at my affliction and suffering,
and forgive all my sins.
Transliteration: reeh ׇneyiy vaamaliy vesha lekhׇl-chatovtay

Hebrew: רְאֵֽה־אֹיְבַ֥י כִּי־רָ֑בּוּ וְשִׂנְאַ֖ת חָמָ֣ס שְׂנֵאֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
See how numerous my enemies are,
and how unjustly they hate me!
Transliteration: reeh-oyevay khiy-ravu veshineat chamas sheneuniy

Hebrew: שׇׁמְרָ֣ה נַ֭פְשִׁי וְהַצִּילֵ֑נִי אַל־אֵ֝ב֗וֹשׁ כִּֽי־חָסִ֥יתִי בָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Protect me and save me;
let me not be disappointed,
for I have sought refuge in You.
Transliteration: shׇmerah nafeshiy vehatsiyleniy al-evvosh khiy-chasiytiy vakhe

Hebrew: תֹּם־וָיֹ֥שֶׁר יִצְּר֑וּנִי כִּ֝֗י קִוִּיתִֽיךָ׃
Translated:
May integrity and uprightness watch over me,
for I look to You.
Transliteration: tom-vayosher yitseruniy khiy kiviytiykha

Hebrew: פְּדֵ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִ֝כֹּ֗ל צָרוֹתָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated:
O God, redeem Israel
from all its distress.
Transliteration: fedeh Elohim et-yisherael mikhol tsarvotayv {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ שׇׁפְטֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּֽי־אֲ֭נִי בְּתֻמִּ֣י הָלַ֑כְתִּי וּבַיהֹוָ֥ה בָּ֝טַ֗חְתִּי לֹ֣א אֶמְעָֽד׃
Translated:
Of David.

Vindicate me, O LORD,
for I have walked without blame;
I have trusted in the LORD;
I have not faltered.
Transliteration: ledavid shׇfeteniy yehovah khiy-aniy vetumiy halakhetiy uvayhovah vatachetiy lo emead

Hebrew: בְּחָנֵ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֣ה וְנַסֵּ֑נִי (צרופה) [צׇרְפָ֖ה] כִלְיוֹתַ֣י וְלִבִּֽי׃
Translated:
Probe me, O LORD, and try me,
test my heart and mind;
Transliteration: vechaneniy yehovah venaseniy (tsrvfh) [tsׇrefah] khileyvotay veliviy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חַ֭סְדְּךָ לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינָ֑י וְ֝הִתְהַלַּ֗כְתִּי בַּאֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
for my eyes are on Your steadfast love;
I have set my course by it.
Transliteration: khiy-chasedekha leneged eynay vehitehalakhetiy vaamitekha

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יָ֭שַׁבְתִּי עִם־מְתֵי־שָׁ֑וְא וְעִ֥ם נַ֝עֲלָמִ֗ים לֹ֣א אָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
I do not consort with scoundrels,
or mix with hypocrites;
Transliteration: lo-yashavetiy im-metey-shave veim naalamiym lo avvo

Hebrew: שָׂ֭נֵאתִי קְהַ֣ל מְרֵעִ֑ים וְעִם־רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים לֹ֣א אֵשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
I detest the company of evil men,
and do not consort with the wicked;
Transliteration: shanetiy kehal mereiym veim-reshaiym lo eshev

Hebrew: אֶרְחַ֣ץ בְּנִקָּי֣וֹן כַּפָּ֑י וַאֲסֹבְבָ֖ה אֶת־מִזְבַּחֲךָ֣ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
I wash my hands in innocence,
and walk around Your altar, O LORD,
Transliteration: erechats venikayvon khafay vaasovevah et-mizevachakha yehovah

Hebrew: לַ֭שְׁמִעַ בְּק֣וֹל תּוֹדָ֑ה וּ֝לְסַפֵּ֗ר כׇּל־נִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
raising my voice in thanksgiving,
and telling all Your wonders.
Transliteration: lashemia vekvol tvodah ulesafer khׇl-nifelevoteykha

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה אָ֭הַבְתִּי מְע֣וֹן בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ וּ֝מְק֗וֹם מִשְׁכַּ֥ן כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
O LORD, I love Your temple abode,
the dwelling-place of Your glory.
Transliteration: yehovah ahavetiy mevon veytekha umekvom mishekhan khevvodekha

Hebrew: אַל־תֶּאֱסֹ֣ף עִם־חַטָּאִ֣ים נַפְשִׁ֑י וְעִם־אַנְשֵׁ֖י דָמִ֣ים חַיָּֽי׃
Translated:
Do not sweep me away with sinners,
or [snuff out] my life with murderers,
Transliteration: al-teesof im-chataiym nafeshiy veim-aneshey damiym chayay

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־בִּידֵיהֶ֥ם זִמָּ֑ה וִ֝ימִינָ֗ם מָ֣לְאָה שֹּֽׁחַד׃
Translated:
who have schemes at their fingertips,
and hands full of bribes.
Transliteration: asher-viydeyhem zimah viymiynam maleah shochad

Hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי בְּתֻמִּ֥י אֵלֵ֗ךְ פְּדֵ֣נִי וְחׇנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
But I walk without blame;
redeem me, have mercy on me!
Transliteration: vaaniy vetumiy elekhe fedeniy vechׇneniy

Hebrew: רַ֭גְלִי עָמְדָ֣ה בְמִישׁ֑וֹר בְּ֝מַקְהֵלִ֗ים אֲבָרֵ֥ךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
My feet are on level ground.
In assemblies I will bless the LORD.
Transliteration: rageliy amedah vemiyshvor vemakeheliym avarekhe yehovah {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ אוֹרִ֣י וְ֭יִשְׁעִי מִמִּ֣י אִירָ֑א יְהֹוָ֥ה מָעוֹז־חַ֝יַּ֗י מִמִּ֥י אֶפְחָֽד׃
Translated:
Of David.

The LORD is my light and my help;
whom should I fear?
The LORD is the stronghold of my life,
whom should I dread?
Transliteration: ledavid yehovah voriy veyiisheiy mimiy iyra yehovah mavoz-chayay mimiy efechad

Hebrew: בִּקְרֹ֤ב עָלַ֨י ׀ מְרֵעִים֮ לֶאֱכֹ֢ל אֶת־בְּשָׂ֫רִ֥י צָרַ֣י וְאֹיְבַ֣י לִ֑י הֵ֖מָּה כָשְׁל֣וּ וְנָפָֽלוּ׃
Translated:
When evil men assail me
to devour my flesh—
it is they, my foes and my enemies,
who stumble and fall.
Transliteration: vikerov alay mereiym leekho֢l et-veshariy tsaray veoyevay liy hemah khashelu venafalu

Hebrew: אִם־תַּחֲנֶ֬ה עָלַ֨י ׀ מַחֲנֶה֮ לֹא־יִירָ֢א לִ֫בִּ֥י אִם־תָּק֣וּם עָ֭לַי מִלְחָמָ֑ה בְּ֝זֹ֗את אֲנִ֣י בוֹטֵֽחַ׃
Translated:
Should an army besiege me,
my heart would have no fear;
should war beset me,
still would I be confident.
Transliteration: im-tachaneh alay machaneh lo-yiyra֢ liviy im-takum alay milechamah vezot aniy vvotecha

Hebrew: אַחַ֤ת ׀ שָׁאַ֣לְתִּי מֵאֵת־יְהֹוָה֮ אוֹתָ֢הּ אֲבַ֫קֵּ֥שׁ שִׁבְתִּ֣י בְּבֵית־יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י חַיַּ֑י לַחֲז֥וֹת בְּנֹעַם־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וּלְבַקֵּ֥ר בְּהֵֽיכָלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
One thing I ask of the LORD,
only that do I seek:
to live in the house of the LORD
all the days of my life,
to gaze upon the beauty of the LORD,
to frequent His temple.
Transliteration: achat shaaletiy meet-yehovah vota֢h avakesh shivetiy veveyt-yehovah khׇl-yemey chayay lachazvot venoam-yehovah ulevaker veheykhalvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יִצְפְּנֵ֨נִי ׀ בְּסֻכֹּה֮ בְּי֢וֹם רָ֫עָ֥ה יַ֭סְתִּרֵנִי בְּסֵ֣תֶר אׇהֳל֑וֹ בְּ֝צ֗וּר יְרוֹמְמֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
He will shelter me in His pavilion
on an evil day,
grant me the protection of His tent,
raise me high upon a rock.
Transliteration: khiy yitsefeneniy vesukhoh vey֢vom raah yasetireniy veseter ׇholvo vetsur yervomemeniy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֨ה יָר֪וּם רֹאשִׁ֡י עַ֤ל אֹיְבַ֬י סְֽבִיבוֹתַ֗י וְאֶזְבְּחָ֣ה בְ֭אׇהֳלוֹ זִבְחֵ֣י תְרוּעָ֑ה אָשִׁ֥ירָה וַ֝אֲזַמְּרָ֗ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Now is my head high
over my enemies round about;
I sacrifice in His tent with shouts of joy,
singing and chanting a hymn to the LORD.
Transliteration: veatah yarum roshiy al oyevay seviyvvotay veezevechah veׇholvo zivechey teruah ashiyrah vaazamerah layhovah

Hebrew: שְׁמַע־יְהֹוָ֖ה קוֹלִ֥י אֶקְרָ֗א וְחׇנֵּ֥נִי וַעֲנֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Hear, O LORD, when I cry aloud;
have mercy on me, answer me.
Transliteration: shema-yehovah kvoliy ekera vechׇneniy vaaneniy

Hebrew: לְךָ֤ ׀ אָמַ֣ר לִ֭בִּי בַּקְּשׁ֣וּ פָנָ֑י אֶת־פָּנֶ֖יךָ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֲבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
Translated:
In Your behalf my heart says:
“Seek My face!”
O LORD, I seek Your face.
Transliteration: lekha amar liviy vakeshu fanay et-faneykha yehovah avakesh

Hebrew: אַל־תַּסְתֵּ֬ר פָּנֶ֨יךָ ׀ מִמֶּנִּי֮ אַ֥ל תַּט־בְּאַ֗ף עַ֫בְדֶּ֥ךָ עֶזְרָתִ֥י הָיִ֑יתָ אַֽל־תִּטְּשֵׁ֥נִי וְאַל־תַּ֝עַזְבֵ֗נִי אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׁעִֽי׃
Translated:
Do not hide Your face from me;
do not thrust aside Your servant in anger;
You have ever been my help.
Do not forsake me, do not abandon me,
O God, my deliverer.
Transliteration: al-taseter faneykha mimeniy al tat-veaf avedekha ezeratiy hayiyta al-titesheniy veal-taazeveniy elohey yisheiy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אָבִ֣י וְאִמִּ֣י עֲזָב֑וּנִי וַֽיהֹוָ֣ה יַאַסְפֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Though my father and mother abandon me,
the LORD will take me in.
Transliteration: khiy-aviy veimiy azavuniy vayhovah yaasefeniy

Hebrew: ה֤וֹרֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֗ה דַּ֫רְכֶּ֥ךָ וּ֭נְחֵנִי בְּאֹ֣רַח מִישׁ֑וֹר לְ֝מַ֗עַן שֽׁוֹרְרָֽי׃
Translated:
Show me Your way, O LORD,
and lead me on a level path
because of my watchful foes.
Transliteration: hvoreniy yehovah darekhekha unecheniy veorach miyshvor lemaan shvoreray

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּ֭תְּנֵנִי בְּנֶ֣פֶשׁ צָרָ֑י כִּ֥י קָמוּ־בִ֥י עֵדֵי־שֶׁ֝֗קֶר וִיפֵ֥חַ חָמָֽס׃
Translated:
Do not subject me to the will of my foes,
for false witnesses and unjust accusers
have appeared against me.
Transliteration: al-titeneniy venefesh tsaray khiy kamu-viy edey-sheker viyfecha chamas

Hebrew: לׅׄוּׅׄלֵׅ֗ׄאׅׄ הֶ֭אֱמַנְתִּי לִרְא֥וֹת בְּֽטוּב־יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חַיִּֽים׃
Translated:
Had I not the assurance
that I would enjoy the goodness of the LORD
in the land of the living…
Transliteration: luule heemanetiy lirevot vetuv-yehovah veerets chayiym

Hebrew: קַוֵּ֗ה אֶל־יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה חֲ֭זַק וְיַאֲמֵ֣ץ לִבֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝קַוֵּ֗ה אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Look to the LORD;
be strong and of good courage!
O look to the LORD!
Transliteration: kaveh el-yehovah chazak veyaamets livekha vekaveh el-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֡ד אֵ֘לֶ֤יךָ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ אֶקְרָ֗א צוּרִי֮ אַֽל־תֶּחֱרַ֢שׁ מִ֫מֶּ֥נִּי פֶּן־תֶּחֱשֶׁ֥ה מִמֶּ֑נִּי וְ֝נִמְשַׁ֗לְתִּי עִם־י֥וֹרְדֵי בֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Of David.

O LORD, I call to You;
my rock, do not disregard me,
for if You hold aloof from me,
I shall be like those gone down into the Pit.
Transliteration: ledavid eleykha yehovah ekera tsuriy al-techera֢sh mimeniy fen-techesheh mimeniy venimeshaletiy im-yvoredey vvor

Hebrew: שְׁמַ֤ע ק֣וֹל תַּ֭חֲנוּנַי בְּשַׁוְּעִ֣י אֵלֶ֑יךָ בְּנׇשְׂאִ֥י יָ֝דַ֗י אֶל־דְּבִ֥יר קׇדְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
Listen to my plea for mercy
when I cry out to You,
when I lift my hands
toward Your inner sanctuary.
Transliteration: shema kvol tachanunay veshaveiy eleykha venׇsheiy yaday el-deviyr kׇdeshekha

Hebrew: אַל־תִּמְשְׁכֵ֣נִי עִם־רְשָׁעִים֮ וְעִם־פֹּ֢עֲלֵ֫י אָ֥וֶן דֹּבְרֵ֣י שָׁ֭לוֹם עִם־רֵעֵיהֶ֑ם וְ֝רָעָ֗ה בִּלְבָבָֽם׃
Translated:
Do not count me with the wicked and evildoers
who profess goodwill toward their fellows
while malice is in their heart.
Transliteration: al-timeshekheniy im-reshaiym veim-fo֢aley aven doverey shalvom im-reeyhem veraah vilevavam

Hebrew: תֶּן־לָהֶ֣ם כְּפׇעֳלָם֮ וּכְרֹ֢עַ מַעַלְלֵ֫יהֶ֥ם כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יְ֭דֵיהֶם תֵּ֣ן לָהֶ֑ם הָשֵׁ֖ב גְּמוּלָ֣ם לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Pay them according to their deeds,
their malicious acts;
according to their handiwork pay them,
give them their deserts.
Transliteration: ten-lahem khefׇolam ukhero֢a maaleleyhem khemaasheh yedeyhem ten lahem hashev gemulam lahem

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֪א יָבִ֡ינוּ אֶל־פְּעֻלֹּ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה וְאֶל־מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדָ֑יו יֶ֝הֶרְסֵ֗ם וְלֹ֣א יִבְנֵֽם׃
Translated:
For they do not consider the LORD’s deeds,
the work of His hands.
May He tear them down,
never to rebuild them!
Transliteration: khiy lo yaviynu el-feulot yehovah veel-maasheh yadayv yeheresem velo yivenem

Hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּי־שָׁ֝מַ֗ע ק֣וֹל תַּחֲנוּנָֽי׃
Translated:
Blessed is the LORD,
for He listens to my plea for mercy.
Transliteration: varukhe yehovah khiy-shama kvol tachanunay

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ עֻזִּ֥י וּמָגִנִּי֮ בּ֤וֹ בָטַ֥ח לִבִּ֗י וְֽנֶ֫עֱזָ֥רְתִּי וַיַּעֲלֹ֥ז לִבִּ֑י וּֽמִשִּׁירִ֥י אֲהוֹדֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
The LORD is my strength and my shield;
my heart trusts in Him.
I was helped, and my heart exulted,
so I will glorify Him with my song.
Transliteration: yehovah uziy umaginiy vvo vatach liviy veneezaretiy vayaaloz liviy umishiyriy ahvodenu

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה עֹֽז־לָ֑מוֹ וּמָ֘ע֤וֹז יְשׁוּע֖וֹת מְשִׁיח֣וֹ הֽוּא׃
Translated:
The LORD is their strength;
He is a stronghold for the deliverance of His anointed.
Transliteration: yehovah oz-lamvo umavoz yeshuvot meshiychvo hu

Hebrew: הוֹשִׁ֤יעָה ׀ אֶת־עַמֶּ֗ךָ וּבָרֵ֥ךְ אֶת־נַחֲלָתֶ֑ךָ וּֽרְעֵ֥ם וְ֝נַשְּׂאֵ֗ם עַד־הָעוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Deliver and bless Your very own people;
tend them and sustain them forever.
Transliteration: hvoshiyah et-amekha uvarekhe et-nachalatekha ureem venasheem ad-havolam {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָ֫וִ֥ד הָב֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה בְּנֵ֣י אֵלִ֑ים הָב֥וּ לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה כָּב֥וֹד וָעֹֽז׃
Translated:
A psalm of David.

Ascribe to the LORD, O divine beings,
ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
Transliteration: mizemvor ledavid havu layhovah veney eliym havu layhovah khavvod vaoz

Hebrew: הָב֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה כְּב֣וֹד שְׁמ֑וֹ הִשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה בְּהַדְרַת־קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated:
Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name;
bow down to the LORD, majestic in holiness.
Transliteration: havu layhovah khevvod shemvo hishetachavu layhovah vehaderat-kodesh

Hebrew: ק֥וֹל יְהֹוָ֗ה עַל־הַ֫מָּ֥יִם אֵֽל־הַכָּב֥וֹד הִרְעִ֑ים יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עַל־מַ֥יִם רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
The voice of the LORD is over the waters;
the God of glory thunders,
the LORD, over the mighty waters.
Transliteration: kvol yehovah al-hamayiim el-hakhavvod hireiym yehovah al-mayiim raviym

Hebrew: קוֹל־יְהֹוָ֥ה בַּכֹּ֑חַ ק֥וֹל יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בֶּהָדָֽר׃
Translated:
The voice of the LORD is power;
the voice of the LORD is majesty;
Transliteration: kvol-yehovah vakhocha kvol yehovah vehadar

Hebrew: ק֣וֹל יְ֭הֹוָה שֹׁבֵ֣ר אֲרָזִ֑ים וַיְשַׁבֵּ֥ר יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אֶת־אַרְזֵ֥י הַלְּבָנֽוֹן׃
Translated:
the voice of the LORD breaks cedars;
the LORD shatters the cedars of Lebanon.
Transliteration: kvol yehovah shover araziym vayeshaver yehovah et-arezey halevanvon

Hebrew: וַיַּרְקִידֵ֥ם כְּמוֹ־עֵ֑גֶל לְבָנ֥וֹן וְ֝שִׂרְיֹ֗ן כְּמ֣וֹ בֶן־רְאֵמִֽים׃
Translated:
He makes Lebanon skip like a calf,
Sirion, like a young wild ox.
Transliteration: vayarekiydem khemvo-egel levanvon veshireyon khemvo ven-reemiym

Hebrew: קוֹל־יְהֹוָ֥ה חֹצֵ֗ב לַהֲב֥וֹת אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: The voice of the L<small>ORD</small> kindles flames of fire;
Transliteration: kvol-yehovah chotsev lahavvot esh

Hebrew: ק֣וֹל יְ֭הֹוָה יָחִ֣יל מִדְבָּ֑ר יָחִ֥יל יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מִדְבַּ֥ר קָדֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
the voice of the LORD convulses the wilderness;
the LORD convulses the wilderness of Kadesh;
Transliteration: kvol yehovah yachiyl midevar yachiyl yehovah midevar kadesh

Hebrew: ק֤וֹל יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ יְחוֹלֵ֣ל אַיָּלוֹת֮ וַֽיֶּחֱשֹׂ֢ף יְעָ֫ר֥וֹת וּבְהֵיכָל֑וֹ כֻּ֝לּ֗וֹ אֹמֵ֥ר כָּבֽוֹד׃
Translated:
the voice of the LORD causes hinds to calve,
and strips forests bare;
while in His temple all say “Glory!”
Transliteration: kvol yehovah yechvolel ayalvot vayechesho֢f yearvot uveheykhalvo khulvo omer khavvod

Hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה לַמַּבּ֣וּל יָשָׁ֑ב וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מֶ֣לֶךְ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
The LORD sat enthroned at the Flood;
the LORD sits enthroned, king forever.
Transliteration: yehovah lamavul yashav vayeshev yehovah melekhe levolam

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה עֹ֭ז לְעַמּ֣וֹ יִתֵּ֑ן יְהֹוָ֓ה ׀ יְבָרֵ֖ךְ אֶת־עַמּ֣וֹ בַשָּׁלֽוֹם׃ {פ}
Translated:
May the LORD grant strength to His people;
may the LORD bestow on His people wellbeing.
Transliteration: yehovah oz leamvo yiten yehovah yevarekhe et-amvo vashalvom {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֡וֹר שִׁיר־חֲנֻכַּ֖ת הַבַּ֣יִת לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: A psalm of David. A song for the dedication of the House.
Transliteration: mizemvor shiyr-chanukhat havayiit ledavid

Hebrew: אֲרוֹמִמְךָ֣ יְ֭הֹוָה כִּ֣י דִלִּיתָ֑נִי וְלֹֽא־שִׂמַּ֖חְתָּ אֹיְבַ֣י לִֽי׃
Translated:
I extol You, O LORD,
for You have lifted me up,
and not let my enemies rejoice over me.
Transliteration: arvomimekha yehovah khiy diliytaniy velo-shimacheta oyevay liy

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָ֑י שִׁוַּ֥עְתִּי אֵ֝לֶ֗יךָ וַתִּרְפָּאֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
O LORD, my God,
I cried out to You,
and You healed me.
Transliteration: yehovah elohay shivaetiy eleykha vatirefaeniy

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה הֶעֱלִ֣יתָ מִן־שְׁא֣וֹל נַפְשִׁ֑י חִ֝יִּיתַ֗נִי (מיורדי) [מִיׇּֽרְדִי־]בֽוֹר׃
Translated:
O LORD, You brought me up from Sheol,
preserved me from going down into the Pit.
Transliteration: yehovah heeliyta min-shevol nafeshiy chiyiytaniy (myvrdy) [miyׇrediy-]vvor

Hebrew: זַמְּר֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חֲסִידָ֑יו וְ֝הוֹד֗וּ לְזֵ֣כֶר קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
O you faithful of the LORD, sing to Him,
and praise His holy name.
Transliteration: zameru layhovah chasiydayv vehvodu lezekher kׇdeshvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י רֶ֨גַע ׀ בְּאַפּוֹ֮ חַיִּ֢ים בִּרְצ֫וֹנ֥וֹ בָּ֭עֶרֶב יָלִ֥ין בֶּ֗כִי וְלַבֹּ֥קֶר רִנָּֽה׃
Translated:
For He is angry but a moment,
and when He is pleased there is life.
One may lie down weeping at nightfall;
but at dawn there are shouts of joy.
Transliteration: khiy rega veafvo chayi֢ym viretsvonvo vaerev yaliyn vekhiy velavoker rinah

Hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי אָמַ֣רְתִּי בְשַׁלְוִ֑י בַּל־אֶמּ֥וֹט לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
When I was untroubled,
I thought, “I shall never be shaken,”
Transliteration: vaaniy amaretiy veshaleviy val-emvot levolam

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בִּרְצוֹנְךָ֮ הֶעֱמַ֢דְתָּה לְֽהַרְרִ֫י־עֹ֥ז הִסְתַּ֥רְתָּ פָנֶ֗יךָ הָיִ֥יתִי נִבְהָֽל׃
Translated:
for You, O LORD, when You were pleased,
made [me] firm as a mighty mountain.
When You hid Your face,
I was terrified.
Transliteration: yehovah viretsvonekha heema֢detah lehareriy-oz hisetareta faneykha hayiytiy nivehal

Hebrew: אֵלֶ֣יךָ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶקְרָ֑א וְאֶל־אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י אֶתְחַנָּֽן׃
Translated:
I called to You, O LORD;
to my Lord I made appeal,
Transliteration: eleykha yehovah ekera veel-adonay etechanan

Hebrew: מַה־בֶּ֥צַע בְּדָמִי֮ בְּרִדְתִּ֢י אֶ֫ל־שָׁ֥חַת הֲיוֹדְךָ֥ עָפָ֑ר הֲיַגִּ֥יד אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
“What is to be gained from my death,
from my descent into the Pit?
Can dust praise You?
Can it declare Your faithfulness?
Transliteration: mah-vetsa vedamiy verideti֢y el-shachat hayvodekha afar hayagiyd amitekha

Hebrew: שְׁמַע־יְהֹוָ֥ה וְחׇנֵּ֑נִי יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הֱֽיֵה־עֹזֵ֥ר לִֽי׃
Translated:
Hear, O LORD, and have mercy on me;
O LORD, be my help!”
Transliteration: shema-yehovah vechׇneniy yehovah heeieh-ozer liy

Hebrew: הָפַ֣כְתָּ מִסְפְּדִי֮ לְמָח֢וֹל לִ֥֫י פִּתַּ֥חְתָּ שַׂקִּ֑י וַֽתְּאַזְּרֵ֥נִי שִׂמְחָֽה׃
Translated:
You turned my lament into dancing,
you undid my sackcloth and girded me with joy,
Transliteration: hafakheta misefediy lemach֢vol liy fitacheta shakiy vateazereniy shimechah

Hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן ׀ יְזַמֶּרְךָ֣ כָ֭בוֹד וְלֹ֣א יִדֹּ֑ם יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י לְעוֹלָ֥ם אוֹדֶֽךָּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
that [my] whole being might sing hymns to You endlessly;
O LORD my God, I will praise You forever.
Transliteration: lemaan yezamerekha khavvod velo yidom yehovah elohay levolam vodekha {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: בְּךָֽ־יְהֹוָ֣ה חָ֭סִיתִי אַל־אֵב֣וֹשָׁה לְעוֹלָ֑ם בְּצִדְקָתְךָ֥ פַלְּטֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
I seek refuge in You, O LORD;
may I never be disappointed;
as You are righteous, rescue me.
Transliteration: vekha-yehovah chasiytiy al-evvoshah levolam vetsidekatekha faleteniy

Hebrew: הַטֵּ֤ה אֵלַ֨י ׀ אׇזְנְךָ֮ מְהֵרָ֢ה הַצִּ֫ילֵ֥נִי הֱיֵ֤ה לִ֨י ׀ לְֽצוּר־מָ֭עוֹז לְבֵ֥ית מְצוּד֗וֹת לְהוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Incline Your ear to me;
be quick to save me;
be a rock, a stronghold for me,
a citadel, for my deliverance.
Transliteration: hateh elay ׇzenekha mehera֢h hatsiyleniy heeih liy letsur-mavoz leveyt metsudvot lehvoshiyeniy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־סַלְעִ֣י וּמְצוּדָתִ֣י אָ֑תָּה וּלְמַ֥עַן שִׁ֝מְךָ֗ תַּֽנְחֵ֥נִי וּֽתְנַהֲלֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
For You are my rock and my fortress;
You lead me and guide me as befits Your name.
Transliteration: khiy-saleiy umetsudatiy atah ulemaan shimekha tanecheniy utenahaleniy

Hebrew: תּוֹצִיאֵ֗נִי מֵרֶ֣שֶׁת ז֭וּ טָ֣מְנוּ לִ֑י כִּי־אַ֝תָּ֗ה מָעוּזִּֽי׃
Translated:
You free me from the net laid for me,
for You are my stronghold.
Transliteration: tvotsiyeniy mereshet zu tamenu liy khiy-atah mauziy

Hebrew: בְּיָדְךָ֮ אַפְקִ֢יד ר֫וּחִ֥י פָּדִ֖יתָ אוֹתִ֥י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵ֣ל אֱמֶֽת׃
Translated:
Into Your hand I entrust my spirit;
You redeem me, O LORD, faithful God.
Transliteration: veyadekha afeki֢yd ruchiy fadiyta votiy yehovah el emet

Hebrew: שָׂנֵ֗אתִי הַשֹּׁמְרִ֥ים הַבְלֵי־שָׁ֑וְא וַ֝אֲנִ֗י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֥ה בָּטָֽחְתִּי׃
Translated:
I detest those who rely on empty folly,
but I trust in the LORD.
Transliteration: shanetiy hashomeriym haveley-shave vaaniy el-yehovah vatachetiy

Hebrew: אָגִ֥ילָה וְאֶשְׂמְחָ֗ה בְּחַ֫סְדֶּ֥ךָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָ֭אִיתָ אֶת־עׇנְיִ֑י יָ֝דַ֗עְתָּ בְּצָר֥וֹת נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
Let me exult and rejoice in Your faithfulness
when You notice my affliction,
are mindful of my deep distress,
Transliteration: agiylah veeshemechah vechasedekha asher raiyta et-ׇneyiy yadaeta vetsarvot nafeshiy

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א הִ֭סְגַּרְתַּנִי בְּיַד־אוֹיֵ֑ב הֶעֱמַ֖דְתָּ בַמֶּרְחָ֣ב רַגְלָֽי׃
Translated:
and do not hand me over to my enemy,
but grant me relief.
Transliteration: velo hisegaretaniy veyad-voeiv heemadeta vamerechav ragelay

Hebrew: חׇנֵּ֥נִי יְהֹוָה֮ כִּ֤י צַ֫ר־לִ֥י עָשְׁשָׁ֖ה בְכַ֥עַס עֵינִ֗י נַפְשִׁ֥י וּבִטְנִֽי׃
Translated:
Have mercy on me, O LORD,
for I am in distress;
my eyes are wasted by vexation,
my substance and body too.
Transliteration: chׇneniy yehovah khiy tsar-liy asheshah vekhaas eyniy nafeshiy uviteniy

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כָל֪וּ בְיָג֡וֹן חַיַּי֮ וּשְׁנוֹתַ֢י בַּאֲנָ֫חָ֥ה כָּשַׁ֣ל בַּעֲוֺנִ֣י כֹחִ֑י וַעֲצָמַ֥י עָשֵֽׁשׁוּ׃
Translated:
My life is spent in sorrow,
my years in groaning;
my strength fails because of my iniquity,
my limbs waste away.
Transliteration: khiy khalu veyagvon chayay ushenvota֢y vaanachah khashal vaavoniy khochiy vaatsamay asheshu

Hebrew: מִכׇּל־צֹרְרַ֨י הָיִ֪יתִי חֶרְפָּ֡ה וְלִ֥שְׁכֵנַ֨י ׀ מְאֹד֮ וּפַ֢חַד לִֽמְיֻדָּ֫עָ֥י רֹאַ֥י בַּח֑וּץ נָדְד֥וּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
Because of all my foes
I am the particular butt of my neighbors,
a horror to my friends;
those who see me on the street avoid me.
Transliteration: mikhׇl-tsoreray hayiytiy cherefah velishekhenay meod ufa֢chad limeyudaay roay vachuts nadedu mimeniy

Hebrew: נִ֭שְׁכַּחְתִּי כְּמֵ֣ת מִלֵּ֑ב הָ֝יִ֗יתִי כִּכְלִ֥י אֹבֵֽד׃
Translated:
I am put out of mind like the dead;
I am like an object given up for lost.
Transliteration: nishekhachetiy khemet milev hayiiytiy khikheliy oved

Hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁמַ֨עְתִּי ׀ דִּבַּ֥ת רַבִּים֮ מָג֢וֹר מִסָּ֫בִ֥יב בְּהִוָּסְדָ֣ם יַ֣חַד עָלַ֑י לָקַ֖חַת נַפְשִׁ֣י זָמָֽמוּ׃
Translated:
I hear the whisperings of many,
intrigue on every side,
as they scheme together against me,
plotting to take my life.
Transliteration: khiy shamaetiy divat raviym mag֢vor misaviyv vehivasedam yachad alay lakachat nafeshiy zamamu

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ עָלֶ֣יךָ בָטַ֣חְתִּי יְהֹוָ֑ה אָ֝מַ֗רְתִּי אֱלֹהַ֥י אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
But I trust in You, O LORD;
I say, “You are my God!”
Transliteration: vaaniy aleykha vatachetiy yehovah amaretiy elohay atah

Hebrew: בְּיָדְךָ֥ עִתֹּתָ֑י הַצִּ֘ילֵ֤נִי מִיַּד־א֝וֹיְבַ֗י וּמֵֽרֹדְפָֽי׃
Translated:
My fate is in Your hand;
save me from the hand of my enemies and pursuers.
Transliteration: veyadekha itotay hatsiyleniy miyad-voyevay umerodefay

Hebrew: הָאִ֣ירָה פָ֭נֶיךָ עַל־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ ה֖וֹשִׁיעֵ֣נִי בְחַסְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Show favor to Your servant;
as You are faithful, deliver me.
Transliteration: haiyrah faneykha al-avedekha hvoshiyeniy vechasedekha

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה אַל־אֵ֭בוֹשָׁה כִּ֣י קְרָאתִ֑יךָ יֵבֹ֥שׁוּ רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יִדְּמ֥וּ לִשְׁאֽוֹל׃
Translated:
O LORD, let me not be disappointed when I call You;
let the wicked be disappointed;
let them be silenced in Sheol;
Transliteration: yehovah al-evvoshah khiy keratiykha eivoshu reshaiym yidemu lishevol

Hebrew: תֵּ֥אָלַ֗מְנָה שִׂפְתֵ֫י־שָׁ֥קֶר הַדֹּבְר֖וֹת עַל־צַדִּ֥יק עָתָ֗ק בְּגַאֲוָ֥ה וָבֽוּז׃
Translated:
let lying lips be stilled
that speak haughtily against the righteous
with arrogance and contempt.
Transliteration: tealamenah shifetey-shaker hadovervot al-tsadiyk atak vegaavah vavuz

Hebrew: מָ֤ה רַֽב־טוּבְךָ֮ אֲשֶׁר־צָפַ֢נְתָּ לִּירֵ֫אֶ֥יךָ פָּ֭עַלְתָּ לַחֹסִ֣ים בָּ֑ךְ נֶ֝֗גֶד בְּנֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
How abundant is the good
that You have in store for those who fear You,
that You do in the full view of men
for those who take refuge in You.
Transliteration: mah rav-tuvekha asher-tsafa֢neta liyreeykha faaleta lachosiym vakhe neged veney adam

Hebrew: תַּסְתִּירֵ֤ם ׀ בְּסֵ֥תֶר פָּנֶיךָ֮ מֵרֻכְסֵ֫י־אִ֥ישׁ תִּצְפְּנֵ֥ם בְּסֻכָּ֗ה מֵרִ֥יב לְשֹׁנֽוֹת׃
Translated:
You grant them the protection of Your presence
against scheming men;
You shelter them in Your pavilion
from contentious tongues.
Transliteration: tasetiyrem veseter faneykha merukhesey-iysh titsefenem vesukhah meriyv leshonvot

Hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֥י הִפְלִ֘יא־חַסְדּ֥וֹ לִ֝֗י בְּעִ֣יר מָצֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Blessed is the LORD,
for He has been wondrously faithful to me,
a veritable bastion.
Transliteration: varukhe yehovah khiy hifeliy-chasedvo liy veiyr matsvor

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ אָ֘מַ֤רְתִּי בְחׇפְזִ֗י נִגְרַזְתִּי֮ מִנֶּ֢גֶד עֵ֫ינֶ֥יךָ אָכֵ֗ן שָׁ֭מַעְתָּ ק֥וֹל תַּחֲנוּנַ֗י בְּשַׁוְּעִ֥י אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Alarmed, I had thought,
“I am thrust out of Your sight”;
yet You listened to my plea for mercy
when I cried out to You.
Transliteration: vaaniy amaretiy vechׇfeziy nigerazetiy mine֢ged eyneykha akhen shamaeta kvol tachanunay veshaveiy eleykha

Hebrew: אֶ֥הֱב֥וּ אֶֽת־יְהֹוָ֗ה כׇּֽל־חֲסִ֫ידָ֥יו אֱ֭מוּנִים נֹצֵ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמְשַׁלֵּ֥ם עַל־יֶ֝֗תֶר עֹשֵׂ֥ה גַאֲוָֽה׃
Translated:
So love the LORD, all you faithful;
the LORD guards the loyal,
and more than requites
him who acts arrogantly.
Transliteration: ehevu et-yehovah khׇl-chasiydayv emuniym notser yehovah umeshalem al-yeter osheh gaavah

Hebrew: חִ֭זְקוּ וְיַאֲמֵ֣ץ לְבַבְכֶ֑ם כׇּל־הַ֝מְיַחֲלִ֗ים לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Be strong and of good courage,
all you who wait for the LORD.
Transliteration: chizeku veyaamets levavekhem khׇl-hameyachaliym layhovah {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֗ד מַ֫שְׂכִּ֥יל אַשְׁרֵ֥י נְֽשׂוּי־פֶּ֗שַׁע כְּס֣וּי חֲטָאָֽה׃
Translated:
Of David. A maskil.

Happy is he whose transgression is forgiven,
whose sin is covered over.
Transliteration: ledavid mashekhiyl asherey neshuy-fesha khesuy chataah

Hebrew: אַ֥שְֽׁרֵי־אָדָ֗ם לֹ֤א יַחְשֹׁ֬ב יְהֹוָ֣ה ל֣וֹ עָוֺ֑ן וְאֵ֖ין בְּרוּח֣וֹ רְמִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
Happy the man whom the LORD does not hold guilty,
and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
Transliteration: asherey-adam lo yacheshov yehovah lvo avon veeyn veruchvo remiyah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הֶ֭חֱרַשְׁתִּי בָּל֣וּ עֲצָמָ֑י בְּ֝שַׁאֲגָתִ֗י כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
As long as I said nothing,
my limbs wasted away
from my anguished roaring all day long.
Transliteration: khiy-hecherashetiy valu atsamay veshaagatiy khׇl-hayyvom

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלַיְלָה֮ תִּכְבַּ֥ד עָלַ֗י יָ֫דֶ֥ךָ נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ לְשַׁדִּ֑י בְּחַרְבֹ֖נֵי קַ֣יִץ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
For night and day
Your hand lay heavy on me;
my vigor waned
as in the summer drought. Selah.
Transliteration: khiy yvomam valayelah tikhevad alay yadekha nehefakhe leshadiy vecharevoney kayiits selah

Hebrew: חַטָּאתִ֨י אוֹדִ֪יעֲךָ֡ וַעֲ֘וֺנִ֤י לֹֽא־כִסִּ֗יתִי אָמַ֗רְתִּי אוֹדֶ֤ה עֲלֵ֣י פְ֭שָׁעַי לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְאַתָּ֨ה נָ֘שָׂ֤אתָ עֲוֺ֖ן חַטָּאתִ֣י סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Then I acknowledged my sin to You;
I did not cover up my guilt;
I resolved, “I will confess my transgressions to the LORD,”
and You forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah.
Transliteration: chatatiy vodiyakha vaavoniy lo-khisiytiy amaretiy vodeh aley feshaay layhovah veatah nashata avon chatatiy selah

Hebrew: עַל־זֹ֡את יִתְפַּלֵּ֬ל כׇּל־חָסִ֨יד ׀ אֵלֶיךָ֮ לְעֵ֢ת מְ֫צֹ֥א רַ֗ק לְ֭שֵׁטֶף מַ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים אֵ֝לָ֗יו לֹ֣א יַגִּֽיעוּ׃
Translated:
Therefore let every faithful man pray to You
upon discovering [his sin],
that the rushing mighty waters
not overtake him.
Transliteration: al-zot yitefalel khׇl-chasiyd eleykha lee֢t metso rak leshetef mayiim raviym elayv lo yagiyu

Hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה ׀ סֵ֥תֶר לִי֮ מִצַּ֢ר תִּ֫צְּרֵ֥נִי רׇנֵּ֥י פַלֵּ֑ט תְּס֖וֹבְבֵ֣נִי סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
You are my shelter;
You preserve me from distress;
You surround me with the joyous shouts of deliverance. Selah.
Transliteration: atah seter liy mitsa֢r titsereniy rׇney falet tesvoveveniy selah

Hebrew: אַשְׂכִּֽילְךָ֨ ׀ וְֽאוֹרְךָ֗ בְּדֶֽרֶךְ־ז֥וּ תֵלֵ֑ךְ אִיעֲצָ֖ה עָלֶ֣יךָ עֵינִֽי׃
Translated:
Let me enlighten you
and show you which way to go;
let me offer counsel; my eye is on you.
Transliteration: ashekhiylekha vevorekha vederekhe-zu telekhe iyatsah aleykha eyniy

Hebrew: אַל־תִּהְי֤וּ ׀ כְּס֥וּס כְּפֶרֶד֮ אֵ֤ין הָ֫בִ֥ין בְּמֶתֶג־וָרֶ֣סֶן עֶדְי֣וֹ לִבְל֑וֹם בַּ֝֗ל קְרֹ֣ב אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Be not like a senseless horse or mule
whose movement must be curbed by bit and bridle;
far be it from you!
Transliteration: al-tiheyu khesus khefered eyn haviyn vemeteg-varesen edeyvo livelvom val kerov eleykha

Hebrew: רַבִּ֥ים מַכְאוֹבִ֗ים לָ֫רָשָׁ֥ע וְהַבּוֹטֵ֥חַ בַּֽיהֹוָ֑ה חֶ֝֗סֶד יְסוֹבְבֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Many are the torments of the wicked,
but he who trusts in the LORD
shall be surrounded with favor.
Transliteration: raviym makhevoviym larasha vehavvotecha vayhovah chesed yesvovevenu

Hebrew: שִׂמְח֬וּ בַיהֹוָ֣ה וְ֭גִילוּ צַדִּיקִ֑ים וְ֝הַרְנִ֗ינוּ כׇּל־יִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃ {פ}
Translated:
Rejoice in the LORD and exult, O you righteous;
shout for joy, all upright men!
Transliteration: shimechu vayhovah vegiylu tsadiykiym vehareniynu khׇl-yisherey-lev {f}

Hebrew: רַנְּנ֣וּ צַ֭דִּיקִים בַּֽיהֹוָ֑ה לַ֝יְשָׁרִ֗ים נָאוָ֥ה תְהִלָּֽה׃
Translated:
Sing forth, O you righteous, to the LORD;
it is fit that the upright acclaim Him.
Transliteration: ranenu tsadiykiym vayhovah layeshariym navah tehilah

Hebrew: הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה בְּכִנּ֑וֹר בְּנֵ֥בֶל עָ֝שׂ֗וֹר זַמְּרוּ־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Praise the LORD with the lyre;
with the ten-stringed harp sing to Him;
Transliteration: hvodu layhovah vekhinvor venevel ashvor zameru-lvo

Hebrew: שִֽׁירוּ־ל֭וֹ שִׁ֣יר חָדָ֑שׁ הֵיטִ֥יבוּ נַ֝גֵּ֗ן בִּתְרוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
sing Him a new song;
play sweetly with shouts of joy.
Transliteration: shiyru-lvo shiyr chadash heytiyvu nagen viteruah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָשָׁ֥ר דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְכׇל־מַ֝עֲשֵׂ֗הוּ בֶּאֱמוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
For the word of the LORD is right;
His every deed is faithful.
Transliteration: khiy-yashar devar-yehovah vekhׇl-maashehu veemunah

Hebrew: אֹ֭הֵב צְדָקָ֣ה וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט חֶ֥סֶד יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מָלְאָ֥ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
He loves what is right and just;
the earth is full of the LORD’s faithful care.
Transliteration: ohev tsedakah umishefat chesed yehovah maleah haarets

Hebrew: בִּדְבַ֣ר יְ֭הֹוָה שָׁמַ֣יִם נַעֲשׂ֑וּ וּבְר֥וּחַ פִּ֝֗יו כׇּל־צְבָאָֽם׃
Translated:
By the word of the LORD the heavens were made,
by the breath of His mouth, all their host.
Transliteration: videvar yehovah shamayiim naashu uverucha fiyv khׇl-tsevaam

Hebrew: כֹּנֵ֣ס כַּ֭נֵּד מֵ֣י הַיָּ֑ם נֹתֵ֖ן בְּאוֹצָר֣וֹת תְּהוֹמֽוֹת׃
Translated:
He heaps up the ocean waters like a mound,
stores the deep in vaults.
Transliteration: khones khaned mey hayam noten vevotsarvot tehvomvot

Hebrew: יִֽירְא֣וּ מֵ֭יְהֹוָה כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ מִמֶּ֥נּוּ יָ֝ג֗וּרוּ כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י תֵבֵֽל׃
Translated:
Let all the earth fear the LORD;
let all the inhabitants of the world dread Him.
Transliteration: yiyreu meyehovah khׇl-haarets mimenu yaguru khׇl-yoshevey tevel

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ה֣וּא אָמַ֣ר וַיֶּ֑הִי הֽוּא־צִ֝וָּ֗ה וַֽיַּעֲמֹֽד׃
Translated:
For He spoke, and it was;
He commanded, and it endured.
Transliteration: khiy hu amar vayehiy hu-tsivah vayaamod

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה הֵפִ֥יר עֲצַת־גּוֹיִ֑ם הֵ֝נִ֗יא מַחְשְׁב֥וֹת עַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
The LORD frustrates the plans of nations,
brings to naught the designs of peoples.
Transliteration: yehovah hefiyr atsat-gvoyim heniy macheshevvot amiym

Hebrew: עֲצַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה לְעוֹלָ֣ם תַּעֲמֹ֑ד מַחְשְׁב֥וֹת לִ֝בּ֗וֹ לְדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃
Translated:
What the LORD plans endures forever,
what He designs, for ages on end.
Transliteration: atsat yehovah levolam taamod macheshevvot livvo ledor vador

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י הַ֭גּוֹי אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו הָעָ֓ם ׀ בָּחַ֖ר לְנַחֲלָ֣ה לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Happy the nation whose God is the LORD,
the people He has chosen to be His own.
Transliteration: asherey hagvoy asher-yehovah elohayv haam vachar lenachalah lvo

Hebrew: מִ֭שָּׁמַיִם הִבִּ֣יט יְהֹוָ֑ה רָ֝אָ֗ה אֶֽת־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י הָאָדָֽם׃
Translated:
The LORD looks down from heaven;
He sees all mankind.
Transliteration: mishamayim hiviyt yehovah raah et-khׇl-veney haadam

Hebrew: מִֽמְּכוֹן־שִׁבְתּ֥וֹ הִשְׁגִּ֑יחַ אֶ֖ל כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
From His dwelling-place He gazes
on all the inhabitants of the earth—
Transliteration: mimekhvon-shivetvo hishegiycha el khׇl-yoshevey haarets

Hebrew: הַיֹּצֵ֣ר יַ֣חַד לִבָּ֑ם הַ֝מֵּבִ֗ין אֶל־כׇּל־מַעֲשֵׂיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
He who fashions the hearts of them all,
who discerns all their doings.
Transliteration: hayotser yachad livam hameviyn el-khׇl-maasheyhem

Hebrew: אֵֽין־הַ֭מֶּלֶךְ נוֹשָׁ֣ע בְּרׇב־חָ֑יִל גִּ֝בּ֗וֹר לֹא־יִנָּצֵ֥ל בְּרׇב־כֹּֽחַ׃
Translated:
Kings are not delivered by a large force;
warriors are not saved by great strength;
Transliteration: eyn-hamelekhe nvosha verׇv-chayiil givvor lo-yinatsel verׇv-khocha

Hebrew: שֶׁ֣קֶר הַ֭סּוּס לִתְשׁוּעָ֑ה וּבְרֹ֥ב חֵ֝יל֗וֹ לֹ֣א יְמַלֵּֽט׃
Translated:
horses are a false hope for deliverance;
for all their great power they provide no escape.
Transliteration: sheker hasus liteshuah uverov cheylvo lo yemalet

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה עֵ֣ין יְ֭הֹוָה אֶל־יְרֵאָ֑יו לַֽמְיַחֲלִ֥ים לְחַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Truly the eye of the LORD is on those who fear Him,
who wait for His faithful care
Transliteration: hineh eyn yehovah el-yereayv lameyachaliym lechasedvo

Hebrew: לְהַצִּ֣יל מִמָּ֣וֶת נַפְשָׁ֑ם וּ֝לְחַיּוֹתָ֗ם בָּרָעָֽב׃
Translated:
to save them from death,
to sustain them in famine.
Transliteration: lehatsiyl mimavet nafesham ulechayyvotam varaav

Hebrew: נַ֭פְשֵׁנוּ חִכְּתָ֣ה לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה עֶזְרֵ֖נוּ וּמָגִנֵּ֣נוּ הֽוּא׃
Translated:
We set our hope on the LORD,
He is our help and shield;
Transliteration: nafeshenu chikhetah layhovah ezerenu umaginenu hu

Hebrew: כִּי־ב֭וֹ יִשְׂמַ֣ח לִבֵּ֑נוּ כִּ֤י בְשֵׁ֖ם קׇדְשׁ֣וֹ בָטָֽחְנוּ׃
Translated:
in Him our hearts rejoice,
for in His holy name we trust.
Transliteration: khiy-vvo yishemach livenu khiy veshem kׇdeshvo vatachenu

Hebrew: יְהִי־חַסְדְּךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֣ה עָלֵ֑ינוּ כַּ֝אֲשֶׁ֗ר יִחַ֥לְנוּ לָֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
May we enjoy, O LORD, Your faithful care,
as we have put our hope in You.
Transliteration: yehiy-chasedekha yehovah aleynu khaasher yichalenu lakhe {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֗ד בְּשַׁנּוֹת֣וֹ אֶת־טַ֭עְמוֹ לִפְנֵ֣י אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ וַ֝יְגָרְשֵׁ֗הוּ וַיֵּלַֽךְ׃
Translated: Of David, when he feigned madness in the presence of Abimelech, who turned him out, and he left.
Transliteration: ledavid veshanvotvo et-taemvo lifeney aviymelekhe vayegareshehu vayelakhe

Hebrew: אֲבָרְכָ֣ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּכׇל־עֵ֑ת תָּ֝מִ֗יד תְּֽהִלָּת֥וֹ בְּפִֽי׃
Translated:
I bless the LORD at all times;
praise of Him is ever in my mouth.
Transliteration: avarekhah et-yehovah vekhׇl-et tamiyd tehilatvo vefiy

Hebrew: בַּ֭יהֹוָה תִּתְהַלֵּ֣ל נַפְשִׁ֑י יִשְׁמְע֖וּ עֲנָוִ֣ים וְיִשְׂמָֽחוּ׃
Translated:
I glory in the LORD;
let the lowly hear it and rejoice.
Transliteration: vayhovah titehalel nafeshiy yishemeu anaviym veyishemachu

Hebrew: גַּדְּל֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אִתִּ֑י וּנְרוֹמְמָ֖ה שְׁמ֣וֹ יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated:
Exalt the LORD with me;
let us extol His name together.
Transliteration: gadelu layhovah itiy unervomemah shemvo yachedav

Hebrew: דָּרַ֣שְׁתִּי אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה וְעָנָ֑נִי וּמִכׇּל־מְ֝גוּרוֹתַ֗י הִצִּילָֽנִי׃
Translated:
I turned to the LORD, and He answered me;
He saved me from all my terrors.
Transliteration: darashetiy et-yehovah veananiy umikhׇl-megurvotay hitsiylaniy

Hebrew: הִבִּ֣יטוּ אֵלָ֣יו וְנָהָ֑רוּ וּ֝פְנֵיהֶ֗ם אַל־יֶחְפָּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Men look to Him and are radiant;
let their faces not be downcast.
Transliteration: hiviytu elayv venaharu ufeneyhem al-yechefaru

Hebrew: זֶ֤ה עָנִ֣י קָ֭רָא וַיהֹוָ֣ה שָׁמֵ֑עַ וּמִכׇּל־צָ֝רוֹתָ֗יו הוֹשִׁיעֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Here was a lowly man who called,
and the LORD listened,
and delivered him from all his troubles.
Transliteration: zeh aniy kara vayhovah shamea umikhׇl-tsarvotayv hvoshiyvo

Hebrew: חֹנֶ֤ה מַלְאַךְ־יְהֹוָ֓ה סָ֘בִ֤יב לִירֵאָ֗יו וַֽיְחַלְּצֵֽם׃
Translated:
The angel of the LORD camps around those who fear Him
and rescues them.
Transliteration: choneh maleakhe-yehovah saviyv liyreayv vayechaletsem

Hebrew: טַעֲמ֣וּ וּ֭רְאוּ כִּֽי־ט֣וֹב יְהֹוָ֑ה אַֽשְׁרֵ֥י הַ֝גֶּ֗בֶר יֶחֱסֶה־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Taste and see how good the LORD is;
happy the man who takes refuge in Him!
Transliteration: taamu ureu khiy-tvov yehovah asherey hagever yecheseh-vvo

Hebrew: יְר֣אוּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה קְדֹשָׁ֑יו כִּי־אֵ֥ין מַ֝חְס֗וֹר לִירֵאָֽיו׃
Translated:
Fear the LORD, you His consecrated ones,
for those who fear Him lack nothing.
Transliteration: yeru et-yehovah kedoshayv khiy-eyn machesvor liyreayv

Hebrew: כְּ֭פִירִים רָשׁ֣וּ וְרָעֵ֑בוּ וְדֹרְשֵׁ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לֹא־יַחְסְר֥וּ כׇל־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Lions have been reduced to starvation,
but those who turn to the LORD shall not lack any good.
Transliteration: khefiyriym rashu veraevu vedoreshey yehovah lo-yacheseru khׇl-tvov

Hebrew: לְֽכוּ־בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י יִֽרְאַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אֲלַמֶּדְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Come, my sons, listen to me;
I will teach you what it is to fear the LORD.
Transliteration: lekhu-vaniym shimeu-liy yireat yehovah alamedekhem

Hebrew: מִֽי־הָ֭אִישׁ הֶחָפֵ֣ץ חַיִּ֑ים אֹהֵ֥ב יָ֝מִ֗ים לִרְא֥וֹת טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Who is the man who is eager for life,
who desires years of good fortune?
Transliteration: miy-haiysh hechafets chayiym ohev yamiym lirevot tvov

Hebrew: נְצֹ֣ר לְשׁוֹנְךָ֣ מֵרָ֑ע וּ֝שְׂפָתֶ֗יךָ מִדַּבֵּ֥ר מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
Guard your tongue from evil,
your lips from deceitful speech.
Transliteration: netsor leshvonekha mera ushefateykha midaver miremah

Hebrew: ס֣וּר מֵ֭רָע וַעֲשֵׂה־ט֑וֹב בַּקֵּ֖שׁ שָׁל֣וֹם וְרׇדְפֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Shun evil and do good,
seek amity and pursue it.
Transliteration: sur mera vaasheh-tvov vakesh shalvom verׇdefehu

Hebrew: עֵינֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה אֶל־צַדִּיקִ֑ים וְ֝אׇזְנָ֗יו אֶל־שַׁוְעָתָֽם׃
Translated:
The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous,
His ears attentive to their cry.
Transliteration: eyney yehovah el-tsadiykiym veׇzenayv el-shaveatam

Hebrew: פְּנֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה בְּעֹ֣שֵׂי רָ֑ע לְהַכְרִ֖ית מֵאֶ֣רֶץ זִכְרָֽם׃
Translated:
The face of the LORD is set against evildoers,
to erase their names from the earth.
Transliteration: feney yehovah veoshey ra lehakheriyt meerets zikheram

Hebrew: צָ֭עֲקוּ וַיהֹוָ֣ה שָׁמֵ֑עַ וּמִכׇּל־צָ֝רוֹתָ֗ם הִצִּילָֽם׃
Translated:
They cry out, and the LORD hears,
and saves them from all their troubles.
Transliteration: tsaaku vayhovah shamea umikhׇl-tsarvotam hitsiylam

Hebrew: קָר֣וֹב יְ֭הֹוָה לְנִשְׁבְּרֵי־לֵ֑ב וְֽאֶת־דַּכְּאֵי־ר֥וּחַ יוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
The LORD is close to the brokenhearted;
those crushed in spirit He delivers.
Transliteration: karvov yehovah lenisheverey-lev veet-dakheey-rucha yvoshiya

Hebrew: רַ֭בּוֹת רָע֣וֹת צַדִּ֑יק וּ֝מִכֻּלָּ֗ם יַצִּילֶ֥נּוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Though the misfortunes of the righteous be many,
the LORD will save him from them all,
Transliteration: ravvot ravot tsadiyk umikhulam yatsiylenu yehovah

Hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֥ר כׇּל־עַצְמוֹתָ֑יו אַחַ֥ת מֵ֝הֵ֗נָּה לֹ֣א נִשְׁבָּֽרָה׃
Translated:
Keeping all his bones intact,
not one of them being broken.
Transliteration: shomer khׇl-atsemvotayv achat mehenah lo nishevarah

Hebrew: תְּמוֹתֵ֣ת רָשָׁ֣ע רָעָ֑ה וְשֹׂנְאֵ֖י צַדִּ֣יק יֶאְשָֽׁמוּ׃
Translated:
One misfortune is the deathblow of the wicked;
the foes of the righteous shall be ruined.
Transliteration: temvotet rasha raah veshoneey tsadiyk yeeshamu

Hebrew: פֹּדֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה נֶ֣פֶשׁ עֲבָדָ֑יו וְלֹ֥א יֶ֝אְשְׁמ֗וּ כׇּֽל־הַחֹסִ֥ים בּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The LORD redeems the life of His servants;
all who take refuge in Him shall not be ruined.
Transliteration: fodeh yehovah nefesh avadayv velo yeeshemu khׇl-hachosiym vvo {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ רִיבָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־יְרִיבַ֑י לְ֝חַ֗ם אֶת־לֹחֲמָֽי׃
Translated:
Of David.

O LORD, strive with my adversaries,
give battle to my foes,
Transliteration: ledavid riyvah yehovah et-yeriyvay lecham et-lochamay

Hebrew: הַחֲזֵ֣ק מָגֵ֣ן וְצִנָּ֑ה וְ֝ק֗וּמָה בְּעֶזְרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
take up shield and buckler,
and come to my defense;
Transliteration: hachazek magen vetsinah vekumah veezeratiy

Hebrew: וְהָ֘רֵ֤ק חֲנִ֣ית וּ֭סְגֹר לִקְרַ֣את רֹדְפָ֑י אֱמֹ֥ר לְ֝נַפְשִׁ֗י יְֽשֻׁעָתֵ֥ךְ אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
ready the spear and javelin
against my pursuers;
tell me, “I am your deliverance.”
Transliteration: veharek chaniyt usegor likerat rodefay emor lenafeshiy yeshuatekhe aniy

Hebrew: יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ וְיִכָּלְמוּ֮ מְבַקְשֵׁ֢י נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י יִסֹּ֣גוּ אָח֣וֹר וְיַחְפְּר֑וּ חֹ֝שְׁבֵ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Let those who seek my life
be frustrated and put to shame;
let those who plan to harm me
fall back in disgrace.
Transliteration: eivoshu veyikhalemu mevakeshe֢y nafeshiy yisogu achvor veyacheferu choshevey raatiy

Hebrew: יִֽהְי֗וּ כְּמֹ֥ץ לִפְנֵי־ר֑וּחַ וּמַלְאַ֖ךְ יְהֹוָ֣ה דּוֹחֶֽה׃
Translated:
Let them be as chaff in the wind,
the LORD’s angel driving them on.
Transliteration: yiheyu khemots lifeney-rucha umaleakhe yehovah dvocheh

Hebrew: יְֽהִי־דַרְכָּ֗ם חֹ֥שֶׁךְ וַחֲלַקְלַקֹּ֑ת וּמַלְאַ֥ךְ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה רֹדְפָֽם׃
Translated:
Let their path be dark and slippery,
with the LORD’s angel in pursuit.
Transliteration: yehiy-darekham choshekhe vachalakelakot umaleakhe yehovah rodefam

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חִנָּ֣ם טָֽמְנוּ־לִ֭י שַׁ֣חַת רִשְׁתָּ֑ם חִ֝נָּ֗ם חָפְר֥וּ לְנַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
For without cause they hid a net to trap me;
without cause they dug a pit for me.
Transliteration: khiy-chinam tamenu-liy shachat rishetam chinam chaferu lenafeshiy

Hebrew: תְּבוֹאֵ֣הוּ שׁוֹאָה֮ לֹֽא־יֵ֫דָ֥ע וְרִשְׁתּ֣וֹ אֲשֶׁר־טָמַ֣ן תִּלְכְּד֑וֹ בְּ֝שׁוֹאָ֗ה יִפׇּל־בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Let disaster overtake them unawares;
let the net they hid catch them;
let them fall into it when disaster [strikes].
Transliteration: tevvoehu shvoah lo-eida verishetvo asher-taman tilekhedvo veshvoah yifׇl-vah

Hebrew: וְ֭נַפְשִׁי תָּגִ֣יל בַּיהֹוָ֑ה תָּ֝שִׂ֗ישׂ בִּישׁוּעָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Then shall I exult in the LORD,
rejoice in His deliverance.
Transliteration: venafeshiy tagiyl vayhovah tashiysh viyshuatvo

Hebrew: כׇּ֥ל־עַצְמוֹתַ֨י ׀ תֹּאמַרְנָה֮ יְהֹוָ֗ה מִ֥י־כָ֫מ֥וֹךָ מַצִּ֣יל עָ֭נִי מֵחָזָ֣ק מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְעָנִ֥י וְ֝אֶבְי֗וֹן מִגֹּֽזְלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
All my bones shall say,
“LORD, who is like You?
You save the poor from one stronger than he,
the poor and needy from his despoiler.”
Transliteration: khׇl-atsemvotay tomarenah yehovah miy-khamvokha matsiyl aniy mechazak mimenu veaniy veeveyvon migozelvo

Hebrew: יְ֭קוּמוּן עֵדֵ֣י חָמָ֑ס אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי יִשְׁאָלֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
Malicious witnesses appear
who question me about things I do not know.
Transliteration: yekumun edey chamas asher lo-yadaetiy yishealuniy

Hebrew: יְשַׁלְּמ֣וּנִי רָ֭עָה תַּ֥חַת טוֹבָ֗ה שְׁכ֣וֹל לְנַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
They repay me evil for good,
[seeking] my bereavement.
Transliteration: yeshalemuniy raah tachat tvovah shekhvol lenafeshiy

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ בַּחֲלוֹתָ֡ם לְב֬וּשִׁי שָׂ֗ק עִנֵּ֣יתִי בַצּ֣וֹם נַפְשִׁ֑י וּ֝תְפִלָּתִ֗י עַל־חֵיקִ֥י תָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated:
Yet, when they were ill,
my dress was sackcloth,
I kept a fast—
may what I prayed for happen to me!
Transliteration: vaaniy vachalvotam levushiy shak ineytiy vatsvom nafeshiy utefilatiy al-cheykiy tashuv

Hebrew: כְּרֵעַ־כְּאָ֣ח לִ֭י הִתְהַלָּ֑כְתִּי כַּאֲבֶל־אֵ֝֗ם קֹדֵ֥ר שַׁחֽוֹתִי׃
Translated:
I walked about as though it were my friend or my brother;
I was bowed with gloom, like one mourning for his mother.
Transliteration: kherea-kheach liy hitehalakhetiy khaavel-em koder shachvotiy

Hebrew: וּבְצַלְעִי֮ שָׂמְח֢וּ וְֽנֶ֫אֱסָ֥פוּ נֶאֶסְפ֬וּ עָלַ֣י נֵ֭כִים וְלֹ֣א יָדַ֑עְתִּי קָרְע֥וּ וְלֹא־דָֽמּוּ׃
Translated:
But when I stumble, they gleefully gather;
wretches gather against me,
I know not why;
they tear at me without end.
Transliteration: uvetsaleiy shamechu veneesafu neesefu alay nekhiym velo yadaetiy kareu velo-damu

Hebrew: בְּ֭חַנְפֵי לַעֲגֵ֣י מָע֑וֹג חָרֹ֖ק עָלַ֣י שִׁנֵּֽימוֹ׃
Translated:
With impious, mocking grimace
they gnash their teeth at me.
Transliteration: vechanefey laagey mavog charok alay shineymvo

Hebrew: אֲדֹנָי֮ כַּמָּ֢ה תִ֫רְאֶ֥ה הָשִׁ֣יבָה נַ֭פְשִׁי מִשֹּׁאֵיהֶ֑ם מִ֝כְּפִירִ֗ים יְחִידָתִֽי׃
Translated:
O Lord, how long will You look on?
Rescue me from their attacks,
my precious life, from the lions,
Transliteration: adonay khama֢h tireeh hashiyvah nafeshiy mishoeyhem mikhefiyriym yechiydatiy

Hebrew: א֭וֹדְךָ בְּקָהָ֣ל רָ֑ב בְּעַ֖ם עָצ֣וּם אֲהַלְלֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
that I may praise You in a great congregation,
acclaim You in a mighty throng.
Transliteration: vodekha vekahal rav veam atsum ahalelekha

Hebrew: אַֽל־יִשְׂמְחוּ־לִ֣י אֹיְבַ֣י שֶׁ֑קֶר שֹׂנְאַ֥י חִ֝נָּ֗ם יִקְרְצוּ־עָֽיִן׃
Translated:
Let not my treacherous enemies rejoice over me,
or those who hate me without reason wink their eyes.
Transliteration: al-yishemechu-liy oyevay sheker shoneay chinam yikeretsu-ayiin

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֥א שָׁל֗וֹם יְדַ֫בֵּ֥רוּ וְעַ֥ל רִגְעֵי־אֶ֑רֶץ דִּבְרֵ֥י מִ֝רְמ֗וֹת יַחֲשֹׁבֽוּן׃
Translated:
For they do not offer amity,
but devise fraudulent schemes against harmless folk.
Transliteration: khiy lo shalvom yedaveru veal rigeey-erets diverey miremvot yachashovun

Hebrew: וַיַּרְחִ֥יבוּ עָלַ֗י פִּ֫יהֶ֥ם אָ֭מְרוּ הֶאָ֣ח <small>׀</small> הֶאָ֑ח רָאֲתָ֥ה עֵינֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
They open wide their mouths at me,
saying, “Aha, aha, we have seen it!”
Transliteration: vayarechiyvu alay fiyhem ameru heach <small></small> heach raatah eynenu

Hebrew: רָאִ֣יתָה יְ֭הֹוָה אַֽל־תֶּחֱרַ֑שׁ אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י אַל־תִּרְחַ֥ק מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
You have seen it, O LORD;
do not hold aloof!
O Lord, be not far from me!
Transliteration: raiytah yehovah al-techerash adonay al-tirechak mimeniy

Hebrew: הָעִ֣ירָה וְ֭הָקִיצָה לְמִשְׁפָּטִ֑י אֱלֹהַ֖י וַאדֹנָ֣י לְרִיבִֽי׃
Translated:
Wake, rouse Yourself for my cause,
for my claim, O my God and my Lord!
Transliteration: haiyrah vehakiytsah lemishefatiy elohay vadonay leriyviy

Hebrew: שׇׁפְטֵ֣נִי כְ֭צִדְקְךָ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָ֗י וְאַל־יִשְׂמְחוּ־לִֽי׃
Translated:
Take up my cause, O LORD my God, as You are beneficent,
and let them not rejoice over me.
Transliteration: shׇfeteniy khetsidekekha yehovah elohay veal-yishemechu-liy

Hebrew: אַל־יֹאמְר֣וּ בְ֭לִבָּם הֶאָ֣ח נַפְשֵׁ֑נוּ אַל־יֹ֝אמְר֗וּ בִּֽלַּעֲנֽוּהוּ׃
Translated:
Let them not think,
“Aha, just what we wished!”
Let them not say,
“We have destroyed him!”
Transliteration: al-yomeru velivam heach nafeshenu al-yomeru vilaanuhu

Hebrew: יֵ֘בֹ֤שׁוּ וְיַחְפְּר֨וּ ׀ יַחְדָּו֮ שְׂמֵחֵ֢י רָעָ֫תִ֥י יִֽלְבְּשׁוּ־בֹ֥שֶׁת וּכְלִמָּ֑ה הַֽמַּגְדִּילִ֥ים עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
May those who rejoice at my misfortune
be frustrated and utterly disgraced;
may those who vaunt themselves over me
be clad in frustration and shame.
Transliteration: eivoshu veyacheferu yachedav shemeche֢y raatiy yileveshu-voshet ukhelimah hamagediyliym alay

Hebrew: יָרֹ֣נּוּ וְיִשְׂמְחוּ֮ חֲפֵצֵ֢י צִ֫דְקִ֥י וְיֹאמְר֣וּ תָ֭מִיד יִגְדַּ֣ל יְהֹוָ֑ה הֶ֝חָפֵ֗ץ שְׁל֣וֹם עַבְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
May those who desire my vindication
sing forth joyously;
may they always say,
“Extolled be the LORD
who desires the well-being of His servant,”
Transliteration: yaronu veyishemechu chafetse֢y tsidekiy veyomeru tamiyd yigedal yehovah hechafets shelvom avedvo

Hebrew: וּ֭לְשׁוֹנִי תֶּהְגֶּ֣ה צִדְקֶ֑ךָ כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
while my tongue shall recite Your beneficent acts,
Your praises all day long.
Transliteration: uleshvoniy tehegeh tsidekekha khׇl-hayyvom tehilatekha {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> לְעֶבֶד־יְהֹוָ֬ה לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. Of the servant of the LORD, of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha <small></small> leeved-yehovah ledavid

Hebrew: נְאֻֽם־פֶּ֣שַׁע לָ֭רָשָׁע בְּקֶ֣רֶב לִבִּ֑י אֵֽין־פַּ֥חַד אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינָֽיו׃
Translated:
I know what Transgression says to the wicked;
he has no sense of the dread of God,
Transliteration: neum-fesha larasha vekerev liviy eyn-fachad Elohimm leneged eynayv

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הֶחֱלִ֣יק אֵלָ֣יו בְּעֵינָ֑יו לִמְצֹ֖א עֲוֺנ֣וֹ לִשְׂנֹֽא׃
Translated:
because its speech is seductive to him
till his iniquity be found out and he be hated.
Transliteration: khiy-hecheliyk elayv veeynayv limetso avonvo lisheno

Hebrew: דִּבְרֵי־פִ֭יו אָ֣וֶן וּמִרְמָ֑ה חָדַ֖ל לְהַשְׂכִּ֣יל לְהֵיטִֽיב׃
Translated:
His words are evil and deceitful;
he will not consider doing good.
Transliteration: diverey-fiyv aven umiremah chadal lehashekhiyl leheytiyv

Hebrew: אָ֤וֶן ׀ יַחְשֹׁ֗ב עַֽל־מִשְׁכָּ֫ב֥וֹ יִ֭תְיַצֵּב עַל־דֶּ֣רֶךְ לֹא־ט֑וֹב רָ֝֗ע לֹ֣א יִמְאָֽס׃
Translated:
In bed he plots mischief;
he is set on a path of no good,
he does not reject evil.
Transliteration: aven yacheshov al-mishekhavvo yiteyatsev al-derekhe lo-tvov ra lo yimeas

Hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה בְּהַשָּׁמַ֣יִם חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ אֱ֝מ֥וּנָתְךָ֗ עַד־שְׁחָקִֽים׃
Translated:
O LORD, Your faithfulness reaches to heaven;
Your steadfastness to the sky;
Transliteration: yehovah vehashamayiim chasedekha emunatekha ad-shechakiym

Hebrew: צִדְקָתְךָ֨ ׀ כְּֽהַרְרֵי־אֵ֗ל מִ֭שְׁפָּטֶיךָ תְּה֣וֹם רַבָּ֑ה אָ֤דָֽם־וּבְהֵמָ֖ה תוֹשִׁ֣יעַ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Your beneficence is like the high mountains;
Your justice like the great deep;
man and beast You deliver, O LORD.
Transliteration: tsidekatekha kheharerey-el mishefateykha tehvom ravah adam-uvehemah tvoshiya yehovah

Hebrew: מַה־יָּקָ֥ר חַסְדְּךָ֗ אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים וּבְנֵ֥י אָדָ֑ם בְּצֵ֥ל כְּ֝נָפֶ֗יךָ יֶחֱסָיֽוּן׃
Translated:
How precious is Your faithful care, O God!
Mankind shelters in the shadow of Your wings.
Transliteration: mah-yakar chasedekha Elohimm uveney adam vetsel khenafeykha yechesayun

Hebrew: יִ֭רְוְיֻן מִדֶּ֣שֶׁן בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ וְנַ֖חַל עֲדָנֶ֣יךָ תַשְׁקֵֽם׃
Translated:
They feast on the rich fare of Your house;
You let them drink at Your refreshing stream.
Transliteration: yireveyun mideshen veytekha venachal adaneykha tashekem

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עִ֭מְּךָ מְק֣וֹר חַיִּ֑ים בְּ֝אוֹרְךָ֗ נִרְאֶה־אֽוֹר׃
Translated:
With You is the fountain of life;
by Your light do we see light.
Transliteration: khiy-imekha mekvor chayiym vevorekha nireeh-vor

Hebrew: מְשֹׁ֣ךְ חַ֭סְדְּךָ לְיֹדְעֶ֑יךָ וְ֝צִדְקָתְךָ֗ לְיִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
Bestow Your faithful care on those devoted to You,
and Your beneficence on upright men.
Transliteration: meshokhe chasedekha leyodeeykha vetsidekatekha leyisherey-lev

Hebrew: אַל־תְּ֭בוֹאֵנִי רֶ֣גֶל גַּאֲוָ֑ה וְיַד־רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים אַל־תְּנִדֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Let not the foot of the arrogant tread on me,
or the hand of the wicked drive me away.
Transliteration: al-tevvoeniy regel gaavah veyad-reshaiym al-tenideniy

Hebrew: שָׁ֣ם נָ֭פְלוּ פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן דֹּ֝ח֗וּ וְלֹא־יָ֥כְלוּ קֽוּם׃ {פ}
Translated:
There lie the evildoers, fallen,
thrust down, unable to rise.
Transliteration: sham nafelu foaley aven dochu velo-yakhelu kum {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ אַל־תִּתְחַ֥ר בַּמְּרֵעִ֑ים אַל־תְּ֝קַנֵּ֗א בְּעֹשֵׂ֥י עַוְלָֽה׃
Translated:
Of David.

Do not be vexed by evil men;
do not be incensed by wrongdoers;
Transliteration: ledavid al-titechar vamereiym al-tekane veoshey avelah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֶ֭חָצִיר מְהֵרָ֣ה יִמָּ֑לוּ וּכְיֶ֥רֶק דֶּ֝֗שֶׁא יִבּוֹלֽוּן׃
Translated:
for they soon wither like grass,
like verdure fade away.
Transliteration: khiy khechatsiyr meherah yimalu ukheyerek deshe yivvolun

Hebrew: בְּטַ֣ח בַּ֭יהֹוָה וַעֲשֵׂה־ט֑וֹב שְׁכׇן־אֶ֝֗רֶץ וּרְעֵ֥ה אֱמוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
Trust in the LORD and do good,
abide in the land and remain loyal.
Transliteration: vetach vayhovah vaasheh-tvov shekhׇn-erets ureeh emunah

Hebrew: וְהִתְעַנַּ֥ג עַל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְיִֽתֶּן־לְ֝ךָ֗ מִשְׁאֲלֹ֥ת לִבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Seek the favor of the LORD,
and He will grant you the desires of your heart.
Transliteration: vehiteanag al-yehovah veyiten-lekha mishealot livekha

Hebrew: גּ֣וֹל עַל־יְהֹוָ֣ה דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ וּבְטַ֥ח עָ֝לָ֗יו וְה֣וּא יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated:
Leave all to the LORD;
trust in Him; He will do it.
Transliteration: gvol al-yehovah darekhekha uvetach alayv vehu yaasheh

Hebrew: וְהוֹצִ֣יא כָא֣וֹר צִדְקֶ֑ךָ וּ֝מִשְׁפָּטֶ֗ךָ כַּֽצׇּהֳרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
He will cause your vindication to shine forth like the light,
the justice of your case, like the noonday sun.
Transliteration: vehvotsiy khavor tsidekekha umishefatekha khatsׇhorayiim

Hebrew: דּ֤וֹם ׀ לַיהֹוָה֮ וְהִתְח֢וֹלֵֽ֫ל ל֥וֹ אַל־תִּ֭תְחַר בְּמַצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְכּ֑וֹ בְּ֝אִ֗ישׁ עֹשֶׂ֥ה מְזִמּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Be patient and wait for the LORD,
do not be vexed by the prospering man
who carries out his schemes.
Transliteration: dvom layhovah vehitech֢volel lvo al-titechar vematseliycha darekhvo veiysh osheh mezimvot

Hebrew: הֶ֣רֶף מֵ֭אַף וַעֲזֹ֣ב חֵמָ֑ה אַל־תִּ֝תְחַ֗ר אַךְ־לְהָרֵֽעַ׃
Translated:
Give up anger, abandon fury,
do not be vexed;
it can only do harm.
Transliteration: heref meaf vaazov chemah al-titechar akhe-leharea

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מְ֭רֵעִים יִכָּרֵת֑וּן וְקֹוֵ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הֵ֣מָּה יִֽירְשׁוּ־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
For evil men will be cut off,
but those who look to the LORD—
they shall inherit the land.
Transliteration: khiy-mereiym yikharetun vekovey yehovah hemah yiyreshu-arets

Hebrew: וְע֣וֹד מְ֭עַט וְאֵ֣ין רָשָׁ֑ע וְהִתְבּוֹנַ֖נְתָּ עַל־מְקוֹמ֣וֹ וְאֵינֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
A little longer and there will be no wicked man;
you will look at where he was—
he will be gone.
Transliteration: vevod meat veeyn rasha vehitevvonaneta al-mekvomvo veeynenu

Hebrew: וַעֲנָוִ֥ים יִֽירְשׁוּ־אָ֑רֶץ וְ֝הִֽתְעַנְּג֗וּ עַל־רֹ֥ב שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated:
But the lowly shall inherit the land,
and delight in abundant well-being.
Transliteration: vaanaviym yiyreshu-arets vehiteanegu al-rov shalvom

Hebrew: זֹמֵ֣ם רָ֭שָׁע לַצַּדִּ֑יק וְחֹרֵ֖ק עָלָ֣יו שִׁנָּֽיו׃
Translated:
The wicked man schemes against the righteous,
and gnashes his teeth at him.
Transliteration: zomem rasha latsadiyk vechorek alayv shinayv

Hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֥י יִשְׂחַק־ל֑וֹ כִּי־רָ֝אָ֗ה כִּֽי־יָבֹ֥א יוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The Lord laughs at him,
for He knows that his day will come.
Transliteration: adonay yishechak-lvo khiy-raah khiy-yavo yvomvo

Hebrew: חֶ֤רֶב ׀ פָּ֥תְח֣וּ רְשָׁעִים֮ וְדָרְכ֢וּ קַ֫שְׁתָּ֥ם לְ֭הַפִּיל עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְי֑וֹן לִ֝טְב֗וֹחַ יִשְׁרֵי־דָֽרֶךְ׃
Translated:
The wicked draw their swords, bend their bows,
to bring down the lowly and needy,
to slaughter upright men.
Transliteration: cherev fatechu reshaiym vedarekhu kashetam lehafiyl aniy veeveyvon litevvocha yisherey-darekhe

Hebrew: חַ֭רְבָּם תָּב֣וֹא בְלִבָּ֑ם וְ֝קַשְּׁתוֹתָ֗ם תִּשָּׁבַֽרְנָה׃
Translated:
Their swords shall pierce their own hearts,
and their bows shall be broken.
Transliteration: charevam tavvo velivam vekashetvotam tishavarenah

Hebrew: טוֹב־מְ֭עַט לַצַּדִּ֑יק מֵ֝הֲמ֗וֹן רְשָׁעִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
Better the little that the righteous man has
than the great abundance of the wicked.
Transliteration: tvov-meat latsadiyk mehamvon reshaiym raviym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י זְרוֹע֣וֹת רְ֭שָׁעִים תִּשָּׁבַ֑רְנָה וְסוֹמֵ֖ךְ צַדִּיקִ֣ים יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken,
but the LORD is the support of the righteous.
Transliteration: khiy zervovot reshaiym tishavarenah vesvomekhe tsadiykiym yehovah

Hebrew: יוֹדֵ֣עַ יְ֭הֹוָה יְמֵ֣י תְמִימִ֑ם וְ֝נַחֲלָתָ֗ם לְעוֹלָ֥ם תִּהְיֶֽה׃
Translated:
The LORD is concerned for the needs of the blameless;
their portion lasts forever;
Transliteration: yvodea yehovah yemey temiymim venachalatam levolam tiheyeh

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יֵ֭בֹשׁוּ בְּעֵ֣ת רָעָ֑ה וּבִימֵ֖י רְעָב֣וֹן יִשְׂבָּֽעוּ׃
Translated:
they shall not come to grief in bad times;
in famine, they shall eat their fill.
Transliteration: lo-eivoshu veet raah uviymey reavvon yishevau

Hebrew: כִּ֤י רְשָׁעִ֨ים ׀ יֹאבֵ֗דוּ וְאֹיְבֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה כִּיקַ֣ר כָּרִ֑ים כָּל֖וּ בֶעָשָׁ֣ן כָּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
But the wicked shall perish,
and the enemies of the LORD shall be consumed,
like meadow grass consumed in smoke.
Transliteration: khiy reshaiym yovedu veoyevey yehovah khiykar khariym khalu veashan khalu

Hebrew: לֹוֶ֣ה רָ֭שָׁע וְלֹ֣א יְשַׁלֵּ֑ם וְ֝צַדִּ֗יק חוֹנֵ֥ן וְנוֹתֵֽן׃
Translated:
The wicked man borrows and does not repay;
the righteous is generous and keeps giving.
Transliteration: loveh rasha velo yeshalem vetsadiyk chvonen venvoten

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מְ֭בֹרָכָיו יִ֣ירְשׁוּ אָ֑רֶץ וּ֝מְקֻלָּלָ֗יו יִכָּרֵֽתוּ׃
Translated:
Those blessed by Him shall inherit the land,
but those cursed by Him shall be cut off.
Transliteration: khiy mevorakhayv yiyreshu arets umekulalayv yikharetu

Hebrew: מֵ֭יְהֹוָה מִֽצְעֲדֵי־גֶ֥בֶר כּוֹנָ֗נוּ וְדַרְכּ֥וֹ יֶחְפָּֽץ׃
Translated:
The steps of a man are made firm by the LORD,
when He delights in his way.
Transliteration: meyehovah mitseadey-gever khvonanu vedarekhvo yechefats

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִפֹּ֥ל לֹֽא־יוּטָ֑ל כִּֽי־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה סוֹמֵ֥ךְ יָדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Though he stumbles, he does not fall down,
for the LORD gives him support.
Transliteration: khiy-yifol lo-yutal khiy-yehovah svomekhe yadvo

Hebrew: נַ֤עַר ׀ הָיִ֗יתִי גַּם־זָ֫קַ֥נְתִּי וְֽלֹא־רָ֭אִיתִי צַדִּ֣יק נֶעֱזָ֑ב וְ֝זַרְע֗וֹ מְבַקֶּשׁ־לָֽחֶם׃
Translated:
I have been young and am now old,
but I have never seen a righteous man abandoned,
or his children seeking bread.
Transliteration: naar hayiytiy gam-zakanetiy velo-raiytiy tsadiyk neezav vezarevo mevakesh-lachem

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם חוֹנֵ֣ן וּמַלְוֶ֑ה וְ֝זַרְע֗וֹ לִבְרָכָֽה׃
Translated:
He is always generous, and lends,
and his children are held blessed.
Transliteration: khׇl-hayyvom chvonen umaleveh vezarevo liverakhah

Hebrew: ס֣וּר מֵ֭רָע וַעֲשֵׂה־ט֗וֹב וּשְׁכֹ֥ן לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Shun evil and do good,
and you shall abide forever.
Transliteration: sur mera vaasheh-tvov ushekhon levolam

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ אֹ֘הֵ֤ב מִשְׁפָּ֗ט וְלֹא־יַעֲזֹ֣ב אֶת־חֲ֭סִידָיו לְעוֹלָ֣ם נִשְׁמָ֑רוּ וְזֶ֖רַע רְשָׁעִ֣ים נִכְרָֽת׃
Translated:
For the LORD loves what is right,
He does not abandon His faithful ones.
They are preserved forever,
while the children of the wicked will be cut off.
Transliteration: khiy yehovah ohev mishefat velo-yaazov et-chasiydayv levolam nishemaru vezera reshaiym nikherat

Hebrew: צַדִּיקִ֥ים יִֽירְשׁוּ־אָ֑רֶץ וְיִשְׁכְּנ֖וּ לָעַ֣ד עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
The righteous shall inherit the land,
and abide forever in it.
Transliteration: tsadiykiym yiyreshu-arets veyishekhenu laad aleyha

Hebrew: פִּֽי־צַ֭דִּיק יֶהְגֶּ֣ה חׇכְמָ֑ה וּ֝לְשׁוֹנ֗וֹ תְּדַבֵּ֥ר מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,
and his tongue speaks what is right.
Transliteration: fiy-tsadiyk yehegeh chׇkhemah uleshvonvo tedaver mishefat

Hebrew: תּוֹרַ֣ת אֱלֹהָ֣יו בְּלִבּ֑וֹ לֹ֖א תִמְעַ֣ד אֲשֻׁרָֽיו׃
Translated:
The teaching of his God is in his heart;
his feet do not slip.
Transliteration: tvorat elohayv velivvo lo timead ashurayv

Hebrew: צוֹפֶ֣ה רָ֭שָׁע לַצַּדִּ֑יק וּ֝מְבַקֵּ֗שׁ לַהֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The wicked watches for the righteous,
seeking to put him to death;
Transliteration: tsvofeh rasha latsadiyk umevakesh lahamiytvo

Hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה לֹא־יַעַזְבֶ֣נּוּ בְיָד֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א יַ֝רְשִׁיעֶ֗נּוּ בְּהִשָּׁפְטֽוֹ׃
Translated:
the LORD will not abandon him to his power;
He will not let him be condemned in judgment.
Transliteration: yehovah lo-yaazevenu veyadvo velo yareshiyenu vehishafetvo

Hebrew: קַוֵּ֤ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ וּשְׁמֹ֬ר דַּרְכּ֗וֹ וִֽ֭ירוֹמִמְךָ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אָ֑רֶץ בְּהִכָּרֵ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תִּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
Look to the LORD and keep to His way,
and He will raise you high that you may inherit the land;
when the wicked are cut off, you shall see it.
Transliteration: kaveh el-yehovah ushemor darekhvo viyrvomimekha lareshet arets vehikharet reshaiym tireeh

Hebrew: רָ֭אִיתִי רָשָׁ֣ע עָרִ֑יץ וּ֝מִתְעָרֶ֗ה כְּאֶזְרָ֥ח רַעֲנָֽן׃
Translated:
I saw a wicked man, powerful,
well-rooted like a robust native tree.
Transliteration: raiytiy rasha ariyts umiteareh kheezerach raanan

Hebrew: וַֽ֭יַּעֲבֹר וְהִנֵּ֣ה אֵינֶ֑נּוּ וָ֝אֲבַקְשֵׁ֗הוּ וְלֹ֣א נִמְצָֽא׃
Translated:
Suddenly he vanished and was gone;
I sought him, but he was not to be found.
Transliteration: vayaavor vehineh eynenu vaavakeshehu velo nimetsa

Hebrew: שְׁמׇר־תָּ֭ם וּרְאֵ֣ה יָשָׁ֑ר כִּֽי־אַחֲרִ֖ית לְאִ֣ישׁ שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Mark the blameless, note the upright,
for there is a future for the man of integrity.
Transliteration: shemׇr-tam ureeh yashar khiy-achariyt leiysh shalvom

Hebrew: וּֽ֭פֹשְׁעִים נִשְׁמְד֣וּ יַחְדָּ֑ו אַחֲרִ֖ית רְשָׁעִ֣ים נִכְרָֽתָה׃
Translated:
But transgressors shall be utterly destroyed,
the future of the wicked shall be cut off.
Transliteration: ufosheiym nishemedu yachedav achariyt reshaiym nikheratah

Hebrew: וּתְשׁוּעַ֣ת צַ֭דִּיקִים מֵיְהֹוָ֑ה מָ֝עוּזָּ֗ם בְּעֵ֣ת צָרָֽה׃
Translated:
The deliverance of the righteous comes from the LORD,
their stronghold in time of trouble.
Transliteration: uteshuat tsadiykiym meyehovah mauzam veet tsarah

Hebrew: וַ֥יַּעְזְרֵ֥ם יְהֹוָ֗ה וַֽיְפַ֫לְּטֵ֥ם יְפַלְּטֵ֣ם מֵ֭רְשָׁעִים וְיוֹשִׁיעֵ֑ם כִּי־חָ֥סוּ בֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The LORD helps them and rescues them,
rescues them from the wicked and delivers them,
for they seek refuge in Him.
Transliteration: vayaezerem yehovah vayefaletem yefaletem mereshaiym veyvoshiyem khiy-chasu vvo {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֖וֹר לְדָוִ֣ד לְהַזְכִּֽיר׃
Translated: A psalm of David. Lehazkir.
Transliteration: mizemvor ledavid lehazekhiyr

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה אַל־בְּקֶצְפְּךָ֥ תוֹכִיחֵ֑נִי וּֽבַחֲמָתְךָ֥ תְיַסְּרֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
O LORD, do not punish me in wrath;
do not chastise me in fury.
Transliteration: yehovah al-veketsefekha tvokhiycheniy uvachamatekha teyasereniy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חִ֭צֶּיךָ נִ֣חֲתוּ בִ֑י וַתִּנְחַ֖ת עָלַ֣י יָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
For Your arrows have struck me;
Your blows have fallen upon me.
Transliteration: khiy-chitseykha nichatu viy vatinechat alay yadekha

Hebrew: אֵין־מְתֹ֣ם בִּ֭בְשָׂרִי מִפְּנֵ֣י זַעְמֶ֑ךָ אֵין־שָׁל֥וֹם בַּ֝עֲצָמַ֗י מִפְּנֵ֥י חַטָּאתִֽי׃
Translated:
There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your rage,
no wholeness in my bones because of my sin.
Transliteration: eyn-metom viveshariy mifeney zaemekha eyn-shalvom vaatsamay mifeney chatatiy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י עֲ֭וֺנֹתַי עָבְר֣וּ רֹאשִׁ֑י כְּמַשָּׂ֥א כָ֝בֵ֗ד יִכְבְּד֥וּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
For my iniquities have overwhelmed me;
they are like a heavy burden, more than I can bear.
Transliteration: khiy avonotay averu roshiy khemasha khaved yikhevedu mimeniy

Hebrew: הִבְאִ֣ישׁוּ נָ֭מַקּוּ חַבּוּרֹתָ֑י מִ֝פְּנֵ֗י אִוַּלְתִּֽי׃
Translated:
My wounds stink and fester
because of my folly.
Transliteration: hiveiyshu namaku chavurotay mifeney ivaletiy

Hebrew: נַעֲוֵ֣יתִי שַׁחֹ֣תִי עַד־מְאֹ֑ד כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם קֹדֵ֥ר הִלָּֽכְתִּי׃
Translated:
I am all bent and bowed;
I walk about in gloom all day long.
Transliteration: naaveytiy shachotiy ad-meod khׇl-hayyvom koder hilakhetiy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־כְ֭סָלַי מָלְא֣וּ נִקְלֶ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין מְ֝תֹ֗ם בִּבְשָׂרִֽי׃
Translated:
For my sinews are full of fever;
there is no soundness in my flesh.
Transliteration: khiy-khesalay maleu nikeleh veeyn metom viveshariy

Hebrew: נְפוּג֣וֹתִי וְנִדְכֵּ֣יתִי עַד־מְאֹ֑ד שָׁ֝אַ֗גְתִּי מִֽנַּהֲמַ֥ת לִבִּֽי׃
Translated:
I am all benumbed and crushed;
I roar because of the turmoil in my mind.
Transliteration: nefugvotiy venidekheytiy ad-meod shaagetiy minahamat liviy

Hebrew: אֲֽדֹנָ֗י נֶגְדְּךָ֥ כׇל־תַּאֲוָתִ֑י וְ֝אַנְחָתִ֗י מִמְּךָ֥ לֹֽא־נִסְתָּֽרָה׃
Translated:
O Lord, You are aware of all my entreaties;
my groaning is not hidden from You.
Transliteration: adonay negedekha khׇl-taavatiy veanechatiy mimekha lo-nisetarah

Hebrew: לִבִּ֣י סְ֭חַרְחַר עֲזָבַ֣נִי כֹחִ֑י וְֽאוֹר־עֵינַ֥י גַּם־הֵ֝֗ם אֵ֣ין אִתִּֽי׃
Translated:
My mind reels;
my strength fails me;
my eyes too have lost their luster.
Transliteration: liviy secharechar azavaniy khochiy vevor-eynay gam-hem eyn itiy

Hebrew: אֹֽהֲבַ֨י ׀ וְרֵעַ֗י מִנֶּ֣גֶד נִגְעִ֣י יַעֲמֹ֑דוּ וּ֝קְרוֹבַ֗י מֵרָחֹ֥ק עָמָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
My friends and companions stand back from my affliction;
my kinsmen stand far off.
Transliteration: ohavay vereay mineged nigeiy yaamodu ukervovay merachok amadu

Hebrew: וַיְנַקְשׁ֤וּ ׀ מְבַקְשֵׁ֬י נַפְשִׁ֗י וְדֹרְשֵׁ֣י רָ֭עָתִי דִּבְּר֣וּ הַוּ֑וֹת וּ֝מִרְמ֗וֹת כׇּל־הַיּ֥וֹם יֶהְגּֽוּ׃
Translated:
Those who seek my life lay traps;
those who wish me harm speak malice;
they utter deceit all the time.
Transliteration: vayenakeshu mevakeshey nafeshiy vedoreshey raatiy diveru hauvot umiremvot khׇl-hayyvom yehegu

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י כְ֭חֵרֵשׁ לֹ֣א אֶשְׁמָ֑ע וּ֝כְאִלֵּ֗ם לֹ֣א יִפְתַּח־פִּֽיו׃
Translated:
But I am like a deaf man, unhearing,
like a dumb man who cannot speak up;
Transliteration: vaaniy khecheresh lo eshema ukheilem lo yifetach-fiyv

Hebrew: וָאֱהִ֗י כְּ֭אִישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־שֹׁמֵ֑עַ וְאֵ֥ין בְּ֝פִ֗יו תּוֹכָחֽוֹת׃
Translated:
I am like one who does not hear,
who has no retort on his lips.
Transliteration: vaehiy kheiysh asher lo-shomea veeyn vefiyv tvokhachvot

Hebrew: כִּֽי־לְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֣ה הוֹחָ֑לְתִּי אַתָּ֥ה תַ֝עֲנֶ֗ה אֲדֹנָ֥י אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated:
But I wait for You, O LORD;
You will answer, O Lord, my God.
Transliteration: khiy-lekha yehovah hvochaletiy atah taaneh adonay elohay

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי פֶּן־יִשְׂמְחוּ־לִ֑י בְּמ֥וֹט רַ֝גְלִ֗י עָלַ֥י הִגְדִּֽילוּ׃
Translated:
For I fear they will rejoice over me;
when my foot gives way they will vaunt themselves against me.
Transliteration: khiy-amaretiy fen-yishemechu-liy vemvot rageliy alay higediylu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֲ֭נִי לְצֶ֣לַע נָכ֑וֹן וּמַכְאוֹבִ֖י נֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִֽיד׃
Translated:
For I am on the verge of collapse;
my pain is always with me.
Transliteration: khiy-aniy letsela nakhvon umakhevoviy negediy tamiyd

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עֲוֺנִ֥י אַגִּ֑יד אֶ֝דְאַ֗ג מֵ֖חַטָּאתִֽי׃
Translated:
I acknowledge my iniquity;
I am fearful over my sin;
Transliteration: khiy-avoniy agiyd edeag mechatatiy

Hebrew: וְֽ֭אֹיְבַי חַיִּ֣ים עָצֵ֑מוּ וְרַבּ֖וּ שֹׂנְאַ֣י שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
for my mortal enemies are numerous;
my treacherous foes are many.
Transliteration: veoyevay chayiym atsemu veravu shoneay shaker

Hebrew: וּמְשַׁלְּמֵ֣י רָ֭עָה תַּ֣חַת טוֹבָ֑ה יִ֝שְׂטְנ֗וּנִי תַּ֣חַת (רדופי) [רׇֽדְפִי־]טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Those who repay evil for good
harass me for pursuing good.
Transliteration: umeshalemey raah tachat tvovah yishetenuniy tachat (rdvfy) [rׇdefiy-]tvov

Hebrew: אַל־תַּעַזְבֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֑ה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י אַל־תִּרְחַ֥ק מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
Do not abandon me, O LORD;
my God, be not far from me;
Transliteration: al-taazeveniy yehovah elohay al-tirechak mimeniy

Hebrew: ח֥וּשָׁה לְעֶזְרָתִ֑י אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י תְּשׁוּעָתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
hasten to my aid,
O Lord, my deliverance.
Transliteration: chushah leezeratiy adonay teshuatiy {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ (לידיתון) [לִֽידוּת֗וּן] מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; for Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha (lydytvn) [liydutun] mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: אָמַ֗רְתִּי אֶ֥שְׁמְרָ֣ה דְרָכַי֮ מֵחֲט֢וֹא בִלְשׁ֫וֹנִ֥י אֶשְׁמְרָ֥ה לְפִ֥י מַחְס֑וֹם בְּעֹ֖ד רָשָׁ֣ע לְנֶגְדִּֽי׃
Translated:
I resolved I would watch my step
lest I offend by my speech;
I would keep my mouth muzzled
while the wicked man was in my presence.
Transliteration: amaretiy eshemerah derakhay mechat֢vo vileshvoniy eshemerah lefiy machesvom veod rasha lenegediy

Hebrew: נֶאֱלַ֣מְתִּי ד֭וּמִיָּה הֶחֱשֵׁ֣יתִי מִטּ֑וֹב וּכְאֵבִ֥י נֶעְכָּֽר׃
Translated:
I was dumb, silent;
I was very still
while my pain was intense.
Transliteration: neelametiy dumiyah hechesheytiy mitvov ukheeviy neekhar

Hebrew: חַם־לִבִּ֨י ׀ בְּקִרְבִּ֗י בַּהֲגִיגִ֥י תִבְעַר־אֵ֑שׁ דִּ֝בַּ֗רְתִּי בִּלְשׁוֹנִֽי׃
Translated:
My mind was in a rage,
my thoughts were all aflame;
I spoke out:
Transliteration: cham-liviy vekireviy vahagiygiy tivear-esh divaretiy vileshvoniy

Hebrew: הוֹדִ֘יעֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ קִצִּ֗י וּמִדַּ֣ת יָמַ֣י מַה־הִ֑יא אֵ֝דְעָ֗ה מֶה־חָדֵ֥ל אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
Tell me, O LORD, what my term is,
what is the measure of my days;
I would know how fleeting my life is.
Transliteration: hvodiyeniy yehovah kitsiy umidat yamay mah-hiy edeah meh-chadel aniy

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה טְפָח֨וֹת ׀ נָ֘תַ֤תָּה יָמַ֗י וְחֶלְדִּ֣י כְאַ֣יִן נֶגְדֶּ֑ךָ אַ֥ךְ כׇּֽל־הֶ֥בֶל כׇּל־אָ֝דָ֗ם נִצָּ֥ב סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
You have made my life just handbreadths long;
its span is as nothing in Your sight;
no man endures any longer than a breath. Selah.
Transliteration: hineh tefachvot natatah yamay vechelediy kheayiin negedekha akhe khׇl-hevel khׇl-adam nitsav selah

Hebrew: אַךְ־בְּצֶ֤לֶם ׀ יִֽתְהַלֶּךְ־אִ֗ישׁ אַךְ־הֶ֥בֶל יֶהֱמָי֑וּן יִ֝צְבֹּ֗ר וְֽלֹא־יֵדַ֥ע מִֽי־אֹסְפָֽם׃
Translated:
Man walks about as a mere shadow;
mere futility is his hustle and bustle,
amassing and not knowing who will gather in.
Transliteration: akhe-vetselem yitehalekhe-iysh akhe-hevel yehemayun yitsevor velo-eida miy-osefam

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה מַה־קִּוִּ֣יתִי אֲדֹנָ֑י תּ֝וֹחַלְתִּ֗י לְךָ֣ הִֽיא׃
Translated:
What, then, can I count on, O Lord?
In You my hope lies.
Transliteration: veatah mah-kiviytiy adonay tvochaletiy lekha hiy

Hebrew: מִכׇּל־פְּשָׁעַ֥י הַצִּילֵ֑נִי חֶרְפַּ֥ת נָ֝בָ֗ל אַל־תְּשִׂימֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Deliver me from all my transgressions;
make me not the butt of the benighted.
Transliteration: mikhׇl-feshaay hatsiyleniy cherefat naval al-teshiymeniy

Hebrew: נֶ֭אֱלַמְתִּי לֹ֣א אֶפְתַּח־פִּ֑י כִּ֖י אַתָּ֣ה עָשִֽׂיתָ׃
Translated:
I am dumb, I do not speak up,
for it is Your doing.
Transliteration: neelametiy lo efetach-fiy khiy atah ashiyta

Hebrew: הָסֵ֣ר מֵעָלַ֣י נִגְעֶ֑ךָ מִתִּגְרַ֥ת יָ֝דְךָ֗ אֲנִ֣י כָלִֽיתִי׃
Translated:
Take away Your plague from me;
I perish from Your blows.
Transliteration: haser mealay nigeekha mitigerat yadekha aniy khaliytiy

Hebrew: בְּֽתוֹכָ֘ח֤וֹת עַל־עָוֺ֨ן ׀ יִסַּ֬רְתָּ אִ֗ישׁ וַתֶּ֣מֶס כָּעָ֣שׁ חֲמוּד֑וֹ אַ֤ךְ הֶ֖בֶל כׇּל־אָדָ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
You chastise a man in punishment for his sin,
consuming like a moth what he treasures.
No man is more than a breath. Selah.
Transliteration: vetvokhachvot al-avon yisareta iysh vatemes khaash chamudvo akhe hevel khׇl-adam selah

Hebrew: שִׁ֥מְעָֽה־תְפִלָּתִ֨י ׀ יְהֹוָ֡ה וְשַׁוְעָתִ֨י ׀ הַאֲזִינָה֮ אֶֽל־דִּמְעָתִ֗י אַֽל־תֶּ֫חֱרַ֥שׁ כִּ֤י גֵ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י עִמָּ֑ךְ תּ֝וֹשָׁ֗ב כְּכׇל־אֲבוֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
Hear my prayer, O LORD;
give ear to my cry;
do not disregard my tears;
for like all my forebears
