I am an alien, resident with You.
Transliteration: shimeah-tefilatiy yehovah veshaveatiy haaziynah el-dimeatiy al-techerash khiy ger anokhiy imakhe tvoshav khekhׇl-avvotay

Hebrew: הָשַׁ֣ע מִמֶּ֣נִּי וְאַבְלִ֑יגָה בְּטֶ֖רֶם אֵלֵ֣ךְ וְאֵינֶֽנִּי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Look away from me, that I may recover,
before I pass away and am gone.
Transliteration: hasha mimeniy veaveliygah veterem elekhe veeyneniy {f}

Hebrew: לַ֝מְנַצֵּ֗חַ לְדָוִ֥ד מִזְמֽוֹר׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha ledavid mizemvor

Hebrew: קַוֺּ֣ה קִוִּ֣יתִי יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֥ט אֵ֝לַ֗י וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע שַׁוְעָתִֽי׃
Translated:
I put my hope in the LORD;
He inclined toward me,
and heeded my cry.
Transliteration: kavoh kiviytiy yehovah vayet elay vayishema shaveatiy

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲלֵ֤נִי ׀ מִבּ֥וֹר שָׁאוֹן֮ מִטִּ֢יט הַיָּ֫וֵ֥ן וַיָּ֖קֶם עַל־סֶ֥לַע רַגְלַ֗י כּוֹנֵ֥ן אֲשֻׁרָֽי׃
Translated:
He lifted me out of the miry pit,
the slimy clay,
and set my feet on a rock,
steadied my legs.
Transliteration: vayaaleniy mivvor shavon miti֢yt hayaven vayakem al-sela ragelay khvonen ashuray

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֬ן בְּפִ֨י ׀ שִׁ֥יר חָדָשׁ֮ תְּהִלָּ֢ה לֵאלֹ֫הֵ֥ינוּ יִרְא֣וּ רַבִּ֣ים וְיִירָ֑אוּ וְ֝יִבְטְח֗וּ בַּיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
He put a new song into my mouth,
a hymn to our God.
May many see it and stand in awe,
and trust in the LORD.
Transliteration: vayiten vefiy shiyr chadash tehila֢h leloheynu yireu raviym veyiyrau veyiivetechu vayhovah

Hebrew: אַ֥שְֽׁרֵי־הַגֶּ֗בֶר אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם יְ֭הֹוָה מִבְטַח֑וֹ וְֽלֹא־פָנָ֥ה אֶל־רְ֝הָבִ֗ים וְשָׂטֵ֥י כָזָֽב׃
Translated:
Happy is the man who makes the LORD his trust,
who turns not to the arrogant or to followers of falsehood.
Transliteration: asherey-hagever asher-sham yehovah mivetachvo velo-fanah el-rehaviym veshatey khazav

Hebrew: רַבּ֤וֹת עָשִׂ֨יתָ ׀ אַתָּ֤ה ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהַי֮ נִ֥פְלְאֹתֶ֥יךָ וּמַחְשְׁבֹתֶ֗יךָ אֵ֫לֵ֥ינוּ אֵ֤ין ׀ עֲרֹ֬ךְ אֵלֶ֗יךָ אַגִּ֥ידָה וַאֲדַבֵּ֑רָה עָ֝צְמ֗וּ מִסַּפֵּֽר׃
Translated:
You, O LORD my God, have done many things;
the wonders You have devised for us
cannot be set out before You;
I would rehearse the tale of them,
but they are more than can be told.
Transliteration: ravvot ashiyta atah yehovah elohay nifeleoteykha umacheshevoteykha eleynu eyn arokhe eleykha agiydah vaadaverah atsemu misafer

Hebrew: זֶ֤בַח וּמִנְחָ֨ה ׀ לֹֽא־חָפַ֗צְתָּ אׇ֭זְנַיִם כָּרִ֣יתָ לִּ֑י עוֹלָ֥ה וַ֝חֲטָאָ֗ה לֹ֣א שָׁאָֽלְתָּ׃
Translated:
You gave me to understand that
You do not desire sacrifice and meal offering;
You do not ask for burnt offering and sin offering.
Transliteration: zevach uminechah lo-chafatseta ׇzenayim khariyta liy volah vachataah lo shaaleta

Hebrew: אָ֣ז אָ֭מַרְתִּי הִנֵּה־בָ֑אתִי בִּמְגִלַּת־סֵ֝֗פֶר כָּת֥וּב עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
Then I said,
“See, I will bring a scroll recounting what befell me.”
Transliteration: az amaretiy hineh-vatiy vimegilat-sefer khatuv alay

Hebrew: לַ֥עֲשׂוֹת־רְצוֹנְךָ֣ אֱלֹהַ֣י חָפָ֑צְתִּי וְ֝ת֥וֹרָתְךָ֗ בְּת֣וֹךְ מֵעָֽי׃
Translated:
To do what pleases You, my God, is my desire;
Your teaching is in my inmost parts.
Transliteration: laashvot-retsvonekha elohay chafatsetiy vetvoratekha vetvokhe meay

Hebrew: בִּשַּׂ֤רְתִּי צֶ֨דֶק ׀ בְּקָ֘הָ֤ל רָ֗ב הִנֵּ֣ה שְׂ֭פָתַי לֹ֣א אֶכְלָ֑א יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אַתָּ֥ה יָדָֽעְתָּ׃
Translated:
I proclaimed [Your] righteousness in a great congregation;
see, I did not withhold my words;
O LORD, You must know it.
Transliteration: visharetiy tsedek vekahal rav hineh shefatay lo ekhela yehovah atah yadaeta

Hebrew: צִדְקָתְךָ֬ לֹֽא־כִסִּ֨יתִי ׀ בְּת֬וֹךְ לִבִּ֗י אֱמוּנָתְךָ֣ וּתְשׁוּעָתְךָ֣ אָמָ֑רְתִּי לֹא־כִחַ֥דְתִּי חַסְדְּךָ֥ וַ֝אֲמִתְּךָ֗ לְקָהָ֥ל רָֽב׃
Translated:
I did not keep Your beneficence to myself;
I declared Your faithful deliverance;
I did not fail to speak of Your steadfast love in a great congregation.
Transliteration: tsidekatekha lo-khisiytiy vetvokhe liviy emunatekha uteshuatekha amaretiy lo-khichadetiy chasedekha vaamitekha lekahal rav

Hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָ֗ה לֹֽא־תִכְלָ֣א רַחֲמֶ֣יךָ מִמֶּ֑נִּי חַסְדְּךָ֥ וַ֝אֲמִתְּךָ֗ תָּמִ֥יד יִצְּרֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
O LORD, You will not withhold from me Your compassion;
Your steadfast love will protect me always.
Transliteration: atah yehovah lo-tikhela rachameykha mimeniy chasedekha vaamitekha tamiyd yitseruniy

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אָפְפֽוּ־עָלַ֨י ׀ רָע֡וֹת עַד־אֵ֬ין מִסְפָּ֗ר הִשִּׂיג֣וּנִי עֲ֭וֺנֹתַי וְלֹא־יָכֹ֣לְתִּי לִרְא֑וֹת עָצְמ֥וּ מִשַּׂעֲר֥וֹת רֹ֝אשִׁ֗י וְלִבִּ֥י עֲזָבָֽנִי׃
Translated:
For misfortunes without number envelop me;
my iniquities have caught up with me;
I cannot see;
they are more than the hairs of my head;
I am at my wits’ end.
Transliteration: khiy afefu-alay ravot ad-eyn misefar hishiyguniy avonotay velo-yakholetiy lirevot atsemu mishaarvot roshiy veliviy azavaniy

Hebrew: רְצֵ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה לְהַצִּילֵ֑נִי יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי חֽוּשָׁה׃
Translated:
O favor me, LORD, and save me;
O LORD, hasten to my aid.
Transliteration: retseh yehovah lehatsiyleniy yehovah leezeratiy chushah

Hebrew: יֵ֘בֹ֤שׁוּ וְיַחְפְּר֨וּ ׀ יַחַד֮ מְבַקְשֵׁ֥י נַפְשִׁ֗י לִסְפּ֫וֹתָ֥הּ יִסֹּ֣גוּ אָ֭חוֹר וְיִכָּלְמ֑וּ חֲ֝פֵצֵ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Let those who seek to destroy my life
be frustrated and disgraced;
let those who wish me harm
fall back in shame.
Transliteration: eivoshu veyacheferu yachad mevakeshey nafeshiy lisefvotah yisogu achvor veyikhalemu chafetsey raatiy

Hebrew: יָ֭שֹׁמּוּ עַל־עֵ֣קֶב בׇּשְׁתָּ֑ם הָאֹמְרִ֥ים לִ֝֗י הֶ֘אָ֥ח <small>׀</small> הֶאָֽח׃
Translated:
Let those who say “Aha! Aha!” over me
be desolate because of their frustration.
Transliteration: yashomu al-ekev vׇshetam haomeriym liy heach <small></small> heach

Hebrew: יָ֘שִׂ֤ישׂוּ וְיִשְׂמְח֨וּ ׀ בְּךָ֗ כׇּֽל־מְבַ֫קְשֶׁ֥יךָ יֹאמְר֣וּ תָ֭מִיד יִגְדַּ֣ל יְהֹוָ֑ה אֹ֝הֲבֵ֗י תְּשׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
But let all who seek You be glad and rejoice in You;
let those who are eager for Your deliverance always say,
“Extolled be the LORD!”
Transliteration: yashiyshu veyishemechu vekha khׇl-mevakesheykha yomeru tamiyd yigedal yehovah ohavey teshuatekha

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְיוֹן֮ אֲדֹנָ֢י יַחֲשׇׁ֫ב־לִ֥י עֶזְרָתִ֣י וּמְפַלְטִ֣י אַ֑תָּה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י אַל־תְּאַחַֽר׃ {פ}
Translated:
But I am poor and needy;
may the Lord devise [deliverance] for me.
You are my help and my rescuer;
my God, do not delay.
Transliteration: vaaniy aniy veeveyvon adona֢y yachashׇv-liy ezeratiy umefaletiy atah elohay al-teachar {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: אַ֭שְׁרֵי מַשְׂכִּ֣יל אֶל־דָּ֑ל בְּי֥וֹם רָ֝עָ֗ה יְֽמַלְּטֵ֥הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Happy is he who is thoughtful of the wretched;
in bad times may the LORD keep him from harm.
Transliteration: asherey mashekhiyl el-dal veyvom raah yemaletehu yehovah

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ יִשְׁמְרֵ֣הוּ וִ֭יחַיֵּהוּ (יאשר) [וְאֻשַּׁ֣ר] בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְאַֽל־תִּ֝תְּנֵ֗הוּ בְּנֶ֣פֶשׁ אֹיְבָֽיו׃
Translated:
May the LORD guard him and preserve him;
and may he be thought happy in the land.
Do not subject him to the will of his enemies.
Transliteration: yehovah yishemerehu viychayehu (yshr) [veushar] vaarets veal-titenehu venefesh oyevayv

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה יִ֭סְעָדֶנּוּ עַל־עֶ֣רֶשׂ דְּוָ֑י כׇּל־מִ֝שְׁכָּב֗וֹ הָפַ֥כְתָּ בְחׇלְיֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The LORD will sustain him on his sickbed;
You shall wholly transform his bed of suffering.
Transliteration: yehovah yiseadenu al-eresh devay khׇl-mishekhavvo hafakheta vechׇleyvo

Hebrew: אֲֽנִי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי יְהֹוָ֣ה חׇנֵּ֑נִי רְפָאָ֥ה נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י כִּי־חָטָ֥אתִי לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
I said, “O LORD, have mercy on me,
heal me, for I have sinned against You.”
Transliteration: aniy-amaretiy yehovah chׇneniy refaah nafeshiy khiy-chatatiy lakhe

Hebrew: אוֹיְבַ֗י יֹאמְר֣וּ רַ֣ע לִ֑י מָתַ֥י יָ֝מ֗וּת וְאָבַ֥ד שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
My enemies speak evilly of me,
“When will he die and his name perish?”
Transliteration: voyevay yomeru ra liy matay yamut veavad shemvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־בָּ֤א לִרְא֨וֹת ׀ שָׁ֤וְא יְדַבֵּ֗ר לִבּ֗וֹ יִקְבׇּץ־אָ֥וֶן ל֑וֹ יֵצֵ֖א לַח֣וּץ יְדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated:
If one comes to visit, he speaks falsely;
his mind stores up evil thoughts;
once outside, he speaks them.
Transliteration: veim-va lirevot shave yedaver livvo yikevׇts-aven lvo eitse lachuts yedaver

Hebrew: יַ֗חַד עָלַ֣י יִ֭תְלַחֲשׁוּ כׇּל־שֹׂנְאָ֑י עָלַ֓י ׀ יַחְשְׁב֖וּ רָעָ֣ה לִֽי׃
Translated:
All my enemies whisper together against me,
imagining the worst for me.
Transliteration: yachad alay yitelachashu khׇl-shoneay alay yacheshevu raah liy

Hebrew: דְּֽבַר־בְּ֭לִיַּעַל יָצ֣וּק בּ֑וֹ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁ֝כַ֗ב לֹא־יוֹסִ֥יף לָקֽוּם׃
Translated:
“Something baneful has settled in him;
he’ll not rise from his bed again.”
Transliteration: devar-veliyaal yatsuk vvo vaasher shakhav lo-yvosiyf lakum

Hebrew: גַּם־אִ֤ישׁ שְׁלוֹמִ֨י ׀ אֲשֶׁר־בָּטַ֣חְתִּי ב֭וֹ אוֹכֵ֣ל לַחְמִ֑י הִגְדִּ֖יל עָלַ֣י עָקֵֽב׃
Translated:
My ally in whom I trusted,
even he who shares my bread,
has been utterly false to me.
Transliteration: gam-iysh shelvomiy asher-vatachetiy vvo vokhel lachemiy higediyl alay akev

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָ֗ה חׇנֵּ֥נִי וַהֲקִימֵ֑נִי וַאֲשַׁלְּמָ֥ה לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
But You, O LORD, have mercy on me;
let me rise again and repay them.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah chׇneniy vahakiymeniy vaashalemah lahem

Hebrew: בְּזֹ֣את יָ֭דַעְתִּי כִּֽי־חָפַ֣צְתָּ בִּ֑י כִּ֤י לֹֽא־יָרִ֖יעַ אֹיְבִ֣י עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
Then shall I know that You are pleased with me:
when my enemy cannot shout in triumph over me.
Transliteration: vezot yadaetiy khiy-chafatseta viy khiy lo-yariya oyeviy alay

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י בְּ֭תֻמִּי תָּמַ֣כְתָּ בִּ֑י וַתַּצִּיבֵ֖נִי לְפָנֶ֣יךָ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
You will support me because of my integrity,
and let me abide in Your presence forever.
Transliteration: vaaniy vetumiy tamakheta viy vatatsiyveniy lefaneykha levolam

Hebrew: בָּ֘ר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מֵֽ֭הָעוֹלָם וְעַ֥ד הָעוֹלָ֗ם אָ֘מֵ֥ן ׀ וְאָמֵֽן׃
Translated:
Blessed is the LORD, God of Israel,
from eternity to eternity.
Amen and Amen.
Transliteration: varukhe yehovah elohey yisherael mehavolam vead havolam amen veamen

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לִבְנֵי־קֹֽרַח׃
Translated: For the leader. A maskil of the Korahites.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mashekhiyl liveney-korach

Hebrew: כְּאַיָּ֗ל תַּעֲרֹ֥ג עַל־אֲפִֽיקֵי־מָ֑יִם כֵּ֤ן נַפְשִׁ֨י תַעֲרֹ֖ג אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
Like a hind crying for water,
my soul cries for You, O God;
Transliteration: kheayal taarog al-afiykey-mayiim khen nafeshiy taarog eleykha Elohim

Hebrew: צָמְאָ֬ה נַפְשִׁ֨י ׀ לֵאלֹהִים֮ לְאֵ֢ל חָ֥֫י מָתַ֥י אָב֑וֹא וְ֝אֵרָאֶ֗ה פְּנֵ֣י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
my soul thirsts for God, the living God;
O when will I come to appear before God!
Transliteration: tsameah nafeshiy lelohiym lee֢l chay matay avvo veeraeh feney Elohim

Hebrew: הָֽיְתָה־לִּ֬י דִמְעָתִ֣י לֶ֭חֶם יוֹמָ֣ם וָלָ֑יְלָה בֶּאֱמֹ֥ר אֵלַ֥י כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם אַיֵּ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
My tears have been my food day and night;
I am ever taunted with, “Where is your God?”
Transliteration: hayetah-liy dimeatiy lechem yvomam valayelah veemor elay khׇl-hayyvom ayeh eloheykha

Hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה אֶזְכְּרָ֨ה ׀ וְאֶשְׁפְּכָ֬ה עָלַ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁ֗י כִּ֤י אֶעֱבֹ֨ר ׀ בַּסָּךְ֮ אֶדַּדֵּ֗ם עַד־בֵּ֥ית־אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים בְּקוֹל־רִנָּ֥ה וְתוֹדָ֗ה הָמ֥וֹן חוֹגֵֽג׃
Translated:
When I think of this, I pour out my soul:
how I walked with the crowd, moved with them,
the festive throng, to the House of God
with joyous shouts of praise.
Transliteration: eleh ezekherah veeshefekhah alay nafeshiy khiy eevor vasakhe edadem ad-veyt-Elohimm vekvol-rinah vetvodah hamvon chvogeg

Hebrew: מַה־תִּשְׁתּ֬וֹחֲחִ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ וַתֶּהֱמִ֢י עָ֫לָ֥י הוֹחִ֣לִי לֵ֭אלֹהִים כִּי־ע֥וֹד אוֹדֶ֗נּוּ יְשׁוּע֥וֹת פָּנָֽיו׃
Translated:
Why so downcast, my soul,
why disquieted within me?
Have hope in God;
I will yet praise Him
for His saving presence.
Transliteration: mah-tishetvochachiy nafeshiy vatehemi֢y alay hvochiliy lelohiym khiy-vod vodenu yeshuvot fanayv

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהַ֗י עָלַי֮ נַפְשִׁ֢י תִשְׁתּ֫וֹחָ֥ח עַל־כֵּ֗ן אֶ֭זְכׇּרְךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ יַרְדֵּ֑ן וְ֝חֶרְמוֹנִ֗ים מֵהַ֥ר מִצְעָֽר׃
Translated:
O my God, my soul is downcast;
therefore I think of You
in this land of Jordan and Hermon,
in Mount Mizar,
Transliteration: elohay alay nafeshi֢y tishetvochach al-khen ezekhׇrekha meerets yareden vecheremvoniym mehar mitsear

Hebrew: תְּהוֹם־אֶל־תְּה֣וֹם ק֭וֹרֵא לְק֣וֹל צִנּוֹרֶ֑יךָ כׇּֽל־מִשְׁבָּרֶ֥יךָ וְ֝גַלֶּ֗יךָ עָלַ֥י עָבָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
where deep calls to deep
in the roar of Your cataracts;
all Your breakers and billows have swept over me.
Transliteration: tehvom-el-tehvom kvore lekvol tsinvoreykha khׇl-mishevareykha vegaleykha alay avaru

Hebrew: יוֹמָ֤ם ׀ יְצַוֶּ֬ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ חַסְדּ֗וֹ וּ֭בַלַּיְלָה שִׁירֹ֣ה עִמִּ֑י תְּ֝פִלָּ֗ה לְאֵ֣ל חַיָּֽי׃
Translated:
By day may the LORD vouchsafe His faithful care,
so that at night a song to Him may be with me,
a prayer to the God of my life.
Transliteration: yvomam yetsaveh yehovah chasedvo uvalayelah shiyroh imiy tefilah leel chayay

Hebrew: אוֹמְרָ֤ה ׀ לְאֵ֥ל סַלְעִי֮ לָמָ֢ה שְׁכַ֫חְתָּ֥נִי לָֽמָּה־קֹדֵ֥ר אֵלֵ֗ךְ בְּלַ֣חַץ אוֹיֵֽב׃
Translated:
I say to God, my rock,
“Why have You forgotten me,
why must I walk in gloom,
oppressed by my enemy?”
Transliteration: vomerah leel saleiy lama֢h shekhachetaniy lamah-koder elekhe velachats voeiv

Hebrew: בְּרֶ֤צַח ׀ בְּֽעַצְמוֹתַ֗י חֵרְפ֥וּנִי צוֹרְרָ֑י בְּאׇמְרָ֥ם אֵלַ֥י כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם אַיֵּ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Crushing my bones,
my foes revile me,
taunting me always with, “Where is your God?”
Transliteration: veretsach veatsemvotay cherefuniy tsvoreray veׇmeram elay khׇl-hayyvom ayeh eloheykha

Hebrew: מַה־תִּשְׁתּ֬וֹחֲחִ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ וּֽמַה־תֶּהֱמִ֢י עָ֫לָ֥י הוֹחִ֣ילִי לֵ֭אלֹהִים כִּי־ע֣וֹד אוֹדֶ֑נּוּ יְשׁוּעֹ֥ת פָּ֝נַ֗י וֵאלֹהָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Why so downcast, my soul,
why disquieted within me?
Have hope in God;
I will yet praise Him,
my ever-present help, my God.
Transliteration: mah-tishetvochachiy nafeshiy umah-tehemi֢y alay hvochiyliy lelohiym khiy-vod vodenu yeshuot fanay velohay {f}

Hebrew: שׇׁפְטֵ֤נִי אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ וְרִ֘יבָ֤ה רִיבִ֗י מִגּ֥וֹי לֹֽא־חָסִ֑יד מֵ֤אִישׁ־מִרְמָ֖ה וְעַוְלָ֣ה תְפַלְּטֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Vindicate me, O God,
champion my cause
against faithless people;
rescue me from the treacherous, dishonest man.
Transliteration: shׇfeteniy Elohim veriyvah riyviy migvoy lo-chasiyd meiysh-miremah veavelah tefaleteniy

Hebrew: כִּי־אַתָּ֤ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י מָעוּזִּי֮ לָמָ֢ה זְנַ֫חְתָּ֥נִי לָֽמָּה־קֹדֵ֥ר אֶתְהַלֵּ֗ךְ בְּלַ֣חַץ אוֹיֵֽב׃
Translated:
For You are my God, my stronghold;
why have You rejected me?
Why must I walk in gloom,
oppressed by the enemy?
Transliteration: khiy-atah elohey mauziy lama֢h zenachetaniy lamah-koder etehalekhe velachats voeiv

Hebrew: שְׁלַח־אוֹרְךָ֣ וַ֭אֲמִתְּךָ הֵ֣מָּה יַנְח֑וּנִי יְבִיא֥וּנִי אֶל־הַֽר־קׇ֝דְשְׁךָ֗ וְאֶל־מִשְׁכְּנוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Send forth Your light and Your truth;
they will lead me;
they will bring me to Your holy mountain,
to Your dwelling-place,
Transliteration: shelach-vorekha vaamitekha hemah yanechuniy yeviyuniy el-har-kׇdeshekha veel-mishekhenvoteykha

Hebrew: וְאָב֤וֹאָה ׀ אֶל־מִזְבַּ֬ח אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֶל־אֵל֮ שִׂמְחַ֢ת גִּ֫ילִ֥י וְאוֹדְךָ֥ בְכִנּ֗וֹר אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated:
that I may come to the altar of God,
God, my delight, my joy;
that I may praise You with the lyre,
O God, my God.
Transliteration: veavvoah el-mizevach Elohim el-el shimecha֢t giyliy vevodekha vekhinvor Elohim elohay

Hebrew: מַה־תִּשְׁתּ֬וֹחֲחִ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ וּֽמַה־תֶּהֱמִ֢י עָ֫לָ֥י הוֹחִ֣ילִי לֵ֭אלֹהִים כִּי־ע֣וֹד אוֹדֶ֑נּוּ יְשׁוּעֹ֥ת פָּ֝נַ֗י וֵאלֹהָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Why so downcast, my soul,
why disquieted within me?
Have hope in God;
I will yet praise Him,
my ever-present help, my God.
Transliteration: mah-tishetvochachiy nafeshiy umah-tehemi֢y alay hvochiyliy lelohiym khiy-vod vodenu yeshuot fanay velohay {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃
Translated: For the leader. Of the Korahites. A maskil.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha <small></small> liveney-korach mashekhiyl

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ בְּאׇזְנֵ֬ינוּ שָׁמַ֗עְנוּ אֲבוֹתֵ֥ינוּ סִפְּרוּ־לָ֑נוּ פֹּ֥עַל פָּעַ֥לְתָּ בִ֝ימֵיהֶ֗ם בִּ֣ימֵי קֶֽדֶם׃
Translated:
We have heard, O God,
our fathers have told us
the deeds You performed in their time,
in days of old.
Transliteration: Elohim veׇzeneynu shamaenu avvoteynu siferu-lanu foal faaleta viymeyhem viymey kedem

Hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה ׀ יָדְךָ֡ גּוֹיִ֣ם ה֭וֹרַשְׁתָּ וַתִּטָּעֵ֑ם תָּרַ֥ע לְ֝אֻמִּ֗ים וַֽתְּשַׁלְּחֵֽם׃
Translated:
With Your hand You planted them,
displacing nations;
You brought misfortune on peoples,
and drove them out.
Transliteration: atah yadekha gvoyim hvorasheta vatitaem tara leumiym vateshalechem

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֪א בְחַרְבָּ֡ם יָ֥רְשׁוּ אָ֗רֶץ וּזְרוֹעָם֮ לֹא־הוֹשִׁ֢יעָ֫ה לָּ֥מוֹ כִּֽי־יְמִינְךָ֣ וּ֭זְרוֹעֲךָ וְא֥וֹר פָּנֶ֗יךָ כִּ֣י רְצִיתָֽם׃
Translated:
It was not by their sword that they took the land,
their arm did not give them victory,
but Your right hand, Your arm, and Your goodwill,
for You favored them.
Transliteration: khiy lo vecharevam yareshu arets uzervoam lo-hvoshi֢yah lamvo khiy-yemiynekha uzervoakha vevor faneykha khiy retsiytam

Hebrew: אַתָּה־ה֣וּא מַלְכִּ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים צַ֝וֵּ֗ה יְשׁוּע֥וֹת יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
You are my king, O God;
decree victories for Jacob!
Transliteration: atah-hu malekhiy Elohim tsaveh yeshuvot yaakov

Hebrew: בְּ֭ךָ צָרֵ֣ינוּ נְנַגֵּ֑חַ בְּ֝שִׁמְךָ֗ נָב֥וּס קָמֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Through You we gore our foes;
by Your name we trample our adversaries;
Transliteration: vekha tsareynu nenagecha veshimekha navus kameynu

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א בְקַשְׁתִּ֣י אֶבְטָ֑ח וְ֝חַרְבִּ֗י לֹ֣א תוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
I do not trust in my bow;
it is not my sword that gives me victory;
Transliteration: khiy lo vekashetiy evetach vechareviy lo tvoshiyeniy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ה֭וֹשַׁעְתָּנוּ מִצָּרֵ֑ינוּ וּמְשַׂנְאֵ֥ינוּ הֱבִישֽׁוֹתָ׃
Translated:
You give us victory over our foes;
You thwart those who hate us.
Transliteration: khiy hvoshaetanu mitsareynu umeshaneeynu heviyshvota

Hebrew: בֵּ֭אלֹהִים הִלַּ֣לְנוּ כׇל־הַיּ֑וֹם וְשִׁמְךָ֓ ׀ לְעוֹלָ֖ם נוֹדֶ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
In God we glory at all times,
and praise Your name unceasingly. Selah.
Transliteration: velohiym hilalenu khׇl-hayyvom veshimekha levolam nvodeh selah

Hebrew: אַף־זָ֭נַחְתָּ וַתַּכְלִימֵ֑נוּ וְלֹא־תֵ֝צֵ֗א בְּצִבְאוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Yet You have rejected and disgraced us;
You do not go with our armies.
Transliteration: af-zanacheta vatakheliymenu velo-tetse vetsivevoteynu

Hebrew: תְּשִׁיבֵ֣נוּ אָ֭חוֹר מִנִּי־צָ֑ר וּ֝מְשַׂנְאֵ֗ינוּ שָׁ֣סוּ לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
You make us retreat before our foe;
our enemies plunder us at will.
Transliteration: teshiyvenu achvor miniy-tsar umeshaneeynu shasu lamvo

Hebrew: תִּ֭תְּנֵנוּ כְּצֹ֣אן מַאֲכָ֑ל וּ֝בַגּוֹיִ֗ם זֵרִיתָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
You let them devour us like sheep;
You disperse us among the nations.
Transliteration: titenenu khetson maakhal uvagvoyim zeriytanu

Hebrew: תִּמְכֹּֽר־עַמְּךָ֥ בְלֹא־ה֑וֹן וְלֹֽא־רִ֝בִּ֗יתָ בִּמְחִירֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
You sell Your people for no fortune,
You set no high price on them.
Transliteration: timekhor-amekha velo-hvon velo-riviyta vimechiyreyhem

Hebrew: תְּשִׂימֵ֣נוּ חֶ֭רְפָּה לִשְׁכֵנֵ֑ינוּ לַ֥עַג וָ֝קֶ֗לֶס לִסְבִיבוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
You make us the butt of our neighbors,
the scorn and derision of those around us.
Transliteration: teshiymenu cherefah lishekheneynu laag vakeles liseviyvvoteynu

Hebrew: תְּשִׂימֵ֣נוּ מָ֭שָׁל בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם מְנֽוֹד־רֹ֝֗אשׁ בַּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
Translated:
You make us a byword among the nations,
a laughingstock among the peoples.
Transliteration: teshiymenu mashal vagvoyim menvod-rosh valeumiym

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם כְּלִמָּתִ֣י נֶגְדִּ֑י וּבֹ֖שֶׁת פָּנַ֣י כִּסָּֽתְנִי׃
Translated:
I am always aware of my disgrace;
I am wholly covered with shame
Transliteration: khׇl-hayyvom khelimatiy negediy uvoshet fanay khisateniy

Hebrew: מִ֭קּוֹל מְחָרֵ֣ף וּמְגַדֵּ֑ף מִפְּנֵ֥י א֝וֹיֵ֗ב וּמִתְנַקֵּֽם׃
Translated:
at the sound of taunting revilers,
in the presence of the vengeful foe.
Transliteration: mikvol mecharef umegadef mifeney voeiv umitenakem

Hebrew: כׇּל־זֹ֣את בָּ֭אַתְנוּ וְלֹ֣א שְׁכַחֲנ֑וּךָ וְלֹֽא־שִׁ֝קַּ֗רְנוּ בִּבְרִיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
All this has come upon us,
yet we have not forgotten You,
or been false to Your covenant.
Transliteration: khׇl-zot vaatenu velo shekhachanukha velo-shikarenu viveriytekha

Hebrew: לֹא־נָס֣וֹג אָח֣וֹר לִבֵּ֑נוּ וַתֵּ֥ט אֲ֝שֻׁרֵ֗ינוּ מִנִּ֥י אׇרְחֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Our hearts have not gone astray,
nor have our feet swerved from Your path,
Transliteration: lo-nasvog achvor livenu vatet ashureynu miniy ׇrechekha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י דִ֭כִּיתָנוּ בִּמְק֣וֹם תַּנִּ֑ים וַתְּכַ֖ס עָלֵ֣ינוּ בְצַלְמָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
though You cast us, crushed, to where the sea monster is,
and covered us over with deepest darkness.
Transliteration: khiy dikhiytanu vimekvom taniym vatekhas aleynu vetsalemavet

Hebrew: אִם־שָׁ֭כַחְנוּ שֵׁ֣ם אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַנִּפְרֹ֥שׂ כַּ֝פֵּ֗ינוּ לְאֵ֣ל זָֽר׃
Translated:
If we forgot the name of our God
and spread forth our hands to a foreign god,
Transliteration: im-shakhachenu shem eloheynu vaniferosh khafeynu leel zar

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א אֱ֭לֹהִים יַחֲקׇר־זֹ֑את כִּי־ה֥וּא יֹ֝דֵ֗עַ תַּעֲלֻמ֥וֹת לֵֽב׃
Translated:
God would surely search it out,
for He knows the secrets of the heart.
Transliteration: halo Elohim yachakׇr-zot khiy-hu yodea taalumvot lev

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עָ֭לֶיךָ הֹרַ֣גְנוּ כׇל־הַיּ֑וֹם נֶ֝חְשַׁ֗בְנוּ כְּצֹ֣אן טִבְחָֽה׃
Translated:
It is for Your sake that we are slain all day long,
that we are regarded as sheep to be slaughtered.
Transliteration: khiy-aleykha horagenu khׇl-hayyvom necheshavenu khetson tivechah

Hebrew: ע֤וּרָה ׀ לָ֖מָּה תִישַׁ֥ן ׀ אֲדֹנָ֑י הָ֝קִ֗יצָה אַל־תִּזְנַ֥ח לָנֶֽצַח׃
Translated:
Rouse Yourself; why do You sleep, O Lord?
Awaken, do not reject us forever!
Transliteration: urah lamah tiyshan adonay hakiytsah al-tizenach lanetsach

Hebrew: לָֽמָּה־פָנֶ֥יךָ תַסְתִּ֑יר תִּשְׁכַּ֖ח עׇנְיֵ֣נוּ וְֽלַחֲצֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Why do You hide Your face,
ignoring our affliction and distress?
Transliteration: lamah-faneykha tasetiyr tishekhach ׇneeinu velachatsenu

Hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁ֣חָה לֶעָפָ֣ר נַפְשֵׁ֑נוּ דָּבְקָ֖ה לָאָ֣רֶץ בִּטְנֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
We lie prostrate in the dust;
our body clings to the ground.
Transliteration: khiy shachah leafar nafeshenu davekah laarets vitenenu

Hebrew: ק֭וּמָֽה עֶזְרָ֣תָה לָּ֑נוּ וּ֝פְדֵ֗נוּ לְמַ֣עַן חַסְדֶּֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Arise and help us,
redeem us, as befits Your faithfulness.
Transliteration: kumah ezeratah lanu ufedenu lemaan chasedekha {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ עַל־שֹׁ֭שַׁנִּים לִבְנֵי־קֹ֑רַח מַ֝שְׂכִּ֗יל שִׁ֣יר יְדִידֹֽת׃
Translated: For the leader; on shoshannim. Of the Korahites. A maskil. A love song.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-shoshaniym liveney-korach mashekhiyl shiyr yediydot

Hebrew: רָ֘חַ֤שׁ לִבִּ֨י ׀ דָּ֘בָ֤ר ט֗וֹב אֹמֵ֣ר אָ֭נִי מַעֲשַׂ֣י לְמֶ֑לֶךְ לְ֝שׁוֹנִ֗י עֵ֤ט ׀ סוֹפֵ֬ר מָהִֽיר׃
Translated:
My heart is astir with gracious words;
I speak my poem to a king;
my tongue is the pen of an expert scribe.
Transliteration: rachash liviy davar tvov omer aniy maashay lemelekhe leshvoniy et svofer mahiyr

Hebrew: יׇפְיָפִ֡יתָ מִבְּנֵ֬י אָדָ֗ם ה֣וּצַק חֵ֭ן בְּשִׂפְתוֹתֶ֑יךָ עַל־כֵּ֤ן בֵּרַכְךָ֖ אֱלֹהִ֣ים לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
You are fairer than all men;
your speech is endowed with grace;
rightly has God given you an eternal blessing.
Transliteration: yׇfeyafiyta miveney adam hutsak chen veshifetvoteykha al-khen verakhekha Elohim levolam

Hebrew: חֲגֽוֹר־חַרְבְּךָ֣ עַל־יָרֵ֣ךְ גִּבּ֑וֹר ה֝וֹדְךָ֗ וַהֲדָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Gird your sword upon your thigh, O hero,
in your splendor and glory;
Transliteration: chagvor-charevekha al-yarekhe givvor hvodekha vahadarekha

Hebrew: וַהֲדָ֬רְךָ֨ ׀ צְלַ֬ח רְכַ֗ב עַֽל־דְּבַר־אֱ֭מֶת וְעַנְוָה־צֶ֑דֶק וְתוֹרְךָ֖ נוֹרָא֣וֹת יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
in your glory, win success;
ride on in the cause of truth and meekness and right;
and let your right hand lead you to awesome deeds.
Transliteration: vahadarekha tselach rekhav al-devar-emet veanevah-tsedek vetvorekha nvoravot yemiynekha

Hebrew: חִצֶּ֗יךָ שְׁנ֫וּנִ֥ים עַ֭מִּים תַּחְתֶּ֣יךָ יִפְּל֑וּ בְּ֝לֵ֗ב אוֹיְבֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated:
Your arrows, sharpened,
[pierce] the breast of the king’s enemies;
peoples fall at your feet.
Transliteration: chitseykha shenuniym amiym tacheteykha yifelu velev voyevey hamelekhe

Hebrew: כִּסְאֲךָ֣ אֱ֭לֹהִים עוֹלָ֣ם וָעֶ֑ד שֵׁ֥בֶט מִ֝ישֹׁ֗ר שֵׁ֣בֶט מַלְכוּתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Your divine throne is everlasting;
your royal scepter is a scepter of equity.
Transliteration: khiseakha Elohim volam vaed shevet miyshor shevet malekhutekha

Hebrew: אָהַ֣בְתָּ צֶּדֶק֮ וַתִּשְׂנָ֫א־רֶ֥שַׁע עַל־כֵּ֤ן ׀ מְשָׁחֲךָ֡ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֱ֭לֹהֶיךָ שֶׁ֥מֶן שָׂשׂ֗וֹן מֵחֲבֵרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
You love righteousness and hate wickedness;
rightly has God, your God, chosen to anoint you
with oil of gladness over all your peers.
Transliteration: ahaveta tsedek vatishena-resha al-khen meshachakha Elohim eloheykha shemen shashvon mechaverekha

Hebrew: מֹר־וַאֲהָל֣וֹת קְ֭צִיעוֹת כׇּל־בִּגְדֹתֶ֑יךָ מִֽן־הֵ֥יכְלֵי שֵׁ֝֗ן מִנִּ֥י שִׂמְּחֽוּךָ׃
Translated:
All your robes [are fragrant] with
myrrh and aloes and cassia;
from ivoried palaces
lutes entertain you.
Transliteration: mor-vaahalvot ketsiyvot khׇl-vigedoteykha min-heykheley shen miniy shimechukha

Hebrew: בְּנ֣וֹת מְ֭לָכִים בְּיִקְּרוֹתֶ֑יךָ נִצְּבָ֥ה שֵׁגַ֥ל לִ֝ימִינְךָ֗ בְּכֶ֣תֶם אוֹפִֽיר׃
Translated:
Royal princesses are your favorites;
the consort stands at your right hand,
decked in gold of Ophir.
Transliteration: venvot melakhiym veyikervoteykha nitsevah shegal liymiynekha vekhetem vofiyr

Hebrew: שִׁמְעִי־בַ֣ת וּ֭רְאִי וְהַטִּ֣י אׇזְנֵ֑ךְ וְשִׁכְחִ֥י עַ֝מֵּ֗ךְ וּבֵ֥ית אָבִֽיךְ׃
Translated:
Take heed, lass, and note,
incline your ear:
forget your people and your father’s house,
Transliteration: shimeiy-vat ureiy vehatiy ׇzenekhe veshikhechiy amekhe uveyt aviykhe

Hebrew: וְיִתְאָ֣ו הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ יׇפְיֵ֑ךְ כִּי־ה֥וּא אֲ֝דֹנַ֗יִךְ וְהִשְׁתַּֽחֲוִי־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
and let the king be aroused by your beauty;
since he is your lord, bow to him.
Transliteration: veyiteav hamelekhe yׇfeeikhe khiy-hu adonayiikhe vehishetachaviy-lvo

Hebrew: וּבַֽת־צֹ֨ר ׀ בְּ֭מִנְחָה פָּנַ֥יִךְ יְחַלּ֗וּ עֲשִׁ֣ירֵי עָֽם׃
Translated:
O Tyrian lass,
the wealthiest people will court your favor with gifts,
Transliteration: uvat-tsor veminechah fanayiikhe yechalu ashiyrey am

Hebrew: כׇּל־כְּבוּדָּ֣ה בַת־מֶ֣לֶךְ פְּנִ֑ימָה מִֽמִּשְׁבְּצ֖וֹת זָהָ֣ב לְבוּשָֽׁהּ׃
Translated:
goods of all sorts.

The royal princess,
her dress embroidered with golden mountings,
Transliteration: khׇl-khevudah vat-melekhe feniymah mimishevetsvot zahav levushah

Hebrew: לִרְקָמוֹת֮ תּוּבַ֢ל לַ֫מֶּ֥לֶךְ בְּתוּל֣וֹת אַ֭חֲרֶיהָ רֵעוֹתֶ֑יהָ מ֖וּבָא֣וֹת לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
is led inside to the king;
maidens in her train, her companions,
are presented to you.
Transliteration: lirekamvot tuva֢l lamelekhe vetulvot achareyha revoteyha muvavot lakhe

Hebrew: תּ֭וּבַלְנָה בִּשְׂמָחֹ֣ת וָגִ֑יל תְּ֝בֹאֶ֗ינָה בְּהֵ֣יכַל מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated:
They are led in with joy and gladness;
they enter the palace of the king.
Transliteration: tuvalenah vishemachot vagiyl tevoeynah veheykhal melekhe

Hebrew: תַּ֣חַת אֲ֭בֹתֶיךָ יִהְי֣וּ בָנֶ֑יךָ תְּשִׁיתֵ֥מוֹ לְ֝שָׂרִ֗ים בְּכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Your sons will succeed your ancestors;
you will appoint them princes throughout the land.
Transliteration: tachat avoteykha yiheyu vaneykha teshiytemvo leshariym vekhׇl-haarets

Hebrew: אַזְכִּ֣ירָה שִׁ֭מְךָ בְּכׇל־דֹּ֣ר וָדֹ֑ר עַל־כֵּ֥ן עַמִּ֥ים יְ֝הוֹד֗וּךָ לְעֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
I commemorate your fame for all generations,
so peoples will praise you forever and ever.
Transliteration: azekhiyrah shimekha vekhׇl-dor vador al-khen amiym yehvodukha leolam vaed {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ לִבְנֵי־קֹ֑רַח עַֽל־עֲלָמ֥וֹת שִֽׁיר׃
Translated:
For the leader. Of the Korahites;
on alamoth. A song.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha liveney-korach al-alamvot shiyr

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֣ים לָ֭נוּ מַחֲסֶ֣ה וָעֹ֑ז עֶזְרָ֥ה בְ֝צָר֗וֹת נִמְצָ֥א מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
God is our refuge and stronghold,
a help in trouble, very near.
Transliteration: Elohim lanu machaseh vaoz ezerah vetsarvot nimetsa meod

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֣ן לֹֽא־נִ֭ירָא בְּהָמִ֣יר אָ֑רֶץ וּבְמ֥וֹט הָ֝רִ֗ים בְּלֵ֣ב יַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
Therefore we are not afraid
though the earth reels,
though mountains topple into the sea—
Transliteration: al-khen lo-niyra vehamiyr arets uvemvot hariym velev yamiym

Hebrew: יֶהֱמ֣וּ יֶחְמְר֣וּ מֵימָ֑יו יִ֥רְעֲשֽׁוּ־הָרִ֖ים בְּגַאֲוָת֣וֹ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
its waters rage and foam;
in its swell mountains quake. Selah.
Transliteration: yehemu yechemeru meymayv yireashu-hariym vegaavatvo selah

Hebrew: נָהָ֗ר פְּלָגָ֗יו יְשַׂמְּח֥וּ עִיר־אֱלֹהִ֑ים קְ֝דֹ֗שׁ מִשְׁכְּנֵ֥י עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
There is a river whose streams gladden God’s city,
the holy dwelling-place of the Most High.
Transliteration: nahar felagayv yeshamechu iyr-Elohim kedosh mishekheney eleyvon

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֣ים בְּ֭קִרְבָּהּ בַּל־תִּמּ֑וֹט יַעְזְרֶ֥הָ אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לִפְנ֥וֹת בֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated:
God is in its midst, it will not be toppled;
by daybreak God will come to its aid.
Transliteration: Elohim vekirevah val-timvot yaezereha Elohimm lifenvot voker

Hebrew: הָמ֣וּ ג֭וֹיִם מָ֣טוּ מַמְלָכ֑וֹת נָתַ֥ן בְּ֝קוֹל֗וֹ תָּמ֥וּג אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Nations rage, kingdoms topple;
at the sound of His thunder the earth dissolves.
Transliteration: hamu gvoyim matu mamelakhvot natan vekvolvo tamug arets

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֣וֹת עִמָּ֑נוּ מִשְׂגָּֽב־לָ֨נוּ אֱלֹהֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
The LORD of hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our haven. Selah.
Transliteration: yehovah tsevavot imanu mishegav-lanu elohey yaakov selah

Hebrew: לְֽכוּ־חֲ֭זוּ מִפְעֲל֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֖ם שַׁמּ֣וֹת בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Come and see what the LORD has done,
how He has wrought desolation on the earth.
Transliteration: lekhu-chazu mifealvot yehovah asher-sham shamvot vaarets

Hebrew: מַשְׁבִּ֥ית מִלְחָמוֹת֮ עַד־קְצֵ֢ה הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ קֶ֣שֶׁת יְ֭שַׁבֵּר וְקִצֵּ֣ץ חֲנִ֑ית עֲ֝גָל֗וֹת יִשְׂרֹ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
He puts a stop to wars throughout the earth,
breaking the bow, snapping the spear,
consigning wagons to the flames.
Transliteration: masheviyt milechamvot ad-ketse֢h haarets keshet yeshaver vekitsets chaniyt agalvot yisherof vaesh

Hebrew: הַרְפּ֣וּ וּ֭דְעוּ כִּֽי־אָנֹכִ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים אָר֥וּם בַּ֝גּוֹיִ֗ם אָר֥וּם בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
“Desist! Realize that I am God!
I dominate the nations;
I dominate the earth.”
Transliteration: harefu udeu khiy-anokhiy Elohim arum vagvoyim arum vaarets

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֣וֹת עִמָּ֑נוּ מִשְׂגָּֽב־לָ֨נוּ אֱלֹהֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃ {פ}
Translated:
The LORD of hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our haven. Selah.
Transliteration: yehovah tsevavot imanu mishegav-lanu elohey yaakov selah {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מִזְמֽוֹר׃
Translated: For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha <small></small> liveney-korach mizemvor

Hebrew: כׇּֽל־הָ֭עַמִּים תִּקְעוּ־כָ֑ף הָרִ֥יעוּ לֵ֝אלֹהִ֗ים בְּק֣וֹל רִנָּֽה׃
Translated:
All you peoples, clap your hands,
raise a joyous shout for God.
Transliteration: khׇl-haamiym tikeu-khaf hariyu lelohiym vekvol rinah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֣ה עֶלְי֣וֹן נוֹרָ֑א מֶ֥לֶךְ גָּ֝ד֗וֹל עַל־כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
For the LORD Most High is awesome,
great king over all the earth;
Transliteration: khiy-yehovah eleyvon nvora melekhe gadvol al-khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: יַדְבֵּ֣ר עַמִּ֣ים תַּחְתֵּ֑ינוּ וּ֝לְאֻמִּ֗ים תַּ֣חַת רַגְלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
He subjects peoples to us,
sets nations at our feet.
Transliteration: yadever amiym tacheteynu uleumiym tachat rageleynu

Hebrew: יִבְחַר־לָ֥נוּ אֶת־נַחֲלָתֵ֑נוּ אֶ֥ת־גְּא֨וֹן יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֲשֶׁר־אָהֵ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
He chose our heritage for us,
the pride of Jacob whom He loved. Selah.
Transliteration: yivechar-lanu et-nachalatenu et-gevon yaakov asher-ahev selah

Hebrew: עָלָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים בִּתְרוּעָ֑ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בְּק֣וֹל שׁוֹפָֽר׃
Translated:
God ascends midst acclamation;
the LORD, to the blasts of the horn.
Transliteration: alah Elohim viteruah yehovah vekvol shvofar

Hebrew: זַמְּר֣וּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים זַמֵּ֑רוּ זַמְּר֖וּ לְמַלְכֵּ֣נוּ זַמֵּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Sing, O sing to God;
sing, O sing to our king;
Transliteration: zameru Elohim zameru zameru lemalekhenu zameru

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מֶ֖לֶךְ כׇּל־הָאָ֥רֶץ אֱלֹהִ֗ים זַמְּר֥וּ מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃
Translated:
for God is king over all the earth;
sing a hymn.
Transliteration: khiy melekhe khׇl-haarets Elohim zameru mashekhiyl

Hebrew: מָלַ֣ךְ אֱ֭לֹהִים עַל־גּוֹיִ֑ם אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים יָשַׁ֤ב ׀ עַל־כִּסֵּ֬א קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
God reigns over the nations;
God is seated on His holy throne.
Transliteration: malakhe Elohim al-gvoyim Elohimm yashav al-khise kׇdeshvo

Hebrew: נְדִ֘יבֵ֤י עַמִּ֨ים ׀ נֶאֱסָ֗פוּ עַם֮ אֱלֹהֵ֢י אַבְרָ֫הָ֥ם כִּ֣י לֵ֭אלֹהִים מָֽגִנֵּי־אֶ֗רֶץ מְאֹ֣ד נַעֲלָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
The great of the peoples are gathered together,
the retinue of Abraham’s God;
for the guardians of the earth belong to God;
He is greatly exalted.
Transliteration: nediyvey amiym neesafu am elohe֢y averaham khiy lelohiym maginey-erets meod naalah {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֥יר מִ֝זְמ֗וֹר לִבְנֵי־קֹֽרַח׃
Translated: A song. A psalm of the Korahites.
Transliteration: shiyr mizemvor liveney-korach

Hebrew: גָּ֘ד֤וֹל יְהֹוָ֣ה וּמְהֻלָּ֣ל מְאֹ֑ד בְּעִ֥יר אֱ֝לֹהֵ֗ינוּ הַר־קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
The LORD is great and much acclaimed
in the city of our God,
His holy mountain—
Transliteration: gadvol yehovah umehulal meod veiyr eloheynu har-kׇdeshvo

Hebrew: יְפֵ֥ה נוֹף֮ מְשׂ֢וֹשׂ כׇּל־הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ הַר־צִ֭יּוֹן יַרְכְּתֵ֣י צָפ֑וֹן קִ֝רְיַ֗ת מֶ֣לֶךְ רָֽב׃
Translated:
fair-crested, joy of all the earth,
Mount Zion, summit of Zaphon,
city of the great king.
Transliteration: yefeh nvof mesh֢vosh khׇl-haarets har-tsiyyvon yarekhetey tsafvon kireyat melekhe rav

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֥ים בְּאַרְמְנוֹתֶ֗יהָ נוֹדַ֥ע לְמִשְׂגָּֽב׃
Translated: Through its citadels, God has made Himself known as a haven.
Transliteration: Elohim vearemenvoteyha nvoda lemishegav

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֣ה הַ֭מְּלָכִים נ֥וֹעֲד֑וּ עָבְר֥וּ יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated:
See, the kings joined forces;
they advanced together.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh hamelakhiym nvoadu averu yachedav

Hebrew: הֵ֣מָּה רָ֭אוּ כֵּ֣ן תָּמָ֑הוּ נִבְהֲל֥וּ נֶחְפָּֽזוּ׃
Translated:
At the mere sight of it they were stunned,
they were terrified, they panicked;
Transliteration: hemah rau khen tamahu nivehalu nechefazu

Hebrew: רְ֭עָדָה אֲחָזָ֣תַם שָׁ֑ם חִ֝֗יל כַּיּוֹלֵדָֽה׃
Translated:
they were seized there with a trembling,
like a woman in the throes of labor,
Transliteration: readah achazatam sham chiyl khayyvoledah

Hebrew: בְּר֥וּחַ קָדִ֑ים תְּ֝שַׁבֵּ֗ר אֳנִיּ֥וֹת תַּרְשִֽׁישׁ׃
Translated:
as the Tarshish fleet was wrecked
in an easterly gale.
Transliteration: verucha kadiym teshaver oniyyvot tareshiysh

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר שָׁמַ֨עְנוּ ׀ כֵּ֤ן רָאִ֗ינוּ בְּעִיר־יְהֹוָ֣ה צְ֭בָאוֹת בְּעִ֣יר אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ אֱלֹ֘הִ֤ים יְכוֹנְנֶ֖הָ עַד־עוֹלָ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
The likes of what we heard we have now witnessed
in the city of the LORD of hosts,
in the city of our God—
may God preserve it forever! Selah.
Transliteration: khaasher shamaenu khen raiynu veiyr-yehovah tsevavot veiyr eloheynu Elohimm yekhvoneneha ad-volam selah

Hebrew: דִּמִּ֣ינוּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ בְּ֝קֶ֗רֶב הֵיכָלֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
In Your temple, God,
we meditate upon Your faithful care.
Transliteration: dimiynu Elohim chasedekha vekerev heykhalekha

Hebrew: כְּשִׁמְךָ֤ אֱלֹהִ֗ים כֵּ֣ן תְּ֭הִלָּתְךָ עַל־קַצְוֵי־אֶ֑רֶץ צֶ֝֗דֶק מָלְאָ֥ה יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
The praise of You, God, like Your name,
reaches to the ends of the earth;
Your right hand is filled with beneficence.
Transliteration: kheshimekha Elohim khen tehilatekha al-katsevey-erets tsedek maleah yemiynekha

Hebrew: יִשְׂמַ֤ח ׀ הַר־צִיּ֗וֹן תָּ֭גֵלְנָה בְּנ֣וֹת יְהוּדָ֑ה לְ֝מַ֗עַן מִשְׁפָּטֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Let Mount Zion rejoice!
Let the towns of Judah exult,
because of Your judgments.
Transliteration: yishemach har-tsiyyvon tagelenah venvot yehudah lemaan mishefateykha

Hebrew: סֹ֣בּוּ צִ֭יּוֹן וְהַקִּיפ֑וּהָ סִ֝פְר֗וּ מִגְדָּלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Walk around Zion,
circle it;
count its towers,
Transliteration: sovu tsiyyvon vehakiyfuha siferu migedaleyha

Hebrew: שִׁ֤יתוּ לִבְּכֶ֨ם ׀ לְֽחֵילָ֗הֿ פַּסְּג֥וּ אַרְמְנוֹתֶ֑יהָ לְמַ֥עַן תְּ֝סַפְּר֗וּ לְד֣וֹר אַחֲרֽוֹן׃
Translated:
take note of its ramparts;
go through its citadels,
that you may recount it to a future age.
Transliteration: shiytu livekhem lecheylahֿ fasegu aremenvoteyha lemaan tesaferu ledvor acharvon

Hebrew: כִּ֤י זֶ֨ה ׀ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֱ֭לֹהֵינוּ עוֹלָ֣ם וָעֶ֑ד ה֖וּא יְנַהֲגֵ֣נוּ עַל־מֽוּת׃ {פ}
Translated:
For God—He is our God forever;
He will lead us evermore.
Transliteration: khiy zeh Elohim eloheynu volam vaed hu yenahagenu al-mut {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מִזְמֽוֹר׃
Translated: For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha <small></small> liveney-korach mizemvor

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־זֹ֭את כׇּל־הָעַמִּ֑ים הַ֝אֲזִ֗ינוּ כׇּל־יֹ֥שְׁבֵי חָֽלֶד׃
Translated:
Hear this, all you peoples;
give ear, all inhabitants of the world,
Transliteration: shimeu-zot khׇl-haamiym haaziynu khׇl-yoshevey chaled

Hebrew: גַּם־בְּנֵ֣י אָ֭דָם גַּם־בְּנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ יַ֝֗חַד עָשִׁ֥יר וְאֶבְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
men of all estates,
rich and poor alike.
Transliteration: gam-veney adam gam-veney-iysh yachad ashiyr veeveyvon

Hebrew: פִּ֭י יְדַבֵּ֣ר חׇכְמ֑וֹת וְהָג֖וּת לִבִּ֣י תְבוּנֽוֹת׃
Translated:
My mouth utters wisdom,
my speech is full of insight.
Transliteration: fiy yedaver chׇkhemvot vehagut liviy tevunvot

Hebrew: אַטֶּ֣ה לְמָשָׁ֣ל אׇזְנִ֑י אֶפְתַּ֥ח בְּ֝כִנּ֗וֹר חִידָתִֽי׃
Translated:
I will turn my attention to a theme,
set forth my lesson to the music of a lyre.
Transliteration: ateh lemashal ׇzeniy efetach vekhinvor chiydatiy

Hebrew: לָ֣מָּה אִ֭ירָא בִּ֣ימֵי רָ֑ע עֲוֺ֖ן עֲקֵבַ֣י יְסוּבֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
In time of trouble, why should I fear
the encompassing evil of those who would supplant me—
Transliteration: lamah iyra viymey ra avon akevay yesuveniy

Hebrew: הַבֹּטְחִ֥ים עַל־חֵילָ֑ם וּבְרֹ֥ב עׇ֝שְׁרָ֗ם יִתְהַלָּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
men who trust in their riches,
who glory in their great wealth?
Transliteration: havotechiym al-cheylam uverov ׇsheram yitehalalu

Hebrew: אָ֗ח לֹא־פָדֹ֣ה יִפְדֶּ֣ה אִ֑ישׁ לֹא־יִתֵּ֖ן לֵאלֹהִ֣ים כׇּפְרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Ah, it cannot redeem a man,
or pay his ransom to God;
Transliteration: ach lo-fadoh yifedeh iysh lo-yiten lelohiym khׇfervo

Hebrew: וְ֭יֵקַר פִּדְי֥וֹן נַפְשָׁ֗ם וְחָדַ֥ל לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
the price of life is too high;
and so one ceases to be, forever.
Transliteration: veeiekar fideyvon nafesham vechadal levolam

Hebrew: וִיחִי־ע֥וֹד לָנֶ֑צַח לֹ֖א יִרְאֶ֣ה הַשָּֽׁחַת׃
Translated:
Shall he live eternally,
and never see the grave?
Transliteration: viychiy-vod lanetsach lo yireeh hashachat

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יִרְאֶ֨ה ׀ חֲכָ֘מִ֤ים יָמ֗וּתוּ יַ֤חַד כְּסִ֣יל וָבַ֣עַר יֹאבֵ֑דוּ וְעָזְב֖וּ לַאֲחֵרִ֣ים חֵילָֽם׃
Translated:
For one sees that the wise die,
that the foolish and ignorant both perish,
leaving their wealth to others.
Transliteration: khiy yireeh chakhamiym yamutu yachad khesiyl vavaar yovedu veazevu laacheriym cheylam

Hebrew: קִרְבָּ֤ם בָּתֵּ֨ימוֹ ׀ לְֽעוֹלָ֗ם מִ֭שְׁכְּנֹתָם לְד֣וֹר וָדֹ֑ר קָרְא֥וּ בִ֝שְׁמוֹתָ֗ם עֲלֵ֣י אֲדָמֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Their grave is their eternal home,
the dwelling-place for all generations
of those once famous on earth.
Transliteration: kirevam vateymvo levolam mishekhenotam ledvor vador kareu vishemvotam aley adamvot

Hebrew: וְאָדָ֣ם בִּ֭יקָר בַּל־יָלִ֑ין נִמְשַׁ֖ל כַּבְּהֵמ֣וֹת נִדְמֽוּ׃
Translated:
Man does not abide in honor;
he is like the beasts that perish.
Transliteration: veadam viykar val-yaliyn nimeshal khavehemvot nidemu

Hebrew: זֶ֣ה דַ֭רְכָּם כֵּ֣סֶל לָ֑מוֹ וְאַחֲרֵיהֶ֓ם ׀ בְּפִיהֶ֖ם יִרְצ֣וּ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Such is the fate of those who are self-confident,
the end of those pleased with their own talk. Selah.
Transliteration: zeh darekham khesel lamvo veachareyhem vefiyhem yiretsu selah

Hebrew: כַּצֹּ֤אן ׀ לִ֥שְׁא֣וֹל שַׁתּוּ֮ מָ֤וֶת יִ֫רְעֵ֥ם וַיִּרְדּ֘וּ־בָ֤ם יְשָׁרִ֨ים ׀ לַבֹּ֗קֶר (וצירם) [וְ֭צוּרָם] לְבַלּ֥וֹת שְׁא֗וֹל מִזְּבֻ֥ל לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Sheeplike they head for Sheol,
with Death as their shepherd.
The upright shall rule over them at daybreak,
and their form shall waste away in Sheol
till its nobility be gone.
Transliteration: khatson lishevol shatu mavet yireem vayiredu-vam yeshariym lavoker (vtsyrm) [vetsuram] levalvot shevol mizevul lvo

Hebrew: אַךְ־אֱלֹהִ֗ים יִפְדֶּ֣ה נַ֭פְשִׁי מִֽיַּד־שְׁא֑וֹל כִּ֖י יִקָּחֵ֣נִי סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
But God will redeem my life from the clutches of Sheol,
for He will take me. Selah.
Transliteration: akhe-Elohim yifedeh nafeshiy miyad-shevol khiy yikacheniy selah

Hebrew: אַל־תִּ֭ירָא כִּֽי־יַעֲשִׁ֣ר אִ֑ישׁ כִּי־יִ֝רְבֶּ֗ה כְּב֣וֹד בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Do not be afraid when a man becomes rich,
when his household goods increase;
Transliteration: al-tiyra khiy-yaashir iysh khiy-yireveh khevvod veytvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א בְ֭מוֹתוֹ יִקַּ֣ח הַכֹּ֑ל לֹֽא־יֵרֵ֖ד אַחֲרָ֣יו כְּבוֹדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
for when he dies he can take none of it along;
his goods cannot follow him down.
Transliteration: khiy lo vemvotvo yikach hakhol lo-eired acharayv khevvodvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־נַ֭פְשׁוֹ בְּחַיָּ֣יו יְבָרֵ֑ךְ וְ֝יוֹדֻ֗ךָ כִּי־תֵיטִ֥יב לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Though he congratulates himself in his lifetime
—“They must admit that you did well by yourself”—
Transliteration: khiy-nafeshvo vechayayv yevarekhe veyvodukha khiy-teytiyv lakhe

Hebrew: תָּ֭בוֹא עַד־דּ֣וֹר אֲבוֹתָ֑יו עַד־נֵ֝֗צַח לֹ֣א יִרְאוּ־אֽוֹר׃
Translated:
yet he must join the company of his ancestors,
who will never see daylight again.
Transliteration: tavvo ad-dvor avvotayv ad-netsach lo yireu-vor

Hebrew: אָדָ֣ם בִּ֭יקָר וְלֹ֣א יָבִ֑ין נִמְשַׁ֖ל כַּבְּהֵמ֣וֹת נִדְמֽוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Man does not understand honor;
he is like the beasts that perish.
Transliteration: adam viykar velo yaviyn nimeshal khavehemvot nidemu {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אֵ֤ל ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֡ים יְֽהֹוָ֗ה דִּבֶּ֥ר וַיִּקְרָא־אָ֑רֶץ מִמִּזְרַח־שֶׁ֝֗מֶשׁ עַד־מְבֹאֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A psalm of Asaph.

God, the LORD God spoke
and summoned the world from east to west.
Transliteration: mizemvor leasaf el Elohimm yehovah diver vayikera-arets mimizerach-shemesh ad-mevovo

Hebrew: מִצִּיּ֥וֹן מִכְלַל־יֹ֗פִי אֱלֹהִ֥ים הוֹפִֽיעַ׃
Translated:
From Zion, perfect in beauty,
God appeared
Transliteration: mitsiyyvon mikhelal-yofiy Elohim hvofiya

Hebrew: יָ֤בֹ֥א אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וְֽאַל־יֶ֫חֱרַ֥שׁ אֵשׁ־לְפָנָ֥יו תֹּאכֵ֑ל וּ֝סְבִיבָ֗יו נִשְׂעֲרָ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
—let our God come and not fail to act!
Devouring fire preceded Him;
it stormed around Him fiercely.
Transliteration: yavo eloheynu veal-yecherash esh-lefanayv tokhel useviyvayv nishearah meod

Hebrew: יִקְרָ֣א אֶל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם מֵעָ֑ל וְאֶל־הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ לָדִ֥ין עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He summoned the heavens above,
and the earth, for the trial of His people.
Transliteration: yikera el-hashamayiim meal veel-haarets ladiyn amvo

Hebrew: אִסְפוּ־לִ֥י חֲסִידָ֑י כֹּרְתֵ֖י בְרִיתִ֣י עֲלֵי־זָֽבַח׃
Translated:
“Bring in My devotees,
who made a covenant with Me over sacrifice!”
Transliteration: isefu-liy chasiyday khoretey veriytiy aley-zavach

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ שָׁמַ֣יִם צִדְק֑וֹ כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֓ים ׀ שֹׁפֵ֖ט ה֣וּא סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Then the heavens proclaimed His righteousness,
for He is a God who judges. Selah.
Transliteration: vayagiydu shamayiim tsidekvo khiy-Elohim shofet hu selah

Hebrew: שִׁמְעָ֤ה עַמִּ֨י ׀ וַאֲדַבֵּ֗רָה יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל וְאָעִ֣ידָה בָּ֑ךְ אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֱלֹהֶ֣יךָ אָנֹֽכִי׃
Translated:
“Pay heed, My people, and I will speak,
O Israel, and I will arraign you.
I am God, your God.
Transliteration: shimeah amiy vaadaverah yisherael veaiydah vakhe Elohim eloheykha anokhiy

Hebrew: לֹ֣א עַל־זְ֭בָחֶיךָ אוֹכִיחֶ֑ךָ וְעוֹלֹתֶ֖יךָ לְנֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִֽיד׃
Translated:
I censure you not for your sacrifices,
and your burnt offerings, made to Me daily;
Transliteration: lo al-zevacheykha vokhiychekha vevoloteykha lenegediy tamiyd

Hebrew: לֹא־אֶקַּ֣ח מִבֵּיתְךָ֣ פָ֑ר מִ֝מִּכְלְאֹתֶ֗יךָ עַתּוּדִֽים׃
Translated:
I claim no bull from your estate,
no he-goats from your pens.
Transliteration: lo-ekach miveytekha far mimikheleoteykha atudiym

Hebrew: כִּי־לִ֥י כׇל־חַיְתוֹ־יָ֑עַר בְּ֝הֵמ֗וֹת בְּהַרְרֵי־אָֽלֶף׃
Translated:
For Mine is every animal of the forest,
the beasts on a thousand mountains.
Transliteration: khiy-liy khׇl-chayetvo-yaar vehemvot veharerey-alef

Hebrew: יָ֭דַעְתִּי כׇּל־ע֣וֹף הָרִ֑ים וְזִ֥יז שָׂ֝דַ֗י עִמָּדִֽי׃
Translated:
I know every bird of the mountains,
the creatures of the field are subject to Me.
Transliteration: yadaetiy khׇl-vof hariym veziyz shaday imadiy

Hebrew: אִם־אֶ֭רְעַב לֹא־אֹ֣מַר לָ֑ךְ כִּי־לִ֥י תֵ֝בֵ֗ל וּמְלֹאָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Were I hungry, I would not tell you,
for Mine is the world and all it holds.
Transliteration: im-ereav lo-omar lakhe khiy-liy tevel umeloah

Hebrew: הַ֭אוֹכַל בְּשַׂ֣ר אַבִּירִ֑ים וְדַ֖ם עַתּוּדִ֣ים אֶשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Do I eat the flesh of bulls,
or drink the blood of he-goats?
Transliteration: havokhal veshar aviyriym vedam atudiym esheteh

Hebrew: זְבַ֣ח לֵאלֹהִ֣ים תּוֹדָ֑ה וְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לְעֶלְי֣וֹן נְדָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Sacrifice a thank offering to God,
and pay your vows to the Most High.
Transliteration: zevach lelohiym tvodah veshalem leeleyvon nedareykha

Hebrew: וּ֭קְרָאֵנִי בְּי֣וֹם צָרָ֑ה אֲ֝חַלֶּצְךָ֗ וּֽתְכַבְּדֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Call upon Me in time of trouble;
I will rescue you, and you shall honor Me.”
Transliteration: ukeraeniy veyvom tsarah achaletsekha utekhavedeniy

Hebrew: וְלָ֤רָשָׁ֨ע ׀ אָ֘מַ֤ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים מַה־לְּ֭ךָ לְסַפֵּ֣ר חֻקָּ֑י וַתִּשָּׂ֖א בְרִיתִ֣י עֲלֵי־פִֽיךָ׃
Translated:
And to the wicked, God said:
“Who are you to recite My laws,
and mouth the terms of My covenant,
Transliteration: velarasha amar Elohim mah-lekha lesafer chukay vatisha veriytiy aley-fiykha

Hebrew: וְ֭אַתָּה שָׂנֵ֣אתָ מוּסָ֑ר וַתַּשְׁלֵ֖ךְ דְּבָרַ֣י אַחֲרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
seeing that you spurn My discipline,
and brush My words aside?
Transliteration: veatah shaneta musar vatashelekhe devaray achareykha

Hebrew: אִם־רָאִ֣יתָ גַ֭נָּב וַתִּ֣רֶץ עִמּ֑וֹ וְעִ֖ם מְנָאֲפִ֣ים חֶלְקֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
When you see a thief, you fall in with him,
and throw in your lot with adulterers;
Transliteration: im-raiyta ganav vatirets imvo veim menaafiym chelekekha

Hebrew: פִּ֭יךָ שָׁלַ֣חְתָּ בְרָעָ֑ה וּ֝לְשׁוֹנְךָ֗ תַּצְמִ֥יד מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
you devote your mouth to evil,
and yoke your tongue to deceit;
Transliteration: fiykha shalacheta veraah uleshvonekha tatsemiyd miremah

Translated:
you are busy maligning your brother,
defaming the son of your mother.
Transliteration: teshev veachiykha tedaver veven-imekha titen-dofiy

Hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה עָשִׂ֨יתָ ׀ וְֽהֶחֱרַ֗שְׁתִּי דִּמִּ֗יתָ הֱיֽוֹת־אֶהְיֶ֥ה כָמ֑וֹךָ אוֹכִיחֲךָ֖ וְאֶעֶרְכָ֣ה לְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
If I failed to act when you did these things,
you would fancy that I was like you;
so I censure you and confront you with charges.
Transliteration: eleh ashiyta vehecherashetiy dimiyta heyvot-eheyeh khamvokha vokhiychakha veeerekhah leeyneykha

Hebrew: בִּינוּ־נָ֣א זֹ֭את שֹׁכְחֵ֣י אֱל֑וֹהַּ פֶּן־אֶ֝טְרֹ֗ף וְאֵ֣ין מַצִּֽיל׃
Translated:
Mark this, you who are unmindful of God,
lest I tear you apart and no one save you.
Transliteration: viynu-na zot shokhechey elvoha fen-eterof veeyn matsiyl

Hebrew: זֹבֵ֥חַ תּוֹדָ֗ה יְֽכַ֫בְּדָ֥נְנִי וְשָׂ֥ם דֶּ֑רֶךְ אַ֝רְאֶ֗נּוּ בְּיֵ֣שַׁע אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
He who sacrifices a thank offering honors Me,
and to him who improves his way
I will show the salvation of God.”
Transliteration: zovecha tvodah yekhavedaneniy vesham derekhe areenu veeisha Elohim {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David,
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: בְּֽבוֹא־אֵ֭לָיו נָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֑יא כַּאֲשֶׁר־בָּ֝֗א אֶל־בַּת־שָֽׁבַע׃
Translated: when Nathan the prophet came to him after he had come to Bathsheba.
Transliteration: vevvo-elayv natan hanaviy khaasher-va el-vat-shava

Hebrew: חׇנֵּ֣נִי אֱלֹהִ֣ים כְּחַסְדֶּ֑ךָ כְּרֹ֥ב רַ֝חֲמֶ֗יךָ מְחֵ֣ה פְשָׁעָֽי׃
Translated:
Have mercy upon me, O God,
as befits Your faithfulness;
in keeping with Your abundant compassion,
blot out my transgressions.
Transliteration: chׇneniy Elohim khechasedekha kherov rachameykha mecheh feshaay

Hebrew: (הרבה) [הֶ֭רֶב] כַּבְּסֵ֣נִי מֵעֲוֺנִ֑י וּֽמֵחַטָּאתִ֥י טַהֲרֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Wash me thoroughly of my iniquity,
and purify me of my sin;
Transliteration: (hrvh) [herev] khaveseniy meavoniy umechatatiy tahareniy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־פְ֭שָׁעַי אֲנִ֣י אֵדָ֑ע וְחַטָּאתִ֖י נֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִֽיד׃
Translated:
for I recognize my transgressions,
and am ever conscious of my sin.
Transliteration: khiy-feshaay aniy eda vechatatiy negediy tamiyd

Hebrew: לְךָ֤ לְבַדְּךָ֨ ׀ חָטָאתִי֮ וְהָרַ֥ע בְּעֵינֶ֗יךָ עָ֫שִׂ֥יתִי לְ֭מַעַן תִּצְדַּ֥ק בְּדׇבְרֶ֗ךָ תִּזְכֶּ֥ה בְשׇׁפְטֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Against You alone have I sinned,
and done what is evil in Your sight;
so You are just in Your sentence,
and right in Your judgment.
Transliteration: lekha levadekha chatatiy vehara veeyneykha ashiytiy lemaan titsedak vedׇverekha tizekheh veshׇfetekha

Hebrew: הֵן־בְּעָו֥וֹן חוֹלָ֑לְתִּי וּ֝בְחֵ֗טְא יֶחֱמַ֥תְנִי אִמִּֽי׃
Translated:
Indeed I was born with iniquity;
with sin my mother conceived me.
Transliteration: hen-veavvon chvolaletiy uvechete yechemateniy imiy

Hebrew: הֵן־אֱ֭מֶת חָפַ֣צְתָּ בַטֻּח֑וֹת וּ֝בְסָתֻ֗ם חׇכְמָ֥ה תוֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Indeed You desire truth about that which is hidden;
teach me wisdom about secret things.
Transliteration: hen-emet chafatseta vatuchvot uvesatum chׇkhemah tvodiyeniy

Hebrew: תְּחַטְּאֵ֣נִי בְאֵז֣וֹב וְאֶטְהָ֑ר תְּ֝כַבְּסֵ֗נִי וּמִשֶּׁ֥לֶג אַלְבִּֽין׃
Translated:
Purge me with hyssop till I am pure;
wash me till I am whiter than snow.
Transliteration: techateeniy veezvov veetehar tekhaveseniy umisheleg aleviyn

Hebrew: תַּ֭שְׁמִיעֵנִי שָׂשׂ֣וֹן וְשִׂמְחָ֑ה תָּ֝גֵ֗לְנָה עֲצָמ֥וֹת דִּכִּֽיתָ׃
Translated:
Let me hear tidings of joy and gladness;
let the bones You have crushed exult.
Transliteration: tashemiyeniy shashvon veshimechah tagelenah atsamvot dikhiyta

Hebrew: הַסְתֵּ֣ר פָּ֭נֶיךָ מֵחֲטָאָ֑י וְֽכׇל־עֲוֺ֖נֹתַ֣י מְחֵֽה׃
Translated:
Hide Your face from my sins;
blot out all my iniquities.
Transliteration: haseter faneykha mechataay vekhׇl-avonotay mecheh

Hebrew: לֵ֣ב טָ֭הוֹר בְּרָא־לִ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְר֥וּחַ נָ֝כ֗וֹן חַדֵּ֥שׁ בְּקִרְבִּֽי׃
Translated:
Fashion a pure heart for me, O God;
create in me a steadfast spirit.
Transliteration: lev tahvor vera-liy Elohim verucha nakhvon chadesh vekireviy

Hebrew: אַל־תַּשְׁלִיכֵ֥נִי מִלְּפָנֶ֑יךָ וְר֥וּחַ קׇ֝דְשְׁךָ֗ אַל־תִּקַּ֥ח מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
Do not cast me out of Your presence,
or take Your holy spirit away from me.
Transliteration: al-tasheliykheniy milefaneykha verucha kׇdeshekha al-tikach mimeniy

Hebrew: הָשִׁ֣יבָה לִּ֭י שְׂשׂ֣וֹן יִשְׁעֶ֑ךָ וְר֖וּחַ נְדִיבָ֣ה תִסְמְכֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Let me again rejoice in Your help;
let a vigorous spirit sustain me.
Transliteration: hashiyvah liy sheshvon yisheekha verucha nediyvah tisemekheniy

Hebrew: אֲלַמְּדָ֣ה פֹשְׁעִ֣ים דְּרָכֶ֑יךָ וְ֝חַטָּאִ֗ים אֵלֶ֥יךָ יָשֽׁוּבוּ׃
Translated:
I will teach transgressors Your ways,
that sinners may return to You.
Transliteration: alamedah fosheiym derakheykha vechataiym eleykha yashuvu

Hebrew: הַצִּ֘ילֵ֤נִי מִדָּמִ֨ים ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים אֱלֹהֵ֥י תְשׁוּעָתִ֑י תְּרַנֵּ֥ן לְ֝שׁוֹנִ֗י צִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Save me from bloodguilt,
O God, God, my deliverer,
that I may sing forth Your beneficence.
Transliteration: hatsiyleniy midamiym Elohimm elohey teshuatiy teranen leshvoniy tsidekatekha

Hebrew: אֲ֭דֹנָי שְׂפָתַ֣י תִּפְתָּ֑ח וּ֝פִ֗י יַגִּ֥יד תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
O Lord, open my lips,
and let my mouth declare Your praise.
Transliteration: adonay shefatay tifetach ufiy yagiyd tehilatekha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־תַחְפֹּ֣ץ זֶ֣בַח וְאֶתֵּ֑נָה ע֝וֹלָ֗ה לֹ֣א תִרְצֶֽה׃
Translated:
You do not want me to bring sacrifices;
You do not desire burnt offerings;
Transliteration: khiy lo-tachefots zevach veetenah volah lo tiretseh

Hebrew: זִ֥בְחֵ֣י אֱלֹהִים֮ ר֤וּחַ נִשְׁבָּ֫רָ֥ה לֵב־נִשְׁבָּ֥ר וְנִדְכֶּ֑ה אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לֹ֣א תִבְזֶֽה׃
Translated:
True sacrifice to God is a contrite spirit;
God, You will not despise
a contrite and crushed heart.
Transliteration: zivechey Elohim rucha nishevarah lev-nishevar venidekheh Elohimm lo tivezeh

Hebrew: הֵיטִ֣יבָה בִ֭רְצוֹנְךָ אֶת־צִיּ֑וֹן תִּ֝בְנֶ֗ה חוֹמ֥וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
May it please You to make Zion prosper;
rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: heytiyvah viretsvonekha et-tsiyyvon tiveneh chvomvot yerushala͏im

Hebrew: אָ֤ז תַּחְפֹּ֣ץ זִבְחֵי־צֶ֭דֶק עוֹלָ֣ה וְכָלִ֑יל אָ֤ז יַעֲל֖וּ עַל־מִזְבַּחֲךָ֣ פָרִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
Then You will want sacrifices offered in righteousness,
burnt and whole offerings;
then bulls will be offered on Your altar.
Transliteration: az tachefots zivechey-tsedek volah vekhaliyl az yaalu al-mizevachakha fariym {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. A maskil of David,
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mashekhiyl ledavid

Hebrew: בְּב֤וֹא ׀ דּוֹאֵ֣ג הָאֲדֹמִי֮ וַיַּגֵּ֢ד לְשָׁ֫א֥וּל וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֑וֹ בָּ֥א דָ֝וִ֗ד אֶל־בֵּ֥ית אֲחִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: when Doeg the Edomite came and informed Saul, telling him, “David came to Ahimelech’s house.”
Transliteration: vevvo dvoeg haadomiy vayage֢d leshaul vayomer lvo va david el-veyt achiymelekhe

Hebrew: מַה־תִּתְהַלֵּ֣ל בְּ֭רָעָה הַגִּבּ֑וֹר חֶ֥סֶד אֵ֝֗ל כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Why do you boast of your evil, brave fellow?
God’s faithfulness never ceases.
Transliteration: mah-titehalel veraah hagivvor chesed el khׇl-hayyvom

Hebrew: הַ֭וּוֹת תַּחְשֹׁ֣ב לְשׁוֹנֶ֑ךָ כְּתַ֥עַר מְ֝לֻטָּ֗שׁ עֹשֵׂ֥ה רְמִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
Your tongue devises mischief,
like a sharpened razor that works treacherously.
Transliteration: hauvot tacheshov leshvonekha khetaar melutash osheh remiyah

Hebrew: אָהַ֣בְתָּ רָּ֣ע מִטּ֑וֹב שֶׁ֓קֶר ׀ מִדַּבֵּ֖ר צֶ֣דֶק סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
You prefer evil to good,
the lie, to speaking truthfully. Selah.
Transliteration: ahaveta ra mitvov sheker midaver tsedek selah

Hebrew: אָהַ֥בְתָּ כׇֽל־דִּבְרֵי־בָ֗לַע לְשׁ֣וֹן מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
You love all pernicious words,
treacherous speech.
Transliteration: ahaveta khׇl-diverey-vala leshvon miremah

Hebrew: גַּם־אֵל֮ יִתׇּצְךָ֢ לָ֫נֶ֥צַח יַחְתְּךָ֣ וְיִסָּחֲךָ֣ מֵאֹ֑הֶל וְשֵׁרֶשְׁךָ֨ מֵאֶ֖רֶץ חַיִּ֣ים סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
So God will tear you down for good,
will break you and pluck you from your tent,
and root you out of the land of the living. Selah.
Transliteration: gam-el yitׇtsekha֢ lanetsach yachetekha veyisachakha meohel veshereshekha meerets chayiym selah

Hebrew: וְיִרְא֖וּ צַדִּיקִ֥ים וְיִירָ֗אוּ וְעָלָ֥יו יִשְׂחָֽקוּ׃
Translated:
The righteous, seeing it, will be awestruck;
they will jibe at him, saying,
Transliteration: veyireu tsadiykiym veyiyrau vealayv yishechaku

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה הַגֶּ֗בֶר לֹ֤א יָשִׂ֥ים אֱלֹהִ֗ים מָ֫עוּזּ֥וֹ וַ֭יִּבְטַח בְּרֹ֣ב עׇשְׁר֑וֹ יָ֝עֹ֗ז בְּהַוָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
“Here was a fellow who did not make God his refuge,
but trusted in his great wealth,
relied upon his mischief.”
Transliteration: hineh hagever lo yashiym Elohim mauzvo vayivetach verov ׇshervo yaoz vehavatvo

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ כְּזַ֣יִת רַ֭עֲנָן בְּבֵ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים בָּטַ֥חְתִּי בְחֶסֶד־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים עוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
Translated:
But I am like a thriving olive tree in God’s house;
I trust in the faithfulness of God forever and ever.
Transliteration: vaaniy khezayiit raanan veveyt Elohim vatachetiy vechesed-Elohimm volam vaed

Hebrew: אוֹדְךָ֣ לְ֭עוֹלָם כִּ֣י עָשִׂ֑יתָ וַאֲקַוֶּ֥ה שִׁמְךָ֥ כִי־ט֝֗וֹב נֶ֣גֶד חֲסִידֶֽיךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
I praise You forever, for You have acted;
I declare that Your name is good
in the presence of Your faithful ones.
Transliteration: vodekha levolam khiy ashiyta vaakaveh shimekha khiy-tvov neged chasiydeykha {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־מָחֲלַ֗ת מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; on mahalath. A maskil of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-machalat mashekhiyl ledavid

Hebrew: אָ֘מַ֤ר נָבָ֣ל בְּ֭לִבּוֹ אֵ֣ין אֱלֹהִ֑ים הִֽ֝שְׁחִ֗יתוּ וְהִֽתְעִ֥יבוּ עָ֝֗וֶל אֵ֣ין עֹֽשֵׂה־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
The benighted man thinks,
“God does not care.”
Man’s wrongdoing is corrupt and loathsome;
no one does good.
Transliteration: amar naval velivvo eyn Elohim hishechiytu vehiteiyvu avel eyn osheh-tvov

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים מִשָּׁמַיִם֮ הִשְׁקִ֢יף עַֽל־בְּנֵי־אָ֫דָ֥ם לִ֭רְאוֹת הֲיֵ֣שׁ מַשְׂכִּ֑יל דֹּ֝רֵ֗שׁ אֶת־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
God looks down from heaven on mankind
to find a man of understanding,
a man mindful of God.
Transliteration: Elohimm mishamayim hisheki֢yf al-veney-adam lirevot haeish mashekhiyl doresh et-Elohim

Hebrew: כֻּלּ֥וֹ סָג֮ יַחְדָּ֢ו נֶ֫אֱלָ֥חוּ אֵ֤ין עֹֽשֵׂה־ט֑וֹב אֵ֝֗ין גַּם־אֶחָֽד׃
Translated:
Everyone is dross,
altogether foul;
there is none who does good,
not even one.
Transliteration: khulvo sag yacheda֢v neelachu eyn osheh-tvov eyn gam-echad

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֥א יָדְעוּ֮ פֹּ֤עֲלֵ֫י אָ֥וֶן אֹכְלֵ֣י עַ֭מִּי אָ֣כְלוּ לֶ֑חֶם אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לֹ֣א קָרָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
Are they so witless, those evildoers,
who devour my people as they devour food,
and do not invoke God?
Transliteration: halo yadeu foaley aven okheley amiy akhelu lechem Elohimm lo karau

Hebrew: שָׁ֤ם ׀ פָּ֥חֲדוּ פַחַד֮ לֹא־הָ֢יָ֫ה פָ֥חַד כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֗ים פִּ֭זַּר עַצְמ֣וֹת חֹנָ֑ךְ הֱ֝בִשֹׁ֗תָה כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים מְאָסָֽם׃
Translated:
There they will be seized with fright
—never was there such a fright—
for God has scattered the bones of your besiegers;
you have put them to shame,
for God has rejected them.
Transliteration: sham fachadu fachad lo-ha֢yah fachad khiy-Elohim fizar atsemvot chonakhe hevishotah khiy-Elohim measam

Hebrew: מִ֥י־יִתֵּ֣ן מִצִּיּוֹן֮ יְשֻׁע֢וֹת יִשְׂרָ֫אֵ֥ל בְּשׁ֣וּב אֱ֭לֹהִים שְׁב֣וּת עַמּ֑וֹ יָגֵ֥ל יַ֝עֲקֹ֗ב יִשְׂמַ֥ח יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
O that the deliverance of Israel might come from Zion!
When God restores the fortunes of His people,
Jacob will exult, Israel will rejoice.
Transliteration: miy-yiten mitsiyyvon yeshu֢vot yisherael veshuv Elohim shevut amvo yagel yaakov yishemach yisherael {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֗ת מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; with instrumental music. A maskil of David,
Transliteration: lamenatsecha vinegiynot mashekhiyl ledavid

Hebrew: בְּבֹ֣א הַ֭זִּיפִים וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לְשָׁא֑וּל הֲלֹ֥א דָ֝וִ֗ד מִסְתַּתֵּ֥ר עִמָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: when the Ziphites came and told Saul, “Know, David is in hiding among us.”
Transliteration: vevo haziyfiym vayomeru leshaul halo david misetater imanu

Hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים בְּשִׁמְךָ֣ הוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי וּבִגְבוּרָתְךָ֥ תְדִינֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
O God, deliver me by Your name;
by Your power vindicate me.
Transliteration: Elohim veshimekha hvoshiyeniy uvigevuratekha tediyneniy

Hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים שְׁמַ֣ע תְּפִלָּתִ֑י הַ֝אֲזִ֗ינָה לְאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
Translated:
O God, hear my prayer;
give ear to the words of my mouth.
Transliteration: Elohim shema tefilatiy haaziynah leimerey-fiy

Hebrew: כִּ֤י זָרִ֨ים ׀ קָ֤מוּ עָלַ֗י וְֽ֭עָרִיצִים בִּקְשׁ֣וּ נַפְשִׁ֑י לֹ֤א שָׂ֨מוּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְנֶגְדָּ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
For strangers have risen against me,
and ruthless men seek my life;
they are unmindful of God. Selah.
Transliteration: khiy zariym kamu alay veariytsiym vikeshu nafeshiy lo shamu Elohim lenegedam selah

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים עֹזֵ֣ר לִ֑י אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י בְּֽסֹמְכֵ֥י נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
See, God is my helper;
the Lord is my support.
Transliteration: hineh Elohim ozer liy adonay vesomekhey nafeshiy

Hebrew: (ישוב) [יָשִׁ֣יב] הָ֭רַע לְשֹׁרְרָ֑י בַּ֝אֲמִתְּךָ֗ הַצְמִיתֵֽם׃
Translated:
He will repay the evil of my watchful foes;
by Your faithfulness, destroy them!
Transliteration: (yshvv) [yashiyv] hara leshoreray vaamitekha hatsemiytem

Hebrew: בִּנְדָבָ֥ה אֶזְבְּחָה־לָּ֑ךְ א֤וֹדֶה־שִּׁמְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Then I will offer You a freewill sacrifice;
I will praise Your name, LORD, for it is good,
Transliteration: vinedavah ezevechah-lakhe vodeh-shimekha yehovah khiy-tvov

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מִכׇּל־צָ֭רָה הִצִּילָ֑נִי וּ֝בְאֹיְבַ֗י רָאֲתָ֥ה עֵינִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
for it has saved me from my foes,
and let me gaze triumphant upon my enemies.
Transliteration: khiy mikhׇl-tsarah hitsiylaniy uveoyevay raatah eyniy {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֗ת מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; with instrumental music. A maskil of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha vinegiynot mashekhiyl ledavid

Hebrew: הַאֲזִ֣ינָה אֱ֭לֹהִים תְּפִלָּתִ֑י וְאַל־תִּ֝תְעַלַּ֗ם מִתְּחִנָּתִֽי׃
Translated:
Give ear, O God, to my prayer;
do not ignore my plea;
Transliteration: haaziynah Elohim tefilatiy veal-titealam mitechinatiy

Hebrew: הַקְשִׁ֣יבָה לִּ֣י וַעֲנֵ֑נִי אָרִ֖יד בְּשִׂיחִ֣י וְאָהִֽימָה׃
Translated:
pay heed to me and answer me.
I am tossed about, complaining and moaning
Transliteration: hakeshiyvah liy vaaneniy ariyd veshiychiy veahiymah

Hebrew: מִקּ֤וֹל אוֹיֵ֗ב מִ֭פְּנֵי עָקַ֣ת רָשָׁ֑ע כִּֽי־יָמִ֥יטוּ עָלַ֥י אָ֝֗וֶן וּבְאַ֥ף יִשְׂטְמֽוּנִי׃
Translated:
at the clamor of the enemy,
because of the oppression of the wicked;
for they bring evil upon me
and furiously harass me.
Transliteration: mikvol voeiv mifeney akat rasha khiy-yamiytu alay aven uveaf yishetemuniy

Hebrew: לִ֭בִּי יָחִ֣יל בְּקִרְבִּ֑י וְאֵימ֥וֹת מָ֝֗וֶת נָפְל֥וּ עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
My heart is convulsed within me;
terrors of death assail me.
Transliteration: liviy yachiyl vekireviy veeymvot mavet nafelu alay

Hebrew: יִרְאָ֣ה וָ֭רַעַד יָ֣בֹא בִ֑י וַ֝תְּכַסֵּ֗נִי פַּלָּצֽוּת׃
Translated:
Fear and trembling invade me;
I am clothed with horror.
Transliteration: yireah varaad yavo viy vatekhaseniy falatsut

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר מִֽי־יִתֶּן־לִ֣י אֵ֭בֶר כַּיּוֹנָ֗ה אָע֥וּפָה וְאֶשְׁכֹּֽנָה׃
Translated:
I said,
“O that I had the wings of a dove!
I would fly away and find rest;
Transliteration: vaomar miy-yiten-liy ever khayyvonah aufah veeshekhonah

Hebrew: הִ֭נֵּה אַרְחִ֣יק נְדֹ֑ד אָלִ֖ין בַּמִּדְבָּ֣ר סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
surely, I would flee far off;
I would lodge in the wilderness; selah
Transliteration: hineh arechiyk nedod aliyn vamidevar selah

Hebrew: אָחִ֣ישָׁה מִפְלָ֣ט לִ֑י מֵר֖וּחַ סֹעָ֣ה מִסָּֽעַר׃
Translated:
I would soon find me a refuge
from the sweeping wind,
from the tempest.”
Transliteration: achiyshah mifelat liy merucha soah misaar

Hebrew: בַּלַּ֣ע אֲ֭דֹנָי פַּלַּ֣ג לְשׁוֹנָ֑ם כִּֽי־רָאִ֨יתִי חָמָ֖ס וְרִ֣יב בָּעִֽיר׃
Translated:
O Lord, confound their speech, confuse it!
For I see lawlessness and strife in the city;
Transliteration: vala adonay falag leshvonam khiy-raiytiy chamas veriyv vaiyr

Hebrew: יוֹמָ֤ם וָלַ֗יְלָה יְסוֹבְבֻ֥הָ עַל־חוֹמֹתֶ֑יהָ וְאָ֖וֶן וְעָמָ֣ל בְּקִרְבָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
day and night they make their rounds on its walls;
evil and mischief are inside it.
Transliteration: yvomam valayelah yesvovevuha al-chvomoteyha veaven veamal vekirevah

Hebrew: הַוּ֥וֹת בְּקִרְבָּ֑הּ וְֽלֹא־יָמִ֥ישׁ מֵ֝רְחֹבָ֗הּ תֹּ֣ךְ וּמִרְמָֽה׃
Translated:
Malice is within it;
fraud and deceit never leave its square.
Transliteration: hauvot vekirevah velo-yamiysh merechovah tokhe umiremah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹֽא־אוֹיֵ֥ב יְחָֽרְפֵ֗נִי וְאֶ֫שָּׂ֥א לֹא־מְ֭שַׂנְאִי עָלַ֣י הִגְדִּ֑יל וְאֶסָּתֵ֥ר מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
It is not an enemy who reviles me
—I could bear that;
it is not my foe who vaunts himself against me
—I could hide from him;
Transliteration: khiy lo-voeiv yecharefeniy veesha lo-meshaneiy alay higediyl veesater mimenu

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה אֱנ֣וֹשׁ כְּעֶרְכִּ֑י אַ֝לּוּפִ֗י וּמְיֻדָּעִֽי׃
Translated:
but it is you, my equal,
my companion, my friend;
Transliteration: veatah envosh kheerekhiy alufiy umeyudaiy

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַ֭חְדָּו נַמְתִּ֣יק ס֑וֹד בְּבֵ֥ית אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים נְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בְּרָֽגֶשׁ׃
Translated:
sweet was our fellowship;
we walked together in God’s house.
Transliteration: asher yachedav nametiyk svod veveyt Elohimm nehalekhe veragesh

Hebrew: (ישימות) [יַשִּׁ֤י מָ֨וֶת ׀] עָלֵ֗ימוֹ יֵרְד֣וּ שְׁא֣וֹל חַיִּ֑ים כִּֽי־רָע֖וֹת בִּמְגוּרָ֣ם בְּקִרְבָּֽם׃
Translated:
Let Him incite death against them;
may they go down alive into Sheol!
For where they dwell,
there evil is.
Transliteration: (yshymvt) [yashiy mavet ] aleymvo eiredu shevol chayiym khiy-ravot vimeguram vekirevam

Hebrew: אֲ֭נִי אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֶקְרָ֑א וַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה יוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
As for me, I call to God;
the LORD will deliver me.
Transliteration: aniy el-Elohim ekera vayhovah yvoshiyeniy

Hebrew: עֶ֤רֶב וָבֹ֣קֶר וְ֭צׇהֳרַיִם אָשִׂ֣יחָה וְאֶהֱמֶ֑ה וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע קוֹלִֽי׃
Translated:
Evening, morning, and noon,
I complain and moan,
and He hears my voice.
Transliteration: erev vavoker vetsׇhorayim ashiychah veehemeh vayishema kvoliy

Hebrew: פָּ֘דָ֤ה בְשָׁל֣וֹם נַ֭פְשִׁי מִקְּרׇב־לִ֑י כִּֽי־בְ֝רַבִּ֗ים הָי֥וּ עִמָּדִֽי׃
Translated:
He redeems me unharmed
from the battle against me;
it is as though many are on my side.
Transliteration: fadah veshalvom nafeshiy mikerׇv-liy khiy-veraviym hayu imadiy

Hebrew: יִשְׁמַ֤ע ׀ אֵ֨ל ׀ וְֽיַעֲנֵם֮ וְיֹ֤שֵׁ֥ב קֶ֗דֶם סֶ֥֫לָה אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֵ֣ין חֲלִיפ֣וֹת לָ֑מוֹ וְלֹ֖א יָרְא֣וּ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
God who has reigned from the first,
who will have no successor,
hears and humbles those who have no fear of God. Selah.
Transliteration: yishema el veyaanem veyoshev kedem selah asher eyn chaliyfvot lamvo velo yareu Elohim

Hebrew: שָׁלַ֣ח יָ֭דָיו בִּשְׁלֹמָ֗יו חִלֵּ֥ל בְּרִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He harmed his ally,
he broke his pact;
Transliteration: shalach yadayv vishelomayv chilel veriytvo

Hebrew: חָלְק֤וּ ׀ מַחְמָאֹ֣ת פִּיו֮ וּֽקְרָב־לִ֫בּ֥וֹ רַכּ֖וּ דְבָרָ֥יו מִשֶּׁ֗מֶן וְהֵ֣מָּה פְתִחֽוֹת׃
Translated:
his talk was smoother than butter,
yet his mind was on war;
his words were more soothing than oil,
yet they were drawn swords.
Transliteration: chaleku machemaot fiyv ukerav-livvo rakhu devarayv mishemen vehemah fetichvot

Hebrew: הַשְׁלֵ֤ךְ עַל־יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ יְהָבְךָ֮ וְה֢וּא יְכַ֫לְכְּלֶ֥ךָ לֹא־יִתֵּ֖ן לְעוֹלָ֥ם מ֗וֹט לַצַּדִּֽיק׃
Translated:
Cast your burden on the LORD and He will sustain you;
He will never let the righteous man collapse.
Transliteration: hashelekhe al-yehovah yehavekha vehu yekhalekhelekha lo-yiten levolam mvot latsadiyk

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ תּוֹרִדֵ֬ם ׀ לִבְאֵ֬ר שַׁ֗חַת אַנְשֵׁ֤י דָמִ֣ים וּ֭מִרְמָה לֹא־יֶחֱצ֣וּ יְמֵיהֶ֑ם וַ֝אֲנִ֗י אֶבְטַח־בָּֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
For You, O God, will bring them down to the nethermost Pit—
those murderous, treacherous men;
they shall not live out half their days;
but I trust in You.
Transliteration: veatah Elohim tvoridem liveer shachat aneshey damiym umiremah lo-yechetsu yemeyhem vaaniy evetach-vakhe {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֤חַ ׀ עַל־י֬וֹנַת אֵ֣לֶם רְ֭חֹקִים לְדָוִ֣ד מִכְתָּ֑ם בֶּאֱחֹ֨ז אוֹת֖וֹ פְלִשְׁתִּ֣ים בְּגַֽת׃
Translated: For the leader; on yonath elem reḥokim. Of David. A michtam; when the Philistines seized him in Gath.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-yvonat elem rechokiym ledavid mikhetam veechoz votvo felishetiym vegat

Hebrew: חׇנֵּ֣נִי אֱ֭לֹהִים כִּֽי־שְׁאָפַ֣נִי אֱנ֑וֹשׁ כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם לֹחֵ֥ם יִלְחָצֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Have mercy on me, O God,
for men persecute me;
all day long my adversary oppresses me.
Transliteration: chׇneniy Elohim khiy-sheafaniy envosh khׇl-hayyvom lochem yilechatseniy

Hebrew: שָׁאֲפ֣וּ שׁ֭וֹרְרַי כׇּל־הַיּ֑וֹם כִּֽי־רַבִּ֨ים לֹחֲמִ֖ים לִ֣י מָרֽוֹם׃
Translated:
My watchful foes persecute me all day long;
many are my adversaries, O Exalted One.
Transliteration: shaafu shvoreray khׇl-hayyvom khiy-raviym lochamiym liy marvom

Hebrew: י֥וֹם אִירָ֑א אֲ֝נִ֗י אֵלֶ֥יךָ אֶבְטָֽח׃
Translated: When I am afraid, I trust in You,
Transliteration: yvom iyra aniy eleykha evetach

Hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִים֮ אֲהַלֵּ֢ל דְּבָ֫ר֥וֹ בֵּאלֹהִ֣ים בָּ֭טַחְתִּי לֹ֣א אִירָ֑א מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בָשָׂ֣ר לִֽי׃
Translated:
in God, whose word I praise,
in God I trust;
I am not afraid;
what can mortals do to me?
Transliteration: velohiym ahale֢l devarvo velohiym vatachetiy lo iyra mah-yaasheh vashar liy

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם דְּבָרַ֣י יְעַצֵּ֑בוּ עָלַ֖י כׇּל־מַחְשְׁבֹתָ֣ם לָרָֽע׃
Translated:
All day long they cause me grief in my affairs,
they plan only evil against me.
Transliteration: khׇl-hayyvom devaray yeatsevu alay khׇl-macheshevotam lara

Hebrew: יָג֤וּרוּ ׀ (יצפינו) [יִצְפּ֗וֹנוּ] הֵ֭מָּה עֲקֵבַ֣י יִשְׁמֹ֑רוּ כַּ֝אֲשֶׁ֗ר קִוּ֥וּ נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
They plot, they lie in ambush;
they watch my every move, hoping for my death.
Transliteration: yaguru (ytsfynv) [yitsefvonu] hemah akevay yishemoru khaasher kiuu nafeshiy

Hebrew: עַל־אָ֥וֶן פַּלֶּט־לָ֑מוֹ בְּ֝אַ֗ף עַמִּ֤ים ׀ הוֹרֵ֬ד אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
Cast them out for their evil;
subdue peoples in Your anger, O God.
Transliteration: al-aven falet-lamvo veaf amiym hvored Elohim

Hebrew: נֹדִי֮ סָפַ֢רְתָּ֫ה אָ֥תָּה שִׂ֣ימָה דִמְעָתִ֣י בְנֹאדֶ֑ךָ הֲ֝לֹ֗א בְּסִפְרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
You keep count of my wanderings;
put my tears into Your flask,
into Your record.
Transliteration: nodiy safa֢retah atah shiymah dimeatiy venodekha halo vesiferatekha

Hebrew: אָ֨ז יָ֘שׁ֤וּבוּ אוֹיְבַ֣י אָ֭חוֹר בְּי֣וֹם אֶקְרָ֑א זֶֽה־יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים לִֽי׃
Translated:
Then my enemies will retreat when I call on You;
this I know, that God is for me.
Transliteration: az yashuvu voyevay achvor veyvom ekera zeh-yadaetiy khiy-Elohim liy

Hebrew: בֵּ֭אלֹהִים אֲהַלֵּ֣ל דָּבָ֑ר בַּ֝יהֹוָ֗ה אֲהַלֵּ֥ל דָּבָֽר׃
Translated:
In God, whose word I praise,
in the LORD, whose word I praise,
Transliteration: velohiym ahalel davar vayhovah ahalel davar

Hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִ֣ים בָּ֭טַחְתִּי לֹּ֣א אִירָ֑א מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה אָדָ֣ם לִֽי׃
Translated:
in God I trust;
I am not afraid;
what can man do to me?
Transliteration: velohiym vatachetiy lo iyra mah-yaasheh adam liy

Hebrew: עָלַ֣י אֱלֹהִ֣ים נְדָרֶ֑יךָ אֲשַׁלֵּ֖ם תּוֹדֹ֣ת לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
I must pay my vows to You, O God;
I will render thank offerings to You.
Transliteration: alay Elohim nedareykha ashalem tvodot lakhe

Hebrew: כִּ֤י הִצַּ֪לְתָּ נַפְשִׁ֡י מִמָּוֶת֮ הֲלֹ֥א רַגְלַ֗י מִ֫דֶּ֥חִי לְ֭הִֽתְהַלֵּךְ לִפְנֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּ֝א֗וֹר הַחַיִּֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
For You have saved me from death,
my foot from stumbling,
that I may walk before God in the light of life.
Transliteration: khiy hitsaleta nafeshiy mimavet halo ragelay midechiy lehitehalekhe lifeney Elohim vevor hachayiym {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ אַל־תַּ֭שְׁחֵת לְדָוִ֣ד מִכְתָּ֑ם בְּבׇרְח֥וֹ מִפְּנֵי־שָׁ֝א֗וּל בַּמְּעָרָֽה׃
Translated: For the leader; al tashḥeth. Of David. A michtam; when he fled from Saul into a cave.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-tashechet ledavid mikhetam vevׇrechvo mifeney-shaul vamearah

Hebrew: חׇנֵּ֤נִי אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ חׇנֵּ֗נִי כִּ֥י בְךָ֮ חָסָ֢יָה נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י וּבְצֵֽל־כְּנָפֶ֥יךָ אֶחְסֶ֑ה עַ֝֗ד יַעֲבֹ֥ר הַוּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Have mercy on me, O God, have mercy on me,
for I seek refuge in You,
I seek refuge in the shadow of Your wings,
until danger passes.
Transliteration: chׇneniy Elohim chׇneniy khiy vekha chasa֢yah nafeshiy uvetsel-khenafeykha echeseh ad yaavor hauvot

Hebrew: אֶ֭קְרָא לֵאלֹהִ֣ים עֶלְי֑וֹן לָ֝אֵ֗ל גֹּמֵ֥ר עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
I call to God Most High,
to God who is good to me.
Transliteration: ekera lelohiym eleyvon lael gomer alay

Hebrew: יִשְׁלַ֤ח מִשָּׁמַ֨יִם ׀ וְֽיוֹשִׁיעֵ֗נִי חֵרֵ֣ף שֹׁאֲפִ֣י סֶ֑לָה יִשְׁלַ֥ח אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים חַסְדּ֥וֹ וַאֲמִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He will reach down from heaven and deliver me:
God will send down His steadfast love;
my persecutor reviles. Selah.
Transliteration: yishelach mishamayiim veyvoshiyeniy cheref shoafiy selah yishelach Elohimm chasedvo vaamitvo

Hebrew: נַפְשִׁ֤י ׀ בְּת֥וֹךְ לְבָאִם֮ אֶשְׁכְּבָ֢ה לֹ֫הֲטִ֥ים בְּֽנֵי־אָדָ֗ם שִׁ֭נֵּיהֶם חֲנִ֣ית וְחִצִּ֑ים וּ֝לְשׁוֹנָ֗ם חֶ֣רֶב חַדָּֽה׃
Translated:
As for me, I lie down among man-eating lions
whose teeth are spears and arrows,
whose tongue is a sharp sword.
Transliteration: nafeshiy vetvokhe levaim eshekheva֢h lohatiym veney-adam shineyhem chaniyt vechitsiym uleshvonam cherev chadah

Hebrew: ר֣וּמָה עַל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם אֱלֹהִ֑ים עַ֖ל כׇּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Exalt Yourself over the heavens, O God,
let Your glory be over all the earth!
Transliteration: rumah al-hashamayiim Elohim al khׇl-haarets khevvodekha

Hebrew: רֶ֤שֶׁת ׀ הֵכִ֣ינוּ לִפְעָמַי֮ כָּפַ֢ף נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י כָּר֣וּ לְפָנַ֣י שִׁיחָ֑ה נָפְל֖וּ בְתוֹכָ֣הּ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
They prepared a net for my feet to ensnare me;
they dug a pit for me,
but they fell into it. Selah.
Transliteration: reshet hekhiynu lifeamay khafa֢f nafeshiy kharu lefanay shiychah nafelu vetvokhah selah

Hebrew: נָ֘כ֤וֹן לִבִּ֣י אֱ֭לֹהִים נָכ֣וֹן לִבִּ֑י אָ֝שִׁ֗ירָה וַאֲזַמֵּֽרָה׃
Translated:
My heart is firm, O God;
my heart is firm;
I will sing, I will chant a hymn.
Transliteration: nakhvon liviy Elohim nakhvon liviy ashiyrah vaazamerah

Hebrew: ע֤וּרָה כְבוֹדִ֗י ע֭וּרָֽה הַנֵּ֥בֶל וְכִנּ֗וֹר אָעִ֥ירָה שָּֽׁחַר׃
Translated:
Awake, O my soul!
Awake, O harp and lyre!
I will wake the dawn.
Transliteration: urah khevvodiy urah hanevel vekhinvor aiyrah shachar

Hebrew: אוֹדְךָ֖ בָעַמִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָ֑י אֲ֝זַמֶּרְךָ֗ בַּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
Translated:
I will praise You among the peoples, O Lord;
I will sing a hymn to You among the nations;
Transliteration: vodekha vaamiym <small></small> adonay azamerekha valeumiym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־גָדֹ֣ל עַד־שָׁמַ֣יִם חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וְֽעַד־שְׁחָקִ֥ים אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
for Your faithfulness is as high as heaven;
Your steadfastness reaches to the sky.
Transliteration: khiy-gadol ad-shamayiim chasedekha vead-shechakiym amitekha

Hebrew: ר֣וּמָה עַל־שָׁמַ֣יִם אֱלֹהִ֑ים עַ֖ל כׇּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Exalt Yourself over the heavens, O God,
let Your glory be over all the earth!
Transliteration: rumah al-shamayiim Elohim al khׇl-haarets khevvodekha {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אַל־תַּשְׁחֵ֗ת לְדָוִ֥ד מִכְתָּֽם׃
Translated: For the leader; al tashḥeth. Of David. A michtam.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-tashechet ledavid mikhetam

Hebrew: הַאֻמְנָ֗ם אֵ֣לֶם צֶ֭דֶק תְּדַבֵּר֑וּן מֵישָׁרִ֥ים תִּ֝שְׁפְּט֗וּ בְּנֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
O mighty ones, do you really decree what is just?
Do you judge mankind with equity?
Transliteration: haumenam elem tsedek tedaverun meyshariym tishefetu veney adam

Hebrew: אַף־בְּלֵב֮ עוֹלֹ֢ת תִּפְעָ֫ל֥וּן בָּאָ֡רֶץ חֲמַ֥ס יְ֝דֵיכֶ֗ם תְּפַלֵּסֽוּן׃
Translated:
In your minds you devise wrongdoing in the land;
with your hands you deal out lawlessness.
Transliteration: af-velev volo֢t tifealun vaarets chamas yedeykhem tefalesun

Hebrew: זֹ֣רוּ רְשָׁעִ֣ים מֵרָ֑חֶם תָּע֥וּ מִ֝בֶּ֗טֶן דֹּבְרֵ֥י כָזָֽב׃
Translated:
The wicked are defiant from birth;
the liars go astray from the womb.
Transliteration: zoru reshaiym merachem tau miveten doverey khazav

Hebrew: חֲמַת־לָ֗מוֹ כִּדְמ֥וּת חֲמַת־נָחָ֑שׁ כְּמוֹ־פֶ֥תֶן חֵ֝רֵ֗שׁ יַאְטֵ֥ם אׇזְנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Their venom is like that of a snake,
a deaf viper that stops its ears
Transliteration: chamat-lamvo khidemut chamat-nachash khemvo-feten cheresh yaetem ׇzenvo

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־יִ֭שְׁמַע לְק֣וֹל מְלַחֲשִׁ֑ים חוֹבֵ֖ר חֲבָרִ֣ים מְחֻכָּֽם׃
Translated:
so as not to hear the voice of charmers
or the expert mutterer of spells.
Transliteration: asher lo-yishema lekvol melachashiym chvover chavariym mechukham

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים הֲרׇס־שִׁנֵּ֥ימֽוֹ בְּפִ֑ימוֹ מַלְתְּע֥וֹת כְּ֝פִירִ֗ים נְתֹ֣ץ <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
O God, smash their teeth in their mouth;
shatter the fangs of lions, O LORD;
Transliteration: Elohimm harׇs-shineymvo vefiymvo maletevot khefiyriym netots <small></small> yehovah

Hebrew: יִמָּאֲס֣וּ כְמוֹ־מַ֭יִם יִתְהַלְּכוּ־לָ֑מוֹ יִדְרֹ֥ךְ חִ֝צָּ֗ו כְּמ֣וֹ יִתְמֹלָֽלוּ׃
Translated:
let them melt, let them vanish like water;
let Him aim His arrows that they be cut down;
Transliteration: yimaasu khemvo-mayiim yitehalekhu-lamvo yiderokhe chitsav khemvo yitemolalu

Hebrew: כְּמ֣וֹ שַׁ֭בְּלוּל תֶּ֣מֶס יַהֲלֹ֑ךְ נֵ֥פֶל אֵ֝֗שֶׁת בַּל־חָ֥זוּ שָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated:
like a snail that melts away as it moves;
like a woman’s stillbirth, may they never see the sun!
Transliteration: khemvo shavelul temes yahalokhe nefel eshet val-chazu shamesh

Hebrew: בְּטֶ֤רֶם ׀ יָבִ֣ינוּ סִּירֹתֵכֶ֣ם אָטָ֑ד כְּמוֹ־חַ֥י כְּמוֹ־חָ֝ר֗וֹן יִשְׂעָרֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Before the thorns grow into a bramble,
may He whirl them away alive in fury.
Transliteration: veterem yaviynu siyrotekhem atad khemvo-chay khemvo-charvon yishearenu

Hebrew: יִשְׂמַ֣ח צַ֭דִּיק כִּי־חָזָ֣ה נָקָ֑ם פְּעָמָ֥יו יִ֝רְחַ֗ץ בְּדַ֣ם הָרָשָֽׁע׃
Translated:
The righteous man will rejoice when he sees revenge;
he will bathe his feet in the blood of the wicked.
Transliteration: yishemach tsadiyk khiy-chazah nakam feamayv yirechats vedam harasha

Hebrew: וְיֹאמַ֣ר אָ֭דָם אַךְ־פְּרִ֣י לַצַּדִּ֑יק אַ֥ךְ יֵשׁ־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים שֹׁפְטִ֥ים בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Men will say,
“There is, then, a reward for the righteous;
there is, indeed, divine justice on earth.”
Transliteration: veyomar adam akhe-feriy latsadiyk akhe eish-Elohimm shofetiym vaarets {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ אַל־תַּשְׁחֵת֮ לְדָוִ֢ד מִ֫כְתָּ֥ם בִּשְׁלֹ֥חַ שָׁא֑וּל וַֽיִּשְׁמְר֥וּ אֶת־הַ֝בַּ֗יִת לַהֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: For the leader; al tashḥeth. Of David. A michtam; when Saul sent men to watch his house in order to put him to death.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-tashechet ledavi֢d mikhetam vishelocha shaul vayishemeru et-havayiit lahamiytvo

Hebrew: הַצִּילֵ֖נִי מֵאֹיְבַ֥י <small>׀</small> אֱלֹהָ֑י מִֽמִּתְקוֹמְמַ֥י תְּשַׂגְּבֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Save me from my enemies, O my God;
secure me against my assailants.
Transliteration: hatsiyleniy meoyevay <small></small> elohay mimitekvomemay teshageveniy

Hebrew: הַ֭צִּילֵנִי מִפֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן וּֽמֵאַנְשֵׁ֥י דָ֝מִ֗ים הוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Save me from evildoers;
deliver me from murderers.
Transliteration: hatsiyleniy mifoaley aven umeaneshey damiym hvoshiyeniy

Hebrew: כִּ֤י הִנֵּ֪ה אָרְב֡וּ לְנַפְשִׁ֗י יָג֣וּרוּ עָלַ֣י עַזִּ֑ים לֹֽא־פִשְׁעִ֖י וְלֹא־חַטָּאתִ֣י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
For see, they lie in wait for me;
fierce men plot against me
for no offense of mine,
for no transgression, O LORD;
Transliteration: khiy hineh arevu lenafeshiy yaguru alay aziym lo-fisheiy velo-chatatiy yehovah

Hebrew: בְּֽלִי־עָ֭וֺן יְרֻצ֣וּן וְיִכּוֹנָ֑נוּ ע֖וּרָה לִקְרָאתִ֣י וּרְאֵֽה׃
Translated:
for no guilt of mine
do they rush to array themselves against me.
Look, rouse Yourself on my behalf!
Transliteration: veliy-avon yerutsun veyikhvonanu urah likeratiy ureeh

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָֽה־אֱלֹהִ֥ים <small>׀</small> צְבָא֡וֹת אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הָקִ֗יצָה לִפְקֹ֥ד כׇּֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם אַל־תָּחֹ֨ן כׇּל־בֹּ֖גְדֵי אָ֣וֶן סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
You, O LORD God of hosts,
God of Israel,
bestir Yourself to bring all nations to account;
have no mercy on any treacherous villain. Selah.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah-Elohim <small></small> tsevavot elohey yisherael hakiytsah lifekod khׇl-hagvoyim al-tachon khׇl-vogedey aven selah

Hebrew: יָשׁ֣וּבוּ לָ֭עֶרֶב יֶהֱמ֥וּ כַכָּ֗לֶב וִיס֥וֹבְבוּ עִֽיר׃
Translated:
They come each evening growling like dogs,
roaming the city.
Transliteration: yashuvu laerev yehemu khakhalev viysvovevu iyr

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה ׀ יַבִּ֘יע֤וּן בְּפִיהֶ֗ם חֲ֭רָבוֹת בְּשִׂפְתֽוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם כִּי־מִ֥י שֹׁמֵֽעַ׃
Translated:
They rave with their mouths,
sharp words are on their lips;
[they think,] “Who hears?”
Transliteration: hineh yaviyun vefiyhem charavvot veshifetvoteyhem khiy-miy shomea

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה תִּשְׂחַק־לָ֑מוֹ תִּ֝לְעַ֗ג לְכׇל־גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
But You, O LORD, laugh at them;
You mock all the nations.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah tishechak-lamvo tileag lekhׇl-gvoyim

Hebrew: עֻ֭זּוֹ אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֶשְׁמֹ֑רָה כִּֽי־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים מִשְׂגַּבִּֽי׃
Translated:
O my strength, I wait for You;
for God is my haven.
Transliteration: uzvo eleykha eshemorah khiy-Elohimm mishegaviy

Hebrew: אֱלֹהֵ֣י (חסדו) [חַסְדִּ֣י] יְקַדְּמֵ֑נִי אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים יַרְאֵ֥נִי בְשֹׁרְרָֽי׃
Translated:
My faithful God will come to aid me;
God will let me gloat over my watchful foes.
Transliteration: elohey (chsdv) [chasediy] yekademeniy Elohimm yareeniy veshoreray

Hebrew: אַל־תַּהַרְגֵ֤ם ׀ פֶּֽן־יִשְׁכְּח֬וּ עַמִּ֗י הֲנִיעֵ֣מוֹ בְ֭חֵילְךָ וְהוֹרִידֵ֑מוֹ מָ֖גִנֵּ֣נוּ אֲדֹנָֽי׃
Translated:
Do not kill them lest my people be unmindful;
with Your power make wanderers of them;
bring them low, O our shield, the Lord,
Transliteration: al-taharegem fen-yishekhechu amiy haniyemvo vecheylekha vehvoriydemvo maginenu adonay
