Hebrew: חַטַּאת־פִּ֗ימוֹ דְּֽבַר־שְׂפָ֫תֵ֥ימוֹ וְיִלָּכְד֥וּ בִגְאוֹנָ֑ם וּמֵאָלָ֖ה וּמִכַּ֣חַשׁ יְסַפֵּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
because of their sinful mouths,
the words on their lips.
Let them be trapped by their pride,
and by the imprecations and lies they utter.
Transliteration: chatat-fiymvo devar-shefateymvo veyilakhedu vigevonam umealah umikhachash yesaferu

Hebrew: כַּלֵּ֥ה בְחֵמָה֮ כַּלֵּ֢ה וְֽאֵ֫ינֵ֥מוֹ וְֽיֵדְע֗וּ כִּֽי־אֱ֭לֹהִים מֹשֵׁ֣ל בְּֽיַעֲקֹ֑ב לְאַפְסֵ֖י הָאָ֣רֶץ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
In Your fury put an end to them;
put an end to them that they be no more;
that it may be known to the ends of the earth
that God does rule over Jacob. Selah.
Transliteration: khaleh vechemah khale֢h veeynemvo veeiedeu khiy-Elohim moshel veyaakov leafesey haarets selah

Hebrew: וְיָשֻׁ֣בוּ לָ֭עֶרֶב יֶהֱמ֥וּ כַכָּ֗לֶב וִיס֥וֹבְבוּ עִֽיר׃
Translated:
They come each evening growling like dogs,
roaming the city.
Transliteration: veyashuvu laerev yehemu khakhalev viysvovevu iyr

Hebrew: הֵ֭מָּה (ינועון) [יְנִיע֣וּן] לֶאֱכֹ֑ל אִם־לֹ֥א יִ֝שְׂבְּע֗וּ וַיָּלִֽינוּ׃
Translated:
They wander in search of food;
and whine if they are not satisfied.
Transliteration: hemah (ynvvn) [yeniyun] leekhol im-lo yisheveu vayaliynu

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ אָשִׁ֣יר עֻזֶּךָ֮ וַאֲרַנֵּ֥ן לַבֹּ֗קֶר חַ֫סְדֶּ֥ךָ כִּֽי־הָיִ֣יתָ מִשְׂגָּ֣ב לִ֑י וּ֝מָנ֗וֹס בְּי֣וֹם צַר־לִֽי׃
Translated:
But I will sing of Your strength,
extol each morning Your faithfulness;
for You have been my haven,
a refuge in time of trouble.
Transliteration: vaaniy ashiyr uzekha vaaranen lavoker chasedekha khiy-hayiyta mishegav liy umanvos veyvom tsar-liy

Hebrew: עֻ֭זִּי אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֲזַמֵּ֑רָה כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים מִ֝שְׂגַּבִּ֗י אֱלֹהֵ֥י חַסְדִּֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
O my strength, to You I sing hymns;
for God is my haven, my faithful God.
Transliteration: uziy eleykha azamerah khiy-Elohim mishegaviy elohey chasediy {f}

Hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ עַל־שׁוּשַׁ֣ן עֵד֑וּת מִכְתָּ֖ם לְדָוִ֣ד לְלַמֵּֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; on shushan eduth. A michtam of David (to be taught),
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-shushan edut mikhetam ledavid lelamed

Hebrew: בְּהַצּוֹת֨וֹ ׀ אֶ֥ת־אֲרַ֣ם נַהֲרַיִם֮ וְאֶת־אֲרַ֢ם צ֫וֹבָ֥ה וַיָּ֤שׇׁב יוֹאָ֗ב וַיַּ֣ךְ אֶת־אֱד֣וֹם בְּגֵיא־מֶ֑לַח שְׁנֵ֖ים עָשָׂ֣ר אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: when he fought with Aram-Naharaim and Aram-Zobah, and Joab returned and defeated Edom—[an army] of twelve thousand men—in the Valley of Salt.
Transliteration: vehatsvotvo et-aram naharayim veet-ara֢m tsvovah vayashׇv yvoav vayakhe et-edvom vegey-melach sheneym ashar alef

Hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים זְנַחְתָּ֣נוּ פְרַצְתָּ֑נוּ אָ֝נַ֗פְתָּ תְּשׁ֣וֹבֵֽב לָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
O God, You have rejected us,
You have made a breach in us;
You have been angry;
restore us!
Transliteration: Elohim zenachetanu feratsetanu anafeta teshvovev lanu

Hebrew: הִרְעַ֣שְׁתָּה אֶ֣רֶץ פְּצַמְתָּ֑הּ רְפָ֖ה שְׁבָרֶ֣יהָ כִי־מָֽטָה׃
Translated:
You have made the land quake;
You have torn it open.
Mend its fissures,
for it is collapsing.
Transliteration: hireashetah erets fetsametah refah shevareyha khiy-matah

Hebrew: הִרְאִ֣יתָ עַמְּךָ֣ קָשָׁ֑ה הִ֝שְׁקִיתָ֗נוּ יַ֣יִן תַּרְעֵלָֽה׃
Translated:
You have made Your people suffer hardship;
You have given us wine that makes us reel.
Transliteration: hireiyta amekha kashah hishekiytanu yayiin tareelah

Hebrew: נָ֘תַ֤תָּה לִּירֵאֶ֣יךָ נֵּ֭ס לְהִתְנוֹסֵ֑ס מִ֝פְּנֵ֗י קֹ֣שֶׁט סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Give those who fear You because of Your truth
a banner for rallying. Selah.
Transliteration: natatah liyreeykha nes lehitenvoses mifeney koshet selah

Hebrew: לְ֭מַעַן יֵחָלְצ֣וּן יְדִידֶ֑יךָ הוֹשִׁ֖יעָה יְמִינְךָ֣ (ועננו) [וַעֲנֵֽנִי]׃
Translated:
That those whom You love might be rescued,
deliver with Your right hand and answer me.
Transliteration: lemaan eichaletsun yediydeykha hvoshiyah yemiynekha (vnnv) [vaaneniy]

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ דִּבֶּ֥ר בְּקׇדְשׁ֗וֹ אֶ֫עְלֹ֥זָה אֲחַלְּקָ֥ה שְׁכֶ֑ם וְעֵ֖מֶק סֻכּ֣וֹת אֲמַדֵּֽד׃
Translated:
God promised in His sanctuary
that I would exultingly divide up Shechem,
and measure the Valley of Sukkoth;
Transliteration: Elohim diver vekׇdeshvo eelozah achalekah shekhem veemek sukhvot amaded

Hebrew: לִ֤י גִלְעָ֨ד ׀ וְלִ֬י מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה וְ֭אֶפְרַיִם מָע֣וֹז רֹאשִׁ֑י יְ֝הוּדָ֗ה מְחֹֽקְקִֽי׃
Translated:
Gilead and Manasseh would be mine,
Ephraim my chief stronghold,
Judah my scepter;
Transliteration: liy gilead veliy menasheh veeferayim mavoz roshiy yehudah mechokekiy

Hebrew: מוֹאָ֤ב ׀ סִ֬יר רַחְצִ֗י עַל־אֱ֭דוֹם אַשְׁלִ֣יךְ נַעֲלִ֑י עָ֝לַ֗י פְּלֶ֣שֶׁת הִתְרוֹעָֽעִי׃
Translated:
Moab would be my washbasin;
on Edom I would cast my shoe;
acclaim me, O Philistia!
Transliteration: mvoav siyr rachetsiy al-edvom asheliykhe naaliy alay feleshet hitervoaiy

Hebrew: מִ֣י יֹ֭בִלֵנִי עִ֣יר מָצ֑וֹר מִ֖י נָחַ֣נִי עַד־אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Would that I were brought to the bastion!
Would that I were led to Edom!
Transliteration: miy yovileniy iyr matsvor miy nachaniy ad-edvom

Hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־אַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים זְנַחְתָּ֑נוּ וְֽלֹא־תֵצֵ֥א אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים בְּצִבְאוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
But You have rejected us, O God;
God, You do not march with our armies.
Transliteration: halo-atah Elohim zenachetanu velo-tetse Elohimm vetsivevoteynu

Hebrew: הָֽבָה־לָּ֣נוּ עֶזְרָ֣ת מִצָּ֑ר וְ֝שָׁ֗וְא תְּשׁוּעַ֥ת אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Grant us Your aid against the foe,
for the help of man is worthless.
Transliteration: havah-lanu ezerat mitsar veshave teshuat adam

Hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִ֥ים נַֽעֲשֶׂה־חָ֑יִל וְ֝ה֗וּא יָב֥וּס צָרֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
With God we shall triumph;
He will trample our foes.
Transliteration: velohiym naasheh-chayiil vehu yavus tsareynu {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> עַֽל־נְגִינַ֬ת לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; with instrumental music. Of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha <small></small> al-negiynat ledavid

Hebrew: שִׁמְעָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים רִנָּתִ֑י הַ֝קְשִׁ֗יבָה תְּפִלָּתִֽי׃
Translated:
Hear my cry, O God,
heed my prayer.
Transliteration: shimeah Elohim rinatiy hakeshiyvah tefilatiy

Hebrew: מִקְצֵ֤ה הָאָ֨רֶץ ׀ אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֶ֭קְרָא בַּעֲטֹ֣ף לִבִּ֑י בְּצוּר־יָר֖וּם מִמֶּ֣נִּי תַנְחֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
From the end of the earth I call to You;
when my heart is faint,
You lead me to a rock that is high above me.
Transliteration: miketseh haarets eleykha ekera vaatof liviy vetsur-yarum mimeniy tanecheniy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הָיִ֣יתָ מַחְסֶ֣ה לִ֑י מִגְדַּל־עֹ֝֗ז מִפְּנֵ֥י אוֹיֵֽב׃
Translated:
For You have been my refuge,
a tower of strength against the enemy.
Transliteration: khiy-hayiyta macheseh liy migedal-oz mifeney voeiv

Hebrew: אָג֣וּרָה בְ֭אׇהׇלְךָ עוֹלָמִ֑ים אֶ֥חֱסֶ֨ה בְסֵ֖תֶר כְּנָפֶ֣יךָ סֶּֽלָה׃
Translated:
O that I might dwell in Your tent forever,
take refuge under Your protecting wings. Selah.
Transliteration: agurah veׇhׇlekha volamiym echeseh veseter khenafeykha selah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים שָׁמַ֣עְתָּ לִנְדָרָ֑י נָתַ֥תָּ יְ֝רֻשַּׁ֗ת יִרְאֵ֥י שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
O God, You have heard my vows;
grant the request of those who fear Your name.
Transliteration: khiy-atah Elohim shamaeta linedaray natata yerushat yireey shemekha

Hebrew: יָמִ֣ים עַל־יְמֵי־מֶ֣לֶךְ תּוֹסִ֑יף שְׁ֝נוֹתָ֗יו כְּמוֹ־דֹ֥ר וָדֹֽר׃
Translated:
Add days to the days of the king;
may his years extend through generations;
Transliteration: yamiym al-yemey-melekhe tvosiyf shenvotayv khemvo-dor vador

Hebrew: יֵשֵׁ֣ב ע֭וֹלָם לִפְנֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים חֶ֥סֶד וֶ֝אֱמֶ֗ת מַ֣ן יִנְצְרֻֽהוּ׃
Translated:
may he dwell in God’s presence forever;
appoint steadfast love to guard him.
Transliteration: eishev volam lifeney Elohim chesed veemet man yinetseruhu

Hebrew: כֵּ֤ן אֲזַמְּרָ֣ה שִׁמְךָ֣ לָעַ֑ד לְֽשַׁלְּמִ֥י נְ֝דָרַ֗י י֣וֹם ׀ יֽוֹם׃ {פ}
Translated:
So I will sing hymns to Your name forever,
as I fulfill my vows day after day.
Transliteration: khen azamerah shimekha laad leshalemiy nedaray yvom yvom {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־יְדוּת֗וּן מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader; on Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-yedutun mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ אֶל־אֱ֭לֹהִים דּֽוּמִיָּ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֑י מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ יְשׁוּעָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Truly my soul waits quietly for God;
my deliverance comes from Him.
Transliteration: akhe el-Elohim dumiyah nafeshiy mimenu yeshuatiy

Hebrew: אַךְ־ה֣וּא צ֭וּרִי וִישׁוּעָתִ֑י מִ֝שְׂגַּבִּ֗י לֹא־אֶמּ֥וֹט רַבָּֽה׃
Translated:
Truly He is my rock and deliverance,
my haven; I shall never be shaken.
Transliteration: akhe-hu tsuriy viyshuatiy mishegaviy lo-emvot ravah

Hebrew: עַד־אָ֤נָה ׀ תְּה֥וֹתְת֣וּ עַל־אִישׁ֮ תְּרָצְּח֢וּ כֻ֫לְּכֶ֥ם כְּקִ֥יר נָט֑וּי גָּ֝דֵ֗ר הַדְּחוּיָֽה׃
Translated:
How long will all of you attack a man,
to crush him, as though he were
a leaning wall, a tottering fence?
Transliteration: ad-anah tehvotetu al-iysh teratsechu khulekhem khekiyr natuy gader hadechuyah

Hebrew: אַ֤ךְ מִשְּׂאֵת֨וֹ ׀ יָ֥עֲצ֣וּ לְהַדִּיחַ֮ יִרְצ֢וּ כָ֫זָ֥ב בְּפִ֥יו יְבָרֵ֑כוּ וּ֝בְקִרְבָּ֗ם יְקַֽלְלוּ־סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
They lay plans to topple him from his rank;
they delight in falsehood;
they bless with their mouths,
while inwardly they curse. Selah.
Transliteration: akhe misheetvo yaatsu lehadiycha yiretsu khazav vefiyv yevarekhu uvekirevam yekalelu-selah

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ לֵ֭אלֹהִים דּ֣וֹמִּי נַפְשִׁ֑י כִּֽי־מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ תִּקְוָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Truly, wait quietly for God, O my soul,
for my hope comes from Him.
Transliteration: akhe lelohiym dvomiy nafeshiy khiy-mimenu tikevatiy

Hebrew: אַךְ־ה֣וּא צ֭וּרִי וִישׁוּעָתִ֑י מִ֝שְׂגַּבִּ֗י לֹ֣א אֶמּֽוֹט׃
Translated:
He is my rock and deliverance,
my haven; I shall not be shaken.
Transliteration: akhe-hu tsuriy viyshuatiy mishegaviy lo emvot

Hebrew: עַל־אֱ֭לֹהִים יִשְׁעִ֣י וּכְבוֹדִ֑י צוּר־עֻזִּ֥י מַ֝חְסִ֗י בֵּאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
I rely on God, my deliverance and glory,
my rock of strength;
in God is my refuge.
Transliteration: al-Elohim yisheiy ukhevvodiy tsur-uziy machesiy velohiym

Hebrew: בִּטְח֘וּ־ב֤וֹ בְכׇל־עֵ֨ת ׀ עָ֗ם שִׁפְכֽוּ־לְפָנָ֥יו לְבַבְכֶ֑ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים מַחֲסֶה־לָּ֣נוּ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Trust in Him at all times, O people;
pour out your hearts before Him;
God is our refuge. Selah.
Transliteration: vitechu-vvo vekhׇl-et am shifekhu-lefanayv levavekhem Elohim machaseh-lanu selah

Hebrew: אַ֤ךְ ׀ הֶ֥בֶל בְּנֵֽי־אָדָם֮ כָּזָ֢ב בְּנֵ֫י־אִ֥ישׁ בְּמֹאזְנַ֥יִם לַעֲל֑וֹת הֵ֝֗מָּה מֵהֶ֥בֶל יָֽחַד׃
Translated:
Men are mere breath;
mortals, illusion;
placed on a scale all together,
they weigh even less than a breath.
Transliteration: akhe hevel veney-adam khaza֢v veney-iysh vemozenayiim laalvot hemah mehevel yachad

Hebrew: אַל־תִּבְטְח֣וּ בְעֹשֶׁק֮ וּבְגָזֵ֢ל אַל־תֶּ֫הְבָּ֥לוּ חַ֤יִל ׀ כִּֽי־יָנ֑וּב אַל־תָּשִׁ֥יתוּ לֵֽב׃
Translated:
Do not trust in violence,
or put false hopes in robbery;
if force bears fruit pay it no mind.
Transliteration: al-tivetechu veoshek uvegaze֢l al-tehevalu chayiil khiy-yanuv al-tashiytu lev

Hebrew: אַחַ֤ת ׀ דִּבֶּ֬ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים שְׁתַּֽיִם־ז֥וּ שָׁמָ֑עְתִּי כִּ֥י עֹ֝֗ז לֵֽאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
One thing God has spoken;
two things have I heard:
that might belongs to God,
Transliteration: achat diver Elohim shetayiim-zu shamaetiy khiy oz lelohiym

Hebrew: וּלְךָֽ־אֲדֹנָ֥י חָ֑סֶד כִּֽי־אַתָּ֨ה תְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לְאִ֣ישׁ כְּֽמַעֲשֵֽׂהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
and faithfulness is Yours, O Lord,
to reward each man according to his deeds.
Transliteration: ulekha-adonay chased khiy-atah teshalem leiysh khemaashehu {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִ֑ד בִּ֝הְיוֹת֗וֹ בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: A psalm of David, when he was in the Wilderness of Judah.
Transliteration: mizemvor ledavid viheyvotvo vemidevar yehudah

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ אֵלִ֥י אַתָּ֗ה אֲֽשַׁ֫חֲרֶ֥ךָּ צָמְאָ֬ה לְךָ֨ ׀ נַפְשִׁ֗י כָּמַ֣הּ לְךָ֣ בְשָׂרִ֑י בְּאֶרֶץ־צִיָּ֖ה וְעָיֵ֣ף בְּלִי־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
God, You are my God;
I search for You,
my soul thirsts for You,
my body yearns for You,
as a parched and thirsty land that has no water.
Transliteration: Elohim eliy atah ashacharekha tsameah lekha nafeshiy khamah lekha veshariy veerets-tsiyah veaeif veliy-mayiim

Hebrew: כֵּ֭ן בַּקֹּ֣דֶשׁ חֲזִיתִ֑ךָ לִרְא֥וֹת עֻ֝זְּךָ֗ וּכְבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I shall behold You in the sanctuary,
and see Your might and glory,
Transliteration: khen vakodesh chaziytikha lirevot uzekha ukhevvodekha

Hebrew: כִּי־ט֣וֹב חַ֭סְדְּךָ מֵחַיִּ֗ים שְׂפָתַ֥י יְשַׁבְּחֽוּנְךָ׃
Translated:
Truly Your faithfulness is better than life;
my lips declare Your praise.
Transliteration: khiy-tvov chasedekha mechayiym shefatay yeshavechunekha

Translated:
I bless You all my life;
I lift up my hands, invoking Your name.
Transliteration: khen avarekhekha vechayay veshimekha esha khafay

Hebrew: כְּמ֤וֹ חֵ֣לֶב וָ֭דֶשֶׁן תִּשְׂבַּ֣ע נַפְשִׁ֑י וְשִׂפְתֵ֥י רְ֝נָנ֗וֹת יְהַלֶּל־פִּֽי׃
Translated:
I am sated as with a rich feast,
I sing praises with joyful lips
Transliteration: khemvo chelev vadeshen tisheva nafeshiy veshifetey renanvot yehalel-fiy

Hebrew: אִם־זְכַרְתִּ֥יךָ עַל־יְצוּעָ֑י בְּ֝אַשְׁמֻר֗וֹת אֶהְגֶּה־בָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
when I call You to mind upon my bed,
when I think of You in the watches of the night;
Transliteration: im-zekharetiykha al-yetsuay veashemurvot ehegeh-vakhe

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הָיִ֣יתָ עֶזְרָ֣תָה לִּ֑י וּבְצֵ֖ל כְּנָפֶ֣יךָ אֲרַנֵּֽן׃
Translated:
for You are my help,
and in the shadow of Your wings
I shout for joy.
Transliteration: khiy-hayiyta ezeratah liy uvetsel khenafeykha aranen

Hebrew: דָּבְקָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֣י אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ בִּ֝֗י תָּמְכָ֥ה יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
My soul is attached to You;
Your right hand supports me.
Transliteration: davekah nafeshiy achareykha viy tamekhah yemiynekha

Hebrew: וְהֵ֗מָּה לְ֭שׁוֹאָה יְבַקְשׁ֣וּ נַפְשִׁ֑י יָ֝בֹ֗אוּ בְּֽתַחְתִּיּ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
May those who seek to destroy my life
enter the depths of the earth.
Transliteration: vehemah leshvoah yevakeshu nafeshiy yavou vetachetiyyvot haarets

Hebrew: יַגִּירֻ֥הוּ עַל־יְדֵי־חָ֑רֶב מְנָ֖ת שֻׁעָלִ֣ים יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated:
May they be gutted by the sword;
may they be prey to jackals.
Transliteration: yagiyruhu al-yedey-charev menat shualiym yiheyu

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּלֶךְ֮ יִשְׂמַ֢ח בֵּאלֹ֫הִ֥ים יִ֭תְהַלֵּל כׇּל־הַנִּשְׁבָּ֣ע בּ֑וֹ כִּ֥י יִ֝סָּכֵ֗ר פִּ֣י דוֹבְרֵי־שָֽׁקֶר׃ {פ}
Translated:
But the king shall rejoice in God;
all who swear by Him shall exult,
when the mouth of liars is stopped.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe yishema֢ch velohiym yitehalel khׇl-hanisheva vvo khiy yisakher fiy dvoverey-shaker {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: שְׁמַע־אֱלֹהִ֣ים קוֹלִ֣י בְשִׂיחִ֑י מִפַּ֥חַד א֝וֹיֵ֗ב תִּצֹּ֥ר חַיָּֽי׃
Translated:
Hear my voice, O God, when I plead;
guard my life from the enemy’s terror.
Transliteration: shema-Elohim kvoliy veshiychiy mifachad voeiv titsor chayay

Hebrew: תַּ֭סְתִּירֵנִי מִסּ֣וֹד מְרֵעִ֑ים מֵ֝רִגְשַׁ֗ת פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Hide me from a band of evil men,
from a crowd of evildoers,
Transliteration: tasetiyreniy misvod mereiym merigeshat foaley aven

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר שָׁנְנ֣וּ כַחֶ֣רֶב לְשׁוֹנָ֑ם דָּרְכ֥וּ חִ֝צָּ֗ם דָּבָ֥ר מָֽר׃
Translated:
who whet their tongues like swords;
they aim their arrows—cruel words—
Transliteration: asher shanenu khacherev leshvonam darekhu chitsam davar mar

Hebrew: לִירֹ֣ת בַּמִּסְתָּרִ֣ים תָּ֑ם פִּתְאֹ֥ם יֹ֝רֻ֗הוּ וְלֹ֣א יִירָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
to shoot from hiding at the blameless man;
they shoot him suddenly and without fear.
Transliteration: liyrot vamisetariym tam fiteom yoruhu velo yiyrau

Hebrew: יְחַזְּקוּ־לָ֨מוֹ ׀ דָּ֘בָ֤ר רָ֗ע יְֽ֭סַפְּרוּ לִטְמ֣וֹן מוֹקְשִׁ֑ים אָ֝מְר֗וּ מִ֣י יִרְאֶה־לָּֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
They arm themselves with an evil word;
when they speak, it is to conceal traps;
they think, “Who will see them?”
Transliteration: yechazeku-lamvo davar ra yesaferu litemvon mvokeshiym ameru miy yireeh-lamvo

Hebrew: יַ֥חְפְּֽשׂוּ־עוֹלֹ֗ת תַּ֭מְנוּ חֵ֣פֶשׂ מְחֻפָּ֑שׂ וְקֶ֥רֶב אִ֝֗ישׁ וְלֵ֣ב עָמֹֽק׃
Translated:
Let the wrongdoings they have concealed,
each one inside him, his secret thoughts,
be wholly exposed.
Transliteration: yachefeshu-volot tamenu chefesh mechufash vekerev iysh velev amok

Hebrew: וַיֹּרֵ֗ם אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים חֵ֥ץ פִּתְא֑וֹם הָ֝י֗וּ מַכּוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
God shall shoot them with arrows;
they shall be struck down suddenly.
Transliteration: vayorem Elohimm chets fitevom hayu makhvotam

Hebrew: וַיַּכְשִׁיל֣וּהוּ עָלֵ֣ימוֹ לְשׁוֹנָ֑ם יִ֝תְנֹדְד֗וּ כׇּל־רֹ֥אֵה בָֽם׃
Translated:
Their tongue shall be their downfall;
all who see them shall recoil in horror;
Transliteration: vayakheshiyluhu aleymvo leshvonam yitenodedu khׇl-roeh vam

Hebrew: וַיִּֽירְא֗וּ כׇּל־אָ֫דָ֥ם וַ֭יַּגִּידוּ פֹּ֥עַל אֱלֹהִ֗ים וּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֥הוּ הִשְׂכִּֽילוּ׃
Translated:
all men shall stand in awe;
they shall proclaim the work of God
and His deed which they perceived.
Transliteration: vayiyreu khׇl-adam vayagiydu foal Elohim umaashehu hishekhiylu

Hebrew: יִשְׂמַ֬ח צַדִּ֣יק בַּ֭יהֹוָה וְחָ֣סָה ב֑וֹ וְ֝יִתְהַלְל֗וּ כׇּל־יִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃ {פ}
Translated:
The righteous shall rejoice in the LORD,
and take refuge in Him;
all the upright shall exult.
Transliteration: yishemach tsadiyk vayhovah vechasah vvo veyiitehalelu khׇl-yisherey-lev {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָוִ֥ד שִֽׁיר׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David. A song.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mizemvor ledavid shiyr

Hebrew: לְךָ֤ דֻֽמִיָּ֬ה תְהִלָּ֓ה אֱלֹ֘הִ֥ים בְּצִיּ֑וֹן וּ֝לְךָ֗ יְשֻׁלַּם־נֶֽדֶר׃
Translated:
Praise befits You in Zion, O God;
vows are paid to You;
Transliteration: lekha dumiyah tehilah Elohimm vetsiyyvon ulekha yeshulam-neder

Hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֥עַ תְּפִלָּ֑ה עָ֝דֶ֗יךָ כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֥ר יָבֹֽאוּ׃
Translated:
all mankind comes to You,
You who hear prayer.
Transliteration: shomea tefilah adeykha khׇl-vashar yavou

Hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֣י עֲ֭וֺנֹת גָּ֣בְרוּ מֶ֑נִּי פְּ֝שָׁעֵ֗ינוּ אַתָּ֥ה תְכַפְּרֵֽם׃
Translated:
When all manner of sins overwhelm me,
it is You who forgive our iniquities.
Transliteration: diverey avonot gaveru meniy feshaeynu atah tekhaferem

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֤י ׀ תִּ֥בְחַ֣ר וּתְקָרֵב֮ יִשְׁכֹּ֢ן חֲצֵ֫רֶ֥יךָ נִ֭שְׂבְּעָה בְּט֣וּב בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ קְ֝דֹ֗שׁ הֵיכָלֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Happy is the man You choose and bring near
to dwell in Your courts;
may we be sated with the blessings of Your house,
Your holy temple.
Transliteration: asherey tivechar utekarev yishekho֢n chatsereykha nisheveah vetuv veytekha kedosh heykhalekha

Hebrew: נ֤וֹרָא֨וֹת ׀ בְּצֶ֣דֶק תַּ֭עֲנֵנוּ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעֵ֑נוּ מִבְטָ֥ח כׇּל־קַצְוֵי־אֶ֝֗רֶץ וְיָ֣ם רְחֹקִֽים׃
Translated:
Answer us with victory through awesome deeds,
O God, our deliverer,
in whom all the ends of the earth
and the distant seas
put their trust;
Transliteration: nvoravot vetsedek taanenu elohey yisheenu mivetach khׇl-katsevey-erets veyam rechokiym

Hebrew: מֵכִ֣ין הָרִ֣ים בְּכֹח֑וֹ נֶ֝אְזָ֗ר בִּגְבוּרָֽה׃
Translated:
who by His power fixed the mountains firmly,
who is girded with might,
Transliteration: mekhiyn hariym vekhochvo neezar vigevurah

Hebrew: מַשְׁבִּ֤יחַ ׀ שְׁא֣וֹן יַ֭מִּים שְׁא֥וֹן גַּלֵּיהֶ֗ם וַהֲמ֥וֹן לְאֻמִּֽים׃
Translated:
who stills the raging seas,
the raging waves,
and tumultuous peoples.
Transliteration: masheviycha shevon yamiym shevon galeyhem vahamvon leumiym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤ירְא֨וּ ׀ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י קְ֭צָוֺת מֵאוֹתֹתֶ֑יךָ מ֤וֹצָֽאֵי־בֹ֖קֶר וָעֶ֣רֶב תַּרְנִֽין׃
Translated:
Those who live at the ends of the earth are awed by Your signs;
You make the lands of sunrise and sunset shout for joy.
Transliteration: vayiyreu yoshevey ketsavot mevototeykha mvotsaey-voker vaerev tareniyn

Hebrew: פָּ֤קַֽדְתָּ־הָאָ֨רֶץ וַתְּשֹׁ֪קְקֶ֡הָ רַבַּ֬ת תַּעְשְׁרֶ֗נָּה פֶּ֣לֶג אֱ֭לֹהִים מָ֣לֵא מָ֑יִם תָּכִ֥ין דְּ֝גָנָ֗ם כִּי־כֵ֥ן תְּכִינֶֽהָ׃
Translated:
You take care of the earth and irrigate it;
You enrich it greatly,
with the channel of God full of water;
You provide grain for men;
for so do You prepare it.
Transliteration: fakadeta-haarets vateshokekeha ravat taesherenah feleg Elohim male mayiim takhiyn deganam khiy-khen tekhiyneha

Hebrew: תְּלָמֶ֣יהָ רַ֭וֵּה נַחֵ֣ת גְּדוּדֶ֑הָ בִּרְבִיבִ֥ים תְּ֝מֹגְגֶ֗נָּה צִמְחָ֥הּ תְּבָרֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
Saturating its furrows,
leveling its ridges,
You soften it with showers,
You bless its growth.
Transliteration: telameyha raveh nachet gedudeha vireviyviym temogegenah tsimechah tevarekhe

Hebrew: עִ֭טַּרְתָּ שְׁנַ֣ת טוֹבָתֶ֑ךָ וּ֝מַעְגָּלֶ֗יךָ יִרְעֲפ֥וּן דָּֽשֶׁן׃
Translated:
You crown the year with Your bounty;
fatness is distilled in Your paths;
Transliteration: itareta shenat tvovatekha umaegaleykha yireafun dashen

Hebrew: יִ֭רְעֲפוּ נְא֣וֹת מִדְבָּ֑ר וְ֝גִ֗יל גְּבָע֥וֹת תַּחְגֹּֽרְנָה׃
Translated:
the pasturelands distill it;
the hills are girded with joy.
Transliteration: yireafu nevot midevar vegiyl gevavot tachegorenah

Hebrew: לָבְשׁ֬וּ כָרִ֨ים ׀ הַצֹּ֗אן וַעֲמָקִ֥ים יַֽעַטְפוּ־בָ֑ר יִ֝תְרוֹעֲע֗וּ אַף־יָשִֽׁירוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The meadows are clothed with flocks,
the valleys mantled with grain;
they raise a shout, they break into song.
Transliteration: laveshu khariym hatson vaamakiym yaatefu-var yitervoau af-yashiyru {f}

Hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ שִׁ֣יר מִזְמ֑וֹר הָרִ֥יעוּ לֵ֝אלֹהִ֗ים כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
For the leader. A song. A psalm.

Raise a shout for God, all the earth;
Transliteration: lamenatsecha shiyr mizemvor hariyu lelohiym khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: זַמְּר֥וּ כְבֽוֹד־שְׁמ֑וֹ שִׂ֥ימוּ כָ֝ב֗וֹד תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
sing the glory of His name,
make glorious His praise.
Transliteration: zameru khevvod-shemvo shiymu khavvod tehilatvo

Hebrew: אִמְר֣וּ לֵ֭אלֹהִים מַה־נּוֹרָ֣א מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ בְּרֹ֥ב עֻ֝זְּךָ֗ יְֽכַחֲשׁ֖וּ לְךָ֣ אֹיְבֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Say to God,
“How awesome are Your deeds,
Your enemies cower before Your great strength;
Transliteration: imeru lelohiym mah-nvora maasheykha verov uzekha yekhachashu lekha oyeveykha

Hebrew: כׇּל־הָאָ֤רֶץ ׀ יִשְׁתַּחֲו֣וּ לְ֭ךָ וִיזַמְּרוּ־לָ֑ךְ יְזַמְּר֖וּ שִׁמְךָ֣ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
all the earth bows to You,
and sings hymns to You;
all sing hymns to Your name.” Selah.
Transliteration: khׇl-haarets yishetachavu lekha viyzameru-lakhe yezameru shimekha selah

Hebrew: לְכ֣וּ וּ֭רְאוּ מִפְעֲל֣וֹת אֱלֹהִ֑ים נוֹרָ֥א עֲ֝לִילָ֗ה עַל־בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Come and see the works of God,
who is held in awe by men for His acts.
Transliteration: lekhu ureu mifealvot Elohim nvora aliylah al-veney adam

Hebrew: הָ֤פַךְ יָ֨ם ׀ לְֽיַבָּשָׁ֗ה בַּ֭נָּהָר יַעַבְר֣וּ בְרָ֑גֶל שָׁ֝֗ם נִשְׂמְחָה־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He turned the sea into dry land;
they crossed the river on foot;
we therefore rejoice in Him.
Transliteration: hafakhe yam leyavashah vanahar yaaveru veragel sham nishemechah-vvo

Hebrew: מֹ֘שֵׁ֤ל בִּגְבוּרָת֨וֹ ׀ עוֹלָ֗ם עֵ֭ינָיו בַּגּוֹיִ֣ם תִּצְפֶּ֑ינָה הַסּוֹרְרִ֓ים ׀ אַל־[יָר֖וּמוּ] (ירימו) לָ֣מוֹ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
He rules forever in His might;
His eyes scan the nations;
let the rebellious not assert themselves. Selah.
Transliteration: moshel vigevuratvo volam eynayv vagvoyim titsefeynah hasvoreriym al-[yarumu] (yrymv) lamvo selah

Hebrew: בָּרְכ֖וּ עַמִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְ֝הַשְׁמִ֗יעוּ ק֣וֹל תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
O peoples, bless our God,
celebrate His praises;
Transliteration: varekhu amiym <small></small> eloheynu vehashemiyu kvol tehilatvo

Hebrew: הַשָּׂ֣ם נַ֭פְשֵׁנוּ בַּחַיִּ֑ים וְלֹֽא־נָתַ֖ן לַמּ֣וֹט רַגְלֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
who has granted us life,
and has not let our feet slip.
Transliteration: hasham nafeshenu vachayiym velo-natan lamvot ragelenu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־בְחַנְתָּ֥נוּ אֱלֹהִ֑ים צְ֝רַפְתָּ֗נוּ כִּצְרׇף־כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated:
You have tried us, O God,
refining us, as one refines silver.
Transliteration: khiy-vechanetanu Elohim tserafetanu khitserׇf-khasef

Hebrew: הֲבֵאתָ֥נוּ בַמְּצוּדָ֑ה שַׂ֖מְתָּ מוּעָקָ֣ה בְמׇתְנֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
You have caught us in a net,
caught us in trammels.
Transliteration: havetanu vametsudah shameta muakah vemׇteneynu

Hebrew: הִרְכַּ֥בְתָּֽ אֱנ֗וֹשׁ לְרֹ֫אשֵׁ֥נוּ בָּֽאנוּ־בָאֵ֥שׁ וּבַמַּ֑יִם וַ֝תּוֹצִיאֵ֗נוּ לָרְוָיָֽה׃
Translated:
You have let men ride over us;
we have endured fire and water,
and You have brought us through to prosperity.
Transliteration: hirekhaveta envosh leroshenu vanu-vaesh uvamayiim vatvotsiyenu larevayah

Hebrew: אָב֣וֹא בֵיתְךָ֣ בְעוֹל֑וֹת אֲשַׁלֵּ֖ם לְךָ֣ נְדָרָֽי׃
Translated:
I enter Your house with burnt offerings,
I pay my vows to You,
Transliteration: avvo veytekha vevolvot ashalem lekha nedaray

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־פָּצ֥וּ שְׂפָתָ֑י וְדִבֶּר־פִּ֝֗י בַּצַּר־לִֽי׃
Translated:
[vows] that my lips pronounced,
that my mouth uttered in my distress.
Transliteration: asher-fatsu shefatay vediver-fiy vatsar-liy

Hebrew: עֹ֘ל֤וֹת מֵיחִ֣ים אַֽעֲלֶה־לָּ֭ךְ עִם־קְטֹ֣רֶת אֵילִ֑ים אֶ֥עֱשֶֽׂה־בָקָ֖ר עִם־עַתּוּדִ֣ים סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
I offer up fatlings to You,
with the odor of burning rams;
I sacrifice bulls and he-goats. Selah.
Transliteration: olvot meychiym aaleh-lakhe im-ketoret eyliym eesheh-vakar im-atudiym selah

Hebrew: לְכוּ־שִׁמְע֣וּ וַ֭אֲסַפְּרָה כׇּל־יִרְאֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עָשָׂ֣ה לְנַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
Come and hear, all God-fearing men,
as I tell what He did for me.
Transliteration: lekhu-shimeu vaasaferah khׇl-yireey Elohim asher ashah lenafeshiy

Hebrew: אֵלָ֥יו פִּֽי־קָרָ֑אתִי וְ֝רוֹמַ֗ם תַּ֣חַת לְשׁוֹנִֽי׃
Translated:
I called aloud to Him,
glorification on my tongue.
Transliteration: elayv fiy-karatiy vervomam tachat leshvoniy

Hebrew: אָ֭וֶן אִם־רָאִ֣יתִי בְלִבִּ֑י לֹ֖א יִשְׁמַ֣ע <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָֽי׃
Translated:
Had I an evil thought in my mind,
the Lord would not have listened.
Transliteration: aven im-raiytiy veliviy lo yishema <small></small> adonay

Hebrew: אָ֭כֵן שָׁמַ֣ע אֱלֹהִ֑ים הִ֝קְשִׁ֗יב בְּק֣וֹל תְּפִלָּתִֽי׃
Translated:
But God did listen;
He paid heed to my prayer.
Transliteration: akhen shama Elohim hikeshiyv vekvol tefilatiy

Hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־הֵסִ֘יר־תְּפִלָּתִ֥י וְ֝חַסְדּ֗וֹ מֵאִתִּֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Blessed is God who has not turned away my prayer,
or His faithful care from me.
Transliteration: varukhe Elohim asher lo-hesiyr-tefilatiy vechasedvo meitiy {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֗ת מִזְמ֥וֹר שִֽׁיר׃
Translated: For the leader; with instrumental music. A psalm. A song.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha vinegiynot mizemvor shiyr

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים יְחׇנֵּ֥נוּ וִיבָרְכֵ֑נוּ יָ֤אֵֽר־פָּנָ֖יו אִתָּ֣נוּ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
May God be gracious to us and bless us;
may He show us favor, selah
Transliteration: Elohimm yechׇnenu viyvarekhenu yaer-fanayv itanu selah

Hebrew: לָדַ֣עַת בָּאָ֣רֶץ דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ בְּכׇל־גּ֝וֹיִ֗ם יְשׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
that Your way be known on earth,
Your deliverance among all nations.
Transliteration: ladaat vaarets darekhekha vekhׇl-gvoyim yeshuatekha

Hebrew: יוֹד֖וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֱלֹהִ֑ים י֝וֹד֗וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated:
Peoples will praise You, O God;
all peoples will praise You.
Transliteration: yvodukha amiym <small></small> Elohim yvodukha amiym khulam

Hebrew: יִ֥שְׂמְח֥וּ וִירַנְּנ֗וּ לְאֻ֫מִּ֥ים כִּֽי־תִשְׁפֹּ֣ט עַמִּ֣ים מִישֹׁ֑ר וּלְאֻמִּ֓ים ׀ בָּאָ֖רֶץ תַּנְחֵ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Nations will exult and shout for joy,
for You rule the peoples with equity,
You guide the nations of the earth. Selah.
Transliteration: yishemechu viyranenu leumiym khiy-tishefot amiym miyshor uleumiym vaarets tanechem selah

Hebrew: יוֹד֖וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֱלֹהִ֑ים י֝וֹד֗וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated:
The peoples will praise You, O God;
all peoples will praise You.
Transliteration: yvodukha amiym <small></small> Elohim yvodukha amiym khulam

Hebrew: אֶ֭רֶץ נָתְנָ֣ה יְבוּלָ֑הּ יְ֝בָרְכֵ֗נוּ אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
May the earth yield its produce;
may God, our God, bless us.
Transliteration: erets natenah yevulah yevarekhenu Elohim eloheynu

Hebrew: יְבָרְכֵ֥נוּ אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְיִֽירְא֥וּ א֝וֹת֗וֹ כׇּל־אַפְסֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
May God bless us,
and be revered to the ends of the earth.
Transliteration: yevarekhenu Elohim veyiyreu votvo khׇl-afesey-arets {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ לְדָוִ֗ד מִזְמ֥וֹר שִֽׁיר׃
Translated: For the leader. Of David. A psalm. A song.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha ledavid mizemvor shiyr

Hebrew: יָק֣וּם אֱ֭לֹהִים יָפ֣וּצוּ אוֹיְבָ֑יו וְיָנ֥וּסוּ מְ֝שַׂנְאָ֗יו מִפָּנָֽיו׃
Translated:
God will arise,
His enemies shall be scattered,
His foes shall flee before Him.
Transliteration: yakum Elohim yafutsu voyevayv veyanusu meshaneayv mifanayv

Hebrew: כְּהִנְדֹּ֥ף עָשָׁ֗ן תִּ֫נְדֹּ֥ף כְּהִמֵּ֣ס דּ֭וֹנַג מִפְּנֵי־אֵ֑שׁ יֹאבְד֥וּ רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים מִפְּנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
Disperse them as smoke is dispersed;
as wax melts at fire,
so the wicked shall perish before God.
Transliteration: khehinedof ashan tinedof khehimes dvonag mifeney-esh yovedu reshaiym mifeney Elohim

Hebrew: וְֽצַדִּיקִ֗ים יִשְׂמְח֣וּ יַ֭עַלְצוּ לִפְנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִ֗ים וְיָשִׂ֥ישׂוּ בְשִׂמְחָֽה׃
Translated:
But the righteous shall rejoice;
they shall exult in the presence of God;
they shall be exceedingly joyful.
Transliteration: vetsadiykiym yishemechu yaaletsu lifeney Elohim veyashiyshu veshimechah

Hebrew: שִׁ֤ירוּ ׀ לֵאלֹהִים֮ זַמְּר֢וּ שְׁ֫מ֥וֹ סֹ֡לּוּ לָרֹכֵ֣ב בָּ֭עֲרָבוֹת בְּיָ֥הּ שְׁמ֗וֹ וְעִלְז֥וּ לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated:
Sing to God, chant hymns to His name;
extol Him who rides the clouds;
the LORD is His name.
Exult in His presence—
Transliteration: shiyru lelohiym zameru shemvo solu larokhev vaaravvot veyah shemvo veilezu lefanayv

Hebrew: אֲבִ֣י יְ֭תוֹמִים וְדַיַּ֣ן אַלְמָנ֑וֹת אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים בִּמְע֥וֹן קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
the father of orphans, the champion of widows,
God, in His holy habitation.
Transliteration: aviy yetvomiym vedayan alemanvot Elohimm vimevon kׇdeshvo

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ מ֘וֹשִׁ֤יב יְחִידִ֨ים ׀ בַּ֗יְתָה מוֹצִ֣יא אֲ֭סִירִים בַּכּוֹשָׁר֑וֹת אַ֥ךְ ס֝וֹרְרִ֗ים שָׁכְנ֥וּ צְחִיחָֽה׃
Translated:
God restores the lonely to their homes,
sets free the imprisoned, safe and sound,
while the rebellious must live in a parched land.
Transliteration: Elohim mvoshiyv yechiydiym vayetah mvotsiy asiyriym vakhvosharvot akhe svoreriym shakhenu tsechiychah

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים בְּ֭צֵאתְךָ לִפְנֵ֣י עַמֶּ֑ךָ בְּצַעְדְּךָ֖ בִישִׁימ֣וֹן סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
O God, when You went at the head of Your army,
when You marched through the desert, selah
Transliteration: Elohimm vetsetekha lifeney amekha vetsaedekha viyshiymvon selah

Hebrew: אֶ֤רֶץ רָעָ֨שָׁה ׀ אַף־שָׁמַ֣יִם נָטְפוּ֮ מִפְּנֵ֢י אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים זֶ֥ה סִינַ֑י מִפְּנֵ֥י אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
the earth trembled, the sky rained because of God,
yon Sinai, because of God, the God of Israel.
Transliteration: erets raashah af-shamayiim natefu mifene֢y Elohimm zeh siynay mifeney Elohimm elohey yisherael

Hebrew: גֶּ֣שֶׁם נְ֭דָבוֹת תָּנִ֣יף אֱלֹהִ֑ים נַחֲלָתְךָ֥ וְ֝נִלְאָ֗ה אַתָּ֥ה כוֹנַנְתָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
You released a bountiful rain, O God;
when Your own land languished, You sustained it.
Transliteration: geshem nedavvot taniyf Elohim nachalatekha venileah atah khvonanetah

Hebrew: חַיָּתְךָ֥ יָשְׁבוּ־בָ֑הּ תָּ֤כִֽין־בְּטוֹבָתְךָ֖ לֶֽעָנִ֣י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
Your tribe dwells there;
O God, in Your goodness You provide for the needy.
Transliteration: chayatekha yashevu-vah takhiyn-vetvovatekha leaniy Elohim

Hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֥י יִתֶּן־אֹ֑מֶר הַֽ֝מְבַשְּׂר֗וֹת צָבָ֥א רָֽב׃
Translated:
The Lord gives a command;
the women who bring the news are a great host:
Transliteration: adonay yiten-omer hamevashervot tsava rav

Hebrew: מַלְכֵ֣י צְ֭בָאוֹת יִדֹּד֣וּן יִדֹּד֑וּן וּנְוַת־בַּ֝֗יִת תְּחַלֵּ֥ק שָׁלָֽל׃
Translated:
“The kings and their armies are in headlong flight;
housewives are sharing in the spoils;
Transliteration: malekhey tsevavot yidodun yidodun unevat-vayiyit techalek shalal

Hebrew: אִֽם־תִּשְׁכְּבוּן֮ בֵּ֤ין שְׁפַ֫תָּ֥יִם כַּנְפֵ֣י י֭וֹנָה נֶחְפָּ֣ה בַכֶּ֑סֶף וְ֝אֶבְרוֹתֶ֗יהָ בִּירַקְרַ֥ק חָרֽוּץ׃
Translated:
even for those of you who lie among the sheepfolds
there are wings of a dove sheathed in silver,
its pinions in fine gold.”
Transliteration: im-tishekhevun veyn shefatayiim khanefey yvonah nechefah vakhesef veevervoteyha viyrakerak charuts

Hebrew: בְּפָ֘רֵ֤שׂ שַׁדַּ֓י מְלָ֘כִ֤ים בָּ֗הּ תַּשְׁלֵ֥ג בְּצַלְמֽוֹן׃
Translated:
When Shaddai scattered the kings,
it seemed like a snowstorm in Zalmon.
Transliteration: vefaresh shaday melakhiym vah tasheleg vetsalemvon

Hebrew: הַר־אֱ֭לֹהִים הַר־בָּשָׁ֑ן הַ֥ר גַּ֝בְנֻנִּ֗ים הַר־בָּשָֽׁן׃
Translated:
O majestic mountain, Mount Bashan;
O jagged mountain, Mount Bashan;
Transliteration: har-Elohim har-vashan har gavenuniym har-vashan

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה ׀ תְּֽרַצְּדוּן֮ הָרִ֢ים גַּבְנֻ֫נִּ֥ים הָהָ֗ר חָמַ֣ד אֱלֹהִ֣ים לְשִׁבְתּ֑וֹ אַף־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יִשְׁכֹּ֥ן לָנֶֽצַח׃
Translated:
why so hostile, O jagged mountains,
toward the mountain God desired as His dwelling?
The LORD shall abide there forever.
Transliteration: lamah teratsedun hari֢ym gavenuniym hahar chamad Elohim leshivetvo af-yehovah yishekhon lanetsach

Hebrew: רֶ֤כֶב אֱלֹהִ֗ים רִבֹּתַ֣יִם אַלְפֵ֣י שִׁנְאָ֑ן אֲדֹנָ֥י בָֿ֝֗ם סִינַ֥י בַּקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated:
God’s chariots are myriads upon myriads,
thousands upon thousands;
the Lord is among them as in Sinai in holiness.
Transliteration: rekhev Elohim rivotayiim alefey shinean adonay vֿam siynay vakodesh

Hebrew: עָ֘לִ֤יתָ לַמָּר֨וֹם ׀ שָׁ֘בִ֤יתָ שֶּׁ֗בִי לָקַ֣חְתָּ מַ֭תָּנוֹת בָּאָדָ֑ם וְאַ֥ף ס֝וֹרְרִ֗ים לִשְׁכֹּ֤ן ׀ יָ֬הּ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
You went up to the heights, having taken captives,
having received tribute of men,
even of those who rebel
against the LORD God’s abiding there.
Transliteration: aliyta lamarvom shaviyta sheviy lakacheta matanvot vaadam veaf svoreriym lishekhon yah Elohim

Hebrew: בָּ֤ר֣וּךְ אֲדֹנָי֮ י֤וֹם ׀ י֥֫וֹם יַעֲמׇס־לָ֗נוּ הָ֘אֵ֤ל יְֽשׁוּעָתֵ֬נוּ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Blessed is the Lord.
Day by day He supports us,
God, our deliverance. Selah.
Transliteration: varukhe adonay yvom yvom yaamׇs-lanu hael yeshuatenu selah

Hebrew: הָ֤אֵ֣ל <small>׀</small> לָנוּ֮ אֵ֤ל לְֽמ֫וֹשָׁע֥וֹת וְלֵיהֹוִ֥ה אֲדֹנָ֑י לַ֝מָּ֗וֶת תֹּצָאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
God is for us a God of deliverance;
GOD the Lord provides an escape from death.
Transliteration: hael <small></small> lanu el lemvoshavot veleyhovih adonay lamavet totsavot

Hebrew: אַךְ־אֱלֹהִ֗ים יִמְחַץ֮ רֹ֤אשׁ אֹ֫יְבָ֥יו קׇדְקֹ֥ד שֵׂעָ֑ר מִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ךְ בַּאֲשָׁמָֽיו׃
Translated:
God will smash the heads of His enemies,
the hairy crown of him who walks about in his guilt.
Transliteration: akhe-Elohim yimechats rosh oyevayv kׇdekod shear mitehalekhe vaashamayv

Hebrew: אָמַ֣ר אֲ֭דֹנָי מִבָּשָׁ֣ן אָשִׁ֑יב אָ֝שִׁ֗יב מִֽמְּצֻל֥וֹת יָֽם׃
Translated:
The Lord said, “I will retrieve from Bashan,
I will retrieve from the depths of the sea;
Transliteration: amar adonay mivashan ashiyv ashiyv mimetsulvot yam

Hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן ׀ תִּ֥מְחַ֥ץ רַגְלְךָ֗ בְּ֫דָ֥ם לְשׁ֥וֹן כְּלָבֶ֑יךָ מֵאֹיְבִ֥ים מִנֵּֽהוּ׃
Translated:
that your feet may wade through blood;
that the tongue of your dogs may have its portion of your enemies.”
Transliteration: lemaan timechats ragelekha vedam leshvon khelaveykha meoyeviym minehu

Hebrew: רָא֣וּ הֲלִיכוֹתֶ֣יךָ אֱלֹהִ֑ים הֲלִ֘יכ֤וֹת אֵלִ֖י מַלְכִּ֣י בַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated:
Men see Your processions, O God,
the processions of my God, my king,
into the sanctuary.
Transliteration: rau haliykhvoteykha Elohim haliykhvot eliy malekhiy vakodesh

Hebrew: קִדְּמ֣וּ שָׁ֭רִים אַחַ֣ר נֹגְנִ֑ים בְּת֥וֹךְ עֲ֝לָמ֗וֹת תּוֹפֵפֽוֹת׃
Translated:
First come singers, then musicians,
amidst maidens playing timbrels.
Transliteration: kidemu shariym achar nogeniym vetvokhe alamvot tvofefvot

Hebrew: בְּֽ֭מַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכ֣וּ אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י מִמְּק֥וֹר יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
In assemblies bless God,
the LORD, O you who are from the fountain of Israel.
Transliteration: vemakehelvot varekhu Elohim adonay mimekvor yisherael

Hebrew: שָׁ֤ם בִּנְיָמִ֨ן ׀ צָעִ֡יר רֹדֵ֗ם שָׂרֵ֣י יְ֭הוּדָה רִגְמָתָ֑ם שָׂרֵ֥י זְ֝בֻל֗וּן שָׂרֵ֥י נַפְתָּלִֽי׃
Translated:
There is little Benjamin who rules them,
the princes of Judah who command them,
the princes of Zebulun and Naphtali.
Transliteration: sham vineyamin tsaiyr rodem sharey yehudah rigematam sharey zevulun sharey nafetaliy

Hebrew: צִוָּ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ עֻ֫זֶּ֥ךָ עוּזָּ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים ז֝֗וּ פָּעַ֥לְתָּ לָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Your God has ordained strength for you,
the strength, O God,
which You displayed for us
Transliteration: tsivah eloheykha uzekha uzah Elohim zuu faaleta lanu

Hebrew: מֵ֭הֵיכָלֶךָ עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לְךָ֤ יוֹבִ֖ילוּ מְלָכִ֣ים שָֽׁי׃
Translated:
from Your temple above Jerusalem.
The kings bring You tribute.
Transliteration: meheykhalekha al-yerushala͏im lekha yvoviylu melakhiym shay

Hebrew: גְּעַ֨ר חַיַּ֪ת קָנֶ֡ה עֲדַ֤ת אַבִּירִ֨ים ׀ בְּעֶגְלֵ֬י עַמִּ֗ים מִתְרַפֵּ֥ס בְּרַצֵּי־כָ֑סֶף בִּזַּ֥ר עַ֝מִּ֗ים קְרָב֥וֹת יֶחְפָּֽצוּ׃
Translated:
Blast the beast of the marsh,
the herd of bulls among the peoples, the calves,
till they come cringing with pieces of silver.
Scatter the peoples who delight in wars!
Transliteration: gear chayat kaneh adat aviyriym veegeley amiym miterafes veratsey-khasef vizar amiym keravvot yechefatsu

Hebrew: יֶאֱתָ֣יוּ חַ֭שְׁמַנִּים מִנִּ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם כּ֥וּשׁ תָּרִ֥יץ יָ֝דָ֗יו לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
Tribute-bearers shall come from Egypt;
Cush shall hasten its gifts to God.
Transliteration: yeetayu chashemaniym miniy mitserayiim khush tariyts yadayv lelohiym

Hebrew: מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָ֭אָרֶץ שִׁ֣ירוּ לֵאלֹהִ֑ים זַמְּר֖וּ אֲדֹנָ֣י סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
O kingdoms of the earth,
sing to God;
chant hymns to the Lord, selah
Transliteration: mamelekhvot haarets shiyru lelohiym zameru adonay selah

Hebrew: לָ֭רֹכֵב בִּשְׁמֵ֣י שְׁמֵי־קֶ֑דֶם הֵ֥ן יִתֵּ֥ן בְּ֝קוֹל֗וֹ ק֣וֹל עֹֽז׃
Translated:
to Him who rides the ancient highest heavens,
who thunders forth with His mighty voice.
Transliteration: larokhev vishemey shemey-kedem hen yiten vekvolvo kvol oz

Hebrew: תְּנ֥וּ עֹ֗ז לֵאלֹ֫הִ֥ים עַֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל גַּאֲוָת֑וֹ וְ֝עֻזּ֗וֹ בַּשְּׁחָקִֽים׃
Translated:
Ascribe might to God,
whose majesty is over Israel,
whose might is in the skies.
Transliteration: tenu oz lelohiym al-yisherael gaavatvo veuzvo vashechakiym

Hebrew: נ֤וֹרָ֥א אֱלֹהִ֗ים מִֽמִּקְדָּ֫שֶׁ֥יךָ אֵ֤ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל ה֤וּא נֹתֵ֨ן ׀ עֹ֖ז וְתַעֲצֻמ֥וֹת לָעָ֗ם בָּר֥וּךְ אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
You are awesome, O God, in Your holy places;
it is the God of Israel who gives might and power to the people.
Blessed is God.
Transliteration: nvora Elohim mimikedasheykha el yisherael hu noten oz vetaatsumvot laam varukhe Elohim {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> עַֽל־שׁוֹשַׁנִּ֬ים לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. On shoshannim. Of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha <small></small> al-shvoshaniym ledavid

Hebrew: הוֹשִׁיעֵ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֤י בָ֖אוּ מַ֣יִם עַד־נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated:
Deliver me, O God,
for the waters have reached my neck;
Transliteration: hvoshiyeniy Elohim khiy vau mayiim ad-nafesh

Hebrew: טָבַ֤עְתִּי ׀ בִּיוֵ֣ן מְ֭צוּלָה וְאֵ֣ין מׇעֳמָ֑ד בָּ֥אתִי בְמַעֲמַקֵּי־מַ֝֗יִם וְשִׁבֹּ֥לֶת שְׁטָפָֽתְנִי׃
Translated:
I am sinking into the slimy deep
and find no foothold;
I have come into the watery depths;
the flood sweeps me away.
Transliteration: tavaetiy viyven metsulah veeyn mׇomad vatiy vemaamakey-mayiyim veshivolet shetafateniy

Hebrew: יָגַ֣עְתִּי בְקׇרְאִי֮ נִחַ֢ר גְּר֫וֹנִ֥י כָּל֥וּ עֵינַ֑י מְ֝יַחֵ֗ל לֵאלֹהָֽי׃
Translated:
I am weary with calling;
my throat is dry;
my eyes fail
while I wait for God.
Transliteration: yagaetiy vekׇreiy nicha֢r gervoniy khalu eynay meyachel lelohay

Hebrew: רַבּ֤וּ ׀ מִשַּׂעֲר֣וֹת רֹאשִׁי֮ שֹׂנְאַ֢י חִ֫נָּ֥ם עָצְמ֣וּ מַ֭צְמִיתַי אֹיְבַ֣י שֶׁ֑קֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־גָ֝זַ֗לְתִּי אָ֣ז אָשִֽׁיב׃
Translated:
More numerous than the hairs of my head
are those who hate me without reason;
many are those who would destroy me,
my treacherous enemies.
Must I restore what I have not stolen?
Transliteration: ravu mishaarvot roshiy shonea֢y chinam atsemu matsemiytay oyevay sheker asher lo-gazaletiy az ashiyv

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים אַתָּ֣ה יָ֭דַעְתָּ לְאִוַּלְתִּ֑י וְ֝אַשְׁמוֹתַ֗י מִמְּךָ֥ לֹֽא־נִכְחָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
God, You know my folly;
my guilty deeds are not hidden from You.
Transliteration: Elohimm atah yadaeta leivaletiy veashemvotay mimekha lo-nikhechadu

Hebrew: אַל־יֵ֘בֹ֤שׁוּ בִ֨י ׀ קֹוֶיךָ֮ אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֗ה צְבָ֫א֥וֹת אַל־יִכָּ֣לְמֽוּ בִ֣י מְבַקְשֶׁ֑יךָ אֱ֝לֹהֵ֗י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Let those who look to You,
O Lord, GOD of hosts,
not be disappointed on my account;
let those who seek You,
O God of Israel,
not be shamed because of me.
Transliteration: al-eivoshu viy koveykha adonay yehovih tsevavot al-yikhalemu viy mevakesheykha elohey yisherael

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עָ֭לֶיךָ נָשָׂ֣אתִי חֶרְפָּ֑ה כִּסְּתָ֖ה כְלִמָּ֣ה פָנָֽי׃
Translated:
It is for Your sake that I have been reviled,
that shame covers my face;
Transliteration: khiy-aleykha nashatiy cherefah khisetah khelimah fanay

Hebrew: מ֭וּזָר הָיִ֣יתִי לְאֶחָ֑י וְ֝נׇכְרִ֗י לִבְנֵ֥י אִמִּֽי׃
Translated:
I am a stranger to my brothers,
an alien to my kin.
Transliteration: muzar hayiytiy leechay venׇkheriy liveney imiy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־קִנְאַ֣ת בֵּיתְךָ֣ אֲכָלָ֑תְנִי וְחֶרְפּ֥וֹת ח֝וֹרְפֶ֗יךָ נָפְל֥וּ עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
My zeal for Your house has been my undoing;
the reproaches of those who revile You have fallen upon me.
Transliteration: khiy-kineat veytekha akhalateniy vecherefvot chvorefeykha nafelu alay

Hebrew: וָאֶבְכֶּ֣ה בַצּ֣וֹם נַפְשִׁ֑י וַתְּהִ֖י לַחֲרָפ֣וֹת לִֽי׃
Translated:
When I wept and fasted,
I was reviled for it.
Transliteration: vaevekheh vatsvom nafeshiy vatehiy lacharafvot liy

Hebrew: וָאֶתְּנָ֣ה לְבוּשִׁ֣י שָׂ֑ק וָאֱהִ֖י לָהֶ֣ם לְמָשָֽׁל׃
Translated:
I made sackcloth my garment;
I became a byword among them.
Transliteration: vaetenah levushiy shak vaehiy lahem lemashal

Hebrew: יָשִׂ֣יחוּ בִ֭י יֹ֣שְׁבֵי שָׁ֑עַר וּ֝נְגִינ֗וֹת שׁוֹתֵ֥י שֵׁכָֽר׃
Translated:
Those who sit in the gate talk about me;
I am the taunt of drunkards.
Transliteration: yashiychu viy yoshevey shaar unegiynvot shvotey shekhar

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י תְפִלָּֽתִי־לְךָ֨ ׀ יְהֹוָ֡ה עֵ֤ת רָצ֗וֹן אֱלֹהִ֥ים בְּרׇב־חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ עֲ֝נֵ֗נִי בֶּאֱמֶ֥ת יִשְׁעֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
As for me, may my prayer come to You, O LORD,
at a favorable moment;
O God, in Your abundant faithfulness,
answer me with Your sure deliverance.
Transliteration: vaaniy tefilatiy-lekha yehovah et ratsvon Elohim verׇv-chasedekha aneniy veemet yisheekha

Hebrew: הַצִּילֵ֣נִי מִ֭טִּיט וְאַל־אֶטְבָּ֑עָה אִנָּצְלָ֥ה מִ֝שֹּׂנְאַ֗י וּמִמַּ֖עֲמַקֵּי־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Rescue me from the mire;
let me not sink;
let me be rescued from my enemies,
and from the watery depths.
Transliteration: hatsiyleniy mitiyt veal-etevaah inatselah mishoneay umimaamakey-mayiim

Hebrew: אַל־תִּשְׁטְפֵ֤נִי ׀ שִׁבֹּ֣לֶת מַ֭יִם וְאַל־תִּבְלָעֵ֣נִי מְצוּלָ֑ה וְאַל־תֶּאְטַר־עָלַ֖י בְּאֵ֣ר פִּֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Let the floodwaters not sweep me away;
let the deep not swallow me;
let the mouth of the Pit not close over me.
Transliteration: al-tishetefeniy shivolet mayiim veal-tivelaeniy metsulah veal-teetar-alay veer fiyha

Hebrew: עֲנֵ֣נִי יְ֭הֹוָה כִּי־ט֣וֹב חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ כְּרֹ֥ב רַ֝חֲמֶ֗יךָ פְּנֵ֣ה אֵלָֽי׃
Translated:
Answer me, O LORD,
according to Your great steadfastness;
in accordance with Your abundant mercy
turn to me;
Transliteration: aneniy yehovah khiy-tvov chasedekha kherov rachameykha feneh elay

Hebrew: וְאַל־תַּסְתֵּ֣ר פָּ֭נֶיךָ מֵעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּי־צַר־לִ֝֗י מַהֵ֥ר עֲנֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
do not hide Your face from Your servant,
for I am in distress;
answer me quickly.
Transliteration: veal-taseter faneykha meavedekha khiy-tsar-liy maher aneniy

Hebrew: קׇרְבָ֣ה אֶל־נַפְשִׁ֣י גְאָלָ֑הּ לְמַ֖עַן אֹיְבַ֣י פְּדֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Come near to me and redeem me;
free me from my enemies.
Transliteration: kׇrevah el-nafeshiy gealah lemaan oyevay fedeniy

Hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה יָדַ֗עְתָּ חֶרְפָּתִ֣י וּ֭בׇשְׁתִּי וּכְלִמָּתִ֑י נֶ֝גְדְּךָ֗ כׇּל־צוֹרְרָֽי׃
Translated:
You know my reproach,
my shame, my disgrace;
You are aware of all my foes.
Transliteration: atah yadaeta cherefatiy uvׇshetiy ukhelimatiy negedekha khׇl-tsvoreray

Hebrew: חֶרְפָּ֤ה ׀ שָׁ֥בְרָ֥ה לִבִּ֗י וָאָ֫נ֥וּשָׁה וָאֲקַוֶּ֣ה לָנ֣וּד וָאַ֑יִן וְ֝לַמְנַחֲמִ֗ים וְלֹ֣א מָצָֽאתִי׃
Translated:
Reproach breaks my heart,
I am in despair;
I hope for consolation, but there is none,
for comforters, but find none.
Transliteration: cherefah shaverah liviy vaanushah vaakaveh lanud vaayiin velamenachamiym velo matsatiy

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֣וּ בְּבָרוּתִ֣י רֹ֑אשׁ וְ֝לִצְמָאִ֗י יַשְׁק֥וּנִי חֹֽמֶץ׃
Translated:
They give me gall for food,
vinegar to quench my thirst.
Transliteration: vayitenu vevarutiy rosh velitsemaiy yashekuniy chomets

Hebrew: יְהִי־שֻׁלְחָנָ֣ם לִפְנֵיהֶ֣ם לְפָ֑ח וְלִשְׁלוֹמִ֥ים לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
May their table be a trap for them,
a snare for their allies.
Transliteration: yehiy-shulechanam lifeneyhem lefach velishelvomiym lemvokesh

Hebrew: תֶּחְשַׁ֣כְנָה עֵ֭ינֵיהֶם מֵרְא֑וֹת וּ֝מׇתְנֵיהֶ֗ם תָּמִ֥יד הַמְעַֽד׃
Translated:
May their eyes grow dim so that they cannot see;
may their loins collapse continually.
Transliteration: techeshakhenah eyneyhem merevot umׇteneyhem tamiyd hamead

Hebrew: שְׁפׇךְ־עֲלֵיהֶ֥ם זַעְמֶ֑ךָ וַחֲר֥וֹן אַ֝פְּךָ֗ יַשִּׂיגֵֽם׃
Translated:
Pour out Your wrath on them;
may Your blazing anger overtake them;
Transliteration: shefׇkhe-aleyhem zaemekha vacharvon afekha yashiygem

Hebrew: תְּהִי־טִירָתָ֥ם נְשַׁמָּ֑ה בְּ֝אׇהֳלֵיהֶ֗ם אַל־יְהִ֥י יֹשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
may their encampments be desolate;
may their tents stand empty.
Transliteration: tehiy-tiyratam neshamah veׇholeyhem al-yehiy yoshev

Hebrew: כִּי־אַתָּ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־הִכִּ֣יתָ רָדָ֑פוּ וְאֶל־מַכְא֖וֹב חֲלָלֶ֣יךָ יְסַפֵּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
For they persecute those You have struck;
they talk about the pain of those You have felled.
Transliteration: khiy-atah asher-hikhiyta radafu veel-makhevov chalaleykha yesaferu

Hebrew: תְּֽנָה־עָ֭וֺן עַל־עֲוֺנָ֑ם וְאַל־יָ֝בֹ֗אוּ בְּצִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Add that to their guilt;
let them have no share of Your beneficence;
Transliteration: tenah-avon al-avonam veal-yavou vetsidekatekha

Hebrew: יִ֭מָּחֽוּ מִסֵּ֣פֶר חַיִּ֑ים וְעִ֥ם צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים אַל־יִכָּתֵֽבוּ׃
Translated:
may they be erased from the book of life,
and not be inscribed with the righteous.
Transliteration: yimachu misefer chayiym veim tsadiykiym al-yikhatevu

Hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי עָנִ֣י וְכוֹאֵ֑ב יְשׁוּעָתְךָ֖ אֱלֹהִ֣ים תְּשַׂגְּבֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
But I am lowly and in pain;
Your help, O God, keeps me safe.
Transliteration: vaaniy aniy vekhvoev yeshuatekha Elohim teshageveniy

Hebrew: אֲהַלְלָ֣ה שֵׁם־אֱלֹהִ֣ים בְּשִׁ֑יר וַאֲגַדְּלֶ֥נּוּ בְתוֹדָֽה׃
Translated:
I will extol God’s name with song,
and exalt Him with praise.
Transliteration: ahalelah shem-Elohim veshiyr vaagadelenu vetvodah

Hebrew: וְתִיטַ֣ב לַ֭יהֹוָה מִשּׁ֥וֹר פָּ֗ר מַקְרִ֥ן מַפְרִֽיס׃
Translated:
That will please the LORD more than oxen,
than bulls with horns and hooves.
Transliteration: vetiytav layhovah mishvor far makerin maferiys

Hebrew: רָא֣וּ עֲנָוִ֣ים יִשְׂמָ֑חוּ דֹּרְשֵׁ֥י אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים וִיחִ֥י לְבַבְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
The lowly will see and rejoice;
you who are mindful of God, take heart!
Transliteration: rau anaviym yishemachu doreshey Elohimm viychiy levavekhem

Hebrew: כִּי־שֹׁמֵ֣עַ אֶל־אֶבְיוֹנִ֣ים יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֶת־אֲ֝סִירָ֗יו לֹ֣א בָזָֽה׃
Translated:
For the LORD listens to the needy,
and does not spurn His captives.
Transliteration: khiy-shomea el-eveyvoniym yehovah veet-asiyrayv lo vazah

Hebrew: יְֽ֭הַלְלוּהוּ שָׁמַ֣יִם וָאָ֑רֶץ יַ֝מִּ֗ים וְֽכׇל־רֹמֵ֥שׂ בָּֽם׃
Translated:
Heaven and earth shall extol Him,
the seas, and all that moves in them.
Transliteration: yehaleluhu shamayiim vaarets yamiym vekhׇl-romesh vam

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ י֘וֹשִׁ֤יעַ צִיּ֗וֹן וְ֭יִבְנֶה עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וְיָ֥שְׁבוּ שָׁ֝֗ם וִירֵשֽׁוּהָ׃
Translated:
For God will deliver Zion
and rebuild the cities of Judah;
they shall live there and inherit it;
Transliteration: khiy Elohim yvoshiya tsiyyvon veyiiveneh arey yehudah veyashevu sham viyreshuha

Hebrew: וְזֶ֣רַע עֲ֭בָדָיו יִנְחָל֑וּהָ וְאֹהֲבֵ֥י שְׁ֝מ֗וֹ יִשְׁכְּנוּ־בָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
the offspring of His servants shall possess it;
those who cherish His name shall dwell there.
Transliteration: vezera avadayv yinechaluha veohavey shemvo yishekhenu-vah {f}

Hebrew: לַ֝מְנַצֵּ֗חַ לְדָוִ֥ד לְהַזְכִּֽיר׃
Translated: For the leader. Of David. Lehazkir.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha ledavid lehazekhiyr

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֥ים לְהַצִּילֵ֑נִי יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי חֽוּשָׁה׃
Translated:
Hasten, O God, to save me;
O LORD, to aid me!
Transliteration: Elohim lehatsiyleniy yehovah leezeratiy chushah

Hebrew: יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ וְיַחְפְּרוּ֮ מְבַקְשֵׁ֢י נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י יִסֹּ֣גוּ אָ֭חוֹר וְיִכָּלְמ֑וּ חֲ֝פֵצֵ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Let those who seek my life
be frustrated and disgraced;
let those who wish me harm,
fall back in shame.
Transliteration: eivoshu veyacheferu mevakeshe֢y nafeshiy yisogu achvor veyikhalemu chafetsey raatiy

Hebrew: יָ֭שׁוּבוּ עַל־עֵ֣קֶב בׇּשְׁתָּ֑ם הָ֝אֹמְרִ֗ים הֶ֘אָ֥ח <small>׀</small> הֶאָֽח׃
Translated:
Let those who say, “Aha! Aha!”
turn back because of their frustration.
Transliteration: yashuvu al-ekev vׇshetam haomeriym heach <small></small> heach

Hebrew: יָ֘שִׂ֤ישׂוּ וְיִשְׂמְח֨וּ ׀ בְּךָ֗ כׇּֽל־מְבַ֫קְשֶׁ֥יךָ וְיֹאמְר֣וּ תָ֭מִיד יִגְדַּ֣ל אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֹ֝הֲבֵ֗י יְשׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
But let all who seek You be glad and rejoice in You;
let those who are eager for Your deliverance always say,
“Extolled be God!”
Transliteration: yashiyshu veyishemechu vekha khׇl-mevakesheykha veyomeru tamiyd yigedal Elohim ohavey yeshuatekha

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְיוֹן֮ אֱלֹהִ֢ים ח֫וּשָׁה־לִּ֥י עֶזְרִ֣י וּמְפַלְטִ֣י אַ֑תָּה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אַל־תְּאַחַֽר׃ {פ}
Translated:
But I am poor and needy;
O God, hasten to me!
You are my help and my rescuer;
O LORD, do not delay.
Transliteration: vaaniy aniy veeveyvon Elohim chushah-liy ezeriy umefaletiy atah yehovah al-teachar {f}

Hebrew: בְּךָֽ־יְהֹוָ֥ה חָסִ֑יתִי אַל־אֵב֥וֹשָׁה לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
I seek refuge in You, O LORD;
may I never be disappointed.
Transliteration: vekha-yehovah chasiytiy al-evvoshah levolam

Hebrew: בְּצִדְקָתְךָ֗ תַּצִּילֵ֥נִי וּֽתְפַלְּטֵ֑נִי הַטֵּֽה־אֵלַ֥י אׇ֝זְנְךָ֗ וְהוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
As You are beneficent, save me and rescue me;
incline Your ear to me and deliver me.
Transliteration: vetsidekatekha tatsiyleniy utefaleteniy hateh-elay ׇzenekha vehvoshiyeniy

Hebrew: הֱיֵ֤ה לִ֨י ׀ לְצ֥וּר מָע֡וֹן לָב֗וֹא תָּמִ֗יד צִוִּ֥יתָ לְהוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי כִּֽי־סַלְעִ֖י וּמְצוּדָתִ֣י אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
Be a sheltering rock for me to which I may always repair;
decree my deliverance,
for You are my rock and my fortress.
Transliteration: heeih liy letsur mavon lavvo tamiyd tsiviyta lehvoshiyeniy khiy-saleiy umetsudatiy atah

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהַ֗י פַּ֭לְּטֵנִי מִיַּ֣ד רָשָׁ֑ע מִכַּ֖ף מְעַוֵּ֣ל וְחוֹמֵֽץ׃
Translated:
My God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked,
from the grasp of the unjust and the lawless.
Transliteration: elohay faleteniy miyad rasha mikhaf meavel vechvomets

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה תִקְוָתִ֑י אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱ֝הֹוִ֗ה מִבְטַחִ֥י מִנְּעוּרָֽי׃
Translated:
For You are my hope,
O Lord GOD,
my trust from my youth.
Transliteration: khiy-atah tikevatiy adonay yehovih mivetachiy mineuray

Hebrew: עָלֶ֤יךָ ׀ נִסְמַ֬כְתִּי מִבֶּ֗טֶן מִמְּעֵ֣י אִ֭מִּי אַתָּ֣ה גוֹזִ֑י בְּךָ֖ תְהִלָּתִ֣י תָמִֽיד׃
Translated:
While yet unborn, I depended on You;
in the womb of my mother, You were my support;
I sing Your praises always.
Transliteration: aleykha nisemakhetiy miveten mimeey imiy atah gvoziy vekha tehilatiy tamiyd

Hebrew: כְּ֭מוֹפֵת הָיִ֣יתִי לְרַבִּ֑ים וְ֝אַתָּ֗ה מַֽחֲסִי־עֹֽז׃
Translated:
I have become an example for many,
since You are my mighty refuge.
Transliteration: khemvofet hayiytiy leraviym veatah machasiy-oz

Hebrew: יִמָּ֣לֵא פִ֭י תְּהִלָּתֶ֑ךָ כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם תִּפְאַרְתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
My mouth is full of praise to You,
glorifying You all day long.
Transliteration: yimale fiy tehilatekha khׇl-hayyvom tifearetekha

Hebrew: אַֽל־תַּ֭שְׁלִיכֵנִי לְעֵ֣ת זִקְנָ֑ה כִּכְל֥וֹת כֹּ֝חִ֗י אַֽל־תַּעַזְבֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Do not cast me off in old age;
when my strength fails, do not forsake me!
Transliteration: al-tasheliykheniy leet zikenah khikhelvot khochiy al-taazeveniy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אָמְר֣וּ אוֹיְבַ֣י לִ֑י וְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י נוֹעֲצ֥וּ יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated:
For my enemies talk against me;
those who wait for me are of one mind,
Transliteration: khiy-ameru voyevay liy veshomerey nafeshiy nvoatsu yachedav

Hebrew: לֵ֭אמֹר אֱלֹהִ֣ים עֲזָב֑וֹ רִֽדְפ֥וּ וְ֝תִפְשׂ֗וּהוּ כִּי־אֵ֥ין מַצִּֽיל׃
Translated:
saying, “God has forsaken him;
chase him and catch him,
for no one will save him!”
Transliteration: lemor Elohim azavvo ridefu vetifeshuhu khiy-eyn matsiyl

Hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים אַל־תִּרְחַ֣ק מִמֶּ֑נִּי אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי (חישה) [חֽוּשָׁה]׃
Translated:
O God, be not far from me;
my God, hasten to my aid!
Transliteration: Elohim al-tirechak mimeniy elohay leezeratiy (chyshh) [chushah]

Hebrew: יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ יִכְלוּ֮ שֹׂטְנֵ֢י נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י יַעֲט֣וּ חֶ֭רְפָּה וּכְלִמָּ֑ה מְ֝בַקְשֵׁ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Let my accusers perish in frustration;
let those who seek my ruin be clothed in reproach and disgrace!
Transliteration: eivoshu yikhelu shotene֢y nafeshiy yaatu cherefah ukhelimah mevakeshey raatiy

Hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי תָּמִ֣יד אֲיַחֵ֑ל וְ֝הוֹסַפְתִּ֗י עַל־כׇּל־תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
As for me, I will hope always,
and add to the many praises of You.
Transliteration: vaaniy tamiyd ayachel vehvosafetiy al-khׇl-tehilatekha

Hebrew: פִּ֤י ׀ יְסַפֵּ֬ר צִדְקָתֶ֗ךָ כׇּל־הַיּ֥וֹם תְּשׁוּעָתֶ֑ךָ כִּ֤י לֹ֖א יָדַ֣עְתִּי סְפֹרֽוֹת׃
Translated:
My mouth tells of Your beneficence,
of Your deliverance all day long,
though I know not how to tell it.
Transliteration: fiy yesafer tsidekatekha khׇl-hayyvom teshuatekha khiy lo yadaetiy seforvot

Hebrew: אָב֗וֹא בִּ֭גְבֻרוֹת אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה אַזְכִּ֖יר צִדְקָתְךָ֣ לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
I come with praise of Your mighty acts, O Lord GOD;
I celebrate Your beneficence, Yours alone.
Transliteration: avvo vigevurvot adonay yehovih azekhiyr tsidekatekha levadekha

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים לִמַּדְתַּ֥נִי מִנְּעוּרָ֑י וְעַד־הֵ֝֗נָּה אַגִּ֥יד נִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You have let me experience it, God, from my youth;
until now I have proclaimed Your wondrous deeds,
Transliteration: Elohimm limadetaniy mineuray vead-henah agiyd nifelevoteykha

Hebrew: וְגַ֤ם עַד־זִקְנָ֨ה ׀ וְשֵׂיבָה֮ אֱלֹהִ֢ים אַֽל־תַּ֫עַזְבֵ֥נִי עַד־אַגִּ֣יד זְרוֹעֲךָ֣ לְד֑וֹר לְכׇל־יָ֝ב֗וֹא גְּבוּרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
and even in hoary old age do not forsake me, God,
until I proclaim Your strength to the next generation,
Your mighty acts, to all who are to come,
Transliteration: vegam ad-zikenah vesheyvah Elohim al-taazeveniy ad-agiyd zervoakha ledvor lekhׇl-yavvo gevuratekha

Hebrew: וְצִדְקָתְךָ֥ אֱלֹהִ֗ים עַד־מָ֫ר֥וֹם אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֥יתָ גְדֹל֑וֹת אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים מִ֣י כָמֽוֹךָ׃
Translated:
Your beneficence, high as the heavens, O God,
You who have done great things;
O God, who is Your peer!
Transliteration: vetsidekatekha Elohim ad-marvom asher-ashiyta gedolvot Elohimm miy khamvokha

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר (הראיתנו) [הִרְאִיתַ֨נִי ׀] צָר֥וֹת רַבּ֗וֹת וְרָ֫ע֥וֹת תָּשׁ֥וּב (תחינו) [תְּחַיֵּ֑נִי] וּֽמִתְּהֹמ֥וֹת הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ תָּשׁ֥וּב תַּעֲלֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
You who have made me undergo many troubles and misfortunes
will revive me again,
and raise me up from the depths of the earth.
Transliteration: asher (hrytnv) [hireiytaniy ] tsarvot ravvot veravot tashuv (tchynv) [techayeniy] umitehomvot haarets tashuv taaleniy

Translated:
You will grant me much greatness,
You will turn and comfort me.
Transliteration: terev gedulatiy vetisov tenachameniy

Hebrew: גַּם־אֲנִ֤י ׀ אוֹדְךָ֣ בִכְלִי־נֶבֶל֮ אֲמִתְּךָ֢ אֱלֹ֫הָ֥י אֲזַמְּרָ֣ה לְךָ֣ בְכִנּ֑וֹר קְ֝ד֗וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Then I will acclaim You to the music of the lyre
for Your faithfulness, O my God;
I will sing a hymn to You with a harp,
O Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: gam-aniy vodekha vikheliy-nevel amitekha֢ elohay azamerah lekha vekhinvor kedvosh yisherael

Hebrew: תְּרַנֵּ֣נָּה שְׂ֭פָתַי כִּ֣י אֲזַמְּרָה־לָּ֑ךְ וְ֝נַפְשִׁ֗י אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּדִֽיתָ׃
Translated:
My lips shall be jubilant, as I sing a hymn to You,
my whole being, which You have redeemed.
Transliteration: teranenah shefatay khiy azamerah-lakhe venafeshiy asher fadiyta

Hebrew: גַּם־לְשׁוֹנִ֗י כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם תֶּהְגֶּ֣ה צִדְקָתֶ֑ךָ כִּי־בֹ֥שׁוּ כִי־חָ֝פְר֗וּ מְבַקְשֵׁ֥י רָעָתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
All day long my tongue shall recite Your beneficent acts,
how those who sought my ruin were frustrated and disgraced.
Transliteration: gam-leshvoniy khׇl-hayyvom tehegeh tsidekatekha khiy-voshu khiy-chaferu mevakeshey raatiy {f}

Hebrew: לִשְׁלֹמֹ֨ה ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים מִ֭שְׁפָּטֶיךָ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ תֵּ֑ן וְצִדְקָתְךָ֥ לְבֶן־מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated:
Of Solomon.

O God, endow the king with Your judgments,
the king’s son with Your righteousness;
Transliteration: lishelomoh Elohimm mishefateykha lemelekhe ten vetsidekatekha leven-melekhe

Hebrew: יָדִ֣ין עַמְּךָ֣ בְצֶ֑דֶק וַעֲנִיֶּ֥יךָ בְמִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
that he may judge Your people rightly,
Your lowly ones, justly.
Transliteration: yadiyn amekha vetsedek vaaniyeykha vemishefat

Hebrew: יִשְׂא֤וּ הָרִ֓ים שָׁ֘ל֥וֹם לָעָ֑ם וּ֝גְבָע֗וֹת בִּצְדָקָֽה׃
Translated:
Let the mountains produce well-being for the people,
the hills, the reward of justice.
Transliteration: yisheu hariym shalvom laam ugevavot vitsedakah

Hebrew: יִשְׁפֹּ֤ט ׀ עֲֽנִיֵּי־עָ֗ם י֭וֹשִׁיעַ לִבְנֵ֣י אֶבְי֑וֹן וִ֖ידַכֵּ֣א עוֹשֵֽׁק׃
Translated:
Let him champion the lowly among the people,
deliver the needy folk,
and crush those who wrong them.
Transliteration: yishefot aniyey-am yvoshiya liveney eveyvon viydakhe voshek

Hebrew: יִירָא֥וּךָ עִם־שָׁ֑מֶשׁ וְלִפְנֵ֥י יָ֝רֵ֗חַ דּ֣וֹר דּוֹרִֽים׃
Translated:
Let them fear You as long as the sun shines,
while the moon lasts, generations on end.
Transliteration: yiyraukha im-shamesh velifeney yarecha dvor dvoriym

Hebrew: יֵ֭רֵד כְּמָטָ֣ר עַל־גֵּ֑ז כִּ֝רְבִיבִ֗ים זַרְזִ֥יף אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Let him be like rain that falls on a mown field,
like a downpour of rain on the ground,
Transliteration: eired khematar al-gez khireviyviym zareziyf arets

Hebrew: יִֽפְרַח־בְּיָמָ֥יו צַדִּ֑יק וְרֹ֥ב שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם עַד־בְּלִ֥י יָרֵֽחַ׃
Translated:
that the righteous may flourish in his time,
and well-being abound, till the moon is no more.
Transliteration: yiferach-veyamayv tsadiyk verov shalvom ad-veliy yarecha

Hebrew: וְ֭יֵרְדְּ מִיָּ֣ם עַד־יָ֑ם וּ֝מִנָּהָ֗ר עַד־אַפְסֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Let him rule from sea to sea,
from the river to the ends of the earth.
Transliteration: veeierede miyam ad-yam uminahar ad-afesey-arets

Hebrew: לְ֭פָנָיו יִכְרְע֣וּ צִיִּ֑ים וְ֝אֹיְבָ֗יו עָפָ֥ר יְלַחֵֽכוּ׃
Translated:
Let desert-dwellers kneel before him,
and his enemies lick the dust.
Transliteration: lefanayv yikhereu tsiyiym veoyevayv afar yelachekhu

Hebrew: מַלְכֵ֬י תַרְשִׁ֣ישׁ וְ֭אִיִּים מִנְחָ֣ה יָשִׁ֑יבוּ מַלְכֵ֥י שְׁבָ֥א וּ֝סְבָ֗א אֶשְׁכָּ֥ר יַקְרִֽיבוּ׃
Translated:
Let kings of Tarshish and the islands pay tribute,
kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.
Transliteration: malekhey tareshiysh veiyiym minechah yashiyvu malekhey sheva useva eshekhar yakeriyvu

Hebrew: וְיִשְׁתַּחֲווּ־ל֥וֹ כׇל־מְלָכִ֑ים כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֥ם יַעַבְדֽוּהוּ׃
Translated:
Let all kings bow to him,
and all nations serve him.
Transliteration: veyishetachavu-lvo khׇl-melakhiym khׇl-gvoyim yaaveduhu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יַ֭צִּיל אֶבְי֣וֹן מְשַׁוֵּ֑עַ וְ֝עָנִ֗י וְֽאֵין־עֹזֵ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For he saves the needy who cry out,
the lowly who have no helper.
Transliteration: khiy-yatsiyl eveyvon meshavea veaniy veeyn-ozer lvo

Hebrew: יָ֭חֹס עַל־דַּ֣ל וְאֶבְי֑וֹן וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹת אֶבְיוֹנִ֣ים יוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
He cares about the poor and the needy;
He brings the needy deliverance.
Transliteration: yachos al-dal veeveyvon venafeshvot eveyvoniym yvoshiya

Hebrew: מִתּ֣וֹךְ וּ֭מֵחָמָס יִגְאַ֣ל נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְיֵיקַ֖ר דָּמָ֣ם בְּעֵינָֽיו׃
Translated:
He redeems them from fraud and lawlessness;
the shedding of their blood weighs heavily upon him.
Transliteration: mitvokhe umechamas yigeal nafesham veeiykar damam veeynayv

Hebrew: וִיחִ֗י וְיִתֶּן־לוֹ֮ מִזְּהַ֢ב שְׁ֫בָ֥א וְיִתְפַּלֵּ֣ל בַּעֲד֣וֹ תָמִ֑יד כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם יְבָרְכֶֽנְהוּ׃
Translated:
So let him live, and receive gold of Sheba;
let prayers for him be said always,
blessings on him invoked at all times.
Transliteration: viychiy veyiten-lvo mizeha֢v sheva veyitefalel vaadvo tamiyd khׇl-hayyvom yevarekhenehu

Hebrew: יְהִ֤י פִסַּת־בַּ֨ר ׀ בָּאָרֶץ֮ בְּרֹ֢אשׁ הָ֫רִ֥ים יִרְעַ֣שׁ כַּלְּבָנ֣וֹן פִּרְי֑וֹ וְיָצִ֥יצוּ מֵ֝עִ֗יר כְּעֵ֣שֶׂב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Let abundant grain be in the land, to the tops of the mountains;
let his crops thrive like the forest of Lebanon;
and let men sprout up in towns like country grass.
Transliteration: yehiy fisat-var vaarets vero֢sh hariym yireash khalevanvon fireyvo veyatsiytsu meiyr kheeshev haarets

Hebrew: יְהִ֤י שְׁמ֨וֹ ׀ לְֽעוֹלָ֗ם לִפְנֵי־שֶׁמֶשׁ֮ (ינין) [יִנּ֢וֹן] שְׁ֫מ֥וֹ וְיִתְבָּ֥רְכוּ ב֑וֹ כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֥ם יְאַשְּׁרֽוּהוּ׃
Translated:
May his name be eternal;
while the sun lasts, may his name endure;
let men invoke his blessedness upon themselves;
let all nations count him happy.
Transliteration: yehiy shemvo levolam lifeney-shemesh (ynyn) [yin֢von] shemvo veyitevarekhu vvo khׇl-gvoyim yeasheruhu

Hebrew: בָּר֤וּךְ ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עֹשֵׂ֖ה נִפְלָא֣וֹת לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Blessed is the LORD God, God of Israel,
who alone does wondrous things;
Transliteration: varukhe yehovah Elohim elohey yisherael osheh nifelavot levadvo

Hebrew: וּבָר֤וּךְ ׀ שֵׁ֥ם כְּבוֹד֗וֹ לְע֫וֹלָ֥ם וְיִמָּלֵ֣א כְ֭בוֹדוֹ אֶת־כֹּ֥ל הָאָ֗רֶץ אָ֘מֵ֥ן ׀ וְאָמֵֽן׃
Translated:
Blessed is His glorious name forever;
His glory fills the whole world.
Amen and Amen.
Transliteration: uvarukhe shem khevvodvo levolam veyimale khevvodvo et-khol haarets amen veamen

Hebrew: כׇּלּ֥וּ תְפִלּ֑וֹת דָּ֝וִ֗ד בֶּן־יִשָֽׁי׃
Translated: End of the prayers of David son of Jesse.
Transliteration: khׇlu tefilvot david ven-yishay

Hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אַ֤ךְ ט֖וֹב לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אֱלֹהִ֗ים לְבָרֵ֥י לֵבָֽב׃
Translated:
A psalm of Asaph.

God is truly good to Israel,
to those whose heart is pure.
Transliteration: mizemvor leasaf akhe tvov leyisherael Elohim levarey levav

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י כִּ֭מְעַט (נטוי) [נָטָ֣יוּ] רַגְלָ֑י כְּ֝אַ֗יִן (שפכה) [שֻׁפְּכ֥וּ] אֲשֻׁרָֽי׃
Translated:
As for me, my feet had almost strayed,
my steps were nearly led off course,
Transliteration: vaaniy khimeat (ntvy) [natayu] ragelay kheayiin (shfkhh) [shufekhu] ashuray

Hebrew: כִּֽי־קִ֭נֵּאתִי בַּהוֹלְלִ֑ים שְׁל֖וֹם רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֶרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
for I envied the wanton;
I saw the wicked at ease.
Transliteration: khiy-kinetiy vahvoleliym shelvom reshaiym ereeh

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֖ין חַרְצֻבּ֥וֹת לְמוֹתָ֗ם וּבָרִ֥יא אוּלָֽם׃
Translated:
Death has no pangs for them;
their body is healthy.
Transliteration: khiy eyn charetsuvvot lemvotam uvariy ulam

Hebrew: בַּעֲמַ֣ל אֱנ֣וֹשׁ אֵינֵ֑מוֹ וְעִם־אָ֝דָ֗ם לֹ֣א יְנֻגָּֽעוּ׃
Translated:
They have no part in the travail of men;
they are not afflicted like the rest of mankind.
Transliteration: vaamal envosh eynemvo veim-adam lo yenugau

Hebrew: לָ֭כֵן עֲנָקַ֣תְמוֹ גַאֲוָ֑ה יַעֲטָף־שִׁ֝֗ית חָמָ֥ס לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
So pride adorns their necks,
lawlessness enwraps them as a mantle.
Transliteration: lakhen anakatemvo gaavah yaataf-shiyt chamas lamvo

Hebrew: יָ֭צָא מֵחֵ֣לֶב עֵינֵ֑מוֹ עָ֝בְר֗וּ מַשְׂכִּיּ֥וֹת לֵבָֽב׃
Translated:
Fat shuts out their eyes;
their fancies are extravagant.
Transliteration: yatsa mechelev eynemvo averu mashekhiyyvot levav

Hebrew: יָמִ֤יקוּ ׀ וִידַבְּר֣וּ בְרָ֣ע עֹ֑שֶׁק מִמָּר֥וֹם יְדַבֵּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
They scoff and plan evil;
from their eminence they plan wrongdoing.
Transliteration: yamiyku viydaveru vera oshek mimarvom yedaveru

Hebrew: שַׁתּ֣וּ בַשָּׁמַ֣יִם פִּיהֶ֑ם וּ֝לְשׁוֹנָ֗ם תִּהֲלַ֥ךְ בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
They set their mouths against heaven,
and their tongues range over the earth.
Transliteration: shatu vashamayiim fiyhem uleshvonam tihalakhe vaarets

Hebrew: לָכֵ֤ן ׀ (ישיב) [יָשׁ֣וּב] עַמּ֣וֹ הֲלֹ֑ם וּמֵ֥י מָ֝לֵ֗א יִמָּ֥צוּ לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
So they pound His people again and again,
until they are drained of their very last tear.
Transliteration: lakhen (yshyv) [yashuv] amvo halom umey male yimatsu lamvo

Hebrew: וְֽאָמְר֗וּ אֵיכָ֥ה יָדַֽע־אֵ֑ל וְיֵ֖שׁ דֵּעָ֣ה בְעֶלְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Then they say, “How could God know?
Is there knowledge with the Most High?”
Transliteration: veameru eykhah yada-el veeish deah veeleyvon

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־אֵ֥לֶּה רְשָׁעִ֑ים וְשַׁלְוֵ֥י ע֝וֹלָ֗ם הִשְׂגּוּ־חָֽיִל׃
Translated:
Such are the wicked;
ever tranquil, they amass wealth.
Transliteration: hineh-eleh reshaiym veshalevey volam hishegu-chayiil

Hebrew: אַךְ־רִ֭יק זִכִּ֣יתִי לְבָבִ֑י וָאֶרְחַ֖ץ בְּנִקָּי֣וֹן כַּפָּֽי׃
Translated:
It was for nothing that I kept my heart pure
and washed my hands in innocence,
Transliteration: akhe-riyk zikhiytiy levaviy vaerechats venikayvon khafay

Hebrew: וָאֱהִ֣י נָ֭גוּעַ כׇּל־הַיּ֑וֹם וְ֝תוֹכַחְתִּ֗י לַבְּקָרִֽים׃
Translated:
seeing that I have been constantly afflicted,
that each morning brings new punishments.
Transliteration: vaehiy nagua khׇl-hayyvom vetvokhachetiy lavekariym

Hebrew: אִם־אָ֭מַרְתִּי אֲסַפְּרָ֥ה כְמ֑וֹ הִנֵּ֤ה ד֖וֹר בָּנֶ֣יךָ בָגָֽדְתִּי׃
Translated:
Had I decided to say these things,
I should have been false to the circle of Your disciples.
Transliteration: im-amaretiy asaferah khemvo hineh dvor vaneykha vagadetiy

Hebrew: וָ֭אֲחַשְּׁבָה לָדַ֣עַת זֹ֑את עָמָ֖ל (היא) [ה֣וּא] בְעֵינָֽי׃
Translated:
So I applied myself to understand this,
but it seemed a hopeless task
Transliteration: vaachashevah ladaat zot amal (hy) [hu] veeynay

Hebrew: עַד־אָ֭בוֹא אֶל־מִקְדְּשֵׁי־אֵ֑ל אָ֝בִ֗ינָה לְאַחֲרִיתָֽם׃
Translated:
till I entered God’s sanctuary
and reflected on their fate.
Transliteration: ad-avvo el-mikedeshey-el aviynah leachariytam

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ בַּ֭חֲלָקוֹת תָּשִׁ֣ית לָ֑מוֹ הִ֝פַּלְתָּ֗ם לְמַשּׁוּאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
You surround them with flattery;
You make them fall through blandishments.
Transliteration: akhe vachalakvot tashiyt lamvo hifaletam lemashuvot

Hebrew: אֵ֤יךְ הָי֣וּ לְשַׁמָּ֣ה כְרָ֑גַע סָ֥פוּ תַ֝֗מּוּ מִן־בַּלָּהֽוֹת׃
Translated:
How suddenly are they ruined,
wholly swept away by terrors.
Transliteration: eykhe hayu leshamah kheraga safu tamu min-valahvot

Hebrew: כַּחֲל֥וֹם מֵהָקִ֑יץ אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י בָּעִ֤יר ׀ צַלְמָ֬ם תִּבְזֶֽה׃
Translated:
When You are aroused You despise their image,
as one does a dream after waking, O Lord.
Transliteration: khachalvom mehakiyts adonay vaiyr tsalemam tivezeh

Hebrew: כִּ֭י יִתְחַמֵּ֣ץ לְבָבִ֑י וְ֝כִלְיוֹתַ֗י אֶשְׁתּוֹנָֽן׃
Translated:
My mind was stripped of its reason,
my feelings were numbed.
Transliteration: khiy yitechamets levaviy vekhileyvotay eshetvonan

Hebrew: וַאֲנִי־בַ֭עַר וְלֹ֣א אֵדָ֑ע בְּ֝הֵמ֗וֹת הָיִ֥יתִי עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
I was a dolt, without knowledge;
I was brutish toward You.
Transliteration: vaaniy-vaar velo eda vehemvot hayiytiy imakhe

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י תָמִ֣יד עִמָּ֑ךְ אָ֝חַ֗זְתָּ בְּיַד־יְמִינִֽי׃
Translated:
Yet I was always with You,
You held my right hand;
Transliteration: vaaniy tamiyd imakhe achazeta veyad-yemiyniy

Hebrew: בַּעֲצָתְךָ֥ תַנְחֵ֑נִי וְ֝אַחַ֗ר כָּב֥וֹד תִּקָּחֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
You guided me by Your counsel
and led me toward honor.
Transliteration: vaatsatekha tanecheniy veachar khavvod tikacheniy

Hebrew: מִי־לִ֥י בַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְ֝עִמְּךָ֗ לֹא־חָפַ֥צְתִּי בָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Whom else have I in heaven?
And having You, I want no one on earth.
Transliteration: miy-liy vashamayiim veimekha lo-chafatsetiy vaarets

Hebrew: כָּלָ֥ה שְׁאֵרִ֗י וּלְבָ֫בִ֥י צוּר־לְבָבִ֥י וְחֶלְקִ֗י אֱלֹהִ֥ים לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
My body and mind fail;
but God is the stay of my mind, my portion forever.
Transliteration: khalah sheeriy ulevaviy tsur-levaviy vechelekiy Elohim levolam

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֣ה רְחֵקֶ֣יךָ יֹאבֵ֑דוּ הִ֝צְמַ֗תָּה כׇּל־זוֹנֶ֥ה מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Those who keep far from You perish;
You annihilate all who are untrue to You.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh rechekeykha yovedu hitsematah khׇl-zvoneh mimekha

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ קִ֥רְבַ֥ת אֱלֹהִ֗ים לִ֫י־ט֥וֹב שַׁתִּ֤י ׀ בַּאדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֣ה מַחְסִ֑י לְ֝סַפֵּ֗ר כׇּל־מַלְאֲכוֹתֶֽיךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
As for me, nearness to God is good;
I have made the Lord GOD my refuge,
that I may recount all Your works.
Transliteration: vaaniy kirevat Elohim liy-tvov shatiy vadonay yehovih machesiy lesafer khׇl-maleakhvoteykha {f}

Hebrew: מַשְׂכִּ֗יל לְאָ֫סָ֥ף לָמָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים זָנַ֣חְתָּ לָנֶ֑צַח יֶעְשַׁ֥ן אַ֝פְּךָ֗ בְּצֹ֣אן מַרְעִיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
A maskil of Asaph.

Why, O God, do You forever reject us,
do You fume in anger at the flock that You tend?
Transliteration: mashekhiyl leasaf lamah Elohim zanacheta lanetsach yeeshan afekha vetson mareiytekha

Hebrew: זְכֹ֤ר עֲדָתְךָ֨ ׀ קָ֘נִ֤יתָ קֶּ֗דֶם גָּ֭אַלְתָּ שֵׁ֣בֶט נַחֲלָתֶ֑ךָ הַר־צִ֝יּ֗וֹן זֶ֤ה ׀ שָׁכַ֬נְתָּ בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Remember the community You made Yours long ago,
Your very own tribe that You redeemed,
Mount Zion, where You dwell.
Transliteration: zekhor adatekha kaniyta kedem gaaleta shevet nachalatekha har-tsiyyvon zeh shakhaneta vvo

Hebrew: הָרִ֣ימָה פְ֭עָמֶיךָ לְמַשֻּׁא֣וֹת נֶ֑צַח כׇּל־הֵרַ֖ע אוֹיֵ֣ב בַּקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated:
Bestir Yourself because of the perpetual tumult,
all the outrages of the enemy in the sanctuary.
Transliteration: hariymah feameykha lemashuvot netsach khׇl-hera voeiv vakodesh

Hebrew: שָׁאֲג֣וּ צֹ֭רְרֶיךָ בְּקֶ֣רֶב מוֹעֲדֶ֑ךָ שָׂ֖מוּ אוֹתֹתָ֣ם אֹתֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Your foes roar inside Your meeting-place;
they take their signs for true signs.
Transliteration: shaagu tsorereykha vekerev mvoadekha shamu vototam otvot

Hebrew: יִ֭וָּדַע כְּמֵבִ֣יא לְמָ֑עְלָה בִּסְבׇךְ־עֵ֝֗ץ קַרְדֻּמּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
It is like men wielding axes
against a gnarled tree;
Transliteration: yivada khemeviy lemaelah visevׇkhe-ets karedumvot

Hebrew: (ועת) [וְ֭עַתָּה] פִּתּוּחֶ֣יהָ יָּ֑חַד בְּכַשִּׁ֥יל וְ֝כֵילַפּ֗וֹת יַהֲלֹמֽוּן׃
Translated:
with hatchet and pike
they hacked away at its carved work.
Transliteration: (vt) [veatah] fitucheyha yachad vekhashiyl vekheylafvot yahalomun

Hebrew: שִׁלְח֣וּ בָ֭אֵשׁ מִקְדָּשֶׁ֑ךָ לָ֝אָ֗רֶץ חִלְּל֥וּ מִֽשְׁכַּן־שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
They made Your sanctuary go up in flames;
they brought low in dishonor the dwelling-place of Your presence.
Transliteration: shilechu vaesh mikedashekha laarets chilelu mishekhan-shemekha

Hebrew: אָמְר֣וּ בְ֭לִבָּם נִינָ֣ם יָ֑חַד שָׂרְפ֖וּ כׇל־מוֹעֲדֵי־אֵ֣ל בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
They resolved, “Let us destroy them altogether!”
They burned all God’s tabernacles in the land.
Transliteration: ameru velivam niynam yachad sharefu khׇl-mvoadey-el vaarets

Hebrew: אֽוֹתֹתֵ֗ינוּ לֹ֥א־רָ֫אִ֥ינוּ אֵֽין־ע֥וֹד נָבִ֑יא וְלֹֽא־אִ֝תָּ֗נוּ יֹדֵ֥עַ עַד־מָֽה׃
Translated:
No signs appear for us;
there is no longer any prophet;
no one among us knows for how long.
Transliteration: vototeynu lo-raiynu eyn-vod naviy velo-itanu yodea ad-mah

Hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֣י אֱ֭לֹהִים יְחָ֣רֶף צָ֑ר יְנָ֘אֵ֤ץ אוֹיֵ֖ב שִׁמְךָ֣ לָנֶֽצַח׃
Translated:
Till when, O God, will the foe blaspheme,
will the enemy forever revile Your name?
Transliteration: ad-matay Elohim yecharef tsar yenaets voeiv shimekha lanetsach

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה תָשִׁ֣יב יָ֭דְךָ וִימִינֶ֑ךָ מִקֶּ֖רֶב (חוקך) [חֵיקְךָ֣] כַלֵּֽה׃
Translated:
Why do You hold back Your hand, Your right hand?
Draw it out of Your bosom!
Transliteration: lamah tashiyv yadekha viymiynekha mikerev (chvkkh) [cheykekha] khaleh

Hebrew: וֵ֭אלֹהִים מַלְכִּ֣י מִקֶּ֑דֶם פֹּעֵ֥ל יְ֝שׁוּע֗וֹת בְּקֶ֣רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
O God, my King from of old,
who brings deliverance throughout the land;
Transliteration: velohiym malekhiy mikedem foel yeshuvot vekerev haarets

Hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה פוֹרַ֣רְתָּ בְעׇזְּךָ֣ יָ֑ם שִׁבַּ֥רְתָּ רָאשֵׁ֥י תַ֝נִּינִ֗ים עַל־הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated:
it was You who drove back the sea with Your might,
who smashed the heads of the monsters in the waters;
Transliteration: atah fvorareta veׇzekha yam shivareta rashey taniyniym al-hamayiim

Hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה רִ֭צַּצְתָּ רָאשֵׁ֣י לִוְיָתָ֑ן תִּתְּנֶ֥נּוּ מַ֝אֲכָ֗ל לְעָ֣ם לְצִיִּֽים׃
Translated:
it was You who crushed the heads of Leviathan,
who left him as food for the denizens of the desert;
Transliteration: atah ritsatseta rashey liveyatan titenenu maakhal leam letsiyiym

Hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה בָ֭קַעְתָּ מַעְיָ֣ן וָנָ֑חַל אַתָּ֥ה ה֝וֹבַ֗שְׁתָּ נַהֲר֥וֹת אֵיתָֽן׃
Translated:
it was You who released springs and torrents,
who made mighty rivers run dry;
Transliteration: atah vakaeta maeyan vanachal atah hvovasheta naharvot eytan

Hebrew: לְךָ֣ י֭וֹם אַף־לְךָ֥ לָ֑יְלָה אַתָּ֥ה הֲ֝כִינ֗וֹתָ מָא֥וֹר וָשָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated:
the day is Yours, the night also;
it was You who set in place the orb of the sun;
Transliteration: lekha yvom af-lekha layelah atah hakhiynvota mavor vashamesh

Hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה הִ֭צַּבְתָּ כׇּל־גְּבוּל֣וֹת אָ֑רֶץ קַ֥יִץ וָ֝חֹ֗רֶף אַתָּ֥ה יְצַרְתָּֽם׃
Translated:
You fixed all the boundaries of the earth;
summer and winter—You made them.
Transliteration: atah hitsaveta khׇl-gevulvot arets kayiits vachoref atah yetsaretam

Hebrew: זְכׇר־זֹ֗את א֭וֹיֵב חֵרֵ֣ף <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה וְעַ֥ם נָ֝בָ֗ל נִאֲצ֥וּ שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Be mindful of how the enemy blasphemes the LORD,
how base people revile Your name.
Transliteration: zekhׇr-zot voeiv cheref <small></small> yehovah veam naval niatsu shemekha

Hebrew: אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן לְ֭חַיַּת נֶ֣פֶשׁ תּוֹרֶ֑ךָ חַיַּ֥ת עֲ֝נִיֶּ֗יךָ אַל־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח לָנֶֽצַח׃
Translated:
Do not deliver Your dove to the wild beast;
do not ignore forever the band of Your lowly ones.
Transliteration: al-titen lechayat nefesh tvorekha chayat aniyeykha al-tishekhach lanetsach

Hebrew: הַבֵּ֥ט לַבְּרִ֑ית כִּ֥י מָלְא֥וּ מַחֲשַׁכֵּי־אֶ֝֗רֶץ נְא֣וֹת חָמָֽס׃
Translated:
Look to the covenant!
For the dark places of the land are full of the haunts of lawlessness.
Transliteration: havet laveriyt khiy maleu machashakhey-erets nevot chamas

Hebrew: אַל־יָשֹׁ֣ב דַּ֣ךְ נִכְלָ֑ם עָנִ֥י וְ֝אֶבְי֗וֹן יְֽהַלְל֥וּ שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Let not the downtrodden turn away disappointed;
let the poor and needy praise Your name.
Transliteration: al-yashov dakhe nikhelam aniy veeveyvon yehalelu shemekha

Hebrew: קוּמָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים רִיבָ֣ה רִיבֶ֑ךָ זְכֹ֥ר חֶרְפָּתְךָ֥ מִנִּי־נָ֝בָ֗ל כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Rise, O God, champion Your cause;
be mindful that You are blasphemed by base men all day long.
Transliteration: kumah Elohim riyvah riyvekha zekhor cherefatekha miniy-naval khׇl-hayyvom

Hebrew: אַל־תִּ֭שְׁכַּח ק֣וֹל צֹרְרֶ֑יךָ שְׁא֥וֹן קָ֝מֶ֗יךָ עֹלֶ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃ {פ}
Translated:
Do not ignore the shouts of Your foes,
the din of Your adversaries that ascends all the time.
Transliteration: al-tishekhach kvol tsorereykha shevon kameykha oleh tamiyd {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אַל־תַּשְׁחֵ֑ת מִזְמ֖וֹר לְאָסָ֣ף שִֽׁיר׃
Translated:
For the leader; al tashḥeth.
A psalm of Asaph, a song.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-tashechet mizemvor leasaf shiyr

Hebrew: ה֘וֹדִ֤ינוּ לְּךָ֨ ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים ה֭וֹדִינוּ וְקָר֣וֹב שְׁמֶ֑ךָ סִ֝פְּר֗וּ נִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
We praise You, O God;
we praise You;
Your presence is near;
men tell of Your wondrous deeds.
Transliteration: hvodiynu lekha Elohimm hvodiynu vekarvov shemekha siferu nifelevoteykha

Hebrew: כִּ֭י אֶקַּ֣ח מוֹעֵ֑ד אֲ֝נִ֗י מֵישָׁרִ֥ים אֶשְׁפֹּֽט׃
Translated:
“At the time I choose,
I will give judgment equitably.
Transliteration: khiy ekach mvoed aniy meyshariym eshefot

Hebrew: נְֽמֹגִ֗ים אֶ֥רֶץ וְכׇל־יֹשְׁבֶ֑יהָ אָנֹכִ֨י תִכַּ֖נְתִּי עַמּוּדֶ֣יהָ סֶּֽלָה׃
Translated:
Earth and all its inhabitants dissolve;
it is I who keep its pillars firm. Selah.
Transliteration: nemogiym erets vekhׇl-yosheveyha anokhiy tikhanetiy amudeyha selah

Hebrew: אָמַ֣רְתִּי לַ֭הוֹלְלִים אַל־תָּהֹ֑לּוּ וְ֝לָרְשָׁעִ֗ים אַל־תָּרִ֥ימוּ קָֽרֶן׃
Translated:
To wanton men I say, ‘Do not be wanton!’
to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horns!’”
Transliteration: amaretiy lahvoleliym al-taholu velareshaiym al-tariymu karen

Hebrew: אַל־תָּרִ֣ימוּ לַמָּר֣וֹם קַרְנְכֶ֑ם תְּדַבְּר֖וּ בְצַוָּ֣אר עָתָֽק׃
Translated:
Do not lift your horns up high
in vainglorious bluster.
Transliteration: al-tariymu lamarvom karenekhem tedaveru vetsavar atak

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א מִ֭מּוֹצָא וּמִֽמַּעֲרָ֑ב וְ֝לֹ֗א מִמִּדְבַּ֥ר הָרִֽים׃
Translated:
For what lifts a man comes not from the east
or the west or the wilderness;
Transliteration: khiy lo mimvotsa umimaarav velo mimidevar hariym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים שֹׁפֵ֑ט זֶ֥ה יַ֝שְׁפִּ֗יל וְזֶ֣ה יָרִֽים׃
Translated:
for God it is who gives judgment;
He brings down one man, He lifts up another.
Transliteration: khiy-Elohim shofet zeh yashefiyl vezeh yariym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כ֪וֹס בְּֽיַד־יְהֹוָ֡ה וְיַ֤יִן חָמַ֨ר ׀ מָ֥לֵא מֶסֶךְ֮ וַיַּגֵּ֢ר מִ֫זֶּ֥ה אַךְ־שְׁ֭מָרֶיהָ יִמְצ֣וּ יִשְׁתּ֑וּ כֹּ֝֗ל רִשְׁעֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
There is a cup in the LORD’s hand
with foaming wine fully mixed;
from this He pours;
all the wicked of the earth drink,
draining it to the very dregs.
Transliteration: khiy khvos veyad-yehovah veyayiin chamar male mesekhe vayage֢r mizeh akhe-shemareyha yimetsu yishetu khol risheey-arets

Hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי אַגִּ֣יד לְעֹלָ֑ם אֲ֝זַמְּרָ֗ה לֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
As for me, I will declare forever,
I will sing a hymn to the God of Jacob.
Transliteration: vaaniy agiyd leolam azamerah lelohey yaakov

Hebrew: וְכׇל־קַרְנֵ֣י רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֲגַדֵּ֑עַ תְּ֝רוֹמַ֗מְנָה קַֽרְנ֥וֹת צַדִּֽיק׃ {פ}
Translated:
“All the horns of the wicked I will cut;
but the horns of the righteous shall be lifted up.”
Transliteration: vekhׇl-kareney reshaiym agadea tervomamenah karenvot tsadiyk {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֑ת מִזְמ֖וֹר לְאָסָ֣ף שִֽׁיר׃
Translated:
For the leader; with instrumental music.
A psalm of Asaph, a song.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha vinegiynot mizemvor leasaf shiyr

Hebrew: נוֹדָ֣ע בִּיהוּדָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּ֝יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל גָּד֥וֹל שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
God has made Himself known in Judah,
His name is great in Israel;
Transliteration: nvoda viyhudah Elohim veyiisherael gadvol shemvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בְשָׁלֵ֣ם סוּכּ֑וֹ וּמְע֖וֹנָת֣וֹ בְצִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Salem became His abode;
Zion, His den.
Transliteration: vayehiy veshalem sukhvo umevonatvo vetsiyyvon

Hebrew: שָׁ֭מָּה שִׁבַּ֣ר רִשְׁפֵי־קָ֑שֶׁת מָגֵ֬ן וְחֶ֖רֶב וּמִלְחָמָ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
There He broke the fiery arrows of the bow,
the shield and the sword of war. Selah.
Transliteration: shamah shivar rishefey-kashet magen vecherev umilechamah selah

Hebrew: נָ֭אוֹר אַתָּ֥ה אַדִּ֗יר מֵֽהַרְרֵי־טָֽרֶף׃
Translated:
You were resplendent,
glorious, on the mountains of prey.
Transliteration: navor atah adiyr meharerey-taref

Hebrew: אֶשְׁתּֽוֹלְל֨וּ ׀ אַבִּ֣ירֵי לֵ֭ב נָמ֣וּ שְׁנָתָ֑ם וְלֹֽא־מָצְא֖וּ כׇל־אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֣יִל יְדֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
The stout-hearted were despoiled;
they were in a stupor;
the bravest of men could not lift a hand.
Transliteration: eshetvolelu aviyrey lev namu shenatam velo-matseu khׇl-aneshey-chayiil yedeyhem

Hebrew: מִ֭גַּעֲרָ֣תְךָ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֑ב נִ֝רְדָּ֗ם וְרֶ֣כֶב וָסֽוּס׃
Translated:
At Your blast, O God of Jacob,
horse and chariot lay stunned.
Transliteration: migaaratekha elohey yaakov niredam verekhev vasus

Hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה ׀ נ֥וֹרָא אַ֗תָּה וּמִֽי־יַעֲמֹ֥ד לְפָנֶ֗יךָ מֵאָ֥ז אַפֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
O You! You are awesome!
Who can withstand You
when You are enraged?
Transliteration: atah nvora atah umiy-yaamod lefaneykha meaz afekha

Hebrew: מִ֭שָּׁמַיִם הִשְׁמַ֣עְתָּ דִּ֑ין אֶ֖רֶץ יָֽרְאָ֣ה וְשָׁקָֽטָה׃
Translated:
In heaven You pronounced sentence;
the earth was numbed with fright
Transliteration: mishamayim hishemaeta diyn erets yareah veshakatah

Hebrew: בְּקוּם־לַמִּשְׁפָּ֥ט אֱלֹהִ֑ים לְהוֹשִׁ֖יעַ כׇּל־עַנְוֵי־אֶ֣רֶץ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
as God rose to execute judgment,
to deliver all the lowly of the earth. Selah.
Transliteration: vekum-lamishefat Elohim lehvoshiya khׇl-anevey-erets selah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חֲמַ֣ת אָדָ֣ם תּוֹדֶ֑ךָּ שְׁאֵרִ֖ית חֵמֹ֣ת תַּחְגֹּֽר׃
Translated:
The fiercest of men shall acknowledge You,
when You gird on the last bit of fury.
Transliteration: khiy-chamat adam tvodekha sheeriyt chemot tachegor

Hebrew: נִ֥דְר֣וּ וְשַׁלְּמוּ֮ לַיהֹוָ֢ה אֱֽלֹהֵ֫יכֶ֥ם כׇּל־סְבִיבָ֑יו יֹבִ֥ילוּ שַׁ֝֗י לַמּוֹרָֽא׃
Translated:
Make vows and pay them to the LORD your God;
all who are around Him shall bring tribute to the Awesome One.
Transliteration: nideru veshalemu layhova֢h eloheykhem khׇl-seviyvayv yoviylu shay lamvora

Hebrew: יִ֭בְצֹר ר֣וּחַ נְגִידִ֑ים נ֝וֹרָ֗א לְמַלְכֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He curbs the spirit of princes,
inspires awe in the kings of the earth.
Transliteration: yivetsor rucha negiydiym nvora lemalekhey-arets {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־[יְדוּת֗וּן] (ידיתון) לְאָסָ֥ף מִזְמֽוֹר׃
Translated:
For the leader; on Jeduthun.
Of Asaph. A psalm.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-[yedutun] (ydytvn) leasaf mizemvor
