Hebrew: קוֹלִ֣י אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֣ים וְאֶצְעָ֑קָה קוֹלִ֥י אֶל־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים וְהַאֲזִ֥ין אֵלָֽי׃
Translated:
I cry aloud to God;
I cry to God that He may give ear to me.
Transliteration: kvoliy el-Elohim veetseakah kvoliy el-Elohimm vehaaziyn elay

Hebrew: בְּי֥וֹם צָרָתִי֮ אֲדֹנָ֢י דָּ֫רָ֥שְׁתִּי יָדִ֤י ׀ לַ֣יְלָה נִ֭גְּרָה וְלֹ֣א תָפ֑וּג מֵאֲנָ֖ה הִנָּחֵ֣ם נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
In my time of distress I turn to the Lord,
with my hand [uplifted];
[my eyes] flow all night without respite;

I will not be comforted.
Transliteration: veyvom tsaratiy adona֢y darashetiy yadiy layelah nigerah velo tafug meanah hinachem nafeshiy

Hebrew: אֶזְכְּרָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים וְאֶהֱמָ֑יָה אָשִׂ֓יחָה ׀ וְתִתְעַטֵּ֖ף רוּחִ֣י סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
I call God to mind, I moan,
I complain, my spirit fails. Selah.
Transliteration: ezekherah Elohim veehemayah ashiychah vetiteatef ruchiy selah

Hebrew: אָ֭חַזְתָּ שְׁמֻר֣וֹת עֵינָ֑י נִ֝פְעַ֗מְתִּי וְלֹ֣א אֲדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated:
You have held my eyelids open;
I am overwrought, I cannot speak.
Transliteration: achazeta shemurvot eynay nifeametiy velo adaver

Hebrew: חִשַּׁ֣בְתִּי יָמִ֣ים מִקֶּ֑דֶם שְׁ֝נ֗וֹת עוֹלָמִֽים׃
Translated:
My thoughts turn to days of old,
to years long past.
Transliteration: chishavetiy yamiym mikedem shenvot volamiym

Hebrew: אֶ֥זְכְּרָ֥ה נְגִינָתִ֗י בַּ֫לָּ֥יְלָה עִם־לְבָבִ֥י אָשִׂ֑יחָה וַיְחַפֵּ֥שׂ רוּחִֽי׃
Translated:
I recall at night their jibes at me;
I commune with myself;
my spirit inquires,
Transliteration: ezekherah negiynatiy valayelah im-levaviy ashiychah vayechafesh ruchiy

Hebrew: הַֽ֭לְעוֹלָמִים יִזְנַ֥ח <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָ֑י וְלֹא־יֹסִ֖יף לִרְצ֣וֹת עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
“Will the Lord reject forever
and never again show favor?
Transliteration: halevolamiym yizenach <small></small> adonay velo-yosiyf liretsvot vod

Hebrew: הֶאָפֵ֣ס לָנֶ֣צַח חַסְדּ֑וֹ גָּ֥מַר אֹ֝֗מֶר לְדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃
Translated:
Has His faithfulness disappeared forever?
Will His promise be unfulfilled for all time?
Transliteration: heafes lanetsach chasedvo gamar omer ledor vador

Hebrew: הֲשָׁכַ֣ח חַנּ֣וֹת אֵ֑ל אִם־קָפַ֥ץ בְּ֝אַ֗ף רַחֲמָ֥יו סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Has God forgotten how to pity?
Has He in anger stifled His compassion?” Selah.
Transliteration: hashakhach chanvot el im-kafats veaf rachamayv selah

Hebrew: וָ֭אֹמַר חַלּ֣וֹתִי הִ֑יא שְׁ֝נ֗וֹת יְמִ֣ין עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
And I said, “It is my fault
that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
Transliteration: vaomar chalvotiy hiy shenvot yemiyn eleyvon

Hebrew: (אזכיר) [אֶזְכּ֥וֹר] מַעַלְלֵי־יָ֑הּ כִּֽי־אֶזְכְּרָ֖ה מִקֶּ֣דֶם פִּלְאֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I recall the deeds of the LORD;
yes, I recall Your wonders of old;
Transliteration: (zkhyr) [ezekhvor] maaleley-yah khiy-ezekherah mikedem fileekha

Hebrew: וְהָגִ֥יתִי בְכׇל־פׇּעֳלֶ֑ךָ וּֽבַעֲלִ֖ילוֹתֶ֣יךָ אָשִֽׂיחָה׃
Translated:
I recount all Your works;
I speak of Your acts.
Transliteration: vehagiytiy vekhׇl-fׇolekha uvaaliylvoteykha ashiychah

Hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים בַּקֹּ֣דֶשׁ דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ מִי־אֵ֥ל גָּ֝ד֗וֹל כֵּאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
O God, Your ways are holiness;
what god is as great as God?
Transliteration: Elohim vakodesh darekhekha miy-el gadvol khelohiym

Hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה הָ֭אֵל עֹ֣שֵׂה פֶ֑לֶא הוֹדַ֖עְתָּ בָעַמִּ֣ים עֻזֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
You are the God who works wonders;
You have manifested Your strength among the peoples.
Transliteration: atah hael osheh fele hvodaeta vaamiym uzekha

Hebrew: גָּאַ֣לְתָּ בִּזְר֣וֹעַ עַמֶּ֑ךָ בְּנֵֽי־יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְיוֹסֵ֣ף סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
By Your arm You redeemed Your people,
the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
Transliteration: gaaleta vizervoa amekha veney-yaakov veyvosef selah

Hebrew: רָ֘א֤וּךָ מַּ֨יִם ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים רָא֣וּךָ מַּ֣יִם יָחִ֑ילוּ אַ֝֗ף יִרְגְּז֥וּ תְהֹמֽוֹת׃
Translated:
The waters saw You, O God,
the waters saw You and were convulsed;
the very deep quaked as well.
Transliteration: raukha mayiim Elohimm raukha mayiim yachiylu af yiregezu tehomvot

Hebrew: זֹ֤רְמוּ מַ֨יִם ׀ עָב֗וֹת ק֭וֹל נָתְנ֣וּ שְׁחָקִ֑ים אַף־חֲ֝צָצֶ֗יךָ יִתְהַלָּֽכוּ׃
Translated:
Clouds streamed water;
the heavens rumbled;
Your arrows flew about;
Transliteration: zoremu mayiim avvot kvol natenu shechakiym af-chatsatseykha yitehalakhu

Hebrew: ק֤וֹל רַעַמְךָ֨ ׀ בַּגַּלְגַּ֗ל הֵאִ֣ירוּ בְרָקִ֣ים תֵּבֵ֑ל רָגְזָ֖ה וַתִּרְעַ֣שׁ הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Your thunder rumbled like wheels;
lightning lit up the world;
the earth quaked and trembled.
Transliteration: kvol raamekha vagalegal heiyru verakiym tevel ragezah vatireash haarets

Hebrew: בַּיָּ֤ם דַּרְכֶּ֗ךָ (ושביליך) [וּֽ֭שְׁבִילְךָ] בְּמַ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים וְ֝עִקְּבוֹתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א נֹדָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
Your way was through the sea,
Your path, through the mighty waters;
Your tracks could not be seen.
Transliteration: vayam darekhekha (vshvylykh) [usheviylekha] vemayiim raviym veikevvoteykha lo nodau

Hebrew: נָחִ֣יתָ כַצֹּ֣אן עַמֶּ֑ךָ בְּֽיַד־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃ {פ}
Translated:
You led Your people like a flock
in the care of Moses and Aaron.
Transliteration: nachiyta khatson amekha veyad-mosheh veaharon {f}

Hebrew: מַשְׂכִּ֗יל לְאָ֫סָ֥ף הַאֲזִ֣ינָה עַ֭מִּי תּוֹרָתִ֑י הַטּ֥וּ אׇ֝זְנְכֶ֗ם לְאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
Translated:
A maskil of Asaph.

Give ear, my people, to my teaching,
turn your ear to what I say.
Transliteration: mashekhiyl leasaf haaziynah amiy tvoratiy hatu ׇzenekhem leimerey-fiy

Hebrew: אֶפְתְּחָ֣ה בְמָשָׁ֣ל פִּ֑י אַבִּ֥יעָה חִ֝יד֗וֹת מִנִּי־קֶֽדֶם׃
Translated:
I will expound a theme,
hold forth on the lessons of the past,
Transliteration: efetechah vemashal fiy aviyah chiydvot miniy-kedem

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁ֭מַעְנוּ וַנֵּדָעֵ֑ם וַ֝אֲבוֹתֵ֗ינוּ סִפְּרוּ־לָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
things we have heard and known,
that our fathers have told us.
Transliteration: asher shamaenu vanedaem vaavvoteynu siferu-lanu

Hebrew: לֹ֤א נְכַחֵ֨ד ׀ מִבְּנֵיהֶ֗ם לְד֥וֹר אַחֲר֗וֹן מְֽ֭סַפְּרִים תְּהִלּ֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה וֶעֱזוּז֥וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאֹתָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated:
We will not withhold them from their children,
telling the coming generation
the praises of the LORD and His might,
and the wonders He performed.
Transliteration: lo nekhached miveneyhem ledvor acharvon mesaferiym tehilvot yehovah veezuzvo venifeleotayv asher ashah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤קֶם עֵד֨וּת ׀ בְּֽיַעֲקֹ֗ב וְתוֹרָה֮ שָׂ֤ם בְּיִשְׂרָ֫אֵ֥ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִ֭וָּה אֶת־אֲבוֹתֵ֑ינוּ לְ֝הוֹדִיעָ֗ם לִבְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
He established a decree in Jacob,
ordained a teaching in Israel,
charging our fathers
to make them known to their children,
Transliteration: vayakem edut veyaakov vetvorah sham veyisherael asher tsivah et-avvoteynu lehvodiyam liveneyhem

Hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן יֵדְע֨וּ ׀ דּ֣וֹר אַ֭חֲרוֹן בָּנִ֣ים יִוָּלֵ֑דוּ יָ֝קֻ֗מוּ וִיסַפְּר֥וּ לִבְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
that a future generation might know
—children yet to be born—
and in turn tell their children
Transliteration: lemaan eideu dvor acharvon vaniym yivaledu yakumu viysaferu liveneyhem

Hebrew: וְיָשִׂ֥ימוּ בֵאלֹהִ֗ים כִּ֫סְלָ֥ם וְלֹ֣א יִ֭שְׁכְּחוּ מַ֥עַלְלֵי־אֵ֑ל וּמִצְוֺתָ֥יו יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃
Translated:
that they might put their confidence in God,
and not forget God’s great deeds,
but observe His commandments,
Transliteration: veyashiymu velohiym khiselam velo yishekhechu maaleley-el umitsevotayv yinetsoru

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א יִהְי֨וּ ׀ כַּאֲבוֹתָ֗ם דּוֹר֮ סוֹרֵ֢ר וּמֹ֫רֶ֥ה דּ֭וֹר לֹא־הֵכִ֣ין לִבּ֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־נֶאֶמְנָ֖ה אֶת־אֵ֣ל רוּחֽוֹ׃
Translated:
and not be like their fathers,
a wayward and defiant generation,
a generation whose heart was inconstant,
whose spirit was not true to God.
Transliteration: velo yiheyu khaavvotam dvor svore֢r umoreh dvor lo-hekhiyn livvo velo-neemenah et-el ruchvo

Hebrew: בְּֽנֵי־אֶפְרַ֗יִם נוֹשְׁקֵ֥י רֽוֹמֵי־קָ֑שֶׁת הָ֝פְכ֗וּ בְּי֣וֹם קְרָֽב׃
Translated:
Like the Ephraimite bowmen
who played false in the day of battle,
Transliteration: veney-eferayiim nvoshekey rvomey-kashet hafekhu veyvom kerav

Hebrew: לֹ֣א שָׁ֭מְרוּ בְּרִ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים וּ֝בְתוֹרָת֗וֹ מֵאֲנ֥וּ לָלֶֽכֶת׃
Translated:
they did not keep God’s covenant,
they refused to follow His instruction;
Transliteration: lo shameru veriyt Elohim uvetvoratvo meanu lalekhet

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכְּח֥וּ עֲלִילוֹתָ֑יו וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶרְאָֽם׃
Translated:
they forgot His deeds
and the wonders that He showed them.
Transliteration: vayishekhechu aliylvotayv venifelevotayv asher heream

Hebrew: נֶ֣גֶד אֲ֭בוֹתָם עָ֣שָׂה פֶ֑לֶא בְּאֶ֖רֶץ מִצְרַ֣יִם שְׂדֵה־צֹֽעַן׃
Translated:
He performed marvels in the sight of their fathers,
in the land of Egypt, the plain of Zoan.
Transliteration: neged avvotam ashah fele veerets mitserayiim shedeh-tsoan

Hebrew: בָּ֣קַע יָ֭ם וַיַּעֲבִירֵ֑ם וַֽיַּצֶּב־מַ֥יִם כְּמוֹ־נֵֽד׃
Translated:
He split the sea and took them through it;
He made the waters stand like a wall.
Transliteration: vaka yam vayaaviyrem vayatsev-mayiim khemvo-ned

Hebrew: וַיַּנְחֵ֣ם בֶּעָנָ֣ן יוֹמָ֑ם וְכׇל־הַ֝לַּ֗יְלָה בְּא֣וֹר אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
He led them with a cloud by day,
and throughout the night by the light of fire.
Transliteration: vayanechem veanan yvomam vekhׇl-halayelah vevor esh

Hebrew: יְבַקַּ֣ע צֻ֭רִים בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַ֝יַּ֗שְׁקְ כִּתְהֹמ֥וֹת רַבָּֽה׃
Translated:
He split rocks in the wilderness
and gave them drink as if from the great deep.
Transliteration: yevaka tsuriym vamidevar vayasheke khitehomvot ravah

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצִ֣א נוֹזְלִ֣ים מִסָּ֑לַע וַיּ֖וֹרֶד כַּנְּהָר֣וֹת מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
He brought forth streams from a rock
and made them flow down like a river.
Transliteration: vayyvotsi nvozeliym misala vayyvored khaneharvot mayiim

Hebrew: וַיּוֹסִ֣יפוּ ע֭וֹד לַחֲטֹא־ל֑וֹ לַֽמְר֥וֹת עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן בַּצִּיָּֽה׃
Translated:
But they went on sinning against Him,
defying the Most High in the parched land.
Transliteration: vayyvosiyfu vod lachato-lvo lamervot eleyvon vatsiyah

Hebrew: וַיְנַסּוּ־אֵ֥ל בִּלְבָבָ֑ם לִֽשְׁאׇל־אֹ֥כֶל לְנַפְשָֽׁם׃
Translated:
To test God was in their mind
when they demanded food for themselves.
Transliteration: vayenasu-el vilevavam lisheׇl-okhel lenafesham

Hebrew: וַֽיְדַבְּר֗וּ בֵּאלֹ֫הִ֥ים אָ֭מְרוּ הֲי֣וּכַל אֵ֑ל לַעֲרֹ֥ךְ שֻׁ֝לְחָ֗ן בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated:
They spoke against God, saying,
“Can God spread a feast in the wilderness?
Transliteration: vayedaveru velohiym ameru hayukhal el laarokhe shulechan vamidevar

Hebrew: הֵ֤ן הִכָּה־צ֨וּר ׀ וַיָּז֣וּבוּ מַיִם֮ וּנְחָלִ֢ים יִ֫שְׁטֹ֥פוּ הֲגַם־לֶ֭חֶם י֣וּכַל תֵּ֑ת אִם־יָכִ֖ין שְׁאֵ֣ר לְעַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
True, He struck the rock and waters flowed,
streams gushed forth;
but can He provide bread?
Can He supply His people with meat?”
Transliteration: hen hikhah-tsur vayazuvu mayim unechali֢ym yishetofu hagam-lechem yukhal tet im-yakhiyn sheer leamvo

Hebrew: לָכֵ֤ן ׀ שָׁמַ֥ע יְהֹוָ֗ה וַֽיִּתְעַ֫בָּ֥ר וְ֭אֵשׁ נִשְּׂקָ֣ה בְיַעֲקֹ֑ב וְגַם־אַ֝֗ף עָלָ֥ה בְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
The LORD heard and He raged;
fire broke out against Jacob,
anger flared up at Israel,
Transliteration: lakhen shama yehovah vayiteavar veesh nishekah veyaakov vegam-af alah veyisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א הֶ֭אֱמִינוּ בֵּאלֹהִ֑ים וְלֹ֥א בָ֝טְח֗וּ בִּישׁוּעָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
because they did not put their trust in God,
did not rely on His deliverance.
Transliteration: khiy lo heemiynu velohiym velo vatechu viyshuatvo

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו שְׁחָקִ֣ים מִמָּ֑עַל וְדַלְתֵ֖י שָׁמַ֣יִם פָּתָֽח׃
Translated:
So He commanded the skies above,
He opened the doors of heaven
Transliteration: vayetsav shechakiym mimaal vedaletey shamayiim fatach

Hebrew: וַיַּמְטֵ֬ר עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם מָ֣ן לֶאֱכֹ֑ל וּדְגַן־שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם נָ֣תַן לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
and rained manna upon them for food,
giving them heavenly grain.
Transliteration: vayameter aleyhem man leekhol udegan-shamayiim natan lamvo

Hebrew: לֶ֣חֶם אַ֭בִּירִים אָ֣כַל אִ֑ישׁ צֵידָ֬ה שָׁלַ֖ח לָהֶ֣ם לָשֹֽׂבַע׃
Translated:
Each man ate a hero’s meal;
He sent them provision in plenty.
Transliteration: lechem aviyriym akhal iysh tseydah shalach lahem lashova

Hebrew: יַסַּ֣ע קָ֭דִים בַּשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַיְנַהֵ֖ג בְּעֻזּ֣וֹ תֵימָֽן׃
Translated:
He set the east wind moving in heaven,
and drove the south wind by His might.
Transliteration: yasa kadiym vashamayiim vayenaheg veuzvo teyman

Hebrew: וַיַּמְטֵ֬ר עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּעָפָ֣ר שְׁאֵ֑ר וּֽכְח֥וֹל יַ֝מִּ֗ים ע֣וֹף כָּנָֽף׃
Translated:
He rained meat on them like dust,
winged birds like the sands of the sea,
Transliteration: vayameter aleyhem kheafar sheer ukhechvol yamiym vof khanaf

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּפֵּל בְּקֶ֣רֶב מַחֲנֵ֑הוּ סָ֝בִ֗יב לְמִשְׁכְּנֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
making them come down inside His camp,
around His dwelling-place.
Transliteration: vayafel vekerev machanehu saviyv lemishekhenotayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּאכְל֣וּ וַיִּשְׂבְּע֣וּ מְאֹ֑ד וְ֝תַאֲוָתָ֗ם יָבִ֥א לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
They ate till they were sated;
He gave them what they craved.
Transliteration: vayokhelu vayisheveu meod vetaavatam yavi lahem

Hebrew: לֹא־זָ֥רוּ מִתַּאֲוָתָ֑ם ע֝֗וֹד אׇכְלָ֥ם בְּפִיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
They had not yet wearied of what they craved,
the food was still in their mouths
Transliteration: lo-zaru mitaavatam vod ׇkhelam vefiyhem

Hebrew: וְאַ֤ף אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ עָ֘לָ֤ה בָהֶ֗ם וַֽ֭יַּהֲרֹג בְּמִשְׁמַנֵּיהֶ֑ם וּבַחוּרֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל הִכְרִֽיעַ׃
Translated:
when God’s anger flared up at them.
He slew their sturdiest,
struck down the youth of Israel.
Transliteration: veaf Elohim alah vahem vayaharog vemishemaneyhem uvachurey yisherael hikheriya

Hebrew: בְּכׇל־זֹ֥את חָֽטְאוּ־ע֑וֹד וְלֹֽא־הֶ֝אֱמִ֗ינוּ בְּנִפְלְאוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Nonetheless, they went on sinning
and had no faith in His wonders.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-zot chateu-vod velo-heemiynu venifelevotayv

Hebrew: וַיְכַל־בַּהֶ֥בֶל יְמֵיהֶ֑ם וּ֝שְׁנוֹתָ֗ם בַּבֶּהָלָֽה׃
Translated:
He made their days end in futility,
their years in sudden death.
Transliteration: vayekhal-vahevel yemeyhem ushenvotam vavehalah

Hebrew: אִם־הֲרָגָ֥ם וּדְרָשׁ֑וּהוּ וְ֝שָׁ֗בוּ וְשִֽׁחֲרוּ־אֵֽל׃
Translated:
When He struck them, they turned to Him
and sought God once again.
Transliteration: im-haragam uderashuhu veshavu veshicharu-el

Hebrew: וַֽ֭יִּזְכְּרוּ כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֣ים צוּרָ֑ם וְאֵ֥ל עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן גֹּאֲלָֽם׃
Translated:
They remembered that God was their rock,
God Most High, their Redeemer.
Transliteration: vayizekheru khiy-Elohim tsuram veel eleyvon goalam

Hebrew: וַיְפַתּ֥וּהוּ בְּפִיהֶ֑ם וּ֝בִלְשׁוֹנָ֗ם יְכַזְּבוּ־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Yet they deceived Him with their speech,
lied to Him with their words;
Transliteration: vayefatuhu vefiyhem uvileshvonam yekhazevu-lvo

Hebrew: וְ֭לִבָּם לֹא־נָכ֣וֹן עִמּ֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א נֶ֝אֶמְנ֗וּ בִּבְרִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
their hearts were inconstant toward Him;
they were untrue to His covenant.
Transliteration: velivam lo-nakhvon imvo velo neemenu viveriytvo

Hebrew: וְה֤וּא רַח֨וּם ׀ יְכַפֵּ֥ר עָוֺן֮ וְֽלֹא־יַֽ֫שְׁחִ֥ית וְ֭הִרְבָּה לְהָשִׁ֣יב אַפּ֑וֹ וְלֹא־יָ֝עִ֗יר כׇּל־חֲמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
But He, being merciful, forgave iniquity
and would not destroy;
He restrained His wrath time and again
and did not give full vent to His fury;
Transliteration: vehu rachum yekhafer avon velo-yashechiyt vehirevah lehashiyv afvo velo-yaiyr khׇl-chamatvo

Hebrew: וַ֭יִּזְכֹּר כִּֽי־בָשָׂ֣ר הֵ֑מָּה ר֥וּחַ ה֝וֹלֵ֗ךְ וְלֹ֣א יָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated:
for He remembered that they were but flesh,
a passing breath that does not return.
Transliteration: vayizekhor khiy-vashar hemah rucha hvolekhe velo yashuv

Hebrew: כַּ֭מָּה יַמְר֣וּהוּ בַמִּדְבָּ֑ר יַ֝עֲצִיב֗וּהוּ בִּישִׁימֽוֹן׃
Translated:
How often did they defy Him in the wilderness,
did they grieve Him in the wasteland!
Transliteration: khamah yameruhu vamidevar yaatsiyvuhu viyshiymvon

Hebrew: וַיָּשׁ֣וּבוּ וַיְנַסּ֣וּ אֵ֑ל וּקְד֖וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל הִתְוֽוּ׃
Translated:
Again and again they tested God,
vexed the Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: vayashuvu vayenasu el ukedvosh yisherael hitevu

Hebrew: לֹא־זָכְר֥וּ אֶת־יָד֑וֹ י֝֗וֹם אֲֽשֶׁר־פָּדָ֥ם מִנִּי־צָֽר׃
Translated:
They did not remember His strength,
or the day He redeemed them from the foe;
Transliteration: lo-zakheru et-yadvo yvom asher-fadam miniy-tsar

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם בְּ֭מִצְרַיִם אֹתוֹתָ֑יו וּ֝מוֹפְתָ֗יו בִּשְׂדֵה־צֹֽעַן׃
Translated:
how He displayed His signs in Egypt,
His wonders in the plain of Zoan.
Transliteration: asher-sham vemitserayim otvotayv umvofetayv vishedeh-tsoan

Hebrew: וַיַּהֲפֹ֣ךְ לְ֭דָם יְאֹרֵיהֶ֑ם וְ֝נֹזְלֵיהֶ֗ם בַּל־יִשְׁתָּיֽוּן׃
Translated:
He turned their rivers into blood;
He made their waters undrinkable.
Transliteration: vayahafokhe ledam yeoreyhem venozeleyhem val-yishetayun

Hebrew: יְשַׁלַּ֬ח בָּהֶ֣ם עָ֭רֹב וַיֹּאכְלֵ֑ם וּ֝צְפַרְדֵּ֗עַ וַתַּשְׁחִיתֵֽם׃
Translated:
He inflicted upon them swarms of insects to devour them,
frogs to destroy them.
Transliteration: yeshalach vahem arov vayokhelem utsefaredea vatashechiytem

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לֶחָסִ֣יל יְבוּלָ֑ם וִ֝יגִיעָ֗ם לָאַרְבֶּֽה׃
Translated:
He gave their crops over to grubs,
their produce to locusts.
Transliteration: vayiten lechasiyl yevulam viygiyam laareveh

Hebrew: יַהֲרֹ֣ג בַּבָּרָ֣ד גַּפְנָ֑ם וְ֝שִׁקְמוֹתָ֗ם בַּחֲנָמַֽל׃
Translated:
He killed their vines with hail,
their sycamores with frost.
Transliteration: yaharog vavarad gafenam veshikemvotam vachanamal

Hebrew: וַיַּסְגֵּ֣ר לַבָּרָ֣ד בְּעִירָ֑ם וּ֝מִקְנֵיהֶ֗ם לָרְשָׁפִֽים׃
Translated:
He gave their beasts over to hail,
their cattle to lightning bolts.
Transliteration: vayaseger lavarad veiyram umikeneyhem lareshafiym

Hebrew: יְשַׁלַּח־בָּ֨ם ׀ חֲר֬וֹן אַפּ֗וֹ עֶבְרָ֣ה וָזַ֣עַם וְצָרָ֑ה מִ֝שְׁלַ֗חַת מַלְאֲכֵ֥י רָעִֽים׃
Translated:
He inflicted His burning anger upon them,
wrath, indignation, trouble,
a band of deadly messengers.
Transliteration: yeshalach-vam charvon afvo everah vazaam vetsarah mishelachat maleakhey raiym

Hebrew: יְפַלֵּ֥ס נָתִ֗יב לְאַ֫פּ֥וֹ לֹא־חָשַׂ֣ךְ מִמָּ֣וֶת נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְ֝חַיָּתָ֗ם לַדֶּ֥בֶר הִסְגִּֽיר׃
Translated:
He cleared a path for His anger;
He did not stop short of slaying them,
but gave them over to pestilence.
Transliteration: yefales natiyv leafvo lo-chashakhe mimavet nafesham vechayatam ladever hisegiyr

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ כׇּל־בְּכ֣וֹר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם רֵאשִׁ֥ית א֝וֹנִ֗ים בְּאׇהֳלֵי־חָֽם׃
Translated:
He struck every first-born in Egypt,
the first fruits of their vigor in the tents of Ham.
Transliteration: vayakhe khׇl-vekhvor vemitserayiim reshiyt voniym veׇholey-cham

Hebrew: וַיַּסַּ֣ע כַּצֹּ֣אן עַמּ֑וֹ וַֽיְנַהֲגֵ֥ם כַּ֝עֵ֗דֶר בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated:
He set His people moving like sheep,
drove them like a flock in the wilderness.
Transliteration: vayasa khatson amvo vayenahagem khaeder vamidevar

Hebrew: וַיַּנְחֵ֣ם לָ֭בֶטַח וְלֹ֣א פָחָ֑דוּ וְאֶת־א֝וֹיְבֵיהֶ֗ם כִּסָּ֥ה הַיָּֽם׃
Translated:
He led them in safety; they were unafraid;
as for their enemies, the sea covered them.
Transliteration: vayanechem lavetach velo fachadu veet-voyeveyhem khisah hayam

Hebrew: וַ֭יְבִיאֵם אֶל־גְּב֣וּל קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ הַר־זֶ֝֗ה קָנְתָ֥ה יְמִינֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He brought them to His holy realm,
the mountain His right hand had acquired.
Transliteration: vayeviyem el-gevul kׇdeshvo har-zeh kanetah yemiynvo

Hebrew: וַיְגָ֤רֶשׁ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֨ם ׀ גּוֹיִ֗ם וַֽ֭יַּפִּילֵם בְּחֶ֣בֶל נַחֲלָ֑ה וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֥ן בְּ֝אׇהֳלֵיהֶ֗ם שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
He expelled nations before them,
settled the tribes of Israel in their tents,
allotting them their portion by the line.
Transliteration: vayegaresh mifeneyhem gvoyim vayafiylem vechevel nachalah vayashekhen veׇholeyhem shivetey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְנַסּ֣וּ וַ֭יַּמְרוּ אֶת־אֱלֹהִ֣ים עֶלְי֑וֹן וְ֝עֵדוֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א שָׁמָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Yet they defiantly tested God Most High,
and did not observe His decrees.
Transliteration: vayenasu vayameru et-Elohim eleyvon veedvotayv lo shamaru

Hebrew: וַיִּסֹּ֣גוּ וַֽ֭יִּבְגְּדוּ כַּאֲבוֹתָ֑ם נֶ֝הְפְּכ֗וּ כְּקֶ֣שֶׁת רְמִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
They fell away, disloyal like their fathers;
they played false like a treacherous bow.
Transliteration: vayisogu vayivegedu khaavvotam nehefekhu khekeshet remiyah

Hebrew: וַיַּכְעִיס֥וּהוּ בְּבָמוֹתָ֑ם וּ֝בִפְסִילֵיהֶ֗ם יַקְנִיאֽוּהוּ׃
Translated:
They vexed Him with their high places;
they incensed Him with their idols.
Transliteration: vayakheiysuhu vevamvotam uvifesiyleyhem yakeniyuhu

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֣ע אֱ֭לֹהִים וַֽיִּתְעַבָּ֑ר וַיִּמְאַ֥ס מְ֝אֹ֗ד בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
God heard it and was enraged;
He utterly rejected Israel.
Transliteration: shama Elohim vayiteavar vayimeas meod veyisherael

Translated:
He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh,
the tent He had set among men.
Transliteration: vayitosh mishekhan shilvo ohel shikhen vaadam

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לַשְּׁבִ֣י עֻזּ֑וֹ וְֽתִפְאַרְתּ֥וֹ בְיַד־צָֽר׃
Translated:
He let His might go into captivity,
His glory into the hands of the foe.
Transliteration: vayiten lasheviy uzvo vetifearetvo veyad-tsar

Hebrew: וַיַּסְגֵּ֣ר לַחֶ֣רֶב עַמּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְנַחֲלָת֗וֹ הִתְעַבָּֽר׃
Translated:
He gave His people over to the sword;
He was enraged at His very own.
Transliteration: vayaseger lacherev amvo uvenachalatvo hiteavar

Hebrew: בַּחוּרָ֥יו אָכְלָה־אֵ֑שׁ וּ֝בְתוּלֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א הוּלָּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
Fire consumed their young men,
and their maidens remained unwed.
Transliteration: vachurayv akhelah-esh uvetulotayv lo hulalu

Hebrew: כֹּ֭הֲנָיו בַּחֶ֣רֶב נָפָ֑לוּ וְ֝אַלְמְנֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִבְכֶּֽינָה׃
Translated:
Their priests fell by the sword,
and their widows could not weep.
Transliteration: khohanayv vacherev nafalu vealemenotayv lo tivekheynah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַ֖ץ כְּיָשֵׁ֥ן <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָ֑י כְּ֝גִבּ֗וֹר מִתְרוֹנֵ֥ן מִיָּֽיִן׃
Translated:
The Lord awoke as from sleep,
like a warrior shaking off wine.
Transliteration: vayikats kheyashen <small></small> adonay khegivvor mitervonen miyayiin

Hebrew: וַיַּךְ־צָרָ֥יו אָח֑וֹר חֶרְפַּ֥ת ע֝וֹלָ֗ם נָ֣תַן לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
He beat back His foes,
dealing them lasting disgrace.
Transliteration: vayakhe-tsarayv achvor cherefat volam natan lamvo

Hebrew: וַ֭יִּמְאַס בְּאֹ֣הֶל יוֹסֵ֑ף וּֽבְשֵׁ֥בֶט אֶ֝פְרַ֗יִם לֹ֣א בָחָֽר׃
Translated:
He rejected the clan of Joseph;
He did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.
Transliteration: vayimeas veohel yvosef uveshevet eferayiim lo vachar

Hebrew: וַ֭יִּבְחַר אֶת־שֵׁ֣בֶט יְהוּדָ֑ה אֶֽת־הַ֥ר צִ֝יּ֗וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָהֵֽב׃
Translated:
He did choose the tribe of Judah,
Mount Zion, which He loved.
Transliteration: vayivechar et-shevet yehudah et-har tsiyyvon asher ahev

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣בֶן כְּמֽוֹ־רָ֭מִים מִקְדָּשׁ֑וֹ כְּ֝אֶ֗רֶץ יְסָדָ֥הּ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
He built His Sanctuary like the heavens,
like the earth that He established forever.
Transliteration: vayiven khemvo-ramiym mikedashvo kheerets yesadah levolam

Hebrew: וַ֭יִּבְחַר בְּדָוִ֣ד עַבְדּ֑וֹ וַ֝יִּקָּחֵ֗הוּ מִֽמִּכְלְאֹ֥ת צֹֽאן׃
Translated:
He chose David, His servant,
and took him from the sheepfolds.
Transliteration: vayivechar vedavid avedvo vayikachehu mimikheleot tson

Hebrew: מֵאַחַ֥ר עָל֗וֹת הֱבִ֫יא֥וֹ לִ֭רְעוֹת בְּיַעֲקֹ֣ב עַמּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He brought him from minding the nursing ewes
to tend His people Jacob, Israel, His very own.
Transliteration: meachar alvot heviyvo lirevot veyaakov amvo uveyisherael nachalatvo

Hebrew: וַ֭יִּרְעֵם כְּתֹ֣ם לְבָב֑וֹ וּבִתְבוּנ֖וֹת כַּפָּ֣יו יַנְחֵֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
He tended them with blameless heart;
with skillful hands he led them.
Transliteration: vayireem khetom levavvo uvitevunvot khafayv yanechem {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אֱֽלֹהִ֡ים בָּ֤אוּ גוֹיִ֨ם ׀ בְּֽנַחֲלָתֶ֗ךָ טִ֭מְּאוּ אֶת־הֵיכַ֣ל קׇדְשֶׁ֑ךָ שָׂ֖מוּ אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֣͏ִם לְעִיִּֽים׃
Translated:
A psalm of Asaph.

O God, heathens have entered Your domain,
defiled Your holy temple,
and turned Jerusalem into ruins.
Transliteration: mizemvor leasaf Elohimm vau gvoyim venachalatekha timeu et-heykhal kׇdeshekha shamu et-yerushala͏im leiyiym

Hebrew: נָתְנ֡וּ אֶת־נִבְלַ֬ת עֲבָדֶ֗יךָ מַ֭אֲכָל לְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם בְּשַׂ֥ר חֲ֝סִידֶ֗יךָ לְחַיְתוֹ־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
They have left Your servants’ corpses
as food for the fowl of heaven,
and the flesh of Your faithful for the wild beasts.
Transliteration: natenu et-nivelat avadeykha maakhal levof hashamayiim veshar chasiydeykha lechayetvo-arets

Hebrew: שָׁפְכ֬וּ דָמָ֨ם ׀ כַּמַּ֗יִם סְֽבִ֘יב֤וֹת יְֽרוּשָׁלָ֗͏ִם וְאֵ֣ין קוֹבֵֽר׃
Translated:
Their blood was shed like water around Jerusalem,
with none to bury them.
Transliteration: shafekhu damam khamayiim seviyvvot yerushala͏im veeyn kvover

Hebrew: הָיִ֣ינוּ חֶ֭רְפָּה לִשְׁכֵנֵ֑ינוּ לַ֥עַג וָ֝קֶ֗לֶס לִסְבִיבוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
We have become the butt of our neighbors,
the scorn and derision of those around us.
Transliteration: hayiynu cherefah lishekheneynu laag vakeles liseviyvvoteynu

Hebrew: עַד־מָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה תֶּאֱנַ֣ף לָנֶ֑צַח תִּֽבְעַ֥ר כְּמוֹ־אֵ֝֗שׁ קִנְאָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
How long, O LORD, will You be angry forever,
will Your indignation blaze like fire?
Transliteration: ad-mah yehovah teenaf lanetsach tivear khemvo-esh kineatekha

Hebrew: שְׁפֹ֤ךְ חֲמָתְךָ֗ אֶֽל־הַגּוֹיִם֮ אֲשֶׁ֢ר לֹא־יְדָ֫ע֥וּךָ וְעַ֥ל מַמְלָכ֑וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּ֝שִׁמְךָ֗ לֹ֣א קָרָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
Pour out Your fury on the nations that do not know You,
upon the kingdoms that do not invoke Your name,
Transliteration: shefokhe chamatekha el-hagvoyim ashe֢r lo-yedaukha veal mamelakhvot asher veshimekha lo karau

Hebrew: כִּ֭י אָכַ֣ל אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְֽאֶת־נָוֵ֥הוּ הֵשַֽׁמּוּ׃
Translated:
for they have devoured Jacob
and desolated his home.
Transliteration: khiy akhal et-yaakov veet-navehu heshamu

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּזְכׇּר־לָנוּ֮ עֲוֺנֹ֢ת רִאשֹׁ֫נִ֥ים מַ֭הֵר יְקַדְּמ֣וּנוּ רַחֲמֶ֑יךָ כִּ֖י דַלּ֣וֹנוּ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
Do not hold our former iniquities against us;
let Your compassion come swiftly toward us,
for we have sunk very low.
Transliteration: al-tizekhׇr-lanu avono֢t rishoniym maher yekademunu rachameykha khiy dalvonu meod

Hebrew: עׇזְרֵ֤נוּ ׀ אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י יִשְׁעֵ֗נוּ עַֽל־דְּבַ֥ר כְּבֽוֹד־שְׁמֶ֑ךָ וְהַצִּילֵ֥נוּ וְכַפֵּ֥ר עַל־חַ֝טֹּאתֵ֗ינוּ לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Help us, O God, our deliverer,
for the sake of the glory of Your name.
Save us and forgive our sin,
for the sake of Your name.
Transliteration: ׇzerenu elohey yisheenu al-devar khevvod-shemekha vehatsiylenu vekhafer al-chatoteynu lemaan shemekha

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה ׀ יֹאמְר֣וּ הַגּוֹיִם֮ אַיֵּ֢ה אֱֽלֹהֵ֫יהֶ֥ם יִוָּדַ֣ע (בגיים) [בַּגּוֹיִ֣ם] לְעֵינֵ֑ינוּ נִ֝קְמַ֗ת דַּֽם־עֲבָדֶ֥יךָ הַשָּׁפֽוּךְ׃
Translated:
Let the nations not say, “Where is their God?”
Before our eyes let it be known among the nations
that You avenge the spilled blood of Your servants.
Transliteration: lamah yomeru hagvoyim aye֢h eloheyhem yivada (vgyym) [vagvoyim] leeyneynu nikemat dam-avadeykha hashafukhe

Hebrew: תָּ֤ב֣וֹא לְפָנֶיךָ֮ אֶנְקַ֢ת אָ֫סִ֥יר כְּגֹ֥דֶל זְרוֹעֲךָ֑ ה֝וֹתֵ֗ר בְּנֵ֣י תְמוּתָֽה׃
Translated:
Let the groans of the prisoners reach You;
reprieve those condemned to death,
as befits Your great strength.
Transliteration: tavvo lefaneykha eneka֢t asiyr khegodel zervoakha hvoter veney temutah

Hebrew: וְהָ֘שֵׁ֤ב לִשְׁכֵנֵ֣ינוּ שִׁ֭בְעָתַיִם אֶל־חֵיקָ֑ם חֶרְפָּ֘תָ֤ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר חֵרְפ֣וּךָ אֲדֹנָֽי׃
Translated:
Pay back our neighbors sevenfold
for the abuse they have flung at You, O Lord.
Transliteration: vehashev lishekheneynu shiveatayim el-cheykam cherefatam asher cherefukha adonay

Hebrew: וַאֲנַ֤חְנוּ עַמְּךָ֨ ׀ וְצֹ֥אן מַרְעִיתֶךָ֮ נ֤וֹדֶ֥ה לְּךָ֗ לְע֫וֹלָ֥ם לְד֥וֹר וָדֹ֑ר נְ֝סַפֵּ֗ר תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Then we, Your people,
the flock You shepherd,
shall glorify You forever;
for all time we shall tell Your praises.
Transliteration: vaanachenu amekha vetson mareiytekha nvodeh lekha levolam ledvor vador nesafer tehilatekha {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אֶל־שֹׁשַׁנִּ֑ים עֵד֖וּת לְאָסָ֣ף מִזְמֽוֹר׃
Translated: For the leader; on shoshannim, eduth. Of Asaph. A psalm.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha el-shoshaniym edut leasaf mizemvor

Hebrew: רֹ֘עֵ֤ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל ׀ הַאֲזִ֗ינָה נֹהֵ֣ג כַּצֹּ֣אן יוֹסֵ֑ף יֹשֵׁ֖ב הַכְּרוּבִ֣ים הוֹפִֽיעָה׃
Translated:
Give ear, O shepherd of Israel
who leads Joseph like a flock!
Appear, You who are enthroned on the cherubim,
Transliteration: roeh yisherael haaziynah noheg khatson yvosef yoshev hakheruviym hvofiyah

Hebrew: לִפְנֵ֤י אֶפְרַ֨יִם ׀ וּבִנְיָ֘מִ֤ן וּמְנַשֶּׁ֗ה עוֹרְרָ֥ה אֶת־גְּבוּרָתֶ֑ךָ וּלְכָ֖ה לִישֻׁעָ֣תָה לָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
at the head of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh!
Rouse Your might and come to our help!
Transliteration: lifeney eferayiim uvineyamin umenasheh vorerah et-gevuratekha ulekhah liyshuatah lanu

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֥ים הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נוּ וְהָאֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וְנִוָּשֵֽׁעָה׃
Translated:
Restore us, O God;
show Your favor that we may be delivered.
Transliteration: Elohim hashiyvenu vehaer faneykha venivasheah

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְבָא֑וֹת עַד־מָתַ֥י עָ֝שַׁ֗נְתָּ בִּתְפִלַּ֥ת עַמֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
O LORD, God of hosts,
how long will You be wrathful
toward the prayers of Your people?
Transliteration: yehovah Elohim tsevavot ad-matay ashaneta vitefilat amekha

Hebrew: הֶ֭אֱכַלְתָּם לֶ֣חֶם דִּמְעָ֑ה וַ֝תַּשְׁקֵ֗מוֹ בִּדְמָע֥וֹת שָׁלִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
You have fed them tears as their daily bread,
made them drink great measures of tears.
Transliteration: heekhaletam lechem dimeah vatashekemvo videmavot shaliysh

Hebrew: תְּשִׂימֵ֣נוּ מָ֭דוֹן לִשְׁכֵנֵ֑ינוּ וְ֝אֹיְבֵ֗ינוּ יִלְעֲגוּ־לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
You set us at strife with our neighbors;
our enemies mock us at will.
Transliteration: teshiymenu madvon lishekheneynu veoyeveynu yileagu-lamvo

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְבָא֣וֹת הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נוּ וְהָאֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וְנִוָּשֵֽׁעָה׃
Translated:
O God of hosts, restore us;
show Your favor that we may be delivered.
Transliteration: Elohim tsevavot hashiyvenu vehaer faneykha venivasheah

Hebrew: גֶּ֭פֶן מִמִּצְרַ֣יִם תַּסִּ֑יעַ תְּגָרֵ֥שׁ גּ֝וֹיִ֗ם וַתִּטָּעֶֽהָ׃
Translated:
You plucked up a vine from Egypt;
You expelled nations and planted it.
Transliteration: gefen mimitserayiim tasiya tegaresh gvoyim vatitaeha

Hebrew: פִּנִּ֥יתָ לְפָנֶ֑יהָ וַתַּשְׁרֵ֥שׁ שׇׁ֝רָשֶׁ֗יהָ וַתְּמַלֵּא־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
You cleared a place for it;
it took deep root and filled the land.
Transliteration: finiyta lefaneyha vatasheresh shׇrasheyha vatemale-arets

Hebrew: כׇּסּ֣וּ הָרִ֣ים צִלָּ֑הּ וַ֝עֲנָפֶ֗יהָ אַֽרְזֵי־אֵֽל׃
Translated:
The mountains were covered by its shade,
mighty cedars by its boughs.
Transliteration: khׇsu hariym tsilah vaanafeyha arezey-el

Hebrew: תְּשַׁלַּ֣ח קְצִירֶ֣הָ עַד־יָ֑ם וְאֶל־נָ֝הָ֗ר יוֹנְקוֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Its branches reached the sea,
its shoots, the river.
Transliteration: teshalach ketsiyreha ad-yam veel-nahar yvonekvoteyha

Hebrew: לָ֭מָּה פָּרַ֣צְתָּ גְדֵרֶ֑יהָ וְ֝אָר֗וּהָ כׇּל־עֹ֥בְרֵי דָֽרֶךְ׃
Translated:
Why did You breach its wall
so that every passerby plucks its fruit,
Transliteration: lamah faratseta gedereyha vearuha khׇl-overey darekhe

Hebrew: יְכַרְסְמֶ֣נָּֽה חֲזִ֣יר מִיָּ֑<sup>עַ</sup>ר וְזִ֖יז שָׂדַ֣י יִרְעֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
wild boars gnaw at it,
and creatures of the field feed on it?
Transliteration: yekharesemenah chaziyr miya<sup>a</sup>r veziyz shaday yireenah

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְבָאוֹת֮ שֽׁ֫וּב־נָ֥א הַבֵּ֣ט מִשָּׁמַ֣יִם וּרְאֵ֑ה וּ֝פְקֹ֗ד גֶּ֣פֶן זֹֽאת׃
Translated:
O God of hosts, turn again,
look down from heaven and see;
take note of that vine,
Transliteration: Elohim tsevavot shuuv-na havet mishamayiim ureeh ufekod gefen zot

Hebrew: וְ֭<big>כַ</big>נָּה אֲשֶׁר־נָטְעָ֣ה יְמִינֶ֑ךָ וְעַל־בֵּ֝֗ן אִמַּ֥צְתָּה לָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
the stock planted by Your right hand,
the stem you have taken as Your own.
Transliteration: ve<big>kha</big>nah asher-nateah yemiynekha veal-ven imatsetah lakhe

Hebrew: שְׂרֻפָ֣ה בָאֵ֣שׁ כְּסוּחָ֑ה מִגַּעֲרַ֖ת פָּנֶ֣יךָ יֹאבֵֽדוּ׃
Translated:
For it is burned by fire and cut down,
perishing before Your angry blast.
Transliteration: sherufah vaesh khesuchah migaarat faneykha yovedu

Hebrew: תְּֽהִי־יָ֭דְךָ עַל־אִ֣ישׁ יְמִינֶ֑ךָ עַל־בֶּן־אָ֝דָ֗ם אִמַּ֥צְתָּ לָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
Grant Your help to the man at Your right hand,
the one You have taken as Your own.
Transliteration: tehiy-yadekha al-iysh yemiynekha al-ven-adam imatseta lakhe

Hebrew: וְלֹא־נָס֥וֹג מִמֶּ֑ךָּ תְּ֝חַיֵּ֗נוּ וּבְשִׁמְךָ֥ נִקְרָֽא׃
Translated:
We will not turn away from You;
preserve our life that we may invoke Your name.
Transliteration: velo-nasvog mimekha techayenu uveshimekha nikera

Hebrew: יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְבָא֣וֹת הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נוּ הָאֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וְנִוָּשֵֽׁעָה׃ {פ}
Translated:
O LORD, God of hosts, restore us;
show Your favor that we may be delivered.
Transliteration: yehovah Elohim tsevavot hashiyvenu haer faneykha venivasheah {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> עַֽל־הַגִּתִּ֬ית לְאָסָֽף׃
Translated: For the leader; on the gittith. Of Asaph.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha <small></small> al-hagitiyt leasaf

Hebrew: הַ֭רְנִינוּ לֵאלֹהִ֣ים עוּזֵּ֑נוּ הָ֝רִ֗יעוּ לֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
Sing joyously to God, our strength;
raise a shout for the God of Jacob.
Transliteration: hareniynu lelohiym uzenu hariyu lelohey yaakov

Hebrew: שְֽׂאוּ־זִ֭מְרָה וּתְנוּ־תֹ֑ף כִּנּ֖וֹר נָעִ֣ים עִם־נָֽבֶל׃
Translated:
Take up the song,
sound the timbrel,
the melodious lyre and harp.
Transliteration: sheu-zimerah utenu-tof khinvor naiym im-navel

Hebrew: תִּקְע֣וּ בַחֹ֣דֶשׁ שׁוֹפָ֑ר בַּ֝כֵּ֗סֶה לְי֣וֹם חַגֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Blow the horn on the new moon,
on the full moon for our feast day.
Transliteration: tikeu vachodesh shvofar vakheseh leyvom chagenu

Hebrew: כִּ֤י חֹ֣ק לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל ה֑וּא מִ֝שְׁפָּ֗ט לֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
For it is a law for Israel,
a ruling of the God of Jacob;
Transliteration: khiy chok leyisherael hu mishefat lelohey yaakov

Hebrew: עֵד֤וּת ׀ בִּיה֘וֹסֵ֤ף שָׂמ֗וֹ בְּ֭צֵאתוֹ עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם שְׂפַ֖ת לֹא־יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated:
He imposed it as a decree upon Joseph
when he went forth from the land of Egypt;
I heard a language that I knew not.
Transliteration: edut viyhvosef shamvo vetsetvo al-erets mitserayiim shefat lo-yadaetiy eshema

Hebrew: הֲסִיר֣וֹתִי מִסֵּ֣בֶל שִׁכְמ֑וֹ כַּ֝פָּ֗יו מִדּ֥וּד תַּעֲבֹֽרְנָה׃
Translated:
I relieved his shoulder of the burden,
his hands were freed from the basket.
Transliteration: hasiyrvotiy misevel shikhemvo khafayv midud taavorenah

Hebrew: בַּצָּרָ֥ה קָרָ֗אתָ וָאֲחַ֫לְּצֶ֥ךָּ אֶ֭עֶנְךָ בְּסֵ֣תֶר רַ֑עַם אֶבְחׇנְךָ֨ עַל־מֵ֖י מְרִיבָ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
In distress you called and I rescued you;
I answered you from the secret place of thunder
I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
Transliteration: vatsarah karata vaachaletsekha eenekha veseter raam evechׇnekha al-mey meriyvah selah

Hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע עַ֭מִּי וְאָעִ֣ידָה בָּ֑ךְ יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל אִם־תִּֽשְׁמַֽע־לִֽי׃
Translated:
Hear, My people, and I will admonish you;
Israel, if you would but listen to Me!
Transliteration: shema amiy veaiydah vakhe yisherael im-tishema-liy

Hebrew: לֹא־יִהְיֶ֣ה בְ֭ךָ אֵ֣ל זָ֑ר וְלֹ֥א תִ֝שְׁתַּחֲוֶ֗ה לְאֵ֣ל נֵכָֽר׃
Translated:
You shall have no foreign god,
you shall not bow to an alien god.
Transliteration: lo-yiheyeh vekha el zar velo tishetachaveh leel nekhar

Hebrew: אָֽנֹכִ֨י ׀ יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ הַֽ֭מַּעַלְךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם הַרְחֶב־פִּ֝֗יךָ וַאֲמַלְאֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
I the LORD am your God
who brought you out of the land of Egypt;
open your mouth wide and I will fill it.
Transliteration: anokhiy yehovah eloheykha hamaalekha meerets mitserayiim harechev-fiykha vaamaleehu

Hebrew: וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֣ע עַמִּ֣י לְקוֹלִ֑י וְ֝יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֹא־אָ֥בָה לִֽי׃
Translated:
But My people would not listen to Me,
Israel would not obey Me.
Transliteration: velo-shama amiy lekvoliy veyiisherael lo-avah liy

Hebrew: וָ֭אֲשַׁלְּחֵהוּ בִּשְׁרִיר֣וּת לִבָּ֑ם יֵ֝לְכ֗וּ בְּֽמוֹעֲצ֖וֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
So I let them go after their willful heart
that they might follow their own devices.
Transliteration: vaashalechehu visheriyrut livam eilekhu vemvoatsvoteyhem

Hebrew: ל֗וּ עַ֭מִּי שֹׁמֵ֣עַֽ לִ֑י יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל בִּדְרָכַ֥י יְהַלֵּֽכוּ׃
Translated:
If only My people would listen to Me,
if Israel would follow My paths,
Transliteration: lu amiy shomea liy yisherael viderakhay yehalekhu

Hebrew: כִּ֭מְעַט אוֹיְבֵיהֶ֣ם אַכְנִ֑יעַ וְעַ֥ל צָ֝רֵיהֶ֗ם אָשִׁ֥יב יָדִֽי׃
Translated:
then would I subdue their enemies at once,
strike their foes again and again.
Transliteration: khimeat voyeveyhem akheniya veal tsareyhem ashiyv yadiy

Hebrew: מְשַׂנְאֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה יְכַחֲשׁוּ־ל֑וֹ וִיהִ֖י עִתָּ֣ם לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Those who hate the LORD shall cower before Him;
their doom shall be eternal.
Transliteration: meshaneey yehovah yekhachashu-lvo viyhiy itam levolam

Hebrew: וַֽ֭יַּאֲכִילֵהוּ מֵחֵ֣לֶב חִטָּ֑ה וּ֝מִצּ֗וּר דְּבַ֣שׁ אַשְׂבִּיעֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He fed them the finest wheat;
I sated you with honey from the rock.
Transliteration: vayaakhiylehu mechelev chitah umitsur devash asheviyekha {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים נִצָּ֥ב בַּעֲדַת־אֵ֑ל בְּקֶ֖רֶב אֱלֹהִ֣ים יִשְׁפֹּֽט׃
Translated:
A psalm of Asaph.

God stands in the divine assembly;
among the divine beings He pronounces judgment.
Transliteration: mizemvor leasaf Elohimm nitsav vaadat-el vekerev Elohim yishefot

Hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֥י תִּשְׁפְּטוּ־עָ֑וֶל וּפְנֵ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תִּשְׂאוּ־סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
How long will you judge perversely,
showing favor to the wicked? Selah.
Transliteration: ad-matay tishefetu-avel ufeney reshaiym tisheu-selah

Hebrew: שִׁפְטוּ־דַ֥ל וְיָת֑וֹם עָנִ֖י וָרָ֣שׁ הַצְדִּֽיקוּ׃
Translated:
Judge the wretched and the orphan,
vindicate the lowly and the poor,
Transliteration: shifetu-dal veyatvom aniy varash hatsediyku

Hebrew: פַּלְּטוּ־דַ֥ל וְאֶבְי֑וֹן מִיַּ֖ד רְשָׁעִ֣ים הַצִּֽילוּ׃
Translated:
rescue the wretched and the needy;
save them from the hand of the wicked.
Transliteration: faletu-dal veeveyvon miyad reshaiym hatsiylu

Hebrew: לֹ֤א יָדְע֨וּ ׀ וְלֹ֥א יָבִ֗ינוּ בַּחֲשֵׁכָ֥ה יִתְהַלָּ֑כוּ יִ֝מּ֗וֹטוּ כׇּל־מ֥וֹסְדֵי אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
They neither know nor understand,
they go about in darkness;
all the foundations of the earth totter.
Transliteration: lo yadeu velo yaviynu vachashekhah yitehalakhu yimvotu khׇl-mvosedey arets

Hebrew: אֲֽנִי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי אֱלֹהִ֣ים אַתֶּ֑ם וּבְנֵ֖י עֶלְי֣וֹן כֻּלְּכֶֽם׃
Translated:
I had taken you for divine beings,
sons of the Most High, all of you;
Transliteration: aniy-amaretiy Elohim atem uveney eleyvon khulekhem

Hebrew: אָ֭כֵן כְּאָדָ֣ם תְּמוּת֑וּן וּכְאַחַ֖ד הַשָּׂרִ֣ים תִּפֹּֽלוּ׃
Translated:
but you shall die as men do,
fall like any prince.
Transliteration: akhen kheadam temutun ukheachad hashariym tifolu

Hebrew: קוּמָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים שׇׁפְטָ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה תִ֝נְחַ֗ל בְּכׇל־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Arise, O God, judge the earth,
for all the nations are Your possession.
Transliteration: kumah Elohim shׇfetah haarets khiy-atah tinechal vekhׇl-hagvoyim {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֖יר מִזְמ֣וֹר לְאָסָֽף׃
Translated: A song, a psalm of Asaph.
Transliteration: shiyr mizemvor leasaf

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֥ים אַל־דֳּמִי־לָ֑ךְ אַל־תֶּחֱרַ֖שׁ וְאַל־תִּשְׁקֹ֣ט אֵֽל׃
Translated:
O God, do not be silent;
do not hold aloof;
do not be quiet, O God!
Transliteration: Elohim al-domiy-lakhe al-techerash veal-tishekot el

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֣ה א֭וֹיְבֶיךָ יֶהֱמָי֑וּן וּ֝מְשַׂנְאֶ֗יךָ נָ֣שְׂאוּ רֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated:
For Your enemies rage,
Your foes assert themselves.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh voyeveykha yehemayun umeshaneeykha nasheu rosh

Hebrew: עַֽל־עַ֭מְּךָ יַעֲרִ֣ימוּ ס֑וֹד וְ֝יִתְיָעֲצ֗וּ עַל־צְפוּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
They plot craftily against Your people,
take counsel against Your treasured ones.
Transliteration: al-amekha yaariymu svod veyiiteyaatsu al-tsefuneykha

Hebrew: אָמְר֗וּ לְ֭כוּ וְנַכְחִידֵ֣ם מִגּ֑וֹי וְלֹֽא־יִזָּכֵ֖ר שֵֽׁם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עֽוֹד׃
Translated:
They say, “Let us wipe them out as a nation;
Israel’s name will be mentioned no more.”
Transliteration: ameru lekhu venakhechiydem migvoy velo-yizakher shem-yisherael vod

Hebrew: כִּ֤י נוֹעֲצ֣וּ לֵ֣ב יַחְדָּ֑ו עָ֝לֶ֗יךָ בְּרִ֣ית יִכְרֹֽתוּ׃
Translated:
Unanimous in their counsel
they have made an alliance against You—
Transliteration: khiy nvoatsu lev yachedav aleykha veriyt yikherotu

Hebrew: אׇהֳלֵ֣י אֱ֭דוֹם וְיִשְׁמְעֵאלִ֗ים מוֹאָ֥ב וְהַגְרִֽים׃
Translated:
the clans of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
Moab and the Hagrites,
Transliteration: ׇholey edvom veyishemeeliym mvoav vehageriym

Hebrew: גְּבָ֣ל וְ֭עַמּוֹן וַעֲמָלֵ֑ק פְּ֝לֶ֗שֶׁת עִם־יֹ֥שְׁבֵי צֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek,
Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;
Transliteration: geval veamvon vaamalek feleshet im-yoshevey tsvor

Hebrew: גַּם־אַ֭שּׁוּר נִלְוָ֣ה עִמָּ֑ם הָ֤יֽוּ־זְר֖וֹעַ לִבְנֵי־ל֣וֹט סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Assyria too joins forces with them;
they give support to the sons of Lot. Selah.
Transliteration: gam-ashur nilevah imam hayu-zervoa liveney-lvot selah

Hebrew: עֲשֵֽׂה־לָהֶ֥ם כְּמִדְיָ֑ן כְּֽסִיסְרָ֥א כְ֝יָבִ֗ין בְּנַ֣חַל קִישֽׁוֹן׃
Translated:
Deal with them as You did with Midian,
with Sisera, with Jabin,
at the brook Kishon—
Transliteration: asheh-lahem khemideyan khesiysera kheyaviyn venachal kiyshvon

Hebrew: נִשְׁמְד֥וּ בְֽעֵין־דֹּ֑אר הָ֥יוּ דֹ֝֗מֶן לָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated:
who were destroyed at En-dor,
who became dung for the field.
Transliteration: nishemedu veeyn-dor hayu domen laadamah

Hebrew: שִׁיתֵ֣מוֹ נְ֭דִיבֵימוֹ כְּעֹרֵ֣ב וְכִזְאֵ֑ב וּֽכְזֶ֥בַח וּ֝כְצַלְמֻנָּ֗ע כׇּל־נְסִיכֵֽימוֹ׃
Translated:
Treat their great men like Oreb and Zeeb,
all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
Transliteration: shiytemvo nediyveymvo kheorev vekhizeev ukhezevach ukhetsalemuna khׇl-nesiykheymvo

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָ֭מְרוּ נִ֣ירְשָׁה לָּ֑נוּ אֵ֝֗ת נְא֣וֹת אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: who said, “Let us take the meadows of God as our possession.”
Transliteration: asher ameru niyreshah lanu et nevot Elohim

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהַ֗י שִׁיתֵ֥מוֹ כַגַּלְגַּ֑ל כְּ֝קַ֗שׁ לִפְנֵי־רֽוּחַ׃
Translated:
O my God, make them like thistledown,
like stubble driven by the wind.
Transliteration: elohay shiytemvo khagalegal khekash lifeney-rucha

Hebrew: כְּאֵ֥שׁ תִּבְעַר־יָ֑עַר וּ֝כְלֶהָבָ֗ה תְּלַהֵ֥ט הָרִֽים׃
Translated:
As a fire burns a forest,
as flames scorch the hills,
Transliteration: kheesh tivear-yaar ukhelehavah telahet hariym

Hebrew: כֵּ֭ן תִּרְדְּפֵ֣ם בְּסַעֲרֶ֑ךָ וּבְסוּפָתְךָ֥ תְבַהֲלֵֽם׃
Translated:
pursue them with Your tempest,
terrify them with Your storm.
Transliteration: khen tiredefem vesaarekha uvesufatekha tevahalem

Hebrew: מַלֵּ֣א פְנֵיהֶ֣ם קָל֑וֹן וִיבַקְשׁ֖וּ שִׁמְךָ֣ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Cover their faces with shame
so that they seek Your name, O LORD.
Transliteration: male feneyhem kalvon viyvakeshu shimekha yehovah

Hebrew: יֵבֹ֖שׁוּ וְיִבָּהֲל֥וּ עֲדֵי־עַ֗ד וְֽיַחְפְּר֥וּ וְיֹאבֵֽדוּ׃
Translated:
May they be frustrated and terrified,
disgraced and doomed forever.
Transliteration: eivoshu veyivahalu adey-ad veyacheferu veyovedu

Hebrew: וְֽיֵדְע֗וּ כִּי־אַתָּ֬ה שִׁמְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֣ה לְבַדֶּ֑ךָ עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן עַל־כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
May they know
that Your name, Yours alone, is the LORD,
supreme over all the earth.
Transliteration: veeiedeu khiy-atah shimekha yehovah levadekha eleyvon al-khׇl-haarets {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־הַגִּתִּ֑ית לִבְנֵי־קֹ֥רַח מִזְמֽוֹר׃
Translated: For the leader; on the gittith. Of the Korahites. A psalm.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha al-hagitiyt liveney-korach mizemvor

Hebrew: מַה־יְּדִיד֥וֹת מִשְׁכְּנוֹתֶ֗יךָ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
How lovely is Your dwelling-place,
O LORD of hosts.
Transliteration: mah-yediydvot mishekhenvoteykha yehovah tsevavot

Hebrew: נִכְסְפָ֬ה וְגַם־כָּלְתָ֨ה ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ לְחַצְר֢וֹת יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה לִבִּ֥י וּבְשָׂרִ֑י יְ֝רַנְּנ֗וּ אֶ֣ל אֵֽל־חָֽי׃
Translated:
I long, I yearn for the courts of the LORD;
my body and soul shout for joy to the living God.
Transliteration: nikhesefah vegam-khaletah nafeshiy lechatser֢vot yehovah liviy uveshariy yeranenu el el-chay

Hebrew: גַּם־צִפּ֨וֹר מָ֪צְאָה בַ֡יִת וּדְר֤וֹר ׀ קֵ֥ן לָהּ֮ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֢תָה אֶפְרֹ֫חֶ֥יהָ אֶֽת־מִ֭זְבְּחוֹתֶיךָ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת מַ֝לְכִּ֗י וֵאלֹהָֽי׃
Translated:
Even the sparrow has found a home,
and the swallow a nest for herself
in which to set her young,
near Your altar, O LORD of hosts,
my king and my God.
Transliteration: gam-tsifvor matseah vayiit udervor ken lah asher-sha֢tah eferocheyha et-mizevechvoteykha yehovah tsevavot malekhiy velohay

Hebrew: אַ֭שְׁרֵי יוֹשְׁבֵ֣י בֵיתֶ֑ךָ ע֝֗וֹד יְֽהַלְל֥וּךָ סֶּֽלָה׃
Translated:
Happy are those who dwell in Your house;
they forever praise You. Selah.
Transliteration: asherey yvoshevey veytekha vod yehalelukha selah

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י אָ֭דָם עֽוֹז־ל֥וֹ בָ֑ךְ מְ֝סִלּ֗וֹת בִּלְבָבָֽם׃
Translated:
Happy is the man who finds refuge in You,
whose mind is on the [pilgrim] highways.
Transliteration: asherey adam voz-lvo vakhe mesilvot vilevavam

Hebrew: עֹבְרֵ֤י ׀ בְּעֵ֣מֶק הַ֭בָּכָא מַעְיָ֣ן יְשִׁית֑וּהוּ גַּם־בְּ֝רָכ֗וֹת יַעְטֶ֥ה מוֹרֶֽה׃
Translated:
They pass through the Valley of Baca,
regarding it as a place of springs,
as if the early rain had covered it with blessing.
Transliteration: overey veemek havakha maeyan yeshiytuhu gam-verakhvot yaeteh mvoreh

Hebrew: יֵ֭לְכוּ מֵחַ֣יִל אֶל־חָ֑יִל יֵרָאֶ֖ה אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֣ים בְּצִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
They go from rampart to rampart,
appearing before God in Zion.
Transliteration: eilekhu mechayiil el-chayiil eiraeh el-Elohim vetsiyyvon

Hebrew: יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְ֭בָאוֹת שִׁמְעָ֣ה תְפִלָּתִ֑י הַאֲזִ֨ינָה אֱלֹהֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
O LORD, God of hosts,
hear my prayer;
give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
Transliteration: yehovah Elohim tsevavot shimeah tefilatiy haaziynah elohey yaakov selah

Hebrew: מָ֭גִנֵּנוּ רְאֵ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְ֝הַבֵּ֗ט פְּנֵ֣י מְשִׁיחֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
O God, behold our shield,
look upon the face of Your anointed.
Transliteration: maginenu reeh Elohim vehavet feney meshiychekha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י טֽוֹב־י֥וֹם בַּחֲצֵרֶ֗יךָ מֵ֫אָ֥לֶף בָּחַ֗רְתִּי הִ֭סְתּוֹפֵף בְּבֵ֣ית אֱלֹהַ֑י מִ֝דּ֗וּר בְּאׇהֳלֵי־רֶֽשַׁע׃
Translated:
Better one day in Your courts than a thousand [anywhere else];
I would rather stand at the threshold of God’s house
than dwell in the tents of the wicked.
Transliteration: khiy tvov-yvom vachatsereykha mealef vacharetiy hisetvofef veveyt elohay midur veׇholey-resha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י שֶׁ֨מֶשׁ ׀ וּמָגֵן֮ יְהֹוָ֢ה אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים חֵ֣ן וְ֭כָבוֹד יִתֵּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹ֥א יִמְנַע־ט֝֗וֹב לַֽהֹלְכִ֥ים בְּתָמִֽים׃
Translated:
For the LORD God is sun and shield;
the LORD bestows grace and glory;
He does not withhold His bounty from those who live without blame.
Transliteration: khiy shemesh umagen yehova֢h Elohimm chen vekhavvod yiten yehovah lo yimena-tvov laholekhiym vetamiym

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֑וֹת אַֽשְׁרֵ֥י אָ֝דָ֗ם בֹּטֵ֥חַ בָּֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
O LORD of hosts,
happy is the man who trusts in You.
Transliteration: yehovah tsevavot asherey adam votecha vakhe {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מִזְמֽוֹר׃
Translated: For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha <small></small> liveney-korach mizemvor

Hebrew: רָצִ֣יתָ יְהֹוָ֣ה אַרְצֶ֑ךָ שַׁ֝֗בְתָּ (שבות) [שְׁבִ֣ית] יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
O LORD, You will favor Your land,
restore Jacob’s fortune;
Transliteration: ratsiyta yehovah aretsekha shaveta (shvvt) [sheviyt] yaakov

Hebrew: נָ֭שָׂאתָ עֲוֺ֣ן עַמֶּ֑ךָ כִּסִּ֖יתָ כׇל־חַטָּאתָ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
You will forgive Your people’s iniquity,
pardon all their sins; selah
Transliteration: nashata avon amekha khisiyta khׇl-chatatam selah

Hebrew: אָסַ֥פְתָּ כׇל־עֶבְרָתֶ֑ךָ הֱ֝שִׁיב֗וֹתָ מֵחֲר֥וֹן אַפֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
You will withdraw all Your anger,
turn away from Your rage.
Transliteration: asafeta khׇl-everatekha heshiyvvota mecharvon afekha

Hebrew: שׁ֭וּבֵנוּ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעֵ֑נוּ וְהָפֵ֖ר כַּעַסְךָ֣ עִמָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Turn again, O God, our helper,
revoke Your displeasure with us.
Transliteration: shuvenu elohey yisheenu vehafer khaasekha imanu

Hebrew: הַלְעוֹלָ֥ם תֶּאֱנַף־בָּ֑נוּ תִּמְשֹׁ֥ךְ אַ֝פְּךָ֗ לְדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃
Translated:
Will You be angry with us forever,
prolong Your wrath for all generations?
Transliteration: halevolam teenaf-vanu timeshokhe afekha ledor vador

Hebrew: הֲֽלֹא־אַ֭תָּה תָּשׁ֣וּב תְּחַיֵּ֑נוּ וְ֝עַמְּךָ֗ יִשְׂמְחוּ־בָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Surely You will revive us again,
so that Your people may rejoice in You.
Transliteration: halo-atah tashuv techayenu veamekha yishemechu-vakhe

Hebrew: הַרְאֵ֣נוּ יְהֹוָ֣ה חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝יֶשְׁעֲךָ֗ תִּתֶּן־לָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Show us, O LORD, Your faithfulness;
grant us Your deliverance.
Transliteration: hareenu yehovah chasedekha veyesheakha titen-lanu

Hebrew: אֶשְׁמְעָ֗ה מַה־יְדַבֵּר֮ הָאֵ֢ל ׀ יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה כִּ֤י ׀ יְדַבֵּ֬ר שָׁל֗וֹם אֶל־עַמּ֥וֹ וְאֶל־חֲסִידָ֑יו וְאַל־יָשׁ֥וּבוּ לְכִסְלָֽה׃
Translated:
Let me hear what God, the LORD, will speak;
He will promise well-being to His people, His faithful ones;
may they not turn to folly.
Transliteration: eshemeah mah-yedaver hae֢l yehovah khiy yedaver shalvom el-amvo veel-chasiydayv veal-yashuvu lekhiselah

Hebrew: אַ֤ךְ קָר֣וֹב לִירֵאָ֣יו יִשְׁע֑וֹ לִשְׁכֹּ֖ן כָּב֣וֹד בְּאַרְצֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
His help is very near those who fear Him,
to make His glory dwell in our land.
Transliteration: akhe karvov liyreayv yishevo lishekhon khavvod vearetsenu

Hebrew: חֶסֶד־וֶאֱמֶ֥ת נִפְגָּ֑שׁוּ צֶ֖דֶק וְשָׁל֣וֹם נָשָֽׁקוּ׃
Translated:
Faithfulness and truth meet;
justice and well-being kiss.
Transliteration: chesed-veemet nifegashu tsedek veshalvom nashaku

Hebrew: אֱ֭מֶת מֵאֶ֣רֶץ תִּצְמָ֑ח וְ֝צֶ֗דֶק מִשָּׁמַ֥יִם נִשְׁקָֽף׃
Translated:
Truth springs up from the earth;
justice looks down from heaven.
Transliteration: emet meerets titsemach vetsedek mishamayiim nishekaf

Hebrew: גַּם־יְ֭הֹוָה יִתֵּ֣ן הַטּ֑וֹב וְ֝אַרְצֵ֗נוּ תִּתֵּ֥ן יְבוּלָֽהּ׃
Translated:
The LORD also bestows His bounty;
our land yields its produce.
Transliteration: gam-yehovah yiten hatvov vearetsenu titen yevulah

Hebrew: צֶ֭דֶק לְפָנָ֣יו יְהַלֵּ֑ךְ וְיָשֵׂ֖ם לְדֶ֣רֶךְ פְּעָמָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated:
Justice goes before Him
as He sets out on His way.
Transliteration: tsedek lefanayv yehalekhe veyashem lederekhe feamayv {f}

Hebrew: תְּפִלָּ֗ה לְדָ֫וִ֥ד הַטֵּֽה־יְהֹוָ֣ה אׇזְנְךָ֣ עֲנֵ֑נִי כִּֽי־עָנִ֖י וְאֶבְי֣וֹן אָֽנִי׃
Translated:
A prayer of David.

Incline Your ear, O LORD,
answer me,
for I am poor and needy.
Transliteration: tefilah ledavid hateh-yehovah ׇzenekha aneniy khiy-aniy veeveyvon aniy

Hebrew: שׇׁ֥מְרָ֣ה נַפְשִׁי֮ כִּֽי־חָסִ֢יד אָ֥֫נִי הוֹשַׁ֣ע עַ֭בְדְּךָ אַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהַ֑י הַבּוֹטֵ֥חַ אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Preserve my life, for I am steadfast;
O You, my God,
deliver Your servant who trusts in You.
Transliteration: shׇmerah nafeshiy khiy-chasi֢yd aniy hvosha avedekha atah elohay havvotecha eleykha

Hebrew: חׇנֵּ֥נִי אֲדֹנָ֑י כִּ֥י אֵלֶ֥יךָ אֶ֝קְרָ֗א כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Have mercy on me, O Lord,
for I call to You all day long;
Transliteration: chׇneniy adonay khiy eleykha ekera khׇl-hayyvom

Hebrew: שַׂ֭מֵּחַ נֶ֣פֶשׁ עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י אֵלֶ֥יךָ אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י נַפְשִׁ֥י אֶשָּֽׂא׃
Translated:
bring joy to Your servant’s life,
for on You, Lord, I set my hope.
Transliteration: shamecha nefesh avedekha khiy eleykha adonay nafeshiy esha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה אֲ֭דֹנָי ט֣וֹב וְסַלָּ֑ח וְרַב־חֶ֝֗סֶד לְכׇל־קֹֽרְאֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
For You, Lord, are good and forgiving,
abounding in steadfast love to all who call on You.
Transliteration: khiy-atah adonay tvov vesalach verav-chesed lekhׇl-koreeykha

Hebrew: הַאֲזִ֣ינָה יְ֭הֹוָה תְּפִלָּתִ֑י וְ֝הַקְשִׁ֗יבָה בְּק֣וֹל תַּחֲנוּנוֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer;
heed my plea for mercy.
Transliteration: haaziynah yehovah tefilatiy vehakeshiyvah vekvol tachanunvotay

Hebrew: בְּי֣וֹם צָ֭רָתִֽי אֶקְרָאֶ֗ךָּ כִּ֣י תַעֲנֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
In my time of trouble I call You,
for You will answer me.
Transliteration: veyvom tsaratiy ekeraekha khiy taaneniy

Hebrew: אֵין־כָּמ֖וֹךָ בָאֱלֹהִ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָ֗י וְאֵ֣ין כְּֽמַעֲשֶֽׂיךָ׃
Translated:
There is none like You among the gods, O Lord,
and there are no deeds like Yours.
Transliteration: eyn-khamvokha vaElohim <small></small> adonay veeyn khemaasheykha

Hebrew: כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֤ם ׀ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֗יתָ יָב֤וֹאוּ ׀ וְיִשְׁתַּחֲו֣וּ לְפָנֶ֣יךָ אֲדֹנָ֑י וִ֖יכַבְּד֣וּ לִשְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
All the nations You have made
will come to bow down before You, O Lord,
and they will pay honor to Your name.
Transliteration: khׇl-gvoyim asher ashiyta yavvou veyishetachavu lefaneykha adonay viykhavedu lishemekha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־גָד֣וֹל אַ֭תָּה וְעֹשֵׂ֣ה נִפְלָא֑וֹת אַתָּ֖ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
For You are great and perform wonders;
You alone are God.
Transliteration: khiy-gadvol atah veosheh nifelavot atah Elohim levadekha

Hebrew: ה֘וֹרֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ דַּרְכֶּ֗ךָ אֲהַלֵּ֥ךְ בַּאֲמִתֶּ֑ךָ יַחֵ֥ד לְ֝בָבִ֗י לְיִרְאָ֥ה שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Teach me Your way, O LORD;
I will walk in Your truth;
let my heart be undivided in reverence for Your name.
Transliteration: hvoreniy yehovah darekhekha ahalekhe vaamitekha yached levaviy leyireah shemekha

Hebrew: אוֹדְךָ֤ ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י אֱ֭לֹהַי בְּכׇל־לְבָבִ֑י וַאֲכַבְּדָ֖ה שִׁמְךָ֣ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
I will praise You, O Lord, my God, with all my heart
and pay honor to Your name forever.
Transliteration: vodekha adonay elohay vekhׇl-levaviy vaakhavedah shimekha levolam

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חַ֭סְדְּךָ גָּד֣וֹל עָלָ֑י וְהִצַּ֥לְתָּ נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י מִשְּׁא֥וֹל תַּחְתִּיָּֽה׃
Translated:
For Your steadfast love toward me is great;
You have saved me from the depths of Sheol.
Transliteration: khiy-chasedekha gadvol alay vehitsaleta nafeshiy mishevol tachetiyah

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ זֵ֘דִ֤ים קָמוּ־עָלַ֗י וַעֲדַ֣ת עָ֭רִיצִים בִּקְשׁ֣וּ נַפְשִׁ֑י וְלֹ֖א שָׂמ֣וּךָ לְנֶגְדָּֽם׃
Translated:
O God, arrogant men have risen against me;
a band of ruthless men seek my life;
they are not mindful of You.
Transliteration: Elohim zediym kamu-alay vaadat ariytsiym vikeshu nafeshiy velo shamukha lenegedam

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה אֲ֭דֹנָי אֵל־רַח֣וּם וְחַנּ֑וּן אֶ֥רֶךְ אַ֝פַּ֗יִם וְרַב־חֶ֥סֶד וֶאֱמֶֽת׃
Translated:
But You, O Lord, are a God
compassionate and merciful,
slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.
Transliteration: veatah adonay el-rachum vechanun erekhe afayiim verav-chesed veemet

Hebrew: פְּנֵ֥ה אֵלַ֗י וְחׇ֫נֵּ֥נִי תְּנָֽה־עֻזְּךָ֥ לְעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝הוֹשִׁ֗יעָה לְבֶן־אֲמָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Turn to me and have mercy on me;
grant Your strength to Your servant
and deliver the son of Your maidservant.
Transliteration: feneh elay vechׇneniy tenah-uzekha leavedekha vehvoshiyah leven-amatekha

Hebrew: עֲשֵֽׂה־עִמִּ֥י א֗וֹת לְט֫וֹבָ֥ה וְיִרְא֣וּ שֹׂנְאַ֣י וְיֵבֹ֑שׁוּ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עֲזַרְתַּ֥נִי וְנִחַמְתָּֽנִי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Show me a sign of Your favor,
that my enemies may see and be frustrated
because You, O LORD, have given me aid and comfort.
Transliteration: asheh-imiy vot letvovah veyireu shoneay veeivoshu khiy-atah yehovah azaretaniy venichametaniy {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵי־קֹ֭רַח מִזְמ֣וֹר שִׁ֑יר יְ֝סוּדָת֗וֹ בְּהַרְרֵי־קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: Of the Korahites. A psalm. A song.
Transliteration: liveney-korach mizemvor shiyr yesudatvo veharerey-kodesh

Hebrew: אֹהֵ֣ב יְ֭הֹוָה שַׁעֲרֵ֣י צִיּ֑וֹן מִ֝כֹּ֗ל מִשְׁכְּנ֥וֹת יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
The LORD loves the gates of Zion,
His foundation on the holy mountains,
more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
Transliteration: ohev yehovah shaarey tsiyyvon mikhol mishekhenvot yaakov

Hebrew: נִ֭כְבָּדוֹת מְדֻבָּ֣ר בָּ֑ךְ עִ֖יר הָאֱלֹהִ֣ים סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Glorious things are spoken of you,
O city of God. Selah.
Transliteration: nikhevadvot meduvar vakhe iyr haElohim selah

Hebrew: אַזְכִּ֤יר ׀ רַ֥הַב וּבָבֶ֗ל לְֽיֹ֫דְעָ֥י הִנֵּ֤ה פְלֶ֣שֶׁת וְצֹ֣ר עִם־כּ֑וּשׁ זֶ֝֗ה יֻלַּד־שָֽׁם׃
Translated:
I mention Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge Me;
Philistia, and Tyre, and Cush—each was born there.
Transliteration: azekhiyr rahav uvavel leyodeay hineh feleshet vetsor im-khush zeh yulad-sham

Hebrew: וּ֥לְצִיּ֨וֹן ׀ יֵאָמַ֗ר אִ֣ישׁ וְ֭אִישׁ יֻלַּד־בָּ֑הּ וְה֖וּא יְכוֹנְנֶ֣הָ עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Indeed, it shall be said of Zion,
“Every man was born there.”
He, the Most High, will preserve it.
Transliteration: uletsiyyvon eiamar iysh veiysh yulad-vah vehu yekhvoneneha eleyvon

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה יִ֭סְפֹּר בִּכְת֣וֹב עַמִּ֑ים זֶ֖ה יֻלַּד־שָׁ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
The LORD will inscribe in the register of peoples
that each was born there. Selah.
Transliteration: yehovah yisefor vikhetvov amiym zeh yulad-sham selah

Hebrew: וְשָׁרִ֥ים כְּחֹלְלִ֑ים כׇּֽל־מַעְיָנַ֥י בָּֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Singers and dancers alike [will say]:
“All my roots are in You.”
Transliteration: veshariym khecholeliym khׇl-maeyanay vakhe {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֥יר מִזְמ֗וֹר לִבְנֵ֫י־קֹ֥רַח לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ עַל־מָחֲלַ֣ת לְעַנּ֑וֹת מַ֝שְׂכִּ֗יל לְהֵימָ֥ן הָאֶזְרָחִֽי׃
Translated: A song. A psalm of the Korahites. For the leader; on maḥalath leannoth. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
Transliteration: shiyr mizemvor liveney-korach lamenatsecha al-machalat leanvot mashekhiyl leheyman haezerachiy

Hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יְשׁוּעָתִ֑י יוֹם־צָעַ֖קְתִּי בַלַּ֣יְלָה נֶגְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
O LORD, God of my deliverance,
when I cry out in the night before You,
Transliteration: yehovah elohey yeshuatiy yvom-tsaaketiy valayelah negedekha

Hebrew: תָּב֣וֹא לְ֭פָנֶיךָ תְּפִלָּתִ֑י הַטֵּ֥ה אׇ֝זְנְךָ֗ לְרִנָּתִֽי׃
Translated:
let my prayer reach You;
incline Your ear to my cry.
Transliteration: tavvo lefaneykha tefilatiy hateh ׇzenekha lerinatiy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־שָׂבְעָ֣ה בְרָע֣וֹת נַפְשִׁ֑י וְ֝חַיַּ֗י לִשְׁא֥וֹל הִגִּֽיעוּ׃
Translated:
For I am sated with misfortune;
I am at the brink of Sheol.
Transliteration: khiy-shaveah veravot nafeshiy vechayay lishevol higiyu

Hebrew: נֶ֭חְשַׁבְתִּי עִם־י֣וֹרְדֵי ב֑וֹר הָ֝יִ֗יתִי כְּגֶ֣בֶר אֵֽין־אֱיָֽל׃
Translated:
I am numbered with those who go down to the Pit;
I am a helpless man
Transliteration: necheshavetiy im-yvoredey vvor hayiiytiy khegever eyn-eyal

Hebrew: בַּמֵּתִ֗ים חׇ֫פְשִׁ֥י כְּמ֤וֹ חֲלָלִ֨ים ׀ שֹׁ֥כְבֵי קֶ֗בֶר אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹ֣א זְכַרְתָּ֣ם ע֑וֹד וְ֝הֵ֗מָּה מִיָּדְךָ֥ נִגְזָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
abandoned among the dead,
like bodies lying in the grave
of whom You are mindful no more,
and who are cut off from Your care.
Transliteration: vametiym chׇfeshiy khemvo chalaliym shokhevey kever asher lo zekharetam vod vehemah miyadekha nigezaru

Hebrew: שַׁ֭תַּנִי בְּב֣וֹר תַּחְתִּיּ֑וֹת בְּ֝מַחֲשַׁכִּ֗ים בִּמְצֹלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
You have put me at the bottom of the Pit,
in the darkest places, in the depths.
Transliteration: shataniy vevvor tachetiyyvot vemachashakhiym vimetsolvot

Hebrew: עָ֭לַי סָמְכָ֣ה חֲמָתֶ֑ךָ וְכׇל־מִ֝שְׁבָּרֶ֗יךָ עִנִּ֥יתָ סֶּֽלָה׃
Translated:
Your fury lies heavy upon me;
You afflict me with all Your breakers. Selah.
Transliteration: alay samekhah chamatekha vekhׇl-mishevareykha iniyta selah

Hebrew: הִרְחַ֥קְתָּ מְיֻדָּעַ֗י מִ֫מֶּ֥נִּי שַׁתַּ֣נִי תוֹעֵב֣וֹת לָ֑מוֹ כָּ֝לֻ֗א וְלֹ֣א אֵצֵֽא׃
Translated:
You make my companions shun me;
You make me abhorrent to them;
I am shut in and do not go out.
Transliteration: hirechaketa meyudaay mimeniy shataniy tvoevvot lamvo khalu velo etse

Hebrew: עֵינִ֥י דָאֲבָ֗ה מִנִּ֫י־עֹ֥נִי קְרָאתִ֣יךָ יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּכׇל־י֑וֹם שִׁטַּ֖חְתִּי אֵלֶ֣יךָ כַפָּֽי׃
Translated:
My eyes pine away from affliction;
I call to You, O LORD, each day;
I stretch out my hands to You.
Transliteration: eyniy daavah miniy-oniy keratiykha yehovah vekhׇl-yvom shitachetiy eleykha khafay

Hebrew: הֲלַמֵּתִ֥ים תַּעֲשֶׂה־פֶּ֑לֶא אִם־רְ֝פָאִ֗ים יָק֤וּמוּ ׀ יוֹד֬וּךָ סֶּֽלָה׃
Translated:
Do You work wonders for the dead?
Do the shades rise to praise You? Selah.
Transliteration: halametiym taasheh-fele im-refaiym yakumu yvodukha selah

Hebrew: הַיְסֻפַּ֣ר בַּקֶּ֣בֶר חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ אֱ֝מ֥וּנָתְךָ֗ בָּאֲבַדּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Is Your faithful care recounted in the grave,
Your constancy in the place of perdition?
Transliteration: hayesufar vakever chasedekha emunatekha vaavadvon

Hebrew: הֲיִוָּדַ֣ע בַּחֹ֣שֶׁךְ פִּלְאֶ֑ךָ וְ֝צִדְקָתְךָ֗ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ נְשִׁיָּֽה׃
Translated:
Are Your wonders made known in the netherworld,
Your beneficent deeds in the land of oblivion?
Transliteration: hayivada vachoshekhe fileekha vetsidekatekha veerets neshiyah

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ אֵלֶ֣יךָ יְהֹוָ֣ה שִׁוַּ֑עְתִּי וּ֝בַבֹּ֗קֶר תְּֽפִלָּתִ֥י תְקַדְּמֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
As for me, I cry out to You, O LORD;
each morning my prayer greets You.
Transliteration: vaaniy eleykha yehovah shivaetiy uvavoker tefilatiy tekademekha

Hebrew: לָמָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה תִּזְנַ֣ח נַפְשִׁ֑י תַּסְתִּ֖יר פָּנֶ֣יךָ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
Why, O LORD, do You reject me,
do You hide Your face from me?
Transliteration: lamah yehovah tizenach nafeshiy tasetiyr faneykha mimeniy

Hebrew: עָ֘נִ֤י אֲנִ֣י וְגֹוֵ֣עַ מִנֹּ֑עַר נָשָׂ֖אתִי אֵמֶ֣יךָ אָפֽוּנָה׃
Translated:
From my youth I have been afflicted
and near death;
I suffer Your terrors wherever I turn.
Transliteration: aniy aniy vegovea minoar nashatiy emeykha afunah

Hebrew: עָ֭לַי עָבְר֣וּ חֲרוֹנֶ֑יךָ בִּ֝עוּתֶ֗יךָ צִמְּתוּתֻֽנִי׃
Translated:
Your fury overwhelms me;
Your terrors destroy me.
Transliteration: alay averu charvoneykha viuteykha tsimetutuniy

Hebrew: סַבּ֣וּנִי כַ֭מַּיִם כׇּל־הַיּ֑וֹם הִקִּ֖יפוּ עָלַ֣י יָֽחַד׃
Translated:
They swirl about me like water all day long;
they encircle me on every side.
Transliteration: savuniy khamayim khׇl-hayyvom hikiyfu alay yachad

Hebrew: הִרְחַ֣קְתָּ מִ֭מֶּנִּי אֹהֵ֣ב וָרֵ֑עַ מְֽיֻדָּעַ֥י מַחְשָֽׁךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
You have put friend and neighbor far from me
and my companions out of my sight.
Transliteration: hirechaketa mimeniy ohev varea meyudaay macheshakhe {f}

Hebrew: מַ֝שְׂכִּ֗יל לְאֵיתָ֥ן הָאֶזְרָחִֽי׃
Translated: A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
Transliteration: mashekhiyl leeytan haezerachiy

Hebrew: חַֽסְדֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה עוֹלָ֣ם אָשִׁ֑ירָה לְדֹ֥ר וָדֹ֓ר ׀ אוֹדִ֖יעַ אֱמוּנָתְךָ֣ בְּפִֽי׃
Translated:
I will sing of the LORD’s steadfast love forever;
to all generations I will proclaim Your faithfulness with my mouth.
Transliteration: chasedey yehovah volam ashiyrah ledor vador vodiya emunatekha vefiy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אָמַ֗רְתִּי ע֭וֹלָם חֶ֣סֶד יִבָּנֶ֑ה שָׁמַ֓יִם ׀ תָּכִ֖ן אֱמוּנָתְךָ֣ בָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
I declare, “Your steadfast love is confirmed forever;
there in the heavens You establish Your faithfulness.”
Transliteration: khiy-amaretiy volam chesed yivaneh shamayiim takhin emunatekha vahem

Hebrew: כָּרַ֣תִּי בְ֭רִית לִבְחִירִ֑י נִ֝שְׁבַּ֗עְתִּי לְדָוִ֥ד עַבְדִּֽי׃
Translated:
“I have made a covenant with My chosen one;
I have sworn to My servant David:
Transliteration: kharatiy veriyt livechiyriy nishevaetiy ledavid avediy

Hebrew: עַד־ע֭וֹלָם אָכִ֣ין זַרְעֶ֑ךָ וּבָנִ֨יתִי לְדֹר־וָד֖וֹר כִּסְאֲךָ֣ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
I will establish your offspring forever,
I will confirm your throne for all generations.” Selah.
Transliteration: ad-volam akhiyn zareekha uvaniytiy ledor-vadvor khiseakha selah

Hebrew: וְי֘וֹד֤וּ שָׁמַ֣יִם פִּלְאֲךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֑ה אַף־אֱ֝מ֥וּנָתְךָ֗ בִּקְהַ֥ל קְדֹשִֽׁים׃
Translated:
Your wonders, O LORD, are praised by the heavens,
Your faithfulness, too, in the assembly of holy beings.
Transliteration: veyvodu shamayiim fileakha yehovah af-emunatekha vikehal kedoshiym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י מִ֣י בַ֭שַּׁחַק יַעֲרֹ֣ךְ לַיהֹוָ֑ה יִדְמֶ֥ה לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה בִּבְנֵ֥י אֵלִֽים׃
Translated:
For who in the skies can equal the LORD,
can compare with the LORD among the divine beings,
Transliteration: khiy miy vashachak yaarokhe layhovah yidemeh layhovah viveney eliym

Hebrew: אֵ֣ל נַ֭עֲרָץ בְּסוֹד־קְדֹשִׁ֣ים רַבָּ֑ה וְ֝נוֹרָ֗א עַל־כׇּל־סְבִיבָֽיו׃
Translated:
a God greatly dreaded in the council of holy beings,
held in awe by all around Him?
Transliteration: el naarats vesvod-kedoshiym ravah venvora al-khׇl-seviyvayv

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י צְבָא֗וֹת מִי־כָמ֖וֹךָֽ חֲסִ֥ין ׀ יָ֑הּ וֶ֝אֱמ֥וּנָתְךָ֗ סְבִיבוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
O LORD, God of hosts,
who is mighty like You, O LORD?
Your faithfulness surrounds You;
Transliteration: yehovah elohey tsevavot miy-khamvokha chasiyn yah veemunatekha seviyvvoteykha

Hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה מ֭וֹשֵׁל בְּגֵא֣וּת הַיָּ֑ם בְּשׂ֥וֹא גַ֝לָּ֗יו אַתָּ֥ה תְשַׁבְּחֵֽם׃
Translated:
You rule the swelling of the sea;
when its waves surge, You still them.
Transliteration: atah mvoshel vegeut hayam veshvo galayv atah teshavechem

Hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה דִכִּ֣אתָ כֶחָלָ֣ל רָ֑הַב בִּזְר֥וֹעַ עֻ֝זְּךָ֗ פִּזַּ֥רְתָּ אוֹיְבֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You crushed Rahab; he was like a corpse;
with Your powerful arm You scattered Your enemies.
Transliteration: atah dikhita khechalal rahav vizervoa uzekha fizareta voyeveykha

Hebrew: לְךָ֣ שָׁ֭מַיִם אַף־לְךָ֥ אָ֑רֶץ תֵּבֵ֥ל וּ֝מְלֹאָ֗הּ אַתָּ֥ה יְסַדְתָּֽם׃
Translated:
The heaven is Yours,
the earth too;
the world and all it holds—
You established them.
Transliteration: lekha shamayim af-lekha arets tevel umeloah atah yesadetam

Hebrew: צָפ֣וֹן וְ֭יָמִין אַתָּ֣ה בְרָאתָ֑ם תָּב֥וֹר וְ֝חֶרְמ֗וֹן בְּשִׁמְךָ֥ יְרַנֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
North and south—
You created them;
Tabor and Hermon sing forth Your name.
Transliteration: tsafvon veyamiyn atah veratam tavvor vecheremvon veshimekha yeranenu

Hebrew: לְךָ֣ זְ֭רוֹעַ עִם־גְּבוּרָ֑ה תָּעֹ֥ז יָ֝דְךָ֗ תָּר֥וּם יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Yours is an arm endowed with might;
Your hand is strong;
Your right hand, exalted.
Transliteration: lekha zervoa im-gevurah taoz yadekha tarum yemiynekha

Hebrew: צֶ֣דֶק וּ֭מִשְׁפָּט מְכ֣וֹן כִּסְאֶ֑ךָ חֶ֥סֶד וֶ֝אֱמֶ֗ת יְֽקַדְּמ֥וּ פָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Righteousness and justice are the base of Your throne;
steadfast love and faithfulness stand before You.
Transliteration: tsedek umishefat mekhvon khiseekha chesed veemet yekademu faneykha

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י הָ֭עָם יֹדְעֵ֣י תְרוּעָ֑ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בְּֽאוֹר־פָּנֶ֥יךָ יְהַלֵּכֽוּן׃
Translated:
Happy is the people who know the joyful shout;
O LORD, they walk in the light of Your presence.
Transliteration: asherey haam yodeey teruah yehovah vevor-faneykha yehalekhun

Hebrew: בְּ֭שִׁמְךָ יְגִיל֣וּן כׇּל־הַיּ֑וֹם וּבְצִדְקָתְךָ֥ יָרֽוּמוּ׃
Translated:
They rejoice in Your name all day long;
they are exalted through Your righteousness.
Transliteration: veshimekha yegiylun khׇl-hayyvom uvetsidekatekha yarumu

Hebrew: כִּי־תִפְאֶ֣רֶת עֻזָּ֣מוֹ אָ֑תָּה וּ֝בִרְצוֹנְךָ֗ (תרים) [תָּר֥וּם] קַרְנֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
For You are their strength in which they glory;
our horn is exalted through Your favor.
Transliteration: khiy-tifeeret uzamvo atah uviretsvonekha (trym) [tarum] kareneynu

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לַ֭יהֹוָה מָגִנֵּ֑נוּ וְלִקְד֖וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל מַלְכֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Truly our shield is of the LORD,
our king, of the Holy One of Israel.
Transliteration: khiy layhovah maginenu velikedvosh yisherael malekhenu

Hebrew: אָ֤ז דִּבַּ֥רְתָּֽ־בְחָז֡וֹן לַחֲסִידֶ֗יךָ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר שִׁוִּ֣יתִי עֵ֭זֶר עַל־גִּבּ֑וֹר הֲרִימ֖וֹתִי בָח֣וּר מֵעָֽם׃
Translated:
Then You spoke to Your faithful ones in a vision
and said, “I have conferred power upon a warrior;
I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
Transliteration: az divareta-vechazvon lachasiydeykha vatomer shiviytiy ezer al-givvor hariymvotiy vachur meam

Hebrew: מָ֭צָאתִי דָּוִ֣ד עַבְדִּ֑י בְּשֶׁ֖מֶן קׇדְשִׁ֣י מְשַׁחְתִּֽיו׃
Translated:
I have found David, My servant;
anointed him with My sacred oil.
Transliteration: matsatiy david avediy veshemen kׇdeshiy meshachetiyv

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָ֭דִי תִּכּ֣וֹן עִמּ֑וֹ אַף־זְרוֹעִ֥י תְאַמְּצֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
My hand shall be constantly with him,
and My arm shall strengthen him.
Transliteration: asher yadiy tikhvon imvo af-zervoiy teametsenu

Hebrew: לֹא־יַשִּׁ֣יא אוֹיֵ֣ב בּ֑וֹ וּבֶן־עַ֝וְלָ֗ה לֹ֣א יְעַנֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
No enemy shall oppress him,
no vile man afflict him.
Transliteration: lo-yashiy voeiv vvo uven-avelah lo yeanenu

Hebrew: וְכַתּוֹתִ֣י מִפָּנָ֣יו צָרָ֑יו וּמְשַׂנְאָ֥יו אֶגּֽוֹף׃
Translated:
I will crush his adversaries before him;
I will strike down those who hate him.
Transliteration: vekhatvotiy mifanayv tsarayv umeshaneayv egvof

Hebrew: וֶ֥אֱֽמוּנָתִ֣י וְחַסְדִּ֣י עִמּ֑וֹ וּ֝בִשְׁמִ֗י תָּר֥וּם קַרְנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
My faithfulness and steadfast love shall be with him;
his horn shall be exalted through My name.
Transliteration: veemunatiy vechasediy imvo uvishemiy tarum karenvo

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י בַיָּ֣ם יָד֑וֹ וּֽבַנְּהָר֥וֹת יְמִינֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I will set his hand upon the sea,
his right hand upon the rivers.
Transliteration: veshametiy vayam yadvo uvaneharvot yemiynvo

Hebrew: ה֣וּא יִ֭קְרָאֵנִי אָ֣בִי אָ֑תָּה אֵ֝לִ֗י וְצ֣וּר יְשׁוּעָתִֽי׃
Translated:
He shall say to Me,
‘You are my father, my God, the rock of my deliverance.’
Transliteration: hu yikeraeniy aviy atah eliy vetsur yeshuatiy

Hebrew: אַף־אָ֭נִי בְּכ֣וֹר אֶתְּנֵ֑הוּ עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן לְמַלְכֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
I will appoint him first-born,
highest of the kings of the earth.
Transliteration: af-aniy vekhvor etenehu eleyvon lemalekhey-arets

Hebrew: לְ֭עוֹלָם (אשמור) [אֶשְׁמׇר־]ל֣וֹ חַסְדִּ֑י וּ֝בְרִיתִ֗י נֶאֱמֶ֥נֶת לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I will maintain My steadfast love for him always;
My covenant with him shall endure.
Transliteration: levolam (shmvr) [eshemׇr-]lvo chasediy uveriytiy neemenet lvo

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י לָעַ֣ד זַרְע֑וֹ וְ֝כִסְא֗וֹ כִּימֵ֥י שָׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated:
I will establish his line forever,
his throne, as long as the heavens last.
Transliteration: veshametiy laad zarevo vekhisevo khiymey shamayiim

Hebrew: אִם־יַעַזְב֣וּ בָ֭נָיו תּוֹרָתִ֑י וּ֝בְמִשְׁפָּטַ֗י לֹ֣א יֵלֵכֽוּן׃
Translated:
If his sons forsake My Teaching
and do not live by My rules;
Transliteration: im-yaazevu vanayv tvoratiy uvemishefatay lo eilekhun

Hebrew: אִם־חֻקֹּתַ֥י יְחַלֵּ֑לוּ וּ֝מִצְוֺתַ֗י לֹ֣א יִשְׁמֹֽרוּ׃
Translated:
if they violate My laws,
and do not observe My commands,
Transliteration: im-chukotay yechalelu umitsevotay lo yishemoru

Hebrew: וּפָקַדְתִּ֣י בְשֵׁ֣בֶט פִּשְׁעָ֑ם וּבִנְגָעִ֥ים עֲוֺנָֽם׃
Translated:
I will punish their transgression with the rod,
their iniquity with plagues.
Transliteration: ufakadetiy veshevet fisheam uvinegaiym avonam

Hebrew: וְ֭חַסְדִּי לֹא־אָפִ֣יר מֵעִמּ֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־אֲ֝שַׁקֵּ֗ר בֶּאֱמוּנָתִֽי׃
Translated:
But I will not take away My steadfast love from him;
I will not betray My faithfulness.
Transliteration: vechasediy lo-afiyr meimvo velo-ashaker veemunatiy

Hebrew: לֹֽא־אֲחַלֵּ֥ל בְּרִיתִ֑י וּמוֹצָ֥א שְׂ֝פָתַ֗י לֹ֣א אֲשַׁנֶּֽה׃
Translated:
I will not violate My covenant,
or change what I have uttered.
Transliteration: lo-achalel veriytiy umvotsa shefatay lo ashaneh

Hebrew: אַ֭חַת נִשְׁבַּ֣עְתִּי בְקׇדְשִׁ֑י אִֽם־לְדָוִ֥ד אֲכַזֵּֽב׃
Translated:
I have sworn by My holiness, once and for all;
I will not be false to David.
Transliteration: achat nishevaetiy vekׇdeshiy im-ledavid akhazev

Hebrew: זַ֭רְעוֹ לְעוֹלָ֣ם יִהְיֶ֑ה וְכִסְא֖וֹ כַשֶּׁ֣מֶשׁ נֶגְדִּֽי׃
Translated:
His line shall continue forever,
his throne, as the sun before Me,
Transliteration: zarevo levolam yiheyeh vekhisevo khashemesh negediy

Hebrew: כְּ֭יָרֵחַ יִכּ֣וֹן עוֹלָ֑ם וְעֵ֥ד בַּ֝שַּׁ֗חַק נֶאֱמָ֥ן סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
as the moon, established forever,
an enduring witness in the sky.” Selah.
Transliteration: kheyarecha yikhvon volam veed vashachak neeman selah

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה זָ֭נַחְתָּ וַתִּמְאָ֑ס הִ֝תְעַבַּ֗רְתָּ עִם־מְשִׁיחֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Yet You have rejected, spurned,
and become enraged at Your anointed.
Transliteration: veatah zanacheta vatimeas hiteavareta im-meshiychekha

Hebrew: נֵ֭אַרְתָּה בְּרִ֣ית עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ חִלַּ֖לְתָּ לָאָ֣רֶץ נִזְרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
You have repudiated the covenant with Your servant;
You have dragged his dignity in the dust.
Transliteration: nearetah veriyt avedekha chilaleta laarets nizervo

Hebrew: פָּרַ֥צְתָּ כׇל־גְּדֵרֹתָ֑יו שַׂ֖מְתָּ מִבְצָרָ֣יו מְחִתָּֽה׃
Translated:
You have breached all his defenses,
shattered his strongholds.
Transliteration: faratseta khׇl-gederotayv shameta mivetsarayv mechitah

Hebrew: שַׁ֭סֻּהוּ כׇּל־עֹ֣בְרֵי דָ֑רֶךְ הָיָ֥ה חֶ֝רְפָּ֗ה לִשְׁכֵנָֽיו׃
Translated:
All who pass by plunder him;
he has become the butt of his neighbors.
Transliteration: shasuhu khׇl-overey darekhe hayah cherefah lishekhenayv

Hebrew: הֲ֭רִימוֹתָ יְמִ֣ין צָרָ֑יו הִ֝שְׂמַ֗חְתָּ כׇּל־אוֹיְבָֽיו׃
Translated:
You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries,
and made all his enemies rejoice.
Transliteration: hariymvota yemiyn tsarayv hishemacheta khׇl-voyevayv

Hebrew: אַף־תָּ֭שִׁיב צ֣וּר חַרְבּ֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א הֲ֝קֵימֹת֗וֹ בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
You have turned back the blade of his sword,
and have not sustained him in battle.
Transliteration: af-tashiyv tsur charevvo velo hakeymotvo vamilechamah

Hebrew: הִשְׁבַּ֥תָּ מִטְּהָר֑וֹ וְ֝כִסְא֗וֹ לָאָ֥רֶץ מִגַּֽרְתָּה׃
Translated:
You have brought his splendor to an end
and have hurled his throne to the ground.
Transliteration: hishevata miteharvo vekhisevo laarets migaretah

Hebrew: הִ֭קְצַרְתָּ יְמֵ֣י עֲלוּמָ֑יו הֶ֥עֱטִ֨יתָ עָלָ֖יו בּוּשָׁ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
You have cut short the days of his youth;
You have covered him with shame. Selah.
Transliteration: hiketsareta yemey alumayv heetiyta alayv vushah selah

Hebrew: עַד־מָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה תִּסָּתֵ֣ר לָנֶ֑צַח תִּבְעַ֖ר כְּמוֹ־אֵ֣שׁ חֲמָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
How long, O LORD; will You forever hide Your face,
will Your fury blaze like fire?
Transliteration: ad-mah yehovah tisater lanetsach tivear khemvo-esh chamatekha

Hebrew: זְכׇר־אֲנִ֥י מֶה־חָ֑לֶד עַל־מַה־שָּׁ֝֗וְא בָּרָ֥אתָ כׇל־בְּנֵֽי־אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
O remember how short my life is;
why should You have created every man in vain?
Transliteration: zekhׇr-aniy meh-chaled al-mah-shave varata khׇl-veney-adam

Hebrew: מִ֤י גֶ֣בֶר יִֽ֭חְיֶה וְלֹ֣א יִרְאֶה־מָּ֑וֶת יְמַלֵּ֨ט נַפְשׁ֖וֹ מִיַּד־שְׁא֣וֹל סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
What man can live and not see death,
can save himself from the clutches of Sheol? Selah.
Transliteration: miy gever yicheyeh velo yireeh-mavet yemalet nafeshvo miyad-shevol selah

Hebrew: אַיֵּ֤ה ׀ חֲסָדֶ֖יךָ הָרִאשֹׁנִ֥ים ׀ אֲדֹנָ֑י נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתָּ לְ֝דָוִ֗ד בֶּאֱמוּנָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
O Lord, where is Your steadfast love of old
which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?
Transliteration: ayeh chasadeykha harishoniym adonay nishevaeta ledavid veemunatekha

Hebrew: זְכֹ֣ר אֲ֭דֹנָי חֶרְפַּ֣ת עֲבָדֶ֑יךָ שְׂאֵתִ֥י בְ֝חֵיקִ֗י כׇּל־רַבִּ֥ים עַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
Remember, O Lord, the abuse flung at Your servants
that I have borne in my bosom [from] many peoples,
Transliteration: zekhor adonay cherefat avadeykha sheetiy vecheykiy khׇl-raviym amiym

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר חֵרְפ֖וּ אוֹיְבֶ֥יךָ <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר חֵ֝רְפ֗וּ עִקְּב֥וֹת מְשִׁיחֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
how Your enemies, O LORD, have flung abuse,
abuse at Your anointed at every step.
Transliteration: asher cherefu voyeveykha <small></small> yehovah asher cherefu ikevvot meshiychekha

Hebrew: בָּר֖וּךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה לְעוֹלָ֗ם אָ֘מֵ֥ן <small>׀</small> וְאָמֵֽן׃
Translated:
Blessed is the LORD forever;
Amen and Amen.
Transliteration: varukhe yehovah levolam amen <small></small> veamen

Hebrew: תְּפִלָּה֮ לְמֹשֶׁ֢ה אִֽישׁ־הָאֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים אֲֽדֹנָ֗י מָע֣וֹן אַ֭תָּה הָיִ֥יתָ לָּ֗נוּ בְּדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃
Translated:
A prayer of Moses, the man of God.

O Lord, You have been our refuge in every generation.
Transliteration: tefilah lemoshe֢h iysh-haElohimm adonay mavon atah hayiyta lanu vedor vador

Hebrew: בְּטֶ֤רֶם ׀ הָ֘רִ֤ים יֻלָּ֗דוּ וַתְּח֣וֹלֵֽל אֶ֣רֶץ וְתֵבֵ֑ל וּֽמֵעוֹלָ֥ם עַד־ע֝וֹלָ֗ם אַתָּ֥ה אֵֽל׃
Translated:
Before the mountains came into being,
before You brought forth the earth and the world,
from eternity to eternity You are God.
Transliteration: veterem hariym yuladu vatechvolel erets vetevel umevolam ad-volam atah el

Hebrew: תָּשֵׁ֣ב אֱ֭נוֹשׁ עַד־דַּכָּ֑א וַ֝תֹּ֗אמֶר שׁ֣וּבוּ בְנֵֽי־אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
You return man to dust;
You decreed, “Return you mortals!”
Transliteration: tashev envosh ad-dakha vatomer shuvu veney-adam

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֶ֪לֶף שָׁנִ֡ים בְּֽעֵינֶ֗יךָ כְּי֣וֹם אֶ֭תְמוֹל כִּ֣י יַעֲבֹ֑ר וְאַשְׁמוּרָ֥ה בַלָּֽיְלָה׃
Translated:
For in Your sight a thousand years
are like yesterday that has passed,
like a watch of the night.
Transliteration: khiy elef shaniym veeyneykha kheyvom etemvol khiy yaavor veashemurah valayelah

Hebrew: זְ֭רַמְתָּם שֵׁנָ֣ה יִהְי֑וּ בַּ֝בֹּ֗קֶר כֶּחָצִ֥יר יַחֲלֹֽף׃
Translated:
You engulf men in sleep;
at daybreak they are like grass that renews itself;
Transliteration: zerametam shenah yiheyu vavoker khechatsiyr yachalof

Hebrew: בַּ֭בֹּקֶר יָצִ֣יץ וְחָלָ֑ף לָ֝עֶ֗רֶב יְמוֹלֵ֥ל וְיָבֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
at daybreak it flourishes anew;
by dusk it withers and dries up.
Transliteration: vavoker yatsiyts vechalaf laerev yemvolel veyavesh

Hebrew: כִּי־כָלִ֥ינוּ בְאַפֶּ֑ךָ וּֽבַחֲמָתְךָ֥ נִבְהָֽלְנוּ׃
Translated:
So we are consumed by Your anger,
terror-struck by Your fury.
Transliteration: khiy-khaliynu veafekha uvachamatekha nivehalenu

Hebrew: שַׁתָּ֣ עֲוֺנֹתֵ֣ינוּ לְנֶגְדֶּ֑ךָ עֲ֝לֻמֵ֗נוּ לִמְא֥וֹר פָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You have set our iniquities before You,
our hidden sins in the light of Your face.
Transliteration: shata avonoteynu lenegedekha alumenu limevor faneykha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כׇל־יָ֭מֵינוּ פָּנ֣וּ בְעֶבְרָתֶ֑ךָ כִּלִּ֖ינוּ שָׁנֵ֣ינוּ כְמוֹ־הֶֽגֶה׃
Translated:
All our days pass away in Your wrath;
we spend our years like a sigh.
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-yameynu fanu veeveratekha khiliynu shaneynu khemvo-hegeh

Hebrew: יְמֵֽי־שְׁנוֹתֵ֨ינוּ בָהֶ֥ם שִׁבְעִ֪ים שָׁנָ֡ה וְאִ֤ם בִּגְבוּרֹ֨ת ׀ שְׁמ֘וֹנִ֤ים שָׁנָ֗ה וְ֭רׇהְבָּם עָמָ֣ל וָאָ֑וֶן כִּי־גָ֥ז חִ֝֗ישׁ וַנָּעֻֽפָה׃
Translated:
The span of our life is seventy years,
or, given the strength, eighty years;
but the best of them are trouble and sorrow.
They pass by speedily, and we are in darkness.
Transliteration: yemey-shenvoteynu vahem shiveiym shanah veim vigevurot shemvoniym shanah verׇhevam amal vaaven khiy-gaz chiysh vanaufah

Hebrew: מִֽי־י֭וֹדֵעַ עֹ֣ז אַפֶּ֑ךָ וּ֝כְיִרְאָתְךָ֗ עֶבְרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Who can know Your furious anger?
Your wrath matches the fear of You.
Transliteration: miy-yvodea oz afekha ukheyireatekha everatekha

Hebrew: לִמְנ֣וֹת יָ֭מֵינוּ כֵּ֣ן הוֹדַ֑ע וְ֝נָבִ֗א לְבַ֣ב חׇכְמָֽה׃
Translated:
Teach us to count our days rightly,
that we may obtain a wise heart.
Transliteration: limenvot yameynu khen hvoda venavi levav chׇkhemah

Hebrew: שׁוּבָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה עַד־מָתָ֑י וְ֝הִנָּחֵ֗ם עַל־עֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Turn, O LORD!
How long?
Show mercy to Your servants.
Transliteration: shuvah yehovah ad-matay vehinachem al-avadeykha

Hebrew: שַׂבְּעֵ֣נוּ בַבֹּ֣קֶר חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וּֽנְרַנְּנָ֥ה וְ֝נִשְׂמְחָ֗ה בְּכׇל־יָמֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Satisfy us at daybreak with Your steadfast love
that we may sing for joy all our days.
Transliteration: shaveenu vavoker chasedekha uneranenah venishemechah vekhׇl-yameynu

Hebrew: שַׂ֭מְּחֵנוּ כִּימ֣וֹת עִנִּיתָ֑נוּ שְׁ֝נ֗וֹת רָאִ֥ינוּ רָעָֽה׃
Translated:
Give us joy for as long as You have afflicted us,
for the years we have suffered misfortune.
Transliteration: shamechenu khiymvot iniytanu shenvot raiynu raah

Hebrew: יֵרָאֶ֣ה אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֣יךָ פׇעֳלֶ֑ךָ וַ֝הֲדָרְךָ֗ עַל־בְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Let Your deeds be seen by Your servants,
Your glory by their children.
Transliteration: eiraeh el-avadeykha fׇolekha vahadarekha al-veneyhem

Hebrew: וִיהִ֤י ׀ נֹ֤עַם אֲדֹנָ֥י אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ עָ֫לֵ֥ינוּ וּמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָ֭דֵינוּ כּוֹנְנָ֥ה עָלֵ֑ינוּ וּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָ֝דֵ֗ינוּ כּוֹנְנֵֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
May the favor of the Lord, our God, be upon us;
let the work of our hands prosper,
O prosper the work of our hands!
Transliteration: viyhiy noam adonay eloheynu aleynu umaasheh yadeynu khvonenah aleynu umaasheh yadeynu khvonenehu {f}

Hebrew: יֹ֭שֵׁב בְּסֵ֣תֶר עֶלְי֑וֹן בְּצֵ֥ל שַׁ֝דַּ֗י יִתְלוֹנָֽן׃
Translated:
O you who dwell in the shelter of the Most High
and abide in the protection of Shaddai—
Transliteration: yoshev veseter eleyvon vetsel shaday yitelvonan

Hebrew: אֹמַ֗ר לַ֭יהֹוָה מַחְסִ֣י וּמְצוּדָתִ֑י אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י אֶבְטַח־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I say of the LORD, my refuge and stronghold,
my God in whom I trust,
Transliteration: omar layhovah machesiy umetsudatiy elohay evetach-vvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ה֣וּא יַ֭צִּילְךָ מִפַּ֥ח יָק֗וּשׁ מִדֶּ֥בֶר הַוּֽוֹת׃
Translated:
that He will save you from the fowler’s trap,
from the destructive plague.
Transliteration: khiy hu yatsiylekha mifach yakush midever hauvot

Hebrew: בְּאֶבְרָת֨וֹ ׀ יָ֣סֶךְ לָ֭ךְ וְתַחַת־כְּנָפָ֣יו תֶּחְסֶ֑ה צִנָּ֖ה וְסֹחֵרָ֣ה אֲמִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He will cover you with His pinions;
you will find refuge under His wings;
His fidelity is an encircling shield.
Transliteration: veeveratvo yasekhe lakhe vetachat-khenafayv techeseh tsinah vesocherah amitvo

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִ֭ירָא מִפַּ֣חַד לָ֑יְלָה מֵ֝חֵ֗ץ יָע֥וּף יוֹמָֽם׃
Translated:
You need not fear the terror by night,
or the arrow that flies by day,
Transliteration: lo-tiyra mifachad layelah mechets yauf yvomam

Hebrew: מִ֭דֶּבֶר בָּאֹ֣פֶל יַהֲלֹ֑ךְ מִ֝קֶּ֗טֶב יָשׁ֥וּד צׇהֳרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
the plague that stalks in the darkness,
or the scourge that ravages at noon.
Transliteration: midever vaofel yahalokhe miketev yashud tsׇhorayiim

Hebrew: יִפֹּ֤ל מִצִּדְּךָ֨ ׀ אֶ֗לֶף וּרְבָבָ֥ה מִימִינֶ֑ךָ אֵ֝לֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א יִגָּֽשׁ׃
Translated:
A thousand may fall at your left side,
ten thousand at your right,
but it shall not reach you.
