Transliteration: yifol mitsidekha elef urevavah miymiynekha eleykha lo yigash

Hebrew: רַ֭ק בְּעֵינֶ֣יךָ תַבִּ֑יט וְשִׁלֻּמַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תִּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated:
You will see it with your eyes,
you will witness the punishment of the wicked.
Transliteration: rak veeyneykha taviyt veshilumat reshaiym tireeh

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה מַחְסִ֑י עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן שַׂ֣מְתָּ מְעוֹנֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Because you took the LORD—my refuge,
the Most High—as your haven,
Transliteration: khiy-atah yehovah machesiy eleyvon shameta mevonekha

Hebrew: לֹא־תְאֻנֶּ֣ה אֵלֶ֣יךָ רָעָ֑ה וְ֝נֶ֗גַע לֹא־יִקְרַ֥ב בְּאׇהֳלֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
no harm will befall you,
no disease touch your tent.
Transliteration: lo-teuneh eleykha raah venega lo-yikerav veׇholekha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מַ֭לְאָכָיו יְצַוֶּה־לָּ֑ךְ לִ֝שְׁמׇרְךָ֗ בְּכׇל־דְּרָכֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
For He will order His angels
to guard you wherever you go.
Transliteration: khiy maleakhayv yetsaveh-lakhe lishemׇrekha vekhׇl-derakheykha

Hebrew: עַל־כַּפַּ֥יִם יִשָּׂא֑וּנְךָ פֶּן־תִּגֹּ֖ף בָּאֶ֣בֶן רַגְלֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
They will carry you in their hands
lest you hurt your foot on a stone.
Transliteration: al-khafayiim yishaunekha fen-tigof vaeven ragelekha

Hebrew: עַל־שַׁ֣חַל וָפֶ֣תֶן תִּדְרֹ֑ךְ תִּרְמֹ֖ס כְּפִ֣יר וְתַנִּֽין׃
Translated:
You will tread on cubs and vipers;
you will trample lions and asps.
Transliteration: al-shachal vafeten tiderokhe tiremos khefiyr vetaniyn

Hebrew: כִּ֤י בִ֣י חָ֭שַׁק וַאֲפַלְּטֵ֑הוּ אֲ֝שַׂגְּבֵ֗הוּ כִּֽי־יָדַ֥ע שְׁמִֽי׃
Translated:
“Because he is devoted to Me I will deliver him;
I will keep him safe, for he knows My name.
Transliteration: khiy viy chashak vaafaletehu ashagevehu khiy-yada shemiy

Hebrew: יִקְרָאֵ֨נִי ׀ וְֽאֶעֱנֵ֗הוּ עִמּֽוֹ־אָנֹכִ֥י בְצָרָ֑ה אֲ֝חַלְּצֵ֗הוּ וַאֲכַבְּדֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
When he calls on Me, I will answer him;
I will be with him in distress;
I will rescue him and make him honored;
Transliteration: yikeraeniy veeenehu imvo-anokhiy vetsarah achaletsehu vaakhavedehu

Hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ יָ֭מִים אַשְׂבִּיעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝אַרְאֵ֗הוּ בִּישׁוּעָתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will let him live to a ripe old age,
and show him My salvation.”
Transliteration: orekhe yamiym asheviyehu veareehu viyshuatiy {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֥וֹר שִׁ֗יר לְי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃
Translated: A psalm. A song; for the sabbath day.
Transliteration: mizemvor shiyr leyvom hashavat

Hebrew: ט֗וֹב לְהֹד֥וֹת לַיהֹוָ֑ה וּלְזַמֵּ֖ר לְשִׁמְךָ֣ עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
It is good to praise the LORD,
to sing hymns to Your name, O Most High,
Transliteration: tvov lehodvot layhovah ulezamer leshimekha eleyvon

Hebrew: לְהַגִּ֣יד בַּבֹּ֣קֶר חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וֶ֝אֱמ֥וּנָתְךָ֗ בַּלֵּילֽוֹת׃
Translated:
To proclaim Your steadfast love at daybreak,
Your faithfulness each night
Transliteration: lehagiyd vavoker chasedekha veemunatekha valeylvot

Hebrew: עֲֽלֵי־עָ֭שׂוֹר וַעֲלֵי־נָ֑בֶל עֲלֵ֖י הִגָּי֣וֹן בְּכִנּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
With a ten-stringed harp,
with voice and lyre together.
Transliteration: aley-ashvor vaaley-navel aley higayvon vekhinvor

Hebrew: כִּ֤י שִׂמַּחְתַּ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּפׇעֳלֶ֑ךָ בְּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֖י יָדֶ֣יךָ אֲרַנֵּֽן׃
Translated:
You have gladdened me by Your deeds, O LORD;
I shout for joy at Your handiwork.
Transliteration: khiy shimachetaniy yehovah vefׇolekha vemaashey yadeykha aranen

Hebrew: מַה־גָּדְל֣וּ מַעֲשֶׂ֣יךָ יְהֹוָ֑ה מְ֝אֹ֗ד עָמְק֥וּ מַחְשְׁבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
How great are Your works, O LORD,
how very subtle Your designs!
Transliteration: mah-gadelu maasheykha yehovah meod ameku macheshevoteykha

Hebrew: אִֽישׁ־בַּ֭עַר לֹ֣א יֵדָ֑ע וּ֝כְסִ֗יל לֹא־יָבִ֥ין אֶת־זֹֽאת׃
Translated:
A brutish man cannot know,
a fool cannot understand this:
Transliteration: iysh-vaar lo eida ukhesiyl lo-yaviyn et-zot

Hebrew: בִּפְרֹ֤חַ רְשָׁעִ֨ים ׀ כְּמ֥וֹ־עֵ֗שֶׂב וַ֭יָּצִיצוּ כׇּל־פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן לְהִשָּׁמְדָ֥ם עֲדֵי־עַֽד׃
Translated:
though the wicked sprout like grass,
though all evildoers blossom,
it is only that they may be destroyed forever.
Transliteration: viferocha reshaiym khemvo-eshev vayatsiytsu khׇl-foaley aven lehishamedam adey-ad

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֥ה מָר֗וֹם לְעֹלָ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But You are exalted, O LORD, for all time.
Transliteration: veatah marvom leolam yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י הִנֵּ֪ה אֹיְבֶ֡יךָ יְֽהֹוָ֗ה כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֣ה אֹיְבֶ֣יךָ יֹאבֵ֑דוּ יִ֝תְפָּרְד֗וּ כׇּל־פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Surely, Your enemies, O LORD,
surely, Your enemies perish;
all evildoers are scattered.
Transliteration: khiy hineh oyeveykha yehovah khiy-hineh oyeveykha yovedu yitefaredu khׇl-foaley aven

Hebrew: וַתָּ֣רֶם כִּרְאֵ֣ים קַרְנִ֑י בַּ֝לֹּתִ֗י בְּשֶׁ֣מֶן רַעֲנָֽן׃
Translated:
You raise my horn high like that of a wild ox;
I am soaked in freshening oil.
Transliteration: vatarem khireeym kareniy valotiy veshemen raanan

Hebrew: וַתַּבֵּ֥ט עֵינִ֗י בְּשׁ֫וּרָ֥י בַּקָּמִ֖ים עָלַ֥י מְרֵעִ֗ים תִּשְׁמַ֥עְנָה אׇזְנָֽי׃
Translated:
I shall see the defeat of my watchful foes,
hear of the downfall of the wicked who beset me.
Transliteration: vatavet eyniy veshuray vakamiym alay mereiym tishemaenah ׇzenay

Hebrew: צַ֭דִּיק כַּתָּמָ֣ר יִפְרָ֑ח כְּאֶ֖רֶז בַּלְּבָנ֣וֹן יִשְׂגֶּֽה׃
Translated:
The righteous bloom like a date-palm;
they thrive like a cedar in Lebanon;
Transliteration: tsadiyk khatamar yiferach kheerez valevanvon yishegeh

Hebrew: שְׁ֭תוּלִים בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּחַצְר֖וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣ינוּ יַפְרִֽיחוּ׃
Translated:
planted in the house of the LORD,
they flourish in the courts of our God.
Transliteration: shetuliym veveyt yehovah vechatservot eloheynu yaferiychu

Hebrew: ע֭וֹד יְנוּב֣וּן בְּשֵׂיבָ֑ה דְּשֵׁנִ֖ים וְֽרַעֲנַנִּ֣ים יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated:
In old age they still produce fruit;
they are full of sap and freshness,
Transliteration: vod yenuvun vesheyvah desheniym veraananiym yiheyu

Hebrew: לְ֭הַגִּיד כִּֽי־יָשָׁ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה צ֝וּרִ֗י וְֽלֹא־[עַוְלָ֥תָה] (עלתה) בּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
attesting that the LORD is upright,
my rock, in whom there is no wrong.
Transliteration: lehagiyd khiy-yashar yehovah tsuriy velo-[avelatah] (lth) vvo {f}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה מָלָךְ֮ גֵּא֢וּת לָ֫בֵ֥שׁ לָבֵ֣שׁ יְ֭הֹוָה עֹ֣ז הִתְאַזָּ֑ר אַף־תִּכּ֥וֹן תֵּ֝בֵ֗ל בַּל־תִּמּֽוֹט׃
Translated:
The LORD is king,
He is robed in grandeur;
the LORD is robed,
He is girded with strength.
The world stands firm;
it cannot be shaken.
Transliteration: yehovah malakhe geut lavesh lavesh yehovah oz hiteazar af-tikhvon tevel val-timvot

Hebrew: נָכ֣וֹן כִּסְאֲךָ֣ מֵאָ֑ז מֵעוֹלָ֣ם אָֽתָּה׃
Translated:
Your throne stands firm from of old;
from eternity You have existed.
Transliteration: nakhvon khiseakha meaz mevolam atah

Hebrew: נָשְׂא֤וּ נְהָר֨וֹת ׀ יְֽהֹוָ֗ה נָשְׂא֣וּ נְהָר֣וֹת קוֹלָ֑ם יִשְׂא֖וּ נְהָר֣וֹת דׇּכְיָֽם׃
Translated:
The ocean sounds, O LORD,
the ocean sounds its thunder,
the ocean sounds its pounding.
Transliteration: nasheu neharvot yehovah nasheu neharvot kvolam yisheu neharvot dׇkheyam

Hebrew: מִקֹּל֨וֹת ׀ מַ֤יִם רַבִּ֗ים אַדִּירִ֣ים מִשְׁבְּרֵי־יָ֑ם אַדִּ֖יר בַּמָּר֣וֹם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Above the thunder of the mighty waters,
more majestic than the breakers of the sea
is the LORD, majestic on high.
Transliteration: mikolvot mayiim raviym adiyriym misheverey-yam adiyr vamarvom yehovah

Hebrew: עֵֽדֹתֶ֨יךָ ׀ נֶאֶמְנ֬וּ מְאֹ֗ד לְבֵיתְךָ֥ נַאֲוָה־קֹ֑דֶשׁ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לְאֹ֣רֶךְ יָמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
Your decrees are indeed enduring;
holiness befits Your house,
O LORD, for all times.
Transliteration: edoteykha neemenu meod leveytekha naavah-kodesh yehovah leorekhe yamiym {f}

Hebrew: אֵל־נְקָמ֥וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה אֵ֖ל נְקָמ֣וֹת הוֹפִֽיעַ׃
Translated:
God of retribution, LORD,
God of retribution, appear!
Transliteration: el-nekamvot yehovah el nekamvot hvofiya

Hebrew: הִ֭נָּשֵׂא שֹׁפֵ֣ט הָאָ֑רֶץ הָשֵׁ֥ב גְּ֝מ֗וּל עַל־גֵּאִֽים׃
Translated:
Rise up, judge of the earth,
give the arrogant their deserts!
Transliteration: hinashe shofet haarets hashev gemul al-geiym

Hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֖י רְשָׁעִ֥ים <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה עַד־מָ֝תַ֗י רְשָׁעִ֥ים יַעֲלֹֽזוּ׃
Translated:
How long shall the wicked, O LORD,
how long shall the wicked exult,
Transliteration: ad-matay reshaiym <small></small> yehovah ad-matay reshaiym yaalozu

Hebrew: יַבִּ֣יעוּ יְדַבְּר֣וּ עָתָ֑ק יִ֝תְאַמְּר֗וּ כׇּל־פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
shall they utter insolent speech,
shall all evildoers vaunt themselves?
Transliteration: yaviyu yedaveru atak yiteameru khׇl-foaley aven

Hebrew: עַמְּךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֣ה יְדַכְּא֑וּ וְֽנַחֲלָתְךָ֥ יְעַנּֽוּ׃
Translated:
They crush Your people, O LORD,
they afflict Your very own;
Transliteration: amekha yehovah yedakheu venachalatekha yeanu

Hebrew: אַלְמָנָ֣ה וְגֵ֣ר יַהֲרֹ֑גוּ וִ֖יתוֹמִ֣ים יְרַצֵּֽחוּ׃
Translated:
they kill the widow and the stranger;
they murder the fatherless,
Transliteration: alemanah veger yaharogu viytvomiym yeratsechu

Hebrew: וַ֭יֹּ֣אמְרוּ לֹ֣א יִרְאֶה־יָּ֑הּ וְלֹא־יָ֝בִ֗ין אֱלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
thinking, “The LORD does not see it,
the God of Jacob does not pay heed.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lo yireeh-yah velo-yaviyn elohey yaakov

Hebrew: בִּ֭ינוּ בֹּעֲרִ֣ים בָּעָ֑ם וּ֝כְסִילִ֗ים מָתַ֥י תַּשְׂכִּֽילוּ׃
Translated:
Take heed, you most brutish people;
fools, when will you get wisdom?
Transliteration: viynu voariym vaam ukhesiyliym matay tashekhiylu

Hebrew: הֲנֹ֣טַֽע אֹ֭זֶן הֲלֹ֣א יִשְׁמָ֑ע אִֽם־יֹ֥צֵֽר עַ֝֗יִן הֲלֹ֣א יַבִּֽיט׃
Translated:
Shall He who implants the ear not hear,
He who forms the eye not see?
Transliteration: hanota ozen halo yishema im-yotser ayiyin halo yaviyt

Hebrew: הֲיֹסֵ֣ר גּ֭וֹיִם הֲלֹ֣א יוֹכִ֑יחַ הַֽמְלַמֵּ֖ד אָדָ֣ם דָּֽעַת׃
Translated:
Shall He who disciplines nations not punish,
He who instructs men in knowledge?
Transliteration: hayoser gvoyim halo yvokhiycha hamelamed adam daat

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה יֹ֭דֵעַ מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת אָדָ֑ם כִּי־הֵ֥מָּה הָֽבֶל׃
Translated: The LORD knows the designs of men to be futile.
Transliteration: yehovah yodea macheshevvot adam khiy-hemah havel

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֤י ׀ הַגֶּ֣בֶר אֲשֶׁר־תְּיַסְּרֶ֣נּוּ יָּ֑הּ וּֽמִתּוֹרָתְךָ֥ תְלַמְּדֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Happy is the man whom You discipline, O LORD,
the man You instruct in Your teaching,
Transliteration: asherey hagever asher-teyaserenu yah umitvoratekha telamedenu

Hebrew: לְהַשְׁקִ֣יט ל֭וֹ מִ֣ימֵי רָ֑ע עַ֤ד יִכָּרֶ֖ה לָרָשָׁ֣ע שָֽׁחַת׃
Translated:
to give him tranquillity in times of misfortune,
until a pit be dug for the wicked.
Transliteration: lehashekiyt lvo miymey ra ad yikhareh larasha shachat

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־יִטֹּ֣שׁ יְהֹוָ֣ה עַמּ֑וֹ וְ֝נַחֲלָת֗וֹ לֹ֣א יַעֲזֹֽב׃
Translated:
For the LORD will not forsake His people;
He will not abandon His very own.
Transliteration: khiy lo-yitosh yehovah amvo venachalatvo lo yaazov

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עַד־צֶ֭דֶק יָשׁ֣וּב מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וְ֝אַחֲרָ֗יו כׇּל־יִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
Judgment shall again accord with justice
and all the upright shall rally to it.
Transliteration: khiy-ad-tsedek yashuv mishefat veacharayv khׇl-yisherey-lev

Hebrew: מִֽי־יָק֣וּם לִ֭י עִם־מְרֵעִ֑ים מִי־יִתְיַצֵּ֥ב לִ֝֗י עִם־פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Who will take my part against evil men?
Who will stand up for me against wrongdoers?
Transliteration: miy-yakum liy im-mereiym miy-yiteyatsev liy im-foaley aven

Hebrew: לוּלֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה עֶזְרָ֣תָה לִּ֑י כִּמְעַ֓ט ׀ שָׁכְנָ֖ה דוּמָ֣ה נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
Were not the LORD my help,
I should soon dwell in silence.
Transliteration: luley yehovah ezeratah liy khimeat shakhenah dumah nafeshiy

Hebrew: אִם־אָ֭מַרְתִּי מָ֣טָה רַגְלִ֑י חַסְדְּךָ֥ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יִסְעָדֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
When I think my foot has given way,
Your faithfulness, O LORD, supports me.
Transliteration: im-amaretiy matah rageliy chasedekha yehovah yiseadeniy

Hebrew: בְּרֹ֣ב שַׂרְעַפַּ֣י בְּקִרְבִּ֑י תַּ֝נְחוּמֶ֗יךָ יְֽשַׁעַשְׁע֥וּ נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
When I am filled with cares,
Your assurance soothes my soul.
Transliteration: verov shareafay vekireviy tanechumeykha yeshaasheu nafeshiy

Hebrew: הַֽ֭יְחׇבְרְךָ כִּסֵּ֣א הַוּ֑וֹת יֹצֵ֖ר עָמָ֣ל עֲלֵי־חֹֽק׃
Translated:
Shall the seat of injustice be Your partner,
that frames mischief by statute?
Transliteration: hayechׇverekha khise hauvot yotser amal aley-chok

Hebrew: יָ֭גוֹדּוּ עַל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ צַדִּ֑יק וְדָ֖ם נָקִ֣י יַרְשִֽׁיעוּ׃
Translated:
They band together to do away with the righteous;
they condemn the innocent to death.
Transliteration: yagvodu al-nefesh tsadiyk vedam nakiy yareshiyu

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֬י יְהֹוָ֣ה לִ֣י לְמִשְׂגָּ֑ב וֵ֝אלֹהַ֗י לְצ֣וּר מַחְסִֽי׃
Translated:
But the LORD is my haven;
my God is my sheltering rock.
Transliteration: vayehiy yehovah liy lemishegav velohay letsur machesiy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶ֨ם ׀ אֶת־אוֹנָ֗ם וּבְרָעָתָ֥ם יַצְמִיתֵ֑ם יַ֝צְמִיתֵ֗ם יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He will make their evil recoil upon them,
annihilate them through their own wickedness;
the LORD our God will annihilate them.
Transliteration: vayashev aleyhem et-vonam uveraatam yatsemiytem yatsemiytem yehovah eloheynu {f}

Hebrew: לְ֭כוּ נְרַנְּנָ֣ה לַיהֹוָ֑ה נָ֝רִ֗יעָה לְצ֣וּר יִשְׁעֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Come, let us sing joyously to the LORD,
raise a shout for our rock and deliverer;
Transliteration: lekhu neranenah layhovah nariyah letsur yisheenu

Hebrew: נְקַדְּמָ֣ה פָנָ֣יו בְּתוֹדָ֑ה בִּ֝זְמִר֗וֹת נָרִ֥יעַֽ לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
let us come into His presence with praise;
let us raise a shout for Him in song!
Transliteration: nekademah fanayv vetvodah vizemirvot nariya lvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֣ל גָּד֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמֶ֥לֶךְ גָּ֝ד֗וֹל עַל־כׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
For the LORD is a great God,
the great king of all divine beings.
Transliteration: khiy el gadvol yehovah umelekhe gadvol al-khׇl-Elohim

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּ֭יָדוֹ מֶחְקְרֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְתוֹעֲפֹ֖ת הָרִ֣ים לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
In His hand are the depths of the earth;
the peaks of the mountains are His.
Transliteration: asher veyadvo mechekerey-arets vetvoafot hariym lvo

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־ל֣וֹ הַ֭יָּם וְה֣וּא עָשָׂ֑הוּ וְ֝יַבֶּ֗שֶׁת יָדָ֥יו יָצָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
His is the sea, He made it;
and the land, which His hands fashioned.
Transliteration: asher-lvo hayam vehu ashahu veyaveshet yadayv yatsaru

Hebrew: בֹּ֭אוּ נִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֣ה וְנִכְרָ֑עָה נִ֝בְרְכָ֗ה לִֽפְנֵי־יְהֹוָ֥ה עֹשֵֽׂנוּ׃
Translated:
Come, let us bow down and kneel,
bend the knee before the LORD our maker,
Transliteration: vou nishetachaveh venikheraah niverekhah lifeney-yehovah oshenu

Hebrew: כִּ֘י־ה֤וּא אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וַאֲנַ֤חְנוּ עַ֣ם מַ֭רְעִיתוֹ וְצֹ֣אן יָד֑וֹ הַ֝יּ֗וֹם אִֽם־בְּקֹל֥וֹ תִשְׁמָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
for He is our God,
and we are the people He tends, the flock in His care.
O, if you would but heed His charge this day:
Transliteration: khiy-hu eloheynu vaanachenu am mareiytvo vetson yadvo hayyvom im-vekolvo tishemau

Hebrew: אַל־תַּקְשׁ֣וּ לְ֭בַבְכֶם כִּמְרִיבָ֑ה כְּי֥וֹם מַ֝סָּ֗ה בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated:
Do not be stubborn as at Meribah,
as on the day of Massah, in the wilderness,
Transliteration: al-takeshu levavekhem khimeriyvah kheyvom masah vamidevar

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִ֭סּוּנִי אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּ֝חָנ֗וּנִי גַּם־רָא֥וּ פׇעֳלִֽי׃
Translated:
when your fathers put Me to the test,
tried Me, though they had seen My deeds.
Transliteration: asher nisuniy avvoteykhem vechanuniy gam-rau fׇoliy

Hebrew: אַרְבָּ֘עִ֤ים שָׁנָ֨ה ׀ אָ֘ק֤וּט בְּד֗וֹר וָאֹמַ֗ר עַ֤ם תֹּעֵ֣י לֵבָ֣ב הֵ֑ם וְ֝הֵ֗ם לֹא־יָדְע֥וּ דְרָכָֽי׃
Translated:
Forty years I was provoked by that generation;
I thought, “They are a senseless people;
they would not know My ways.”
Transliteration: arevaiym shanah akut vedvor vaomar am toey levav hem vehem lo-yadeu derakhay

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתִּי בְאַפִּ֑י אִם־יְ֝בֹא֗וּן אֶל־מְנוּחָתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Concerning them I swore in anger,
“They shall never come to My resting-place!”
Transliteration: asher-nishevaetiy veafiy im-yevoun el-menuchatiy {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֣ירוּ לַ֭יהֹוָה שִׁ֣יר חָדָ֑שׁ שִׁ֥ירוּ לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Sing to the LORD a new song,
sing to the LORD, all the earth.
Transliteration: shiyru layhovah shiyr chadash shiyru layhovah khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: שִׁ֣ירוּ לַ֭יהֹוָה בָּרְכ֣וּ שְׁמ֑וֹ בַּשְּׂר֥וּ מִיּֽוֹם־לְ֝י֗וֹם יְשׁוּעָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Sing to the LORD, bless His name,
proclaim His victory day after day.
Transliteration: shiyru layhovah varekhu shemvo vasheru miyyvom-leyvom yeshuatvo

Hebrew: סַפְּר֣וּ בַגּוֹיִ֣ם כְּבוֹד֑וֹ בְּכׇל־הָ֝עַמִּ֗ים נִפְלְאוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Tell of His glory among the nations,
His wondrous deeds, among all peoples.
Transliteration: saferu vagvoyim khevvodvo vekhׇl-haamiym nifelevotayv

Hebrew: כִּ֥י־גָ֘ד֤וֹל יְהֹוָ֣ה וּמְהֻלָּ֣ל מְאֹ֑ד נוֹרָ֥א ה֝֗וּא עַל־כׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
For the LORD is great and much acclaimed,
He is held in awe by all divine beings.
Transliteration: khiy-gadvol yehovah umehulal meod nvora huu al-khׇl-Elohim

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ כׇּל־אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָעַמִּ֣ים אֱלִילִ֑ים וַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה שָׁמַ֥יִם עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated:
All the gods of the peoples are mere idols,
but the LORD made the heavens.
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-elohey haamiym eliyliym vayhovah shamayiim ashah

Hebrew: הוֹד־וְהָדָ֥ר לְפָנָ֑יו עֹ֥ז וְ֝תִפְאֶ֗רֶת בְּמִקְדָּשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Glory and majesty are before Him;
strength and splendor are in His temple.
Transliteration: hvod-vehadar lefanayv oz vetifeeret vemikedashvo

Hebrew: הָב֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה מִשְׁפְּח֣וֹת עַמִּ֑ים הָב֥וּ לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה כָּב֥וֹד וָעֹֽז׃
Translated:
Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the peoples,
ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
Transliteration: havu layhovah mishefechvot amiym havu layhovah khavvod vaoz

Hebrew: הָב֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה כְּב֣וֹד שְׁמ֑וֹ שְׂאֽוּ־מִ֝נְחָ֗ה וּבֹ֥אוּ לְחַצְרוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name,
bring tribute and enter His courts.
Transliteration: havu layhovah khevvod shemvo sheu-minechah uvou lechatservotayv

Hebrew: הִשְׁתַּחֲו֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה בְּהַדְרַת־קֹ֑דֶשׁ חִ֥ילוּ מִ֝פָּנָ֗יו כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Bow down to the LORD majestic in holiness;
tremble in His presence, all the earth!
Transliteration: hishetachavu layhovah vehaderat-kodesh chiylu mifanayv khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: אִמְר֤וּ בַגּוֹיִ֨ם ׀ יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה מָלָ֗ךְ אַף־תִּכּ֣וֹן תֵּ֭בֵל בַּל־תִּמּ֑וֹט יָדִ֥ין עַ֝מִּ֗ים בְּמֵישָׁרִֽים׃
Translated:
Declare among the nations, “The LORD is king!”
the world stands firm; it cannot be shaken;
He judges the peoples with equity.
Transliteration: imeru vagvoyim yehovah malakhe af-tikhvon tevel val-timvot yadiyn amiym vemeyshariym

Hebrew: יִשְׂמְח֣וּ הַ֭שָּׁמַיִם וְתָגֵ֣ל הָאָ֑רֶץ יִֽרְעַ֥ם הַ֝יָּ֗ם וּמְלֹאֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Let the heavens rejoice and the earth exult;
let the sea and all within it thunder,
Transliteration: yishemechu hashamayim vetagel haarets yiream hayam umelovo

Hebrew: יַעֲלֹ֣ז שָׂ֭דַי וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־בּ֑וֹ אָ֥ז יְ֝רַנְּנ֗וּ כׇּל־עֲצֵי־יָֽעַר׃
Translated:
the fields and everything in them exult;
then shall all the trees of the forest shout for joy
Transliteration: yaaloz shaday vekhׇl-asher-vvo az yeranenu khׇl-atsey-yaar

Hebrew: לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ כִּ֬י בָ֗א כִּ֥י בָא֮ לִשְׁפֹּ֢ט הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ יִשְׁפֹּֽט־תֵּבֵ֥ל בְּצֶ֑דֶק וְ֝עַמִּ֗ים בֶּאֱמוּנָתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
at the presence of the LORD, for He is coming,
for He is coming to rule the earth;
He will rule the world justly,
and its peoples in faithfulness.
Transliteration: lifeney yehovah khiy va khiy va lishefo֢t haarets yishefot-tevel vetsedek veamiym veemunatvo {f}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה מָ֭לָךְ תָּגֵ֣ל הָאָ֑רֶץ יִ֝שְׂמְח֗וּ אִיִּ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
The LORD is king!
Let the earth exult,
the many islands rejoice!
Transliteration: yehovah malakhe tagel haarets yishemechu iyiym raviym

Hebrew: עָנָ֣ן וַעֲרָפֶ֣ל סְבִיבָ֑יו צֶ֥דֶק וּ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט מְכ֣וֹן כִּסְאֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Dense clouds are around Him,
righteousness and justice are the base of His throne.
Transliteration: anan vaarafel seviyvayv tsedek umishefat mekhvon khisevo

Hebrew: אֵ֭שׁ לְפָנָ֣יו תֵּלֵ֑ךְ וּתְלַהֵ֖ט סָבִ֣יב צָרָֽיו׃
Translated:
Fire is His vanguard,
burning His foes on every side.
Transliteration: esh lefanayv telekhe utelahet saviyv tsarayv

Hebrew: הֵאִ֣ירוּ בְרָקָ֣יו תֵּבֵ֑ל רָאֲתָ֖ה וַתָּחֵ֣ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
His lightnings light up the world;
the earth is convulsed at the sight;
Transliteration: heiyru verakayv tevel raatah vatachel haarets

Hebrew: הָרִ֗ים כַּדּוֹנַ֗ג נָ֭מַסּוּ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה מִ֝לִּפְנֵ֗י אֲד֣וֹן כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
mountains melt like wax at the LORD’s presence,
at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.
Transliteration: hariym khadvonag namasu milifeney yehovah milifeney advon khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: הִגִּ֣ידוּ הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם צִדְק֑וֹ וְרָא֖וּ כׇל־הָעַמִּ֣ים כְּבוֹדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The heavens proclaim His righteousness
and all peoples see His glory.
Transliteration: higiydu hashamayiim tsidekvo verau khׇl-haamiym khevvodvo

Hebrew: יֵבֹ֤שׁוּ ׀ כׇּל־עֹ֬בְדֵי פֶ֗סֶל הַמִּֽתְהַלְלִ֥ים בָּאֱלִילִ֑ים הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ־ל֝֗וֹ כׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
All who worship images,
who vaunt their idols,
are dismayed;
all divine beings bow down to Him.
Transliteration: eivoshu khׇl-ovedey fesel hamitehaleliym vaeliyliym hishetachavu-lvo khׇl-Elohim

Hebrew: שָׁמְעָ֬ה וַתִּשְׂמַ֨ח ׀ צִיּ֗וֹן וַ֭תָּגֵלְנָה בְּנ֣וֹת יְהוּדָ֑ה לְמַ֖עַן מִשְׁפָּטֶ֣יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Zion, hearing it, rejoices,
the towns of Judah exult,
because of Your judgments, O LORD.
Transliteration: shameah vatishemach tsiyyvon vatagelenah venvot yehudah lemaan mishefateykha yehovah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָ֗ה עֶלְי֥וֹן עַל־כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ מְאֹ֥ד נַ֝עֲלֵ֗יתָ עַל־כׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
For You, LORD, are supreme over all the earth;
You are exalted high above all divine beings.
Transliteration: khiy-atah yehovah eleyvon al-khׇl-haarets meod naaleyta al-khׇl-Elohim

Hebrew: אֹֽהֲבֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֗ה שִׂנְא֫וּ־רָ֥ע שֹׁ֭מֵר נַפְשׁ֣וֹת חֲסִידָ֑יו מִיַּ֥ד רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יַצִּילֵֽם׃
Translated:
O you who love the LORD, hate evil!
He guards the lives of His loyal ones,
saving them from the hand of the wicked.
Transliteration: ohavey yehovah shineu-ra shomer nafeshvot chasiydayv miyad reshaiym yatsiylem

Hebrew: א֭וֹר זָרֻ֣עַ לַצַּדִּ֑יק וּֽלְיִשְׁרֵי־לֵ֥ב שִׂמְחָֽה׃
Translated:
Light is sown for the righteous,
radiance for the upright.
Transliteration: vor zarua latsadiyk uleyisherey-lev shimechah

Hebrew: שִׂמְח֣וּ צַ֭דִּיקִים בַּיהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝הוֹד֗וּ לְזֵ֣כֶר קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
O you righteous, rejoice in the LORD
and acclaim His holy name!
Transliteration: shimechu tsadiykiym vayhovah vehvodu lezekher kׇdeshvo {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֡וֹר שִׁ֤ירוּ לַיהֹוָ֨ה ׀ שִׁ֣יר חָ֭דָשׁ כִּֽי־נִפְלָא֣וֹת עָשָׂ֑ה הוֹשִׁיעָה־לּ֥וֹ יְ֝מִינ֗וֹ וּזְר֥וֹעַ קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
A psalm.

Sing to the LORD a new song,
for He has worked wonders;
His right hand, His holy arm,
has won Him victory.
Transliteration: mizemvor shiyru layhovah shiyr chadash khiy-nifelavot ashah hvoshiyah-lvo yemiynvo uzervoa kׇdeshvo

Hebrew: הוֹדִ֣יעַ יְ֭הֹוָה יְשׁוּעָת֑וֹ לְעֵינֵ֥י הַ֝גּוֹיִ֗ם גִּלָּ֥ה צִדְקָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The LORD has manifested His victory,
has displayed His triumph in the sight of the nations.
Transliteration: hvodiya yehovah yeshuatvo leeyney hagvoyim gilah tsidekatvo

Hebrew: זָ֘כַ֤ר חַסְדּ֨וֹ ׀ וֶ֥אֱֽמוּנָתוֹ֮ לְבֵ֢ית יִשְׂרָ֫אֵ֥ל רָא֥וּ כׇל־אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ אֵ֝֗ת יְשׁוּעַ֥ת אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
He was mindful of His steadfast love and faithfulness toward the house of Israel;
all the ends of the earth beheld the victory of our God.
Transliteration: zakhar chasedvo veemunatvo leve֢yt yisherael rau khׇl-afesey-arets et yeshuat eloheynu

Hebrew: הָרִ֣יעוּ לַ֭יהֹוָה כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ פִּצְח֖וּ וְרַנְּנ֣וּ וְזַמֵּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Raise a shout to the LORD, all the earth,
break into joyous songs of praise!
Transliteration: hariyu layhovah khׇl-haarets fitsechu veranenu vezameru

Hebrew: זַמְּר֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה בְּכִנּ֑וֹר בְּ֝כִנּ֗וֹר וְק֣וֹל זִמְרָֽה׃
Translated:
Sing praise to the LORD with the lyre,
with the lyre and melodious song.
Transliteration: zameru layhovah vekhinvor vekhinvor vekvol zimerah

Hebrew: בַּ֭חֲצֹ֣צְרוֹת וְק֣וֹל שׁוֹפָ֑ר הָ֝רִ֗יעוּ לִפְנֵ֤י ׀ הַמֶּ֬לֶךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
With trumpets and the blast of the horn
raise a shout before the LORD, the King.
Transliteration: vachatsotservot vekvol shvofar hariyu lifeney hamelekhe yehovah

Hebrew: יִרְעַ֣ם הַ֭יָּם וּמְלֹא֑וֹ תֵּ֝בֵ֗ל וְיֹ֣שְׁבֵי בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Let the sea and all within it thunder,
the world and its inhabitants;
Transliteration: yiream hayam umelovo tevel veyoshevey vah

Hebrew: נְהָר֥וֹת יִמְחֲאוּ־כָ֑ף יַ֝֗חַד הָרִ֥ים יְרַנֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
let the rivers clap their hands,
the mountains sing joyously together
Transliteration: neharvot yimechau-khaf yachad hariym yeranenu

Hebrew: לִ֥פְֽנֵי־יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּ֥י בָא֮ לִשְׁפֹּ֢ט הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ יִשְׁפֹּֽט־תֵּבֵ֥ל בְּצֶ֑דֶק וְ֝עַמִּ֗ים בְּמֵישָׁרִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated:
at the presence of the LORD,
for He is coming to rule the earth;
He will rule the world justly,
and its peoples with equity.
Transliteration: lifeney-yehovah khiy va lishefo֢t haarets yishefot-tevel vetsedek veamiym vemeyshariym {f}

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה מָ֭לָךְ יִרְגְּז֣וּ עַמִּ֑ים יֹשֵׁ֥ב כְּ֝רוּבִ֗ים תָּנ֥וּט הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
The LORD, enthroned on cherubim, is king,
peoples tremble, the earth quakes.
Transliteration: yehovah malakhe yiregezu amiym yoshev kheruviym tanut haarets

Hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה בְּצִיּ֣וֹן גָּד֑וֹל וְרָ֥ם ה֝֗וּא עַל־כׇּל־הָעַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
The LORD is great in Zion,
and exalted above all peoples.
Transliteration: yehovah vetsiyyvon gadvol veram huu al-khׇl-haamiym

Hebrew: יוֹד֣וּ שִׁ֭מְךָ גָּד֥וֹל וְנוֹרָ֗א קָד֥וֹשׁ הֽוּא׃
Translated:
They praise Your name as great and awesome;
He is holy!
Transliteration: yvodu shimekha gadvol venvora kadvosh hu

Hebrew: וְעֹ֥ז מֶלֶךְ֮ מִשְׁפָּ֢ט אָ֫הֵ֥ב אַ֭תָּה כּוֹנַ֣נְתָּ מֵישָׁרִ֑ים מִשְׁפָּ֥ט וּ֝צְדָקָ֗ה בְּיַעֲקֹ֤ב ׀ אַתָּ֬ה עָשִֽׂיתָ׃
Translated:
Mighty king who loves justice,
it was You who established equity,
You who worked righteous judgment in Jacob.
Transliteration: veoz melekhe mishefa֢t ahev atah khvonaneta meyshariym mishefat utsedakah veyaakov atah ashiyta

Hebrew: רוֹמְמ֡וּ יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וְֽ֭הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לַהֲדֹ֥ם רַגְלָ֗יו קָד֥וֹשׁ הֽוּא׃
Translated:
Exalt the LORD our God
and bow down to His footstool;
He is holy!
Transliteration: rvomemu yehovah eloheynu vehishetachavu lahadom ragelayv kadvosh hu

Hebrew: מֹ֘שֶׁ֤ה וְאַהֲרֹ֨ן ׀ בְּֽכֹהֲנָ֗יו וּ֭שְׁמוּאֵל בְּקֹרְאֵ֣י שְׁמ֑וֹ קֹרִ֥אים אֶל־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וְה֣וּא יַעֲנֵֽם׃
Translated:
Moses and Aaron among His priests,
Samuel, among those who call on His name—
when they called to the LORD,
He answered them.
Transliteration: mosheh veaharon vekhohanayv ushemuel vekoreey shemvo koriym el-yehovah vehu yaanem

Hebrew: בְּעַמּ֣וּד עָ֭נָן יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם שָׁמְר֥וּ עֵ֝דֹתָ֗יו וְחֹ֣ק נָֽתַן־לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
He spoke to them in a pillar of cloud;
they obeyed His decrees,
the law He gave them.
Transliteration: veamud anan yedaver aleyhem shameru edotayv vechok natan-lamvo

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵינוּ֮ אַתָּ֢ה עֲנִ֫יתָ֥ם אֵ֣ל נֹ֭שֵׂא הָיִ֣יתָ לָהֶ֑ם וְ֝נֹקֵ֗ם עַל־עֲלִילוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
O LORD our God, You answered them;
You were a forgiving God for them,
but You exacted retribution for their misdeeds.
Transliteration: yehovah eloheynu ata֢h aniytam el noshe hayiyta lahem venokem al-aliylvotam

Hebrew: רוֹמְמ֡וּ יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וְֽ֭הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לְהַ֣ר קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ כִּי־קָ֝ד֗וֹשׁ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Exalt the LORD our God,
and bow toward His holy hill,
for the LORD our God is holy.
Transliteration: rvomemu yehovah eloheynu vehishetachavu lehar kׇdeshvo khiy-kadvosh yehovah eloheynu {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֥וֹר לְתוֹדָ֑ה הָרִ֥יעוּ לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
A psalm for praise.

Raise a shout for the LORD, all the earth;
Transliteration: mizemvor letvodah hariyu layhovah khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: עִבְד֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּשִׂמְחָ֑ה בֹּ֥אוּ לְ֝פָנָ֗יו בִּרְנָנָֽה׃
Translated:
worship the LORD in gladness;
come into His presence with shouts of joy.
Transliteration: ivedu et-yehovah veshimechah vou lefanayv virenanah

Hebrew: דְּע֗וּ כִּֽי־יְהֹוָה֮ ה֤וּא אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים הֽוּא־עָ֭שָׂנוּ (ולא) [וְל֣וֹ] אֲנַ֑חְנוּ עַ֝מּ֗וֹ וְצֹ֣אן מַרְעִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Acknowledge that the LORD is God;
He made us and we are His,
His people, the flock He tends.
Transliteration: deu khiy-yehovah hu Elohimm hu-ashanu (vl) [velvo] anachenu amvo vetson mareiytvo

Hebrew: בֹּ֤אוּ שְׁעָרָ֨יו ׀ בְּתוֹדָ֗ה חֲצֵרֹתָ֥יו בִּתְהִלָּ֑ה הוֹדוּ־ל֝֗וֹ בָּרְכ֥וּ שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Enter His gates with praise,
His courts with acclamation.
Praise Him!
Bless His name!
Transliteration: vou shearayv vetvodah chatserotayv vitehilah hvodu-lvo varekhu shemvo

Hebrew: כִּי־ט֣וֹב יְ֭הֹוָה לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְעַד־דֹּ֥ר וָ֝דֹ֗ר אֱמוּנָתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
For the LORD is good;
His steadfast love is eternal;
His faithfulness is for all generations.
Transliteration: khiy-tvov yehovah levolam chasedvo vead-dor vador emunatvo {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֗ד מִ֫זְמ֥וֹר חֶֽסֶד־וּמִשְׁפָּ֥ט אָשִׁ֑ירָה לְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֲזַמֵּֽרָה׃
Translated:
Of David. A psalm.

I will sing of faithfulness and justice;
I will chant a hymn to You, O LORD.
Transliteration: ledavid mizemvor chesed-umishefat ashiyrah lekha yehovah azamerah

Hebrew: אַשְׂכִּ֤ילָה ׀ בְּדֶ֬רֶךְ תָּמִ֗ים מָ֭תַי תָּב֣וֹא אֵלָ֑י אֶתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בְּתׇם־לְ֝בָבִ֗י בְּקֶ֣רֶב בֵּיתִֽי׃
Translated:
I will study the way of the blameless;
when shall I attain it?
I will live without blame within my house.
Transliteration: ashekhiylah vederekhe tamiym matay tavvo elay etehalekhe vetׇm-levaviy vekerev veytiy

Hebrew: לֹֽא־אָשִׁ֨ית ׀ לְנֶ֥גֶד עֵינַ֗י דְּֽבַר־בְּלִ֫יָּ֥עַל עֲשֹֽׂה־סֵטִ֥ים שָׂנֵ֑אתִי לֹ֖א יִדְבַּ֣ק בִּֽי׃
Translated:
I will not set before my eyes anything base;
I hate crooked dealing;
I will have none of it.
Transliteration: lo-ashiyt leneged eynay devar-veliyaal ashoh-setiym shanetiy lo yidevak viy

Hebrew: לֵבָ֣ב עִ֭קֵּשׁ יָס֣וּר מִמֶּ֑נִּי רָ֝֗ע לֹ֣א אֵדָֽע׃
Translated:
Perverse thoughts will be far from me;
I will know nothing of evil.
Transliteration: levav ikesh yasur mimeniy ra lo eda

Hebrew: (מלושני) [מְלׇשְׁנִ֬י] בַסֵּ֨תֶר ׀ רֵעֵהוּ֮ אוֹת֢וֹ אַ֫צְמִ֥ית גְּֽבַהּ־עֵ֭ינַיִם וּרְחַ֣ב לֵבָ֑ב אֹ֝ת֗וֹ לֹ֣א אוּכָֽל׃
Translated:
He who slanders his friend in secret I will destroy;
I cannot endure the haughty and proud man.
Transliteration: (mlvshny) [melׇsheniy] vaseter reehu vot֢vo atsemiyt gevah-eynayim urechav levav otvo lo ukhal

Hebrew: עֵינַ֤י ׀ בְּנֶֽאֶמְנֵי־אֶרֶץ֮ לָשֶׁ֢בֶת עִמָּ֫דִ֥י הֹ֭לֵךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ תָּמִ֑ים ה֝֗וּא יְשָׁרְתֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
My eyes are on the trusty men of the land,
to have them at my side.
He who follows the way of the blameless
shall be in my service.
Transliteration: eynay veneemeney-erets lashe֢vet imadiy holekhe vederekhe tamiym huu yeshareteniy

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יֵשֵׁ֨ב ׀ בְּקֶ֥רֶב בֵּיתִי֮ עֹשֵׂ֢ה רְמִ֫יָּ֥ה דֹּבֵ֥ר שְׁקָרִ֑ים לֹא־יִ֝כּ֗וֹן לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינָֽי׃
Translated:
He who deals deceitfully
shall not live in my house;
he who speaks untruth
shall not stand before my eyes.
Transliteration: lo-eishev vekerev veytiy oshe֢h remiyah dover shekariym lo-yikhvon leneged eynay

Hebrew: לַבְּקָרִ֗ים אַצְמִ֥ית כׇּל־רִשְׁעֵי־אָ֑רֶץ לְהַכְרִ֥ית מֵעִיר־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃ {פ}
Translated:
Each morning I will destroy
all the wicked of the land,
to rid the city of the LORD
of all evildoers.
Transliteration: lavekariym atsemiyt khׇl-risheey-arets lehakheriyt meiyr-yehovah khׇl-foaley aven {f}

Hebrew: תְּ֭פִלָּה לְעָנִ֣י כִֽי־יַעֲטֹ֑ף וְלִפְנֵ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יִשְׁפֹּ֥ךְ שִׂיחֽוֹ׃
Translated: A prayer of the lowly man when he is faint and pours forth his plea before the LORD.
Transliteration: tefilah leaniy khiy-yaatof velifeney yehovah yishefokhe shiychvo

Hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה שִׁמְעָ֣ה תְפִלָּתִ֑י וְ֝שַׁוְעָתִ֗י אֵלֶ֥יךָ תָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
O LORD, hear my prayer;
let my cry come before You.
Transliteration: yehovah shimeah tefilatiy veshaveatiy eleykha tavvo

Hebrew: אַל־תַּסְתֵּ֬ר פָּנֶ֨יךָ ׀ מִמֶּנִּי֮ בְּי֢וֹם צַ֫ר־לִ֥י הַטֵּֽה־אֵלַ֥י אׇזְנֶ֑ךָ בְּי֥וֹם אֶ֝קְרָ֗א מַהֵ֥ר עֲנֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Do not hide Your face from me
in my time of trouble;
turn Your ear to me;
when I cry, answer me speedily.
Transliteration: al-taseter faneykha mimeniy vey֢vom tsar-liy hateh-elay ׇzenekha veyvom ekera maher aneniy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־כָל֣וּ בְעָשָׁ֣ן יָמָ֑י וְ֝עַצְמוֹתַ֗י כְּמוֹקֵ֥ד נִחָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
For my days have vanished like smoke
and my bones are charred like a hearth.
Transliteration: khiy-khalu veashan yamay veatsemvotay khemvoked nicharu

Hebrew: הוּכָּה־כָעֵ֣שֶׂב וַיִּבַ֣שׁ לִבִּ֑י כִּֽי־שָׁ֝כַ֗חְתִּי מֵאֲכֹ֥ל לַחְמִֽי׃
Translated:
My body is stricken and withered like grass;
too wasted to eat my food;
Transliteration: hukhah-khaeshev vayivash liviy khiy-shakhachetiy meakhol lachemiy

Hebrew: מִקּ֥וֹל אַנְחָתִ֑י דָּבְקָ֥ה עַ֝צְמִ֗י לִבְשָׂרִֽי׃
Translated:
on account of my vehement groaning
my bones show through my skin.
Transliteration: mikvol anechatiy davekah atsemiy liveshariy

Hebrew: דָּ֭מִיתִי לִקְאַ֣ת מִדְבָּ֑ר הָ֝יִ֗יתִי כְּכ֣וֹס חֳרָבֽוֹת׃
Translated:
I am like a great owl in the wilderness,
an owl among the ruins.
Transliteration: damiytiy likeat midevar hayiiytiy khekhvos choravvot

Hebrew: שָׁקַ֥דְתִּי וָאֶהְיֶ֑ה כְּ֝צִפּ֗וֹר בּוֹדֵ֥ד עַל־גָּֽג׃
Translated:
I lie awake; I am like
a lone bird upon a roof.
Transliteration: shakadetiy vaeheyeh khetsifvor vvoded al-gag

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם חֵרְפ֣וּנִי אוֹיְבָ֑י מְ֝הוֹלָלַ֗י בִּ֣י נִשְׁבָּֽעוּ׃
Translated:
All day long my enemies revile me;
my deriders use my name to curse.
Transliteration: khׇl-hayyvom cherefuniy voyevay mehvolalay viy nishevau

Hebrew: כִּי־אֵ֭פֶר כַּלֶּ֣חֶם אָכָ֑לְתִּי וְ֝שִׁקֻּוַ֗י בִּבְכִ֥י מָסָֽכְתִּי׃
Translated:
For I have eaten ashes like bread
and mixed my drink with tears,
Transliteration: khiy-efer khalechem akhaletiy veshikuvay vivekhiy masakhetiy

Hebrew: מִפְּנֵֽי־זַעַמְךָ֥ וְקִצְפֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י נְ֝שָׂאתַ֗נִי וַתַּשְׁלִיכֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
because of Your wrath and Your fury;
for You have cast me far away.
Transliteration: mifeney-zaamekha vekitsefekha khiy neshataniy vatasheliykheniy

Hebrew: יָ֭מַי כְּצֵ֣ל נָט֑וּי וַ֝אֲנִ֗י כָּעֵ֥שֶׂב אִיבָֽשׁ׃
Translated:
My days are like a lengthening shadow;
I wither like grass.
Transliteration: yamay khetsel natuy vaaniy khaeshev iyvash

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה לְעוֹלָ֣ם תֵּשֵׁ֑ב וְ֝זִכְרְךָ֗ לְדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃
Translated:
But You, O LORD, are enthroned forever;
Your fame endures throughout the ages.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah levolam teshev vezikherekha ledor vador

Hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה תָ֭קוּם תְּרַחֵ֣ם צִיּ֑וֹן כִּי־עֵ֥ת לְ֝חֶֽנְנָ֗הּ כִּי־בָ֥א מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated:
You will surely arise and take pity on Zion,
for it is time to be gracious to her;
the appointed time has come.
Transliteration: atah takum terachem tsiyyvon khiy-et lechenenah khiy-va mvoed

Hebrew: כִּי־רָצ֣וּ עֲ֭בָדֶיךָ אֶת־אֲבָנֶ֑יהָ וְֽאֶת־עֲפָרָ֥הּ יְחֹנֵֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Your servants take delight in its stones,
and cherish its dust.
Transliteration: khiy-ratsu avadeykha et-avaneyha veet-afarah yechonenu

Hebrew: וְיִֽירְא֣וּ ג֭וֹיִם אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וְֽכׇל־מַלְכֵ֥י הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ אֶת־כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
The nations will fear the name of the LORD,
all the kings of the earth, Your glory.
Transliteration: veyiyreu gvoyim et-shem yehovah vekhׇl-malekhey haarets et-khevvodekha

Hebrew: כִּי־בָנָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה צִיּ֑וֹן נִ֝רְאָ֗ה בִּכְבוֹדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For the LORD has built Zion;
He has appeared in all His glory.
Transliteration: khiy-vanah yehovah tsiyyvon nireah vikhevvodvo

Hebrew: פָּ֭נָה אֶל־תְּפִלַּ֣ת הָעַרְעָ֑ר וְלֹא־בָ֝זָ֗ה אֶת־תְּפִלָּתָֽם׃
Translated:
He has turned to the prayer of the destitute
and has not spurned their prayer.
Transliteration: fanah el-tefilat haarear velo-vazah et-tefilatam

Hebrew: תִּכָּ֣תֶב זֹ֭את לְד֣וֹר אַחֲר֑וֹן וְעַ֥ם נִ֝בְרָ֗א יְהַלֶּל־יָֽהּ׃
Translated:
May this be written down for a coming generation,
that people yet to be created may praise the LORD.
Transliteration: tikhatev zot ledvor acharvon veam nivera yehalel-yah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִ֭שְׁקִיף מִמְּר֣וֹם קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מִשָּׁמַ֤יִם ׀ אֶל־אֶ֬רֶץ הִבִּֽיט׃
Translated:
For He looks down from His holy height;
the LORD beholds the earth from heaven
Transliteration: khiy-hishekiyf mimervom kׇdeshvo yehovah mishamayiim el-erets hiviyt

Hebrew: לִ֭שְׁמֹעַ אֶנְקַ֣ת אָסִ֑יר לְ֝פַתֵּ֗חַ בְּנֵ֣י תְמוּתָֽה׃
Translated:
to hear the groans of the prisoner,
to release those condemned to death;
Transliteration: lishemoa enekat asiyr lefatecha veney temutah

Hebrew: לְסַפֵּ֣ר בְּ֭צִיּוֹן שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וּ֝תְהִלָּת֗וֹ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated:
that the fame of the LORD may be recounted in Zion,
His praises in Jerusalem,
Transliteration: lesafer vetsiyyvon shem yehovah utehilatvo viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: בְּהִקָּבֵ֣ץ עַמִּ֣ים יַחְדָּ֑ו וּ֝מַמְלָכ֗וֹת לַעֲבֹ֥ד אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
when the nations gather together,
the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
Transliteration: vehikavets amiym yachedav umamelakhvot laavod et-yehovah

Hebrew: עִנָּ֖ה בַדֶּ֥רֶךְ (כחו) [כֹּחִ֗י] קִצַּ֥ר יָמָֽי׃
Translated:
He drained my strength in mid-course,
He shortened my days.
Transliteration: inah vaderekhe (khchv) [khochiy] kitsar yamay

Hebrew: אֹמַ֗ר אֵלִ֗י אַֽל־תַּ֭עֲלֵנִי בַּחֲצִ֣י יָמָ֑י בְּד֖וֹר דּוֹרִ֣ים שְׁנוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I say, “O my God, do not take me away
in the midst of my days,
You whose years go on for generations on end.
Transliteration: omar eliy al-taaleniy vachatsiy yamay vedvor dvoriym shenvoteykha

Hebrew: לְ֭פָנִים הָאָ֣רֶץ יָסַ֑דְתָּ וּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יָדֶ֣יךָ שָׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Of old You established the earth;
the heavens are the work of Your hands.
Transliteration: lefaniym haarets yasadeta umaasheh yadeykha shamayiim

Hebrew: הֵ֤מָּה ׀ יֹאבֵדוּ֮ וְאַתָּ֢ה תַ֫עֲמֹ֥ד וְ֭כֻלָּם כַּבֶּ֣גֶד יִבְל֑וּ כַּלְּב֖וּשׁ תַּחֲלִיפֵ֣ם וְֽיַחֲלֹֽפוּ׃
Translated:
They shall perish, but You shall endure;
they shall all wear out like a garment;
You change them like clothing and they pass away.
Transliteration: hemah yovedu veata֢h taamod vekhulam khaveged yivelu khalevush tachaliyfem veyachalofu

Hebrew: וְאַתָּה־ה֑וּא וּ֝שְׁנוֹתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א יִתָּֽמּוּ׃
Translated: But You are the same, and Your years never end.
Transliteration: veatah-hu ushenvoteykha lo yitamu

Hebrew: בְּנֵֽי־עֲבָדֶ֥יךָ יִשְׁכּ֑וֹנוּ וְ֝זַרְעָ֗ם לְפָנֶ֥יךָ יִכּֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated:
May the children of Your servants dwell securely
and their offspring endure in Your presence.”
Transliteration: veney-avadeykha yishekhvonu vezaream lefaneykha yikhvon {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ בָּרְכִ֣י נַ֭פְשִׁי אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְכׇל־קְ֝רָבַ֗י אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Of David.

Bless the LORD, O my soul,
all my being, His holy name.
Transliteration: ledavid varekhiy nafeshiy et-yehovah vekhׇl-keravay et-shem kׇdeshvo

Hebrew: בָּרְכִ֣י נַ֭פְשִׁי אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאַל־תִּ֝שְׁכְּחִ֗י כׇּל־גְּמוּלָֽיו׃
Translated:
Bless the LORD, O my soul
and do not forget all His bounties.
Transliteration: varekhiy nafeshiy et-yehovah veal-tishekhechiy khׇl-gemulayv

Hebrew: הַסֹּלֵ֥חַ לְכׇל־עֲוֺנֵ֑כִי הָ֝רֹפֵ֗א לְכׇל־תַּחֲלוּאָֽיְכִי׃
Translated:
He forgives all your sins,
heals all your diseases.
Transliteration: hasolecha lekhׇl-avonekhiy harofe lekhׇl-tachaluayekhiy

Hebrew: הַגּוֹאֵ֣ל מִשַּׁ֣חַת חַיָּ֑יְכִי הַֽ֝מְעַטְּרֵ֗כִי חֶ֣סֶד וְרַחֲמִֽים׃
Translated:
He redeems your life from the Pit,
surrounds you with steadfast love and mercy.
Transliteration: hagvoel mishachat chayayekhiy hameaterekhiy chesed verachamiym

Hebrew: הַמַּשְׂבִּ֣יעַ בַּטּ֣וֹב עֶדְיֵ֑ךְ תִּתְחַדֵּ֖שׁ כַּנֶּ֣שֶׁר נְעוּרָֽיְכִי׃
Translated:
He satisfies you with good things in the prime of life,
so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
Transliteration: hamasheviya vatvov edeeikhe titechadesh khanesher neurayekhiy

Hebrew: עֹשֵׂ֣ה צְדָק֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה וּ֝מִשְׁפָּטִ֗ים לְכׇל־עֲשׁוּקִֽים׃
Translated:
The LORD executes righteous acts
and judgments for all who are wronged.
Transliteration: osheh tsedakvot yehovah umishefatiym lekhׇl-ashukiym

Hebrew: יוֹדִ֣יעַ דְּרָכָ֣יו לְמֹשֶׁ֑ה לִבְנֵ֥י יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל עֲלִילוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
He made known His ways to Moses,
His deeds to the children of Israel.
Transliteration: yvodiya derakhayv lemosheh liveney yisherael aliylvotayv

Hebrew: רַח֣וּם וְחַנּ֣וּן יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶ֖רֶךְ אַפַּ֣יִם וְרַב־חָֽסֶד׃
Translated:
The LORD is compassionate and gracious,
slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love.
Transliteration: rachum vechanun yehovah erekhe afayiim verav-chased

Hebrew: לֹא־לָנֶ֥צַח יָרִ֑יב וְלֹ֖א לְעוֹלָ֣ם יִטּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
He will not contend forever,
or nurse His anger for all time.
Transliteration: lo-lanetsach yariyv velo levolam yitvor

Hebrew: לֹ֣א כַ֭חֲטָאֵינוּ עָ֣שָׂה לָ֑נוּ וְלֹ֥א כַ֝עֲוֺנֹתֵ֗ינוּ גָּמַ֥ל עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
nor has He requited us according to our iniquities.
Transliteration: lo khachataeynu ashah lanu velo khaavonoteynu gamal aleynu

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כִגְבֹ֣הַּ שָׁ֭מַיִם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ גָּבַ֥ר חַ֝סְדּ֗וֹ עַל־יְרֵאָֽיו׃
Translated:
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
so great is His steadfast love toward those who fear Him.
Transliteration: khiy khigevoha shamayim al-haarets gavar chasedvo al-yereayv

Hebrew: כִּרְחֹ֣ק מִ֭זְרָח מִֽמַּעֲרָ֑ב הִֽרְחִ֥יק מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ אֶת־פְּשָׁעֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
As east is far from west,
so far has He removed our sins from us.
Transliteration: khirechok mizerach mimaarav hirechiyk mimenu et-feshaeynu

Hebrew: כְּרַחֵ֣ם אָ֭ב עַל־בָּנִ֑ים רִחַ֥ם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עַל־יְרֵאָֽיו׃
Translated:
As a father has compassion for his children,
so the LORD has compassion for those who fear Him.
Transliteration: kherachem av al-vaniym richam yehovah al-yereayv

Hebrew: כִּי־ה֭וּא יָדַ֣ע יִצְרֵ֑נוּ זָ֝כ֗וּר כִּי־עָפָ֥ר אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
Translated:
For He knows how we are formed;
He is mindful that we are dust.
Transliteration: khiy-hu yada yitserenu zakhur khiy-afar anachenu

Hebrew: אֱ֭נוֹשׁ כֶּחָצִ֣יר יָמָ֑יו כְּצִ֥יץ הַ֝שָּׂדֶ֗ה כֵּ֣ן יָצִֽיץ׃
Translated:
Man, his days are like those of grass;
he blooms like a flower of the field;
Transliteration: envosh khechatsiyr yamayv khetsiyts hashadeh khen yatsiyts

Hebrew: כִּ֤י ר֣וּחַ עָֽבְרָה־בּ֣וֹ וְאֵינֶ֑נּוּ וְלֹֽא־יַכִּירֶ֖נּוּ ע֣וֹד מְקוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
a wind passes by and it is no more,
its own place no longer knows it.
Transliteration: khiy rucha averah-vvo veeynenu velo-yakhiyrenu vod mekvomvo

Hebrew: וְחֶ֤סֶד יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ מֵעוֹלָ֣ם וְעַד־ע֭וֹלָם עַל־יְרֵאָ֑יו וְ֝צִדְקָת֗וֹ לִבְנֵ֥י בָנִֽים׃
Translated:
But the LORD’s steadfast love is for all eternity
toward those who fear Him,
and His beneficence is for the children’s children
Transliteration: vechesed yehovah mevolam vead-volam al-yereayv vetsidekatvo liveney vaniym

Hebrew: לְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י בְרִית֑וֹ וּלְזֹכְרֵ֥י פִ֝קֻּדָ֗יו לַעֲשׂוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
of those who keep His covenant
and remember to observe His precepts.
Transliteration: leshomerey veriytvo ulezokherey fikudayv laashvotam

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בַּ֭שָּׁמַיִם הֵכִ֣ין כִּסְא֑וֹ וּ֝מַלְכוּת֗וֹ בַּכֹּ֥ל מָשָֽׁלָה׃
Translated:
The LORD has established His throne in heaven,
and His sovereign rule is over all.
Transliteration: yehovah vashamayim hekhiyn khisevo umalekhutvo vakhol mashalah

Hebrew: בָּרְכ֥וּ יְהֹוָ֗ה מַלְאָ֫כָ֥יו גִּבֹּ֣רֵי כֹ֭חַ עֹשֵׂ֣י דְבָר֑וֹ לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗עַ בְּק֣וֹל דְּבָרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Bless the LORD, O His angels,
mighty creatures who do His bidding,
ever obedient to His bidding;
Transliteration: varekhu yehovah maleakhayv givorey khocha oshey devarvo lishemoa vekvol devarvo

Hebrew: בָּרְכ֣וּ יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־צְבָאָ֑יו מְ֝שָׁרְתָ֗יו עֹשֵׂ֥י רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
bless the LORD, all His hosts,
His servants who do His will;
Transliteration: varekhu yehovah khׇl-tsevaayv mesharetayv oshey retsvonvo

Hebrew: בָּרְכ֤וּ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ כׇּֽל־מַעֲשָׂ֗יו בְּכׇל־מְקֹמ֥וֹת מֶמְשַׁלְתּ֑וֹ בָּרְכִ֥י נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
bless the LORD, all His works,
through the length and breadth of His realm;
bless the LORD, O my soul.
Transliteration: varekhu yehovah khׇl-maashayv vekhׇl-mekomvot memeshaletvo varekhiy nafeshiy et-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: בָּרְכִ֥י נַפְשִׁ֗י אֶת־יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהַי גָּדַ֣לְתָּ מְּאֹ֑ד ה֖וֹד וְהָדָ֣ר לָבָֽשְׁתָּ׃
Translated:
Bless the LORD, O my soul;
O LORD, my God, You are very great;
You are clothed in glory and majesty,
Transliteration: varekhiy nafeshiy et-yehovah yehovah elohay gadaleta meod hvod vehadar lavasheta

Hebrew: עֹֽטֶה־א֭וֹר כַּשַּׂלְמָ֑ה נוֹטֶ֥ה שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם כַּיְרִיעָֽה׃
Translated:
wrapped in a robe of light;
You spread the heavens like a tent cloth.
Transliteration: oteh-vor khashalemah nvoteh shamayiim khayeriyah

Hebrew: הַ֥מְקָרֶ֥ה בַמַּ֗יִם עֲֽלִיּ֫וֹתָ֥יו הַשָּׂם־עָבִ֥ים רְכוּב֑וֹ הַֽ֝מְהַלֵּ֗ךְ עַל־כַּנְפֵי־רֽוּחַ׃
Translated:
He sets the rafters of His lofts in the waters,
makes the clouds His chariot,
moves on the wings of the wind.
Transliteration: hamekareh vamayiim aliyyvotayv hasham-aviym rekhuvvo hamehalekhe al-khanefey-rucha

Hebrew: עֹשֶׂ֣ה מַלְאָכָ֣יו רוּח֑וֹת מְ֝שָׁרְתָ֗יו אֵ֣שׁ לֹהֵֽט׃
Translated:
He makes the winds His messengers,
fiery flames His servants.
Transliteration: osheh maleakhayv ruchvot mesharetayv esh lohet

Hebrew: יָֽסַד־אֶ֭רֶץ עַל־מְכוֹנֶ֑יהָ בַּל־תִּ֝מּ֗וֹט עוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
Translated:
He established the earth on its foundations,
so that it shall never totter.
Transliteration: yasad-erets al-mekhvoneyha val-timvot volam vaed

Hebrew: תְּ֭הוֹם כַּלְּב֣וּשׁ כִּסִּית֑וֹ עַל־הָ֝רִ֗ים יַ֖עַמְדוּ־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
You made the deep cover it as a garment;
the waters stood above the mountains.
Transliteration: tehvom khalevush khisiytvo al-hariym yaamedu-mayiim

Hebrew: מִן־גַּעֲרָ֣תְךָ֣ יְנוּס֑וּן מִן־ק֥וֹל רַ֝עַמְךָ֗ יֵחָפֵזֽוּן׃
Translated:
They fled at Your blast,
rushed away at the sound of Your thunder,
Transliteration: min-gaaratekha yenusun min-kvol raamekha eichafezun

Hebrew: יַעֲל֣וּ הָ֭רִים יֵרְד֣וּ בְקָע֑וֹת אֶל־מְ֝ק֗וֹם זֶ֤ה ׀ יָסַ֬דְתָּ לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
—mountains rising, valleys sinking—
to the place You established for them.
Transliteration: yaalu hariym eiredu vekavot el-mekvom zeh yasadeta lahem

Hebrew: גְּֽבוּל־שַׂ֭מְתָּ בַּל־יַעֲבֹר֑וּן בַּל־יְ֝שֻׁב֗וּן לְכַסּ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
You set bounds they must not pass
so that they never again cover the earth.
Transliteration: gevul-shameta val-yaavorun val-yeshuvun lekhasvot haarets

Hebrew: הַֽמְשַׁלֵּ֣חַ מַ֭עְיָנִים בַּנְּחָלִ֑ים בֵּ֥ין הָ֝רִ֗ים יְהַלֵּכֽוּן׃
Translated:
You make springs gush forth in torrents;
they make their way between the hills,
Transliteration: hameshalecha maeyaniym vanechaliym veyn hariym yehalekhun

Hebrew: יַ֭שְׁקוּ כׇּל־חַיְת֣וֹ שָׂדָ֑י יִשְׁבְּר֖וּ פְרָאִ֣ים צְמָאָֽם׃
Translated:
giving drink to all the wild beasts;
the wild asses slake their thirst.
Transliteration: yasheku khׇl-chayetvo shaday yisheveru feraiym tsemaam

Hebrew: עֲ֭לֵיהֶם עוֹף־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם יִשְׁכּ֑וֹן מִבֵּ֥ין עֳ֝פָאיִ֗ם יִתְּנוּ־קֽוֹל׃
Translated:
The birds of the sky dwell beside them
and sing among the foliage.
Transliteration: aleyhem vof-hashamayiim yishekhvon miveyn ofayim yitenu-kvol

Hebrew: מַשְׁקֶ֣ה הָ֭רִים מֵעֲלִיּוֹתָ֑יו מִפְּרִ֥י מַ֝עֲשֶׂ֗יךָ תִּשְׂבַּ֥ע הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
You water the mountains from Your lofts;
the earth is sated from the fruit of Your work.
Transliteration: mashekeh hariym mealiyyvotayv miferiy maasheykha tisheva haarets

Hebrew: מַצְמִ֤יחַ חָצִ֨יר ׀ לַבְּהֵמָ֗ה וְ֭עֵשֶׂב לַעֲבֹדַ֣ת הָאָדָ֑ם לְה֥וֹצִיא לֶ֝֗חֶם מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
You make the grass grow for the cattle,
and herbage for man’s labor
that he may get food out of the earth—
Transliteration: matsemiycha chatsiyr lavehemah veeshev laavodat haadam lehvotsiy lechem min-haarets

Hebrew: וְיַ֤יִן ׀ יְשַׂמַּ֬ח לְֽבַב־אֱנ֗וֹשׁ לְהַצְהִ֣יל פָּנִ֣ים מִשָּׁ֑מֶן וְ֝לֶ֗חֶם לְֽבַב־אֱנ֥וֹשׁ יִסְעָֽד׃
Translated:
wine that cheers the hearts of men,
oil that makes the face shine,
and bread that sustains man’s life.
Transliteration: veyayiin yeshamach levav-envosh lehatsehiyl faniym mishamen velechem levav-envosh yisead

Hebrew: יִ֭שְׂבְּעוּ עֲצֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אַֽרְזֵ֥י לְ֝בָנ֗וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָטָֽע׃
Translated:
The trees of the LORD drink their fill,
the cedars of Lebanon, His own planting,
Transliteration: yisheveu atsey yehovah arezey levanvon asher nata

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֭ם צִפֳּרִ֣ים יְקַנֵּ֑נוּ חֲ֝סִידָ֗ה בְּרוֹשִׁ֥ים בֵּיתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
where birds make their nests;
the stork has her home in the junipers.
Transliteration: asher-sham tsiforiym yekanenu chasiydah vervoshiym veytah

Hebrew: הָרִ֣ים הַ֭גְּבֹהִים לַיְּעֵלִ֑ים סְ֝לָעִ֗ים מַחְסֶ֥ה לַֽשְׁפַנִּֽים׃
Translated:
The high mountains are for wild goats;
the crags are a refuge for rock-badgers.
Transliteration: hariym hagevohiym layeeliym selaiym macheseh lashefaniym

Hebrew: עָשָׂ֣ה יָ֭רֵחַ לְמוֹעֲדִ֑ים שֶׁ֝֗מֶשׁ יָדַ֥ע מְבוֹאֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He made the moon to mark the seasons;
the sun knows when to set.
Transliteration: ashah yarecha lemvoadiym shemesh yada mevvovo

Hebrew: תָּֽשֶׁת־חֹ֭שֶׁךְ וִ֣יהִי לָ֑יְלָה בּוֹ־תִ֝רְמֹ֗שׂ כׇּל־חַיְתוֹ־יָֽעַר׃
Translated:
You bring on darkness and it is night,
when all the beasts of the forests stir.
Transliteration: tashet-choshekhe viyhiy layelah vvo-tiremosh khׇl-chayetvo-yaar

Hebrew: הַ֭כְּפִירִים שֹׁאֲגִ֣ים לַטָּ֑רֶף וּלְבַקֵּ֖שׁ מֵאֵ֣ל אׇכְלָֽם׃
Translated:
The lions roar for prey,
seeking their food from God.
Transliteration: hakhefiyriym shoagiym lataref ulevakesh meel ׇkhelam

Hebrew: תִּזְרַ֣ח הַ֭שֶּׁמֶשׁ יֵאָסֵפ֑וּן וְאֶל־מְ֝עוֹנֹתָ֗ם יִרְבָּצֽוּן׃
Translated:
When the sun rises, they come home
and couch in their dens.
Transliteration: tizerach hashemesh eiasefun veel-mevonotam yirevatsun

Hebrew: יֵצֵ֣א אָדָ֣ם לְפׇעֳל֑וֹ וְֽלַעֲבֹ֖דָת֣וֹ עֲדֵי־עָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
Man then goes out to his work,
to his labor until the evening.
Transliteration: eitse adam lefׇolvo velaavodatvo adey-arev

Hebrew: מָה־רַבּ֬וּ מַעֲשֶׂ֨יךָ ׀ יְֽהֹוָ֗ה כֻּ֭לָּם בְּחׇכְמָ֣ה עָשִׂ֑יתָ מָלְאָ֥ה הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ קִנְיָנֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
How many are the things You have made, O LORD;
You have made them all with wisdom;
the earth is full of Your creations.
Transliteration: mah-ravu maasheykha yehovah khulam vechׇkhemah ashiyta maleah haarets kineyanekha

Hebrew: זֶ֤ה ׀ הַיָּ֥ם גָּדוֹל֮ וּרְחַ֢ב יָ֫דָ֥יִם שָֽׁם־רֶ֭מֶשׂ וְאֵ֣ין מִסְפָּ֑ר חַיּ֥וֹת קְ֝טַנּ֗וֹת עִם־גְּדֹלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
There is the sea, vast and wide,
with its creatures beyond number,
living things, small and great.
Transliteration: zeh hayam gadvol urecha֢v yadayiim sham-remesh veeyn misefar chayyvot ketanvot im-gedolvot

Hebrew: שָׁ֭ם אֳנִיּ֣וֹת יְהַלֵּכ֑וּן לִ֝וְיָתָ֗ן זֶֽה־יָצַ֥רְתָּ לְשַֽׂחֶק־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
There go the ships,
and Leviathan that You formed to sport with.
Transliteration: sham oniyyvot yehalekhun liveyatan zeh-yatsareta leshachek-vvo

Hebrew: כֻּ֭לָּם אֵלֶ֣יךָ יְשַׂבֵּר֑וּן לָתֵ֖ת אׇכְלָ֣ם בְּעִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
All of them look to You
to give them their food when it is due.
Transliteration: khulam eleykha yeshaverun latet ׇkhelam veitvo

Hebrew: תִּתֵּ֣ן לָ֭הֶם יִלְקֹט֑וּן תִּפְתַּ֥ח יָ֝דְךָ֗ יִשְׂבְּע֥וּן טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Give it to them, they gather it up;
open Your hand, they are well satisfied;
Transliteration: titen lahem yilekotun tifetach yadekha yisheveun tvov

Hebrew: תַּסְתִּ֥יר פָּנֶיךָ֮ יִֽבָּהֵ֫ל֥וּן תֹּסֵ֣ף ר֭וּחָם יִגְוָע֑וּן וְֽאֶל־עֲפָרָ֥ם יְשׁוּבֽוּן׃
Translated:
hide Your face, they are terrified;
take away their breath, they perish
and turn again into dust;
Transliteration: tasetiyr faneykha yivahelun tosef rucham yigevaun veel-afaram yeshuvun

Hebrew: תְּשַׁלַּ֣ח ר֭וּחֲךָ יִבָּרֵא֑וּן וּ֝תְחַדֵּ֗שׁ פְּנֵ֣י אֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated:
send back Your breath, they are created,
and You renew the face of the earth.
Transliteration: teshalach ruchakha yivareun utechadesh feney adamah

Hebrew: יְהִ֤י כְב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֣ה לְעוֹלָ֑ם יִשְׂמַ֖ח יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּמַעֲשָֽׂיו׃
Translated:
May the glory of the LORD endure forever;
may the LORD rejoice in His works!
Transliteration: yehiy khevvod yehovah levolam yishemach yehovah vemaashayv

Hebrew: הַמַּבִּ֣יט לָ֭אָרֶץ וַתִּרְעָ֑ד יִגַּ֖ע בֶּהָרִ֣ים וְֽיֶעֱשָֽׁנוּ׃
Translated:
He looks at the earth and it trembles;
He touches the mountains and they smoke.
Transliteration: hamaviyt laarets vatiread yiga vehariym veyeeshanu

Hebrew: אָשִׁ֣ירָה לַיהֹוָ֣ה בְּחַיָּ֑י אֲזַמְּרָ֖ה לֵאלֹהַ֣י בְּעוֹדִֽי׃
Translated:
I will sing to the LORD as long as I live;
all my life I will chant hymns to my God.
Transliteration: ashiyrah layhovah vechayay azamerah lelohay vevodiy

Hebrew: יֶעֱרַ֣ב עָלָ֣יו שִׂיחִ֑י אָ֝נֹכִ֗י אֶשְׂמַ֥ח בַּיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
May my prayer be pleasing to Him;
I will rejoice in the LORD.
Transliteration: yeerav alayv shiychiy anokhiy eshemach vayhovah

Hebrew: יִתַּ֤מּוּ חַטָּאִ֨ים ׀ מִן־הָאָ֡רֶץ וּרְשָׁעִ֤ים ׀ ע֤וֹד אֵינָ֗ם בָּרְכִ֣י נַ֭פְשִׁי אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
May sinners disappear from the earth,
and the wicked be no more.
Bless the LORD, O my soul.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: yitamu chataiym min-haarets ureshaiym vod eynam varekhiy nafeshiy et-yehovah halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: הוֹד֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה קִרְא֣וּ בִשְׁמ֑וֹ הוֹדִ֥יעוּ בָ֝עַמִּ֗ים עֲלִילוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Praise the LORD;
call on His name;
proclaim His deeds among the peoples.
Transliteration: hvodu layhovah kireu vishemvo hvodiyu vaamiym aliylvotayv

Hebrew: שִֽׁירוּ־ל֭וֹ זַמְּרוּ־ל֑וֹ שִׂ֝֗יחוּ בְּכׇל־נִפְלְאוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Sing praises to Him;
speak of all His wondrous acts.
Transliteration: shiyru-lvo zameru-lvo shiychu vekhׇl-nifelevotayv

Hebrew: הִֽ֭תְהַלְלוּ בְּשֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ יִ֝שְׂמַ֗ח לֵ֤ב ׀ מְבַקְשֵׁ֬י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Exult in His holy name;
let all who seek the LORD rejoice.
Transliteration: hitehalelu veshem kׇdeshvo yishemach lev mevakeshey yehovah

Hebrew: דִּרְשׁ֣וּ יְהֹוָ֣ה וְעֻזּ֑וֹ בַּקְּשׁ֖וּ פָנָ֣יו תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated:
Turn to the LORD, to His might;
seek His presence constantly.
Transliteration: direshu yehovah veuzvo vakeshu fanayv tamiyd

Hebrew: זִכְר֗וּ נִפְלְאוֹתָ֥יו אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֑ה מֹ֝פְתָ֗יו וּמִשְׁפְּטֵי־פִֽיו׃
Translated:
Remember the wonders He has done,
His portents and the judgments He has pronounced,
Transliteration: zikheru nifelevotayv asher-ashah mofetayv umishefetey-fiyv

Hebrew: זֶ֭רַע אַבְרָהָ֣ם עַבְדּ֑וֹ בְּנֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֣ב בְּחִירָֽיו׃
Translated:
O offspring of Abraham, His servant,
O descendants of Jacob, His chosen ones.
Transliteration: zera averaham avedvo veney yaakov vechiyrayv

Hebrew: ה֭וּא יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ בְּכׇל־הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ מִשְׁפָּטָֽיו׃
Translated:
He is the LORD our God;
His judgments are throughout the earth.
Transliteration: hu yehovah eloheynu vekhׇl-haarets mishefatayv

Hebrew: זָכַ֣ר לְעוֹלָ֣ם בְּרִית֑וֹ דָּבָ֥ר צִ֝וָּ֗ה לְאֶ֣לֶף דּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
He is ever mindful of His covenant,
the promise He gave for a thousand generations,
Transliteration: zakhar levolam veriytvo davar tsivah leelef dvor

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּ֭רַת אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וּשְׁב֖וּעָת֣וֹ לְיִשְׂחָֽק׃
Translated:
that He made with Abraham,
swore to Isaac,
Transliteration: asher kharat et-averaham ushevuatvo leyishechak

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמִידֶ֣הָ לְיַעֲקֹ֣ב לְחֹ֑ק לְ֝יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל בְּרִ֣ית עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
and confirmed in a decree for Jacob,
for Israel, as an eternal covenant,
Transliteration: vayaamiydeha leyaakov lechok leyiisherael veriyt volam

Hebrew: לֵאמֹ֗ר לְךָ֗ אֶתֵּ֥ן אֶת־אֶֽרֶץ־כְּנָ֑עַן חֶ֝֗בֶל נַחֲלַתְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
as your allotted heritage.”
Transliteration: lemor lekha eten et-erets-khenaan chevel nachalatekhem

Hebrew: בִּֽ֭הְיוֹתָם מְתֵ֣י מִסְפָּ֑ר כִּ֝מְעַ֗ט וְגָרִ֥ים בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
They were then few in number,
a mere handful, sojourning there,
Transliteration: viheyvotam metey misefar khimeat vegariym vah

Hebrew: וַ֭יִּֽתְהַלְּכוּ מִגּ֣וֹי אֶל־גּ֑וֹי מִ֝מַּמְלָכָ֗ה אֶל־עַ֥ם אַחֵֽר׃
Translated:
wandering from nation to nation,
from one kingdom to another.
Transliteration: vayitehalekhu migvoy el-gvoy mimamelakhah el-am acher

Hebrew: לֹא־הִנִּ֣יחַ אָדָ֣ם לְעׇשְׁקָ֑ם וַיּ֖וֹכַח עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם מְלָכִֽים׃
Translated:
He allowed no one to oppress them;
He reproved kings on their account,
Transliteration: lo-hiniycha adam leׇshekam vayyvokhach aleyhem melakhiym

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּגְּע֥וּ בִמְשִׁיחָ֑י וְ֝לִנְבִיאַ֗י אַל־תָּרֵֽעוּ׃
Translated:
“Do not touch My anointed ones;
do not harm My prophets.”
Transliteration: al-tigeu vimeshiychay velineviyay al-tareu

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א רָ֭עָב עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ כׇּֽל־מַטֵּה־לֶ֥חֶם שָׁבָֽר׃
Translated:
He called down a famine on the land,
destroyed every staff of bread.
Transliteration: vayikera raav al-haarets khׇl-mateh-lechem shavar

Hebrew: שָׁלַ֣ח לִפְנֵיהֶ֣ם אִ֑ישׁ לְ֝עֶ֗בֶד נִמְכַּ֥ר יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translated:
He sent ahead of them a man,
Joseph, sold into slavery.
Transliteration: shalach lifeneyhem iysh leeved nimekhar yvosef

Hebrew: עִנּ֣וּ בַכֶּ֣בֶל (רגליו) [רַגְל֑וֹ] בַּ֝רְזֶ֗ל בָּ֣אָה נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
His feet were subjected to fetters;
an iron collar was put on his neck.
Transliteration: inu vakhevel (rglyv) [ragelvo] varezel vaah nafeshvo

Hebrew: עַד־עֵ֥ת בֹּא־דְבָר֑וֹ אִמְרַ֖ת יְהֹוָ֣ה צְרָפָֽתְהוּ׃
Translated:
Until his prediction came true
the decree of the LORD purged him.
Transliteration: ad-et vo-devarvo imerat yehovah tserafatehu

Hebrew: שָׁ֣לַח מֶ֭לֶךְ וַיַּתִּירֵ֑הוּ מֹשֵׁ֥ל עַ֝מִּ֗ים וַֽיְפַתְּחֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
The king sent to have him freed;
the ruler of nations released him.
Transliteration: shalach melekhe vayatiyrehu moshel amiym vayefatechehu

Hebrew: שָׂמ֣וֹ אָד֣וֹן לְבֵית֑וֹ וּ֝מֹשֵׁ֗ל בְּכׇל־קִנְיָנֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He made him the lord of his household,
empowered him over all his possessions,
Transliteration: shamvo advon leveytvo umoshel vekhׇl-kineyanvo

Hebrew: לֶאְסֹ֣ר שָׂרָ֣יו בְּנַפְשׁ֑וֹ וּזְקֵנָ֥יו יְחַכֵּֽם׃
Translated:
to discipline his princes at will,
to teach his elders wisdom.
Transliteration: leesor sharayv venafeshvo uzekenayv yechakhem

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל מִצְרָ֑יִם וְ֝יַעֲקֹ֗ב גָּ֣ר בְּאֶֽרֶץ־חָֽם׃
Translated:
Then Israel came to Egypt;
Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
Transliteration: vayavo yisherael mitserayiim veyaakov gar veerets-cham

Hebrew: וַיֶּ֣פֶר אֶת־עַמּ֣וֹ מְאֹ֑ד וַ֝יַּעֲצִמֵ֗הוּ מִצָּרָֽיו׃
Translated:
He made His people very fruitful,
more numerous than their foes.
Transliteration: vayefer et-amvo meod vayaatsimehu mitsarayv

Hebrew: הָפַ֣ךְ לִ֭בָּם לִשְׂנֹ֣א עַמּ֑וֹ לְ֝הִתְנַכֵּ֗ל בַּעֲבָדָֽיו׃
Translated:
He changed their heart to hate His people,
to plot against His servants.
Transliteration: hafakhe livam lisheno amvo lehitenakhel vaavadayv

Hebrew: שָׁ֭לַח מֹשֶׁ֣ה עַבְדּ֑וֹ אַ֝הֲרֹ֗ן אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַר־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He sent His servant Moses,
and Aaron, whom He had chosen.
Transliteration: shalach mosheh avedvo aharon asher vachar-vvo

Hebrew: שָֽׂמוּ־בָ֭ם דִּבְרֵ֣י אֹתוֹתָ֑יו וּ֝מֹפְתִ֗ים בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חָֽם׃
Translated:
They performed His signs among them,
His wonders, against the land of Ham.
Transliteration: shamu-vam diverey otvotayv umofetiym veerets cham

Hebrew: שָׁ֣לַֽח חֹ֭שֶׁךְ וַיַּחְשִׁ֑ךְ וְלֹא־מָ֝ר֗וּ אֶת־[דְּבָרֽוֹ] (דבריו)׃
Translated:
He sent darkness; it was very dark;
did they not defy His word?
Transliteration: shalach choshekhe vayacheshikhe velo-maru et-[devarvo] (dvryv)

Hebrew: הָפַ֣ךְ אֶת־מֵימֵיהֶ֣ם לְדָ֑ם וַ֝יָּ֗מֶת אֶת־דְּגָתָֽם׃
Translated:
He turned their waters into blood
and killed their fish.
Transliteration: hafakhe et-meymeyhem ledam vayamet et-degatam

Hebrew: שָׁרַ֣ץ אַרְצָ֣ם צְפַרְדְּעִ֑ים בְּ֝חַדְרֵ֗י מַלְכֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Their land teemed with frogs,
even the rooms of their king.
Transliteration: sharats aretsam tsefaredeiym vechaderey malekheyhem

Hebrew: אָ֭מַר וַיָּבֹ֣א עָרֹ֑ב כִּ֝נִּ֗ים בְּכׇל־גְּבוּלָֽם׃
Translated:
Swarms of insects came at His command,
lice, throughout their country.
Transliteration: amar vayavo arov khiniym vekhׇl-gevulam

Hebrew: נָתַ֣ן גִּשְׁמֵיהֶ֣ם בָּרָ֑ד אֵ֖שׁ לֶהָב֣וֹת בְּאַרְצָֽם׃
Translated:
He gave them hail for rain,
and flaming fire in their land.
Transliteration: natan gishemeyhem varad esh lehavvot vearetsam

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ גַּ֭פְנָם וּתְאֵנָתָ֑ם וַ֝יְשַׁבֵּ֗ר עֵ֣ץ גְּבוּלָֽם׃
Translated:
He struck their vines and fig trees,
broke down the trees of their country.
Transliteration: vayakhe gafenam uteenatam vayeshaver ets gevulam

Hebrew: אָ֭מַר וַיָּבֹ֣א אַרְבֶּ֑ה וְ֝יֶ֗לֶק וְאֵ֣ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
Translated:
Locusts came at His command,
grasshoppers without number.
Transliteration: amar vayavo areveh veyelek veeyn misefar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אכַל כׇּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב בְּאַרְצָ֑ם וַ֝יֹּ֗אכַל פְּרִ֣י אַדְמָתָֽם׃
Translated:
They devoured every green thing in the land;
they consumed the produce of the soil.
Transliteration: vayokhal khׇl-eshev vearetsam vayokhal feriy adematam

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ כׇּל־בְּכ֣וֹר בְּאַרְצָ֑ם רֵ֝אשִׁ֗ית לְכׇל־אוֹנָֽם׃
Translated:
He struck down every first-born in the land,
the first fruit of their vigor.
Transliteration: vayakhe khׇl-vekhvor vearetsam reshiyt lekhׇl-vonam

Hebrew: וַֽ֭יּוֹצִיאֵם בְּכֶ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֑ב וְאֵ֖ין בִּשְׁבָטָ֣יו כּוֹשֵֽׁל׃
Translated:
He led Israel out with silver and gold;
none among their tribes faltered.
Transliteration: vayyyyvotsiyem vekhesef vezahav veeyn vishevatayv khvoshel

Hebrew: שָׂמַ֣ח מִצְרַ֣יִם בְּצֵאתָ֑ם כִּֽי־נָפַ֖ל פַּחְדָּ֣ם עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Egypt rejoiced when they left,
for dread of Israel had fallen upon them.
Transliteration: shamach mitserayiim vetsetam khiy-nafal fachedam aleyhem

Hebrew: פָּרַ֣שׂ עָנָ֣ן לְמָסָ֑ךְ וְ֝אֵ֗שׁ לְהָאִ֥יר לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated:
He spread a cloud for a cover,
and fire to light up the night.
Transliteration: farash anan lemasakhe veesh lehaiyr layelah

Hebrew: שָׁ֭אַל וַיָּבֵ֣א שְׂלָ֑ו וְלֶ֥חֶם שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם יַשְׂבִּיעֵֽם׃
Translated:
They asked and He brought them quail,
and satisfied them with food from heaven.
Transliteration: shaal vayave shelav velechem shamayiim yasheviyem

Hebrew: פָּ֣תַח צ֭וּר וַיָּז֣וּבוּ מָ֑יִם הָ֝לְכ֗וּ בַּצִּיּ֥וֹת נָהָֽר׃
Translated:
He opened a rock so that water gushed forth;
it flowed as a stream in the parched land.
Transliteration: fatach tsur vayazuvu mayiim halekhu vatsiyyvot nahar

Hebrew: כִּֽי־זָ֭כַר אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ אֶֽת־אַבְרָהָ֥ם עַבְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Mindful of His sacred promise
to His servant Abraham,
Transliteration: khiy-zakhar et-devar kׇdeshvo et-averaham avedvo

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצִ֣א עַמּ֣וֹ בְשָׂשׂ֑וֹן בְּ֝רִנָּ֗ה אֶת־בְּחִירָֽיו׃
Translated:
He led His people out in gladness,
His chosen ones with joyous song.
Transliteration: vayyvotsi amvo veshashvon verinah et-vechiyrayv

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לָ֭הֶם אַרְצ֣וֹת גּוֹיִ֑ם וַעֲמַ֖ל לְאֻמִּ֣ים יִירָֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
He gave them the lands of nations;
they inherited the wealth of peoples,
Transliteration: vayiten lahem aretsvot gvoyim vaamal leumiym yiyrashu

Hebrew: בַּעֲב֤וּר ׀ יִשְׁמְר֣וּ חֻ֭קָּיו וְתוֹרֹתָ֥יו יִנְצֹ֗רוּ הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
that they might keep His laws
and observe His teachings.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: vaavur yishemeru chukayv vetvorotayv yinetsoru halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Hallelujah.
Praise the LORD for He is good;
His steadfast love is eternal.
Transliteration: halelu-yah hvodu layhovah khiy-tvov khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: מִ֗י יְ֭מַלֵּל גְּבוּר֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה יַ֝שְׁמִ֗יעַ כׇּל־תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who can tell the mighty acts of the LORD,
proclaim all His praises?
Transliteration: miy yemalel gevurvot yehovah yashemiya khׇl-tehilatvo

Hebrew: אַ֭שְׁרֵי שֹׁמְרֵ֣י מִשְׁפָּ֑ט עֹשֵׂ֖ה צְדָקָ֣ה בְכׇל־עֵֽת׃
Translated:
Happy are those who act justly,
who do right at all times.
Transliteration: asherey shomerey mishefat osheh tsedakah vekhׇl-et

Hebrew: זׇכְרֵ֣נִי יְ֭הֹוָה בִּרְצ֣וֹן עַמֶּ֑ךָ פׇּ֝קְדֵ֗נִי בִּישׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Be mindful of me, O LORD, when You favor Your people;
take note of me when You deliver them,
Transliteration: zׇkhereniy yehovah viretsvon amekha fׇkedeniy viyshuatekha

Hebrew: לִרְא֤וֹת ׀ בְּט֘וֹבַ֤ת בְּחִירֶ֗יךָ לִ֭שְׂמֹחַ בְּשִׂמְחַ֣ת גּוֹיֶ֑ךָ לְ֝הִתְהַלֵּ֗ל עִם־נַחֲלָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
that I may enjoy the prosperity of Your chosen ones,
share the joy of Your nation,
glory in Your very own people.
Transliteration: lirevot vetvovat vechiyreykha lishemocha veshimechat gvoyekha lehitehalel im-nachalatekha

Hebrew: חָטָ֥אנוּ עִם־אֲבוֹתֵ֗ינוּ הֶעֱוִ֥ינוּ הִרְשָֽׁעְנוּ׃
Translated:
We have sinned like our forefathers;
we have gone astray, done evil.
Transliteration: chatanu im-avvoteynu heeviynu hireshaenu

Hebrew: אֲב֘וֹתֵ֤ינוּ בְמִצְרַ֨יִם ׀ לֹא־הִשְׂכִּ֬ילוּ נִפְלְאוֹתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א זָ֭כְרוּ אֶת־רֹ֣ב חֲסָדֶ֑יךָ וַיַּמְר֖וּ עַל־יָ֣ם בְּיַם־סֽוּף׃
Translated:
Our forefathers in Egypt did not perceive Your wonders;
they did not remember Your abundant love,
but rebelled at the sea, at the Sea of Reeds.
Transliteration: avvoteynu vemitserayiim lo-hishekhiylu nifelevoteykha lo zakheru et-rov chasadeykha vayameru al-yam veyam-suf

Hebrew: וַֽ֭יּוֹשִׁיעֵם לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמ֑וֹ לְ֝הוֹדִ֗יעַ אֶת־גְּבוּרָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Yet He saved them, as befits His name,
to make known His might.
Transliteration: vayyyyvoshiyem lemaan shemvo lehvodiya et-gevuratvo

Hebrew: וַיִּגְעַ֣ר בְּיַם־ס֭וּף וַֽיֶּחֱרָ֑ב וַיּוֹלִיכֵ֥ם בַּ֝תְּהֹמ֗וֹת כַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated:
He sent His blast against the Sea of Reeds;
it became dry;
He led them through the deep as through a wilderness.
Transliteration: vayigear veyam-suf vayecherav vayyvoliykhem vatehomvot khamidevar

Hebrew: וַֽ֭יּוֹשִׁיעֵם מִיַּ֣ד שׂוֹנֵ֑א וַ֝יִּגְאָלֵ֗ם מִיַּ֥ד אוֹיֵֽב׃
Translated:
He delivered them from the foe,
redeemed them from the enemy.
Transliteration: vayyyyvoshiyem miyad shvone vayigealem miyad voeiv

Hebrew: וַיְכַסּוּ־מַ֥יִם צָרֵיהֶ֑ם אֶחָ֥ד מֵ֝הֶ֗ם לֹ֣א נוֹתָֽר׃
Translated:
Water covered their adversaries;
not one of them was left.
Transliteration: vayekhasu-mayiim tsareyhem echad mehem lo nvotar

Hebrew: וַיַּאֲמִ֥ינוּ בִדְבָרָ֑יו יָ֝שִׁ֗ירוּ תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Then they believed His promise,
and sang His praises.
Transliteration: vayaamiynu videvarayv yashiyru tehilatvo

Hebrew: מִ֭הֲרוּ שָׁכְח֣וּ מַעֲשָׂ֑יו לֹא־חִ֝כּ֗וּ לַעֲצָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
But they soon forgot His deeds;
they would not wait to learn His plan.
Transliteration: miharu shakhechu maashayv lo-chikhu laatsatvo

Hebrew: וַיִּתְאַוּ֣וּ תַ֭אֲוָה בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַיְנַסּוּ־אֵ֝֗ל בִּישִׁימֽוֹן׃
Translated:
They were seized with craving in the wilderness,
and put God to the test in the wasteland.
Transliteration: vayiteauu taavah vamidevar vayenasu-el viyshiymvon

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לָ֭הֶם שֶׁאֱלָתָ֑ם וַיְשַׁלַּ֖ח רָז֣וֹן בְּנַפְשָֽׁם׃
Translated:
He gave them what they asked for,
then made them waste away.
Transliteration: vayiten lahem sheelatam vayeshalach razvon venafesham

Hebrew: וַיְקַנְא֣וּ לְ֭מֹשֶׁה בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה לְ֝אַהֲרֹ֗ן קְד֣וֹשׁ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
There was envy of Moses in the camp,
and of Aaron, the holy one of the LORD.
Transliteration: vayekaneu lemosheh vamachaneh leaharon kedvosh yehovah

Hebrew: תִּפְתַּח־אֶ֭רֶץ וַתִּבְלַ֣ע דָּתָ֑ן וַ֝תְּכַ֗ס עַל־עֲדַ֥ת אֲבִירָֽם׃
Translated:
The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan,
closed over the party of Abiram.
Transliteration: tifetach-erets vativela datan vatekhas al-adat aviyram

Hebrew: וַתִּבְעַר־אֵ֥שׁ בַּעֲדָתָ֑ם לֶ֝הָבָ֗ה תְּלַהֵ֥ט רְשָׁעִֽים׃
Translated:
A fire blazed among their party,
a flame that consumed the wicked.
Transliteration: vativear-esh vaadatam lehavah telahet reshaiym

Hebrew: יַעֲשׂוּ־עֵ֥גֶל בְּחֹרֵ֑ב וַ֝יִּשְׁתַּחֲו֗וּ לְמַסֵּכָֽה׃
Translated:
They made a calf at Horeb
and bowed down to a molten image.
Transliteration: yaashu-egel vechorev vayishetachavu lemasekhah

Hebrew: וַיָּמִ֥ירוּ אֶת־כְּבוֹדָ֑ם בְּתַבְנִ֥ית שׁ֝֗וֹר אֹכֵ֥ל עֵֽשֶׂב׃
Translated:
They exchanged their glory
for the image of a bull that feeds on grass.
Transliteration: vayamiyru et-khevvodam vetaveniyt shvor okhel eshev

Hebrew: שָׁ֭כְחוּ אֵ֣ל מוֹשִׁיעָ֑ם עֹשֶׂ֖ה גְדֹל֣וֹת בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
They forgot God who saved them,
who performed great deeds in Egypt,
Transliteration: shakhechu el mvoshiyam osheh gedolvot vemitserayiim

Hebrew: נִ֭פְלָאוֹת בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חָ֑ם נ֝וֹרָא֗וֹת עַל־יַם־סֽוּף׃
Translated:
wondrous deeds in the land of Ham,
awesome deeds at the Sea of Reeds.
Transliteration: nifelavot veerets cham nvoravot al-yam-suf

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לְֽהַשְׁמִ֫ידָ֥ם לוּלֵ֡י מֹ֘שֶׁ֤ה בְחִיר֗וֹ עָמַ֣ד בַּפֶּ֣רֶץ לְפָנָ֑יו לְהָשִׁ֥יב חֲ֝מָת֗וֹ מֵהַשְׁחִֽית׃
Translated:
He would have destroyed them
had not Moses His chosen one
confronted Him in the breach
to avert His destructive wrath.
Transliteration: vayomer lehashemiydam luley mosheh vechiyrvo amad vaferets lefanayv lehashiyv chamatvo mehashechiyt

Hebrew: וַֽ֭יִּמְאֲסוּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חֶמְדָּ֑ה לֹא־הֶ֝אֱמִ֗ינוּ לִדְבָרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
They rejected the desirable land,
and put no faith in His promise.
Transliteration: vayimeasu veerets chemedah lo-heemiynu lidevarvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָגְנ֥וּ בְאׇהֳלֵיהֶ֑ם לֹ֥א שָׁ֝מְע֗וּ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
They grumbled in their tents
and disobeyed the LORD.
Transliteration: vayeragenu veׇholeyhem lo shameu vekvol yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֣א יָד֣וֹ לָהֶ֑ם לְהַפִּ֥יל א֝וֹתָ֗ם בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated:
So He raised His hand in oath
to make them fall in the wilderness,
Transliteration: vayisha yadvo lahem lehafiyl votam vamidevar

Hebrew: וּלְהַפִּ֣יל זַ֭רְעָם בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם וּ֝לְזָרוֹתָ֗ם בָּאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
Translated:
to disperse their offspring among the nations
and scatter them through the lands.
Transliteration: ulehafiyl zaream vagvoyim ulezarvotam vaaratsvot

Hebrew: וַ֭יִּצָּ֣מְדוּ לְבַ֣עַל פְּע֑וֹר וַ֝יֹּאכְל֗וּ זִבְחֵ֥י מֵתִֽים׃
Translated:
They attached themselves to Baal Peor,
ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
Transliteration: vayitsamedu levaal fevor vayokhelu zivechey metiym

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּכְעִיסוּ בְּמַ֥עַלְלֵיהֶ֑ם וַתִּפְרׇץ־בָּ֝֗ם מַגֵּפָֽה׃
Translated:
They provoked anger by their deeds,
and a plague broke out among them.
Transliteration: vayakheiysu vemaaleleyhem vatiferׇts-vam magefah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד פִּֽ֭ינְחָס וַיְפַלֵּ֑ל וַ֝תֵּעָצַ֗ר הַמַּגֵּפָֽה׃
Translated:
Phinehas stepped forth and intervened,
and the plague ceased.
Transliteration: vayaamod fiynechas vayefalel vateatsar hamagefah

Hebrew: וַתֵּחָ֣שֶׁב ל֭וֹ לִצְדָקָ֑ה לְדֹ֥ר וָ֝דֹ֗ר עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
It was reckoned to his merit
for all generations, to eternity.
Transliteration: vatechashev lvo litsedakah ledor vador ad-volam

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּקְצִיפוּ עַל־מֵ֥י מְרִיבָ֑ה וַיֵּ֥רַע לְ֝מֹשֶׁ֗ה בַּעֲבוּרָֽם׃
Translated:
They provoked wrath at the waters of Meribah
and Moses suffered on their account,
Transliteration: vayaketsiyfu al-mey meriyvah vayera lemosheh vaavuram

Hebrew: כִּי־הִמְר֥וּ אֶת־רוּח֑וֹ וַ֝יְבַטֵּ֗א בִּשְׂפָתָֽיו׃
Translated:
because they rebelled against Him
and he spoke rashly.
Transliteration: khiy-himeru et-ruchvo vayevate vishefatayv

Hebrew: לֹֽא־הִ֭שְׁמִידוּ אֶת־הָעַמִּ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָמַ֖ר יְהֹוָ֣ה לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
They did not destroy the nations
as the LORD had commanded them,
Transliteration: lo-hishemiydu et-haamiym asher amar yehovah lahem

Hebrew: וַיִּתְעָרְב֥וּ בַגּוֹיִ֑ם וַֽ֝יִּלְמְד֗וּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
but mingled with the nations
and learned their ways.
Transliteration: vayitearevu vagvoyim vayilemedu maasheyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּעַבְד֥וּ אֶת־עֲצַבֵּיהֶ֑ם וַיִּהְי֖וּ לָהֶ֣ם לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
They worshiped their idols,
which became a snare for them.
Transliteration: vayaavedu et-atsaveyhem vayiheyu lahem lemvokesh

Hebrew: וַיִּזְבְּח֣וּ אֶת־בְּ֭נֵיהֶם וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם לַשֵּׁדִֽים׃
Translated:
Their own sons and daughters
they sacrificed to demons.
Transliteration: vayizevechu et-veneyhem veet-venvoteyhem lashediym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥שְׁפְּכ֨וּ דָ֪ם נָקִ֡י דַּם־בְּנֵ֘יהֶ֤ם וּֽבְנוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר זִ֭בְּחוּ לַעֲצַבֵּ֣י כְנָ֑עַן וַתֶּחֱנַ֥ף הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ בַּדָּמִֽים׃
Translated:
They shed innocent blood,
the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan;
so the land was polluted with bloodguilt.
Transliteration: vayishefekhu dam nakiy dam-veneyhem uvenvoteyhem asher zivechu laatsavey khenaan vatechenaf haarets vadamiym

Hebrew: וַיִּטְמְא֥וּ בְמַעֲשֵׂיהֶ֑ם וַ֝יִּזְנ֗וּ בְּמַ֥עַלְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Thus they became defiled by their acts,
debauched through their deeds.
Transliteration: vayitemeu vemaasheyhem vayizenu vemaaleleyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּחַר־אַ֣ף יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּעַמּ֑וֹ וַ֝יְתָעֵ֗ב אֶת־נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The LORD was angry with His people
and He abhorred His inheritance.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah veamvo vayetaev et-nachalatvo

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנֵ֥ם בְּיַד־גּוֹיִ֑ם וַֽיִּמְשְׁל֥וּ בָ֝הֶ֗ם שֹׂנְאֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
He handed them over to the nations;
their foes ruled them.
Transliteration: vayitenem veyad-gvoyim vayimeshelu vahem shoneeyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּלְחָצ֥וּם אוֹיְבֵיהֶ֑ם וַ֝יִּכָּנְע֗וּ תַּ֣חַת יָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Their enemies oppressed them
and they were subject to their power.
Transliteration: vayilechatsum voyeveyhem vayikhaneu tachat yadam

Hebrew: פְּעָמִ֥ים רַבּ֗וֹת יַצִּ֫ילֵ֥ם וְ֭הֵמָּה יַמְר֣וּ בַעֲצָתָ֑ם וַ֝יָּמֹ֗כּוּ בַּעֲוֺנָֽם׃
Translated:
He saved them time and again,
but they were deliberately rebellious,
and so they were brought low by their iniquity.
Transliteration: feamiym ravvot yatsiylem vehemah yameru vaatsatam vayamokhu vaavonam

Hebrew: וַ֭יַּרְא בַּצַּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם בְּ֝שׇׁמְע֗וֹ אֶת־רִנָּתָֽם׃
Translated:
When He saw that they were in distress,
when He heard their cry,
Transliteration: vayare vatsar lahem veshׇmevo et-rinatam

Hebrew: וַיִּזְכֹּ֣ר לָהֶ֣ם בְּרִית֑וֹ וַ֝יִּנָּחֵ֗ם כְּרֹ֣ב חֲסָדָֽו׃
Translated:
He was mindful of His covenant
and in His great faithfulness relented.
Transliteration: vayizekhor lahem veriytvo vayinachem kherov chasadav

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אוֹתָ֣ם לְרַחֲמִ֑ים לִ֝פְנֵ֗י כׇּל־שׁוֹבֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: He made all their captors kindly disposed toward them.
Transliteration: vayiten votam lerachamiym lifeney khׇl-shvoveyhem

Hebrew: הֽוֹשִׁיעֵ֨נוּ ׀ יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וְקַבְּצֵנוּ֮ מִֽן־הַגּ֫וֹיִ֥ם לְ֭הֹדוֹת לְשֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשֶׁ֑ךָ לְ֝הִשְׁתַּבֵּ֗חַ בִּתְהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Deliver us, O LORD our God,
and gather us from among the nations,
to acclaim Your holy name,
to glory in Your praise.
Transliteration: hvoshiyenu yehovah eloheynu vekavetsenu min-hagvoyim lehodvot leshem kׇdeshekha lehishetavecha vitehilatekha

Hebrew: בָּ֤רֽוּךְ־יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵ֪י יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל מִן־הָ֤עוֹלָ֨ם ׀ וְעַ֬ד הָעוֹלָ֗ם וְאָמַ֖ר כׇּל־הָעָ֥ם אָמֵ֗ן הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Blessed is the LORD, God of Israel,
From eternity to eternity.
Let all the people say, “Amen.”
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: varukhe-yehovah elohey yisherael min-havolam vead havolam veamar khׇl-haam amen halelu-yah

Hebrew: הֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
“Praise the LORD, for He is good;
His steadfast love is eternal!”
Transliteration: hodu layhovah khiy-tvov khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: יֹ֭אמְרוּ גְּאוּלֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר גְּ֝אָלָ֗ם מִיַּד־צָֽר׃
Translated:
Thus let the redeemed of the LORD say,
those He redeemed from adversity,
Transliteration: yomeru geuley yehovah asher gealam miyad-tsar

Hebrew: וּֽמֵאֲרָצ֗וֹת קִ֫בְּצָ֥ם מִמִּזְרָ֥ח וּמִֽמַּעֲרָ֑ב מִצָּפ֥וֹן וּמִיָּֽם׃
Translated:
whom He gathered in from the lands,
from east and west,
from the north and from the sea.
Transliteration: umearatsvot kivetsam mimizerach umimaarav mitsafvon umiyam

Hebrew: תָּע֣וּ בַ֭מִּדְבָּר בִּישִׁימ֣וֹן דָּ֑רֶךְ עִ֥יר מ֝וֹשָׁ֗ב לֹ֣א מָצָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
Some lost their way in the wilderness,
in the wasteland;
they found no settled place.
Transliteration: tau vamidevar viyshiymvon darekhe iyr mvoshav lo matsau

Hebrew: רְעֵבִ֥ים גַּם־צְמֵאִ֑ים נַ֝פְשָׁ֗ם בָּהֶ֥ם תִּתְעַטָּֽף׃
Translated:
Hungry and thirsty,
their spirit failed.
Transliteration: reeviym gam-tsemeiym nafesham vahem titeataf

Hebrew: וַיִּצְעֲק֣וּ אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בַּצַּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם מִ֝מְּצ֥וּקוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם יַצִּילֵֽם׃
Translated:
In their adversity they cried to the LORD,
and He rescued them from their troubles.
Transliteration: vayitseaku el-yehovah vatsar lahem mimetsukvoteyhem yatsiylem

Hebrew: וַֽ֭יַּדְרִיכֵם בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ יְשָׁרָ֑ה לָ֝לֶ֗כֶת אֶל־עִ֥יר מוֹשָֽׁב׃
Translated:
He showed them a direct way
to reach a settled place.
Transliteration: vayaderiykhem vederekhe yesharah lalekhet el-iyr mvoshav

Hebrew: יוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love,
His wondrous deeds for mankind;
Transliteration: yvodu layhovah chasedvo venifelevotayv liveney adam

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִ֭שְׂבִּיעַ נֶ֣פֶשׁ שֹׁקֵקָ֑ה וְנֶ֥פֶשׁ רְ֝עֵבָ֗ה מִלֵּא־טֽוֹב׃
Translated:
for He has satisfied the thirsty,
filled the hungry with all good things.
Transliteration: khiy-hisheviya nefesh shokekah venefesh reevah mile-tvov

Hebrew: יֹ֭שְׁבֵי חֹ֣שֶׁךְ וְצַלְמָ֑וֶת אֲסִירֵ֖י עֳנִ֣י וּבַרְזֶֽל׃
Translated:
Some lived in deepest darkness,
bound in cruel irons,
Transliteration: yoshevey choshekhe vetsalemavet asiyrey oniy uvarezel

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִמְר֥וּ אִמְרֵי־אֵ֑ל וַעֲצַ֖ת עֶלְי֣וֹן נָאָֽצוּ׃
Translated:
because they defied the word of God,
spurned the counsel of the Most High.
Transliteration: khiy-himeru imerey-el vaatsat eleyvon naatsu

Hebrew: וַיַּכְנַ֣ע בֶּעָמָ֣ל לִבָּ֑ם כָּ֝שְׁל֗וּ וְאֵ֣ין עֹזֵֽר׃
Translated:
He humbled their hearts through suffering;
they stumbled with no one to help.
Transliteration: vayakhena veamal livam khashelu veeyn ozer

Hebrew: וַיִּזְעֲק֣וּ אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בַּצַּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם מִ֝מְּצֻ֥קוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם יוֹשִׁיעֵֽם׃
Translated:
In their adversity they cried to the LORD,
and He rescued them from their troubles.
Transliteration: vayizeaku el-yehovah vatsar lahem mimetsukvoteyhem yvoshiyem

Hebrew: י֭וֹצִיאֵם מֵחֹ֣שֶׁךְ וְצַלְמָ֑וֶת וּמוֹסְר֖וֹתֵיהֶ֣ם יְנַתֵּֽק׃
Translated:
He brought them out of deepest darkness,
broke their bonds asunder.
Transliteration: yvotsiyem mechoshekhe vetsalemavet umvoservoteyhem yenatek

Hebrew: יוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love,
His wondrous deeds for mankind;
Transliteration: yvodu layhovah chasedvo venifelevotayv liveney adam

Hebrew: כִּי־שִׁ֭בַּר דַּלְת֣וֹת נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וּבְרִיחֵ֖י בַרְזֶ֣ל גִּדֵּֽעַ׃
Translated:
for He shattered gates of bronze,
He broke their iron bars.
Transliteration: khiy-shivar daletvot nechoshet uveriychey varezel gidea

Hebrew: אֱ֭וִלִים מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ פִּשְׁעָ֑ם וּֽ֝מֵעֲוֺ֥נֹתֵיהֶ֗ם יִתְעַנּֽוּ׃
Translated:
There were fools who suffered for their sinful way,
and for their iniquities.
Transliteration: eviliym miderekhe fisheam umeavonoteyhem yiteanu

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֹ֭כֶל תְּתַעֵ֣ב נַפְשָׁ֑ם וַ֝יַּגִּ֗יעוּ עַד־שַׁ֥עֲרֵי מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
All food was loathsome to them;
they reached the gates of death.
Transliteration: khׇl-okhel tetaev nafesham vayagiyu ad-shaarey mavet

Hebrew: וַיִּזְעֲק֣וּ אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בַּצַּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם מִ֝מְּצֻ֥קוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם יוֹשִׁיעֵֽם׃
Translated:
In their adversity they cried to the LORD
and He saved them from their troubles.
Transliteration: vayizeaku el-yehovah vatsar lahem mimetsukvoteyhem yvoshiyem

Hebrew: יִשְׁלַ֣ח דְּ֭בָרוֹ וְיִרְפָּאֵ֑ם וִ֝ימַלֵּ֗ט מִשְּׁחִֽיתוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
He gave an order and healed them;
He delivered them from the pits.
Transliteration: yishelach devarvo veyirefaem viymalet mishechiytvotam

Hebrew: יוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love,
His wondrous deeds for mankind.
Transliteration: yvodu layhovah chasedvo venifelevotayv liveney adam

Hebrew: וְ֭יִזְבְּחוּ זִבְחֵ֣י תוֹדָ֑ה וִיסַפְּר֖וּ מַעֲשָׂ֣יו בְּרִנָּֽה׃
Translated:
Let them offer thanksgiving sacrifices,
and tell His deeds in joyful song.
Transliteration: veyiizevechu zivechey tvodah viysaferu maashayv verinah

Hebrew: ׆ יוֹרְדֵ֣י הַ֭יָּם בׇּאֳנִיּ֑וֹת עֹשֵׂ֥י מְ֝לָאכָ֗ה בְּמַ֣יִם רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
Others go down to the sea in ships,
ply their trade in the mighty waters;
Transliteration: yvoredey hayam vׇoniyyvot oshey melakhah vemayiim raviym

Hebrew: ׆ הֵ֣מָּה רָ֭אוּ מַעֲשֵׂ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו בִּמְצוּלָֽה׃
Translated:
they have seen the works of the LORD
and His wonders in the deep.
Transliteration: hemah rau maashey yehovah venifelevotayv vimetsulah

Hebrew: ׆ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר וַֽ֭יַּעֲמֵד ר֣וּחַ סְעָרָ֑ה וַתְּרוֹמֵ֥ם גַּלָּֽיו׃
Translated:
By His word He raised a storm wind
that made the waves surge.
Transliteration: vayomer vayaamed rucha searah vatervomem galayv

Hebrew: ׆ יַעֲל֣וּ שָׁ֭מַיִם יֵרְד֣וּ תְהוֹמ֑וֹת נַ֝פְשָׁ֗ם בְּרָעָ֥ה תִתְמוֹגָֽג׃
Translated:
Mounting up to the heaven,
plunging down to the depths,
disgorging in their misery,
Transliteration: yaalu shamayim eiredu tehvomvot nafesham veraah titemvogag
