Hebrew: ׆ יָח֣וֹגּוּ וְ֭יָנוּעוּ כַּשִּׁכּ֑וֹר וְכׇל־חׇ֝כְמָתָ֗ם תִּתְבַּלָּֽע׃
Translated:
they reeled and staggered like a drunken man,
all their skill to no avail.
Transliteration: yachvogu veyanuu khashikhvor vekhׇl-chׇkhematam titevala

Hebrew: ׆ וַיִּצְעֲק֣וּ אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בַּצַּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם וּֽ֝מִמְּצ֥וּקֹתֵיהֶ֗ם יוֹצִיאֵֽם׃
Translated:
In their adversity they cried to the LORD,
and He saved them from their troubles.
Transliteration: vayitseaku el-yehovah vatsar lahem umimetsukoteyhem yvotsiyem

Hebrew: יָקֵ֣ם סְ֭עָרָה לִדְמָמָ֑ה וַ֝יֶּחֱשׁ֗וּ גַּלֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
He reduced the storm to a whisper;
the waves were stilled.
Transliteration: yakem searah lidemamah vayecheshu galeyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂמְח֥וּ כִֽי־יִשְׁתֹּ֑קוּ וַ֝יַּנְחֵ֗ם אֶל־מְח֥וֹז חֶפְצָֽם׃
Translated:
They rejoiced when all was quiet,
and He brought them to the port they desired.
Transliteration: vayishemechu khiy-yishetoku vayanechem el-mechvoz chefetsam

Hebrew: יוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love,
His wondrous deeds for mankind.
Transliteration: yvodu layhovah chasedvo venifelevotayv liveney adam

Hebrew: וִֽ֭ירוֹמְמוּהוּ בִּקְהַל־עָ֑ם וּבְמוֹשַׁ֖ב זְקֵנִ֣ים יְהַלְלֽוּהוּ׃
Translated:
Let them exalt Him in the congregation of the people,
acclaim Him in the assembly of the elders.
Transliteration: viyrvomemuhu vikehal-am uvemvoshav zekeniym yehaleluhu

Hebrew: יָשֵׂ֣ם נְהָר֣וֹת לְמִדְבָּ֑ר וּמֹצָ֥אֵי מַ֝֗יִם לְצִמָּאֽוֹן׃
Translated:
He turns the rivers into a wilderness,
springs of water into thirsty land,
Transliteration: yashem neharvot lemidevar umotsaey mayiyim letsimavon

Hebrew: אֶ֣רֶץ פְּ֭רִי לִמְלֵחָ֑ה מֵ֝רָעַ֗ת י֣וֹשְׁבֵי בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
fruitful land into a salt marsh,
because of the wickedness of its inhabitants.
Transliteration: erets feriy limelechah meraat yvoshevey vah

Hebrew: יָשֵׂ֣ם מִ֭דְבָּר לַאֲגַם־מַ֑יִם וְאֶ֥רֶץ צִ֝יָּ֗ה לְמֹצָ֥אֵי מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
He turns the wilderness into pools,
parched land into springs of water.
Transliteration: yashem midevar laagam-mayiim veerets tsiyah lemotsaey mayiim

Hebrew: וַיּ֣וֹשֶׁב שָׁ֣ם רְעֵבִ֑ים וַ֝יְכוֹנְנ֗וּ עִ֣יר מוֹשָֽׁב׃
Translated:
There He settles the hungry;
they build a place to settle in.
Transliteration: vayyvoshev sham reeviym vayekhvonenu iyr mvoshav

Hebrew: וַיִּזְרְע֣וּ שָׂ֭דוֹת וַיִּטְּע֣וּ כְרָמִ֑ים וַ֝יַּעֲשׂ֗וּ פְּרִ֣י תְבוּאָֽה׃
Translated:
They sow fields and plant vineyards
that yield a fruitful harvest.
Transliteration: vayizereu shadvot vayiteu kheramiym vayaashu feriy tevuah

Hebrew: וַיְבָרְכֵ֣ם וַיִּרְבּ֣וּ מְאֹ֑ד וּ֝בְהֶמְתָּ֗ם לֹ֣א יַמְעִֽיט׃
Translated:
He blesses them and they increase greatly;
and He does not let their cattle decrease,
Transliteration: vayevarekhem vayirevu meod uvehemetam lo yameiyt

Hebrew: וַיִּמְעֲט֥וּ וַיָּשֹׁ֑חוּ מֵעֹ֖צֶר רָעָ֣ה וְיָגֽוֹן׃
Translated:
after they had been few and crushed
by oppression, misery, and sorrow.
Transliteration: vayimeatu vayashochu meotser raah veyagvon

Hebrew: ׆ שֹׁפֵ֣ךְ בּ֭וּז עַל־נְדִיבִ֑ים וַ֝יַּתְעֵ֗ם בְּתֹ֣הוּ לֹא־דָֽרֶךְ׃
Translated:
He pours contempt on great men
and makes them lose their way in trackless deserts;
Transliteration: shofekhe vuz al-nediyviym vayateem vetohu lo-darekhe

Hebrew: וַיְשַׂגֵּ֣ב אֶבְי֣וֹן מֵע֑וֹנִי וַיָּ֥שֶׂם כַּ֝צֹּ֗אן מִשְׁפָּחֽוֹת׃
Translated:
but the needy He secures from suffering,
and increases their families like flocks.
Transliteration: vayeshagev eveyvon mevoniy vayashem khatson mishefachvot

Hebrew: יִרְא֣וּ יְשָׁרִ֣ים וְיִשְׂמָ֑חוּ וְכׇל־עַ֝וְלָ֗ה קָ֣פְצָה פִּֽיהָ׃
Translated:
The upright see it and rejoice;
the mouth of all wrongdoers is stopped.
Transliteration: yireu yeshariym veyishemachu vekhׇl-avelah kafetsah fiyha

Hebrew: מִי־חָכָ֥ם וְיִשְׁמׇר־אֵ֑לֶּה וְ֝יִתְבּוֹנְנ֗וּ חַֽסְדֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
The wise man will take note of these things;
he will consider the steadfast love of the LORD.
Transliteration: miy-chakham veyishemׇr-eleh veyiitevvonenu chasedey yehovah {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֖יר מִזְמ֣וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: A song. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: shiyr mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: נָכ֣וֹן לִבִּ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים אָשִׁ֥ירָה וַ֝אֲזַמְּרָ֗ה אַף־כְּבוֹדִֽי׃
Translated:
My heart is firm, O God;
I will sing and chant a hymn with all my soul.
Transliteration: nakhvon liviy Elohim ashiyrah vaazamerah af-khevvodiy

Hebrew: ע֭וּרָֽה הַנֵּ֥בֶל וְכִנּ֗וֹר אָעִ֥ירָה שָּֽׁחַר׃
Translated:
Awake, O harp and lyre!
I will wake the dawn.
Transliteration: urah hanevel vekhinvor aiyrah shachar

Hebrew: אוֹדְךָ֖ בָעַמִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה וַ֝אֲזַמֶּרְךָ֗ בַּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
Translated:
I will praise You among the peoples, O LORD,
sing a hymn to You among the nations;
Transliteration: vodekha vaamiym <small></small> yehovah vaazamerekha valeumiym

Hebrew: כִּי־גָד֣וֹל מֵעַל־שָׁמַ֣יִם חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וְֽעַד־שְׁחָקִ֥ים אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
for Your faithfulness is higher than the heavens;
Your steadfastness reaches to the sky.
Transliteration: khiy-gadvol meal-shamayiim chasedekha vead-shechakiym amitekha

Hebrew: ר֣וּמָה עַל־שָׁמַ֣יִם אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Exalt Yourself over the heavens, O God;
let Your glory be over all the earth!
Transliteration: rumah al-shamayiim Elohim veal khׇl-haarets khevvodekha

Hebrew: לְ֭מַעַן יֵחָלְצ֣וּן יְדִידֶ֑יךָ הוֹשִׁ֖יעָה יְמִֽינְךָ֣ וַעֲנֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
That those whom You love may be rescued,
deliver with Your right hand and answer me.
Transliteration: lemaan eichaletsun yediydeykha hvoshiyah yemiynekha vaaneniy

Hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ דִּבֶּ֥ר בְּקׇדְשׁ֗וֹ אֶ֫עְלֹ֥זָה אֲחַלְּקָ֥ה שְׁכֶ֑ם וְעֵ֖מֶק סֻכּ֣וֹת אֲמַדֵּֽד׃
Translated:
God promised in His sanctuary
that I would exultingly divide up Shechem,
and measure the Valley of Sukkoth;
Transliteration: Elohim diver vekׇdeshvo eelozah achalekah shekhem veemek sukhvot amaded

Hebrew: לִ֤י גִלְעָ֨ד ׀ לִ֤י מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה וְ֭אֶפְרַיִם מָע֣וֹז רֹאשִׁ֑י יְ֝הוּדָ֗ה מְחֹקְקִֽי׃
Translated:
Gilead and Manasseh would be mine,
Ephraim my chief stronghold,
Judah my scepter;
Transliteration: liy gilead liy menasheh veeferayim mavoz roshiy yehudah mechokekiy

Hebrew: מוֹאָ֤ב ׀ סִ֬יר רַחְצִ֗י עַל־אֱ֭דוֹם אַשְׁלִ֣יךְ נַעֲלִ֑י עֲלֵי־פְ֝לֶ֗שֶׁת אֶתְרוֹעָֽע׃
Translated:
Moab would be my washbasin;
on Edom I would cast my shoe;
I would raise a shout over Philistia.
Transliteration: mvoav siyr rachetsiy al-edvom asheliykhe naaliy aley-feleshet etervoa

Hebrew: מִ֣י יֹ֭בִלֵנִי עִ֣יר מִבְצָ֑ר מִ֖י נָחַ֣נִי עַד־אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Would that I were brought to the bastion!
Would that I were led to Edom!
Transliteration: miy yovileniy iyr mivetsar miy nachaniy ad-edvom

Hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־אֱלֹהִ֥ים זְנַחְתָּ֑נוּ וְֽלֹא־תֵצֵ֥א אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים בְּצִבְאֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
But You have rejected us, O God;
God, You do not march with our armies.
Transliteration: halo-Elohim zenachetanu velo-tetse Elohimm vetsiveoteynu

Hebrew: הָבָה־לָּ֣נוּ עֶזְרָ֣ת מִצָּ֑ר וְ֝שָׁ֗וְא תְּשׁוּעַ֥ת אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Grant us Your aid against the foe,
for the help of man is worthless.
Transliteration: havah-lanu ezerat mitsar veshave teshuat adam

Hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִ֥ים נַֽעֲשֶׂה־חָ֑יִל וְ֝ה֗וּא יָב֥וּס צָרֵֽינוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
With God we shall triumph;
He will trample our foes.
Transliteration: velohiym naasheh-chayiil vehu yavus tsareynu {f}

Hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ לְדָוִ֣ד מִזְמ֑וֹר אֱלֹהֵ֥י תְ֝הִלָּתִ֗י אַֽל־תֶּחֱרַֽשׁ׃
Translated:
For the leader. Of David. A psalm.

O God of my praise,
do not keep aloof,
Transliteration: lamenatsecha ledavid mizemvor elohey tehilatiy al-techerash

Hebrew: כִּ֤י פִ֪י רָשָׁ֡ע וּֽפִי־מִ֭רְמָה עָלַ֣י פָּתָ֑חוּ דִּבְּר֥וּ אִ֝תִּ֗י לְשׁ֣וֹן שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
for the wicked and the deceitful
open their mouth against me;
they speak to me with lying tongue.
Transliteration: khiy fiy rasha ufiy-miremah alay fatachu diveru itiy leshvon shaker

Hebrew: וְדִבְרֵ֣י שִׂנְאָ֣ה סְבָב֑וּנִי וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֥וּנִי חִנָּֽם׃
Translated:
They encircle me with words of hate;
they attack me without cause.
Transliteration: vediverey shineah sevavuniy vayilachamuniy chinam

Hebrew: תַּֽחַת־אַהֲבָתִ֥י יִשְׂטְנ֗וּנִי וַאֲנִ֥י תְפִלָּֽה׃
Translated:
They answer my love with accusation
and I must stand judgment.
Transliteration: tachat-ahavatiy yishetenuniy vaaniy tefilah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֘שִׂ֤ימוּ עָלַ֣י רָ֭עָה תַּ֣חַת טוֹבָ֑ה וְ֝שִׂנְאָ֗ה תַּ֣חַת אַהֲבָתִֽי׃
Translated:
They repay me with evil for good,
with hatred for my love.
Transliteration: vayashiymu alay raah tachat tvovah veshineah tachat ahavatiy

Hebrew: הַפְקֵ֣ד עָלָ֣יו רָשָׁ֑ע וְ֝שָׂטָ֗ן יַעֲמֹ֥ד עַל־יְמִינֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Appoint a wicked man over him;
may an accuser stand at his right side;
Transliteration: hafeked alayv rasha veshatan yaamod al-yemiynvo

Hebrew: בְּ֭הִשָּׁ֣פְטוֹ יֵצֵ֣א רָשָׁ֑ע וּ֝תְפִלָּת֗וֹ תִּֽהְיֶ֥ה לַחֲטָאָֽה׃
Translated:
may he be tried and convicted;
may he be judged and found guilty.
Transliteration: vehishafetvo eitse rasha utefilatvo tiheyeh lachataah

Hebrew: יִֽהְיוּ־יָמָ֥יו מְעַטִּ֑ים פְּ֝קֻדָּת֗וֹ יִקַּ֥ח אַחֵֽר׃
Translated:
May his days be few;
may another take over his position.
Transliteration: yiheyu-yamayv meatiym fekudatvo yikach acher

Hebrew: יִֽהְיוּ־בָנָ֥יו יְתוֹמִ֑ים וְ֝אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ אַלְמָנָֽה׃
Translated:
May his children be orphans,
his wife a widow.
Transliteration: yiheyu-vanayv yetvomiym veishetvo alemanah

Hebrew: וְנ֤וֹעַ יָנ֣וּעוּ בָנָ֣יו וְשִׁאֵ֑לוּ וְ֝דָרְשׁ֗וּ מֵחׇרְבֽוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
May his children wander from their hovels,
begging in search of [bread].
Transliteration: venvoa yanuu vanayv veshielu vedareshu mechׇrevvoteyhem

Hebrew: יְנַקֵּ֣שׁ נ֭וֹשֶׁה לְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ וְיָבֹ֖זּוּ זָרִ֣ים יְגִיעֽוֹ׃
Translated:
May his creditor seize all his possessions;
may strangers plunder his wealth.
Transliteration: yenakesh nvosheh lekhׇl-asher-lvo veyavozu zariym yegiyvo

Hebrew: אַל־יְהִי־ל֭וֹ מֹשֵׁ֣ךְ חָ֑סֶד וְֽאַל־יְהִ֥י ח֝וֹנֵ֗ן לִֽיתוֹמָֽיו׃
Translated:
May no one show him mercy;
may none pity his orphans;
Transliteration: al-yehiy-lvo moshekhe chased veal-yehiy chvonen liytvomayv

Hebrew: יְהִי־אַחֲרִית֥וֹ לְהַכְרִ֑ית בְּד֥וֹר אַ֝חֵ֗ר יִמַּ֥ח שְׁמָֽם׃
Translated:
may his posterity be cut off;
may their names be blotted out in the next generation.
Transliteration: yehiy-achariytvo lehakheriyt vedvor acher yimach shemam

Hebrew: יִזָּכֵ֤ר ׀ עֲוֺ֣ן אֲ֭בֹתָיו אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְחַטַּ֥את אִ֝מּ֗וֹ אַל־תִּמָּֽח׃
Translated:
May God be ever mindful of his father’s iniquity,
and may the sin of his mother not be blotted out.
Transliteration: yizakher avon avotayv el-yehovah vechatat imvo al-timach

Hebrew: יִהְי֣וּ נֶגֶד־יְהֹוָ֣ה תָּמִ֑יד וְיַכְרֵ֖ת מֵאֶ֣רֶץ זִכְרָֽם׃
Translated:
May the LORD be aware of them always
and cause their names to be cut off from the earth,
Transliteration: yiheyu neged-yehovah tamiyd veyakheret meerets zikheram

Hebrew: יַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר ׀ לֹ֥א זָכַר֮ עֲשׂ֢וֹת חָ֥֫סֶד וַיִּרְדֹּ֡ף אִישׁ־עָנִ֣י וְ֭אֶבְיוֹן וְנִכְאֵ֨ה לֵבָ֬ב לְמוֹתֵֽת׃
Translated:
because he was not minded to act kindly,
and hounded to death the poor and needy man,
one crushed in spirit.
Transliteration: yaan asher lo zakhar ash֢vot chased vayiredof iysh-aniy veeveyvon venikheeh levav lemvotet

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֣ב קְ֭לָלָה וַתְּבוֹאֵ֑הוּ וְֽלֹא־חָפֵ֥ץ בִּ֝בְרָכָ֗ה וַתִּרְחַ֥ק מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
He loved to curse—may a curse come upon him!
He would not bless—may blessing be far from him!
Transliteration: vayeehav kelalah vatevvoehu velo-chafets viverakhah vatirechak mimenu

Hebrew: וַיִּלְבַּ֥שׁ קְלָלָ֗ה כְּמַ֫דּ֥וֹ וַתָּבֹ֣א כַמַּ֣יִם בְּקִרְבּ֑וֹ וְ֝כַשֶּׁ֗מֶן בְּעַצְמוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
May he be clothed in a curse like a garment,
may it enter his body like water,
his bones like oil.
Transliteration: vayilevash kelalah khemadvo vatavo khamayiim vekirevvo vekhashemen veatsemvotayv

Hebrew: תְּהִי־ל֭וֹ כְּבֶ֣גֶד יַעְטֶ֑ה וּ֝לְמֵ֗זַח תָּמִ֥יד יַחְגְּרֶֽהָ׃
Translated:
Let it be like the cloak he wraps around him,
like the belt he always wears.
Transliteration: tehiy-lvo kheveged yaeteh ulemezach tamiyd yachegereha

Hebrew: זֹ֤את פְּעֻלַּ֣ת שֹׂ֭טְנַי מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהַדֹּבְרִ֥ים רָ֝֗ע עַל־נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
May the LORD thus repay my accusers,
all those who speak evil against me.
Transliteration: zot feulat shotenay meet yehovah vehadoveriym ra al-nafeshiy

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה ׀ יֱ֘הֹוִ֤ה אֲדֹנָ֗י עֲֽשֵׂה־אִ֭תִּי לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמֶ֑ךָ כִּי־ט֥וֹב חַ֝סְדְּךָ֗ הַצִּילֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Now You, O God, my Lord,
act on my behalf as befits Your name.
Good and faithful as You are, save me.
Transliteration: veatah yehovih adonay asheh-itiy lemaan shemekha khiy-tvov chasedekha hatsiyleniy

Hebrew: כִּי־עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְי֣וֹן אָנֹ֑כִי וְ֝לִבִּ֗י חָלַ֥ל בְּקִרְבִּֽי׃
Translated:
For I am poor and needy,
and my heart is pierced within me.
Transliteration: khiy-aniy veeveyvon anokhiy veliviy chalal vekireviy

Hebrew: כְּצֵל־כִּנְטוֹת֥וֹ נֶהֱלָ֑כְתִּי נִ֝נְעַ֗רְתִּי כָּאַרְבֶּֽה׃
Translated:
I fade away like a lengthening shadow;
I am shaken off like locusts.
Transliteration: khetsel-khinetvotvo nehelakhetiy ninearetiy khaareveh

Hebrew: בִּ֭רְכַּי כָּשְׁל֣וּ מִצּ֑וֹם וּ֝בְשָׂרִ֗י כָּחַ֥שׁ מִשָּֽׁמֶן׃
Translated:
My knees give way from fasting;
my flesh is lean, has lost its fat.
Transliteration: virekhay khashelu mitsvom uveshariy khachash mishamen

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ הָיִ֣יתִי חֶרְפָּ֣ה לָהֶ֑ם יִ֝רְא֗וּנִי יְנִיע֥וּן רֹאשָֽׁם׃
Translated:
I am the object of their scorn;
when they see me, they shake their head.
Transliteration: vaaniy hayiytiy cherefah lahem yireuniy yeniyun rosham

Hebrew: עׇ֭זְרֵנִי יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑י ה֖וֹשִׁיעֵ֣נִי כְחַסְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Help me, O LORD, my God;
save me in accord with Your faithfulness,
Transliteration: ׇzereniy yehovah elohay hvoshiyeniy khechasedekha

Hebrew: וְֽ֭יֵדְעוּ כִּי־יָ֣דְךָ זֹּ֑את אַתָּ֖ה יְהֹוָ֣ה עֲשִׂיתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
that men may know that it is Your hand,
that You, O LORD, have done it.
Transliteration: veeieideu khiy-yadekha zot atah yehovah ashiytah

Hebrew: יְקַֽלְלוּ־הֵמָּה֮ וְאַתָּ֢ה תְבָ֫רֵ֥ךְ קָ֤מוּ ׀ וַיֵּבֹ֗שׁוּ וְֽעַבְדְּךָ֥ יִשְׂמָֽח׃
Translated:
Let them curse, but You bless;
let them rise up, but come to grief,
while Your servant rejoices.
Transliteration: yekalelu-hemah veata֢h tevarekhe kamu vayevoshu veavedekha yishemach

Hebrew: יִלְבְּשׁ֣וּ שׂוֹטְנַ֣י כְּלִמָּ֑ה וְיַעֲט֖וּ כַמְעִ֣יל בׇּשְׁתָּֽם׃
Translated:
My accusers shall be clothed in shame,
wrapped in their disgrace as in a robe.
Transliteration: yileveshu shvotenay khelimah veyaatu khameiyl vׇshetam

Hebrew: א֘וֹדֶ֤ה יְהֹוָ֣ה מְאֹ֣ד בְּפִ֑י וּבְת֖וֹךְ רַבִּ֣ים אֲהַלְלֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
My mouth shall sing much praise to the LORD;
I will acclaim Him in the midst of a throng,
Transliteration: vodeh yehovah meod vefiy uvetvokhe raviym ahalelenu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יַ֭עֲמֹד לִימִ֣ין אֶבְי֑וֹן לְ֝הוֹשִׁ֗יעַ מִשֹּׁפְטֵ֥י נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
because He stands at the right hand of the needy,
to save him from those who would condemn him.
Transliteration: khiy-yaamod liymiyn eveyvon lehvoshiya mishofetey nafeshvo {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֗ד מִ֫זְמ֥וֹר נְאֻ֤ם יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ לַֽאדֹנִ֗י שֵׁ֥ב לִֽימִינִ֑י עַד־אָשִׁ֥ית אֹ֝יְבֶ֗יךָ הֲדֹ֣ם לְרַגְלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Of David. A psalm.

The LORD said to my lord,
“Sit at My right hand
while I make your enemies your footstool.”
Transliteration: ledavid mizemvor neum yehovah ladoniy shev liymiyniy ad-ashiyt oyeveykha hadom lerageleykha

Hebrew: מַטֵּֽה־עֻזְּךָ֗ יִשְׁלַ֣ח יְ֭הֹוָה מִצִּיּ֑וֹן רְ֝דֵ֗ה בְּקֶ֣רֶב אֹיְבֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
The LORD will stretch forth from Zion your mighty scepter;
hold sway over your enemies!
Transliteration: mateh-uzekha yishelach yehovah mitsiyyvon redeh vekerev oyeveykha

Hebrew: עַמְּךָ֣ נְדָבֹת֮ בְּי֢וֹם חֵ֫ילֶ֥ךָ בְּֽהַדְרֵי־קֹ֭דֶשׁ מֵרֶ֣חֶם מִשְׁחָ֑ר לְ֝ךָ֗ טַ֣ל יַלְדֻתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Your people come forward willingly on your day of battle.
In majestic holiness, from the womb,
from the dawn, yours was the dew of youth.
Transliteration: amekha nedavot vey֢vom cheylekha vehaderey-kodesh merechem mishechar lekha tal yaleduteykha

Hebrew: נִשְׁבַּ֤ע יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ וְלֹ֥א יִנָּחֵ֗ם אַתָּֽה־כֹהֵ֥ן לְעוֹלָ֑ם עַל־דִּ֝בְרָתִ֗י מַלְכִּי־צֶֽדֶק׃
Translated:
The LORD has sworn and will not relent,
“You are a priest forever, a rightful king by My decree.”
Transliteration: nisheva yehovah velo yinachem atah-khohen levolam al-diveratiy malekhiy-tsedek

Hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֥י עַל־יְמִֽינְךָ֑ מָחַ֖ץ בְּיוֹם־אַפּ֣וֹ מְלָכִֽים׃
Translated:
The Lord is at your right hand.
He crushes kings in the day of His anger.
Transliteration: adonay al-yemiynekha machats veyvom-afvo melakhiym

Hebrew: יָדִ֣ין בַּ֭גּוֹיִם מָלֵ֣א גְוִיּ֑וֹת מָ֥חַץ רֹ֝֗אשׁ עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ רַבָּֽה׃
Translated:
He works judgment upon the nations,
heaping up bodies,
crushing heads far and wide.
Transliteration: yadiyn vagvoyim male geviyyvot machats rosh al-erets ravah

Hebrew: מִ֭נַּחַל בַּדֶּ֣רֶךְ יִשְׁתֶּ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן יָרִ֥ים רֹֽאשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He drinks from the stream on his way;
therefore he holds his head high.
Transliteration: minachal vaderekhe yisheteh al-khen yariym rosh {f}

Hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ אוֹדֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה בְּכׇל־לֵבָ֑ב בְּס֖וֹד יְשָׁרִ֣ים וְעֵדָֽה׃
Translated:
Hallelujah.
I praise the LORD with all my heart
in the assembled congregation of the upright.
Transliteration: halelu-yah vodeh yehovah vekhׇl-levav vesvod yeshariym veedah

Hebrew: גְּ֭דֹלִים מַעֲשֵׂ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה דְּ֝רוּשִׁ֗ים לְכׇל־חֶפְצֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
The works of the LORD are great,
within reach of all who desire them.
Transliteration: gedoliym maashey yehovah derushiym lekhׇl-chefetseyhem

Hebrew: הוֹד־וְהָדָ֥ר פׇּעֳל֑וֹ וְ֝צִדְקָת֗וֹ עֹמֶ֥דֶת לָעַֽד׃
Translated:
His deeds are splendid and glorious;
His beneficence is everlasting;
Transliteration: hvod-vehadar fׇolvo vetsidekatvo omedet laad

Hebrew: זֵ֣כֶר עָ֭שָׂה לְנִפְלְאוֹתָ֑יו חַנּ֖וּן וְרַח֣וּם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
He has won renown for His wonders.
The LORD is gracious and compassionate;
Transliteration: zekher ashah lenifelevotayv chanun verachum yehovah

Hebrew: טֶ֭רֶף נָתַ֣ן לִירֵאָ֑יו יִזְכֹּ֖ר לְעוֹלָ֣ם בְּרִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He gives food to those who fear Him;
He is ever mindful of His covenant.
Transliteration: teref natan liyreayv yizekhor levolam veriytvo

Hebrew: כֹּ֣חַ מַ֭עֲשָׂיו הִגִּ֣יד לְעַמּ֑וֹ לָתֵ֥ת לָ֝הֶ֗ם נַחֲלַ֥ת גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
He revealed to His people His powerful works,
in giving them the heritage of nations.
Transliteration: khocha maashayv higiyd leamvo latet lahem nachalat gvoyim

Hebrew: מַעֲשֵׂ֣י יָ֭דָיו אֱמֶ֣ת וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט נֶ֝אֱמָנִ֗ים כׇּל־פִּקּוּדָֽיו׃
Translated:
His handiwork is truth and justice;
all His precepts are enduring,
Transliteration: maashey yadayv emet umishefat neemaniym khׇl-fikudayv

Hebrew: סְמוּכִ֣ים לָעַ֣ד לְעוֹלָ֑ם עֲ֝שׂוּיִ֗ם בֶּאֱמֶ֥ת וְיָשָֽׁר׃
Translated:
well-founded for all eternity,
wrought of truth and equity.
Transliteration: semukhiym laad levolam ashuyim veemet veyashar

Hebrew: פְּד֤וּת ׀ שָׁ֘לַ֤ח לְעַמּ֗וֹ צִוָּֽה־לְעוֹלָ֥ם בְּרִית֑וֹ קָד֖וֹשׁ וְנוֹרָ֣א שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He sent redemption to His people;
He ordained His covenant for all time;
His name is holy and awesome.
Transliteration: fedut shalach leamvo tsivah-levolam veriytvo kadvosh venvora shemvo

Hebrew: רֵ֘אשִׁ֤ית חׇכְמָ֨ה ׀ יִרְאַ֬ת יְהֹוָ֗ה שֵׂ֣כֶל ט֭וֹב לְכׇל־עֹֽשֵׂיהֶ֑ם תְּ֝הִלָּת֗וֹ עֹמֶ֥דֶת לָעַֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
The beginning of wisdom is the fear of the LORD;
all who practice it gain sound understanding.
Praise of Him is everlasting.
Transliteration: reshiyt chׇkhemah yireat yehovah shekhel tvov lekhׇl-osheyhem tehilatvo omedet laad {f}

Hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ אַשְׁרֵי־אִ֭ישׁ יָרֵ֣א אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּ֝מִצְוֺתָ֗יו חָפֵ֥ץ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
Hallelujah.
Happy is the man who fears the LORD,
who is ardently devoted to His commandments.
Transliteration: halelu-yah asherey-iysh yare et-yehovah vemitsevotayv chafets meod

Hebrew: גִּבּ֣וֹר בָּ֭אָרֶץ יִהְיֶ֣ה זַרְע֑וֹ דּ֖וֹר יְשָׁרִ֣ים יְבֹרָֽךְ׃
Translated:
His descendants will be mighty in the land,

a blessed generation of upright men.
Transliteration: givvor vaarets yiheyeh zarevo dvor yeshariym yevorakhe

Hebrew: הוֹן־וָעֹ֥שֶׁר בְּבֵית֑וֹ וְ֝צִדְקָת֗וֹ עֹמֶ֥דֶת לָעַֽד׃
Translated:
Wealth and riches are in his house,
and his beneficence lasts forever.
Transliteration: hvon-vaosher veveytvo vetsidekatvo omedet laad

Hebrew: זָ֘רַ֤ח בַּחֹ֣שֶׁךְ א֭וֹר לַיְשָׁרִ֑ים חַנּ֖וּן וְרַח֣וּם וְצַדִּֽיק׃
Translated:
A light shines for the upright in the darkness;
he is gracious, compassionate, and beneficent.
Transliteration: zarach vachoshekhe vor layeshariym chanun verachum vetsadiyk

Hebrew: טֽוֹב־אִ֭ישׁ חוֹנֵ֣ן וּמַלְוֶ֑ה יְכַלְכֵּ֖ל דְּבָרָ֣יו בְּמִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
All goes well with the man who lends generously,
who conducts his affairs with equity.
Transliteration: tvov-iysh chvonen umaleveh yekhalekhel devarayv vemishefat

Hebrew: כִּֽי־לְעוֹלָ֥ם לֹֽא־יִמּ֑וֹט לְזֵ֥כֶר ע֝וֹלָ֗ם יִהְיֶ֥ה צַדִּֽיק׃
Translated:
He shall never be shaken;
the beneficent man will be remembered forever.
Transliteration: khiy-levolam lo-yimvot lezekher volam yiheyeh tsadiyk

Hebrew: מִשְּׁמוּעָ֣ה רָ֭עָה לֹ֣א יִירָ֑א נָכ֥וֹן לִ֝בּ֗וֹ בָּטֻ֥חַ בַּיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
He is not afraid of evil tidings;
his heart is firm, he trusts in the LORD.
Transliteration: mishemuah raah lo yiyra nakhvon livvo vatucha vayhovah

Hebrew: סָמ֣וּךְ לִ֭בּוֹ לֹ֣א יִירָ֑א עַ֖ד אֲשֶׁר־יִרְאֶ֣ה בְצָרָֽיו׃
Translated:
His heart is resolute, he is unafraid;
in the end he will see the fall of his foes.
Transliteration: samukhe livvo lo yiyra ad asher-yireeh vetsarayv

Hebrew: פִּזַּ֤ר ׀ נָ֘תַ֤ן לָאֶבְיוֹנִ֗ים צִ֭דְקָתוֹ עֹמֶ֣דֶת לָעַ֑ד קַ֝רְנ֗וֹ תָּר֥וּם בְּכָבֽוֹד׃
Translated:
He gives freely to the poor;
his beneficence lasts forever;
his horn is exalted in honor.
Transliteration: fizar natan laeveyvoniym tsidekatvo omedet laad karenvo tarum vekhavvod

Hebrew: רָ֘שָׁ֤ע יִרְאֶ֨ה ׀ וְכָעָ֗ס שִׁנָּ֣יו יַחֲרֹ֣ק וְנָמָ֑ס תַּאֲוַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תֹּאבֵֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
The wicked man shall see it and be vexed;
he shall gnash his teeth; his courage shall fail.
The desire of the wicked shall come to nothing.
Transliteration: rasha yireeh vekhaas shinayv yacharok venamas taavat reshaiym toved {f}

Hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ הַ֭לְלוּ עַבְדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הַֽ֝לְל֗וּ אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Hallelujah.
O servants of the LORD, give praise;
praise the name of the LORD.
Transliteration: halelu-yah halelu avedey yehovah halelu et-shem yehovah

Hebrew: יְהִ֤י שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֣ה מְבֹרָ֑ךְ מֵ֝עַתָּ֗ה וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Let the name of the LORD be blessed
now and forever.
Transliteration: yehiy shem yehovah mevorakhe meatah vead-volam

Hebrew: מִמִּזְרַח־שֶׁ֥מֶשׁ עַד־מְבוֹא֑וֹ מְ֝הֻלָּ֗ל שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
From east to west
the name of the LORD is praised.
Transliteration: mimizerach-shemesh ad-mevvovo mehulal shem yehovah

Hebrew: רָ֖ם עַל־כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֥ם <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה עַ֖ל הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם כְּבוֹדֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The LORD is exalted above all nations;
His glory is above the heavens.
Transliteration: ram al-khׇl-gvoyim <small></small> yehovah al hashamayiim khevvodvo

Hebrew: מִ֭י כַּיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ הַֽמַּגְבִּיהִ֥י לָשָֽׁבֶת׃
Translated:
Who is like the LORD our God,
who, enthroned on high,
Transliteration: miy khayhovah eloheynu hamageviyhiy lashavet

Hebrew: הַֽמַּשְׁפִּילִ֥י לִרְא֑וֹת בַּשָּׁמַ֥יִם וּבָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
sees what is below,
in heaven and on earth?
Transliteration: hamashefiyliy lirevot vashamayiim uvaarets

Hebrew: מְקִ֥ימִ֣י מֵעָפָ֣ר דָּ֑ל מֵ֝אַשְׁפֹּ֗ת יָרִ֥ים אֶבְיֽוֹן׃
Translated:
He raises the poor from the dust,
lifts up the needy from the refuse heap
Transliteration: mekiymiy meafar dal meashefot yariym eveyvon

Hebrew: לְהוֹשִׁיבִ֥י עִם־נְדִיבִ֑ים עִ֝֗ם נְדִיבֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
to set them with the great,
with the great men of His people.
Transliteration: lehvoshiyviy im-nediyviym im nediyvey amvo

Hebrew: מֽוֹשִׁיבִ֨י ׀ עֲקֶ֬רֶת הַבַּ֗יִת אֵֽם־הַבָּנִ֥ים שְׂמֵחָ֗ה הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He sets the childless woman among her household
as a happy mother of children.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: mvoshiyviy akeret havayiit em-havaniym shemechah halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: בְּצֵ֣את יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם בֵּ֥ית יַ֝עֲקֹ֗ב מֵעַ֥ם לֹעֵֽז׃
Translated:
When Israel went forth from Egypt,
the house of Jacob from a people of strange speech,
Transliteration: vetset yisherael mimitserayiim veyt yaakov meam loez

Hebrew: הָיְתָ֣ה יְהוּדָ֣ה לְקׇדְשׁ֑וֹ יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל מַמְשְׁלוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Judah became His holy one,
Israel, His dominion.
Transliteration: hayetah yehudah lekׇdeshvo yisherael mameshelvotayv

Hebrew: הַיָּ֣ם רָ֭אָה וַיָּנֹ֑ס הַ֝יַּרְדֵּ֗ן יִסֹּ֥ב לְאָחֽוֹר׃
Translated:
The sea saw them and fled,
Jordan ran backward,
Transliteration: hayam raah vayanos hayareden yisov leachvor

Hebrew: הֶ֭הָרִים רָקְד֣וּ כְאֵילִ֑ים גְּ֝בָע֗וֹת כִּבְנֵי־צֹֽאן׃
Translated:
mountains skipped like rams,
hills like sheep.
Transliteration: hehariym rakedu kheeyliym gevavot khiveney-tson

Hebrew: מַה־לְּךָ֣ הַ֭יָּם כִּ֣י תָנ֑וּס הַ֝יַּרְדֵּ֗ן תִּסֹּ֥ב לְאָחֽוֹר׃
Translated:
What alarmed you, O sea, that you fled,
Jordan, that you ran backward,
Transliteration: mah-lekha hayam khiy tanus hayareden tisov leachvor

Hebrew: הֶ֭הָרִים תִּרְקְד֣וּ כְאֵילִ֑ים גְּ֝בָע֗וֹת כִּבְנֵי־צֹֽאן׃
Translated:
mountains, that you skipped like rams,
hills, like sheep?
Transliteration: hehariym tirekedu kheeyliym gevavot khiveney-tson

Hebrew: מִלִּפְנֵ֣י אָ֭דוֹן ח֣וּלִי אָ֑רֶץ מִ֝לִּפְנֵ֗י אֱל֣וֹהַּ יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
at the presence of the God of Jacob,
Transliteration: milifeney advon chuliy arets milifeney elvoha yaakov

Hebrew: הַהֹפְכִ֣י הַצּ֣וּר אֲגַם־מָ֑יִם חַ֝לָּמִ֗ישׁ לְמַעְיְנוֹ־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
who turned the rock into a pool of water,
the flinty rock into a fountain.
Transliteration: hahofekhiy hatsur agam-mayiim chalamiysh lemaeyenvo-mayiim

Hebrew: לֹ֤א לָ֥נוּ יְהֹוָ֗ה לֹ֫א־לָ֥נוּ כִּֽי־לְ֭שִׁמְךָ תֵּ֣ן כָּב֑וֹד עַל־חַ֝סְדְּךָ֗ עַל־אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Not to us, O LORD, not to us
but to Your name bring glory
for the sake of Your love and Your faithfulness.
Transliteration: lo lanu yehovah lo-lanu khiy-leshimekha ten khavvod al-chasedekha al-amitekha

Hebrew: לָ֭מָּה יֹאמְר֣וּ הַגּוֹיִ֑ם אַיֵּה־נָ֝֗א אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Let the nations not say,
“Where, now, is their God?”
Transliteration: lamah yomeru hagvoyim ayeh-na eloheyhem

Hebrew: וֵאלֹהֵ֥ינוּ בַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־חָפֵ֣ץ עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated:
when our God is in heaven
and all that He wills He accomplishes.
Transliteration: veloheynu vashamayiim khol asher-chafets ashah

Hebrew: עֲֽ֭צַבֵּיהֶם כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֑ב מַ֝עֲשֵׂ֗ה יְדֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Their idols are silver and gold,
the work of men’s hands.
Transliteration: atsaveyhem khesef vezahav maasheh yedey adam

Hebrew: פֶּֽה־לָ֭הֶם וְלֹ֣א יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ עֵינַ֥יִם לָ֝הֶ֗ם וְלֹ֣א יִרְאֽוּ׃
Translated:
They have mouths, but cannot speak,
eyes, but cannot see;
Transliteration: feh-lahem velo yedaveru eynayiim lahem velo yireu

Hebrew: אׇזְנַ֣יִם לָ֭הֶם וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמָ֑עוּ אַ֥ף לָ֝הֶ֗ם וְלֹ֣א יְרִיחֽוּן׃
Translated:
they have ears, but cannot hear,
noses, but cannot smell;
Transliteration: ׇzenayiim lahem velo yishemau af lahem velo yeriychun

Hebrew: יְדֵיהֶ֤ם ׀ וְלֹ֬א יְמִישׁ֗וּן רַ֭גְלֵיהֶם וְלֹ֣א יְהַלֵּ֑כוּ לֹא־יֶ֝הְגּ֗וּ בִּגְרוֹנָֽם׃
Translated:
they have hands, but cannot touch,
feet, but cannot walk;
they can make no sound in their throats.
Transliteration: yedeyhem velo yemiyshun rageleyhem velo yehalekhu lo-yehegu vigervonam

Hebrew: כְּ֭מוֹהֶם יִהְי֣וּ עֹשֵׂיהֶ֑ם כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־בֹּטֵ֣חַ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Those who fashion them,
all who trust in them,
shall become like them.
Transliteration: khemvohem yiheyu osheyhem khol asher-votecha vahem

Hebrew: יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל בְּטַ֣ח בַּיהֹוָ֑ה עֶזְרָ֖ם וּמָגִנָּ֣ם הֽוּא׃
Translated:
O Israel, trust in the LORD!
He is their help and shield.
Transliteration: yisherael vetach vayhovah ezeram umaginam hu

Hebrew: בֵּ֣ית אַ֭הֲרֹן בִּטְח֣וּ בַיהֹוָ֑ה עֶזְרָ֖ם וּמָגִנָּ֣ם הֽוּא׃
Translated:
O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD!
He is their help and shield.
Transliteration: veyt aharon vitechu vayhovah ezeram umaginam hu

Hebrew: יִרְאֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה בִּטְח֣וּ בַיהֹוָ֑ה עֶזְרָ֖ם וּמָגִנָּ֣ם הֽוּא׃
Translated:
O you who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD!
He is their help and shield.
Transliteration: yireey yehovah vitechu vayhovah ezeram umaginam hu

Hebrew: יְהֹוָה֮ זְכָרָ֢נוּ יְבָ֫רֵ֥ךְ יְ֭בָרֵךְ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יְ֝בָרֵ֗ךְ אֶת־בֵּ֥ית אַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translated:
The LORD is mindful of us.
He will bless us;
He will bless the house of Israel;
He will bless the house of Aaron;
Transliteration: yehovah zekhara֢nu yevarekhe yevarekhe et-veyt yisherael yevarekhe et-veyt aharon

Hebrew: יְ֭בָרֵךְ יִרְאֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הַ֝קְּטַנִּ֗ים עִם־הַגְּדֹלִֽים׃
Translated:
He will bless those who fear the LORD,
small and great alike.
Transliteration: yevarekhe yireey yehovah haketaniym im-hagedoliym

Hebrew: יֹסֵ֣ף יְהֹוָ֣ה עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם עֲ֝לֵיכֶ֗ם וְעַל־בְּנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
May the LORD increase your numbers,
yours and your children’s also.
Transliteration: yosef yehovah aleykhem aleykhem veal-veneykhem

Hebrew: בְּרוּכִ֣ים אַ֭תֶּם לַיהֹוָ֑ה עֹ֝שֵׂ֗ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
May you be blessed by the LORD,
Maker of heaven and earth.
Transliteration: verukhiym atem layhovah osheh shamayiim vaarets

Hebrew: הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם שָׁ֭מַיִם לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝הָאָ֗רֶץ נָתַ֥ן לִבְנֵי־אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
The heavens belong to the LORD,
but the earth He gave over to man.
Transliteration: hashamayiim shamayim layhovah vehaarets natan liveney-adam

Hebrew: לֹ֣א הַ֭מֵּתִים יְהַֽלְלוּ־יָ֑הּ וְ֝לֹ֗א כׇּל־יֹרְדֵ֥י דוּמָֽה׃
Translated:
The dead cannot praise the LORD,
nor any who go down into silence.
Transliteration: lo hametiym yehalelu-yah velo khׇl-yoredey dumah

Hebrew: וַאֲנַ֤חְנוּ ׀ נְבָ֘רֵ֤ךְ יָ֗הּ מֵעַתָּ֥ה וְעַד־עוֹלָ֗ם הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
But we will bless the LORD
now and forever.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: vaanachenu nevarekhe yah meatah vead-volam halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: אָ֭הַבְתִּי כִּי־יִשְׁמַ֥ע <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶת־ק֝וֹלִ֗י תַּחֲנוּנָֽי׃
Translated:
I love the LORD
for He hears my voice, my pleas;
Transliteration: ahavetiy khiy-yishema <small></small> yehovah et-kvoliy tachanunay

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִטָּ֣ה אׇזְנ֣וֹ לִ֑י וּבְיָמַ֥י אֶקְרָֽא׃
Translated:
for He turns His ear to me
whenever I call.
Transliteration: khiy-hitah ׇzenvo liy uveyamay ekera

Hebrew: אֲפָפ֤וּנִי ׀ חֶבְלֵי־מָ֗וֶת וּמְצָרֵ֣י שְׁא֣וֹל מְצָא֑וּנִי צָרָ֖ה וְיָג֣וֹן אֶמְצָֽא׃
Translated:
The bonds of death encompassed me;
the torments of Sheol overtook me.
I came upon trouble and sorrow
Transliteration: afafuniy cheveley-mavet umetsarey shevol metsauniy tsarah veyagvon emetsa

Hebrew: וּבְשֵֽׁם־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֶקְרָ֑א אָנָּ֥ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מַלְּטָ֥ה נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
and I invoked the name of the LORD,
“O LORD, save my life!”
Transliteration: uveshem-yehovah ekera anah yehovah maletah nafeshiy

Hebrew: חַנּ֣וּן יְהֹוָ֣ה וְצַדִּ֑יק וֵ֖אלֹהֵ֣ינוּ מְרַחֵֽם׃
Translated:
The LORD is gracious and beneficent;
our God is compassionate.
Transliteration: chanun yehovah vetsadiyk veloheynu merachem

Hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֣ר פְּתָאיִ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה דַּ֝לֹּתִ֗י וְלִ֣י יְהוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
The LORD protects the simple;
I was brought low and He saved me.
Transliteration: shomer fetayim yehovah dalotiy veliy yehvoshiya

Hebrew: שׁוּבִ֣י נַ֭פְשִׁי לִמְנוּחָ֑יְכִי כִּֽי־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה גָּמַ֥ל עָלָֽיְכִי׃
Translated:
Be at rest, once again, O my soul,
for the LORD has been good to you.
Transliteration: shuviy nafeshiy limenuchayekhiy khiy-yehovah gamal alayekhiy

Hebrew: כִּ֤י חִלַּ֥צְתָּ נַפְשִׁ֗י מִ֫מָּ֥וֶת אֶת־עֵינִ֥י מִן־דִּמְעָ֑ה אֶת־רַגְלִ֥י מִדֶּֽחִי׃
Translated:
You have delivered me from death,
my eyes from tears,
my feet from stumbling.
Transliteration: khiy chilatseta nafeshiy mimavet et-eyniy min-dimeah et-rageliy midechiy

Hebrew: אֶ֭תְהַלֵּךְ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּ֝אַרְצ֗וֹת הַחַיִּֽים׃
Translated:
I shall walk before the LORD
in the lands of the living.
Transliteration: etehalekhe lifeney yehovah vearetsvot hachayiym

Hebrew: הֶ֭אֱמַנְתִּי כִּ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר אֲ֝נִ֗י עָנִ֥יתִי מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
I trust [in the LORD];
out of great suffering I spoke
Transliteration: heemanetiy khiy adaver aniy aniytiy meod

Hebrew: אֲ֭נִי אָמַ֣רְתִּי בְחׇפְזִ֑י כׇּֽל־הָאָדָ֥ם כֹּזֵֽב׃
Translated:
and said rashly,
“All men are false.”
Transliteration: aniy amaretiy vechׇfeziy khׇl-haadam khozev

Hebrew: מָה־אָשִׁ֥יב לַיהֹוָ֑ה כׇּֽל־תַּגְמוּל֥וֹהִי עָלָֽי׃
Translated:
How can I repay the LORD
for all His bounties to me?
Transliteration: mah-ashiyv layhovah khׇl-tagemulvohiy alay

Hebrew: כּוֹס־יְשׁוּע֥וֹת אֶשָּׂ֑א וּבְשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶקְרָֽא׃
Translated:
I raise the cup of deliverance
and invoke the name of the LORD.
Transliteration: khvos-yeshuvot esha uveshem yehovah ekera

Hebrew: נְ֭דָרַי לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֲשַׁלֵּ֑ם נֶגְדָה־נָּ֝֗א לְכׇל־עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I will pay my vows to the LORD
in the presence of all His people.
Transliteration: nedaray layhovah ashalem negedah-na lekhׇl-amvo

Hebrew: יָ֭קָר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הַ֝מָּ֗וְתָה לַחֲסִידָֽיו׃
Translated:
The death of His faithful ones
is grievous in the LORD’s sight.
Transliteration: yakar veeyney yehovah hamavetah lachasiydayv

Hebrew: אָנָּ֣ה יְהֹוָה֮ כִּי־אֲנִ֢י עַ֫בְדֶּ֥ךָ אֲֽנִי־עַ֭בְדְּךָ בֶּן־אֲמָתֶ֑ךָ פִּ֝תַּ֗חְתָּ לְמֽוֹסֵרָֽי׃
Translated:
O LORD,
I am Your servant,
Your servant, the son of Your maidservant;
You have undone the cords that bound me.
Transliteration: anah yehovah khiy-ani֢y avedekha aniy-avedekha ven-amatekha fitacheta lemvoseray

Hebrew: לְֽךָ־אֶ֭זְבַּח זֶ֣בַח תּוֹדָ֑ה וּבְשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶקְרָֽא׃
Translated:
I will sacrifice a thank offering to You
and invoke the name of the LORD.
Transliteration: lekha-ezevach zevach tvodah uveshem yehovah ekera

Hebrew: נְ֭דָרַי לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֲשַׁלֵּ֑ם נֶגְדָה־נָּ֝֗א לְכׇל־עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
I will pay my vows to the LORD
in the presence of all His people,
Transliteration: nedaray layhovah ashalem negedah-na lekhׇl-amvo

Hebrew: בְּחַצְר֤וֹת ׀ בֵּ֤ית יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּֽת֘וֹכֵ֤כִי יְֽרוּשָׁלָ֗͏ִם הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
in the courts of the house of the LORD,
in the midst of Jerusalem.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: vechatservot veyt yehovah vetvokhekhiy yerushala͏im halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: הַֽלְל֣וּ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֑ם שַׁ֝בְּח֗וּהוּ כׇּל־הָאֻמִּֽים׃
Translated:
Praise the LORD, all you nations;
extol Him, all you peoples,
Transliteration: halelu et-yehovah khׇl-gvoyim shavechuhu khׇl-haumiym

Hebrew: כִּ֥י־גָ֘בַ֤ר עָלֵ֨ינוּ ׀ חַסְדּ֗וֹ וֶאֱמֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה לְעוֹלָ֗ם הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
for great is His steadfast love toward us;
the faithfulness of the LORD endures forever.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: khiy-gavar aleynu chasedvo veemet-yehovah levolam halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Praise the LORD, for He is good,
His steadfast love is eternal.
Transliteration: hvodu layhovah khiy-tvov khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: יֹאמַר־נָ֥א יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Let Israel declare,
“His steadfast love is eternal.”
Transliteration: yomar-na yisherael khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: יֹאמְרוּ־נָ֥א בֵֽית־אַהֲרֹ֑ן כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Let the house of Aaron declare,
“His steadfast love is eternal.”
Transliteration: yomeru-na veyt-aharon khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: יֹאמְרוּ־נָ֭א יִרְאֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Let those who fear the LORD declare,
“His steadfast love is eternal.”
Transliteration: yomeru-na yireey yehovah khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: מִֽן־הַ֭מֵּצַר קָרָ֣אתִי יָּ֑הּ עָנָ֖נִי בַמֶּרְחָ֣ב יָֽהּ׃
Translated:
In distress I called on the LORD;
the Lord answered me and brought me relief.
Transliteration: min-hametsar karatiy yah ananiy vamerechav yah

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה לִ֭י לֹ֣א אִירָ֑א מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה לִ֣י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
The LORD is on my side,
I have no fear;
what can man do to me?
Transliteration: yehovah liy lo iyra mah-yaasheh liy adam

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה לִ֭י בְּעֹזְרָ֑י וַ֝אֲנִ֗י אֶרְאֶ֥ה בְשֹׂנְאָֽי׃
Translated:
With the LORD on my side as my helper,
I will see the downfall of my foes.
Transliteration: yehovah liy veozeray vaaniy ereeh veshoneay

Hebrew: ט֗וֹב לַחֲס֥וֹת בַּיהֹוָ֑ה מִ֝בְּטֹ֗חַ בָּאָדָֽם׃
Translated:
It is better to take refuge in the LORD
than to trust in mortals;
Transliteration: tvov lachasvot vayhovah mivetocha vaadam

Hebrew: ט֗וֹב לַחֲס֥וֹת בַּיהֹוָ֑ה מִ֝בְּטֹ֗חַ בִּנְדִיבִֽים׃
Translated:
it is better to take refuge in the LORD
than to trust in the great.
Transliteration: tvov lachasvot vayhovah mivetocha vinediyviym

Hebrew: כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֥ם סְבָב֑וּנִי בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כִּ֣י אֲמִילַֽם׃
Translated:
All nations have beset me;
by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.
Transliteration: khׇl-gvoyim sevavuniy veshem yehovah khiy amiylam

Hebrew: סַבּ֥וּנִי גַם־סְבָב֑וּנִי בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כִּ֣י אֲמִילַֽם׃
Translated:
They beset me, they surround me;
by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.
Transliteration: savuniy gam-sevavuniy veshem yehovah khiy amiylam

Hebrew: סַבּ֤וּנִי כִדְבוֹרִ֗ים דֹּ֭עֲכוּ כְּאֵ֣שׁ קוֹצִ֑ים בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כִּ֣י אֲמִילַֽם׃
Translated:
They have beset me like bees;
they shall be extinguished like burning thorns;
by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.
Transliteration: savuniy khidevvoriym doakhu kheesh kvotsiym veshem yehovah khiy amiylam

Hebrew: דַּחֹ֣ה דְחִיתַ֣נִי לִנְפֹּ֑ל וַ֖יהֹוָ֣ה עֲזָרָֽנִי׃
Translated:
You pressed me hard,
I nearly fell;
but the LORD helped me.
Transliteration: dachoh dechiytaniy linefol vayhovah azaraniy

Hebrew: עׇזִּ֣י וְזִמְרָ֣ת יָ֑הּ וַֽיְהִי־לִ֝֗י לִישׁוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
The LORD is my strength and might;
He has become my deliverance.
Transliteration: ׇziy vezimerat yah vayehiy-liy liyshuah

Hebrew: ק֤וֹל ׀ רִנָּ֬ה וִישׁוּעָ֗ה בְּאׇהֳלֵ֥י צַדִּיקִ֑ים יְמִ֥ין יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עֹ֣שָׂה חָֽיִל׃
Translated:
The tents of the victorious resound with joyous shouts of deliverance,
“The right hand of the LORD is triumphant!
Transliteration: kvol rinah viyshuah veׇholey tsadiykiym yemiyn yehovah oshah chayiil

Hebrew: יְמִ֣ין יְ֭הֹוָה רוֹמֵמָ֑ה יְמִ֥ין יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עֹ֣שָׂה חָֽיִל׃
Translated:
The right hand of the LORD is exalted!
The right hand of the LORD is triumphant!”
Transliteration: yemiyn yehovah rvomemah yemiyn yehovah oshah chayiil

Hebrew: לֹא־אָמ֥וּת כִּֽי־אֶחְיֶ֑ה וַ֝אֲסַפֵּ֗ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥י יָֽהּ׃
Translated:
I shall not die but live
and proclaim the works of the LORD.
Transliteration: lo-amut khiy-echeyeh vaasafer maashey yah

Hebrew: יַסֹּ֣ר יִסְּרַ֣נִּי יָּ֑הּ וְ֝לַמָּ֗וֶת לֹ֣א נְתָנָֽנִי׃
Translated:
The LORD punished me severely,
but did not hand me over to death.
Transliteration: yasor yiseraniy yah velamavet lo netananiy

Hebrew: פִּתְחוּ־לִ֥י שַׁעֲרֵי־צֶ֑דֶק אָבֹא־בָ֝֗ם אוֹדֶ֥ה יָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Open the gates of victory for me
that I may enter them and praise the LORD.
Transliteration: fitechu-liy shaarey-tsedek avo-vam vodeh yah

Hebrew: זֶה־הַשַּׁ֥עַר לַיהֹוָ֑ה צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים יָבֹ֥אוּ בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
This is the gateway to the LORD—
the victorious shall enter through it.
Transliteration: zeh-hashaar layhovah tsadiykiym yavou vvo

Hebrew: א֭וֹדְךָ כִּ֣י עֲנִיתָ֑נִי וַתְּהִי־לִ֝֗י לִישׁוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
I praise You, for You have answered me,
and have become my deliverance.
Transliteration: vodekha khiy aniytaniy vatehiy-liy liyshuah

Hebrew: אֶ֭בֶן מָאֲס֣וּ הַבּוֹנִ֑ים הָ֝יְתָ֗ה לְרֹ֣אשׁ פִּנָּֽה׃
Translated:
The stone that the builders rejected
has become the chief cornerstone.
Transliteration: even maasu havvoniym hayetah lerosh finah

Hebrew: מֵאֵ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה הָ֣יְתָה זֹּ֑את הִ֖יא נִפְלָ֣את בְּעֵינֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
This is the LORD’s doing;
it is marvelous in our sight.
Transliteration: meet yehovah hayetah zot hiy nifelat veeyneynu

Hebrew: זֶה־הַ֭יּוֹם עָשָׂ֣ה יְהֹוָ֑ה נָגִ֖ילָה וְנִשְׂמְחָ֣ה בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
This is the day that the LORD has made—
let us exult and rejoice on it.
Transliteration: zeh-hayyvom ashah yehovah nagiylah venishemechah vvo

Hebrew: אָנָּ֣א יְ֭הֹוָה הוֹשִׁ֘יעָ֥ה נָּ֑א אָנָּ֥א יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הַצְלִ֘יחָ֥ה נָּֽא׃
Translated:
O LORD, deliver us!
O LORD, let us prosper!
Transliteration: ana yehovah hvoshiyah na ana yehovah hatseliychah na

Hebrew: בָּר֣וּךְ הַ֭בָּא בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה בֵּ֝רַ֥כְנוּכֶ֗ם מִבֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
May he who enters be blessed in the name of the LORD;
we bless you from the House of the LORD.
Transliteration: varukhe hava veshem yehovah verakhenukhem miveyt yehovah

Hebrew: אֵ֤ל ׀ יְהֹוָה֮ וַיָּ֢אֶ֫ר לָ֥נוּ אִסְרוּ־חַ֥ג בַּעֲבֹתִ֑ים עַד־קַ֝רְנ֗וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated:
The LORD is God;
He has given us light;
bind the festal offering to the horns of the altar with cords.
Transliteration: el yehovah vaya֢er lanu iseru-chag vaavotiym ad-karenvot hamizevecha

Hebrew: אֵלִ֣י אַתָּ֣ה וְאוֹדֶ֑ךָּ אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י אֲרוֹמְמֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
You are my God and I will praise You;
You are my God and I will extol You.
Transliteration: eliy atah vevodekha elohay arvomemekha

Hebrew: הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Praise the LORD for He is good,
His steadfast love is eternal.
Transliteration: hvodu layhovah khiy-tvov khiy levolam chasedvo {f}

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֥י תְמִֽימֵי־דָ֑רֶךְ הַ֝הֹלְכִ֗ים בְּתוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Happy are those whose way is blameless,
who follow the teaching of the LORD.
Transliteration: asherey temiymey-darekhe haholekhiym vetvorat yehovah

Hebrew: אַ֭שְׁרֵי נֹצְרֵ֥י עֵדֹתָ֗יו בְּכׇל־לֵ֥ב יִדְרְשֽׁוּהוּ׃
Translated:
Happy are those who observe His decrees,
who turn to Him wholeheartedly.
Transliteration: asherey notserey edotayv vekhׇl-lev yidereshuhu

Hebrew: אַ֭ף לֹא־פָעֲל֣וּ עַוְלָ֑ה בִּדְרָכָ֥יו הָלָֽכוּ׃
Translated:
They have done no wrong,
but have followed His ways.
Transliteration: af lo-faalu avelah viderakhayv halakhu

Hebrew: אַ֭תָּה צִוִּ֥יתָה פִקֻּדֶ֗יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
You have commanded that Your precepts
be kept diligently.
Transliteration: atah tsiviytah fikudeykha lishemor meod

Hebrew: אַ֭חֲלַי יִכֹּ֥נוּ דְרָכָ֗י לִשְׁמֹ֥ר חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Would that my ways were firm
in keeping Your laws;
Transliteration: achalay yikhonu derakhay lishemor chukeykha

Hebrew: אָ֥ז לֹא־אֵב֑וֹשׁ בְּ֝הַבִּיטִ֗י אֶל־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
then I would not be ashamed
when I regard all Your commandments.
Transliteration: az lo-evvosh vehaviytiy el-khׇl-mitsevoteykha

Hebrew: א֭וֹדְךָ בְּיֹ֣שֶׁר לֵבָ֑ב בְּ֝לׇמְדִ֗י מִשְׁפְּטֵ֥י צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I will praise You with a sincere heart
as I learn Your just rules.
Transliteration: vodekha veyosher levav velׇmediy mishefetey tsidekekha

Hebrew: אֶת־חֻקֶּ֥יךָ אֶשְׁמֹ֑ר אַֽל־תַּעַזְבֵ֥נִי עַד־מְאֹֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will keep Your laws;
do not utterly forsake me.
Transliteration: et-chukeykha eshemor al-taazeveniy ad-meod {f}

Hebrew: בַּמֶּ֣ה יְזַכֶּה־נַּ֭עַר אֶת־אׇרְח֑וֹ לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
How can a young man keep his way pure?—
by holding to Your word.
Transliteration: vameh yezakheh-naar et-ׇrechvo lishemor khidevarekha

Hebrew: בְּכׇל־לִבִּ֥י דְרַשְׁתִּ֑יךָ אַל־תַּ֝שְׁגֵּ֗נִי מִמִּצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I have turned to You with all my heart;
do not let me stray from Your commandments.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-liviy derashetiykha al-tashegeniy mimitsevoteykha

Hebrew: בְּ֭לִבִּי צָפַ֣נְתִּי אִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ לְ֝מַ֗עַן לֹ֣א אֶחֱטָא־לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
In my heart I treasure Your promise;
therefore I do not sin against You.
Transliteration: veliviy tsafanetiy imeratekha lemaan lo echeta-lakhe

Hebrew: בָּר֖וּךְ אַתָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֗ה לַמְּדֵ֥נִי חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Blessed are You, O LORD;
train me in Your laws.
Transliteration: varukhe atah yehovah lamedeniy chukeykha

Hebrew: בִּשְׂפָתַ֥י סִפַּ֑רְתִּי כֹּ֝֗ל מִשְׁפְּטֵי־פִֽיךָ׃
Translated:
With my lips I rehearse
all the rules You proclaimed.
Transliteration: vishefatay sifaretiy khol mishefetey-fiykha

Hebrew: בְּדֶ֖רֶךְ עֵדְוֺתֶ֥יךָ שַּׂ֗שְׂתִּי כְּעַ֣ל כׇּל־הֽוֹן׃
Translated:
I rejoice over the way of Your decrees
as over all riches.
Transliteration: vederekhe edevoteykha shashetiy kheal khׇl-hvon

Hebrew: בְּפִקּוּדֶ֥יךָ אָשִׂ֑יחָה וְ֝אַבִּ֗יטָה אֹֽרְחֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I study Your precepts;
I regard Your ways;
Transliteration: vefikudeykha ashiychah veaviytah orechoteykha

Hebrew: בְּחֻקֹּתֶ֥יךָ אֶֽשְׁתַּעֲשָׁ֑ע לֹ֖א אֶשְׁכַּ֣ח דְּבָרֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
I take delight in Your laws;
I will not neglect Your word.
Transliteration: vechukoteykha eshetaasha lo eshekhach devarekha {f}

Hebrew: גְּמֹ֖ל עַל־עַבְדְּךָ֥ אֶחְיֶ֗ה וְאֶשְׁמְרָ֥ה דְבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Deal kindly with Your servant,
that I may live to keep Your word.
Transliteration: gemol al-avedekha echeyeh veeshemerah devarekha

Hebrew: גַּל־עֵינַ֥י וְאַבִּ֑יטָה נִ֝פְלָא֗וֹת מִתּוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Open my eyes, that I may perceive
the wonders of Your teaching.
Transliteration: gal-eynay veaviytah nifelavot mitvoratekha

Hebrew: גֵּ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י בָאָ֑רֶץ אַל־תַּסְתֵּ֥ר מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי מִצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I am only a sojourner in the land;
do not hide Your commandments from me.
Transliteration: ger anokhiy vaarets al-taseter mimeniy mitsevoteykha

Hebrew: גָּרְסָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֣י לְתַאֲבָ֑ה אֶֽל־מִשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ בְכׇל־עֵֽת׃
Translated:
My soul is consumed with longing
for Your rules at all times.
Transliteration: garesah nafeshiy letaavah el-mishefateykha vekhׇl-et

Hebrew: גָּ֭עַרְתָּ זֵדִ֣ים אֲרוּרִ֑ים הַ֝שֹּׁגִ֗ים מִמִּצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You blast the accursed insolent ones
who stray from Your commandments.
Transliteration: gaareta zediym aruriym hashogiym mimitsevoteykha

Hebrew: גַּ֣ל מֵ֭עָלַי חֶרְפָּ֣ה וָב֑וּז כִּ֖י עֵדֹתֶ֣יךָ נָצָֽרְתִּי׃
Translated:
Take away from me taunt and abuse,
because I observe Your decrees.
Transliteration: gal mealay cherefah vavuz khiy edoteykha natsaretiy

Hebrew: גַּ֤ם יָשְׁב֣וּ שָׂ֭רִים בִּ֣י נִדְבָּ֑רוּ עַ֝בְדְּךָ֗ יָשִׂ֥יחַ בְּחֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Though princes meet and speak against me,
Your servant studies Your laws.
Transliteration: gam yashevu shariym viy nidevaru avedekha yashiycha vechukeykha

Hebrew: גַּֽם־עֵ֭דֹתֶיךָ שַׁעֲשֻׁעָ֗י אַנְשֵׁ֥י עֲצָתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
For Your decrees are my delight,
my intimate companions.
Transliteration: gam-edoteykha shaashuay aneshey atsatiy {f}

Hebrew: דָּבְקָ֣ה לֶעָפָ֣ר נַפְשִׁ֑י חַ֝יֵּ֗נִי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
My soul clings to the dust;
revive me in accordance with Your word.
Transliteration: davekah leafar nafeshiy chayeniy khidevarekha

Hebrew: דְּרָכַ֣י סִ֭פַּרְתִּי וַֽתַּעֲנֵ֗נִי לַמְּדֵ֥נִי חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I have declared my way, and You have answered me;
train me in Your laws.
Transliteration: derakhay sifaretiy vataaneniy lamedeniy chukeykha

Hebrew: דֶּרֶךְ־פִּקּוּדֶ֥יךָ הֲבִינֵ֑נִי וְ֝אָשִׂ֗יחָה בְּנִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Make me understand the way of Your precepts,
that I may study Your wondrous acts.
Transliteration: derekhe-fikudeykha haviyneniy veashiychah venifelevoteykha

Hebrew: דָּלְפָ֣ה נַ֭פְשִׁי מִתּוּגָ֑ה קַ֝יְּמֵ֗נִי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I am racked with grief;
sustain me in accordance with Your word.
Transliteration: dalefah nafeshiy mitugah kayemeniy khidevarekha

Hebrew: דֶּֽרֶךְ־שֶׁ֭קֶר הָסֵ֣ר מִמֶּ֑נִּי וְֽתוֹרָתְךָ֥ חׇנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
Remove all false ways from me;
favor me with Your teaching.
Transliteration: derekhe-sheker haser mimeniy vetvoratekha chׇneniy

Hebrew: דֶּֽרֶךְ־אֱמוּנָ֥ה בָחָ֑רְתִּי מִשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ שִׁוִּֽיתִי׃
Translated:
I have chosen the way of faithfulness;
I have set Your rules before me.
Transliteration: derekhe-emunah vacharetiy mishefateykha shiviytiy

Hebrew: דָּבַ֥קְתִּי בְעֵדְוֺתֶ֑יךָ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אַל־תְּבִישֵֽׁנִי׃
Translated:
I cling to Your decrees;
O LORD, do not put me to shame.
Transliteration: davaketiy veedevoteykha yehovah al-teviysheniy

Hebrew: דֶּֽרֶךְ־מִצְוֺתֶ֥יךָ אָר֑וּץ כִּ֖י תַרְחִ֣יב לִבִּֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
I eagerly pursue Your commandments,
for You broaden my understanding.
Transliteration: derekhe-mitsevoteykha aruts khiy tarechiyv liviy {f}

Hebrew: הוֹרֵ֣נִי יְ֭הֹוָה דֶּ֥רֶךְ חֻקֶּ֗יךָ וְאֶצְּרֶ֥נָּה עֵֽקֶב׃
Translated:
Teach me, O LORD, the way of Your laws;
I will observe them to the utmost.
Transliteration: hvoreniy yehovah derekhe chukeykha veetserenah ekev

Hebrew: הֲ֭בִינֵנִי וְאֶצְּרָ֥ה תוֹרָתֶ֗ךָ וְאֶשְׁמְרֶ֥נָּה בְכׇל־לֵֽב׃
Translated:
Give me understanding, that I may observe Your teaching
and keep it wholeheartedly.
Transliteration: haviyneniy veetserah tvoratekha veeshemerenah vekhׇl-lev

Hebrew: הַ֭דְרִיכֵנִי בִּנְתִ֣יב מִצְוֺתֶ֑יךָ כִּי־ב֥וֹ חָפָֽצְתִּי׃
Translated:
Lead me in the path of Your commandments,
for that is my concern.
Transliteration: haderiykheniy vinetiyv mitsevoteykha khiy-vvo chafatsetiy

Hebrew: הַט־לִ֭בִּי אֶל־עֵדְוֺתֶ֗יךָ וְאַ֣ל אֶל־בָּֽצַע׃
Translated:
Turn my heart to Your decrees
and not to love of gain.
Transliteration: hat-liviy el-edevoteykha veal el-vatsa

Hebrew: הַעֲבֵ֣ר עֵ֭ינַי מֵרְא֣וֹת שָׁ֑וְא בִּדְרָכֶ֥ךָ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
Avert my eyes from seeing falsehood;
by Your ways preserve me.
Transliteration: haaver eynay merevot shave viderakhekha chayeniy

Hebrew: הָקֵ֣ם לְ֭עַבְדְּךָ אִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ אֲ֝שֶׁ֗ר לְיִרְאָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Fulfill Your promise to Your servant,
which is for those who worship You.
Transliteration: hakem leavedekha imeratekha asher leyireatekha

Hebrew: הַעֲבֵ֣ר חֶ֭רְפָּתִי אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָגֹ֑רְתִּי כִּ֖י מִשְׁפָּטֶ֣יךָ טוֹבִֽים׃
Translated:
Remove the taunt that I dread,
for Your rules are good.
Transliteration: haaver cherefatiy asher yagoretiy khiy mishefateykha tvoviym

Hebrew: הִ֭נֵּה תָּאַ֣בְתִּי לְפִקֻּדֶ֑יךָ בְּצִדְקָתְךָ֥ חַיֵּֽנִי׃ {פ}
Translated:
See, I have longed for Your precepts;
by Your righteousness preserve me.
Transliteration: hineh taavetiy lefikudeykha vetsidekatekha chayeniy {f}

Hebrew: וִיבֹאֻ֣נִי חֲסָדֶ֣ךָ יְהֹוָ֑ה תְּ֝שׁ֥וּעָתְךָ֗ כְּאִמְרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
May Your steadfast love reach me, O LORD,
Your deliverance, as You have promised.
Transliteration: viyvouniy chasadekha yehovah teshuatekha kheimeratekha

Hebrew: וְאֶעֱנֶ֣ה חֹרְפִ֣י דָבָ֑ר כִּֽי־בָ֝טַ֗חְתִּי בִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I shall have an answer for those who taunt me,
for I have put my trust in Your word.
Transliteration: veeeneh chorefiy davar khiy-vatachetiy videvarekha

Hebrew: וְֽאַל־תַּצֵּ֬ל מִפִּ֣י דְבַר־אֱמֶ֣ת עַד־מְאֹ֑ד כִּ֖י לְמִשְׁפָּטֶ֣ךָ יִחָֽלְתִּי׃
Translated:
Do not utterly take the truth away from my mouth,
for I have put my hope in Your rules.
Transliteration: veal-tatsel mifiy devar-emet ad-meod khiy lemishefatekha yichaletiy

Hebrew: וְאֶשְׁמְרָ֖ה תוֹרָתְךָ֥ תָמִ֗יד לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
Translated:
I will always obey Your teaching,
forever and ever.
Transliteration: veeshemerah tvoratekha tamiyd levolam vaed

Hebrew: וְאֶתְהַלְּכָ֥ה בָרְחָבָ֑ה כִּ֖י פִקֻּדֶ֣יךָ דָרָֽשְׁתִּי׃
Translated:
I will walk about at ease,
for I have turned to Your precepts.
Transliteration: veetehalekhah varechavah khiy fikudeykha darashetiy

Hebrew: וַאֲדַבְּרָ֣ה בְ֭עֵדֹתֶיךָ נֶ֥גֶד מְלָכִ֗ים וְלֹ֣א אֵבֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated:
I will speak of Your decrees,
and not be ashamed in the presence of kings.
Transliteration: vaadaverah veedoteykha neged melakhiym velo evvosh

Hebrew: וְאֶשְׁתַּעֲשַׁ֥ע בְּמִצְוֺתֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָהָֽבְתִּי׃
Translated:
I will delight in Your commandments,
which I love.
Transliteration: veeshetaasha vemitsevoteykha asher ahavetiy

Hebrew: וְאֶשָּֽׂא־כַפַּ֗י אֶֽל־מִ֭צְוֺתֶיךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָהָ֗בְתִּי וְאָשִׂ֥יחָה בְחֻקֶּֽיךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
I reach out for Your commandments, which I love;
I study Your laws.
Transliteration: veesha-khafay el-mitsevoteykha asher ahavetiy veashiychah vechukeykha {f}

Hebrew: זְכֹר־דָּבָ֥ר לְעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ עַ֝֗ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִחַלְתָּֽנִי׃
Translated:
Remember Your word to Your servant
through which You have given me hope.
Transliteration: zekhor-davar leavedekha al asher yichaletaniy

Hebrew: זֹ֣את נֶחָמָתִ֣י בְעׇנְיִ֑י כִּ֖י אִמְרָתְךָ֣ חִיָּֽתְנִי׃
Translated:
This is my comfort in my affliction,
that Your promise has preserved me.
Transliteration: zot nechamatiy veׇneyiy khiy imeratekha chiyateniy

Hebrew: זֵ֭דִים הֱלִיצֻ֣נִי עַד־מְאֹ֑ד מִ֝תּ֥וֹרָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א נָטִֽיתִי׃
Translated:
Though the arrogant have cruelly mocked me,
I have not swerved from Your teaching.
Transliteration: zediym heliytsuniy ad-meod mitvoratekha lo natiytiy

Hebrew: זָ֘כַ֤רְתִּי מִשְׁפָּטֶ֖יךָ מֵעוֹלָ֥ם <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֗ה וָאֶתְנֶחָֽם׃
Translated:
I remember Your rules of old, O LORD,
and find comfort in them.
Transliteration: zakharetiy mishefateykha mevolam <small></small> yehovah vaetenecham

Hebrew: זַלְעָפָ֣ה אֲ֭חָזַתְנִי מֵרְשָׁעִ֑ים עֹ֝זְבֵ֗י תּוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I am seized with rage
because of the wicked who forsake Your teaching.
Transliteration: zaleafah achazateniy mereshaiym ozevey tvoratekha

Hebrew: זְ֭מִרוֹת הָיוּ־לִ֥י חֻקֶּ֗יךָ בְּבֵ֣ית מְגוּרָֽי׃
Translated:
Your laws are a source of strength to me
wherever I may dwell.
Transliteration: zemirvot hayu-liy chukeykha veveyt meguray

Hebrew: זָ֘כַ֤רְתִּי בַלַּ֣יְלָה שִׁמְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֑ה וָ֝אֶשְׁמְרָ֗ה תּוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I remember Your name at night, O LORD,
and obey Your teaching.
Transliteration: zakharetiy valayelah shimekha yehovah vaeshemerah tvoratekha

Hebrew: זֹ֥את הָיְתָה־לִּ֑י כִּ֖י פִקֻּדֶ֣יךָ נָצָֽרְתִּי׃ {פ}
Translated:
This has been my lot,
for I have observed Your precepts.
Transliteration: zot hayetah-liy khiy fikudeykha natsaretiy {f}

Hebrew: חֶלְקִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אָמַ֗רְתִּי לִשְׁמֹ֥ר דְּבָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
The LORD is my portion;
I have resolved to keep Your words.
Transliteration: chelekiy yehovah amaretiy lishemor devareykha

Hebrew: חִלִּ֣יתִי פָנֶ֣יךָ בְכׇל־לֵ֑ב חׇ֝נֵּ֗נִי כְּאִמְרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I have implored You with all my heart;
have mercy on me, in accordance with Your promise.
Transliteration: chiliytiy faneykha vekhׇl-lev chׇneniy kheimeratekha

Hebrew: חִשַּׁ֥בְתִּי דְרָכָ֑י וָאָשִׁ֥יבָה רַ֝גְלַ֗י אֶל־עֵדֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I have considered my ways,
and have turned back to Your decrees.
Transliteration: chishavetiy derakhay vaashiyvah ragelay el-edoteykha

Hebrew: חַ֭שְׁתִּי וְלֹ֣א הִתְמַהְמָ֑הְתִּי לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר מִצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I have hurried and not delayed
to keep Your commandments.
Transliteration: chashetiy velo hitemahemahetiy lishemor mitsevoteykha

Hebrew: חֶבְלֵ֣י רְשָׁעִ֣ים עִוְּדֻ֑נִי תּ֥֝וֹרָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
Translated:
Though the bonds of the wicked are coiled round me,
I have not neglected Your teaching.
Transliteration: cheveley reshaiym iveduniy tvoratekha lo shakhachetiy

Hebrew: חֲצֽוֹת־לַ֗יְלָה אָ֭קוּם לְהוֹד֣וֹת לָ֑ךְ עַ֝֗ל מִשְׁפְּטֵ֥י צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I arise at midnight to praise You
for Your just rules.
Transliteration: chatsvot-layelah akum lehvodvot lakhe al mishefetey tsidekekha

Hebrew: חָבֵ֣ר אָ֭נִי לְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְרֵא֑וּךָ וּ֝לְשֹׁמְרֵ֗י פִּקּוּדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I am a companion to all who fear You,
to those who keep Your precepts.
Transliteration: chaver aniy lekhׇl-asher yereukha uleshomerey fikudeykha

Hebrew: חַסְדְּךָ֣ יְ֭הֹוָה מָלְאָ֥ה הָאָ֗רֶץ חֻקֶּ֥יךָ לַמְּדֵֽנִי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Your steadfast love, O LORD, fills the earth;
teach me Your laws.
Transliteration: chasedekha yehovah maleah haarets chukeykha lamedeniy {f}

Hebrew: ט֭וֹב עָשִׂ֣יתָ עִֽם־עַבְדְּךָ֑ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
You have treated Your servant well,
according to Your word, O LORD.
Transliteration: tvov ashiyta im-avedekha yehovah khidevarekha

Hebrew: ט֤וּב טַ֣עַם וָדַ֣עַת לַמְּדֵ֑נִי כִּ֖י בְמִצְוֺתֶ֣יךָ הֶאֱמָֽנְתִּי׃
Translated:
Teach me good sense and knowledge,
for I have put my trust in Your commandments.
Transliteration: tuv taam vadaat lamedeniy khiy vemitsevoteykha heemanetiy

Hebrew: טֶ֣רֶם אֶ֭עֱנֶה אֲנִ֣י שֹׁגֵ֑ג וְ֝עַתָּ֗ה אִמְרָתְךָ֥ שָׁמָֽרְתִּי׃
Translated:
Before I was humbled I went astray,
but now I keep Your word.
Transliteration: terem eeneh aniy shogeg veatah imeratekha shamaretiy

Hebrew: טוֹב־אַתָּ֥ה וּמֵטִ֗יב לַמְּדֵ֥נִי חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You are good and beneficent;
teach me Your laws.
Transliteration: tvov-atah umetiyv lamedeniy chukeykha

Hebrew: טָפְל֬וּ עָלַ֣י שֶׁ֣קֶר זֵדִ֑ים אֲ֝נִ֗י בְּכׇל־לֵ֤ב ׀ אֶצֹּ֬ר פִּקּוּדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Though the arrogant have accused me falsely,
I observe Your precepts wholeheartedly.
Transliteration: tafelu alay sheker zediym aniy vekhׇl-lev etsor fikudeykha

Hebrew: טָפַ֣שׁ כַּחֵ֣לֶב לִבָּ֑ם אֲ֝נִ֗י תּוֹרָתְךָ֥ שִׁעֲשָֽׁעְתִּי׃
Translated:
Their minds are thick like fat;
as for me, Your teaching is my delight.
Transliteration: tafash khachelev livam aniy tvoratekha shiashaetiy

Hebrew: טֽוֹב־לִ֥י כִי־עֻנֵּ֑יתִי לְ֝מַ֗עַן אֶלְמַ֥ד חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
It was good for me that I was humbled,
so that I might learn Your laws.
Transliteration: tvov-liy khiy-uneytiy lemaan elemad chukeykha

Hebrew: טֽוֹב־לִ֥י תוֹרַת־פִּ֑יךָ מֵ֝אַלְפֵ֗י זָהָ֥ב וָכָֽסֶף׃ {פ}
Translated:
I prefer the teaching You proclaimed
to thousands of gold and silver pieces.
Transliteration: tvov-liy tvorat-fiykha mealefey zahav vakhasef {f}

Hebrew: יָדֶ֣יךָ עָ֭שׂוּנִי וַֽיְכוֹנְנ֑וּנִי הֲ֝בִינֵ֗נִי וְאֶלְמְדָ֥ה מִצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Your hands made me and fashioned me;
give me understanding that I may learn Your commandments.
Transliteration: yadeykha ashuniy vayekhvonenuniy haviyneniy veelemedah mitsevoteykha

Hebrew: יְ֭רֵאֶיךָ יִרְא֣וּנִי וְיִשְׂמָ֑חוּ כִּ֖י לִדְבָרְךָ֣ יִחָֽלְתִּי׃
Translated:
Those who fear You will see me and rejoice,
for I have put my hope in Your word.
Transliteration: yereeykha yireuniy veyishemachu khiy lidevarekha yichaletiy

Hebrew: יָדַ֣עְתִּי יְ֭הֹוָה כִּי־צֶ֣דֶק מִשְׁפָּטֶ֑יךָ וֶ֝אֱמוּנָ֗ה עִנִּיתָֽנִי׃
Translated:
I know, O LORD, that Your rulings are just;
rightly have You humbled me.
Transliteration: yadaetiy yehovah khiy-tsedek mishefateykha veemunah iniytaniy

Hebrew: יְהִי־נָ֣א חַסְדְּךָ֣ לְנַחֲמֵ֑נִי כְּאִמְרָתְךָ֥ לְעַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
May Your steadfast love comfort me
in accordance with Your promise to Your servant.
Transliteration: yehiy-na chasedekha lenachameniy kheimeratekha leavedekha

Hebrew: יְבֹא֣וּנִי רַחֲמֶ֣יךָ וְאֶחְיֶ֑ה כִּי־ת֥֝וֹרָתְךָ֗ שַׁעֲשֻׁעָֽי׃
Translated:
May Your mercy reach me, that I might live,
for Your teaching is my delight.
Transliteration: yevouniy rachameykha veecheyeh khiy-tvoratekha shaashuay

Hebrew: יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ זֵ֭דִים כִּי־שֶׁ֣קֶר עִוְּת֑וּנִי אֲ֝נִ֗י אָשִׂ֥יחַ בְּפִקּוּדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Let the insolent be dismayed, for they have wronged me without cause;
I will study Your precepts.
Transliteration: eivoshu zediym khiy-sheker ivetuniy aniy ashiycha vefikudeykha

Hebrew: יָשׁ֣וּבוּ לִ֣י יְרֵאֶ֑יךָ (וידעו) [וְ֝יֹדְעֵ֗י] עֵדֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
May those who fear You,
those who know Your decrees,
turn again to me.
Transliteration: yashuvu liy yereeykha (vydv) [veyodeey] edoteykha

Hebrew: יְהִי־לִבִּ֣י תָמִ֣ים בְּחֻקֶּ֑יךָ לְ֝מַ֗עַן לֹ֣א אֵבֽוֹשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated:
May I wholeheartedly follow Your laws
so that I do not come to grief.
Transliteration: yehiy-liviy tamiym vechukeykha lemaan lo evvosh {f}

Hebrew: כָּלְתָ֣ה לִתְשׁוּעָתְךָ֣ נַפְשִׁ֑י לִדְבָרְךָ֥ יִחָֽלְתִּי׃
Translated:
I long for Your deliverance;
I hope for Your word.
Transliteration: khaletah liteshuatekha nafeshiy lidevarekha yichaletiy

Hebrew: כָּל֣וּ עֵ֭ינַי לְאִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ לֵ֝אמֹ֗ר מָתַ֥י תְּֽנַחֲמֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
My eyes pine away for Your promise;
I say, “When will You comfort me?”
Transliteration: khalu eynay leimeratekha lemor matay tenachameniy

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הָ֭יִיתִי כְּנֹ֣אד בְּקִיט֑וֹר חֻ֝קֶּ֗יךָ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
Translated:
Though I have become like a water-skin dried in smoke,
I have not neglected Your laws.
Transliteration: khiy-hayiiytiy khenod vekiytvor chukeykha lo shakhachetiy

Hebrew: כַּמָּ֥ה יְמֵֽי־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ מָתַ֬י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בְרֹדְפַ֣י מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated:
How long has Your servant to live?
when will You bring my persecutors to judgment?
Transliteration: khamah yemey-avedekha matay taasheh verodefay mishefat

Hebrew: כָּרוּ־לִ֣י זֵדִ֣ים שִׁיח֑וֹת אֲ֝שֶׁ֗ר לֹ֣א כְתוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
The insolent have dug pits for me,
flouting Your teaching.
Transliteration: kharu-liy zediym shiychvot asher lo khetvoratekha

Hebrew: כׇּל־מִצְוֺתֶ֥יךָ אֱמוּנָ֑ה שֶׁ֖קֶר רְדָפ֣וּנִי עׇזְרֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
All Your commandments are enduring;
I am persecuted without cause; help me!
Transliteration: khׇl-mitsevoteykha emunah sheker redafuniy ׇzereniy

Hebrew: כִּ֭מְעַט כִּלּ֣וּנִי בָאָ֑רֶץ וַ֝אֲנִ֗י לֹא־עָזַ֥בְתִּי פִקֻּדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Though they almost wiped me off the earth,
I did not abandon Your precepts.
Transliteration: khimeat khiluniy vaarets vaaniy lo-azavetiy fikudeykha

Hebrew: כְּחַסְדְּךָ֥ חַיֵּ֑נִי וְ֝אֶשְׁמְרָ֗ה עֵד֥וּת פִּֽיךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
As befits Your steadfast love, preserve me,
so that I may keep the decree You proclaimed.
Transliteration: khechasedekha chayeniy veeshemerah edut fiykha {f}

Hebrew: לְעוֹלָ֥ם יְהֹוָ֑ה דְּ֝בָרְךָ֗ נִצָּ֥ב בַּשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated:
The LORD exists forever;
Your word stands firm in heaven.
Transliteration: levolam yehovah devarekha nitsav vashamayiim

Hebrew: לְדֹ֣ר וָ֭דֹר אֱמוּנָתֶ֑ךָ כּוֹנַ֥נְתָּֽ אֶ֝֗רֶץ וַֽתַּעֲמֹֽד׃
Translated:
Your faithfulness is for all generations;
You have established the earth, and it stands.
Transliteration: ledor vador emunatekha khvonaneta erets vataamod

Hebrew: לְֽ֭מִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ עָמְד֣וּ הַיּ֑וֹם כִּ֖י הַכֹּ֣ל עֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
They stand this day to [carry out] Your rulings,
for all are Your servants.
Transliteration: lemishefateykha amedu hayyvom khiy hakhol avadeykha

Hebrew: לוּלֵ֣י ת֭וֹרָתְךָ שַׁעֲשֻׁעָ֑י אָ֝֗ז אָבַ֥דְתִּי בְעׇנְיִֽי׃
Translated:
Were not Your teaching my delight
I would have perished in my affliction.
Transliteration: luley tvoratekha shaashuay az avadetiy veׇneyiy

Hebrew: לְ֭עוֹלָם לֹא־אֶשְׁכַּ֣ח פִּקּוּדֶ֑יךָ כִּ֥י בָ֝֗ם חִיִּיתָֽנִי׃
Translated:
I will never neglect Your precepts,
for You have preserved my life through them.
Transliteration: levolam lo-eshekhach fikudeykha khiy vam chiyiytaniy

Hebrew: לְֽךָ־אֲ֭נִי הוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי כִּ֖י פִקּוּדֶ֣יךָ דָרָֽשְׁתִּי׃
Translated:
I am Yours; save me!
For I have turned to Your precepts.
Transliteration: lekha-aniy hvoshiyeniy khiy fikudeykha darashetiy

Hebrew: לִ֤י קִוּ֣וּ רְשָׁעִ֣ים לְאַבְּדֵ֑נִי עֵ֝דֹתֶ֗יךָ אֶתְבּוֹנָֽן׃
Translated:
The wicked hope to destroy me,
but I ponder Your decrees.
Transliteration: liy kiuu reshaiym leavedeniy edoteykha etevvonan

Hebrew: לְֽכׇל־תִּ֭כְלָה רָאִ֣יתִי קֵ֑ץ רְחָבָ֖ה מִצְוָתְךָ֣ מְאֹֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
I have seen that all things have their limit,
but Your commandment is broad beyond measure.
Transliteration: lekhׇl-tikhelah raiytiy kets rechavah mitsevatekha meod {f}

Hebrew: מָה־אָהַ֥בְתִּי תוֹרָתֶ֑ךָ כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם הִ֣יא שִׂיחָתִֽי׃
Translated:
O how I love Your teaching!
It is my study all day long.
Transliteration: mah-ahavetiy tvoratekha khׇl-hayyvom hiy shiychatiy

Hebrew: מֵֽ֭אֹיְבַי תְּחַכְּמֵ֣נִי מִצְוֺתֶ֑ךָ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם הִיא־לִֽי׃
Translated:
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies;
they always stand by me.
Transliteration: meoyevay techakhemeniy mitsevotekha khiy levolam hiy-liy

Hebrew: מִכׇּל־מְלַמְּדַ֥י הִשְׂכַּ֑לְתִּי כִּ֥י עֵ֝דְוֺתֶ֗יךָ שִׂ֣יחָה לִֽי׃
Translated:
I have gained more insight than all my teachers,
for Your decrees are my study.
Transliteration: mikhׇl-melameday hishekhaletiy khiy edevoteykha shiychah liy

Hebrew: מִזְּקֵנִ֥ים אֶתְבּוֹנָ֑ן כִּ֖י פִקּוּדֶ֣יךָ נָצָֽרְתִּי׃
Translated:
I have gained more understanding than my elders,
for I observe Your precepts.
Transliteration: mizekeniym etevvonan khiy fikudeykha natsaretiy

Hebrew: מִכׇּל־אֹ֣רַח רָ֭ע כָּלִ֣אתִי רַגְלָ֑י לְ֝מַ֗עַן אֶשְׁמֹ֥ר דְּבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I have avoided every evil way
so that I may keep Your word.
Transliteration: mikhׇl-orach ra khalitiy ragelay lemaan eshemor devarekha

Hebrew: מִמִּשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ לֹא־סָ֑רְתִּי כִּי־אַ֝תָּ֗ה הוֹרֵתָֽנִי׃
Translated:
I have not departed from Your rules,
for You have instructed me.
Transliteration: mimishefateykha lo-saretiy khiy-atah hvoretaniy

Hebrew: מַה־נִּמְלְצ֣וּ לְ֭חִכִּי אִמְרָתֶ֗ךָ מִדְּבַ֥שׁ לְפִֽי׃
Translated:
How pleasing is Your word to my palate,
sweeter than honey.
Transliteration: mah-nimeletsu lechikhiy imeratekha midevash lefiy

Hebrew: מִפִּקּוּדֶ֥יךָ אֶתְבּוֹנָ֑ן עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן שָׂנֵ֤אתִי ׀ כׇּל־אֹ֬רַח שָֽׁקֶר׃ {פ}
Translated:
I ponder Your precepts;
therefore I hate every false way.
Transliteration: mifikudeykha etevvonan al-khen shanetiy khׇl-orach shaker {f}

Hebrew: נֵר־לְרַגְלִ֥י דְבָרֶ֑ךָ וְ֝א֗וֹר לִנְתִיבָתִֽי׃
Translated:
Your word is a lamp to my feet,
a light for my path.
Transliteration: ner-lerageliy devarekha vevor linetiyvatiy

Hebrew: נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתִּי וָאֲקַיֵּ֑מָה לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר מִשְׁפְּטֵ֥י צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I have firmly sworn
to keep Your just rules.
Transliteration: nishevaetiy vaakayemah lishemor mishefetey tsidekekha

Hebrew: נַעֲנֵ֥יתִי עַד־מְאֹ֑ד יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה חַיֵּ֥נִי כִדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I am very much afflicted;
O LORD, preserve me in accordance with Your word.
Transliteration: naaneytiy ad-meod yehovah chayeniy khidevarekha

Hebrew: נִדְב֣וֹת פִּ֭י רְצֵה־נָ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וּֽמִשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ לַמְּדֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Accept, O LORD, my freewill offerings;
teach me Your rules.
Transliteration: nidevvot fiy retseh-na yehovah umishefateykha lamedeniy

Hebrew: נַפְשִׁ֣י בְכַפִּ֣י תָמִ֑יד וְ֝ת֥וֹרָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
Translated:
Though my life is always in danger,
I do not neglect Your teaching.
Transliteration: nafeshiy vekhafiy tamiyd vetvoratekha lo shakhachetiy

Hebrew: נָתְנ֬וּ רְשָׁעִ֣ים פַּ֣ח לִ֑י וּ֝מִפִּקּוּדֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א תָעִֽיתִי׃
Translated:
Though the wicked have set a trap for me,
I have not strayed from Your precepts.
Transliteration: natenu reshaiym fach liy umifikudeykha lo taiytiy

Hebrew: נָחַ֣לְתִּי עֵדְוֺתֶ֣יךָ לְעוֹלָ֑ם כִּֽי־שְׂשׂ֖וֹן לִבִּ֣י הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated:
Your decrees are my eternal heritage;
they are my heart’s delight.
Transliteration: nachaletiy edevoteykha levolam khiy-sheshvon liviy hemah

Hebrew: נָטִ֣יתִי לִ֭בִּי לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת חֻקֶּ֗יךָ לְעוֹלָ֥ם עֵֽקֶב׃ {פ}
Translated:
I am resolved to follow Your laws
to the utmost forever.
Transliteration: natiytiy liviy laashvot chukeykha levolam ekev {f}

Hebrew: סֵעֲפִ֥ים שָׂנֵ֑אתִי וְֽתוֹרָתְךָ֥ אָהָֽבְתִּי׃
Translated:
I hate men of divided heart,
but I love Your teaching.
Transliteration: seafiym shanetiy vetvoratekha ahavetiy

Hebrew: סִתְרִ֣י וּמָגִנִּ֣י אָ֑תָּה לִדְבָרְךָ֥ יִחָֽלְתִּי׃
Translated:
You are my protection and my shield;
I hope for Your word.
Transliteration: siteriy umaginiy atah lidevarekha yichaletiy

Hebrew: סוּרוּ־מִמֶּ֥נִּי מְרֵעִ֑ים וְ֝אֶצְּרָ֗ה מִצְוֺ֥ת אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated:
Keep away from me, you evildoers,
that I may observe the commandments of my God.
Transliteration: suru-mimeniy mereiym veetserah mitsevot elohay

Hebrew: סׇמְכֵ֣נִי כְאִמְרָתְךָ֣ וְאֶחְיֶ֑ה וְאַל־תְּ֝בִישֵׁ֗נִי מִשִּׂבְרִֽי׃
Translated:
Support me as You promised, so that I may live;
do not thwart my expectation.
Transliteration: sׇmekheniy kheimeratekha veecheyeh veal-teviysheniy mishiveriy

Hebrew: סְעָדֵ֥נִי וְאִוָּשֵׁ֑עָה וְאֶשְׁעָ֖ה בְחֻקֶּ֣יךָ תָמִֽיד׃
Translated:
Sustain me that I may be saved,
and I will always muse upon Your laws.
Transliteration: seadeniy veivasheah veesheah vechukeykha tamiyd

Hebrew: סָ֭לִיתָ כׇּל־שׁוֹגִ֣ים מֵחֻקֶּ֑יךָ כִּי־שֶׁ֝֗קֶר תַּרְמִיתָֽם׃
Translated:
You reject all who stray from Your laws,
for they are false and deceitful.
Transliteration: saliyta khׇl-shvogiym mechukeykha khiy-sheker taremiytam

Hebrew: סִגִ֗ים הִשְׁבַּ֥תָּ כׇל־רִשְׁעֵי־אָ֑רֶץ לָ֝כֵ֗ן אָהַ֥בְתִּי עֵדֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You do away with the wicked as if they were dross;
rightly do I love Your decrees.
Transliteration: sigiym hishevata khׇl-risheey-arets lakhen ahavetiy edoteykha

Hebrew: סָמַ֣ר מִפַּחְדְּךָ֣ בְשָׂרִ֑י וּֽמִמִּשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ יָרֵֽאתִי׃ {פ}
Translated:
My flesh creeps from fear of You;
I am in awe of Your rulings.
Transliteration: samar mifachedekha veshariy umimishefateykha yaretiy {f}

Hebrew: עָ֭שִׂיתִי מִשְׁפָּ֣ט וָצֶ֑דֶק בַּל־תַּ֝נִּיחֵ֗נִי לְעֹשְׁקָֽי׃
Translated:
I have done what is just and right;
do not abandon me to those who would wrong me.
Transliteration: ashiytiy mishefat vatsedek val-taniycheniy leoshekay

Hebrew: עֲרֹ֣ב עַבְדְּךָ֣ לְט֑וֹב אַֽל־יַעַשְׁקֻ֥נִי זֵדִֽים׃
Translated:
Guarantee Your servant’s well-being;
do not let the arrogant wrong me.
Transliteration: arov avedekha letvov al-yaashekuniy zediym

Hebrew: עֵ֭ינַי כָּל֣וּ לִישׁוּעָתֶ֑ךָ וּלְאִמְרַ֥ת צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
My eyes pine away for Your deliverance,
for Your promise of victory.
Transliteration: eynay khalu liyshuatekha uleimerat tsidekekha

Hebrew: עֲשֵׂ֖ה עִם־עַבְדְּךָ֥ כְחַסְדֶּ֗ךָ וְחֻקֶּ֥יךָ לַמְּדֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Deal with Your servant as befits Your steadfast love;
teach me Your laws.
Transliteration: asheh im-avedekha khechasedekha vechukeykha lamedeniy

Hebrew: עַבְדְּךָ־אָ֥נִי הֲבִינֵ֑נִי וְ֝אֵדְעָ֗ה עֵדֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I am Your servant;
give me understanding,
that I might know Your decrees.
Transliteration: avedekha-aniy haviyneniy veedeah edoteykha

Hebrew: עֵ֭ת לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לַיהֹוָ֑ה הֵ֝פֵ֗רוּ תּוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
It is a time to act for the LORD,
for they have violated Your teaching.
Transliteration: et laashvot layhovah heferu tvoratekha

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֭ן אָהַ֣בְתִּי מִצְוֺתֶ֑יךָ מִזָּהָ֥ב וּמִפָּֽז׃
Translated:
Rightly do I love Your commandments
more than gold, even fine gold.
Transliteration: al-khen ahavetiy mitsevoteykha mizahav umifaz

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֤ן ׀ כׇּל־פִּקּ֣וּדֵי כֹ֣ל יִשָּׁ֑רְתִּי כׇּל־אֹ֖רַח שֶׁ֣קֶר שָׂנֵֽאתִי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Truly by all [Your] precepts I walk straight;
I hate every false way.
Transliteration: al-khen khׇl-fikudey khol yisharetiy khׇl-orach sheker shanetiy {f}

Hebrew: פְּלָא֥וֹת עֵדְוֺתֶ֑יךָ עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן נְצָרָ֥תַם נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
Your decrees are wondrous;
rightly do I observe them.
Transliteration: felavot edevoteykha al-khen netsaratam nafeshiy

Hebrew: פֵּ֖תַח דְּבָרֶ֥יךָ יָאִ֗יר מֵבִ֥ין פְּתָיִֽים׃
Translated:
The words You inscribed give light,
and grant understanding to the simple.
Transliteration: fetach devareykha yaiyr meviyn fetayiym

Hebrew: פִּֽי־פָ֭עַרְתִּי וָאֶשְׁאָ֑פָה כִּ֖י לְמִצְוֺתֶ֣יךָ יָאָֽבְתִּי׃
Translated:
I open my mouth wide, I pant,
longing for Your commandments.
Transliteration: fiy-faaretiy vaesheafah khiy lemitsevoteykha yaavetiy

Hebrew: פְּנֵה־אֵלַ֥י וְחׇנֵּ֑נִי כְּ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט לְאֹהֲבֵ֥י שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
as is Your rule with those who love Your name.
Transliteration: feneh-elay vechׇneniy khemishefat leohavey shemekha

Hebrew: פְּ֭עָמַי הָכֵ֣ן בְּאִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ וְֽאַל־תַּשְׁלֶט־בִּ֥י כׇל־אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Make my feet firm through Your promise;
do not let iniquity dominate me.
Transliteration: feamay hakhen veimeratekha veal-tashelet-viy khׇl-aven

Hebrew: פְּ֭דֵנִי מֵעֹ֣שֶׁק אָדָ֑ם וְ֝אֶשְׁמְרָ֗ה פִּקּוּדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Redeem me from being wronged by man,
that I may keep Your precepts.
Transliteration: fedeniy meoshek adam veeshemerah fikudeykha

Hebrew: פָּ֭נֶיךָ הָאֵ֣ר בְּעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝לַמְּדֵ֗נִי אֶת־חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Show favor to Your servant,
and teach me Your laws.
Transliteration: faneykha haer veavedekha velamedeniy et-chukeykha

Hebrew: פַּלְגֵי־מַ֭יִם יָרְד֣וּ עֵינָ֑י עַ֝֗ל לֹא־שָׁמְר֥וּ תוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
My eyes shed streams of water
because men do not obey Your teaching.
Transliteration: falegey-mayiim yaredu eynay al lo-shameru tvoratekha {f}

Hebrew: צַדִּ֣יק אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝יָשָׁ֗ר מִשְׁפָּטֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You are righteous, O LORD;
Your rulings are just.
Transliteration: tsadiyk atah yehovah veyashar mishefateykha

Hebrew: צִ֭וִּיתָ צֶ֣דֶק עֵדֹתֶ֑יךָ וֶאֱמוּנָ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
You have ordained righteous decrees;
they are firmly enduring.
Transliteration: tsiviyta tsedek edoteykha veemunah meod

Hebrew: צִמְּתַ֥תְנִי קִנְאָתִ֑י כִּֽי־שָׁכְח֖וּ דְבָרֶ֣יךָ צָרָֽי׃
Translated:
I am consumed with rage
over my foes’ neglect of Your words.
Transliteration: tsimetateniy kineatiy khiy-shakhechu devareykha tsaray

Hebrew: צְרוּפָ֖ה אִמְרָתְךָ֥ מְאֹ֗ד וְֽעַבְדְּךָ֥ אֲהֵבָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Your word is exceedingly pure,
and Your servant loves it.
Transliteration: tserufah imeratekha meod veavedekha ahevah

Hebrew: צָעִ֣יר אָנֹכִ֣י וְנִבְזֶ֑ה פִּ֝קֻּדֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
Translated:
Though I am belittled and despised,
I have not neglected Your precepts.
Transliteration: tsaiyr anokhiy venivezeh fikudeykha lo shakhachetiy

Hebrew: צִדְקָתְךָ֣ צֶ֣דֶק לְעוֹלָ֑ם וְֽתוֹרָתְךָ֥ אֱמֶֽת׃
Translated:
Your righteousness is eternal;
Your teaching is true.
Transliteration: tsidekatekha tsedek levolam vetvoratekha emet

Hebrew: צַר־וּמָצ֥וֹק מְצָא֑וּנִי מִ֝צְוֺתֶ֗יךָ שַׁעֲשֻׁעָֽי׃
Translated:
Though anguish and distress come upon me,
Your commandments are my delight.
Transliteration: tsar-umatsvok metsauniy mitsevoteykha shaashuay

Hebrew: צֶ֖דֶק עֵדְוֺתֶ֥יךָ לְעוֹלָ֗ם הֲבִינֵ֥נִי וְאֶחְיֶֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Your righteous decrees are eternal;
give me understanding, that I might live.
Transliteration: tsedek edevoteykha levolam haviyneniy veecheyeh {f}

Hebrew: קָרָ֣אתִי בְכׇל־לֵ֭ב עֲנֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֗ה חֻקֶּ֥יךָ אֶצֹּֽרָה׃
Translated:
I call with all my heart;
answer me, O LORD,
that I may observe Your laws.
Transliteration: karatiy vekhׇl-lev aneniy yehovah chukeykha etsorah

Hebrew: קְרָאתִ֥יךָ הוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי וְ֝אֶשְׁמְרָ֗ה עֵדֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
I call upon You; save me,
that I may keep Your decrees.
Transliteration: keratiykha hvoshiyeniy veeshemerah edoteykha

Hebrew: קִדַּ֣מְתִּי בַ֭נֶּשֶׁף וָאֲשַׁוֵּ֑עָה (לדבריך) [לִדְבָרְךָ֥] יִחָֽלְתִּי׃
Translated:
I rise before dawn and cry for help;
I hope for Your word.
Transliteration: kidametiy vaneshef vaashaveah (ldvrykh) [lidevarekha] yichaletiy

Hebrew: קִדְּמ֣וּ עֵ֭ינַי אַשְׁמֻר֑וֹת לָ֝שִׂ֗יחַ בְּאִמְרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
My eyes greet each watch of the night,
as I meditate on Your promise.
Transliteration: kidemu eynay ashemurvot lashiycha veimeratekha

Hebrew: ק֭וֹלִי שִׁמְעָ֣ה כְחַסְדֶּ֑ךָ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כְּֽמִשְׁפָּטֶ֥ךָ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
Hear my voice as befits Your steadfast love;
O LORD, preserve me, as is Your rule.
Transliteration: kvoliy shimeah khechasedekha yehovah khemishefatekha chayeniy

Hebrew: קָ֭רְבוּ רֹדְפֵ֣י זִמָּ֑ה מִתּוֹרָתְךָ֥ רָחָֽקוּ׃
Translated:
Those who pursue intrigue draw near;
they are far from Your teaching.
Transliteration: karevu rodefey zimah mitvoratekha rachaku

Hebrew: קָר֣וֹב אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֑ה וְֽכׇל־מִצְוֺתֶ֥יךָ אֱמֶֽת׃
Translated:
You, O LORD, are near,
and all Your commandments are true.
Transliteration: karvov atah yehovah vekhׇl-mitsevoteykha emet

Hebrew: קֶ֣דֶם יָ֭דַעְתִּי מֵעֵדֹתֶ֑יךָ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם יְסַדְתָּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
I know from Your decrees of old
that You have established them forever.
Transliteration: kedem yadaetiy meedoteykha khiy levolam yesadetam {f}

Hebrew: רְאֵה־עׇנְיִ֥י וְחַלְּצֵ֑נִי כִּי־ת֥֝וֹרָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
Translated:
See my affliction and rescue me,
for I have not neglected Your teaching.
Transliteration: reeh-ׇneyiy vechaletseniy khiy-tvoratekha lo shakhachetiy

Hebrew: רִיבָ֣ה רִ֭יבִי וּגְאָלֵ֑נִי לְאִמְרָתְךָ֥ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
Champion my cause and redeem me;
preserve me according to Your promise.
Transliteration: riyvah riyviy ugealeniy leimeratekha chayeniy

Hebrew: רָח֣וֹק מֵרְשָׁעִ֣ים יְשׁוּעָ֑ה כִּי־חֻ֝קֶּ֗יךָ לֹ֣א דָרָֽשׁוּ׃
Translated:
Deliverance is far from the wicked,
for they have not turned to Your laws.
Transliteration: rachvok mereshaiym yeshuah khiy-chukeykha lo darashu

Hebrew: רַחֲמֶ֖יךָ רַבִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּֽמִשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
Your mercies are great, O LORD;
as is Your rule, preserve me.
Transliteration: rachameykha raviym <small></small> yehovah khemishefateykha chayeniy

Hebrew: רַ֭בִּים רֹדְפַ֣י וְצָרָ֑י מֵ֝עֵדְוֺתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א נָטִֽיתִי׃
Translated:
Many are my persecutors and foes;
I have not swerved from Your decrees.
Transliteration: raviym rodefay vetsaray meedevoteykha lo natiytiy

Hebrew: רָאִ֣יתִי בֹ֭גְדִים וָאֶתְקוֹטָ֑טָה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִ֝מְרָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א שָׁמָֽרוּ׃
Translated:
I have seen traitors and loathed them,
because they did not keep Your word in mind.
Transliteration: raiytiy vogediym vaetekvotatah asher imeratekha lo shamaru

Hebrew: רְ֭אֵה כִּי־פִקּוּדֶ֣יךָ אָהָ֑בְתִּי יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כְּֽחַסְדְּךָ֥ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
See that I have loved Your precepts;
O LORD, preserve me, as befits Your steadfast love.
Transliteration: reeh khiy-fikudeykha ahavetiy yehovah khechasedekha chayeniy

Hebrew: רֹאשׁ־דְּבָרְךָ֥ אֱמֶ֑ת וּ֝לְעוֹלָ֗ם כׇּל־מִשְׁפַּ֥ט צִדְקֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Truth is the essence of Your word;
Your just rules are eternal.
Transliteration: rosh-devarekha emet ulevolam khׇl-mishefat tsidekekha {f}

Hebrew: שָׂ֭רִים רְדָפ֣וּנִי חִנָּ֑ם (ומדבריך) [וּ֝מִדְּבָרְךָ֗] פָּחַ֥ד לִבִּֽי׃
Translated:
Princes have persecuted me without reason;
my heart thrills at Your word.
Transliteration: shariym redafuniy chinam (vmdvrykh) [umidevarekha] fachad liviy

Hebrew: שָׂ֣שׂ אָ֭נֹכִי עַל־אִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ כְּ֝מוֹצֵ֗א שָׁלָ֥ל רָֽב׃
Translated:
I rejoice over Your promise
as one who obtains great spoil.
Transliteration: shash anokhiy al-imeratekha khemvotse shalal rav

Hebrew: שֶׁ֣קֶר שָׂ֭נֵאתִי וַאֲתַעֵ֑בָה תּוֹרָתְךָ֥ אָהָֽבְתִּי׃
Translated:
I hate and abhor falsehood;
I love Your teaching.
Transliteration: sheker shanetiy vaataevah tvoratekha ahavetiy

Hebrew: שֶׁ֣בַע בַּ֭יּוֹם הִלַּלְתִּ֑יךָ עַ֝֗ל מִשְׁפְּטֵ֥י צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I praise You seven times each day
for Your just rules.
Transliteration: sheva vayyvom hilaletiykha al mishefetey tsidekekha

Hebrew: שָׁל֣וֹם רָ֭ב לְאֹהֲבֵ֣י תוֹרָתֶ֑ךָ וְאֵֽין־לָ֥מוֹ מִכְשֽׁוֹל׃
Translated:
Those who love Your teaching enjoy well-being;
they encounter no adversity.
Transliteration: shalvom rav leohavey tvoratekha veeyn-lamvo mikheshvol

Hebrew: שִׂבַּ֣רְתִּי לִישׁוּעָתְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֑ה וּֽמִצְוֺתֶ֥יךָ עָשִֽׂיתִי׃
Translated:
I hope for Your deliverance, O LORD;
I observe Your commandments.
Transliteration: shivaretiy liyshuatekha yehovah umitsevoteykha ashiytiy

Hebrew: שָֽׁמְרָ֣ה נַ֭פְשִׁי עֵדֹתֶ֑יךָ וָאֹהֲבֵ֥ם מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
I obey Your decrees
and love them greatly.
Transliteration: shamerah nafeshiy edoteykha vaohavem meod

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֣רְתִּי פִ֭קּוּדֶיךָ וְעֵדֹתֶ֑יךָ כִּ֖י כׇל־דְּרָכַ֣י נֶגְדֶּֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
I obey Your precepts and decrees;
all my ways are before You.
Transliteration: shamaretiy fikudeykha veedoteykha khiy khׇl-derakhay negedekha {f}

Hebrew: תִּקְרַ֤ב רִנָּתִ֣י לְפָנֶ֣יךָ יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּדְבָרְךָ֥ הֲבִינֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
May my plea reach You, O LORD;
grant me understanding according to Your word.
Transliteration: tikerav rinatiy lefaneykha yehovah khidevarekha haviyneniy

Hebrew: תָּב֣וֹא תְחִנָּתִ֣י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ כְּ֝אִמְרָתְךָ֗ הַצִּילֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
May my petition come before You;
save me in accordance with Your promise.
Transliteration: tavvo techinatiy lefaneykha kheimeratekha hatsiyleniy

Hebrew: תַּבַּ֣עְנָה שְׂפָתַ֣י תְּהִלָּ֑ה כִּ֖י תְלַמְּדֵ֣נִי חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
My lips shall pour forth praise,
for You teach me Your laws.
Transliteration: tavaenah shefatay tehilah khiy telamedeniy chukeykha

Hebrew: תַּ֣עַן לְ֭שׁוֹנִי אִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ כִּ֖י כׇל־מִצְוֺתֶ֣יךָ צֶּֽדֶק׃
Translated:
My tongue shall declare Your promise,
for all Your commandments are just.
Transliteration: taan leshvoniy imeratekha khiy khׇl-mitsevoteykha tsedek

Hebrew: תְּהִי־יָדְךָ֥ לְעׇזְרֵ֑נִי כִּ֖י פִקּוּדֶ֣יךָ בָחָֽרְתִּי׃
Translated:
Lend Your hand to help me,
for I have chosen Your precepts.
Transliteration: tehiy-yadekha leׇzereniy khiy fikudeykha vacharetiy

Hebrew: תָּאַ֣בְתִּי לִישׁוּעָתְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝ת֥וֹרָתְךָ֗ שַׁעֲשֻׁעָֽי׃
Translated:
I have longed for Your deliverance, O LORD;
Your teaching is my delight.
Transliteration: taavetiy liyshuatekha yehovah vetvoratekha shaashuay

Hebrew: תְּֽחִי־נַ֭פְשִׁי וּֽתְהַלְלֶ֑ךָּ וּֽמִשְׁפָּטֶ֥ךָ יַעְזְרֻֽנִי׃
Translated:
Let me live, that I may praise You;
may Your rules be my help;
Transliteration: techiy-nafeshiy utehalelekha umishefatekha yaezeruniy

Hebrew: תָּעִ֗יתִי כְּשֶׂ֣ה אֹ֭בֵד בַּקֵּ֣שׁ עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י מִ֝צְוֺתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃ {פ}
Translated:
I have strayed like a lost sheep;
search for Your servant,
for I have not neglected Your commandments.
Transliteration: taiytiy khesheh oved vakesh avedekha khiy mitsevoteykha lo shakhachetiy {f}
