Hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בַּצָּרָ֣תָה לִּ֑י קָ֝רָ֗אתִי וַֽיַּעֲנֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
A song of ascents.

In my distress I called to the LORD
and He answered me.
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot el-yehovah vatsaratah liy karatiy vayaaneniy

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה הַצִּ֣ילָה נַ֭פְשִׁי מִשְּׂפַת־שֶׁ֑קֶר מִלָּשׁ֥וֹן רְמִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
O LORD, save me from treacherous lips,
from a deceitful tongue!
Transliteration: yehovah hatsiylah nafeshiy mishefat-sheker milashvon remiyah

Hebrew: מַה־יִּתֵּ֣ן לְ֭ךָ וּמַה־יֹּסִ֥יף לָ֗ךְ לָשׁ֥וֹן רְמִיָּֽה׃
Translated:
What can you profit,
what can you gain,
O deceitful tongue?
Transliteration: mah-yiten lekha umah-yosiyf lakhe lashvon remiyah

Hebrew: חִצֵּ֣י גִבּ֣וֹר שְׁנוּנִ֑ים עִ֝֗ם גַּחֲלֵ֥י רְתָמִֽים׃
Translated:
A warrior’s sharp arrows,
with hot coals of broom-wood.
Transliteration: chitsey givvor shenuniym im gachaley retamiym

Hebrew: אֽוֹיָה־לִ֭י כִּי־גַ֣רְתִּי מֶ֑שֶׁךְ שָׁ֝כַ֗נְתִּי עִֽם־אׇהֳלֵ֥י קֵדָֽר׃
Translated:
Woe is me, that I live with Meshech,
that I dwell among the clans of Kedar.
Transliteration: voyah-liy khiy-garetiy meshekhe shakhanetiy im-ׇholey kedar

Hebrew: רַ֭בַּת שָֽׁכְנָה־לָּ֣הּ נַפְשִׁ֑י עִ֝֗ם שׂוֹנֵ֥א שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Too long have I dwelt with those who hate peace.
Transliteration: ravat shakhenah-lah nafeshiy im shvone shalvom

Hebrew: אֲֽנִי־שָׁ֭לוֹם וְכִ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר הֵ֝֗מָּה לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
I am all peace;
but when I speak,
they are for war.
Transliteration: aniy-shalvom vekhiy adaver hemah lamilechamah {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֗יר לַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת אֶשָּׂ֣א עֵ֭ינַי אֶל־הֶהָרִ֑ים מֵ֝אַ֗יִן יָבֹ֥א עֶזְרִֽי׃
Translated:
A song for ascents.

I turn my eyes to the mountains;
from where will my help come?
Transliteration: shiyr lamaalvot esha eynay el-hehariym meayiin yavo ezeriy

Hebrew: עֶ֭זְרִי מֵעִ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה עֹ֝שֵׂ֗ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
My help comes from the LORD,
maker of heaven and earth.
Transliteration: ezeriy meim yehovah osheh shamayiim vaarets

Hebrew: אַל־יִתֵּ֣ן לַמּ֣וֹט רַגְלֶ֑ךָ אַל־יָ֝נ֗וּם שֹׁמְרֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
He will not let your foot give way;
your guardian will not slumber;
Transliteration: al-yiten lamvot ragelekha al-yanum shomerekha

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה לֹֽא־יָ֭נוּם וְלֹ֣א יִישָׁ֑ן שׁ֝וֹמֵ֗ר יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
See, the guardian of Israel
neither slumbers nor sleeps!
Transliteration: hineh lo-yanum velo yiyshan shvomer yisherael

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה שֹׁמְרֶ֑ךָ יְהֹוָ֥ה צִ֝לְּךָ֗ עַל־יַ֥ד יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
The LORD is your guardian,
the LORD is your protection
at your right hand.
Transliteration: yehovah shomerekha yehovah tsilekha al-yad yemiynekha

Hebrew: יוֹמָ֗ם הַשֶּׁ֥מֶשׁ לֹֽא־יַכֶּ֗כָּה וְיָרֵ֥חַ בַּלָּֽיְלָה׃
Translated:
By day the sun will not strike you,
nor the moon by night.
Transliteration: yvomam hashemesh lo-yakhekhah veyarecha valayelah

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה יִשְׁמׇרְךָ֥ מִכׇּל־רָ֑ע יִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר אֶת־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
The LORD will guard you from all harm;
He will guard your life.
Transliteration: yehovah yishemׇrekha mikhׇl-ra yishemor et-nafeshekha

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה יִשְׁמׇר־צֵאתְךָ֥ וּבוֹאֶ֑ךָ מֵ֝עַתָּ֗ה וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
The LORD will guard your going and coming
now and forever.
Transliteration: yehovah yishemׇr-tsetekha uvvoekha meatah vead-volam {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לְדָ֫וִ֥ד שָׂ֭מַחְתִּי בְּאֹמְרִ֣ים לִ֑י בֵּ֖ית יְהֹוָ֣ה נֵלֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
A song of ascents. Of David. I rejoiced when they said to me,
“We are going to the House of the LORD.”
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot ledavid shamachetiy veomeriym liy veyt yehovah nelekhe

Hebrew: עֹ֭מְדוֹת הָי֣וּ רַגְלֵ֑ינוּ בִּ֝שְׁעָרַ֗יִךְ יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Our feet stood inside your gates, O Jerusalem,
Transliteration: omedvot hayu rageleynu vishearayiikhe yerushala͏im

Hebrew: יְרוּשָׁלַ֥͏ִם הַבְּנוּיָ֑ה כְּ֝עִ֗יר שֶׁחֻבְּרָה־לָּ֥הּ יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated: Jerusalem built up, a city knit together,
Transliteration: yerushala͏im havenuyah kheiyr shechuverah-lah yachedav

Hebrew: שֶׁשָּׁ֨ם עָל֪וּ שְׁבָטִ֡ים שִׁבְטֵי־יָ֭הּ עֵד֣וּת לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְ֝הֹד֗וֹת לְשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
to which tribes would make pilgrimage,
the tribes of the LORD,
—as was enjoined upon Israel—
to praise the name of the LORD.
Transliteration: shesham alu shevatiym shivetey-yah edut leyisherael lehodvot leshem yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁ֨מָּה ׀ יָשְׁב֣וּ כִסְא֣וֹת לְמִשְׁפָּ֑ט כִּ֝סְא֗וֹת לְבֵ֣ית דָּוִֽד׃
Translated:
There the thrones of judgment stood,
thrones of the house of David.
Transliteration: khiy shamah yashevu khisevot lemishefat khisevot leveyt david

Hebrew: שַׁ֭אֲלוּ שְׁל֣וֹם יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם יִ֝שְׁלָ֗יוּ אֹהֲבָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
Pray for the well-being of Jerusalem;
“May those who love you be at peace.
Transliteration: shaalu shelvom yerushala͏im yishelayu ohavayiikhe

Hebrew: יְהִי־שָׁל֥וֹם בְּחֵילֵ֑ךְ שַׁ֝לְוָ֗ה בְּאַרְמְנוֹתָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
May there be well-being within your ramparts,
peace in your citadels.”
Transliteration: yehiy-shalvom vecheylekhe shalevah vearemenvotayiikhe

Hebrew: לְ֭מַעַן אַחַ֣י וְרֵעָ֑י אֲדַבְּרָה־נָּ֖א שָׁל֣וֹם בָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
For the sake of my kin and friends,
I pray for your well-being;
Transliteration: lemaan achay vereay adaverah-na shalvom vakhe

Hebrew: לְ֭מַעַן בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ אֲבַקְשָׁ֖ה ט֣וֹב לָֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated:
for the sake of the house of the LORD our God,
I seek your good.
Transliteration: lemaan veyt-yehovah eloheynu avakeshah tvov lakhe {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת אֵ֭לֶיךָ נָשָׂ֣אתִי אֶת־עֵינַ֑י הַ֝יֹּשְׁבִ֗י בַּשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated:
A song of ascents.

To You, enthroned in heaven,
I turn my eyes.
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot eleykha nashatiy et-eynay hayosheviy vashamayiim

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה כְעֵינֵ֪י עֲבָדִ֡ים אֶל־יַ֤ד אֲֽדוֹנֵיהֶ֗ם כְּעֵינֵ֣י שִׁפְחָה֮ אֶל־יַ֢ד גְּבִ֫רְתָּ֥הּ כֵּ֣ן עֵ֭ינֵינוּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ עַ֝֗ד שֶׁיְּחׇנֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
As the eyes of slaves follow their master’s hand,
as the eyes of a slave-girl follow the hand of her mistress,
so our eyes are toward the LORD our God,
awaiting His favor.
Transliteration: hineh kheeyney avadiym el-yad advoneyhem kheeyney shifechah el-ya֢d geviretah khen eyneynu el-yehovah eloheynu ad sheyechׇnenu

Hebrew: חׇנֵּ֣נוּ יְהֹוָ֣ה חׇנֵּ֑נוּ כִּי־רַ֝֗ב שָׂבַ֥עְנוּ בֽוּז׃
Translated:
Show us favor, O LORD,
show us favor!
We have had more than enough of contempt.
Transliteration: chׇnenu yehovah chׇnenu khiy-rav shavaenu vuz

Hebrew: רַבַּת֮ שָֽׂבְעָה־לָּ֢הּ נַ֫פְשֵׁ֥נוּ הַלַּ֥עַג הַשַּֽׁאֲנַנִּ֑ים הַ֝בּ֗וּז (לגאיונים) [לִגְאֵ֥י יוֹנִֽים]׃ {פ}
Translated:
Long enough have we endured
the scorn of the complacent,
the contempt of the haughty.
Transliteration: ravat shaveah-la֢h nafeshenu halaag hashaananiym havuz (lgyvnym) [ligeey yvoniym] {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לְדָ֫וִ֥ד לוּלֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה שֶׁהָ֣יָה לָ֑נוּ יֹאמַר־נָ֝֗א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
A song of ascents. Of David.

Were it not for the LORD, who was on our side,
let Israel now declare,
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot ledavid luley yehovah shehayah lanu yomar-na yisherael

Hebrew: לוּלֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה שֶׁהָ֣יָה לָ֑נוּ בְּק֖וּם עָלֵ֣ינוּ אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
were it not for the LORD, who was on our side
when men assailed us,
Transliteration: luley yehovah shehayah lanu vekum aleynu adam

Hebrew: אֲ֭זַי חַיִּ֣ים בְּלָע֑וּנוּ בַּחֲר֖וֹת אַפָּ֣ם בָּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
they would have swallowed us alive
in their burning rage against us;
Transliteration: azay chayiym velaunu vacharvot afam vanu

Hebrew: אֲ֭זַי הַמַּ֣יִם שְׁטָפ֑וּנוּ נַ֝֗חְלָה עָבַ֥ר עַל־נַפְשֵֽׁנוּ׃
Translated:
the waters would have carried us off,
the torrent would have swept over us;
Transliteration: azay hamayiim shetafunu nachelah avar al-nafeshenu

Hebrew: אֲ֭זַי עָבַ֣ר עַל־נַפְשֵׁ֑נוּ הַ֝מַּ֗יִם הַזֵּידוֹנִֽים׃
Translated:
over us would have swept
the seething waters.
Transliteration: azay avar al-nafeshenu hamayiim hazeydvoniym

Hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה שֶׁלֹּ֥א נְתָנָ֥נוּ טֶ֝֗רֶף לְשִׁנֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Blessed is the LORD, who did not let us
be ripped apart by their teeth.
Transliteration: varukhe yehovah shelo netananu teref leshineyhem

Hebrew: נַפְשֵׁ֗נוּ כְּצִפּ֥וֹר נִמְלְטָה֮ מִפַּ֢ח י֫וֹקְשִׁ֥ים הַפַּ֥ח נִשְׁבָּ֗ר וַאֲנַ֥חְנוּ נִמְלָֽטְנוּ׃
Translated:
We are like a bird escaped from the fowler’s trap;
the trap broke and we escaped.
Transliteration: nafeshenu khetsifvor nimeletah mifa֢ch yvokeshiym hafach nishevar vaanachenu nimelatenu

Hebrew: עֶ֭זְרֵנוּ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה עֹ֝שֵׂ֗ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Our help is the name of the LORD,
maker of heaven and earth.
Transliteration: ezerenu veshem yehovah osheh shamayiim vaarets {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת הַבֹּטְחִ֥ים בַּיהֹוָ֑ה כְּֽהַר־צִיּ֥וֹן לֹא־יִ֝מּ֗וֹט לְעוֹלָ֥ם יֵשֵֽׁב׃
Translated:
A song of ascents.

Those who trust in the LORD
are like Mount Zion
that cannot be moved,
enduring forever.
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot havotechiym vayhovah khehar-tsiyyvon lo-yimvot levolam eishev

Hebrew: יְֽרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם הָרִים֮ סָבִ֢יב לָ֥֫הּ וַ֭יהֹוָה סָבִ֣יב לְעַמּ֑וֹ מֵ֝עַתָּ֗ה וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Jerusalem, hills enfold it,
and the LORD enfolds His people
now and forever.
Transliteration: yerushala͏im hariym savi֢yv lah vayhovah saviyv leamvo meatah vead-volam

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֪א יָנ֡וּחַ שֵׁ֤בֶט הָרֶ֗שַׁע עַל֮ גּוֹרַ֢ל הַֽצַּדִּ֫יקִ֥ים לְמַ֡עַן לֹא־יִשְׁלְח֖וּ הַצַּדִּיקִ֨ים בְּעַוְלָ֬תָה יְדֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
The scepter of the wicked shall never rest
upon the land allotted to the righteous,
that the righteous not set their hand to wrongdoing.
Transliteration: khiy lo yanucha shevet haresha al gvora֢l hatsadiykiym lemaan lo-yishelechu hatsadiykiym veavelatah yedeyhem

Hebrew: הֵיטִ֣יבָה יְ֭הֹוָה לַטּוֹבִ֑ים וְ֝לִישָׁרִ֗ים בְּלִבּוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
Do good, O LORD, to the good,
to the upright in heart.
Transliteration: heytiyvah yehovah latvoviym veliyshariym velivvotam

Hebrew: וְהַמַּטִּ֤ים עֲֽקַלְקַלּוֹתָ֗ם יוֹלִיכֵ֣ם יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־פֹּעֲלֵ֣י הָאָ֑וֶן שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
But those who in their crookedness act corruptly,
let the LORD make them go the way of evildoers.
May it be well with Israel!
Transliteration: vehamatiym akalekalvotam yvoliykhem yehovah et-foaley haaven shalvom al-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת בְּשׁ֣וּב יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־שִׁיבַ֣ת צִיּ֑וֹן הָ֝יִ֗ינוּ כְּחֹלְמִֽים׃
Translated:
A song of ascents.

When the LORD restores the fortunes of Zion
—we see it as in a dream—
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot veshuv yehovah et-shiyvat tsiyyvon hayiiynu khecholemiym

Hebrew: אָ֤ז יִמָּלֵ֪א שְׂח֡וֹק פִּינוּ֮ וּלְשׁוֹנֵ֢נוּ רִ֫נָּ֥ה אָ֭ז יֹאמְר֣וּ בַגּוֹיִ֑ם הִגְדִּ֥יל יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת עִם־אֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated:
our mouths shall be filled with laughter,
our tongues, with songs of joy.
Then shall they say among the nations,
“The LORD has done great things for them!”
Transliteration: az yimale shechvok fiynu uleshvone֢nu rinah az yomeru vagvoyim higediyl yehovah laashvot im-eleh

Hebrew: הִגְדִּ֣יל יְ֭הֹוָה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת עִמָּ֗נוּ הָיִ֥ינוּ שְׂמֵחִֽים׃
Translated:
The LORD will do great things for us
and we shall rejoice.
Transliteration: higediyl yehovah laashvot imanu hayiynu shemechiym

Hebrew: שׁוּבָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־[שְׁבִיתֵ֑נוּ] (שבותנו) כַּאֲפִיקִ֥ים בַּנֶּֽגֶב׃
Translated:
Restore our fortunes, O LORD,
like watercourses in the Negeb.
Transliteration: shuvah yehovah et-[sheviytenu] (shvvtnv) khaafiykiym vanegev

Hebrew: הַזֹּרְעִ֥ים בְּדִמְעָ֗ה בְּרִנָּ֥ה יִקְצֹֽרוּ׃
Translated:
They who sow in tears
shall reap with songs of joy.
Transliteration: hazoreiym vedimeah verinah yiketsoru

Hebrew: הָ֘ל֤וֹךְ יֵלֵ֨ךְ ׀ וּבָכֹה֮ נֹשֵׂ֢א מֶשֶׁךְ־הַ֫זָּ֥רַע בֹּא־יָבֹ֥א בְרִנָּ֑ה נֹ֝שֵׂ֗א אֲלֻמֹּתָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated:
Though he goes along weeping,
carrying the seed-bag,
he shall come back with songs of joy,
carrying his sheaves.
Transliteration: halvokhe eilekhe uvakhoh noshe֢ meshekhe-hazara vo-yavo verinah noshe alumotayv {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לִשְׁלֹ֫מֹ֥ה אִם־יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ לֹא־יִבְנֶ֬ה בַ֗יִת שָׁ֤וְא עָמְל֣וּ בוֹנָ֣יו בּ֑וֹ אִם־יְהֹוָ֥ה לֹא־יִשְׁמׇר־עִ֝֗יר שָׁ֤וְא ׀ שָׁקַ֬ד שׁוֹמֵֽר׃
Translated:
A song of ascents. Of Solomon.

Unless the LORD builds the house,
its builders labor in vain on it;
unless the LORD watches over the city,
the watchman keeps vigil in vain.
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot lishelomoh im-yehovah lo-yiveneh vayiit shave amelu vvonayv vvo im-yehovah lo-yishemׇr-iyr shave shakad shvomer

Hebrew: שָׁ֤וְא לָכֶ֨ם מַשְׁכִּ֪ימֵֽי ק֡וּם מְאַחֲרֵי־שֶׁ֗בֶת אֹ֭כְלֵי לֶ֣חֶם הָעֲצָבִ֑ים כֵּ֤ן יִתֵּ֖ן לִידִיד֣וֹ שֵׁנָֽא׃
Translated:
In vain do you rise early
and stay up late,
you who toil for the bread you eat;
He provides as much for His loved ones while they sleep.
Transliteration: shave lakhem mashekhiymey kum meacharey-shevet okheley lechem haatsaviym khen yiten liydiydvo shena

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה נַחֲלַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֣ה בָּנִ֑ים שָׂ֝כָ֗ר פְּרִ֣י הַבָּֽטֶן׃
Translated:
Sons are the provision of the LORD;
the fruit of the womb, His reward.
Transliteration: hineh nachalat yehovah vaniym shakhar feriy havaten

Hebrew: כְּחִצִּ֥ים בְּיַד־גִּבּ֑וֹר כֵּ֝֗ן בְּנֵ֣י הַנְּעוּרִֽים׃
Translated:
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior
are sons born to a man in his youth.
Transliteration: khechitsiym veyad-givvor khen veney haneuriym

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֤י הַגֶּ֗בֶר אֲשֶׁ֤ר מִלֵּ֥א אֶת־אַשְׁפָּת֗וֹ מֵ֫הֶ֥ם לֹֽא־יֵבֹ֑שׁוּ כִּֽי־יְדַבְּר֖וּ אֶת־אוֹיְבִ֣ים בַּשָּֽׁעַר׃ {פ}
Translated:
Happy is the man who fills his quiver with them;
they shall not be put to shame
when they contend with the enemy in the gate.
Transliteration: asherey hagever asher mile et-ashefatvo mehem lo-eivoshu khiy-yedaveru et-voyeviym vashaar {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת אַ֭שְׁרֵי כׇּל־יְרֵ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה הַ֝הֹלֵ֗ךְ בִּדְרָכָֽיו׃
Translated:
A song of ascents.

Happy are all who fear the LORD,
who follow His ways.
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot asherey khׇl-yere yehovah haholekhe viderakhayv

Hebrew: יְגִ֣יעַ כַּ֭פֶּיךָ כִּ֣י תֹאכֵ֑ל אַ֝שְׁרֶ֗יךָ וְט֣וֹב לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
You shall enjoy the fruit of your labors;
you shall be happy and you shall prosper.
Transliteration: yegiya khafeykha khiy tokhel ashereykha vetvov lakhe

Hebrew: אֶשְׁתְּךָ֤ ׀ כְּגֶ֥פֶן פֹּרִיָּה֮ בְּיַרְכְּתֵ֢י בֵ֫יתֶ֥ךָ בָּ֭נֶיךָ כִּשְׁתִלֵ֣י זֵיתִ֑ים סָ֝בִ֗יב לְשֻׁלְחָנֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine within your house;
your sons, like olive saplings around your table.
Transliteration: eshetekha khegefen foriyah veyarekhete֢y veytekha vaneykha khishetiley zeytiym saviyv leshulechanekha

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה כִי־כֵ֭ן יְבֹ֥רַךְ גָּ֗בֶר יְרֵ֣א יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: So shall the man who fears the LORD be blessed.
Transliteration: hineh khiy-khen yevorakhe gaver yere yehovah

Hebrew: יְבָרֶכְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֗ה מִצִּ֫יּ֥וֹן וּ֭רְאֵה בְּט֣וּב יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כֹּ֝֗ל יְמֵ֣י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
May the LORD bless you from Zion;
may you share the prosperity of Jerusalem
all the days of your life,
Transliteration: yevarekhekha yehovah mitsiyyvon ureeh vetuv yerushala͏im khol yemey chayeykha

Hebrew: וּרְאֵֽה־בָנִ֥ים לְבָנֶ֑יךָ שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
and live to see your children’s children.
May all be well with Israel!
Transliteration: ureeh-vaniym levaneykha shalvom al-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת רַ֭בַּת צְרָר֣וּנִי מִנְּעוּרַ֑י יֹאמַר־נָ֝֗א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
A song of ascents.

Since my youth they have often assailed me,
let Israel now declare,
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot ravat tseraruniy mineuray yomar-na yisherael

Hebrew: רַ֭בַּת צְרָר֣וּנִי מִנְּעוּרָ֑י גַּ֝֗ם לֹא־יָ֥כְלוּ לִֽי׃
Translated:
since my youth they have often assailed me,
but they have never overcome me.
Transliteration: ravat tseraruniy mineuray gam lo-yakhelu liy

Hebrew: עַל־גַּ֭בִּי חָרְשׁ֣וּ חֹרְשִׁ֑ים הֶ֝אֱרִ֗יכוּ (למענותם) [לְמַעֲנִיתָֽם]׃
Translated:
Plowmen plowed across my back;
they made long furrows.
Transliteration: al-gaviy chareshu choreshiym heeriykhu (lmnvtm) [lemaaniytam]

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה צַדִּ֑יק קִ֝צֵּ֗ץ עֲב֣וֹת רְשָׁעִֽים׃
Translated:
The LORD, the righteous one,
has snapped the cords of the wicked.
Transliteration: yehovah tsadiyk kitsets avvot reshaiym

Hebrew: יֵ֭בֹשׁוּ וְיִסֹּ֣גוּ אָח֑וֹר כֹּ֝֗ל שֹׂנְאֵ֥י צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Let all who hate Zion
fall back in disgrace.
Transliteration: eivoshu veyisogu achvor khol shoneey tsiyyvon

Hebrew: יִ֭הְיוּ כַּחֲצִ֣יר גַּגּ֑וֹת שֶׁקַּדְמַ֖ת שָׁלַ֣ף יָבֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
Let them be like grass on roofs
that fades before it can be pulled up,
Transliteration: yiheyu khachatsiyr gagvot shekademat shalaf yavesh

Hebrew: שֶׁלֹּ֤א מִלֵּ֖א כַפּ֥וֹ קוֹצֵ֗ר וְחִצְנ֥וֹ מְעַמֵּֽר׃
Translated:
that affords no handful for the reaper,
no armful for the gatherer of sheaves,
Transliteration: shelo mile khafvo kvotser vechitsenvo meamer

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א אָמְר֨וּ ׀ הָעֹבְרִ֗ים בִּרְכַּֽת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם בֵּרַ֥כְנוּ אֶ֝תְכֶ֗ם בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
no exchange with passersby:
“The blessing of the LORD be upon you.”
“We bless you by the name of the LORD.”
Transliteration: velo ameru haoveriym virekhat-yehovah aleykhem verakhenu etekhem veshem yehovah {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֑וֹת מִמַּעֲמַקִּ֖ים קְרָאתִ֣יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
A song of ascents.

Out of the depths I call You, O LORD.
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot mimaamakiym keratiykha yehovah

Hebrew: אֲדֹנָי֮ שִׁמְעָ֢ה בְק֫וֹלִ֥י תִּהְיֶ֣ינָה אׇ֭זְנֶיךָ קַשֻּׁב֑וֹת לְ֝ק֗וֹל תַּחֲנוּנָֽי׃
Translated:
O Lord, listen to my cry;
let Your ears be attentive
to my plea for mercy.
Transliteration: adonay shimea֢h vekvoliy tiheyeynah ׇzeneykha kashuvvot lekvol tachanunay

Hebrew: אִם־עֲוֺנ֥וֹת תִּשְׁמׇר־יָ֑הּ אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י מִ֣י יַעֲמֹֽד׃
Translated:
If You keep account of sins, O LORD,
Lord, who will survive?
Transliteration: im-avonvot tishemׇr-yah adonay miy yaamod

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עִמְּךָ֥ הַסְּלִיחָ֑ה לְ֝מַ֗עַן תִּוָּרֵֽא׃
Translated:
Yours is the power to forgive
so that You may be held in awe.
Transliteration: khiy-imekha haseliychah lemaan tivare

Hebrew: קִוִּ֣יתִי יְ֭הֹוָה קִוְּתָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֑י וְֽלִדְבָר֥וֹ הוֹחָֽלְתִּי׃
Translated:
I look to the LORD;
I look to Him;
I await His word.
Transliteration: kiviytiy yehovah kivetah nafeshiy velidevarvo hvochaletiy

Hebrew: נַפְשִׁ֥י לַאדֹנָ֑י מִשֹּׁמְרִ֥ים לַ֝בֹּ֗קֶר שֹׁמְרִ֥ים לַבֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated:
I am more eager for the Lord
than watchmen for the morning,
watchmen for the morning.
Transliteration: nafeshiy ladonay mishomeriym lavoker shomeriym lavoker

Hebrew: יַחֵ֥ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶל־יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה כִּֽי־עִם־יְהֹוָ֥ה הַחֶ֑סֶד וְהַרְבֵּ֖ה עִמּ֣וֹ פְדֽוּת׃
Translated:
O Israel, wait for the LORD;
for with the LORD is steadfast love
and great power to redeem.
Transliteration: yachel yisherael el-yehovah khiy-im-yehovah hachesed vehareveh imvo fedut

Hebrew: וְ֭הוּא יִפְדֶּ֣ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִ֝כֹּ֗ל עֲוֺנֹתָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: It is He who will redeem Israel from all their iniquities.
Transliteration: vehu yifedeh et-yisherael mikhol avonotayv {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לְדָ֫וִ֥ד יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ לֹא־גָבַ֣הּ לִ֭בִּי וְלֹא־רָמ֣וּ עֵינַ֑י וְלֹֽא־הִלַּ֓כְתִּי ׀ בִּגְדֹל֖וֹת וּבְנִפְלָא֣וֹת מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
A song of ascents. Of David.

O LORD, my heart is not proud
nor my look haughty;
I do not aspire to great things
or to what is beyond me;
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot ledavid yehovah lo-gavah liviy velo-ramu eynay velo-hilakhetiy vigedolvot uvenifelavot mimeniy

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֤א שִׁוִּ֨יתִי ׀ וְדוֹמַ֗מְתִּי נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י כְּ֭גָמֻל עֲלֵ֣י אִמּ֑וֹ כַּגָּמֻ֖ל עָלַ֣י נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
but I have taught myself to be contented
like a weaned child with its mother;
like a weaned child am I in my mind.
Transliteration: im-lo shiviytiy vedvomametiy nafeshiy khegamul aley imvo khagamul alay nafeshiy

Hebrew: יַחֵ֣ל יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה מֵ֝עַתָּ֗ה וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
O Israel, wait for the LORD
now and forever.
Transliteration: yachel yisherael el-yehovah meatah vead-volam {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת זְכוֹר־יְהֹוָ֥ה לְדָוִ֑ד אֵ֝֗ת כׇּל־עֻנּוֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
A song of ascents.

O LORD, remember in David’s favor
his extreme self-denial,
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot zekhvor-yehovah ledavid et khׇl-unvotvo

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִ֭שְׁבַּע לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה נָ֝דַ֗ר לַאֲבִ֥יר יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
how he swore to the LORD,
vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob,
Transliteration: asher nisheva layhovah nadar laaviyr yaakov

Hebrew: אִם־אָ֭בֹא בְּאֹ֣הֶל בֵּיתִ֑י אִם־אֶ֝עֱלֶ֗ה עַל־עֶ֥רֶשׂ יְצוּעָֽי׃
Translated:
“I will not enter my house,
nor will I mount my bed,
Transliteration: im-avo veohel veytiy im-eeleh al-eresh yetsuay

Hebrew: אִם־אֶתֵּ֣ן שְׁנַ֣ת לְעֵינָ֑י לְֽעַפְעַפַּ֥י תְּנוּמָֽה׃
Translated:
I will not give sleep to my eyes,
or slumber to my eyelids
Transliteration: im-eten shenat leeynay leafeafay tenumah

Hebrew: עַד־אֶמְצָ֣א מָ֭קוֹם לַיהֹוָ֑ה מִ֝שְׁכָּנ֗וֹת לַאֲבִ֥יר יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
until I find a place for the LORD,
an abode for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
Transliteration: ad-emetsa makvom layhovah mishekhanvot laaviyr yaakov

Hebrew: הִנֵּֽה־שְׁמַעֲנ֥וּהָ בְאֶפְרָ֑תָה מְ֝צָאנ֗וּהָ בִּשְׂדֵי־יָֽעַר׃
Translated:
We heard it was in Ephrath;
we came upon it in the region of Jaar.
Transliteration: hineh-shemaanuha veeferatah metsanuha vishedey-yaar

Hebrew: נָב֥וֹאָה לְמִשְׁכְּנוֹתָ֑יו נִ֝שְׁתַּחֲוֶ֗ה לַהֲדֹ֥ם רַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated:
Let us enter His abode,
bow at His footstool.
Transliteration: navvoah lemishekhenvotayv nishetachaveh lahadom ragelayv

Hebrew: קוּמָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה לִמְנוּחָתֶ֑ךָ אַ֝תָּ֗ה וַאֲר֥וֹן עֻזֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
Advance, O LORD, to Your resting-place,
You and Your mighty Ark!
Transliteration: kumah yehovah limenuchatekha atah vaarvon uzekha

Hebrew: כֹּהֲנֶ֥יךָ יִלְבְּשׁוּ־צֶ֑דֶק וַחֲסִידֶ֥יךָ יְרַנֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Your priests are clothed in triumph;
Your loyal ones sing for joy.
Transliteration: khohaneykha yileveshu-tsedek vachasiydeykha yeranenu

Hebrew: בַּ֭עֲבוּר דָּוִ֣ד עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ אַל־תָּ֝שֵׁ֗ב פְּנֵ֣י מְשִׁיחֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
For the sake of Your servant David
do not reject Your anointed one.
Transliteration: vaavur david avedekha al-tashev feney meshiychekha

Hebrew: נִשְׁבַּֽע־יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ לְדָוִ֡ד אֱמֶת֮ לֹא־יָשׁ֢וּב מִ֫מֶּ֥נָּה מִפְּרִ֥י בִטְנְךָ֑ אָ֝שִׁ֗ית לְכִסֵּא־לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
The LORD swore to David
a firm oath that He will not renounce,
“One of your own issue I will set upon your throne.
Transliteration: nisheva-yehovah ledavid emet lo-yashuv mimenah miferiy vitenekha ashiyt lekhise-lakhe

Hebrew: אִֽם־יִשְׁמְר֬וּ בָנֶ֨יךָ ׀ בְּרִיתִי֮ וְעֵדֹתִ֥י ז֗וֹ אֲלַ֫מְּדֵ֥ם גַּם־בְּנֵיהֶ֥ם עֲדֵי־עַ֑ד יֵ֝שְׁב֗וּ לְכִסֵּא־לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
If your sons keep My covenant
and My decrees that I teach them,
then their sons also,
to the end of time,
shall sit upon your throne.”
Transliteration: im-yishemeru vaneykha veriytiy veedotiy zvo alamedem gam-veneyhem adey-ad eishevu lekhise-lakhe

Hebrew: כִּי־בָחַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּצִיּ֑וֹן אִ֝וָּ֗הּ לְמוֹשָׁ֥ב לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For the LORD has chosen Zion;
He has desired it for His seat.
Transliteration: khiy-vachar yehovah vetsiyyvon ivah lemvoshav lvo

Hebrew: זֹאת־מְנוּחָתִ֥י עֲדֵי־עַ֑ד פֹּה־אֵ֝שֵׁ֗ב כִּ֣י אִוִּתִֽיהָ׃
Translated:
“This is my resting-place for all time;
here I will dwell, for I desire it.
Transliteration: zot-menuchatiy adey-ad foh-eshev khiy ivitiyha

Hebrew: צֵ֭ידָהּ בָּרֵ֣ךְ אֲבָרֵ֑ךְ אֶ֝בְיוֹנֶ֗יהָ אַשְׂבִּ֥יעַֽ לָֽחֶם׃
Translated:
I will amply bless its store of food,
give its needy their fill of bread.
Transliteration: tseydah varekhe avarekhe eveyvoneyha asheviya lachem

Hebrew: וְֽ֭כֹהֲנֶיהָ אַלְבִּ֣ישׁ יֶ֑שַׁע וַ֝חֲסִידֶ֗יהָ רַנֵּ֥ן יְרַנֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
I will clothe its priests in victory,
its loyal ones shall sing for joy.
Transliteration: vekhohaneyha aleviysh yesha vachasiydeyha ranen yeranenu

Hebrew: שָׁ֤ם אַצְמִ֣יחַ קֶ֣רֶן לְדָוִ֑ד עָרַ֥כְתִּי נֵ֝֗ר לִמְשִׁיחִֽי׃
Translated:
There I will make a horn sprout for David;
I have prepared a lamp for My anointed one.
Transliteration: sham atsemiycha keren ledavid arakhetiy ner limeshiychiy

Hebrew: א֭וֹיְבָיו אַלְבִּ֣ישׁ בֹּ֑שֶׁת וְ֝עָלָ֗יו יָצִ֥יץ נִזְרֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will clothe his enemies in disgrace,
while on him his crown shall sparkle.”
Transliteration: voyevayv aleviysh voshet vealayv yatsiyts nizervo {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לְדָ֫וִ֥ד הִנֵּ֣ה מַה־טּ֭וֹב וּמַה־נָּעִ֑ים שֶׁ֖בֶת אַחִ֣ים גַּם־יָֽחַד׃
Translated:
A song of ascents. Of David.

How good and how pleasant it is
that brothers dwell together.
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot ledavid hineh mah-tvov umah-naiym shevet achiym gam-yachad

Hebrew: כַּשֶּׁ֤מֶן הַטּ֨וֹב ׀ עַל־הָרֹ֗אשׁ יֹרֵ֗ד עַֽל־הַזָּקָ֥ן זְקַֽן־אַהֲרֹ֑ן שֶׁ֝יֹּרֵ֗ד עַל־פִּ֥י מִדּוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
It is like fine oil on the head
running down onto the beard,
the beard of Aaron,
that comes down over the collar of his robe;
Transliteration: khashemen hatvov al-harosh yored al-hazakan zekan-aharon sheyored al-fiy midvotayv

Hebrew: כְּטַל־חֶרְמ֗וֹן שֶׁיֹּרֵד֮ עַל־הַרְרֵ֢י צִ֫יּ֥וֹן כִּ֤י שָׁ֨ם ׀ צִוָּ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־הַבְּרָכָ֑ה חַ֝יִּ֗ים עַד־הָעוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
like the dew of Hermon
that falls upon the mountains of Zion.
There the LORD ordained blessing,
everlasting life.
Transliteration: khetal-cheremvon sheyored al-harere֢y tsiyyvon khiy sham tsivah yehovah et-haverakhah chayiym ad-havolam {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת הִנֵּ֤ה ׀ בָּרְכ֣וּ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־עַבְדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הָעֹמְדִ֥ים בְּבֵית־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בַּלֵּילֽוֹת׃
Translated:
A song of ascents.

Now bless the LORD,
all you servants of the LORD
who stand nightly
in the house of the LORD.
Transliteration: shiyr hamaalvot hineh varekhu et-yehovah khׇl-avedey yehovah haomediym veveyt-yehovah valeylvot

Hebrew: שְׂאֽוּ־יְדֵכֶ֥ם קֹ֑דֶשׁ וּ֝בָרְכ֗וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Lift your hands toward the sanctuary
and bless the LORD.
Transliteration: sheu-yedekhem kodesh uvarekhu et-yehovah

Hebrew: יְבָרֶכְךָ֣ יְ֭הֹוָה מִצִּיּ֑וֹן עֹ֝שֵׂ֗ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
May the LORD,
maker of heaven and earth,
bless you from Zion.
Transliteration: yevarekhekha yehovah mitsiyyvon osheh shamayiim vaarets {f}

Hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ הַֽ֭לְלוּ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה הַֽ֝לְל֗וּ עַבְדֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Hallelujah.
Praise the name of the LORD;
give praise, you servants of the LORD
Transliteration: halelu-yah halelu et-shem yehovah halelu avedey yehovah

Hebrew: שֶׁ֣֭עֹמְדִים בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּ֝חַצְר֗וֹת בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
who stand in the house of the LORD,
in the courts of the house of our God.
Transliteration: sheomediym veveyt yehovah vechatservot veyt eloheynu

Hebrew: הַֽלְלוּ־יָ֭הּ כִּֽי־ט֣וֹב יְהֹוָ֑ה זַמְּר֥וּ לִ֝שְׁמ֗וֹ כִּ֣י נָעִֽים׃
Translated:
Praise the LORD, for the LORD is good;
sing hymns to His name, for it is pleasant.
Transliteration: halelu-yah khiy-tvov yehovah zameru lishemvo khiy naiym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יַעֲקֹ֗ב בָּחַ֣ר ל֣וֹ יָ֑הּ יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל לִסְגֻלָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For the LORD has chosen Jacob for Himself,
Israel, as His treasured possession.
Transliteration: khiy-yaakov vachar lvo yah yisherael lisegulatvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֲנִ֣י יָ֭דַעְתִּי כִּֽי־גָד֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֑ה וַ֝אֲדֹנֵ֗ינוּ מִכׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
For I know that the LORD is great,
that our Lord is greater than all gods.
Transliteration: khiy aniy yadaetiy khiy-gadvol yehovah vaadoneynu mikhׇl-Elohim

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־חָפֵ֥ץ יְהֹוָ֗ה עָ֫שָׂ֥ה בַּשָּׁמַ֥יִם וּבָאָ֑רֶץ בַּ֝יַּמִּ֗ים וְכׇל־תְּהֹמֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Whatever the LORD desires He does
in heaven and earth,
in the seas and all the depths.
Transliteration: khol asher-chafets yehovah ashah vashamayiim uvaarets vayamiym vekhׇl-tehomvot

Hebrew: מַעֲלֶ֣ה נְשִׂאִים֮ מִקְצֵ֢ה הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ בְּרָקִ֣ים לַמָּטָ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה מֽוֹצֵא־ר֝֗וּחַ מֵאֽוֹצְרוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
He makes clouds rise from the end of the earth;
He makes lightning for the rain;
He releases the wind from His vaults.
Transliteration: maaleh neshiiym miketse֢h haarets verakiym lamatar ashah mvotse-ruucha mevotservotayv

Hebrew: שֶׁ֭הִכָּה בְּכוֹרֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם מֵ֝אָדָ֗ם עַד־בְּהֵמָֽה׃
Translated:
He struck down the first-born of Egypt,
man and beast alike;
Transliteration: shehikhah vekhvorey mitserayiim meadam ad-vehemah

Hebrew: שָׁלַ֤ח ׀ אוֹתֹ֣ת וּ֭מֹפְתִים בְּתוֹכֵ֣כִי מִצְרָ֑יִם בְּ֝פַרְעֹ֗ה וּבְכׇל־עֲבָדָֽיו׃
Translated:
He sent signs and portents against Egypt,
against Pharaoh and all his servants;
Transliteration: shalach votot umofetiym vetvokhekhiy mitserayiim vefareoh uvekhׇl-avadayv

Hebrew: שֶׁ֭הִכָּה גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֑ים וְ֝הָרַ֗ג מְלָכִ֥ים עֲצוּמִֽים׃
Translated:
He struck down many nations
and slew numerous kings—
Transliteration: shehikhah gvoyim raviym veharag melakhiym atsumiym

Hebrew: לְסִיח֤וֹן ׀ מֶ֤לֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֗י וּ֭לְעוֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֑ן וּ֝לְכֹ֗ל מַמְלְכ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
Og, king of Bashan,
and all the royalty of Canaan—
Transliteration: lesiychvon melekhe haemoriy ulevog melekhe havashan ulekhol mamelekhvot khenaan

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֣ן אַרְצָ֣ם נַחֲלָ֑ה נַ֝חֲלָ֗ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
and gave their lands as a heritage,
as a heritage to His people Israel.
Transliteration: venatan aretsam nachalah nachalah leyisherael amvo

Hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה שִׁמְךָ֣ לְעוֹלָ֑ם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה זִכְרְךָ֥ לְדֹר־וָדֹֽר׃
Translated:
O LORD, Your name endures forever,
Your fame, O LORD, through all generations;
Transliteration: yehovah shimekha levolam yehovah zikherekha ledor-vador

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָדִ֣ין יְהֹוָ֣ה עַמּ֑וֹ וְעַל־עֲ֝בָדָ֗יו יִתְנֶחָֽם׃
Translated:
for the LORD will champion His people,
and obtain satisfaction for His servants.
Transliteration: khiy-yadiyn yehovah amvo veal-avadayv yitenecham

Hebrew: עֲצַבֵּ֣י הַ֭גּוֹיִם כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֑ב מַ֝עֲשֵׂ֗ה יְדֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
the work of men’s hands.
Transliteration: atsavey hagvoyim khesef vezahav maasheh yedey adam

Hebrew: פֶּֽה־לָ֭הֶם וְלֹ֣א יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ עֵינַ֥יִם לָ֝הֶ֗ם וְלֹ֣א יִרְאֽוּ׃
Translated:
They have mouths, but cannot speak;
they have eyes, but cannot see;
Transliteration: feh-lahem velo yedaveru eynayiim lahem velo yireu

Hebrew: אׇזְנַ֣יִם לָ֭הֶם וְלֹ֣א יַאֲזִ֑ינוּ אַ֝֗ף אֵין־יֶשׁ־ר֥וּחַ בְּפִיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
they have ears, but cannot hear,
nor is there breath in their mouths.
Transliteration: ׇzenayiim lahem velo yaaziynu af eyn-yesh-rucha vefiyhem

Hebrew: כְּ֭מוֹהֶם יִהְי֣וּ עֹשֵׂיהֶ֑ם כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־בֹּטֵ֣חַ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Those who fashion them,
all who trust in them,
shall become like them.
Transliteration: khemvohem yiheyu osheyhem khol asher-votecha vahem

Hebrew: בֵּ֣ית יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל בָּרְכ֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה בֵּ֥ית אַ֝הֲרֹ֗ן בָּרְכ֥וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
O house of Israel, bless the LORD;
O house of Aaron, bless the LORD;
Transliteration: veyt yisherael varekhu et-yehovah veyt aharon varekhu et-yehovah

Hebrew: בֵּ֣ית הַ֭לֵּוִי בָּרְכ֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה יִֽרְאֵ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בָּרְכ֥וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
O house of Levi, bless the LORD;
you who fear the LORD, bless the LORD.
Transliteration: veyt haleviy varekhu et-yehovah yireey yehovah varekhu et-yehovah

Hebrew: בָּ֘ר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ מִצִּיּ֗וֹן שֹׁ֘כֵ֤ן יְֽרוּשָׁלָ֗͏ִם הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Blessed is the LORD from Zion,
He who dwells in Jerusalem.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: varukhe yehovah mitsiyyvon shokhen yerushala͏im halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Praise the LORD; for He is good,
His steadfast love is eternal.
Transliteration: hvodu layhovah khiy-tvov khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: ה֭וֹדוּ לֵאלֹהֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Praise the God of gods,
His steadfast love is eternal.
Transliteration: hvodu lelohey haElohim khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: ה֭וֹדוּ לַאֲדֹנֵ֣י הָאֲדֹנִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Praise the Lord of lords,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: hvodu laadoney haadoniym khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: לְעֹ֘שֵׂ֤ה נִפְלָא֣וֹת גְּדֹל֣וֹת לְבַדּ֑וֹ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who alone works great marvels,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: leosheh nifelavot gedolvot levadvo khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: לְעֹשֵׂ֣ה הַ֭שָּׁמַיִם בִּתְבוּנָ֑ה כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who made the heavens with wisdom,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: leosheh hashamayim vitevunah khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: לְרֹקַ֣ע הָ֭אָרֶץ עַל־הַמָּ֑יִם כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who spread the earth over the water,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: leroka haarets al-hamayiim khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: לְ֭עֹשֵׂה אוֹרִ֣ים גְּדֹלִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who made the great lights,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: leosheh voriym gedoliym khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: אֶת־הַ֭שֶּׁמֶשׁ לְמֶמְשֶׁ֣לֶת בַּיּ֑וֹם כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
the sun to dominate the day,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: et-hashemesh lememeshelet vayyvom khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: אֶת־הַיָּרֵ֣חַ וְ֭כוֹכָבִים לְמֶמְשְׁל֣וֹת בַּלָּ֑יְלָה כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
the moon and the stars to dominate the night,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: et-hayarecha vekhvokhaviym lememeshelvot valayelah khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: לְמַכֵּ֣ה מִ֭צְרַיִם בִּבְכוֹרֵיהֶ֑ם כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who struck Egypt through their first-born,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: lemakheh mitserayim vivekhvoreyhem khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֣א יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל מִתּוֹכָ֑ם כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
and brought Israel out of their midst,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: vayyvotse yisherael mitvokham khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: בְּיָ֣ד חֲ֭זָקָה וּבִזְר֣וֹעַ נְטוּיָ֑ה כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
with a strong hand and outstretched arm,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: veyad chazakah uvizervoa netuyah khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: לְגֹזֵ֣ר יַם־ס֭וּף לִגְזָרִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who split apart the Sea of Reeds,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: legozer yam-suf ligezariym khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וְהֶעֱבִ֣יר יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל בְּתוֹכ֑וֹ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
and made Israel pass through it,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: veheeviyr yisherael vetvokhvo khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וְנִ֘עֵ֤ר פַּרְעֹ֣ה וְחֵיל֣וֹ בְיַם־ס֑וּף כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who hurled Pharaoh and his army into the Sea of Reeds,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: venier fareoh vecheylvo veyam-suf khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: לְמוֹלִ֣יךְ עַ֭מּוֹ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who led His people through the wilderness,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: lemvoliykhe amvo vamidevar khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: לְ֭מַכֵּה מְלָכִ֣ים גְּדֹלִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who struck down great kings,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: lemakheh melakhiym gedoliym khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וַֽ֭יַּהֲרֹג מְלָכִ֣ים אַדִּירִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
and slew mighty kings—
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: vayaharog melakhiym adiyriym khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: לְ֭סִיחוֹן מֶ֣לֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֑י כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: lesiychvon melekhe haemoriy khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וּ֭לְעוֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֑ן כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Og, king of Bashan—
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: ulevog melekhe havashan khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֣ן אַרְצָ֣ם לְנַחֲלָ֑ה כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
and gave their land as a heritage,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: venatan aretsam lenachalah khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: נַ֭חֲלָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עַבְדּ֑וֹ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
a heritage to His servant Israel,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: nachalah leyisherael avedvo khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: שֶׁ֭בְּשִׁפְלֵנוּ זָ֣כַר לָ֑נוּ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who took note of us in our degradation,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: sheveshifelenu zakhar lanu khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וַיִּפְרְקֵ֥נוּ מִצָּרֵ֑ינוּ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
and rescued us from our enemies,
His steadfast love is eternal;
Transliteration: vayiferekenu mitsareynu khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: נֹתֵ֣ן לֶ֭חֶם לְכׇל־בָּשָׂ֑ר כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who gives food to all flesh,
His steadfast love is eternal.
Transliteration: noten lechem lekhׇl-vashar khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: ה֭וֹדוּ לְאֵ֣ל הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Praise the God of heaven,
His steadfast love is eternal.
Transliteration: hvodu leel hashamayiim khiy levolam chasedvo {f}

Hebrew: עַ֥ל־נַהֲר֨וֹת ׀ בָּבֶ֗ל שָׁ֣ם יָ֭שַׁבְנוּ גַּם־בָּכִ֑ינוּ בְּ֝זׇכְרֵ֗נוּ אֶת־צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
By the rivers of Babylon,
there we sat,
sat and wept,
as we thought of Zion.
Transliteration: al-naharvot vavel sham yashavenu gam-vakhiynu vezׇkherenu et-tsiyyvon

Hebrew: עַֽל־עֲרָבִ֥ים בְּתוֹכָ֑הּ תָּ֝לִ֗ינוּ כִּנֹּרוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
There on the poplars
we hung up our lyres,
Transliteration: al-araviym vetvokhah taliynu khinorvoteynu

Hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁ֨ם שְֽׁאֵל֪וּנוּ שׁוֹבֵ֡ינוּ דִּבְרֵי־שִׁ֭יר וְתוֹלָלֵ֣ינוּ שִׂמְחָ֑ה שִׁ֥ירוּ לָ֝֗נוּ מִשִּׁ֥יר צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
for our captors asked us there for songs,
our tormentors, for amusement:
“Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
Transliteration: khiy sham sheelunu shvoveynu diverey-shiyr vetvolaleynu shimechah shiyru lanu mishiyr tsiyyvon

Hebrew: אֵ֗יךְ נָשִׁ֥יר אֶת־שִׁיר־יְהֹוָ֑ה עַ֝֗ל אַדְמַ֥ת נֵכָֽר׃
Translated:
How can we sing a song of the LORD
on alien soil?
Transliteration: eykhe nashiyr et-shiyr-yehovah al ademat nekhar

Hebrew: אִֽם־אֶשְׁכָּחֵ֥ךְ יְֽרוּשָׁלָ֗͏ִם תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח יְמִינִֽי׃
Translated:
If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
let my right hand wither;
Transliteration: im-eshekhachekhe yerushala͏im tishekhach yemiyniy

Hebrew: תִּדְבַּֽק־לְשׁוֹנִ֨י ׀ לְחִכִּי֮ אִם־לֹ֢א אֶ֫זְכְּרֵ֥כִי אִם־לֹ֣א אַ֭עֲלֶה אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֑͏ִם עַ֝֗ל רֹ֣אשׁ שִׂמְחָתִֽי׃
Translated:
let my tongue stick to my palate
if I cease to think of you,
if I do not keep Jerusalem in memory
even at my happiest hour.
Transliteration: tidevak-leshvoniy lechikhiy im-lo֢ ezekherekhiy im-lo aaleh et-yerushala͏im al rosh shimechatiy

Hebrew: זְכֹ֤ר יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ לִבְנֵ֬י אֱד֗וֹם אֵת֮ י֤וֹם יְֽר֫וּשָׁלָ֥͏ִם הָ֭אֹ֣מְרִים עָ֤רוּ ׀ עָ֑רוּ עַ֝֗ד הַיְס֥וֹד בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Remember, O LORD, against the Edomites
the day of Jerusalem’s fall;
how they cried, “Strip her, strip her
to her very foundations!”
Transliteration: zekhor yehovah liveney edvom et yvom yerushala͏im haomeriym aru aru ad hayesvod vah

Hebrew: בַּת־בָּבֶ֗ל הַשְּׁד֫וּדָ֥ה אַשְׁרֵ֥י שֶׁיְשַׁלֶּם־לָ֑ךְ אֶת־גְּ֝מוּלֵ֗ךְ שֶׁגָּמַ֥לְתְּ לָֽנוּ׃
Translated:
Fair Babylon, you predator,
a blessing on him who repays you in kind
what you have inflicted on us;
Transliteration: vat-vavel hashedudah asherey sheyeshalem-lakhe et-gemulekhe shegamalete lanu

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֤י ׀ שֶׁיֹּאחֵ֓ז וְנִפֵּ֬ץ אֶֽת־עֹלָלַ֗יִךְ אֶל־הַסָּֽלַע׃ {פ}
Translated:
a blessing on him who seizes your babies
and dashes them against the rocks!
Transliteration: asherey sheyochez venifets et-olalayiikhe el-hasala {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ אוֹדְךָ֥ בְכׇל־לִבִּ֑י נֶ֖גֶד אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲזַמְּרֶֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Of David.

I praise You with all my heart,
sing a hymn to You before the divine beings;
Transliteration: ledavid vodekha vekhׇl-liviy neged Elohim azamerekha

Hebrew: אֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֨ה אֶל־הֵיכַ֪ל קׇדְשְׁךָ֡ וְא֘וֹדֶ֤ה אֶת־שְׁמֶ֗ךָ עַל־חַסְדְּךָ֥ וְעַל־אֲמִתֶּ֑ךָ כִּֽי־הִגְדַּ֥לְתָּ עַל־כׇּל־שִׁ֝מְךָ֗ אִמְרָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
I bow toward Your holy temple
and praise Your name for Your steadfast love and faithfulness,
because You have exalted Your name, Your word, above all.a
Transliteration: eshetachaveh el-heykhal kׇdeshekha vevodeh et-shemekha al-chasedekha veal-amitekha khiy-higedaleta al-khׇl-shimekha imeratekha

Hebrew: בְּי֣וֹם קָ֭רָֽאתִי וַֽתַּעֲנֵ֑נִי תַּרְהִבֵ֖נִי בְנַפְשִׁ֣י עֹֽז׃
Translated:
When I called, You answered me,
You inspired me with courage.
Transliteration: veyvom karatiy vataaneniy tarehiveniy venafeshiy oz

Hebrew: יוֹד֣וּךָ יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־מַלְכֵי־אָ֑רֶץ כִּ֥י שָׁ֝מְע֗וּ אִמְרֵי־פִֽיךָ׃
Translated:
All the kings of the earth shall praise You, O LORD,
for they have heard the words You spoke.
Transliteration: yvodukha yehovah khׇl-malekhey-arets khiy shameu imerey-fiykha

Hebrew: וְ֭יָשִׁירוּ בְּדַרְכֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּֽי־גָ֝ד֗וֹל כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
They shall sing of the ways of the LORD,
“Great is the majesty of the LORD!”
Transliteration: veyashiyru vedarekhey yehovah khiy-gadvol khevvod yehovah

Hebrew: כִּי־רָ֣ם יְ֭הֹוָה וְשָׁפָ֣ל יִרְאֶ֑ה וְ֝גָבֹ֗הַּ מִמֶּרְחָ֥ק יְיֵדָֽע׃
Translated:
High though the LORD is, He sees the lowly;
lofty, He perceives from afar.
Transliteration: khiy-ram yehovah veshafal yireeh vegavoha mimerechak yeeida

Hebrew: אִם־אֵלֵ֤ךְ ׀ בְּקֶ֥רֶב צָרָ֗ה תְּחַ֫יֵּ֥נִי עַ֤ל אַ֣ף אֹ֭יְבַי תִּשְׁלַ֣ח יָדֶ֑ךָ וְת֖וֹשִׁיעֵ֣נִי יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Though I walk among enemies,
You preserve me in the face of my foes;
You extend Your hand;
with Your right hand You deliver me.
Transliteration: im-elekhe vekerev tsarah techayeniy al af oyevay tishelach yadekha vetvoshiyeniy yemiynekha

Hebrew: יְהֹוָה֮ יִגְמֹ֢ר בַּ֫עֲדִ֥י יְ֭הֹוָה חַסְדְּךָ֣ לְעוֹלָ֑ם מַעֲשֵׂ֖י יָדֶ֣יךָ אַל־תֶּֽרֶף׃ {פ}
Translated:
The LORD will settle accounts for me.
O LORD, Your steadfast love is eternal;
do not forsake the work of Your hands.
Transliteration: yehovah yigemo֢r vaadiy yehovah chasedekha levolam maashey yadeykha al-teref {f}

Hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ לְדָוִ֣ד מִזְמ֑וֹר יְהֹוָ֥ה חֲ֝קַרְתַּ֗נִי וַתֵּדָֽע׃
Translated:
For the leader. Of David. A psalm.

O LORD, You have examined me and know me.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha ledavid mizemvor yehovah chakaretaniy vateda

Hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה יָ֭דַעְתָּ שִׁבְתִּ֣י וְקוּמִ֑י בַּ֥נְתָּה לְ֝רֵעִ֗י מֵרָחֽוֹק׃
Translated:
When I sit down or stand up You know it;
You discern my thoughts from afar.
Transliteration: atah yadaeta shivetiy vekumiy vanetah lereiy merachvok

Hebrew: אׇרְחִ֣י וְרִבְעִ֣י זֵרִ֑יתָ וְֽכׇל־דְּרָכַ֥י הִסְכַּֽנְתָּה׃
Translated:
You observe my walking and reclining,
and are familiar with all my ways.
Transliteration: ׇrechiy veriveiy zeriyta vekhׇl-derakhay hisekhanetah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֣ין מִ֭לָּה בִּלְשׁוֹנִ֑י הֵ֥ן יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יָדַ֥עְתָּ כֻלָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
There is not a word on my tongue
but that You, O LORD, know it well.
Transliteration: khiy eyn milah vileshvoniy hen yehovah yadaeta khulah

Hebrew: אָח֣וֹר וָקֶ֣דֶם צַרְתָּ֑נִי וַתָּ֖שֶׁת עָלַ֣י כַּפֶּֽכָה׃
Translated:
You hedge me before and behind;
You lay Your hand upon me.
Transliteration: achvor vakedem tsaretaniy vatashet alay khafekhah

Hebrew: (פלאיה) [פְּלִ֣יאָֽה] דַ֣עַת מִמֶּ֑נִּי נִ֝שְׂגְּבָ֗ה לֹא־א֥וּכַֽל לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
It is beyond my knowledge;
it is a mystery; I cannot fathom it.
Transliteration: (flyh) [feliyah] daat mimeniy nishegevah lo-ukhal lah

Hebrew: אָ֭נָֽה אֵלֵ֣ךְ מֵרוּחֶ֑ךָ וְ֝אָ֗נָה מִפָּנֶ֥יךָ אֶבְרָֽח׃
Translated:
Where can I escape from Your spirit?
Where can I flee from Your presence?
Transliteration: anah elekhe meruchekha veanah mifaneykha everach

Hebrew: אִם־אֶסַּ֣ק שָׁ֭מַיִם שָׁ֣ם אָ֑תָּה וְאַצִּ֖יעָה שְּׁא֣וֹל הִנֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
If I ascend to heaven, You are there;
if I descend to Sheol, You are there too.
Transliteration: im-esak shamayim sham atah veatsiyah shevol hinekha

Hebrew: אֶשָּׂ֥א כַנְפֵי־שָׁ֑חַר אֶ֝שְׁכְּנָ֗ה בְּאַחֲרִ֥ית יָֽם׃
Translated:
If I take wing with the dawn
to come to rest on the western horizon,
Transliteration: esha khanefey-shachar eshekhenah veachariyt yam

Hebrew: גַּם־שָׁ֭ם יָדְךָ֣ תַנְחֵ֑נִי וְֽתֹאחֲזֵ֥נִי יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
even there Your hand will be guiding me,
Your right hand will be holding me fast.
Transliteration: gam-sham yadekha tanecheniy vetochazeniy yemiynekha

Hebrew: וָ֭אֹמַר אַךְ־חֹ֣שֶׁךְ יְשׁוּפֵ֑נִי וְ֝לַ֗יְלָה א֣וֹר בַּעֲדֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
If I say, “Surely darkness will conceal me,
night will provide me with cover,”
Transliteration: vaomar akhe-choshekhe yeshufeniy velayelah vor vaadeniy

Hebrew: גַּם־חֹשֶׁךְ֮ לֹא־יַחְשִׁ֢יךְ מִ֫מֶּ֥ךָּ וְ֭לַיְלָה כַּיּ֣וֹם יָאִ֑יר כַּ֝חֲשֵׁיכָ֗ה כָּאוֹרָֽה׃
Translated:
darkness is not dark for You;
night is as light as day;
darkness and light are the same.
Transliteration: gam-choshekhe lo-yacheshi֢ykhe mimekha velayelah khayyvom yaiyr khachasheykhah khavorah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַ֭תָּה קָנִ֣יתָ כִלְיֹתָ֑י תְּ֝סֻכֵּ֗נִי בְּבֶ֣טֶן אִמִּֽי׃
Translated:
It was You who created my conscience;
You fashioned me in my mother’s womb.
Transliteration: khiy-atah kaniyta khileyotay tesukheniy veveten imiy

Hebrew: אוֹדְךָ֗ עַ֤ל כִּ֥י נוֹרָא֗וֹת נִ֫פְלֵ֥יתִי נִפְלָאִ֥ים מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ וְ֝נַפְשִׁ֗י יֹדַ֥עַת מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
I praise You,
for I am awesomely, wondrously made;
Your work is wonderful;
I know it very well.
Transliteration: vodekha al khiy nvoravot nifeleytiy nifelaiym maasheykha venafeshiy yodaat meod

Hebrew: לֹֽא־נִכְחַ֥ד עׇצְמִ֗י מִ֫מֶּ֥ךָּ אֲשֶׁר־עֻשֵּׂ֥יתִי בַסֵּ֑תֶר רֻ֝קַּ֗מְתִּי בְּֽתַחְתִּיּ֥וֹת אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
My frame was not concealed from You
when I was shaped in a hidden place,
knit together in the recesses of the earth.
Transliteration: lo-nikhechad ׇtsemiy mimekha asher-usheytiy vaseter rukametiy vetachetiyyvot arets

Hebrew: גׇּלְמִ֤י ׀ רָ֘א֤וּ עֵינֶ֗יךָ וְעַֽל־סִפְרְךָ֮ כֻּלָּ֢ם יִכָּ֫תֵ֥בוּ יָמִ֥ים יֻצָּ֑רוּ (ולא) [וְל֖וֹ] אֶחָ֣ד בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Your eyes saw my unformed limbs;
they were all recorded in Your book;
in due time they were formed,
to the very last one of them.
Transliteration: gׇlemiy rau eyneykha veal-siferekha khula֢m yikhatevu yamiym yutsaru (vl) [velvo] echad vahem

Hebrew: וְלִ֗י מַה־יָּקְר֣וּ רֵעֶ֣יךָ אֵ֑ל מֶ֥ה עָ֝צְמ֗וּ רָאשֵׁיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
How weighty Your thoughts seem to me, O God,
how great their number!
Transliteration: veliy mah-yakeru reeykha el meh atsemu rasheyhem

Hebrew: אֶ֭סְפְּרֵם מֵח֣וֹל יִרְבּ֑וּן הֱ֝קִיצֹ֗תִי וְעוֹדִ֥י עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
I count them—they exceed the grains of sand;
I end—but am still with You.
Transliteration: eseferem mechvol yirevun hekiytsotiy vevodiy imakhe

Hebrew: אִם־תִּקְטֹ֖ל אֱל֥וֹהַּ <small>׀</small> רָשָׁ֑ע וְאַנְשֵׁ֥י דָ֝מִ֗ים ס֣וּרוּ מֶֽנִּי׃
Translated:
O God, if You would only slay the wicked—
you murderers, away from me!—
Transliteration: im-tiketol elvoha <small></small> rasha veaneshey damiym suru meniy

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֹ֭מְרוּךָ לִמְזִמָּ֑ה נָשׂ֖וּא לַשָּׁ֣וְא עָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
who invoke You for intrigue,
Your enemies who swear by You falsely.
Transliteration: asher yomerukha limezimah nashu lashave areykha

Hebrew: הֲלֽוֹא־מְשַׂנְאֶ֖יךָ יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> אֶשְׂנָ֑א וּ֝בִתְקוֹמְמֶ֗יךָ אֶתְקוֹטָֽט׃
Translated:
O LORD, You know I hate those who hate You,
and loathe Your adversaries.
Transliteration: halvo-meshaneeykha yehovah <small></small> eshena uvitekvomemeykha etekvotat

Hebrew: תַּכְלִ֣ית שִׂנְאָ֣ה שְׂנֵאתִ֑ים לְ֝אוֹיְבִ֗ים הָ֣יוּ לִֽי׃
Translated:
I feel a perfect hatred toward them;
I count them my enemies.
Transliteration: takheliyt shineah shenetiym levoyeviym hayu liy

Hebrew: חׇקְרֵ֣נִי אֵ֭ל וְדַ֣ע לְבָבִ֑י בְּ֝חָנֵ֗נִי וְדַ֣ע שַׂרְעַפָּֽי׃
Translated:
Examine me, O God, and know my mind;
probe me and know my thoughts.
Transliteration: chׇkereniy el veda levaviy vechaneniy veda shareafay

Hebrew: וּרְאֵ֗ה אִם־דֶּֽרֶךְ־עֹ֥צֶב בִּ֑י וּ֝נְחֵ֗נִי בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
See if I have vexatious ways,
and guide me in ways everlasting.
Transliteration: ureeh im-derekhe-otsev viy unecheniy vederekhe volam {f}

Hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: For the leader. A psalm of David.
Transliteration: lamenatsecha mizemvor ledavid

Hebrew: חַלְּצֵ֣נִי יְ֭הֹוָה מֵאָדָ֣ם רָ֑ע מֵאִ֖ישׁ חֲמָסִ֣ים תִּנְצְרֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Rescue me, O LORD, from evil men;
save me from the lawless,
Transliteration: chaletseniy yehovah meadam ra meiysh chamasiym tinetsereniy

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר חָשְׁב֣וּ רָע֣וֹת בְּלֵ֑ב כׇּל־י֝֗וֹם יָג֥וּרוּ מִלְחָמֽוֹת׃
Translated:
whose minds are full of evil schemes,
who plot war every day.
Transliteration: asher chashevu ravot velev khׇl-yvom yaguru milechamvot

Hebrew: שָׁ֥נְנ֣וּ לְשׁוֹנָם֮ כְּֽמוֹ־נָ֫חָ֥שׁ חֲמַ֥ת עַכְשׁ֑וּב תַּ֖חַת שְׂפָתֵ֣ימוֹ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
They sharpen their tongues like serpents;
spiders’ poison is on their lips. Selah.
Transliteration: shanenu leshvonam khemvo-nachash chamat akheshuv tachat shefateymvo selah

Hebrew: שׇׁמְרֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ מִ֘ידֵ֤י רָשָׁ֗ע מֵאִ֣ישׁ חֲמָסִ֣ים תִּנְצְרֵ֑נִי אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָ֝שְׁב֗וּ לִדְח֥וֹת פְּעָמָֽי׃
Translated:
O LORD, keep me out of the clutches of the wicked;
save me from lawless men
who scheme to make me fall.
Transliteration: shׇmereniy yehovah miydey rasha meiysh chamasiym tinetsereniy asher chashevu lidechvot feamay

Hebrew: טָ֥מְנֽוּ־גֵאִ֨ים ׀ פַּ֡ח לִ֗י וַחֲבָלִ֗ים פָּ֣רְשׂוּ רֶ֭שֶׁת לְיַד־מַעְגָּ֑ל מֹקְשִׁ֖ים שָׁתוּ־לִ֣י סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
Arrogant men laid traps with ropes for me;
they spread out a net along the way;
they set snares for me. Selah.
Transliteration: tamenu-geiym fach liy vachavaliym fareshu reshet leyad-maegal mokeshiym shatu-liy selah

Hebrew: אָמַ֣רְתִּי לַ֭יהֹוָה אֵ֣לִי אָ֑תָּה הַאֲזִ֥ינָה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה ק֣וֹל תַּחֲנוּנָֽי׃
Translated:
I said to the LORD: You are my God;
give ear, O LORD, to my pleas for mercy.
Transliteration: amaretiy layhovah eliy atah haaziynah yehovah kvol tachanunay

Hebrew: יֱהֹוִ֣ה אֲ֭דֹנָי עֹ֣ז יְשׁוּעָתִ֑י סַכֹּ֥תָה לְ֝רֹאשִׁ֗י בְּי֣וֹם נָֽשֶׁק׃
Translated:
O GOD, my Lord, the strength of my deliverance,
You protected my head on the day of battle.
Transliteration: yehovih adonay oz yeshuatiy sakhotah leroshiy veyvom nashek

Hebrew: אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן יְ֭הֹוָה מַאֲוַיֵּ֣י רָשָׁ֑ע זְמָמ֥וֹ אַל־תָּ֝פֵ֗ק יָר֥וּמוּ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
O LORD, do not grant the desires of the wicked;
do not let their plan succeed,
else they be exalted. Selah.
Transliteration: al-titen yehovah maavayey rasha zemamvo al-tafek yarumu selah

Hebrew: רֹ֥אשׁ מְסִבָּ֑י עֲמַ֖ל שְׂפָתֵ֣ימוֹ (יכסומו) [יְכַסֵּֽימוֹ]׃
Translated:
May the heads of those who beset me
be covered with the mischief of their lips.
Transliteration: rosh mesivay amal shefateymvo (ykhsvmv) [yekhaseymvo]

Hebrew: (ימיטו) [יִמּ֥וֹטוּ] עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם גֶּחָ֫לִ֥ים בָּאֵ֥שׁ יַפִּלֵ֑ם בְּ֝מַהֲמֹר֗וֹת בַּל־יָקֽוּמוּ׃
Translated:
may coals of fire drop down upon them,
and they be cast into pits, never to rise again.
Transliteration: (ymytv) [yimvotu] aleyhem gechaliym vaesh yafilem vemahamorvot val-yakumu

Hebrew: אִ֥ישׁ לָשׁוֹן֮ בַּל־יִכּ֢וֹן בָּ֫אָ֥רֶץ אִישׁ־חָמָ֥ס רָ֑ע יְ֝צוּדֶ֗נּוּ לְמַדְחֵפֹֽת׃
Translated:
Let slanderers have no place in the land;
let the evil of the lawless man drive him into corrals.
Transliteration: iysh lashvon val-yikh֢von vaarets iysh-chamas ra yetsudenu lemadechefot

Hebrew: (ידעת) [יָדַ֗עְתִּי] כִּֽי־יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה דִּ֣ין עָנִ֑י מִ֝שְׁפַּ֗ט אֶבְיֹנִֽים׃
Translated:
I know that the LORD will champion
the cause of the poor, the right of the needy.
Transliteration: (ydt) [yadaetiy] khiy-yaasheh yehovah diyn aniy mishefat eveyoniym

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ צַ֭דִּיקִים יוֹד֣וּ לִשְׁמֶ֑ךָ יֵשְׁב֥וּ יְ֝שָׁרִ֗ים אֶת־פָּנֶֽיךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Righteous men shall surely praise Your name;
the upright shall dwell in Your presence.
Transliteration: akhe tsadiykiym yvodu lishemekha eishevu yeshariym et-faneykha {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָ֫וִ֥ד יְהֹוָ֣ה קְ֭רָאתִיךָ ח֣וּשָׁה לִּ֑י הַאֲזִ֥ינָה ק֝וֹלִ֗י בְּקׇרְאִי־לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
A psalm of David.

I call You, O LORD, hasten to me;
give ear to my cry when I call You.
Transliteration: mizemvor ledavid yehovah keratiykha chushah liy haaziynah kvoliy vekׇreiy-lakhe

Hebrew: תִּכּ֤וֹן תְּפִלָּתִ֣י קְטֹ֣רֶת לְפָנֶ֑יךָ מַֽשְׂאַ֥ת כַּ֝פַּ֗י מִנְחַת־עָֽרֶב׃
Translated:
Take my prayer as an offering of incense,
my upraised hands as an evening sacrifice.
Transliteration: tikhvon tefilatiy ketoret lefaneykha masheat khafay minechat-arev

Hebrew: שִׁיתָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה שׇׁמְרָ֣ה לְפִ֑י נִ֝צְּרָ֗ה עַל־דַּ֥ל שְׂפָתָֽי׃
Translated:
O LORD, set a guard over my mouth,
a watch at the door of my lips;
Transliteration: shiytah yehovah shׇmerah lefiy nitserah al-dal shefatay

Hebrew: אַל־תַּט־לִבִּ֨י לְדָבָ֪ר ׀ רָ֡ע לְהִתְע֘וֹלֵ֤ל עֲלִל֨וֹת ׀ בְּרֶ֗שַׁע אֶת־אִישִׁ֥ים פֹּעֲלֵי־אָ֑וֶן וּבַל־אֶ֝לְחַ֗ם בְּמַנְעַמֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
let my mind not turn to an evil thing,
to practice deeds of wickedness
with men who are evildoers;
let me not feast on their dainties.
Transliteration: al-tat-liviy ledavar ra lehitevolel alilvot veresha et-iyshiym foaley-aven uval-elecham vemaneameyhem

Hebrew: יֶ֥הֶלְמֵֽנִי־צַדִּ֨יק ׀ חֶ֡סֶד וְֽיוֹכִיחֵ֗נִי שֶׁ֣מֶן רֹ֭אשׁ אַל־יָנִ֣י רֹאשִׁ֑י כִּי־ע֥וֹד וּ֝תְפִלָּתִ֗י בְּרָעוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Let the righteous man strike me in loyalty,
let him reprove me;
let my head not refuse such choice oil.
My prayers are still against their evil deeds.
Transliteration: yehelemeniy-tsadiyk chesed veyvokhiycheniy shemen rosh al-yaniy roshiy khiy-vod utefilatiy veravoteyhem

Hebrew: נִשְׁמְט֣וּ בִֽידֵי־סֶ֭לַע שֹׁפְטֵיהֶ֑ם וְשָׁמְע֥וּ אֲ֝מָרַ֗י כִּ֣י נָעֵֽמוּ׃
Translated:
May their judges slip on the rock,
but let my words be heard, for they are sweet.
Transliteration: nishemetu viydey-sela shofeteyhem veshameu amaray khiy naemu

Hebrew: כְּמ֤וֹ פֹלֵ֣חַ וּבֹקֵ֣עַ בָּאָ֑רֶץ נִפְזְר֥וּ עֲ֝צָמֵ֗ינוּ לְפִ֣י שְׁאֽוֹל׃
Translated:
As when the earth is cleft and broken up
our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
Transliteration: khemvo folecha uvokea vaarets nifezeru atsameynu lefiy shevol

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵלֶ֨יךָ ׀ יֱהֹוִ֣ה אֲדֹנָ֣י עֵינָ֑י בְּכָ֥ה חָ֝סִ֗יתִי אַל־תְּעַ֥ר נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
My eyes are fixed upon You, O GOD my Lord;
I seek refuge in You, do not put me in jeopardy.
Transliteration: khiy eleykha yehovih adonay eynay vekhah chasiytiy al-tear nafeshiy

Hebrew: שׇׁמְרֵ֗נִי מִ֣ידֵי פַ֭ח יָ֣קְשׁוּ לִ֑י וּ֝מֹקְשׁ֗וֹת פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Keep me from the trap laid for me,
and from the snares of evildoers.
Transliteration: shׇmereniy miydey fach yakeshu liy umokeshvot foaley aven

Hebrew: יִפְּל֣וּ בְמַכְמֹרָ֣יו רְשָׁעִ֑ים יַ֥חַד אָ֝נֹכִ֗י עַֽד־אֶעֱבֽוֹר׃ {פ}
Translated:
Let the wicked fall into their nets
while I alone come through.
Transliteration: yifelu vemakhemorayv reshaiym yachad anokhiy ad-eevvor {f}

Hebrew: מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִ֑ד בִּֽהְיוֹת֖וֹ בַמְּעָרָ֣ה תְפִלָּֽה׃
Translated: A maskil of David, while he was in the cave. A prayer.
Transliteration: mashekhiyl ledavid viheyvotvo vamearah tefilah

Hebrew: ק֭וֹלִי אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶזְעָ֑ק ק֝וֹלִ֗י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֶתְחַנָּֽן׃
Translated:
I cry aloud to the LORD;
I appeal to the LORD loudly for mercy.
Transliteration: kvoliy el-yehovah ezeak kvoliy el-yehovah etechanan

Hebrew: אֶשְׁפֹּ֣ךְ לְפָנָ֣יו שִׂיחִ֑י צָ֝רָתִ֗י לְפָנָ֥יו אַגִּֽיד׃
Translated:
I pour out my complaint before Him;
I lay my trouble before Him
Transliteration: eshefokhe lefanayv shiychiy tsaratiy lefanayv agiyd

Hebrew: בְּהִתְעַטֵּ֬ף עָלַ֨י ׀ רוּחִ֗י וְאַתָּה֮ יָדַ֢עְתָּ נְֽתִיבָ֫תִ֥י בְּאֹֽרַח־ז֥וּ אֲהַלֵּ֑ךְ טָמְנ֖וּ פַ֣ח לִֽי׃
Translated:
when my spirit fails within me.
You know my course;
they have laid a trap in the path I walk.
Transliteration: vehiteatef alay ruchiy veatah yada֢eta netiyvatiy veorach-zu ahalekhe tamenu fach liy

Hebrew: הַבֵּ֤יט יָמִ֨ין ׀ וּרְאֵה֮ וְאֵֽין־לִ֢י מַ֫כִּ֥יר אָבַ֣ד מָנ֣וֹס מִמֶּ֑נִּי אֵ֖ין דּוֹרֵ֣שׁ לְנַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
Look at my right and see—
I have no friend;
there is nowhere I can flee,
no one cares about me.
Transliteration: haveyt yamiyn ureeh veeyn-li֢y makhiyr avad manvos mimeniy eyn dvoresh lenafeshiy

Hebrew: זָעַ֥קְתִּי אֵלֶ֗יךָ יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה אָ֭מַרְתִּי אַתָּ֣ה מַחְסִ֑י חֶ֝לְקִ֗י בְּאֶ֣רֶץ הַחַיִּֽים׃
Translated:
So I cry to You, O LORD;
I say, “You are my refuge,
all I have in the land of the living.”
Transliteration: zaaketiy eleykha yehovah amaretiy atah machesiy chelekiy veerets hachayiym

Hebrew: הַקְשִׁ֤יבָה ׀ אֶֽל־רִנָּתִי֮ כִּֽי־דַלּ֢וֹתִ֫י מְאֹ֥ד הַצִּילֵ֥נִי מֵרֹדְפַ֑י כִּ֖י אָמְצ֣וּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
Listen to my cry, for I have been brought very low;
save me from my pursuers,
for they are too strong for me.
Transliteration: hakeshiyvah el-rinatiy khiy-dal֢votiy meod hatsiyleniy merodefay khiy ametsu mimeniy

Hebrew: ה֘וֹצִ֤יאָה מִמַּסְגֵּ֨ר ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ לְהוֹד֢וֹת אֶת־שְׁ֫מֶ֥ךָ בִּ֭י יַכְתִּ֣רוּ צַדִּיקִ֑ים כִּ֖י תִגְמֹ֣ל עָלָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
Free me from prison,
that I may praise Your name.
The righteous shall glory in me
for Your gracious dealings with me.
Transliteration: hvotsiyah mimaseger nafeshiy lehvod֢vot et-shemekha viy yakhetiru tsadiykiym khiy tigemol alay {f}

Hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָ֫וִ֥ד יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ שְׁמַ֬ע תְּפִלָּתִ֗י הַאֲזִ֥ינָה אֶל־תַּחֲנוּנַ֑י בֶּאֱמֻנָתְךָ֥ עֲ֝נֵ֗נִי בְּצִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
A psalm of David.

O LORD, hear my prayer;
give ear to my plea, as You are faithful;
answer me, as You are beneficent.
Transliteration: mizemvor ledavid yehovah shema tefilatiy haaziynah el-tachanunay veemunatekha aneniy vetsidekatekha

Hebrew: וְאַל־תָּב֣וֹא בְ֭מִשְׁפָּט אֶת־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֤י לֹֽא־יִצְדַּ֖ק לְפָנֶ֣יךָ כׇל־חָֽי׃
Translated:
Do not enter into judgment with Your servant,
for before You no creature is in the right.
Transliteration: veal-tavvo vemishefat et-avedekha khiy lo-yitsedak lefaneykha khׇl-chay

Hebrew: כִּ֥י רָ֘דַ֤ף אוֹיֵ֨ב ׀ נַפְשִׁ֗י דִּכָּ֣א לָ֭אָרֶץ חַיָּתִ֑י הוֹשִׁבַ֥נִי בְ֝מַחֲשַׁכִּ֗ים כְּמֵתֵ֥י עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
My foe hounded me;
he crushed me to the ground;
he made me dwell in darkness
like those long dead.
Transliteration: khiy radaf voeiv nafeshiy dikha laarets chayatiy hvoshivaniy vemachashakhiym khemetey volam

Hebrew: וַתִּתְעַטֵּ֣ף עָלַ֣י רוּחִ֑י בְּ֝תוֹכִ֗י יִשְׁתּוֹמֵ֥ם לִבִּֽי׃
Translated:
My spirit failed within me;
my mind was numbed with horror.
Transliteration: vatiteatef alay ruchiy vetvokhiy yishetvomem liviy

Hebrew: זָ֘כַ֤רְתִּי יָמִ֨ים ׀ מִקֶּ֗דֶם הָגִ֥יתִי בְכׇל־פׇּעֳלֶ֑ךָ בְּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יָדֶ֣יךָ אֲשׂוֹחֵֽחַ׃
Translated:
Then I thought of the days of old;
I rehearsed all Your deeds,
recounted the work of Your hands.
Transliteration: zakharetiy yamiym mikedem hagiytiy vekhׇl-fׇolekha vemaasheh yadeykha ashvochecha

Hebrew: פֵּרַ֣שְׂתִּי יָדַ֣י אֵלֶ֑יךָ נַפְשִׁ֓י ׀ כְּאֶרֶץ־עֲיֵפָ֖ה לְךָ֣ סֶֽלָה׃
Translated:
I stretched out my hands to You,
longing for You like thirsty earth. Selah.
Transliteration: ferashetiy yaday eleykha nafeshiy kheerets-aeifah lekha selah

Hebrew: מַ֘הֵ֤ר עֲנֵ֨נִי ׀ יְהֹוָה֮ כָּלְתָ֢ה ר֫וּחִ֥י אַל־תַּסְתֵּ֣ר פָּנֶ֣יךָ מִמֶּ֑נִּי וְ֝נִמְשַׁ֗לְתִּי עִם־יֹ֥רְדֵי בֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Answer me quickly, O LORD;
my spirit can endure no more.
Do not hide Your face from me,
or I shall become like those who descend into the Pit.
Transliteration: maher aneniy yehovah khaleta֢h ruchiy al-taseter faneykha mimeniy venimeshaletiy im-yoredey vvor

Hebrew: הַשְׁמִ֘יעֵ֤נִי בַבֹּ֨קֶר ׀ חַסְדֶּךָ֮ כִּֽי־בְךָ֢ בָ֫טָ֥חְתִּי הוֹדִיעֵ֗נִי דֶּרֶךְ־ז֥וּ אֵלֵ֑ךְ כִּי־אֵ֝לֶ֗יךָ נָשָׂ֥אתִי נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
Let me learn of Your faithfulness by daybreak,
for in You I trust;
let me know the road I must take,
for on You I have set my hope.
Transliteration: hashemiyeniy vavoker chasedekha khiy-vekha֢ vatachetiy hvodiyeniy derekhe-zu elekhe khiy-eleykha nashatiy nafeshiy

Hebrew: הַצִּילֵ֖נִי מֵאֹיְבַ֥י <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵלֶ֥יךָ כִסִּֽתִי׃
Translated:
Save me from my foes, O LORD;
to You I look for cover.
Transliteration: hatsiyleniy meoyevay <small></small> yehovah eleykha khisitiy

Hebrew: לַמְּדֵ֤נִי ׀ לַ֥עֲשׂ֣וֹת רְצוֹנֶךָ֮ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֢ה אֱל֫וֹהָ֥י רוּחֲךָ֥ טוֹבָ֑ה תַּ֝נְחֵ֗נִי בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִישֽׁוֹר׃
Translated:
Teach me to do Your will,
for You are my God.
Let Your gracious spirit lead me
on level ground.
Transliteration: lamedeniy laashvot retsvonekha khiy-ata֢h elvohay ruchakha tvovah tanecheniy veerets miyshvor

Hebrew: לְמַעַן־שִׁמְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֣ה תְּחַיֵּ֑נִי בְּצִדְקָתְךָ֓ ׀ תּוֹצִ֖יא מִצָּרָ֣ה נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
For the sake of Your name, O LORD, preserve me;
as You are beneficent, free me from distress.
Transliteration: lemaan-shimekha yehovah techayeniy vetsidekatekha tvotsiy mitsarah nafeshiy

Hebrew: וּֽבְחַסְדְּךָ֮ תַּצְמִ֢ית אֹ֫יְבָ֥י וְֽ֭הַאֲבַדְתָּ כׇּל־צֹרְרֵ֣י נַפְשִׁ֑י כִּ֝֗י אֲנִ֣י עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
As You are faithful, put an end to my foes;
destroy all my mortal enemies,
for I am Your servant.
Transliteration: uvechasedekha tatsemi֢yt oyevay vehaavadeta khׇl-tsorerey nafeshiy khiy aniy avedekha {f}

Hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ בָּ֘ר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ צוּרִ֗י הַֽמְלַמֵּ֣ד יָדַ֣י לַקְרָ֑ב אֶ֝צְבְּעוֹתַ֗י לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
Of David.

Blessed is the LORD, my rock,
who trains my hands for battle,
my fingers for warfare;
Transliteration: ledavid varukhe yehovah tsuriy hamelamed yaday lakerav etsevevotay lamilechamah

Hebrew: חַסְדִּ֥י וּמְצוּדָתִי֮ מִשְׂגַּבִּ֢י וּֽמְפַלְטִ֫י־לִ֥י מָ֭גִנִּי וּב֣וֹ חָסִ֑יתִי הָרוֹדֵ֖ד עַמִּ֣י תַחְתָּֽי׃
Translated:
my faithful one, my fortress,
my haven and my deliverer,
my shield, in whom I take shelter,
who makes peoples subject to me.
Transliteration: chasediy umetsudatiy mishegavi֢y umefaletiy-liy maginiy uvvo chasiytiy harvoded amiy tachetay

Hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה מָֽה־אָ֭דָם וַתֵּדָעֵ֑הוּ בֶּן־אֱ֝נ֗וֹשׁ וַֽתְּחַשְּׁבֵֽהוּ׃
Translated:
O LORD, what is man that You should care about him,
mortal man, that You should think of him?
Transliteration: yehovah mah-adam vatedaehu ven-envosh vatechashevehu

Hebrew: אָ֭דָם לַהֶ֣בֶל דָּמָ֑ה יָ֝מָ֗יו כְּצֵ֣ל עוֹבֵֽר׃
Translated:
Man is like a breath;
his days are like a passing shadow.
Transliteration: adam lahevel damah yamayv khetsel vover

Hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה הַט־שָׁמֶ֣יךָ וְתֵרֵ֑ד גַּ֖ע בֶּהָרִ֣ים וְֽיֶעֱשָֽׁנוּ׃
Translated:
O LORD, bend Your sky and come down;
touch the mountains and they will smoke.
Transliteration: yehovah hat-shameykha vetered ga vehariym veyeeshanu

Hebrew: בְּר֣וֹק בָּ֭רָק וּתְפִיצֵ֑ם שְׁלַ֥ח חִ֝צֶּ֗יךָ וּתְהֻמֵּֽם׃
Translated:
Make lightning flash and scatter them;
shoot Your arrows and rout them.
Transliteration: vervok varak utefiytsem shelach chitseykha utehumem

Hebrew: שְׁלַ֥ח יָדֶ֗יךָ מִ֫מָּר֥וֹם פְּצֵ֣נִי וְ֭הַצִּילֵנִי מִמַּ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים מִ֝יַּ֗ד בְּנֵ֣י נֵכָֽר׃
Translated:
Reach Your hand down from on high;
rescue me, save me from the mighty waters,
from the hands of foreigners,
Transliteration: shelach yadeykha mimarvom fetseniy vehatsiyleniy mimayiim raviym miyad veney nekhar

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר פִּ֭יהֶם דִּבֶּר־שָׁ֑וְא וִ֝ימִינָ֗ם יְמִ֣ין שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
whose mouths speak lies,
and whose oaths are false.
Transliteration: asher fiyhem diver-shave viymiynam yemiyn shaker

Hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים שִׁ֣יר חָ֭דָשׁ אָשִׁ֣ירָה לָּ֑ךְ בְּנֵ֥בֶל עָ֝שׂ֗וֹר אֲזַמְּרָה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated:
O God, I will sing You a new song,
sing a hymn to You with a ten-stringed harp,
Transliteration: Elohimm shiyr chadash ashiyrah lakhe venevel ashvor azamerah-lakhe

Hebrew: הַנּוֹתֵ֥ן תְּשׁוּעָ֗ה לַמְּלָ֫כִ֥ים הַ֭פּוֹצֶה אֶת־דָּוִ֥ד עַבְדּ֗וֹ מֵחֶ֥רֶב רָעָֽה׃
Translated:
to You who give victory to kings,
who rescue His servant David from the deadly sword.
Transliteration: hanvoten teshuah lamelakhiym hafvotseh et-david avedvo mecherev raah

Hebrew: פְּצֵ֥נִי וְהַצִּילֵנִי֮ מִיַּ֢ד בְּֽנֵי־נֵ֫כָ֥ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר פִּ֭יהֶם דִּבֶּר־שָׁ֑וְא וִ֝ימִינָ֗ם יְמִ֣ין שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translated:
Rescue me, save me from the hands of foreigners,
whose mouths speak lies,
and whose oaths are false.
Transliteration: fetseniy vehatsiyleniy miya֢d veney-nekhar asher fiyhem diver-shave viymiynam yemiyn shaker

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר בָּנֵ֨ינוּ ׀ כִּנְטִעִים֮ מְגֻדָּלִ֢ים בִּֽנְעוּרֵ֫יהֶ֥ם בְּנוֹתֵ֥ינוּ כְזָוִיֹּ֑ת מְ֝חֻטָּב֗וֹת תַּבְנִ֥ית הֵיכָֽל׃
Translated:
For our sons are like saplings,
well-tended in their youth;
our daughters are like cornerstones
trimmed to give shape to a palace.
Transliteration: asher vaneynu khinetiiym megudali֢ym vineureyhem venvoteynu khezaviyot mechutavvot taveniyt heykhal

Hebrew: מְזָוֵ֣ינוּ מְלֵאִים֮ מְפִיקִ֥ים מִזַּ֗ן אֶ֫ל־זַ֥ן צֹאונֵ֣נוּ מַ֭אֲלִיפוֹת מְרֻבָּב֗וֹת בְּחוּצוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Our storehouses are full,
supplying produce of all kinds;
our flocks number thousands,
even myriads, in our fields;
Transliteration: mezaveynu meleiym mefiykiym mizan el-zan tsovnenu maaliyfvot meruvavvot vechutsvoteynu

Hebrew: אַלּוּפֵ֗ינוּ מְֽסֻבָּ֫לִ֥ים אֵֽין־פֶּ֭רֶץ וְאֵ֣ין יוֹצֵ֑את וְאֵ֥ין צְ֝וָחָ֗ה בִּרְחֹבֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
our cattle are well cared for.
There is no breaching and no sortie,
and no wailing in our streets.
Transliteration: alufeynu mesuvaliym eyn-ferets veeyn yvotset veeyn tsevachah virechovoteynu

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י הָ֭עָם שֶׁכָּ֣כָה לּ֑וֹ אַֽשְׁרֵ֥י הָ֝עָ֗ם שֱׁיְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated:
Happy the people who have it so;
happy the people whose God is the LORD.
Transliteration: asherey haam shekhakhah lvo asherey haam sheyehovah elohayv {f}

Hebrew: תְּהִלָּ֗ה לְדָ֫וִ֥ד אֲרוֹמִמְךָ֣ אֱלוֹהַ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַאֲבָרְכָ֥ה שִׁ֝מְךָ֗ לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
Translated:
A song of praise. Of David.

I will extol You, my God and king,
and bless Your name forever and ever.
Transliteration: tehilah ledavid arvomimekha elvohay hamelekhe vaavarekhah shimekha levolam vaed

Hebrew: בְּכׇל־י֥וֹם אֲבָרְכֶ֑ךָּ וַאֲהַלְלָ֥ה שִׁ֝מְךָ֗ לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
Translated:
Every day will I bless You
and praise Your name forever and ever.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yvom avarekhekha vaahalelah shimekha levolam vaed

Hebrew: גָּ֘ד֤וֹל יְהֹוָ֣ה וּמְהֻלָּ֣ל מְאֹ֑ד וְ֝לִגְדֻלָּת֗וֹ אֵ֣ין חֵֽקֶר׃
Translated:
Great is the LORD and much acclaimed;
His greatness cannot be fathomed.
Transliteration: gadvol yehovah umehulal meod veligedulatvo eyn cheker

Hebrew: דּ֣וֹר לְ֭דוֹר יְשַׁבַּ֣ח מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ וּגְב֖וּרֹתֶ֣יךָ יַגִּֽידוּ׃
Translated:
One generation shall laud Your works to another
and declare Your mighty acts.
Transliteration: dvor ledvor yeshavach maasheykha ugevuroteykha yagiydu

Hebrew: הֲ֭דַר כְּב֣וֹד הוֹדֶ֑ךָ וְדִבְרֵ֖י נִפְלְאֹתֶ֣יךָ אָשִֽׂיחָה׃
Translated:
The glorious majesty of Your splendor
and Your wondrous acts will I recite.
Transliteration: hadar khevvod hvodekha vediverey nifeleoteykha ashiychah

Hebrew: וֶעֱז֣וּז נֽוֹרְאֹתֶ֣יךָ יֹאמֵ֑רוּ (וגדלותיך) [וּגְדֻלָּתְךָ֥] אֲסַפְּרֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
Men shall talk of the might of Your awesome deeds,
and I will recount Your greatness.
Transliteration: veezuz nvoreoteykha yomeru (vgdlvtykh) [ugedulatekha] asaferenah

Hebrew: זֵ֣כֶר רַב־טוּבְךָ֣ יַבִּ֑יעוּ וְצִדְקָתְךָ֥ יְרַנֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated:
They shall celebrate Your abundant goodness,
and sing joyously of Your beneficence.
Transliteration: zekher rav-tuvekha yaviyu vetsidekatekha yeranenu

Hebrew: חַנּ֣וּן וְרַח֣וּם יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶ֥רֶךְ אַ֝פַּ֗יִם וּגְדׇל־חָֽסֶד׃
Translated:
The LORD is gracious and compassionate,
slow to anger and abounding in kindness.
Transliteration: chanun verachum yehovah erekhe afayiim ugedׇl-chased

Hebrew: טוֹב־יְהֹוָ֥ה לַכֹּ֑ל וְ֝רַחֲמָ֗יו עַל־כׇּל־מַעֲשָֽׂיו׃
Translated:
The LORD is good to all,
and His mercy is upon all His works.
Transliteration: tvov-yehovah lakhol verachamayv al-khׇl-maashayv

Hebrew: יוֹד֣וּךָ יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ וַ֝חֲסִידֶ֗יךָ יְבָרְכֽוּכָה׃
Translated:
All Your works shall praise You, O LORD,
and Your faithful ones shall bless You.
Transliteration: yvodukha yehovah khׇl-maasheykha vachasiydeykha yevarekhukhah

Hebrew: כְּב֣וֹד מַלְכוּתְךָ֣ יֹאמֵ֑רוּ וּגְבוּרָתְךָ֥ יְדַבֵּֽרוּ׃
Translated:
They shall talk of the majesty of Your kingship,
and speak of Your might,
Transliteration: khevvod malekhutekha yomeru ugevuratekha yedaveru

Hebrew: לְהוֹדִ֤יעַ ׀ לִבְנֵ֣י הָ֭אָדָם גְּבוּרֹתָ֑יו וּ֝כְב֗וֹד הֲדַ֣ר מַלְכוּתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
to make His mighty acts known among men
and the majestic glory of His kingship.
Transliteration: lehvodiya liveney haadam gevurotayv ukhevvod hadar malekhutvo

Hebrew: מַֽלְכוּתְךָ֗ מַלְכ֥וּת כׇּל־עֹלָמִ֑ים וּ֝מֶֽמְשַׁלְתְּךָ֗ בְּכׇל־דּ֥וֹר וָדֹֽר׃
Translated:
Your kingship is an eternal kingship;
Your dominion is for all generations.
Transliteration: malekhutekha malekhut khׇl-olamiym umemeshaletekha vekhׇl-dvor vador

Hebrew: סוֹמֵ֣ךְ יְ֭הֹוָה לְכׇל־הַנֹּפְלִ֑ים וְ֝זוֹקֵ֗ף לְכׇל־הַכְּפוּפִֽים׃
Translated:
The LORD supports all who stumble,
and makes all who are bent stand straight.
Transliteration: svomekhe yehovah lekhׇl-hanofeliym vezvokef lekhׇl-hakhefufiym

Hebrew: עֵֽינֵי־כֹ֭ל אֵלֶ֣יךָ יְשַׂבֵּ֑רוּ וְאַתָּ֤ה נֽוֹתֵן־לָהֶ֖ם אֶת־אׇכְלָ֣ם בְּעִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The eyes of all look to You expectantly,
and You give them their food when it is due.
Transliteration: eyney-khol eleykha yeshaveru veatah nvoten-lahem et-ׇkhelam veitvo

Hebrew: פּוֹתֵ֥חַ אֶת־יָדֶ֑ךָ וּמַשְׂבִּ֖יעַ לְכׇל־חַ֣י רָצֽוֹן׃
Translated:
You give it openhandedly,
feeding every creature to its heart’s content.
Transliteration: fvotecha et-yadekha umasheviya lekhׇl-chay ratsvon

Hebrew: צַדִּ֣יק יְ֭הֹוָה בְּכׇל־דְּרָכָ֑יו וְ֝חָסִ֗יד בְּכׇל־מַעֲשָֽׂיו׃
Translated:
The LORD is beneficent in all His ways
and faithful in all His works.
Transliteration: tsadiyk yehovah vekhׇl-derakhayv vechasiyd vekhׇl-maashayv

Hebrew: קָר֣וֹב יְ֭הֹוָה לְכׇל־קֹרְאָ֑יו לְכֹ֤ל אֲשֶׁ֖ר יִקְרָאֻ֣הוּ בֶאֱמֶֽת׃
Translated:
The LORD is near to all who call Him,
to all who call Him with sincerity.
Transliteration: karvov yehovah lekhׇl-koreayv lekhol asher yikerauhu veemet

Hebrew: רְצוֹן־יְרֵאָ֥יו יַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וְֽאֶת־שַׁוְעָתָ֥ם יִ֝שְׁמַ֗ע וְיוֹשִׁיעֵֽם׃
Translated:
He fulfills the wishes of those who fear Him;
He hears their cry and delivers them.
Transliteration: retsvon-yereayv yaasheh veet-shaveatam yishema veyvoshiyem

Hebrew: שׁוֹמֵ֣ר יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־כׇּל־אֹהֲבָ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־הָרְשָׁעִ֣ים יַשְׁמִֽיד׃
Translated:
The LORD watches over all who love Him,
but all the wicked He will destroy.
Transliteration: shvomer yehovah et-khׇl-ohavayv veet khׇl-hareshaiym yashemiyd

Hebrew: תְּהִלַּ֥ת יְהֹוָ֗ה יְֽדַבֶּ֫ר־פִּ֥י וִיבָרֵ֣ךְ כׇּל־בָּ֭שָׂר שֵׁ֥ם קׇדְשׁ֗וֹ לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃ {פ}
Translated:
My mouth shall utter the praise of the LORD,
and all creatures shall bless His holy name forever and ever.
Transliteration: tehilat yehovah yedaver-fiy viyvarekhe khׇl-vashar shem kׇdeshvo levolam vaed {f}

Hebrew: הַֽלְלוּ־יָ֡הּ הַֽלְלִ֥י נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Hallelujah.
Praise the LORD, O my soul!
Transliteration: halelu-yah haleliy nafeshiy et-yehovah

Hebrew: אֲהַלְלָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּחַיָּ֑י אֲזַמְּרָ֖ה לֵאלֹהַ֣י בְּעוֹדִֽי׃
Translated:
I will praise the LORD all my life,
sing hymns to my God while I exist.
Transliteration: ahalelah yehovah vechayay azamerah lelohay vevodiy

Hebrew: אַל־תִּבְטְח֥וּ בִנְדִיבִ֑ים בְּבֶן־אָדָ֓ם ׀ שֶׁ֤אֵ֖ין ל֥וֹ תְשׁוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
Put not your trust in the great,
in mortal man who cannot save.
Transliteration: al-tivetechu vinediyviym veven-adam sheeyn lvo teshuah

Hebrew: תֵּצֵ֣א ר֭וּחוֹ יָשֻׁ֣ב לְאַדְמָת֑וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַ֝ה֗וּא אָבְד֥וּ עֶשְׁתֹּנֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
His breath departs;
he returns to the dust;
on that day his plans come to nothing.
Transliteration: tetse ruchvo yashuv leadematvo vayyvom hahu avedu eshetonotayv

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֗י שֶׁ֤אֵ֣ל יַעֲקֹ֣ב בְּעֶזְר֑וֹ שִׂ֝בְר֗וֹ עַל־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated:
Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help,
whose hope is in the LORD his God,
Transliteration: asherey sheel yaakov veezervo shivervo al-yehovah elohayv

Hebrew: עֹשֶׂ֤ה ׀ שָׁ֘מַ֤יִם וָאָ֗רֶץ אֶת־הַיָּ֥ם וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֑ם הַשֹּׁמֵ֖ר אֱמֶ֣ת לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
maker of heaven and earth,
the sea and all that is in them;
who keeps faith forever;
Transliteration: osheh shamayiim vaarets et-hayam veet-khׇl-asher-vam hashomer emet levolam

Hebrew: עֹשֶׂ֤ה מִשְׁפָּ֨ט ׀ לָעֲשׁוּקִ֗ים נֹתֵ֣ן לֶ֭חֶם לָרְעֵבִ֑ים יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מַתִּ֥יר אֲסוּרִֽים׃
Translated:
who secures justice for those who are wronged,
gives food to the hungry.
The LORD sets prisoners free;
Transliteration: osheh mishefat laashukiym noten lechem lareeviym yehovah matiyr asuriym

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ פֹּ֘קֵ֤חַ עִוְרִ֗ים יְ֭הֹוָה זֹקֵ֣ף כְּפוּפִ֑ים יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אֹהֵ֥ב צַדִּיקִֽים׃
Translated:
The LORD restores sight to the blind;
the LORD makes those who are bent stand straight;
the LORD loves the righteous;
Transliteration: yehovah fokecha iveriym yehovah zokef khefufiym yehovah ohev tsadiykiym

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ שֹׁ֘מֵ֤ר אֶת־גֵּרִ֗ים יָת֣וֹם וְאַלְמָנָ֣ה יְעוֹדֵ֑ד וְדֶ֖רֶךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים יְעַוֵּֽת׃
Translated:
The LORD watches over the stranger;
He gives courage to the orphan and widow,
but makes the path of the wicked tortuous.
Transliteration: yehovah shomer et-geriym yatvom vealemanah yevoded vederekhe reshaiym yeavet

Hebrew: יִמְלֹ֤ךְ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ לְעוֹלָ֗ם אֱלֹהַ֣יִךְ צִ֭יּוֹן לְדֹ֥ר וָדֹ֗ר הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
The LORD shall reign forever,
your God, O Zion, for all generations.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: yimelokhe yehovah levolam elohayiikhe tsiyyvon ledor vador halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ כִּי־ט֭וֹב זַמְּרָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ כִּי־נָ֝עִ֗ים נָאוָ֥ה תְהִלָּֽה׃
Translated:
Hallelujah.
It is good to chant hymns to our God;
it is pleasant to sing glorious praise.
Transliteration: halelu-yah khiy-tvov zamerah eloheynu khiy-naiym navah tehilah

Hebrew: בּוֹנֵ֣ה יְרוּשָׁלַ֣͏ִם יְהֹוָ֑ה נִדְחֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל יְכַנֵּֽס׃
Translated:
The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem;
He gathers in the exiles of Israel.
Transliteration: vvoneh yerushala͏im yehovah nidechey yisherael yekhanes

Hebrew: הָ֭רֹפֵא לִשְׁב֣וּרֵי לֵ֑ב וּ֝מְחַבֵּ֗שׁ לְעַצְּבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
He heals their broken hearts,
and binds up their wounds.
Transliteration: harofe lishevurey lev umechavesh leatsevvotam

Hebrew: מוֹנֶ֣ה מִ֭סְפָּר לַכּוֹכָבִ֑ים לְ֝כֻלָּ֗ם שֵׁמ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽא׃
Translated:
He reckoned the number of the stars;
to each He gave its name.
Transliteration: mvoneh misefar lakhvokhaviym lekhulam shemvot yikera

Hebrew: גָּד֣וֹל אֲדוֹנֵ֣ינוּ וְרַב־כֹּ֑חַ לִ֝תְבוּנָת֗וֹ אֵ֣ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
Translated:
Great is our Lord and full of power;
His wisdom is beyond reckoning.
Transliteration: gadvol advoneynu verav-khocha litevunatvo eyn misefar

Hebrew: מְעוֹדֵ֣ד עֲנָוִ֣ים יְהֹוָ֑ה מַשְׁפִּ֖יל רְשָׁעִ֣ים עֲדֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
The LORD gives courage to the lowly,
and brings the wicked down to the dust.
Transliteration: mevoded anaviym yehovah mashefiyl reshaiym adey-arets

Hebrew: עֱנ֣וּ לַֽיהֹוָ֣ה בְּתוֹדָ֑ה זַמְּר֖וּ לֵאלֹהֵ֣ינוּ בְכִנּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Sing to the LORD a song of praise,
chant a hymn with a lyre to our God,
Transliteration: enu layhovah vetvodah zameru leloheynu vekhinvor

Hebrew: הַֽמְכַסֶּ֬ה שָׁמַ֨יִם ׀ בְּעָבִ֗ים הַמֵּכִ֣ין לָאָ֣רֶץ מָטָ֑ר הַמַּצְמִ֖יחַ הָרִ֣ים חָצִֽיר׃
Translated:
who covers the heavens with clouds,
provides rain for the earth,
makes mountains put forth grass;
Transliteration: hamekhaseh shamayiim veaviym hamekhiyn laarets matar hamatsemiycha hariym chatsiyr

Hebrew: נוֹתֵ֣ן לִבְהֵמָ֣ה לַחְמָ֑הּ לִבְנֵ֥י עֹ֝רֵ֗ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִקְרָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
who gives the beasts their food,
to the raven’s brood what they cry for.
Transliteration: nvoten livehemah lachemah liveney orev asher yikerau

Hebrew: לֹ֤א בִגְבוּרַ֣ת הַסּ֣וּס יֶחְפָּ֑ץ לֹא־בְשׁוֹקֵ֖י הָאִ֣ישׁ יִרְצֶֽה׃
Translated:
He does not prize the strength of horses,
nor value the fleetness of men;
Transliteration: lo vigevurat hasus yechefats lo-veshvokey haiysh yiretseh

Hebrew: רוֹצֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־יְרֵאָ֑יו אֶת־הַֽמְיַחֲלִ֥ים לְחַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
but the LORD values those who fear Him,
those who depend on His faithful care.
Transliteration: rvotseh yehovah et-yereayv et-hameyachaliym lechasedvo

Hebrew: שַׁבְּחִ֣י יְ֭רוּשָׁלַ͏ִם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה הַֽלְלִ֖י אֱלֹהַ֣יִךְ צִיּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
O Jerusalem, glorify the LORD;
praise your God, O Zion!
Transliteration: shavechiy yerushala͏im et-yehovah haleliy elohayiikhe tsiyyvon

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חִ֭זַּק בְּרִיחֵ֣י שְׁעָרָ֑יִךְ בֵּרַ֖ךְ בָּנַ֣יִךְ בְּקִרְבֵּֽךְ׃
Translated:
For He made the bars of your gates strong,
and blessed your children within you.
Transliteration: khiy-chizak veriychey shearayiikhe verakhe vanayiikhe vekirevekhe

Hebrew: הַשָּׂם־גְּבוּלֵ֥ךְ שָׁל֑וֹם חֵ֥לֶב חִ֝טִּ֗ים יַשְׂבִּיעֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
He endows your realm with well-being,
and satisfies you with choice wheat.
Transliteration: hasham-gevulekhe shalvom chelev chitiym yasheviyekhe

Hebrew: הַשֹּׁלֵ֣חַ אִמְרָת֣וֹ אָ֑רֶץ עַד־מְ֝הֵרָ֗ה יָר֥וּץ דְּבָרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
He sends forth His word to the earth;
His command runs swiftly.
Transliteration: hasholecha imeratvo arets ad-meherah yaruts devarvo

Hebrew: הַנֹּתֵ֣ן שֶׁ֣לֶג כַּצָּ֑מֶר כְּ֝פ֗וֹר כָּאֵ֥פֶר יְפַזֵּֽר׃
Translated:
He lays down snow like fleece,
scatters frost like ashes.
Transliteration: hanoten sheleg khatsamer khefvor khaefer yefazer

Hebrew: מַשְׁלִ֣יךְ קַֽרְח֣וֹ כְפִתִּ֑ים לִפְנֵ֥י קָ֝רָת֗וֹ מִ֣י יַעֲמֹֽד׃
Translated:
He tosses down hail like crumbs—
who can endure His icy cold?
Transliteration: masheliykhe karechvo khefitiym lifeney karatvo miy yaamod

Hebrew: יִשְׁלַ֣ח דְּבָר֣וֹ וְיַמְסֵ֑ם יַשֵּׁ֥ב ר֝וּח֗וֹ יִזְּלוּ־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
He issues a command—it melts them;
He breathes—the waters flow.
Transliteration: yishelach devarvo veyamesem yashev ruchvo yizelu-mayiim

Hebrew: מַגִּ֣יד דְּבָרָ֣ו לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב חֻקָּ֥יו וּ֝מִשְׁפָּטָ֗יו לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
He issued His commands to Jacob,
His statutes and rules to Israel.
Transliteration: magiyd devarav leyaakov chukayv umishefatayv leyisherael

Hebrew: לֹ֘א־עָ֤שָׂה כֵ֨ן ׀ לְכׇל־גּ֗וֹי וּמִשְׁפָּטִ֥ים בַּל־יְדָע֗וּם הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He did not do so for any other nation;
of such rules they know nothing.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: lo-ashah khen lekhׇl-gvoy umishefatiym val-yedaum halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ הַֽלְל֣וּ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֑יִם הַֽ֝לְל֗וּהוּ בַּמְּרוֹמִֽים׃
Translated:
Hallelujah.
Praise the LORD from the heavens;
praise Him on high.
Transliteration: halelu-yah halelu et-yehovah min-hashamayiim haleluhu vamervomiym

Hebrew: הַֽלְל֥וּהוּ כׇל־מַלְאָכָ֑יו הַ֝לְל֗וּהוּ כׇּל־צְבָאָֽו׃
Translated:
Praise Him, all His angels,
praise Him, all His hosts.
Transliteration: haleluhu khׇl-maleakhayv haleluhu khׇl-tsevaav

Hebrew: הַֽ֭לְלוּהוּ שֶׁ֣מֶשׁ וְיָרֵ֑חַ הַֽ֝לְל֗וּהוּ כׇּל־כּ֥וֹכְבֵי אֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Praise Him, sun and moon,
praise Him, all bright stars.
Transliteration: haleluhu shemesh veyarecha haleluhu khׇl-khvokhevey vor

Hebrew: הַֽ֭לְלוּהוּ שְׁמֵ֣י הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְ֝הַמַּ֗יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר ׀ מֵעַ֬ל הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Praise Him, highest heavens,
and you waters that are above the heavens.
Transliteration: haleluhu shemey hashamayiim vehamayiim asher meal hashamayiim

Hebrew: יְֽ֭הַלְלוּ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֤י ה֖וּא צִוָּ֣ה וְנִבְרָֽאוּ׃
Translated:
Let them praise the name of the LORD,
for it was He who commanded that they be created.
Transliteration: yehalelu et-shem yehovah khiy hu tsivah veniverau

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמִידֵ֣ם לָעַ֣ד לְעוֹלָ֑ם חׇק־נָ֝תַ֗ן וְלֹ֣א יַעֲבֽוֹר׃
Translated:
He made them endure forever,
establishing an order that shall never change.
Transliteration: vayaamiydem laad levolam chׇk-natan velo yaavvor

Hebrew: הַֽלְל֣וּ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ תַּ֝נִּינִ֗ים וְכׇל־תְּהֹמֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Praise the LORD, O you who are on earth,
all sea monsters and ocean depths,
Transliteration: halelu et-yehovah min-haarets taniyniym vekhׇl-tehomvot

Hebrew: אֵ֣שׁ וּ֭בָרָד שֶׁ֣לֶג וְקִיט֑וֹר ר֥וּחַ סְ֝עָרָ֗ה עֹשָׂ֥ה דְבָרֽוֹ׃
Translated:
fire and hail, snow and smoke,
storm wind that executes His command,
Transliteration: esh uvarad sheleg vekiytvor rucha searah oshah devarvo

Hebrew: הֶהָרִ֥ים וְכׇל־גְּבָע֑וֹת עֵ֥ץ פְּ֝רִ֗י וְכׇל־אֲרָזִֽים׃
Translated:
all mountains and hills,
all fruit trees and cedars,
Transliteration: hehariym vekhׇl-gevavot ets feriy vekhׇl-araziym

Hebrew: הַחַיָּ֥ה וְכׇל־בְּהֵמָ֑ה רֶ֝֗מֶשׂ וְצִפּ֥וֹר כָּנָֽף׃
Translated:
all wild and tamed beasts,
creeping things and winged birds,
Transliteration: hachayah vekhׇl-vehemah remesh vetsifvor khanaf

Hebrew: מַלְכֵי־אֶ֭רֶץ וְכׇל־לְאֻמִּ֑ים שָׂ֝רִ֗ים וְכׇל־שֹׁ֥פְטֵי אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
all kings and peoples of the earth,
all princes of the earth and its judges,
Transliteration: malekhey-erets vekhׇl-leumiym shariym vekhׇl-shofetey arets

Hebrew: בַּחוּרִ֥ים וְגַם־בְּתוּל֑וֹת זְ֝קֵנִ֗ים עִם־נְעָרִֽים׃
Translated:
youths and maidens alike,
old and young together.
Transliteration: vachuriym vegam-vetulvot zekeniym im-neariym

Hebrew: יְהַלְל֤וּ ׀ אֶת־שֵׁ֬ם יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּֽי־נִשְׂגָּ֣ב שְׁמ֣וֹ לְבַדּ֑וֹ ה֝וֹד֗וֹ עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ וְשָׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated:
