Let them praise the name of the LORD,
for His name, His alone, is sublime;
His splendor covers heaven and earth.
Transliteration: yehalelu et-shem yehovah khiy-nishegav shemvo levadvo hvodvo al-erets veshamayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤רֶם קֶ֨רֶן ׀ לְעַמּ֡וֹ תְּהִלָּ֤ה לְֽכׇל־חֲסִידָ֗יו לִבְנֵ֣י יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל עַ֥ם קְרֹב֗וֹ הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
He has exalted the horn of His people
for the glory of all His faithful ones,
Israel, the people close to Him.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: vayarem keren leamvo tehilah lekhׇl-chasiydayv liveney yisherael am kerovvo halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ שִׁ֣ירוּ לַֽ֭יהֹוָה שִׁ֣יר חָדָ֑שׁ תְּ֝הִלָּת֗וֹ בִּקְהַ֥ל חֲסִידִֽים׃
Translated:
Hallelujah.
Sing to the LORD a new song,
His praises in the congregation of the faithful.
Transliteration: halelu-yah shiyru layhovah shiyr chadash tehilatvo vikehal chasiydiym

Hebrew: יִשְׂמַ֣ח יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל בְּעֹשָׂ֑יו בְּנֵֽי־צִ֝יּ֗וֹן יָגִ֥ילוּ בְמַלְכָּֽם׃
Translated:
Let Israel rejoice in its maker;
let the children of Zion exult in their king.
Transliteration: yishemach yisherael veoshayv veney-tsiyyvon yagiylu vemalekham

Hebrew: יְהַלְל֣וּ שְׁמ֣וֹ בְמָח֑וֹל בְּתֹ֥ף וְ֝כִנּ֗וֹר יְזַמְּרוּ־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Let them praise His name in dance;
with timbrel and lyre let them chant His praises.
Transliteration: yehalelu shemvo vemachvol vetof vekhinvor yezameru-lvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־רוֹצֶ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּעַמּ֑וֹ יְפָאֵ֥ר עֲ֝נָוִ֗ים בִּישׁוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
For the LORD delights in His people;
He adorns the lowly with victory.
Transliteration: khiy-rvotseh yehovah veamvo yefaer anaviym viyshuah

Hebrew: יַעְלְז֣וּ חֲסִידִ֣ים בְּכָב֑וֹד יְ֝רַנְּנ֗וּ עַל־מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
Let the faithful exult in glory;
let them shout for joy upon their couches,
Transliteration: yaelezu chasiydiym vekhavvod yeranenu al-mishekhevvotam

Hebrew: רוֹמְמ֣וֹת אֵ֭ל בִּגְרוֹנָ֑ם וְחֶ֖רֶב פִּיפִיּ֣וֹת בְּיָדָֽם׃
Translated:
with paeans to God in their throats
and two-edged swords in their hands,
Transliteration: rvomemvot el vigervonam vecherev fiyfiyyvot veyadam

Hebrew: לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת נְ֭קָמָה בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם תּ֝וֹכֵח֗וֹת בַּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
Translated:
to impose retribution upon the nations,
punishment upon the peoples,
Transliteration: laashvot nekamah vagvoyim tvokhechvot valeumiym

Hebrew: לֶאְסֹ֣ר מַלְכֵיהֶ֣ם בְּזִקִּ֑ים וְ֝נִכְבְּדֵיהֶ֗ם בְּכַבְלֵ֥י בַרְזֶֽל׃
Translated:
binding their kings with shackles,
their nobles with chains of iron,
Transliteration: leesor malekheyhem vezikiym venikhevedeyhem vekhaveley varezel

Hebrew: לַעֲשׂ֤וֹת בָּהֶ֨ם ׀ מִשְׁפָּ֬ט כָּת֗וּב הָדָ֣ר ה֭וּא לְכׇל־חֲסִידָ֗יו הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
executing the doom decreed against them.
This is the glory of all His faithful.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: laashvot vahem mishefat khatuv hadar hu lekhׇl-chasiydayv halelu-yah {f}

Hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ הַֽלְלוּ־אֵ֥ל בְּקׇדְשׁ֑וֹ הַֽ֝לְל֗וּהוּ בִּרְקִ֥יעַ עֻזּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Hallelujah.
Praise God in His sanctuary;
praise Him in the sky, His stronghold.
Transliteration: halelu-yah halelu-el vekׇdeshvo haleluhu virekiya uzvo

Hebrew: הַלְל֥וּהוּ בִגְבוּרֹתָ֑יו הַ֝לְל֗וּהוּ כְּרֹ֣ב גֻּדְלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Praise Him for His mighty acts;
praise Him for His exceeding greatness.
Transliteration: haleluhu vigevurotayv haleluhu kherov gudelvo

Hebrew: הַ֭לְלוּהוּ בְּתֵ֣קַע שׁוֹפָ֑ר הַ֝לְל֗וּהוּ בְּנֵ֣בֶל וְכִנּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Praise Him with blasts of the horn;
praise Him with harp and lyre.
Transliteration: haleluhu veteka shvofar haleluhu venevel vekhinvor

Hebrew: הַ֭לְלוּהוּ בְּתֹ֣ף וּמָח֑וֹל הַֽ֝לְל֗וּהוּ בְּמִנִּ֥ים וְעֻגָֽב׃
Translated:
Praise Him with timbrel and dance;
praise Him with lute and pipe.
Transliteration: haleluhu vetof umachvol haleluhu veminiym veugav

Hebrew: הַלְל֥וּהוּ בְצִלְצְלֵי־שָׁ֑מַע הַֽ֝לְל֗וּהוּ בְּֽצִלְצְלֵ֥י תְרוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
Praise Him with resounding cymbals;
praise Him with loud-clashing cymbals.
Transliteration: haleluhu vetsiletseley-shama haleluhu vetsiletseley teruah

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ל הַ֭נְּשָׁמָה תְּהַלֵּ֥ל יָ֗הּ הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Let all that breathes praise the LORD.
Hallelujah.
Transliteration: khol haneshamah tehalel yah halelu-yah
